column2: The confinement of Spain has been “the most severe in the world” In studies carried out by the University of Oxford and The Lancet, and in comparisons between countries worldwide, it can be observed that confinement in Spain has not been the hardest or the longest in the world.
CDCs denied that SARSCoV2 was isolated and said PCR tests don’t work The virus has been isolated in many countries and CDC's have never affirmed that PCR tests don't work
These people were gasified in a beach, as a response to COVID-19 resurgences The airplanes surrounding the beach were a security operation on 2019, and had no relationship with COVID-19
COVID-19 is caused by a bacteria and some countries found the cure in antibiotics COVID-19 is caused by a virus, not a bacteria, so it can not be cured with antibiotics
H1N1 vaccine in Brazil is made in China H1N1 vaccine used in Brazil is produced by Instituto Butantan, in São Paulo
COVID-19 can be prevented and fought through washing your teeth Once someone gets infected with SARS-CoV-2, there is no way to avoid COVID-19
Alberto Fernández (president of Argentina) said: “With Macri we would have had 10,000 deaths from coronavirus” The President never made this statement. It was circulated in a viral meme.
A study says that the COVID-19 vaccine will cause sterility Experts say that this has no scientific basis and the text to which the messages refer is not a scientific research work

COVID-19 vaccine causes cancer, genetic modifications in humans and causes ‘homosexuality’ Vaccines are safe and do not cause any genetic modifications. Homosexuality is not a disease to be caused by a vaccine
Exposing the public to the virus will end the pandemic before vaccines are available Herd immunity is not recommended by specialists

Doctor Luis Martínez made several claims that circulated in viral videos. The doctor claims, in 2 viral videos contents, several false statements about the vaccines that are being developed to prevent the new coronavirus. In addition, he falsely points out that the new coronavirus was not isolated and characterized. Finally, SARS-CoV-2 is not described as a common cold virus but rather causes more serious diseases such as severe acute respiratory syndrome, contrary to what Martínez pointed out.
The WHO says that covid is an endemic virus. The WHO spoke of a possibility, not a fact.
No vaccines against COVID-19 in the world have been through pre-clinical trials All vaccines have their study data recorded and collected by WHO
The Spanish Ministry of Health is sending an email advising of the protocols to prevent coronavirus The Ministry of Health and the National Police have warned that it is a phishing attempt

Adverse effects of CoronaVac can be worst than COVID-19 symptoms The laboratory that coordinates the tests of CoronaVac in Brazil say there was no accute adverse effects. Mild adverse effects were seen in only 0.03% of volunteers
2020 will have less deaths than previous years Post misleadingly compares different periods of time

CoronaVac vaccines sold to São Paulo’s state were ready to be distributted to the population in April 2020 Vaccines from chinese laboratory were produced in April because they were already being tested in clinical trails in China

Adverse effects of CoronaVac can be worst than COVID-19 symptoms The laboratory that coordinates the tests of CoronaVac in Brazil say there was no accute adverse effects. Mild adverse effects were seen in only 0.03% of volunteers

Augusto Costa: “Central air conditioning systems are proven elements of virus spread” It is true that improper use of air conditioning can lead to the spread of the SARS-CoV-2 coronavirus. However, so far there are no conclusive scientific studies on the role of air conditioning in the transmission of the coronavirus. Experts and international organizations agree that it is not necessary to prohibit their use but that they must be used correctly: avoid air recirculation mode and that there is natural ventilation in the room.

If you vote for BJP you will get free coronavirus vaccine, if you dont, you wont The viral post is misleading, The central government has announced free covid19 vaccine for all Indians, as per BJP spokesperson
A german neurophysiologist says that masks cause neurodegenerative diseases that have no cure. The use of masks does not produce an oxygen deficiency or retain carbon dioxide.

A German lawyer claims in a video posted on social networks that during the pandemic there has been no excess mortality. He also says that in Australia they take you to jail if you don’t wear a mask and in the Philippines they shoot you in the head. Records and studies from different organizations show that there have been many more deaths than in other years. And if you don't wear a mask in Australia or the Philippines, at most they fine you.

Brazilian legislation doesn’t support mandatory vaccination There are laws that empower the Union, states and municipalities to compulsorily vaccinate the population, including as a measure to combat COVID-19.

Brazilian law forbids mandatory campaigns of vaccination The civil law quoted in the post is taken out of context. It says that no person can be obliged to go through a medical treatment that involves risk of dying. That does not applies to vaccines already aprooved, always safe to population
A false image says that President Duque will declare a shutdown on November 1st. Duque denied the false statement.

The Ministry of Health is sending an email on “protocols” against COVID-19 The Ministry denies it, it is not an email adress of the Ministry and the Autorithy against cibernethic crimes says it is malware.

Vaccines against COVID-19 were only tested on animals before being tested on Brazilians. The two mentioned immunizations (CoronaVac and the Oxford vaccine) had already been tested in humans in clinical studies before arriving in Brazil.

COVID-19 testing patent was filed in 2015, thus covid19 is a scam Vishvas News investigated the post and found that the viral image is the screenshot of the child application that was filed in year 2020 following the submission of the parent patent application in 2015 that was not related to COVID-19. In fact, the parent application is generalized for a method of “acquiring and transmitting biometric data.” The post is viral with the fake claim.

Government should invest in hydroxychloroquine instead of a vaccine because the medecine has been known for 70 years while the vaccines aren’t known There is no scientific proof that hydroxychloroquine is effective against COVID-19. Also, vaccines are showing good results in scientific tests
Brazil will be the first country in the world to achieve herd immunity Herd immunity is achieved when 90% of the population was infected or vaccinated. Brazil is far from achieving that mark

COVID-19 testing patent was filed in 2015, thus covid19 is a scam Vishvas News investigated the post and found that the viral image is the screenshot of the child application that was filed in year 2020 following the submission of the parent patent application in 2015 that was not related to COVID-19. In fact, the parent application is generalized for a method of “acquiring and transmitting biometric data.” The post is viral with the fake claim.

The U.S. “went from 75,000 flu deaths last year in America to almost 0”; are there “allocation games being played to manipulate the truth?” It is premature to make conclusions about the number of flu deaths for the current flu season, as the season just began and flu deaths do not peak until later in the season. There is no evidence supporting the claim that any observed reduction in the number of flu deaths this season is the result of data manipulation. Instead, the lower level of flu activity observed this season is likely due, in part, to public health measures implemented to reduce the spread of COVID-19.
Brazil will be the first country in the world to achieve herd immunity Herd immunity is achieved when 90% of the population was infected or vaccinated. Brazil is far from achieving that mark

A 13-year-old girl died in Portugal from a cardiorespiratory arrest associated with the use of a mask There is no relation between the use of the mask and the death of the minor, who had previous pathologies related to her death.
A swab test pierced a woman’s brain The swab test did not cause a brain damage. Studies have shown this is impossible.

COVID-19 testing patent was filed in 2015, thus covid19 is a scam Vishvas News investigated the post and found that the viral image is the screenshot of the child application that was filed in year 2020 following the submission of the parent patent application in 2015 that was not related to COVID-19. In fact, the parent application is generalized for a method of “acquiring and transmitting biometric data.” The post is viral with the fake claim.

A letter stating that there do not appear to be any known side effects from the use of chlorine dioxide Different medical and drug control organizations report numerous side effects of chlorine dioxide. There is also no scientific evidence on the supposed positive effects
The WHO says that governments should put aside quarantines The WHO didnt make those statements.

São Paulo City Hall bought excess coffins during the pandemic and now 20,000 of them are stocked The city anticipated the purchase of 38,000 coffins due to the increase in deaths from the pandemic. Of this total, 33,000 have already been used in general burials.

The Chinese vaccine candidate can cause genetic damage and homosexuality The immunization is being produced by inactivating the virus, without genetic alteration. In addition, Anvisa (National Health Surveillance Agency), when analyzing the results of the first tests, understood that the vaccine was safe.
A famous colombian scientist says that natural ingredients can cure the virus The scientist did not make that statement. The message is false.
No vaccines tested in Brazil have been through pre-clinical trials All vaccines now in test in Brazil have been through all previous phases of testing

Social media messages claim that the scientific journal The Lancet has denied the existence COVID-19 pandemic The Lancet explains that what we are experiencing is a 'syndemic', a term that emphasizes the social and economic inequalities caused by COVID-19, which would be "worsening the adverse effects of each disease", not just the COVID-19

A protest was held in Spain against the coronavirus and compulsory vaccination. An accompanying video depicts a crowded rally in Madrid. The video actually shows a rally against the Spanish Prime Minister in February 2019, way ahead of the first case of the new coronavirus was reported.

There is no coronavirus pandemic and it was invented by Masons to reduce the population of the earth. As an example of this, there is no virus in Iraq because there was no need for it to emerge. Proving that the pandemic was invented and that its real purpose was to reduce the world's population is a well-known conspiracy theory. Additionally, it is disinformation that the coronavirus is "not raging" in Iraq. As of October 20, there are 430,678 infected and 10,317 dead in Iraq by coronavirus.

Social media messages claim that the Colombian doctor Manuel Elkin Patarroyo has said that COVID-19 “will spread to the entire population” Manuel Elkin Patarroyo's secretary, sister and biographer have confirmed that he has never made these claims

Once a vaccine for COVID-19 is done there will be no necessity of it because everybody will already have been immunized by the disease itself; It's a misleading claim. Statistics suggests that less than 10% of population in mosts countries haven't yet been infected. It means that a future vaccine can help to immunize a huge number of people. Also, there is no scientific conclusion about immunization after COVID-19

A publication that says that it is not possible to know what the potential vaccine against COVID-19 contains and that if a patient “becomes quadriplegic, he cannot go to court”, with the image of Dr. Roberto Castellano Although it is true that the bill that obtained the half approval in the Chamber of Deputies raises the “confidentiality of the components of the vaccine”, this does not apply to the ANMAT or to the Ministry of Health of the Nation. It is false that if a patient suffers adverse events attributable to the vaccine, they will not be able to go to court to sue the company that manufactured it.

The U.S. CDC said that the virus which causes COVID-19 was never airborne; masks are therefore worthless Current epidemiological data indicates that COVID-19 primarily spreads through respiratory droplets that are released when an infected person sneezes, coughs, or talks. Growing evidence suggests that smaller aerosol particles may also play a role in the transmission of COVID-19. Wearing face masks and cloth face coverings are effective measures for reducing the spread of COVID-19 because they reduce the transmission of large respiratory droplets. In contrast, some aerosol particles may leak through the fabric pores and around the mask. To reduce the risk of COVID-19 infection, wearing face masks must be combined with other transmission control measures, such as physical distancing, good hand hygiene, and avoiding crowded and poorly ventilated spaces.
An image of a mannequin on a stretcher is said to be part of a montage of the COVID-19 pandemic It is not a montage. It is was a simulation of the United States Navy

A doctor confirms that in Austria there are 10 children admitted with lung infections caused by fungi when wearing a mask There is no evidence to support these claims. Children's hospitals in the Austrian capital deny that any child has been admitted for these causes and specialists insist that the masks do not cause lung infections or pose a risk to health.

Use of protective masks is no longer mandatory in Brazil The legislation cited by the piece of misinformation that has been circulating on the networks is from July this year and determines the opposite: that the use of the equipment is necessary in public and private spaces accessible to the population and on public roads and public transport.

Infusions and nebulizations of different herbs cure the new coronavirus The World Health Organization (WHO) states that some of these household preparations can alleviate symptoms, but they do not fight the disease. On the other hand, in the case of fogging, that international body and other institutions warn that they can spread the new coronavirus.

Face masks are useless to prevent people from getting infected Tweet takes out of context some tables from a study in US. It shows 85% of people in the study that were infected in fact worn face masks. But the same study shows that people who go to public places without wearing masks are more affected by the SARS-CoV-2

The World Health Organization confirmed that the coronavirus is no more deadly or dangerous than seasonal flu The infection fatality ratio (IFR) indicates the proportion of people who die from a disease among all people infected, including both confirmed cases as well as undetected infections. The claim that COVID-19 is no more dangerous than the flu is based on a misinterpretation of the WHO’s estimate that a maximum of 10% of the global population has been infected by the virus that causes COVID-19. Calculating IFR with the upper bound of the WHO’s estimate and recent infection data underestimates the global COVID-19 IFR, which according to current estimates, is at least ten times higher than that of the flu. In addition to lethality, its global distribution, lack of vaccines or effective treatments, and potential long-term damage to survivors make COVID-19 a more significant danger compared to the flu.

The current mortality rate of the new coronavirus in Japan is one death per 10,000,000 people. As of October 20, the number of deaths in Japan from the novel coronaviruses was 1672. On a per million population basis, this translates into 13.2 deaths per million people.
Corona kashyam decoction can cure covid infection within 24 hours No, corona kashyam decoction wont cure covid within 2 hours, fake post has resurfaced on social media
There is a new phone number for inquiries about COVID-19 The number in the message is correct, but only for the inhabitants of the autonomous community of Andalusia

Fewer flu cases being recorded this year because these cases are being diagnosed as COVID-19 Health authorities have observed lower than usual flu activity in October 2020, which is generally the month in which flu season begins. The widespread adoption of public health measures to reduce the spread of COVID-19, such as wearing masks and physical distancing, are likely to have contributed in part to the lower flu activity observed this year as compared to previous years. However, scientists have also cautioned that preparing for the flu season is still important, due to the uncertainty posed by the novelty of the COVID-19 pandemic. Furthermore, the flu season has only just begun at the time of this review’s publication, hence it is premature to conclude that flu cases have indeed decreased compared to last year.

Governor of São Paulo said that whoever fails to take CoronaVac can transmit COVID-19 to those already vaccinated Aos Fatos found no records of similar statements, and a political adviser denied the governor had made that claim.

Governor of São Paulo said that whoever fails to take CoronaVac can transmit COVID-19 to those already vaccinated Aos Fatos found no records of similar statements, and a political adviser denied the governor had made that claim.

A post claims that a new law will require obligatory COVID-19 vaccination and will shield laboratories creating the vaccine from legal liability. The COVID-19 vaccine bill was not enacted, but has received support from a portion of the Chamber of Deputies so far and awaiting action by the Senate. The text does not refer to the mandatory application of a future vaccine; nor does it establish "legal immunity for laboratories due to side effects" but rather proposes legal frameworks for potential contractual conflicts between the State and the companies that produce the vaccine. The “confidentiality” of the components of the vaccine does not apply to ANMAT or the Ministry of Health of the Nation, but rather limits the publication of the data after its evaluation and approval.
Florida and Italy have reports of a virus x that will cause the next identified pandemic Disease X is not a disease, but merely a concept about what could possibly cause the next pandemic

The Lancet denied the existence of the pandemic The Lancet did publish an article titled "COVID-19 is not a pandemic." But it explains that the crisis generated by COVID-19 is not only a pandemic, but a syndemic.
COVID-19 vaccine has a 33% mortality index, while COVID-19 has a 0.6% mortality rate There is no vaccine with a 33% mortality rate

We all have been infected with the new coronavirus just by breathing five seconds outdoors The claim uses fauilty science and repeats an oft used falsehood that an alkeline diet can protect you from COVID-19. This is false, and there is no evidence to support this claim.
Some media claim that Paris impossed alarm state with half of coronavirus incidence than Madrid had The incidence in Paris was higher than in Madrid, according to public data available

Social media users claim that six children have died in Germany because of the mask The death of a 13-year-old teenager after fainting on a school bus in Büchelberg is under investigation by the police. Of the rest of the alleged deaths, neither the police nor the competent prosecutors have evidence

A video shows ophthalmologist Mariano Arriaga criticizing the vaccine law, in which he claims that this law gives “legal protection to the laboratories that produce the COVID vaccine” and that, in the event of adverse effects, they will be free from lawsuits. Sources Chequado spoke to confirmed this law does not exempt labratories from legal liability for problems manufacturing the a future COVID-19 vaccine.
Vitamin supplements prevent and cure coronavirus No, Vitamin supplements wont prevent and cure coronavirus

WHO says it never defended the social quarantine The false claim takes out of context a speech from a special envoy from WHO. Dr. David Nabarro did assume socil quarantine and lockdowns are bad socially and economic, but he never denied its importance. In the same interview he said lockdowns are effective in times of crisis.

A Yale study gave ‘evidence level 1’ to COVID-19 hydroxychloroquine treatment In addition to the fact that the research is preliminary, hasn't been revised and has problems of methodology, according to experts reached by Aos Fatos, the positive evidence of the use of the drug today is weak, according to Oxford University, which compiles medical evidence about coronavirus infection.
Some media claim that Paris impossed alarm state with half of coronavirus incidence than Madrid had The incidence in Paris was higher than in Madrid, according to public data available

The World Doctors Alliance claims that COVID-19 is a type of flu and is not a pandemic; that PCR tests are up to 94% false positive; that only 98 COVID-19 related deaths have been reported in Ireland COVID-19 has spread to every continent and hit many countries. Accordingly, the World Health Organization declared it a pandemic in March 2020. COVID-19 is not a type of flu, as it is caused by a coronavirus that belongs to a completely different virus family to that of the flu virus. Like many other countries, Ireland registered its first COVID-19 death in March 2020 and has recorded more than 1,800 deaths as of October 2020.

Flu vaccine raises the odds of getting a coronavirus by 36% Yes, the US DOD study did look at respiratory viruses, but not COVID-19 specifically. Scientists have confirmed flu shots have notthing to do with sars cov 2.
Congressman Osmar Terra says social distancing does not have impact on the spread of COVID-19. The MP uses data that is not backed by the scientific community

WHO says it never defended the social quarantine The false claim takes out of context a speech from a special envoy from WHO. Dr. David Nabarro did assume socil quarantine and lockdowns are bad socially and economic, but he never denied its importance. In the same interview he said lockdowns are effective in times of crisis.

A video that affirm thath the high frequencies that 5G will use are dangerous and absorb oxygen wherever it penetrates Experts confirm that 5G does not absorb oxygen where it penetrates and the high frequencies in which 5G will be located are not dangerous

Measures taken to combat the pandemic, such as wearing masks, distance protection, testing, self-isolation, quarantine and lockdowns, etc. serve two purposes: to reduce the population, and to bring financial profits to pharmaceutical companies through vaccination, which will also lead to a reduction in population. The allegation that the population decline is planned through vaccination a conspiracy that stems from a misinterpretation of Bill Gates' statement. And a conspiracy that vaccinations serves to enrich pharmaceutical companies is one of the main arguments of anti-vaccine groups.
Adidas is raffling off shoes, t-shirts and masks Similar information was shared via WhatsApp in July 2020, but it is false. It is a phishing scam that has also spread to Bolivia and Spain.
Social media messages affirm that a flu treatment is being used “with dog coronavirus” that makes the patient more vulnerable to the coronavirus There is no evidence that such therapy exists.
Video shows how a girl is acting for the media and simulating she suffers from Covid-19 It was not a farce for the media, it was an exersice to train the personal.
George Orwell wrote “apart from work everything will be forbidden” He did not write this

Social media message claim that in Spain the hospitals are empty, that Spain is the only country that has imposed the use of the masks and that the health workers can not talk with the media, among other things There are a couple of true claims, but there are mostly misrepresentations, half truths and falsehoods.

Elderly people were put to sleep by injection in Italy and the authorities cut back on pensions by doing so. This conspiracy theory spread by a Facebook user is not backed by any evidence through reliable open-sources.

A publication that maintains that the World Health Organization (WHO) “was wrong” and called “now” to avoid quarantine “as the main method to control the advance of the coronavirus” Postings circulating on the networks and on WhatsApp claiming that the agency "made a mistake" and "now" asked to avoid quarantine. The messages emerged from the statement of David Nabarro, a WHO official, who recently said that "we do not advocate blockades as the main means of controlling this virus." However, the international body has been warning since last March about the negative effects of the confinements if they extend over time.
Did The Rothschild family ‘patent in 2015 a method to test for COVID-19’ It was not a covid-test patent at that moment, it was updated later.
Home remedies mentioned in the post can cure coronavirus No, home remedies mentioned in the post wont kill coronavirus

São Paulo’s mayor bought too many coffins and now he doesn’t know what to do with them. São Paulo's townhall in fact antecipated the delivery of the coffins that had already been bought and that would be delivered along the year if it wasn't for the pandemic.
WHO figures show Covid is less serious than seasonnal flu It s an abusive misinterpretation. As WHO made clear, Covid IS more serious and letal than seasonnal flu.

São Paulo’s mayor bought too many coffins and now he doesn’t know what to do with them. São Paulo's townhall in fact antecipated the delivery of the coffins that had already been bought and that would be delivered along the year if it wasn't for the pandemic.

Bill Gates spoke about mass vaccination and noted that vaccines should be in the form of the chip, and people will not be allowed to work if they refuse implanting the chips. Gates also assessed atomic weapons as an old challenge, and named coronavirus as a contemporary threat, and even displayed the model of COVID-19. The COVID-19 vaccine chip claim is a long disproven conspiracy theory.  The photo attached to the post is from Bill Gates' appearance on TED Talk in 2015, where he did not mention coronavirus and did not display COVID-19, but the H1N1 model on the screen.

WHO has now asked countries not to use the landfills nor has it declared them ‘illegitimate’ What the WHO asks for is that it that confinement is not the main method and considers them justified to save time

Social media users say that some videos of Kary Mullis, inventor of PCR, make it very clear that the test is not useful for detecting viruses, and that they dismantle the tool that our rulers use to confine the populations. These are old and decontextualized statements by the inventor of PCR criticizing the use of this technique to identify the HIV virus
Rothschild family patented a method to test COVID-19 in 2015 A 2015 patent on biometrics was updated with coronavirus in 2020. And it has nothing to do with the R family

Twitter users say that Spanish Justice Minister, Juan Carlos Campo, traveled outside of Madrid during the lockdown of the city. The person who appears in the photo is not the minister. Is an ex football player, as it was recognised by him.
Home remedies mentioned in the post can cure coronavirus No, home remedies mentioned in the post wont kill coronavirus

“Corona fraud” has been uncovered and its organizers will now face an international tribunal. The post claiming that the coronavirus pandemic was uncovered as a fraud is conspiratorial. The video itself contains no evidence, because in fact, it reflects an opinion of one lawyer, Dr. Reiner Fuellmich, who questions the existence of COVID-19 pandemic and PCR tests as the means to diagnose COVID-19, and plans to file a lawsuit in court. His lawsuit has not reached any court so far.

A CDC study published in September 2020 showed that more people wearing masks had COVID-19, therefore masks don’t work or make us more likely to catch COVID-19 Health authorities encourage the public to use cloth face masks to reduce the spread of COVID-19 from infected to uninfected people. Scientists use case-control studies, like the one cited in the claim, to evaluate whether a person’s activities, such as wearing face masks or going to restaurants, influence their risk of disease. This study approach is not ideal for detecting the effect of an intervention to reduce the spread of a disease when it is widely used, as is the case with wearing face masks. Scientific evidence supports the use of face masks as an effective measure for reducing the spread of COVID-19.

Twitter users say that Spanish President of the Government, Pedro Sanchez, was on a holiday house outside Madrid during the lockdown in Madrid. There is no evidence of it: the presidente spearker denies it, and Sánchez was in Portugal on Saturday and in Madrid on Monday on public acts.
A Facebook post claims to show there are no excess deaths caused by COVID-19. The post misinterprets the official government figures, which are constantly being updated.
French health secretary warned people should get used to not be seeing friends and family This statement was made by a parody Twiter account
The novel coronavirus that causes COVID-19 is a “normal flu virus.” COVID-19 if deadlier than the seasonal flu, according to the WHO, CDC and other experts.

New York is in the same circumstances and worse than Madrid The city of Madrid has an infection rate five times higher than both the city and the state of New York, and its positivity rate is 14 times higher.

The genomic sequences of coronaviruses that support the hypothesis that the virus arose naturally are all fabricated and don’t actually exist There is no evidence supporting the claim by Yan et al. that genetic sequences of several coronaviruses were fabricated to support the hypothesis that SARS-CoV-2 arose naturally. The presence of highly similar or identical gene and protein sequences are common among organisms that are evolutionarily related to each other. Therefore, it is expected that members of the coronavirus family share similar or identical genetic or protein features. Scientific evidence supports the hypothesis that the virus arose naturally in wildlife before it crossed over to humans.

Millions of test kits for COVID-19 were sold on World Integrated Trade Solution (WITS) in 2017-2018. According to BBC and the World Bank, the website with its screenshot being shared by the authors of conspiratorial opinions, was created in April 2020 to make it easier to find all of the previously existing products that are now being used for COVID-19 testing.

Cali Mayor declared a red alert in five communes due to COVID-19 outbreak Through WhatsApp, an audio is circulating in which a radio newscast announces measures for five communes in the capital of the department of Valle del Cauca, Colombia. But it is a news broadcasted in July.

A post claims the Sputnik V vaccine will modify DNA and makes several others statements about the virus The vaccine will not modify the recipient's DNA. Several other claims made in this video are misleading because though it references some true facts, it reaches many false conclusions.
Donald Trump supposedly said that doctors “have never seen a body kill the coronavirus” as his has done, according to a subtitled video Donald Trump didn't say that, the subtitles are fake.

Supposed document from “Doctors for the Truth Canada” saying that de pandemic was caused by an intoxication produced by flu vaccination. There is no scientifc evidence inking the coronavirus to the flu vaccine

A video from Germany proves the pandemic is a hoax created by the media. The video is part of a training exercise held on September 10 at a Berlin hospital. In addition, the images captured by a student who participated voluntarily have been manipulated, which she herself said in a follow up video on Instagram.

The genomic sequences of coronaviruses that support the hypothesis that the virus arose naturally are all fabricated and don’t actually exist There is no evidence supporting the claim by Yan et al. that genetic sequences of several coronaviruses were fabricated to support the hypothesis that SARS-CoV-2 arose naturally. The presence of highly similar or identical gene and protein sequences are common among organisms that are evolutionarily related to each other. Therefore, it is expected that members of the coronavirus family share similar or identical genetic or protein features. Scientific evidence supports the hypothesis that the virus arose naturally in wildlife before it crossed over to humans.

Bill Gates tweeted about the coronavirus and vaccines in 2019. Bill Gates really tweeted about vaccines on September 19, 2019 in the context of global health challenges. But he did not even mention the coronavirus.

A former Education Minister said São Paulo’s state government shouldn’t provide vaccine to all it’s population. He claimed people younger than 35 years-old don’t need to receive the vaccine. About 23.7% of all death occured among people younger than 59 years-old. The former minister also cited the wrong number of doses.

A video of a businessman who assures that hydrogenated alkaline water improves the symptoms of COVID-19 A video is circulating where a businessman assures that the hydrogenated alkaline water that he produces can reduce the symptoms of the new coronavirus. There are no scientific studies to support such a claim and specialists question the promoted efficacy. The plant where the employer produces this substance is not yet licensed by the corresponding body.

Twitter users say that the Superior Court of Justice of Madrid has rejected the lockdown of Madrid “thanks to (politic party) Vox” It was not thanks to the appeal that Vox presented to the court, but it was the court itself that rejected the ratification of the order requested by the General Counsel of the Community of Madrid
PCR tests dont detect SARS-CoV-2 PCR tests are designed to specifically detect the sars cov 2 genome.
China Seeks courts approval to kill 20000 people No, China didnt Seek courts approval to kill 20000 people. Fake post has resurfaced on social media.
China Seeks courts approval to kill 20000 people No, China didnt Seek courts approval to kill 20000 people. Fake post has resurfaced on social media.
97 elderly died in an old’s people home in Madrid after getting the flu vaccination in september Flu vaccination was not administrated in September in Madrid, according to authorities
The new coronavirus can’t stand temperatures above 36ºC Health authorities, specialists and the existing scientific literature on the topic don't support this claim.

An article that ensures that the director general of the WHO said that “another pandemic is coming and it will be another tragedy” An article published by the Prophetic News site is circulating on social networks, citing alleged statements by the leader of the World Health Organization (WHO), Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus, in which he allegedly alerts about the arrival of a new pandemic with tragic results. However, the official's statements were distorted in this publication and do not agree with those made during the speech he gave on July 9, where he assured that the evaluation of what has been done will help to understand “what we must do to prevent another tragedy as this is repeated in the future ”.

Mortality in the U.S. this year is not materially different from the previous 5 years Excess mortality is a measure of how many more deaths have occurred over a period of time as compared to the same period in previous years. During the first 34 weeks of 2020, 280,000 more people died than during the first 34 weeks of any of the five previous years. From March to August 2020, the number of weekly deaths was consistently higher compared to the weekly deaths of any of the previous five years. The 280,000 excess deaths that occurred in 2020 thus far are likely due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

The New York Times reports that “90% of positive PCR tests were false positives. The New York Times only reported that PCR testing in the United States is too accurate and may include a large number of people with low viral load who had no need for quarantine or other treatments, and did not report not that "90% of people are misdiagnosed".

3 young girls died in German after wearing a face mask There is no evidence about the news that 3 young girls died in Germany after wearing a face mask. The news has been denial by police, autorities and hospitals
Face shields can be used in lieu of masks French health authorities say they dont replace masks

The WHO has radically changed its approach to the Covid-19 epidemic. It opposes compulsory vaccination, calls for regulations to be lifted, and changes hygiene recommendations. According to WHO, asymptomatic carriers of the Covid-19 virus can not infect others, so regulations (keeping distance, masks, etc.) make no sense. Old approaches of the WHO were dictated by the Democratic Party of the US. WHO recommendations on wearing masks, keeping distance and other hygienic norms have not changed substantially since the declaration of the pandemic. According to the WHO and various studies, an asymptomatic carrier of the Covid-19 virus and / or a presymptomatic patient may become a source of infection. Recommendations for wearing a mask and keeping a distance are aimed at preventing the spread of infection from both symptomatic and asymptomatic virus carriers. If face masks work to protect us from viral respiratory illnesses like COVID-19 and the flu and we’ve been walking around in them for months, then why would anyone need a flu shot right now? Scientific evidence demonstrates that wearing face masks reduces the transmission of viral respiratory infections including COVID-19 and the flu. Face masks do not provide 100% protection from infection, therefore additional protection measures, such as physical distancing and good hand hygiene, are also important to practice. A preventative flu vaccine is another effective measure for protecting against flu infections. Similar to wearing face masks, the flu vaccine does not provide 100% protection. However, the flu vaccine can reduce the severity of illness and in turn the likelihood of flu-related complications and death, even in cases where the vaccine does not prevent an individual from getting the flu.

COVID-19 is less deadly than seasonal flu The measure that best describes the lethality of an infectious disease is the infection fatality ratio (IFR). The IFR indicates the proportion of people who die from a disease among all the people infected, including both confirmed cases as well as undetected infections. According to their respective IFR estimates, COVID-19 is at least ten times more deadly than an average flu season, particularly for middle-aged and elderly people. Furthermore, the lack of effective treatments or vaccines for COVID-19, along with potential long-term damage to survivors, make COVID-19 a serious health threat.

COVID-19 mortality rates are very low, therefore COVID-19 is not an important public health concern; if you are 70+ years old, you have a 0.054% chance of dying from COVID-19 The infection fatality ratio (IFR) is the proportion of deaths among all infections, both confirmed and undetected cases. While the IFR for COVID-19 is relatively low for most people except for the elderly, it is only one factor to consider when assessing the public health threat posed by a disease. Despite its relatively low IFR, COVID-19 has caused a large number of deaths due to its high transmission. In less than a year, more than 200,000 deaths have occurred in the U.S. and at least 1 million deaths have occurred worldwide as a result of COVID-19.

More babies die by abortion in two days than all the coronavirus deaths thus far The number of abortions occurring worldwide over two days is roughly 400,000, based on annual estimates from between 2015 and 2019 from a study published in July 2020 in the journal The Lancet Global Health. Although the global number of abortions carried out over two days did exceed the total number of COVID-19 deaths reported in March 2020, when this claim surfaced, the number of deaths from COVID-19 has been growing steadily over time. In fact, the global number of COVID-19 deaths approached and crossed the 400,000 mark in June 2020. Therefore, this comparison is no longer accurate.

Why are we wearing masks for COVID-19 when we don’t wear masks for flu and TB which also kill a lot of people? COVID-19, tuberculosis (TB), and the flu are all respiratory illnesses that spread through the air, hence protective measures recommended for these diseases are similar. However, the three diseases differ in disease prevalence and burden, leading public health officials to devise recommendations specific to each disease. Unlike TB and the flu, there are no effective treatments or vaccines for COVID-19. The number of TB cases in the U.S. is extremely low, and the flu has a lower mortality rate than COVID-19. These factors taken together explain why public health measures for controlling COVID-19 spread are needed in the community, but not implemented in the case of TB and the seasonal flu.

There is no second wave of COVID-19; this second wave is really just the normal flu/common cold season that happens every year Determining the spread of COVID-19 relies mainly on the detection of confirmed cases. Cases are confirmed using PCR tests which specifically detect the presence of genetic material from SARS-CoV-2, the virus responsible for COVID-19, and which do not detect viruses that cause the flu and the common cold. Therefore, even though the flu and the common cold can produce symptoms similar to a mild case of COVID-19, cases of the flu and the common cold would not be included in the reported numbers of confirmed COVID-19 cases.

The U.S. CDC quietly updated their numbers in August to show that only 6% of all coronavirus deaths were completely due to the coronavirus alone Cause of death is defined as a medical condition that triggers a chain of clinical events that leads to the death of a patient. In contrast, comorbidities are medical conditions, either pre-existing or resulting from the primary medical condition, that weaken a patient’s resistance to injuries or diseases and indirectly contribute to their death. Many patients who died from COVID-19 had comorbidities, suggesting that these conditions increased their likelihood of death from COVID-19. For these patients, COVID-19 remains their cause of death, as many would not have died from their comorbidities.

Either masks work or they don’t; if masks work, then physical distancing and lockdowns are unnecessary. It is an oversimplification to claim that “either masks work or they don’t”, because the underlying assumption is that face masks must work perfectly, and if they do not, then they don’t work at all. On the contrary, the risks of disease exposure and the degree of protection one can achieve from different safety measures lie on a continuum. Even though face masks do not confer 100% protection to the wearer or to others, scientific evidence has demonstrated that face masks reduce the transmission of viral respiratory infections like COVID-19 to some degree. Therefore, it remains important for people to continue to practice physical distancing and proper hand hygiene as the combination of the three measures greatly enhances the effectiveness of any one measure used alone.

The RT-PCR test for the virus that causes COVID-19 detects human DNA on chromosome 8, therefore all tests will give a positive result The reverse-transcription PCR (RT-PCR) test is the method of choice for detecting SARS-CoV-2 in samples and is highly specific for the virus. For a PCR test to successfully amplify nucleic acids (DNA or RNA) in a sample, it is necessary for a pair of primers, which are short sequences of single-stranded nucleic acids that recognize and bind to a specific region of the genome, to flank the same target sequence. If only one primer in the pair is able to do so, amplification does not take place and the test produces a negative result. Therefore, even when an RT-PCR test for SARS-CoV-2 uses a primer that matches a human gene sequence, the test would not produce a positive result with human DNA alone because the other primer does not match the human gene sequence.

The greatest trick the U.S. CDC ever pulled was convincing the world you can be sick without having symptoms. Scientific evidence indicates that about half of SARS-CoV-2 transmission occurs before infected individuals experience any symptoms of COVID-19. Studies show that asymptomatic carriers, who are people that never develop symptoms of COVID-19, carry as much of the SARS-CoV-2 virus as symptomatic patients and can spread the virus if they do not take adequate measures, such as wearing masks or maintaining physical distance from others.

The protests against the lockdown measures take place in South Korea. The protests in South Korea are about the government, not the COVID-19 response measures. Moreover, some publications use videos filmed before the pandemic started.

The PCR-tests are not meant to detect viruses. The quote is attributed to the inventor of the Polymerase Chain Reaction (PCR) test. PCR-tests detect the presence of genetic material of viruses, including SARS-CoV-2, in the human body.

The survival rate of COVID-19 is close to 100% without a vaccine, so what exactly will the purpose of the new vaccine be? Due to the high transmissibility of SARS-CoV-2, hundreds of thousands of people have died despite the high survival rate of COVID-19. A vaccine would limit transmissibility and thereby reduce the total number of deaths. Furthermore, by reducing the rate of infection or perhaps simply disease severity, a vaccine could also reduce non-lethal yet potentially permanent conditions, such as damage to the heart, lungs, and other tissues. Finally, a vaccine could slow the propagation of the virus through a population by helping to achieve herd immunity, which protects vulnerable persons such as the elderly and immunocompromised. Vaccines confer a range of important benefits, even for diseases with a high average rate of survival.

Wearing a facemask disrupts pH levels and increases the risk of getting cancer It is untrue that wearing a facemask causes people to breathe in their own carbon dioxide, disrupting their body's pH levels and increasing the risk of illness such as cancer.

German physician Klaus Püschel declared: “There is no killer virus.” Püschel did not say that "there is no killer virus." However, the operation included 250 food modules for 17 places near Cushamen, in which there were no major problems.

mRNA vaccine against COVID-19 could cause “irreversible genetic damage” All the DNA-type vaccine does is instruct the body to make the protein with which Sars-Cov-2 enters human cells, so that the immune system reacts and attacks it with antibodies.

The overall lethality of COVID-19 (infection fatality rate) is about 0.1% to 0.3% and thus in the range of a severe influenza; up to 60% of all persons may already have a certain cellular background immunity to the new coronavirus due to contact with previous coronaviruses (i.e. cold viruses); there is still little to no scientific evidence for the effectiveness of cloth face masks in healthy and asymptomatic individuals In 2020, more deaths have occurred than expected relative to previous years (i.e., excess deaths), even more than the number of excess deaths that occurred during the particularly severe flu season of 2017-2018. Countries like Sweden and Japan that did not implement lockdowns have managed to control the outbreak of COVID-19, but this may be due to unique cultural factors such as the voluntary practice of physical distancing and mask-wearing. Published studies have shown that these measures are effective at significantly reducing virus transmission.

An Australian legal expert said that, as of August 18, 2020, he was not aware of any legislation that banned discussions of COVID-19 conspiracy theories; the Attorney General's Department also said it was not aware of any legislation banning such discussions; the television show pictured in the posts, Nine Network’s Today Extra, said it had been reporting the results of a viewer poll about conspiracy theorists, rather than a piece of legislation.

Our chance of not dying from COVID-19 is 99.96% The COVID-19 cause-specific mortality rate is the proportion of people who have died from the disease relative to the entire population. It is sometimes used to compare mortality between populations of different sizes. It also represents the likelihood that a randomly selected person in the population who was alive at the start of the pandemic already died of the disease. However, it cannot be used to predict an individual’s likelihood of dying from COVID-19 in the future, given the dynamic nature of the epidemic and that every individual’s risk of contracting and dying from COVID-19 is different.

Shortly after President Vladimir Putin declared Russia the first country to approve a vaccine for the novel coronavirus, a photo began circulating in Facebook, Twitter and Instagram posts that claimed it showed Putin’s daughter receiving the jab. The claim in the posts is false; the image has circulated online in news reports since at least 2016; New Zealand health officials said no tourists have been allowed into the country since March 2020 due to the coronavirus pandemic.

A vaccine researcher from the University of Melbourne and an infectious diseases paediatrician from the University of Sydney told AAP FactCheck that making a connection to COVID-19 from the study was impossible.

A painting by Walter Molino in 1962, entitled “Life in 2022.” The picture is misleading, as Misbar investigated it and found that it was actually by the Italian artist Walter Molino and was published in the Italian newspaper La Domenica del Corriere in 1962. However, it talks about the problems related to traffic in cities and the mechanisms suggested by the artist in the painting to reduce the congestion crisis, and it has nothing to do with epidemics and viruses whatsoever.

90 percent of all necessary surgeries in Germany were postponed in March and April because of the pandemic; thousands died because of this Data by health insurances shows that many surgeries were postponed, but most of them were not vital

Sweden has a lower COVID-19 death rate than Spain, Italy and the U.K., even though it never had a lockdown An analysis of COVID-19 mortality rates shows that Sweden is one of the worst-performing countries in Europe, although Italy, Spain, and the U.K. have experienced higher rates. Countries like Sweden that did not implement lockdowns show a range of mortality rates, making it difficult to determine whether Sweden’s policies had any impact, either positive or negative in the COVID-19 epidemic outcome.

Multiple Facebook and Twitter posts shared thousands of times in August 2020 claim that five people in the Philippine city of Tarlac died after receiving vaccine shots. The claim is false; the Tarlac City government and the Philippine Department of Health said the claim was “fake”; the World Health Organization (WHO) said the polio vaccine that was administered across the Philippines in August 2020 was safe.

France classifies Tunisia as red zone due to COVID-19, while Tunisia classifies France as a green area. Misbar verified the circulating news and turned out to be false, as France did not announce that Tunisia is a red zone due to coronavirus. The last measure announced by the Council of the European Union yesterday, August 7, in a statement, was that the European Union decided to withdraw Morocco from the list of countries exempt from travel restrictions due to its registration of a surge in the number of COVID-19 infections.

CDC has released an update on how the novel coronavirus can be transmitted CDC has not released an update that radically changes what is known about virus transmission ways. The claim is based on an article by Erin Bromage and was miscaptured. Dr. Bromage is not affiliated with the CDC.

Captain Mohamed Abdel Monsef, the former goalkeeper of the Zamalek team, was infected with COVID-19. Misbar verified the news, and found that it was false, and Abdel-Monsef and his artist wife, Lekaa Al-Khamisi, denied the news on the Al-Tasea program with the journalist Wael Al-Ibrashi, and Abdel-Monsef explained that during training, team members had contact with people infected with the virus without knowing it, but that all members of the Wadi Degla team were tested, and the results were negative.

A video shows a mock funeral procession to “celebrate” Indian Home Minister Amit Shah testing positive for the novel coronavirus. The video shows a mock funeral procession staged during an anti-citizenship law protest in the east Indian state of West Bengal in 2019.

A video has been viewed tens of thousands of times in multiple posts on Facebook and Twitter alongside a claim it shows New Zealand Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern visiting a Hindu temple after declaring the country had reached its 100th consecutive day of no local coronavirus transmissions. The claim is misleading; the video shows Ardern visiting the temple on August 6, 2020, three days before the country hit its 100-day milestone; on August 11, New Zealand recorded four new locally transmitted COVID-19 infections after 102 consecutive days of no community infections.

Multiple Facebook posts shared thousands of times claim the Australian government paid nursing homes AUS$25,000 for “labelling [COVID-19] as the main cause of deaths on death certificates”. The posts cite a purported broadcast with an unidentified man on an Australian radio station as evidence for the claim. The claim is false; the local radio station that broadcast the segment with the anonymous caller from the general public said the claim was “immediately recognised as potentially inaccurate information” and was not aired again after the initial live broadcast; in response to the misleading posts, Australia’s Department of Health said the claim was “false” and that only registered doctors can issue death certificates.
Tests for coronavirus are harmful to our health The information provided in the article is not based on current scientific knowledge.

Georgian citizens are “experimental rabbits” for the UK vaccine: an insufficiently tested vaccine will be tested on Georgians. In fact, the vaccine is still undergoing clinical trials involving human volunteers that are carried out in both developing and developed countries. As for the vaccine tested in the United Kingdom, the results are quite promising and the company has signed agreements with several countries, including the United States and the EU member states.
The WHO has acknowledged that the vaccines are dangerous. The WHO has never made such a statement.

A large, country-randomized controlled trial with 2.7 billion people shows that COVID-19 patients treated with hydroxychloroquine have a 79.1% lower death rate Some governments have favored the use of hydroxychloroquine for treating or preventing COVID-19. However, this does not necessarily imply that the people within those countries used the drug more often than did people in countries that restricted hydroxychloroquine use. Therefore, correlating countries’ mortality rates with their stance towards hydroxychloroquine use results in a spurious association that is based on flawed reasoning. In contrast, growing evidence from large randomized clinical trials suggests no beneficial effect of hydroxychloroquine in treating COVID-19 patients.

If masks were effective and necessary, non-mask wearers should be dead by now In order to limit and eventually stop an ongoing epidemic, it is necessary to reduce virus transmission. Wearing face masks has been shown to be effective at slowing the circulation of respiratory viruses such as SARS-CoV-2. Some individuals who do not wear masks may still remain healthy because exposure to SARS-CoV-2 does not automatically lead to infection or death. In addition, the use of masks by others within the community can also limit virus transmission, thereby protecting those who do not wear masks, similar to the herd immunity effect

We can’t make a vaccine that works for flu, no vaccine for the respiratory syncytial virus (RSV), and we can’t cure cancer. Yet somehow scientists can make a vaccine for COVID-19 in six months? The flu vaccine helps to reduce the incidence and severity of influenza, although its effectiveness varies between seasons depending on the selection of the flu vaccine virus strains. Cancer is a complex family of diseases for which multiple forms of treatment are available, although the success of such treatments can vary significantly, depending on factors like the type and stage of the cancer. There are a proportion of cancer patients who have achieved complete remission after treatment and remain cancer-free for the rest of their lives, who are thereby considered to be cured. And while there is much we do not know about COVID-19, our prior knowledge of how vaccines work is sufficient to allow us to develop a potential vaccine against the disease.

A photo that circulated on Facebook showed Japanese government officials bowing down to their frontliners who have been working during the COVID-19 pandemic. The photo was taken in Zhejiang Province, China in 2011 – way before the first case of COVID-19 was recorded in December 2019.

Hydroxychloroquine, azithromycin and zinc cure COVID-19 Large-scale clinical trials demonstrate no beneficial effect of hydroxychloroquine in terms of viral shedding, disease severity, or mortality among COVID-19 patients. However, numerous ongoing clinical trials are still evaluating the potential use of hydroxychloroquine to prevent infection in people with a high risk of exposure to COVID-19. Public health institutions caution against unsupervised use of the drug, as it may increase the risk of cardiac toxicity in people with underlying medical conditions. Furthermore, the high demand for hydroxychloroquine is causing a shortage of the drug, which may harm patients who need it to treat chronic diseases like lupus.

Mask can cause a lot of diseases, the WHO has said, and asymptomatic patients don’t pass on the virus. Also, there is a lot of false positive PCR tests. Multiple posts shared hundreds of times on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter and on various websites claim that US top infectious disease expert Dr. Anthony Fauci “has known for 15 years” that chloroquine and hydroxychloroquine are effective treatments for coronaviruses, citing a 2005 academic paper. The claims are false; one of the authors of the 2005 study said the findings were based on laboratory tests for SARS-CoV, not clinical trials; the study was published by the Virology Journal, which belongs to a for-profit publisher and is not associated with Fauci or the US National Institutes of Health; as of August 2020, the World Health Organization (WHO) says there is "no proof that hydroxychloroquine or any other drug can cure or prevent COVID-19".

There is no evidence supporting the claim about viruses or other substances being sprayed by spraying something from the planes.

A photo has been shared hundreds of times in multiple Facebook posts that claim it shows Japanese officials paying tribute to frontline workers during the novel coronavirus pandemic. The claim is false; the photo shows a group of workers in China in 2011.

“There is no solution and perhaps never will be”, statements by the Director General of the World Health Organization (WHO), Tedros Adhanom Several headlines in Spanish have replicated alleged statements by the WHO director that are actually the result of a bad translation.
Photo of a protest against lockdown and mask mandates in Berlin Although protests did occur in Berlin, this photo is from 2018 and was taken in Zurich, Switzerland
An image from an episode of Futurama claims the show forbade time to travel back to 2020. The video is doctored.

Facebook posts shared thousands of times claim Washington’s mayor exempted members of Congress from a 14-day quarantine after they traveled to the funeral of civil rights icon John Lewis in Georgia, which the city considers a “high-risk” state for the coronavirus. But this is misleading, as there was no special exemption; rather, government activity is considered an essential service and the US Capitol is not covered by the mayor’s order, her office said.
Between 500,000 and 3.5 million people attended an anti-corona protest in Berlin on August 1st The numbers circulating on the internet are largely exaggerated. The police spoke of 20000 people

A photo collage has been shared hundreds of times in multiple posts on Facebook alongside a claim the images were taken during a protest against coronavirus restrictions in Germany in August 2020. The claim is false; all four photos have circulated in reports about Black Lives Matter protests across Germany in June 2020.

A picture allegedly showing a large crowd gathered in Berlin on August 1st, 2020 to protest against the restrictive measures imposed by the government during the Covid-19 pandemic. The picture is real but it was taken during the Berlin "Love Parade", in 1999. It is true that on August 1st, 2020 people gathered in Berlin to protest against the restrictions imposed during the pandemic, but the picture was not taken during this event.

A photo has been shared thousands of times in multiple posts on Facebook and Twitter which claim it shows a protest against coronavirus restrictions in the German capital of Berlin in August 2020. The claim is false; the photo, which has circulated online since at least 2018, shows a street parade in Switzerland before the COVID-19 pandemic.

Chlorine dioxide is authorized to combat the coronavirus in Bolivia The Health Commission in Deputies approved the bill that was sent from the Senate. However, it must still be approved by the plenary session of the Lower House, promulgated by the Executive Power and published in the Official Gazette to enter into force.
Churches are not where the coronavirus spreads. There are cases of people getting infected during religious services.

Two pictures show a lot of people gathered on the streets of Berlin, allegedly protesting against the restrictions imposed during the COVID-19 pandemic. The pictures were taken respectively in Berlin and Cologne on June 6, 2020, during a protest against racism.
Masks are a way to slavery. They not only do not protect from COVID-19 but harm. Wearing masks reduces the risk of getting the novel coronavirus. They are not harmful and are not a sign of slavery.

According to a Facebook post, COVID-19 patients must “Avoid frozen things”, not bathe at night and do not consume soft drinks and sweets for 80 days after receiving medical discharge to avoid get sick. Although it is true that there are cases of people who became ill with COVID-19 again, the reason is still not clear. But according to the WHO, 14 days are enough for a person diagnosed with COVID-19 to conclude their isolation. Those who have already been ill should follow the same preventive measures as others: social distance, use of masks and frequent hand washing.

A picture allegedly showing a large crowd gathered in Berlin on August 1st, 2020 to protest against the “Health dictatorship” imposed by the government to stop the Covid-19 pandemic. It is true that on August 1st, 2020 people gathered in Berlin to protest against the restrictions imposed during the pandemic, but the picture was not taken during this event.

The Russian Minister of Health promises the end of COVID-19, and announces the readiness to market the vaccine before August 10, 2020. And Misbar did not find the statement attributed to him to the American CNN channel.

Adidas is giving away face masks. The chain that has circulated on WhatsApp in Cali and Valle del Cauca, as in other countries, is false. It's a phishing attact meant to capture personal and financial data.

A tweet from Congressman Eduardo Bolsonaro includes a video by the mayor of São Paulo, Bruno Covas (PSDB), announcing the inclusion of chloroquine in the protocol for treating patients with covid-19 in municipal hospitals. The video is old

Media agencies did not report on the construction of 22 additional quarantine facilities in Metro Manila, a project spearheaded by the Department of Works and Highways (DPWH). There will be a state-like border between the quarantine zones in Ukraine. According to the latest COVID-19 response regulations, there will be no state-like border between the quarantine zones in Ukraine.

The Spain Medical Doctors Association is impressed by President Rodrigo Duterte’s response against COVID-19. Searches do not yield any results for a "Spain Medical Doctors Association." Velma Dinkley is a fictional character in the Scooby-Doo franchise.
Banning hydroxychloroquine is a conspiracy by the pharmaceutical industry to sell more expensive medications. The studies cited by this claim are not conclusive.

Barack Obama, Melinda Gates and Anthony Fauci visited a laboratory in Wuhan. The photo was taken at the headquarters of the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases in the United States in 2014 and shows Obama and Fauci with officials from that center, but does not show Melinda Gates.

Britain’s Princess Beatrice, Prince Andrew’s eldest daughter, praised President Rodrigo Duterte for his efforts against COVID-19. Princess Beatrice did not say anything about Duterte's COVID-19 response. The photo used in the quote card is that of an actress.

WHO said ‘perhaps there was no reason to order lockdowns for coronavirus’ This is false, and the WHO has not said that.The blog interprets the information from an article published in English and, with a lot of opinion, and they affirm that the organization would have rethought its policies.

South Korea study finds quarantines useless in combating COVID-19 In fact, the study found that people who lived with an infected person contracted the disease more than those who didn't live with someone infected with the virus. According to the researchers, this result reinforces the importance of protective measures, even within homes.
In Colombia, ICUs and hospitals are empty. This is false. It is only necessary to consult the reports on the display of the installed capacity of the Ministry of Health to deny this information.

63 intensive care beds were occupied by infected protesters The publication shared on Facebook quotes Eduardo Valdés, deputy of the Nation for the Autonomous City of Buenos Aires (Frente de Todos), who, indeed, stated so in the media. However, there is no official record with this information. Infected patients are not required to report who all their close contacts are.

A street protest criticizing Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe’s government is the source of the “night life city cluster” The video of the protest that went viral actually took place on November 12, 2019, and was posted on Twitter earlier the same day. But it was not until 2020 that the first cases of the new coronavirus were recorded in Japan.
Wearing a mask makes the wearer inhale mold No scientific evidence was found to support this claim. Several experts have denied it

Tasuku Honjo, Nobel Prize in Medicine, said that the coronavirus “is not natural” The Japanese doctor - winner of the award for his research on cancer treatment - denied having said those statements. The source of the misinformation was a fake Twitter account that bears his name and there is no evidence to show that the origin of the coronavirus is artificial.

However, the GDP of the United States did not "suffer a drop" of 33%, as Kicillof said, but that figure is the result of "annualizing" the fall in the second quarter, something that the official did not clarify.

Photos of inflamed tonsils circulating on Facebook are from patients with COVID-19. This photo is taken out of context, and does not show a COVID-19 patient. A publication describing critical effects of Sars-CoV-2 uses photographs of a bacterial infection and tonsillitis that were taken long before the emergence of the new coronavirus as evidence.

Ziraldo, Brazilian cartoon artist, stated that all mayors who ordered lockdowns will not be reelected Ziraldo never said anything like that
Herman Cain, one-time Republican presidential candidate, died of colon cancer, not COVID-19. News reports and Cain's staff confirmed he died of COVID-19 on July 30.

Brazilian City Halls receive R$ 19,000 in federal funding for each recorded COVID-19 death. According to the Ministry of Health, the pandemic combat funds are distributed according to criteria such as the size of the population and the complexity of the service provided by the units in the municipality, not the volume of deaths.

The inventor of the PCR said his test did not work to detect viruses There is no evidence that the creator of the PCR denied that his test can detect viruses. It is also not true that all the tests that are carried out are positive for COVID-19

The protagonist of the series Breaking Bad, Brian Cranston, announced that he has been infected with the coronavirus. Misbar verified the news circulating and found it misleading, as Brian Cranston announced through a video clip he posted on his Instagram page, on July 30, 2020, about the news of his recovery from COVID-19, while he is on his way to donate blood plasma after recoveringo f the disease.

The pandemic is planned since test kits were produced a year ago. The publication refers to the COVID-19 collection kit elements - nasal swabs and test tubes, which were produced in June 2019. However, these tools are standard for different medical purposes. Their production a year ago does not prove to the claim about a pre-planned pandemic.

President Rodrigo Duterte announced in his 2020 State of the Nation Address that classes are cancelled for school year 2020-2021. Duterte made no such announcement. School year 2020-2021 is still slated to begin on Aug. 24. What the chief executive said in his 2020 SONA is that he will not “allow face-to-face teaching or learning” until a COVID-19 vaccine is available.

Gargling water mixed with salt or vinegar will get rid of the novel coronavirus from one’s throat. The Philippine Health department has said “there is no medical evidence that rinsing the throat with warm water and salt or vinegar will eliminate the virus that causes COVID-19.” The claim has also been debunked by fact checkers in six continents.

The pandemic has been planned since 2010. The evidence is the “Event 201,” Bill Gates speeches, the Rockefeller Foundation and the US National Intelligence Council reports, and others. The claim is based on unsubstantiated speculations. Nothing proves that pandemic is planned.

A video post claims RT-PCR tests used to detect COVID-19 aren’t an appropriate testing method. Dr Rashid Buttar’s claims about the value of PCR testing are not supported by advice from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) in the US or the NHS in the UK. The quote on the PCR test used by Dr Buttar is not from Dr Kary Mullis and is taken out of context.

WHO research that shows the ineffectiveness of the mask The document is not on the Organization's official website and the studies it cites are out of context. In its latest update, the WHO does recommend the use of masks or face masks to health personnel, caregivers, COVID patients and the general population who are in environments where other measures such as healthy distance cannot be guaranteed.

Households should have “required” medical kits with certain items and equipment to treat the different stages of COVID-19. So far, there are no required or prescribed home medical kits for COVID-19. Experts also do not recommend self-medication at home to prevent or cure COVID-19. The medical equipment listed in the claim should likewise be used with medical supervision.

The Philippine Food and Drug Administration (FDA) has approved a specific traditional Chinese medicine (TCM) for treating COVID-19 patients. The FDA approved the TCM Lianhua Qingwen Jiaonang on Wednesday, August 12, weeks before the message about the capsules was circulated. Before August 12, FDA had not approved Lianhua Qingwen Jiaonang for treating COVID-19 and even warned the public on May 6 against purchasing and using the product.

Syrian artist Fayez Qazak was infected with coronavirus. Misbar investigated the news, and found it false. The artist, Louris Kazak, daughter of Fayez Kazak's brother, denied on her Facebook account the validity of the news of her uncle's infection with the virus.

Bill Gates has confessed that his experimental COVID-19 vaccine will permanently change DNA. Bill Gates has never said this. Moreover, the mRNA vaccine, the development of which is supported by Gates, cannot change the DNA.

Tall people more likely to get infected with covid-19 The study cannot show that a larger stature increases your risk of covid-19. Among the British participants there were more tall people who tested positive for covid-19, but for the American participants the opposite was true. Any correlation between height and risk of covid-19 is probably due to coincidence.

Chloroquine is the cure for COVID-19 and masks should not be used. The most reliable studies released so far show that antimalarials have no effect on the disease and research indicates that masks can reduce contagion by the new coronavirus.
During COVID-19 PCR test, microships are integrated to human bodies It is anatomically impossible to integrate a chip into the brain through PCR tests.

Wearing a mask lowers the blood oxygen level. There is no evidence for this. A specialist contacted by Aos Fatos did say that when made with inappropriate material, such as jeans, the mask can cause, at most, respiratory distress, but nothing as severe as hypoxia.

Critics say it is wrong to use of PCR tests for to detect COVID-19 since, in theory, this is not specific to SARS-CoV-2.  It is a non-specific test in which genetic material from any organism can be detected and can potentially misidentify another virus as COVID-19. It is not true that the PCR being used now is non-specific. It uses SARS-CoV2's specific genetic make up to detect the virus.
The flu vaccine caused the spread of COVID-19. This is false: there is no evidence of a relationship between the two factors.

A doctor recommends the use of ivermectin, hydroxychloroquine, chlorine dioxide and interferon to cure coronavirus. Those medications don't cure the virus. They are used in other medical treatments, but not for COVID-19.
