Dr. Stella Immanuel says a cure has been found for COVID-19 In a video shared by U.S. President Donald Trump, (which was later removed by various social media platforms), he claims that the cure is "hydroxychloroquine, zinc and Zitromax." There is no evidence this drug combination has any impact on COVID-19. Several scientific studies have shown it has little to no impact.
People will be vaccinated against COVID-19 by force. There is no proof that the vaccination against COVID-19 will be mandatory.

The truck depicting the god of death Anubis is aimed at testing and then infecting people, which eventually ends with human microchipping. These mobile testing trucks belong to the AardvarkMobileTours company, which stated on Twitter on July 11 that their new division’s Aardvark Mobile Health’s Mobile Covid-19 Testing Trucks was available for governmental agencies and large corporations. The symbol of the AardvarkMobileTours derives from the company’s name, Aardvark and is the symbol of the animal with the same name, the aardvark, not the god of death Anubis.

A woman received the vaccine from Chinese Sinovac Biotech and had symptoms such as pain, fever and malaise. In fact, she claimed to have participated in the Oxford University vaccine tests in Brazil. The symptoms reported are not considered serious and may appear in other approved vaccines for diseases such as meningitis.
Wearing masks weakens the immune system. Wearing masks recommended by health organizations like the WHO. Masks allow oxygen to pass through, while protecting the wearer from viral exposure.
COVID-19 does not affect children. Children cannot infect other people either. The Mayo Clinic and WHO say that children of all ages can get and spread SARS-CoV-2.

A message that ensures that the Argentine infectologist Pedro Cahn did not present “a work or was recognized” A message circulates in networks that do not know the professional career of the infectious medicine doctor and current advisor to the President of the Nation, Alberto Fernández, in health matters. However, according to the Scopus index - which measures scientific quality - Pedro Cahn was cited in pairs by more than 8,658 papers. In addition, according to the PubMed search engine, it is mentioned at least in 283 investigations. Whoever wrote the tweet, despite the fact that in his biography he claims to be a "Conicet researcher", does not appear on the payroll of the state agency and his image belongs to another doctor.

An image shows a traffic accident where the driver allegedly died from hypoxia from wearing the mask. It is a hoax since the photo corresponds to a traffic accident that occurred in Mallorca on June 1, 2019, months before the COVID-19 pandemic. The government recommended the use of masks.
Plastering powder on this man’s face shows that masks don’t filter the new coronavirus The plaster powder went through the open spaces between the mask and the skin.

An image that casts doubt on the tools used in rapid tests for coronavirus. The image mistakenly concludes that with saliva drops it is possible to know if a person is infected with coronavirus, something that has not been established.
Lemon, ginger and garlic cures coronavirus. Those natural ingredients don't cure the virus.

A post claimed that photos of a man in a gold mask are of a religious leader who “asked his congregation for a gold mask because God revealed it to him in a dream.” The man with the golden mask is not a preacher. He is a businessman dedicated to the construction of industrial warehouses in India. His name is Shankar Kurhade. The money to buy the face mask came out of his own pocket and no religious congregation intervened.

A video in Bolivia of a man being loaded into an ambulance claims this is a “false death.” The video was taken in a simulation of the protocol for the collection of corpses on public roads. In a program of the Bolivian channel ATB digital it was clarified what should be a "recreation" and not a real case. In another broadcast that caveat was not made and this disinformation arises from that broadcast.

A message that ensures that the Argentine infectologist Pedro Cahn did not present “a work or was recognized” A message circulates in networks that do not know the professional career of the infectious medicine doctor and current advisor to the President of the Nation, Alberto Fernández, in health matters. However, according to the Scopus index - which measures scientific quality - Pedro Cahn was cited in pairs by more than 8,658 papers. In addition, according to the PubMed search engine, it is mentioned at least in 283 investigations. Whoever wrote the tweet, despite the fact that in his biography he claims to be a "Conicet researcher", does not appear on the payroll of the state agency and his image belongs to another doctor.

Video of a doctor at a press conference who said: Hydroxychloroquine is a cure for COVID-19. He also said that masks are not necessary. Hydroxychloroquine was not shown to be a cure for COVID-19. The WHO has already eliminated this drug from its trials. So far there is no cure for COVID-19. Many studies show the effectiveness of masks in stopping infections.

A group called America’s Frontline Doctors are featured in viral video claiming hydroxychloroquine cures COVID-19. There is no known cure for COVID-19, and current scientific evidence hasn’t found that hydroxychloroquine is an effective treatment.

Stella Immanuel claims that the drug combination of hydroxychloroquine, zinc and azithromycin is a cure and preventative for COVID-19 and that people don’t need to wear masks or practice physical distancing in a Breitbart video featuring a group called America’s Frontline Doctors. Current scientific evidence does not support the use of hydroxychloroquine to prevent or cure COVID-19. In contrast to some small early studies showing an increased recovery rate among patients treated with hydroxychloroquine, more recent large and well-designed clinical trials showed no such improvement when the drug was used alone or in combination with zinc or azithromycin. In the absence of a proven cure for COVID-19, physical distancing, good hand hygiene, and the use of masks are effective measures for reducing the transmission of the disease.

A photo of a young man with a swollen face. Allegedly, he was a volunteer for Coronavac, a Chinese vaccine against COVID-19 being tested in Brazil The photo is from 2017 and shows a young man who suffered an allergic reaction to peanuts, in the United States

A photo of man with swollen face shows side effect of CoronaVac in Brazilian volunteer The images were published in 2016 in the USA and show an allergic reaction to peanut butter that was spread on the face of a student at a prank at Central Michigan University.
CoronaVac uses cells from aborted fetuses. CoronaVac is produced from the multiplication of the COVID-19 virus in cells taken in the 1960s from an African monkey kidney and grown in the laboratory.

A Facebook post that claims that the COVID-19 is a “fraud,” because the mass media used the same photo of a portuguese boy in multiple stories about children who died from COVID-19. The post mirrepresents the media's reporting on children dying of COVID-19. One story was about the Portuguese boy in the photo. The other two either didn't use the photo or did not attribute it to the subject of their story.

Medical masks harm health and environment. However, they do not influence the spread of coronavirus. Masks create additional wastes - it is true. However, it is a necessary measure to curb virus transmission. Moreover, wearing masks is safe if one follows the rules.

A news article claims 30% of Ukrainian patients who participated in an American COVID-19 vaccine trial died. The test took place in the area of Lugansk, an Ukrainian separatist region The news hasn't been confirmed by any reliable media or institution, and it has been debunked also by Ukranian fact-checkers.
Maduro decided to maintain quarantine in Venezuela until January No, Maduro hasn´t declared a quarantine for many months, but monthly extensions
Lemon, ginger and garlic cures coronavirus. Those natural ingredients don't cure the virus.

Multiple posts shared hundreds of times on Facebook and Twitter claim that four Ukrainian soldiers died after participating in American COVID-19 vaccine trials in the northeastern Ukrainian city of Kharkiv. The claim, published in several languages across different posts, was attributed to a police spokesperson in the self-proclaimed Lugansk People’s Republic. The claim is false; Ukraine military and Kharkiv medical officials said the posts were “fake news”.
The Ministry of Health of Belarus has recognized COVID-19 to be a mental illness. The Ministry of Health of Belarus has never made such a statement.

The World Health Organization warns a group of countries not to reopen schools and threatens to send UN forces to impose the closure. The news is false and unfounded, as Misbar did not find it published on the official website of the World Health Organization or on any credible media outlet.

A volunteer for Coronavac, a Chinese vaccine against COVID-19 being tested in Brazil, reported severe fevers in a story published by Marie Claire magazine. The story published by Marie Claire is about a volunteer of a different vaccine, that is being developed by Oxford University.

Swedish King Johan Konrad III and Queen Marie Katherine of Sweden praised President Rodrigo Duterte for his administration’s response to the COVID-19 pandemic, the war on drugs, and the 2017 Marawi siege. The images on the quote cards are actually Swedish YouTuber Felix Kjellberg (also known as "PewDiePie") and his wife, social media personality Marzia Kjellberg. The reigning Swedish monarchs, King Carl XVI Gustaf and Queen Silvia, have not recently said anything about President Rodrigo Duterte.
There’s chloroquine and ivermectine on lemon and orange peels Both chloroquine and ivermectin are synthetic molecules, and thus do not exist in nature.
Wearing a face mask to slow the spread of COVID-19 could cause Legionnaires’ disease. People cannot get Legionnaires’ disease from wearing a face mask

Brazilian CoronaVac volunteer reported body pain and fever after vaccination. The volunteer actually took the vaccine produced by the University of Oxford. In addition, the reported symptoms were estimated by the researchers as possible side effects of the immunization.
Masks Can Be Sanitized In Microwave Fabric masks should not be sanitized by microwaving it for 2-3 minutes. Instead, they should be washed properly using soap and water. This viral post is fake.

Bulgarian former politician Plamen Paskov claims that the world leaders, including the Gates, the Rockefellers, the UN, want to reduce the population. The claim is groundles and based on unsustained speculations.

Japanese are acquiring indoor plants to cure mental illnesses caused by the pandemic This image was taken by the photographer Shinjiro Watanabe. Through his works, the artist promotes the coexistence of all living beings.

Brazilian regulatory agency Anvisa labeled ivermectin a controled substance, because it’s cheap and helps save lives. The Brazilian regulatory agency Anvisa labeled ivermectin a controled substance, because of misinformation saying it was a cure for COVID-19. It has not been proven effective by any reliable scientific research, and drugstores were running out of it. The regulatory agency did the same with hydroxychloroquine, chloroquine and azithromycin.

The Syrian artist Mutasim Al-Nahar, the protagonist of the series “Five and a half”, and his wife Lynn Brengakji were infected with the coronavirus. Misbar investigated the news, to find that it was false, and Lyn Brinjakji, Al-Nahar's wife, denied in a story on her Instagram account that she and her husband had been infected with coronavirus.

Brazilian CoronaVac volunteer reported body pain and fever after vaccination. The volunteer actually took the vaccine produced by the University of Oxford. In addition, the reported symptoms were estimated by the researchers as possible side effects of the immunization.

Lawsuits filed against Fauci and Gates for creating and artificially disseminating the virus No lawsuits have been filed in the U.S. against Dr. Fauci and Bill Gates. The claim is based on the Next News Network’s program called Special Report in which three representatives of medicine and science spheres – Rashid Buttar, Shiva Ayyadurai, and Judy Mikovits were demanding that Dr. Fauci to get arrested because the crisis harms the American economy. They also accused Bill Gates of planning to use vaccines for inserting chips into humans and establishing total control. The given report is not available on the official Youtube channel of the Special Report by the Next News Network.

Japanese are acquiring indoor plants to cure mental illnesses caused by the pandemic This image was taken by the photographer Shinjiro Watanabe. Through his works, the artist promotes the coexistence of all living beings.
Wearing a face mask to slow the spread of COVID-19 could cause Legionnaires’ disease. People cannot get Legionnaires’ disease from wearing a face mask
The Ministry of Health of Belarus has recognized COVID-19 to be a mental illness. The Ministry of Health of Belarus has never made such a statement.

Asymptomatic COVID-19 carriers immunize other people. That is why they should not wear masks. Natural immunization is dangerous since it may entail an enormous number of deaths. While wearing masks reduces the transmission of the virus.
The list shows Donald Trump’s actions related to the coronavirus The information provided is false or has been manipulated.

Multiple posts shared tens of thousands of times on Facebook and Twitter claim that a woman contracted pleurisy, a lung inflammation condition, after wearing a face mask for an extended period of time. According to the posts, the unidentified woman caught the disease because she was breathing in carbon dioxide and her own bacteria. The claims are false; pulmonologists say wearing a face mask does not put you at risk of developing pleurisy, nor does it deprive users of adequate oxygen or cause a surge in carbon dioxide levels.
A COVID-19 victim raises an arm after death The original video that appears in this publication comes from the ATB Digital portal and consists of a re-creation

Multiple posts shared tens of thousands of times on Facebook and Twitter claim that a woman contracted pleurisy, a lung inflammation condition, after wearing a face mask for an extended period of time. According to the posts, the unidentified woman caught the disease because she was breathing in carbon dioxide and her own bacteria. The claims are false; pulmonologists say wearing a face mask does not put you at risk of developing pleurisy, nor does it deprive users of adequate oxygen or cause a surge in carbon dioxide levels.
COVID-19 Means ‘See A Sheep Surrender’ In Latin COVID-19 Doesn’t Mean ‘See A Sheep Surrender’ In Latin, Viral Claim On Etymology Of COVID-19 Is Fake.

The World Health Organization announced that SARS-CoV-2 can stay in the air for eight hours. While WHO has already admitted that airborne transmission in public areas of SARS-CoV-2 is a possibility, the international group never said it can live in the air for eight hours.

Pictures of a flooded NMCH hospital in Patna The picture of a hospital flooded rain water going viral as recent claiming it to be from Patna, is actually a 2018 photo of Nalanda Medical College Hospital.
The WHO hired the PR-company to inflate the pandemic. The WHO works with the PR agency to increase public knowledge regarding the prevention of the virus's spread.
The nasal swab test for COVID-19 damages the “blood-brain barrier” and can therefore lead to brain infections. Medical experts say the nasal swab test for COVID-19 is completely safe.

A press conference from a group calling itself ‘Doctors for the truth’, shares false or out of context data regarding cures, prevention and the spread of the virus. The arguments of the doctors that appear in the videos are not supported by scientific evidence, have no validity or recognition by any health authority and most have been previously verified by El Sabueso and other international verifiers.

Publications that state that “the new vaccine contains digitizable ‘RNA’”, an alleged “replicant that is activated by 5G” and that is why “the virus can be reactivated after the patient recovers” There is still no approved vaccine against the new coronavirus. The concept of “digitizable RNA” does not exist and it is not true that RNA can be replicated. It is also not true that 5G networks can activate the virus, as this chain falsely marks.

A ship carrying Honduran mobile hospitals caught fire No, there is no record that this fact is true. The image that was shared thousands of times on different Facebook accounts is from 2018 and the ship traveled through the Arabian Sea.
Men are twice as likely to die from COVID-19 as women. The report overgeneralizes published figures.
The use of a double biosafety suit prevents the new coronavirus A single biosecurity suit is enough to prevent contagion as long as all measures are taken when removing it.
A government minister claims that Papad help produce antibodies to fight COVID-19 infection. Papad does not produce antibodies to fight COVID-19 infection

A Facebook post claims the recovery rate from COVID-19 is “99.9 per cent”, and claims there is a choice between getting the disease and getting “the vaccine with an 80 per cent adverse reaction rate”. It is incorrect to claim COVID-19 has a 99.9 per cent recovery rate as statistics do not back that claim. It is false to claim there is any vaccine available that has an 80 per cent adverse reaction rate and there is no reliable basis on which to claim five people have died during any COVID-19 vaccine trial.

Philippine opposition senator Leila De Lima is shown in a quote card begging President Rodrigo Duterte to free her from detention in fear of dying from COVID-19. This is fake. A keyword search online shows De Lima never made this statement.

Cuba’s low number of COVID-19 deaths is due to its use of hydroxychloroquine to treat patients First of all, Cuba uses chloroquine instead of hydroxychloroquine. Also, the quotes of a cuban doctor were taken out of context. They use it, but they state that it is not one of the main reasons the country has a low death toll
A photo claiming to show Jair Bolsonaro hospitalized for coronavirus. The photo was taken in 2019 when he was being treated for pnemonia

Homemade recipe from a soccer leader from Tarija goes viral teaching how to combat the new coronavirus The World Health Organization indicates that, although there are solutions of Western medicine or home remedies that can be "comforting" and alleviate the mild symptoms of COVID-19, "so far no medication has been shown to prevent or cure this disease" .
A photo claims to show a prescription list of medications to treat coronavirus at home. There is no general treatment for COVID-19 yet, and self-medication may be a risk.
COVID-19 is a plot by the WHO, Bill Gates, and other governments to enrich themselves. There is no evidence supporting this claim.
A person with a cold or flu will test positive for COVID-19 Testing for an existing case of COVID-19 will not return a positive result if a person has a cold or the flu.

A meme claims that Bill Gates was “expelled from India for leaving 47,000 permanently disabled and disabled children, a direct result of his polio vaccine.” The Foundation has not been expelled from the country, rather it is one of India's main partners in the fight against polio. Also, the allegations about vaccines are false.
Health authorities in Ireland have banned hydroxychloroquine as a potential COVID-19 treatment Health authorities have not banned the use of hydroxychloroquine in Ireland.

Claim: Top Georgian health official Gamkrelidze said the COVID-19 vaccine will be available in Georgia in several weeks The head of the NCDC Gamkrelidze has not made a statement saying the vaccines will be available in Georgia in several weeks
Amitabh Bacchan tests negative to COVID-19 Amitabh denied this claim.

Oxford University has a vaccine which has been scientifically proven to work against COVID-19. The product is still in the testing phase. The vaccine needs to demonstrate safety and efficacy in the third stage of clinical trials.
Data show the pandemic is losing its strength and that number of deaths is declining. At the moment of publication, the pandemic was not in decline. This post used outdated information.

The UAE completely controls coronavirus, celebrating this with the national anthem. Misbar checked the video clip to find that the titles accompanying the video are misleading, as the clip has spread as part of a campaign to disinfect and sterilize the streets of UAE cities and not to celebrate the elimination of the coronavirus epidemic.

A video stating that in Brazil hospitals receive €3.000 for each Covid-19-related death. The distribution of resources among Brazilian health facilities does not depend on the number of COVID-19 victims, but is instead based on the number of persons residing in each Brazillian state.
A photo claiming to show Jair Bolsonaro hospitalized for coronavirus. The photo was taken in 2019 when he was being treated for pnemonia
Data show the pandemic is losing its strength and that number of deaths is declining. At the moment of publication, the pandemic was not in decline. This post used outdated information.
A post uses an image of an “undocumented Nicaraguan” and claims he tested positive for COVID-19, and is “spitting on doors” The image really was of a Spanish Youtuber
A photo claims to show a prescription list of medications to treat coronavirus at home. There is no general treatment for COVID-19 yet, and self-medication may be a risk.
Amitabh Bacchan tests negative to COVID-19 Amitabh denied this claim.

Only 8 people under the age of 65 have died of COVID-19 in Ireland 113 people under the age of 65 had died of COVID-19 at the time this claim was made, not 8

Oxford University has a vaccine which has been scientifically proven to work against COVID-19. The product is still in the testing phase. The vaccine needs to demonstrate safety and efficacy in the third stage of clinical trials.
The picture shown in the post is of Dr Sundar Tolani who died due to coronavirus This is not the photograph of Dr Sundar Tolani who died of coronavirus.

5G generates the coronavirus SARS-CoV-2 in human skin cells. The proposed mechanism of action described in the claim that 5G millimeter waves can generate SARS-CoV-2 in human cells violates fundamental principles of biology. Scientific evidence does not support a causal relationship between 5G and COVID-19. Many of the regions with the highest COVID-19 infection rates, such as Brazil, do not have 5G coverage, providing further evidence that 5G is not associated with the pandemic.

João Doria, governor of São Paulo, took a COVID-19 vaccine that is being tested in Brazil without wearing a mask The photo was taken in March 2020, before masks became mandatory in São Paulo, and he was taken a flu vaccine

Coronavac, a Chinese vaccine against COVID-19 being tested in Brazil, is made with aborted fetus cells Science magazine listed six vaccines which are use cell lines originated by two human fetuses that were aborted in the Netherlands, in 1972 and 1985, in their development proccess. Coronavac is not among them. For this particular step, it uses a cell line originated from an African green monkey.

A Facebook video claims that a new oral spray “deactivates 98% of the coronavirus” in the mouth. This effect is believed to be partly due to the ability of trypsin to sever proteins on the surface of the SARS-CoV-2 virus. Some studies suggest that trypsin-containing solutions may speed wound healing and can deactivate certain viruses in vitro, but only a few clinical studies have tested such solutions in humans. These studies demonstrate mild improvement of common cold symptoms, which can be caused by different coronaviruses. However, the mechanism of action of the sprays is still unclear and no in vivo data is available to support the hypothesis that trypsin-based sprays might also work against SARS-CoV-2 as implied in the video.

Scientific evidence does not support a causal relationship between 5G and COVID-19. Many of the regions with the highest COVID-19 infection rates, such as Brazil, do not have 5G coverage, providing further evidence that 5G is not associated with the pandemic.
It s good to catch COVID-19 in the summer, as it is less aggressive To date, no scientific evidence shows that the virus is weaker in the summer.
The WHO wants to inject microchips into everyone to control them. There is no evidence supporting this claim.

President Rodrigo Duterte is set to announce a nationwide total lockdown in July. This is a rehashed false claim that was debunked in April. As of July 23, the Philippine National Police (PNP) said there is "no such nationwide lockdown.

COVID-19 measures are a cover-up for the fall of the global financial markets. There is no evidence supporting the claim. The COVID-19 pandemic is one of the causes of the economic downturn, and is an independent factor influencing it.

A Facebook post claims the Brazilian Supreme Court took over responsibility for the pandemic from  Bolsonaro. The Supreme Court decided that states and cities were able to decide over quarantines and lockdowns, but did not deny the responsibility of federal government over other questions concerning the pandemic of COVID-19.

A tweet from Olavo de Carvalho claims that three ministers from Macron’s government were being investigated because of misregulation regarding chloroquine The reason the French ministers left the government is not related with chloroquine regulamentation

A claim that facemasks restrict breathing and cause hypoxia. Facemasks don't cause hypoxia. They are physical barriers against aerosols and saliva drops, not for oxygen or any other gas, whose molecules are much smaller.
The presidents of Belarus and Madagascar were offered money to introduce lockdown. There is no evidence supporting this claim.

Bolivia allows chlorine dioxide as a cure for Covid-19; it can help patients within days Bolivia passed a law that allows the use of chlorine dioxide for Covid-19 patients (as an exemption). But the health ministry of Bolivia warned against it. There is no evidence that chlorine dioxide can help - on the contrary it may be harmful
The NIH confirms that 5G can cause Covid-19 An article about this was published in the National Library of Medicine, but it was withdrawn

The picture shown in the post is of Dr Sundar Tolani who died due to coronavirus This is not the photograph of Dr Sundar Tolani who died of coronavirus.
A WhatsApp chain circulating in Cali offers free PCR tests with results between 12 to 24 hours This is fake. The Municipal Health Secretariat asked the public not to believe in such publications.
Mayor Claudia López was quoted saying housewives are the occupation with the highest contagion in Bogotá Mayor Claudia López did not mention that many more people did not register any occupation.

The president of Ghana said that the coronavirus was created in a laboratory The disinformation arises from a video that simulates the voice of the Ghanaian president and that was denied by the fact-checking site Bolivia Verifica. There is no evidence to claim that the coronavirus was created artificially.

A claim that facemasks restrict breathing and cause hypoxia. Facemasks don't cause hypoxia. They are physical barriers against aerosols and saliva drops, not for oxygen or any other gas, whose molecules are much smaller.

COVID-19 measures are a cover-up for the fall of the global financial markets. There is no evidence supporting the claim. The COVID-19 pandemic is one of the causes of the economic downturn, and is an independent factor influencing it.

The COVID-19 vaccine being developed in China is more effective and cheaper than the one developed by Oxford University. The two vaccines for COVID-19 are still in the experimental stage, and currently nobody can determine their how much they'll cost of how effective they'll be.
A mobile COVID-19 testing station bears a logo that depicts an ancient deity of death. The logo actually shows an aardvark, which is the name of the company that designs and manufactures the trucks.

Masks can be sanitized in microwave The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare recommends certain ways to sanitize homemade face coverings, and microwaving is not one of them. Some contain metal strips that are not safe to put in a microwave.  Instead, they should be washed properly using soap and water. The viral post is fake.

Protesters who were with actress Angel Locsin at the ABS-CBN noise barrage held on Saturday, July 18, were infected with COVID-19. As of Tuesday, July 28, there have been no official reports that anyone who joined the July 18 noise barrage tested positive for COVID-19 due to their attendance of the said event.

Non-contact thermometers emit infrared rays, which damage the pineal gland just behind the forehead. Non-contact thermometers do not emit infrared rays; they detect the rays emitted by our body and measure temperature. Also, the pineal gland is not on our forehead.

A video that supposedly shows medical staff protesting because the pandemic is a “fraud”, something not real. The video is real but corresponds to a protest that took place in Januay, before the pandemic.

An image that supposedly shows the results of vaccination campaigns on children in Sierra Leone The photographer has confirmed that this photo was taken in 1998 and that it shows children affected by polio.

The Brazilian federal government dismissed 396,000 civil servants who received fraudulent COVID-19 emergency assistance. The number relates to an investigation made by CGU (Comptroller General of the Union) that identified 396,316 benefit payments in May to public agents. Of this total, 7,236 were federal employees, however, the agency said the cases are analyzed individually, and didn't say whether anyone had been fired for that reason.

A video from family doctor Natalia Prego Cancel criticizing PCR, the test used to detect coronavirus in active infections. It is not true that PCR tests positive for all types of coronaviruses and other virus families.

A post that shows a doctor from Santiago del Estero (Argentina) who is fighting against the coronavirus. A publication on Facebook indicates that the woman in the photo is "Daniela Villa", who "is fighting tirelessly to find a cure for Covid-19, but since it is from the inside, no one will share it." The woman in the photo is Lebanese porn actress Mia Khalifa, who posted that image alongside a doctor to her Instagram account in January 2018.
Central government has given permission for schools to re-open. The central government has refuted the claim via Twitter.
A post claims the COVID-19 swab test can cause brain inflamation. The text has multiple medical inaccuracies. The swab test never touches the blood brain barrier.

Favipiravir and colchicine could kill the virus and/or help you avoid the symptons Nor favipavir neither colchicine could cure the virus or help to treat the symptoms. Favipiravir is among the drugs being tested.

Drinking water boiled with turmeric powder, ginger, carom seeds and coriander seeds can cure COVID-19. The claim has no scientific evidence and no approval from WHO or any other health organization. As per Ayurveda, turmeric, carom seeds, ginger, lukewarm water, etc. have medicinal properties and can be used as an immunity booster for all diseases. However, it is not proven that these ingredients can prevent or cure COVID-19.

A post that has a list of recommendations to prevent and treat the new coronavirus. The suggestion of consuming an alkaline diet to combat COVID-19 is false. There is no evidence or official health recommendations regarding the use of acetaminophen as an effective measure against the virus for an infected person. However, the recommendations on how to prevent the spread of SARS-CoV-2 are true.

A video shows the execution of a journalist who denounced wasteful spending in city hall’s work to combat COVID-19 in the Brazilian state of Pará The images show an execution that took place in Ecuador in January 2020, and the journalist himself denied the rumor on his social networks.

Protesters who were with actress Angel Locsin at the ABS-CBN noise barrage held on Saturday, July 18, were infected with COVID-19. As of Tuesday, July 28, there have been no official reports that anyone who joined the July 18 noise barrage tested positive for COVID-19 due to their attendance of the said event.

Masks can be sanitized in microwave The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare recommends certain ways to sanitize homemade face coverings, and microwaving is not one of them. Some contain metal strips that are not safe to put in a microwave.  Instead, they should be washed properly using soap and water. The viral post is fake.
A post claims the COVID-19 swab test can cause brain inflamation. The text has multiple medical inaccuracies. The swab test never touches the blood brain barrier.
A mobile COVID-19 testing station bears a logo that depicts an ancient deity of death. The logo actually shows an aardvark, which is the name of the company that designs and manufactures the trucks.

The number relates to an investigation made by CGU (Comptroller General of the Union) that identified 396,316 benefit payments in May to public agents. Of this total, 7,236 were federal employees, however, the agency said the cases are analyzed individually, and didn't say whether anyone had been fired for that reason.

According to the Brazilian Civil Registry, there were more deaths in 2019 than in 2020, considering the first semester only. The Civil Registry data shows that there were 60 thousand more deaths on the first semester of 2020, when compared to the same period of 2019.
The EPS tested less than 5% of the inhabitants of Córdoba for COVID-19 The calculations were off, but the analysis was spot on.

Favipiravir and colchicine could kill the virus and/or help you avoid the symptons Nor favipavir neither colchicine could cure the virus or help to treat the symptoms. Favipiravir is among the drugs being tested.

A journalist who denounced politicians in Pará for stealing funds destined to fight COVID-19 was shot and killed. The journalist himself published a video on Instagram saying he was alive. The video that "proved" he was murdered was shot in Ecuador, last January.
Ghana’s president backs conspiracy theories about COVID-19. The Ghanaian government has already denied it.

Brazil recorded more deaths in the first half of 2019 than in the first half of 2020. The numbers presented in the posts don't match those of the Civil Registry platform, which the claim indicated as source. In fact, death records from January to June 2020 are higher than the same interval in 2019.

A post claims the WHO ruled out a vaccine from the United States and recommended another from China that costs $10,000 There is no record of these supposed actions. WHO lists more than 160 vaccines in development, including research in the United States, and understands that the more candidates, the better.
Minister of Health Łukasz Szumowski said that flu is now a bigger problem than COVID The statement comes from the beginning of the year when the pandemic was not present in Poland

The flu vaccine increase the risk of a corona infection It has not been demonstrated that the flu vaccine increases the risk of covid-19. The media-released study found a slightly increased risk of infection with coronaviruses other than SARS-CoV-2 (e.g. cold viruses) in U.S. military personnel. But that difference was small and possibly due to other factors.

In the US tenthousands of death cases may have been falsely attributed to Covid-19 There is no evidence that a larger number of death cases were not due to Covid-19 but to other causes like accidents. The way the death cases are counted in the US doesn't support this theory
Authorities discreetly re-authorised hydroxychloroquine for COVID-19 To date, HCQ is not authorized for COVID-19.

A post claims the WHO ruled out a vaccine from the United States and recommended another from China that costs $10,000 There is no record of these supposed actions. WHO lists more than 160 vaccines in development, including research in the United States, and understands that the more candidates, the better.

A student for Pondicherry University found a home remedy cure for COVID-19 which was accepted by WHO. Mixing black pepper powder, ginger and honey and consuming it for 5 days will cure the person of the new coronavirus. No student from the Pondicherry University has come up with a cure for COVID-19. The claim has no scientific evidence. WHO has not given approval to any cure for the new coronavirus.

The Moroccan government decided to open the borders to travelers wishing to leave or enter to and from Moroccan territory, with the exception of foreign tourists. Misbar investigated the news circulating and found it false. The official Moroccan channel reported on its official account on Twitter that the Moroccan prime minister said that until now the government had not decided to open the borders of the Kingdom of Morocco, but it had agreed with some countries to conduct exceptional trips through ships and aircraft.
The government has ordered re-opening of schools and colleges. The government has given no such order. The screenshot with the claim has been doctored.
A message on WhatsApp claims steam inhalation cures COVID-19. There is no scientific evidence for this claim.

Masks do nothing to prevent the spread of pathogens, including SARS-CoV-2, and cause oxygen deficiency Face masks are safe to use and are not associated with oxygen deficiency. Although more research is needed to better establish the efficacy of face masks in reducing disease transmission and the mechanisms behind their efficacy, a growing evidence base indicates that face masks have a beneficial effect in reducing the spread of respiratory diseases like COVID-19. However, masks do not provide 100% protection and must also be combined with other transmission control measures such as physical distancing and good hand hygiene.
Ghana’s president backs conspiracy theories about COVID-19. The Ghanaian government has already denied it.

Supporters of ABS-CBN, including actor Gerald Anderson, gathered together and violated quarantine rules by not wearing face masks during the COVID-19 pandemic. The photo was not taken recently but was from a prayer rally on February 28 intended for the renewal of the ABS-CBN franchise.
A post shows a huge crowd in Benguluru Victoria Hospital in the midst of the COVID-19 pandemic. The video is from a Hospital in Patna, Bihar.
Authorities decided to close the French-Spanish border French authorities denied this.

Inhaling eucalyptus prevents or eliminates the new coronavirus Experts explain that the product may help with some problems, but there is no guarantee that it can help prevent and/or eliminate the new strain of coronavirus.

Comedian Michael V, also known as “Bitoy,” died after contracting the new coronavirus. There are no reports of Michael V's death as of Tuesday, July 21, and he debunked the claim himself on his social media channels. While these posts are now unavailable, news outlets have reported his response to the false claim.
WHO approved home remedy made with pepper, ginger juice and honey as a cure for COVID-19. The organization says there is no drug capable of curing or preventing the disease.
The government has ordered re-opening of schools and colleges. The government has given no such order. The screenshot with the claim has been doctored.

All those who registered for the government’s emergency subsidy program (ESP) via the ReliefAgad app will have to claim their cash aid via GCash, regardless of the payout method they selected in the app. GCash is only one of the payout methods through which ESP beneficiaries can avail of their subsidies.

Brazil recorded more deaths in the first half of 2019 than in the first half of 2020. The numbers presented in the posts don't match those of the Civil Registry platform, which the claim indicated as source. In fact, death records from January to June 2020 are higher than the same interval in 2019.

A chain indicating that a newborn named Martín Sosa is admitted to the Children’s Hospital (CABA, Argentina). The post that circulates on Facebook does not specify which children's hospital he refers to or the date of his birth. This imprecision caused the chain to go viral in different years and in different countries. The Dr. Ricardo Gutiérrez Children's Hospital confirmed to Chequeado that they do not have any patients with that name.

A publication on social media that claims that “cases of pleurisy induced by hypoxia are occurring” due to the use of the mask by supermarket employees. There is no evidence that these cases are occurring. Also, the image he uses has nothing to do with the coronavirus and there is no evidence that the masks cause hypoxia.

Masks do nothing to prevent the spread of pathogens, including SARS-CoV-2, and cause oxygen deficiency Face masks are safe to use and are not associated with oxygen deficiency. Although more research is needed to better establish the efficacy of face masks in reducing disease transmission and the mechanisms behind their efficacy, a growing evidence base indicates that face masks have a beneficial effect in reducing the spread of respiratory diseases like COVID-19. However, masks do not provide 100% protection and must also be combined with other transmission control measures such as physical distancing and good hand hygiene.

A post that indicates that Spanish doctors say that face masks don’t work outdoors. The post is based on a true publication of the General Council of Official College of Physicians (CGCOM) of Spain, but from February 26, before the pandemic was declared. Since June 5, the World Health Organization (WHO) encourages "the general public to wear masks where there is widespread transmission." CGCOM itself issued a statement in May along the same lines and urged that the general population wear surgical masks.

Content stating that “WHO now admits that” perhaps “there was never a reason for a lockdown.” It is a hoax: it refers to a Washington Examiner opinion piece in which this is not said and is based on statements by the director of the WHO zoonosis and emerging diseases unit, Maria Van Kerkhove, about the transmission of Coronavirus in asymptomatic people referred to as "uncommon".

Filipino comedian Michael V. has died from COVID-19. The GMA Network talent has debunked the hoax in his social media accounts according to several news reports. A screenshot of Bitoy’s now-deleted Twitter post is shown in GMA’s article.

The Federal Government fired 396 thousand public servants who received, illegally, the emergency COVID-19 allowance. Only 7 thousand federal public servants' IDs were used to withdraw the allowance. In many cases, the public servants may be victims of fraud. The General Controllership stated that each case will be analysed individually.

An audio that denounces the falsification of death certificates at the Hospital de Clínicas (CABA, Argentina) to increase deaths from coronavirus. The audio states that "Dr. Pérez de la Hoz" has an "order from above" to modify the cause of death of patients because "the Ministry of Health wants everyone to die from COVID." The post also indicates that this happened in a hospital in Lomas de Zamora. Ricardo Pérez de la Hoz does not work in that municipality but is neither the director of the Hospital de Clínicas, but is the head of the Cardiology Division, and assured that "no request of this type ever existed from anyone."

The decrees of the Chief State Sanitary Doctor of Ukraine should not be executed. Since the decrees of the Chief State Sanitary Doctor of Ukraine are the part of the Ukrainian legislature, they should be executed.

A video shows a Brazilian doctor and politician claiming that there is no proof that isolation is effective in containing the pandemic and that people would contaminate themselves more at home. Several scientific studies and health organizations point out that quarantine contributes to reduce the spread of the virus and the number of cases.
The image shows the picture of the coronavirus-infected patient’s throat Fake post claiming to be a picture of the coronavirus-infected patient has resurfaced on social media.

A graph that correlates greater vaccination against influenza in those over 65 years of age and a higher mortality rate compared to COVID-19. Correlation between two phenomena does not mean that one causes the other. The graph leaves out countries with a high vaccination rate and low mortality such as Greece and Portugal.

An ordinance that punishes minors and their parents for violating quarantine rules took effect on Monday, July 20. While Ordinance No. 38 S. 2020 was really issued, it was implemented in Pampanga province only.

A viral message that says that “those over 60 years of age” can get from pharmacies “a pack of three masks per month (…) from Wednesday 29 July.” The text is shared as coming from the Spanish regions of Andalusia, Catalonia, Castilla y León, the Valencian Community or the Basque Country. None of the autonomous communities mentioned in the message are distributing free masks under these conditions.
Raisin prevents clotting thus helps to fight COVID19 There is no evidence that raisins prevent clotting in any cases, including with COVID-19 patients

Claim that Globo deliberately distorted a graphic to manipulate COVID-19 stats in Petrolina, Brazil. The graphics shown by the TV station show different sized columns representing 8 total deaths in 2 separate days, giving the impression that the number of confirmed deaths grew, when it remained stagnant. Although the image is true, this was merely a typo. Petrolina did not have 8 deaths on July 1, but 26. The presenter corrected this information live, and the numbers are consistent with official statistics

The video of a huge crowd not maintaining social distancing is from All India Institute of Medical Science (AIIMS), Patna (a city in the state of Bihar). The video is not from AIIMS, Patna, Bihar but from Mahavir Cancer Sansthan in the state of Bihar.

A message that claims that there are criminals stopping on the street those who do not wear a mask to distribute one that is “impregnated with a certain substance” in order to steal from them. The National Police and Civil Guard have no record of any complaint about this practice in Spain as of July 20, 2020.The message does not specify where these robberies are supposed to be occurring, which is something that should always make us suspicious.

Ivermectin has had good results in the COVID-19 treatment in Bolivia, the Dominican Republic, New Zealand, Australia, and African countries. So far, there are no studies that associate the drug with a reduction in contagion or clinical trials that indicate its effectiveness against the new coronavirus, as attested by WHO and the brazilian agency Anvisa.

Several scientific studies and health organizations point out that quarantine contributes to reduce the spread of the virus and the number of cases.

The decrees of the Chief State Sanitary Doctor of Ukraine should not be executed. Since the decrees of the Chief State Sanitary Doctor of Ukraine are the part of the Ukrainian legislature, they should be executed.

French doctors protest after discovering COVID-19 pandemic is a fraud. Protest happened in January - before the first cases of sick people were confirmed in France. people were protesting againts bad conditions of work in public hospitals.

A picture showing the Italian Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte, the French President Emmanuel Macron and the German Chancellor Angela Merkel having a drink together, with no masks and not respecting social distancing measures. The picture is real but it was taken in 2018. it has nothing to do with Covid-19.

A publication that claims that in 1918 the American city of Philadelphia “prematurely ended its quarantine of the Spanish flu and launched a demonstration against the measures of staying at home”, which led to a peak of infections, hospitalizations and deaths. An image circulating on Facebook that shows the ranking of the main causes of death that occurred in 2017 worldwide and confronts them with the fatal victims of coronavirus. Although the data is true, the image was digitally manipulated to compare the statistics for the entire year 2017 against the first month of 2020. Specialists consulted agreed to confirm that, due to its scope and expansion, the new coronavirus should be considered a pandemic.

The most widely circulated photo in Algeria of a young man watching his mother, who is infected with COVID-19, from the hospital window to check on her. Misbar verified the circulating image and turned out to be misleading, as it belongs to a Palestinian youth named Jihad Al-Sweiti, who chose to sit next to his elderly mother's window after she was infected with COVID-19.

A person who visited Badusha Hypermarket, Perambra was found COVID-19 positive and hence all those who have visited the hypermarket on 16th July 2020 are asked to report to Perambra Taluk Hospital. The Hospital has said that the message is fake
Neem tea is the ‘solution’ for COVID-19 There is no approved treatment for the disease.
Obama, Dr. Fauci visited Wuhan lab in 2015 The picture shows Barack Obama touring Vaccine Research Center at National Institute of Health in Maryland, USA

Alberto Fernández, president of Argentina: “When the health system is saturated, mortality doubles or triples. This is what happened, for example, in the Basque Country”. The President of the Nation made this statement during the announcement of the extension and relaxation of the quarantine until August 2, based on a study mentioned by the committee of doctors and scientists that advises him, according to official spokesmen and members of the committee. The study, from the “No More Pandemics” platform, takes official data, although it is based on its own mathematical projection. The Delegation of the Basque Country to Mercosur maintained that the Argentine president's statement is false, denied that there had been a saturation of beds, and requested a rectification.
Covid 19 : ‘Achha Chalta Hu’ Boy breathed his hast after singing a Hindi song. The boy died battling aplastic anaemia. He tested negative for COVID-19.

A Facebook video claims the PCR test inventor said the tests do not effectively diagnose COVID-19. The quotes in the video are not from PCR test inventor Kary B. Mullis, who died in August 2019, before the discovery of COVID-19. The claims instead appear to have originated from an anonymous online commenter.

A video post claims that a study by Australian scientists found COVID-19 was “human made”. Professor Nikolai Petrovsky told AAP FactCheck the origins of COVID-19 were not yet known. Neither he nor any other Australian scientist is quoted or shown in the post’s video referring to COVID-19 as a “US GOVERNMENT-FUNDED BIOWEAPON”. Prof Petrovsky said the headline was “completely false”.
A few Ukrainian soldiers died after getting the American vaccine against COVID-19. The American vaccine against COVID-19 has not been tested on soldiers in the Ukrainian military.

A map of Sri Lanka was shared with certain cities highlighted as the places visited by close contacts of Kandakadu COVID19 cluster The map belonged to a private company and was shared among some of its employees. Health officials and Sri Lanka police have dismissed the map as false
Podemos politicians turned around at the state ceremony for COVID-19 victims The people who are showing their back to the ceremony are sign language interpreters

Brazilian prefectures are being paid 19 thousand reais per COVID-19 death, which is why numbers are being inflated. This is false and has been debunked on more than one occasion by the Health ministry. Payments are based, mostly, on population.

A study in Germany of 780 patients proved that Vitamin D is an effective treatment against COVID-19. The alledged study is an Indonesian pre-print that does not prove any causal relation between vitamin D intakes and COVID-19. This is stated in the study itself.

The governor of Bahia, Rui Costa, determined that all hydroxychloroquine tablets were confiscated from pharmacies around the state. Costa did not order the removal of hydroxychloroquine from pharmacies, and he does not have the authority to prohibit any medication. What the Bahia police did do was to raid an illegal distribution of controlled drugs, which included hydroxichloroquine.

María Antonieta de las Nieves, the actress who plays Chilindrina in El Chavo del 8, died of COVID-19 There aren't any official publications assuring that the actress has died or has been infected with coronavirus.

N95 and FPP masks are better than the medicals ones Those masks could filter more but there is not evidence about being better to avoid COVID-19. Masks are safe only if combined with other preventative measures like hand-washing and social distancing

There is no evidence that Mentholatum and eucalyptus prevent the development of COVID-19 in the human body. Although these components are part of traditional medicine and serve to alleviate some symptoms related to respiratory conditions, their ability to combat coronavirus has not been proven.

Minister Murillo assures that respirators are available “everywhere” in Bolivia According to the verification carried out, in Bolivia there are not enough intensive care units nor respirators. Numbers don't match with the criteria recommended by the Health Organization.

An image that compares the main causes of death in the world in 2017 with those caused by COVID-19 this year. A parade to raise funds for the First World War held in the American city of Philadelphia caused a spike in the Spanish flu. It was not a mobilization against preventive isolation at that time, as the viral publications point out. The case is singled out as an example of the importance of avoiding crowds during an epidemic.

A post that shows a list of medicines to treat the new coronavirus at home. As of July 17, there was no general treatment for the new coronavirus. Self medication was considered dangerous.

An image in which two people turn their backs to the State ceremony that took place this July 16 in honor of the victims of COVID-19. He moves with a message that they are members of Podemos who turned around while King Felipe VI spoke. It is a hoax, the people in the picture are sign language interpreters.

Porto Feliz, a Brazilian city in the state of São Paulo, doesn’t register deaths from COVID-19 since it adopted a treatment protocol with chloroquine. 10 people have already died from the infection in the city, the first on May 17, more than a month after the adoption of the drugs in the city. Porto Feliz accounts for 415 cases of the disease.

A health alert claims there is a a virus called “machupo” in paracetamol A report from the Pan American Health Organization refutes the version of the aforementioned chain about a possible contagion when consuming the pill.

Chlorine dioxide: The Ecuadorian trial gives academic support to its use in humans. The agency in charge of the control of medicines and foods, the FDA (Foods and Drugs Administration), for its part, issued a statement warning about the risks that the ingestion of sodium chlorite-based solutions can bring to health. So not only is it not scientifically supported, it can be very dangerous.

The EU passed a regulation for a mRNA vaccine with genetically modified organisms The EU regulation is about medicine or vaccines that contain genetically modified organisms. But mRNA vaccines don't contain such organisms

The municipality of Bani Walid in Libya recorded eight new cases of coronavirus, on July 15. MIsbar investigated the news and found that it was false. The Health Services Department in the Libyan city of Bani Walid denied, through its Facebook account, the circulating news.

A Facebook post claims that methane produced by cows doesn’t increase greenhouse gas emissions because the methane is part of a cycle in which it is absorbed back into plants which are then eaten by the cows. Methane produced by cattle is not absorbed back into plants and then recycled as protein in a closed cycle. Methane is in the atmosphere for a shorter period that carbon dioxide but it causes warming at a faster rate than CO2 while it is present.
Yopal Mayor was ‘caught’ in a gay bar for violating quarantine The disinformation was published on a web page that allows publications by any user.

5G technology creates coronavirus in human cells The claim is not based on scientific evidence, experts say, and the paper was withdrawn after its publisher found “manipulation of the peer review” process.
The city of Manizales estimated its cycloband during COVID-19 greatly reduced greenhouse gas emmissions. Experts say they lacked data and agreed to highlight the reduction, although it is minimal.

Extensive mask wearing weakens the immune system because you can’t breathe properly through them Masks don't create a lack of O2 nor an excess of Co2 therefore don't weaken the immune system, say experts.

Chinese scientists have publicly stated that the coronavirus is lab-made The claim is misleading because Chinese scientists from the Wuhan Laboratory who, according to Steve Bannon, have left the country and began cooperating with Western security services, have not publicly stated that the coronavirus is lab-made. A video with text that claims to offer information about the coronavirus that “comes from the Japanese Ministry of Health.” It claims that when the first symptoms of the infection appear, the lungs already show 50% fibrosis. We cannot know if we are infected with coronavirus if we manage to hold our breath for 10 seconds, nor do we take sips of water every 15 minutes to end it.

(sic), like the supposed creation of the virus in a laboratory. However, there is no evidence to claim that the coronavirus was created artificially.

A Facebook post shared thousands of times claims that taking a person’s temperature with an infrared thermometer near their head risks damaging the pineal gland, which is located in the brain. This is false, said neuroscience experts, who explained that this type of thermometer does not emit infrared radiation but captures wavelengths from the body.

The total number of deaths in Brazil decreased, rather than increased, when we compare 2019 to 2020. When making this count, Garcia compared all civil registers on 2019 (deaths, marriages and births) against 2020 deaths, so the comparison makes no sense. When comparing the actual death registries, there were more deaths in 2020. Even so, it's still not an accurate comparison, once the most recent data has not yet been entirely fed to the database, and seasonal variations were not taken into account.

An image that claims that asymptomatic carriers of the novel coronavirus are immune, do not spread the coronavirus and communicate “antibodies” to other people. Asymptomatic carriers are people who have the virus and, despite having no symptoms, the available evidence shows that they can transmit the virus. Asymptomatic people also do not "communicate" the antibodies, as the posts say, which are generated as the person gets rid of the disease or with vaccines, for instance.
Ecuador found the cure for coronavirus. Ecuador didn't find the cure and the false message has been debunked since April.

A photograph of former United States President Barack Obama, with a caption saying it was taken in a “Chinese laboratory in Wuhan. Barack Obama, Anthony Fauci and Melinda Gates, visit the virus factory probably to check on the progress of Coronavirus research.” This is a hoax. The image was taken in 2014 at the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases located in Maryland (United States). Also, Melinda Gates does not appear on it.
Photograph shows a Bolivian doctor who complaining about not getting paid. The photograph has popped up previously in other countries, and there is no proof it was taken in Bolivia.

A student from Pondicherry University has found a home remedy for COVID-19 that has been accepted by World Health Organization (WHO) This post is fake. This article explains the difference between these tests, the antigen tests and the molecular tests.

Patients who die in hospitals are “intubated” to “explode their lungs.” Endotracheal Intubation is a medical procedure to help a person breathe and has been practiced since before COVID-19 existed.
