There is no evidence that the voice of the video is that of the Ghanaian president and the text comes from a forum post. Furthermore, there is no evidence that the virus was created in a laboratory.

Africa managed the pandemic by prescribing ivermectin. Despite what the video claims, the, pandemic is not controlled in Africa. The video suggests using ivermectin was the only measure taken by Ethiopia, which is also false: the country closed schools and shut down operations of Ethiopian airlines, for example.

The WHO claimed that “maybe there was no need for a lockdown”. There are posts on Facebook and Instagram that indicate that the World Health Organization (WHO) admitted this. The claim comes from a blog post that misrepresents an article from the US portal Washington Examiner about what a "world health agency" official would have said. In its article, the US media outlet does not mention that the WHO has suggested that "perhaps there was never a reason for confinement."
Covid-19 test using a swab is used to “collect DNA” from the population. There is no evidence that Covid-19 test using a swab serves to collect DNA from the population.
A video shows monkeys attacking Gandhi Hospital in Hyderabad This is an old video of Monkeys attacking RK Khan hospital in Durban, South Africa
Manuel Elkin Patarroyo, a famous Colombian scientific, wrote a message about the coronavirus and sided against the WHO. Patarroyo denied being the author of the false message.

Fiocruz, a Brazilian state-owned science institute, developed the ChAdOx1 nCov-2019. Then, they offered it to Oxford University, because they were not getting any support from Jair Bolsonaro. The vaccine is being developed by Oxford University scientists and the AstroZeneca pharmaceutical company. Fiocruz is only a partner for testing and production.

Home treatment based in ivermectin, chloroquine, azithromycin and vitamins can cure the infection caused by the novel coronavirus. In addition to the indications made by the doctor in the video not having scientific support, self-medication with these substances can pose health risks, according to health authorities and experts.

Video claims that Brazilian media outlets choose irrelevant scientists to talk about the pandemic. Video mischaracterizes the classification of researchers on h-index. Plus, does not considers elements such as age that could influentiate on it

A photo of Jair Bolsonaro In which he is hospitalized with a tube in his nose. The caption with the photo link it to COVID-19. The messages that accompany the photo link it to COVID-19, but the photo is not current. It is from 2019, when he underwent an operation to correct an abdominal hernia.

WHO warns that wearing masks is unnecessary for healthy people. This misleading publication features the image of a headline published in UOL in March 31, when WHO, in fact, recommended the use of masks only for those who presented symptoms of Covid-19 or were in contact with a patient. On June 5, however, the entity published new guidelines for the use of the equipment by anyone in a region where there is community contamination of the new coronavirus, as in Brazil.

Claim that Secretary of Education Betsy DeVos said ‘only’ .02% of kids are likely to die when they go back to school during the pandemic. We could find no public comments in which DeVos made that remark.

The U.S. government has approved a second round of coronavirus stimulus payments to everyone who signs up — and that the money will be forthcoming in “5-7 business days.” Congress is considering another economic package, but a new round of support has not been passed.
A claim that a video Amitabh Bacchan praising Nanavathi Hospital COVID warriors was just released. The video is from April.

Seasonal influenza vaccination will be mandatory in Georgia this fall. COVID-19 mortality rates are significantly lower than the fatalities caused by other viruses. The Georgian National Disease Control Center has not confirmed the information regarding the planned mandatory seasonal influenza vaccination in the country. Furthermore, the COVID-19 pandemic is not yet over. Therefore, it is difficult to talk about exact death rates. The coronavirus fatality rates vary widely between countries and age - from 0.2% in Germany to 7.7% in Italy. As of July 13, fatality rate is 4.5% on average. It is not specified the fatality of which viruses are lower compared to COVID-19. Some widely circulating myths that COVID-19 is less dangerous than seasonal influenza has already been debunked.

Seasonal influenza vaccination will be mandatory in Georgia this fall. COVID-19 mortality rates are significantly lower than the fatalities caused by other viruses. The Georgian National Disease Control Center has not confirmed the information regarding the planned mandatory seasonal influenza vaccination in the country. Furthermore, the COVID-19 pandemic is not yet over. Therefore, it is difficult to talk about exact death rates. The coronavirus fatality rates vary widely between countries and age - from 0.2% in Germany to 7.7% in Italy. As of July 13, fatality rate is 4.5% on average. It is not specified the fatality of which viruses are lower compared to COVID-19. Some widely circulating myths that COVID-19 is less dangerous than seasonal influenza has already been debunked.
Manuel Elkin Patarroyo, a famous Colombian scientific, wrote a message about the coronavirus and sided against the WHO. Patarroyo denied being the author of the false message.

Claim that Secretary of Education Betsy DeVos said ‘only’ .02% of kids are likely to die when they go back to school during the pandemic. We could find no public comments in which DeVos made that remark.
Dr Sarah Gilbert discovered the COVID-19 vaccine Sarah Gilbert leads the Oxford University team which is developing a vaccine, but it´s not sure yet if it is secure and effective
Masks are dangerous Those claims are false, masks are not dangerous, say multiple experts.
It is not an accident that presentation of ID2020 project and pandemics coincide in time. There is no evidence supporting the claim.
A post claims 50 million died from 1918 flu vaccine. There is no evidence to support the claim a flu vaccine killed 50 million people during the 1918 Spanish Flu.

Israel is at the forefront of the world in the number of tests for COVID-19. Misbar verified the claim and found it to be false. As Israel ranks twelfth in the world in the number of tests to detect coronavirus per person.

Deaths from COVID-19 are nearing zero in the U.S. Weekly deaths due to COVID-19 as reported by various sources have been steadily declining since their peak in April 2020. However, death reporting is a lengthy and complex process. It can take several weeks for deaths to be reported to the U.S. federal government and to reach a reliable estimate of the death count. In contrast, state-level estimates report higher, even increasing numbers of deaths for July 2020. It is thus impossible to draw conclusions on the COVID-19 death counts for very recent periods.
Telangana celebrity, lyricist Suddala Ashok Teja died due to a coronavirus infection. Telangana celebrity, folk singer, poet and activist Mohammed Nissar was mistook for Suddala Ashok Teja.

Sechenov First Moscow State Medical University in Russia has completed the clinical trials for the “world’s first COVID-19 vaccine.” The COVID-19 vaccine that underwent a clinical study at Sechenov University is not the first in the world. A number of other vaccines are in more advanced phases of testing.

The youngest patient who died from COVID-19 in Macedonia, at the age of 24, was actually a victim of medical negligence. A status is posted in a Facebook group about a girl who died in Kosovo from bleeding and alleged medical negligence. However, in the group, the case concerning Kosovo is falsely claimed to be the same as that of a 24-year-old patient who died of coronavirus at the Infectious Diseases Clinic in Macedonia. In this way, the public is manipulated to believe that, in fact, the patient in Macedonia is the one who died of medical negligence.
The COVI-PASS mobile application is collaborating with the Portuguese Government. It is not true that the COVI-PASS mobile application is collaborating with the Portuguese Government.

The Palestinian Minister of Health lost her nerve due to the outbreak of coronavirus. Misbar verified the circulating clip and found it to be false, because the minister used completely different words in the original video than the speech contained in the fabricated clip.

PAHO, the PanAmerican health organisation, has conducted studies of Ivermectin and there is scientific evidence of its efficacy against Covid-19. There are still no scientific studies that support Ivermectin for the treatment of COVID-19, and medical and scientific authorities such as the Pan American Health Organization (PAHO) and the United States Federal Administration of Medicines (FDA) advise against its use in this particular case.
Mayor of Cali, Colombia, will close the city for 14 days due to coronavirus. The Mayor of Cali denied this information on his Twitter account.
The COVI-PASS mobile application is collaborating with the Portuguese Government. It is not true that the COVI-PASS mobile application is collaborating with the Portuguese Government.
Pistol shaped infrared themometers are dangerous and can burn neurons. The statement is false. There is no evidence that shows that infrared thermometers are dangerous and can burn neurons.
Publications suggest it would be better to test for COVID-19 with saliva than through the nose To date, in-nose tests are more viable, say experts.

PCR tests are extremely dangerous. The swabs are not sterile, but purposefully infected with the virus. Therefore, when taking the swab test, healthy people are getting infected, as it accesses the blood-brain barrier through the nose, causing the inflammation of the brain (encephalitis) and later a meningitis. There is no evidence that the people who have been tested by the PCR method became infected with the virus. The swabs being the source of the infection is a conspiracy theory.

The US President praises South Dakota’s confrontation with coronavirus, and tells them in a tweet that they do not need masks, but rather that they close the borders with California. This is a fake tweet. Misbar combed through President Trump's twitter feed as well as a database of deleted tweets, and could not find where he supposedly made this statement.
Adidas is donating shoes in a campaign against the new coronavirus. The press department of Adidas informed it is a fake campaign.
Telangana Chief Minister is being treated for COVID-19 infection in Yashoda Hospitals The video is from January when K. Chandrasekhar Rao was being treated for a different illness.
The pandemic is a plot of the bio-fascists. This plot is implemented based on the sustainable development goals. There is no evidence supporting this claim.

A Facebook post features a medical text from 1989 and claims that coronaviruses equal the common cold. While it is true that common colds are associated with human coronaviruses, the post’s claim that coronaviruses equal a common cold is not accurate.
A statement of a public and famous university (Antioquia University) says that Colombia will have 500 deaths of coronavirus per day. The university denied the false statement.
The new coronavirus settles faster in a dry throat. There is no scientific evidence that the new coronavirus settles faster in dry throat.

Ivermectin, chloroquine and nitazoxanide (sold in Brazil under the name Annita) prevent the multiplication of the novel coronavirus if taken at the beginning of Covid-19 symptoms. Ongoing researches have not confirmed the potential of these drugs against the disease. Ivermectin and nitazoxanide are not even part of the treatment protocol proposed by the Brazilian Ministry of Health.

The WHO says there is evidence of COVID-19 contagion through the air It is true that the World Health Organization (WHO) declared that there are reports of cases of people who were contaminated with COVID-19 through the air. Although the evidence is not conclusive and is under study.

Helicopters will fly over the entirety of Luzon to spray unspecified substances against the coronavirus. This is a rehashed claim that was already debunked in March. The Philippine National Police (PNP) maintains that they have no plans to do this.
Telangana Chief Minister is being treated for COVID-19 infection in Yashoda Hospitals The video is from January when K. Chandrasekhar Rao was being treated for a different illness.

A Facebook post features a medical text from 1989 and claims that coronaviruses equal the common cold. While it is true that common colds are associated with human coronaviruses, the post’s claim that coronaviruses equal a common cold is not accurate.

Brazilian Congress takes advantage of pandemic to pass a law allowing abortion for up to 22 weeks of pregnancy. The bills cited by the misinformation piece do not contain any permission, even if temporary, for abortion, which is not even mentioned indirectly. Aos Fatos did not find in the approved texts even the expressions "integral women care" or "humanized attention", cited by publications. None of the projects modify the Penal Code, that defines the cases in which abortion is legalized in the country.
Adidas is donating shoes in a campaign against the new coronavirus. The press department of Adidas informed it is a fake campaign.
The pandemic is a plot of the bio-fascists. This plot is implemented based on the sustainable development goals. There is no evidence supporting this claim.

PCR tests are extremely dangerous. The swabs are not sterile, but purposefully infected with the virus. Therefore, when taking the swab test, healthy people are getting infected, as it accesses the blood-brain barrier through the nose, causing the inflammation of the brain (encephalitis) and later a meningitis. There is no evidence that the people who have been tested by the PCR method became infected with the virus. The swabs being the source of the infection is a conspiracy theory.

Ivermectin, chloroquine and nitazoxanide (sold in Brazil under the name Annita) prevent the multiplication of the novel coronavirus if taken at the beginning of Covid-19 symptoms. Ongoing researches have not confirmed the potential of these drugs against the disease. Ivermectin and nitazoxanide are not even part of the treatment protocol proposed by the Brazilian Ministry of Health.

A German blog article cites Bulgarian pathologist Stoyan Alexov: Nobody died of Covid-19, you can’t see in an autopsy whether the patient died of Covid-19 or another cause, the WHO ordered not to make autopsies, there are no specific antibodies for SARS-CoV-2 and it’s impossibe to develop a vaccine Autopsies show that people died of Covid-19, there are specific antibodies and it's possible to develop a vaccine

Edouard Philippe, France’s ex-prime minister, is being sued because he forbade hydroxychloroquine in the country. There's no evidence that any of the inquiries against Edouard Philippe involve hydroxychloroquine. Policy around the drug hasn't changed after he left office.
A statement of a public and famous university (Antioquia University) says that Colombia will have 500 deaths of coronavirus per day. The university denied the false statement.
Publications suggest it would be better to test for COVID-19 with saliva than through the nose To date, in-nose tests are more viable, say experts.

While everyone was worried about COVID-19, the Chamber of Deputies approved two bills which legalize abortion. The two mentioned bills have nothing to do with abortion. They're about protecting victims of domestic abuse and violence during the pandemic. Abortion is not mentioned.
The new coronavirus was created in a laboratory. The coronavirus has an animal origin.

Colombia is the second country with the highest unemployment growth in the world in 2020, according to The Economist Colombian senator Rodrigo Lara said these words on a television program. However, the comparison of this indicator between countries is difficult to measure and there are still no 2020 figures that unify the data from around the world.
UK nurse gives recommendations for treating coronavirus. The recommendations are a compilation of home remedies whose effectiveness has not been proven.

The WHO says there is evidence of COVID-19 contagion through the air It is true that the World Health Organization (WHO) declared that there are reports of cases of people who were contaminated with COVID-19 through the air. Although the evidence is not conclusive and is under study.
1918 flu’s second wave was more letal than the first but it was not because people stooped all precaution measures The virus itself had changed and become more letal, says an historian.

Jair Bolsonaro, president of Brazil, said he caught COVID-19 because he had a schedule hearing on an police inquiry. Actually, it was Bolsonaro's son, senator Flavio Bolsonaro, who was heard on a police inquiry on the very same day his father confirmed he caught COVID-19.

Using nasopharyngeal swabs for COVID-19 testing is unnecessary; saliva samples from mouth swabs is an equivalent substitute Due to its reliability and relative ease of specimen collection, the nasopharyngeal swab is considered the gold-standard procedure for collecting cells and secretions from the back of the throat for COVID-19 diagnostic testing. In contrast, the accuracy of less invasive testing of alternative specimens, such as saliva, is still under evaluation. Several laboratories have developed at-home kits for the collection of nasal mucus and saliva samples that are then shipped to a laboratory for analysis. However, specimen collection is a key step in clinical diagnosis, and experts have raised concerns about how potential flaws in at-home sample collection may impact the accuracy of these tests.

An image claiming that there is a Covid-19 clusted in the Nicolás Salmerón street in Santander, Spain and that “it is from an overcrowded flat inhabited by about 13 immigrant individuals.” It is false that all the positives come from a house with 13 people. They also claim that it is false that all infected people are immigrants, although they do not specify whether or not they included immigrants.
A text about how no one is to be blamed for the pandemic in Brazil written by Mario Sergio Cortella, a Brazilian writer and philosophy professor. The writer said he was not the author of the text.

A viral pamphlet claims Herbal Mysore Pak (a south Indian sweet) can cure COVID-19. Herbal Mysore Pak cannot cure COVID-19, and a shop owner who claimed so in an advert had his product siezed by authorities for false advertizing.

The director of the Hospital de Clínicas (CABA, Argentina) forged death certificates to increase deaths from coronavirus. A viral audio is circulating indicating that "Dr. Pérez de la Hoz" has the "order from above" to modify the cause of death of patients because "the Ministry of Health wants everyone to die from COVID." Ricardo Pérez de la Hoz is not the director of the Hospital de Clínicas, but the head of the Cardiology Division, and he assured that "no request of this type ever existed from anyone."

A man uses an air monitor to demonstrate that wearing a mask means a lack of oxygen The experts consulted assure that the correct use of masks does not involve risks: neither do they cause a lack of oxygen nor harmful accumulations of carbon dioxide
Senior officials of Rajasthan police visited Ajmer Sharif Dargah Ajmer Dargah is closed due to Corona, Rajasthan Police's presence here is false
Post claiming coronavirus affected patients in Chinniyampalayam and Vellalore get cured within a day by consuming this herbal Mysore pak There is no known cure and this post is false.

The nose swab for the coronavirus test is dangerous and harms the blood-brain barrier, so the way is free for infections to get directly into the brain The swab is not dangerous and can't harm the blood-brain barrier as this isn't located in the nose

‘Dr. VK Srinivas, Vice-President of Bharath Biotech, He is taking first injection of COVID-19 vaccine. They have confidence in their product’ The Vishvas News found in its investigation that this viral post is false. Dr. VK Srinivas was giving his blood sample for routine procedure when this photo was taken. He did not participate in COVID-19 clinical trial.

‘Dr. VK Srinivas, Vice-President of Bharath Biotech, He is taking first injection of COVID-19 vaccine. They have confidence in their product’ The Vishvas News found in its investigation that this viral post is false. Dr. VK Srinivas was giving his blood sample for routine procedure when this photo was taken. He did not participate in COVID-19 clinical trial.

An audio message claims to show the governor of Cochabamba said she did not believe in COVID-19 The audio is misleading because it is not complete and the circumstances in which the governor expressed the following words are not known.

‘Dr. VK Srinivas, Vice-President of Bharath Biotech, He is taking first injection of COVID-19 vaccine. They have confidence in their product’ The Vishvas News found in its investigation that this viral post is false. Dr. VK Srinivas was giving his blood sample for routine procedure when this photo was taken. He did not participate in COVID-19 clinical trial.

The PCR diagnostic test for Covid-19 is performed in the blood-brain barrier area and can cause inflammation of the brain. According to experts heard by Aos Fatos, in the RT-PCR exam, which identifies the presence of SARS-CoV-2 in the body, a kind of cotton swab is introduced into the nasopharynx, an anatomically impossible place to reach the brain.

‘Dr. VK Srinivas, Vice-President of Bharath Biotech, He is taking first injection of COVID-19 vaccine. They have confidence in their product’ The Vishvas News found in its investigation that this viral post is false. Dr. VK Srinivas was giving his blood sample for routine procedure when this photo was taken. He did not participate in COVID-19 clinical trial.

‘Dr. VK Srinivas, Vice-President of Bharath Biotech, He is taking first injection of COVID-19 vaccine. They have confidence in their product’ The Vishvas News found in its investigation that this viral post is false. Dr. VK Srinivas was giving his blood sample for routine procedure when this photo was taken. He did not participate in COVID-19 clinical trial.

Jair Bolsonaro, president of Brazil, said he caught COVID-19 because he had a schedule hearing on an police inquiry. Actually, it was Bolsonaro's son, senator Flavio Bolsonaro, who was heard on a police inquiry on the very same day his father confirmed he caught COVID-19.

The nose swab for the coronavirus test is dangerous and harms the blood-brain barrier, so the way is free for infections to get directly into the brain The swab is not dangerous and can't harm the blood-brain barrier as this isn't located in the nose

A WhatsApp message claims to inform people of symptoms of COVID-19 infection compared with symptoms of other illnesses or health complications, attributed to the All India Institute Of Medical Sciences in New Delhi. No such advisory was issued by AIIMS. The World Health Organization also said COVID-19 "affects different people in different ways."

A picture allegedly showing Barack Obama, Anthony Fauci and Melinda Gates visiting a Wuhan laboratory, in 2015. The picture is real, but it was shot in 2014 and the woman is not Melinda Gates but Sylvia Burwell, the then HHS secretary. Obama, Fauci and Burwell are in Maryland (United States) and not in China, and they are discussing about ebola with Nancy Sullivan, a scientist.
1918 flu’s second wave was more letal than the first but it was not because people stooped all precaution measures The virus itself had changed and become more letal, says an historian.

An audio message claims to show the governor of Cochabamba said she did not believe in COVID-19 The audio is misleading because it is not complete and the circumstances in which the governor expressed the following words are not known.

Using nasopharyngeal swabs for COVID-19 testing is unnecessary; saliva samples from mouth swabs is an equivalent substitute Due to its reliability and relative ease of specimen collection, the nasopharyngeal swab is considered the gold-standard procedure for collecting cells and secretions from the back of the throat for COVID-19 diagnostic testing. In contrast, the accuracy of less invasive testing of alternative specimens, such as saliva, is still under evaluation. Several laboratories have developed at-home kits for the collection of nasal mucus and saliva samples that are then shipped to a laboratory for analysis. However, specimen collection is a key step in clinical diagnosis, and experts have raised concerns about how potential flaws in at-home sample collection may impact the accuracy of these tests.

The director of the Hospital de Clínicas (CABA, Argentina) forged death certificates to increase deaths from coronavirus. A viral audio is circulating indicating that "Dr. Pérez de la Hoz" has the "order from above" to modify the cause of death of patients because "the Ministry of Health wants everyone to die from COVID." Ricardo Pérez de la Hoz is not the director of the Hospital de Clínicas, but the head of the Cardiology Division, and he assured that "no request of this type ever existed from anyone."
Postural drainage can be used to help patients with COVID-19 breath without ventilators No, that posture is not recommended or useful por COVID-19 patients

A video of an excerpt from an American television program in which the presenter criticizes the use of masks and, as part of that criticism, supposedly measures the oxygen levels inside the mask that a child is wearing. But it is not true: the air we exhale always has a higher carbon dioxide content but the masks do not retain it: by continuing to breathe we make more oxygen come in and the CO2 comes out.
In Hyderabad, India, dogs are roaming in Osmania Hospital wards amid COVID-19 crisis. The video was taken in 2018.

A picture of Brazilian president Jair Bolsonaro in a hospital bed, which would show his condition after testing positive for Covid-19. The picture is real, but it was shot in 2019 and it shows Bolsonaro recovering from a surgery he got for an abdominal hernia. It is not related to COVID-19.

Coffee cures the coronavirus. A WhatsApp chain indicates that the Chinese doctor Li Wenliang had warned that the chemicals methylxanthine, theobromine and theophylline, which would be present in coffee, could cure the coronavirus. This is false.

Consuming chlorine dioxide cures the coronavirus. The chemical compound is a derivative of sodium chlorite that has been promoted for commercial purposes since the 1990s, as a "miracle mineral solution" that supposedly cures the most diverse diseases. However, several state health protection agencies and specialists claim that it is harmful and prohibit its use and sale to the public. Furthermore, the preparation has not been shown to combat the new coronavirus because, according to the World Health Organization (WHO), "until now no medicine has been shown to prevent or cure this disease."

An image circulating via WhatsApp discloses false information about the dates on which, supposedly, the Protect bonus will be deposited in accounts of Costa Rican citizens. The press chief of the Ministry of Labor, Geovanny Díaz, confirmed that the image is a montage and contains incorrect information.

If you have symptoms of Covid-19, take azithromycin, ivermectin and acetylcysteine. None of these substances has scientifically proven effectiveness against the disease and improper use can cause damage to health, according to experts and health authorities.

Nasal swabs used to obtain samples for COVID-19 tests reach the blood-brain barrier and may damage it. Nasal swabs are used to collect biological samples from the back of the nasopharynx in order to test for the presence of SARS-CoV-2 infection. The nasal swab has to be inserted far into the nasal cavity until it reaches the nasopharynx located behind it. The human brain is separated from the nasopharynx by several layers of hard tissue, including bone. It is therefore not possible for nasal swabs to reach the brain or the blood-brain barrier.

A publication in Macedonian claims that “COVID-19 IS NOT A VIRUS” and that the Italians are the first to find the cure. The most problematic thing in the whole text is the claim that COVID-19 is a bacterium and not a virus. There is no evidence in the text, no research, or a relevant source that can confirm this. The truth is that COVID-19 is an acute viral respiratory infection caused by the SARS-CoV-2 virus. The fact that COVID-19 is not a bacterium but a virus has been announced by the WHO in the special part of their website intended for breaking myths related to this new virus.

An alleged image of the Spanish Antena 3 website that says “Coronavirus in Spain today: Two waiters in quarantine and 5 more people of course contagion in a disco” and includes an image of Velice Discoteca, in Torrevieja (Alicante). It is a hoax, the image is a montage. In addition, the Ministry of Universal Health and Public Health of the Valencian Generalitat has no record of this alleged contagion, as of July 8 2020.

Health authorities recommend that you throw a teaspoon of bleach inside every toilet, sink and drain. This helps preventing the SARS-CoV-2 to enter your house through the sewer. The novel coronavirus cannot enter a house through the sewer. No health authorities have made this recommendation.

Prisioners temporarily released because of COVID-19 were responsible for 13.9% of all murders in Brazil in April 2020. Actually, this 13.9% figure refers to all murder victims in Rio Grande do Sul state, which happened to be former prisioners released because of COVID-19. Most murders commited in April were not yet solved.
The Universal Church of the Kingdom of God published a note stating that healing sessions were suspended due to COVID-19. This content is actually satirical.
The amount of oxygen in your blood can decrease by 20% when you wear masks. Homemade masks are not perfectly sealed and are also porous, they don't diminish the amount of oxygen in your blood.
There is a pharmaceutical cure for COVID-19. Claim is made with no scientific evidence and website was published without consent of doctors who were claimed to support the initiative.
Wearing a mask can cause a fungal infection. Wearing a mask doesn't cause fungal lung infection.

5G spreads the new coronavirus. There is no evidence that 5G networks cause or worsen a case of COVIDー19 and, in Ecuador, 5G is still at the testing stage. One of Mintel's goals is to achieve 80% coverage of 4G by 2021.

Pandemics occur once every century. Pandemics do not occur just once every century. While the Spanish flu outbreak happened in 1918 -- more than 100 years prior to the onset of COVID-19 -- there had been at least five pandemics in between.

Eating highly alkaline foods can defeat COVID-19. SARS-CoV-2 has a pH level of between 5.5 and 8.5. Viruses do not have pH levels because they are not water-based solutions. Eating more alkaline food may affect a person’s saliva and urine pH levels but “these changes are variable from person to person and will not prevent or cure COVID-19.”

Claim that Universidad de Antioquia (UdeA), in Colombia, predicted ‘almost a thousand deaths per day’ at the peak of COVID-19. The Faculty of Public Health of the University of Antioquia denied the alert shared on WhatsApp and Facebook, and assured that giving this figure is only the responsibility of the National Government.

A post that says the COVID-19 does not exist, the pandemic is a fraud and that PCR tests cannot find the virus It is false that the COVID-19 pandemic does not have scientific support. There are many researchers around the world who have analyzed in detail the specific genetic material of this new coronavirus. PCR tests detect specific genetic material from this virus.

Articles shared hundreds of times on Facebook in multiple countries claim that holy communion has been banned in Toronto as part of the Canadian city’s response to the coronavirus pandemic. These claims are false, according to Toronto Public Health, Ontario’s Health Ministry and the Catholic and Greek Orthodox Archdioceses of Toronto.
A TV presenter of the German ZDF falsely stated that there are 130 million COVID-19 deaths in the USA and didn’t correct his error He corrected his error in the same broadcast and apologized

In a video a woman walks through an emply hospital, saying it is completely empty The woman is a Brazilian politician and her claims about a field hospital in Sao Paulo are wrong: It was not empty when she was there
Postural drainage can be used to help patients with COVID-19 breath without ventilators No, that posture is not recommended or useful por COVID-19 patients

A Facebook post compares deaths by influenza and Covid-19, in a way that suggests all influenza deaths are now counted as Covid-19 The data for influenza and Covid-19 in Germany can't be compared as they are gathered differently. There is no evidence that influenza deaths are counted as Covid-19 - all Covid-19 cases must have a laboratory confirmed infection with SARS-CoV-2

The low number of deaths from COVID-19 in Japan is due to the “difference in the level of ‘social standards’ between Japan and other countries”. While it is true that the number of deaths per million from COVID-19 infections in Japan is lower than in major Western countries, he fails to mention that there are countries in East and Southeast Asia that have fewer deaths per million than Japan.

A text circulating in Macedonian that says that “new research has shaken the world and that something terrible has been discovered about coronavirus and the human immunity.” The text cites a study without a link, so the claims about the findings of the survey on the immunity of Spanish citizens are not supported by any evidence. The findings can not be called "horrific" because they do not deviate more than what is known so far about immunity and coronavirus- it is not known how long the immunity after recovery from the virus lasts.
Flamingos gather in Venice as there are no tourists around the water channels due to the pandemic. The photo is a piece of art from a russian artist and was taken out of context
The vaccine for coronavirus is ready (as of July 7). There is not a vaccine for coronavirus yet.

An image in which it is stated that kisses and hugs do not increase the risk of transmission of covid-19. As explained by the public health officer Ileana Vargas, kisses and hugs represent an expanded risk, since they break the recommended 1.8 meters of distance between people to prevent the virus from spreading.

Governor of the Brazilian state of Bahia dismissed a doctor who appealed to President Jair Bolsonaro for chloroquine. The doctor, Raissa Soares, who worked at the Regional Hospital Deputado Luís Eduardo Magalhães, denied the allegation on a Youtube video and said she didn't renew the contract with the health unit because she didn't have time to fulfill the required shifts.
A video claims COVID-19 patients are sitting in the hospital corridor of Gandhi Hospital in Hyderabad It was the hospital staff sitting in the hospital corridor not the COVID-19 patients
Pouring bleach into drains prevents Covid-19 contamination. This is a false claim. Pouring bleach into drains doesn't prevent Covid-19.

The Philippines does not have the fastest rising number of COVID-19 cases in the Western Pacific Region as classified by the World Health Organization. India, Pakistan, Bangladesh, Thailand and Indonesia do not belong to WHO's Western Pacific grouping, unlike what Presidential Spokesperson Harry Roque claimed. More, the data Roque presented were the total number of cases (not cases per million population) of the countries mentioned.

A COVID-19 sensor or “tracker” has been inserted in Android cellphones and iPhones. The system, which appears as “COVID-19 Exposure Notifications” in Android devices and “COVID-19 Exposure Logging” in Apple devices, does not track or “sense” potential COVID-19 carriers automatically, unlike what the posts suggest. It is an opt-in system built jointly by Google and Apple.

An article claiming that “Bill Gates’ vaccine” would modify human DNA. The vaccine (which is currently being tested) does not modify human DNA. It tries to replicate the mechanism with which the new coronavirus attacks our cells, in order to activate an immune response against it.

A post is circulating on Facebook of a supposed page of the argentine bank “Banco Provincia” that requests access to a link to re-enter personal data for alleged problems in home banking linked to the COVID-19 crisis. This is a new case of phishing: a type of digital deception that generally circulates by email or social networks that claims to speak on behalf of a company or official body, but which in reality seeks to obtain data from users and then carry out different actions.

WHO backtracked and released a document stating masks are not efficient to protect healthy people against COVID-19. The latest document published by WHO is from June 5, and it recommends the use of masks by healthy people
A study proves that ivermectin helped the number of COVID-19 cases decrease in Natal, Brazil. This study does not exist

A painting depicting children with face masks was created as a mural for the Denver airport in 1994, proving the COVID-19 pandemic was planned. The painting is not at the Denver airport, and is not from 1994.
An image that states that the Costa Rican government prohibited the sale of liquor due to the pandemic. Security Minister Michael Soto denied the publication at a press conference.

If you have symptoms of COVID-19, you should self-medicate with chloroquine and azithromycin and take zinc and vitamin C and D supplements. These substances don't have proven efficacy against the disease and health authorities and specialists warn that the use without the proper medical prescription can cause health damage.

A spike in COVID-19 cases in the U.S. seen in June 2020 is due to increased testing. Detecting more COVID-19 cases alone does not necessarily indicate that the epidemic is worsening, as it could merely result from an expanded testing capacity. A more useful metric for understanding the recent spike in U.S. cases is the proportion of tests with a positive result—called the positivity rate—which takes into account any variations in the total number of tests being performed so that actual epidemiological dynamics can be assessed. During the second half of June 2020, the positivity rate, together with the number of people visiting hospitals due to COVID-19-like illness increased. Taken together, both observations indicate that the COVID-19 epidemic is regaining strength, and that the increase in reported cases is not solely due to increased testing capacity, but due to more infections in the community.

No one has died from the coronavirus; there are no antibodies that identify SARS-CoV-2; pathologists have no means of verifying whether a person was infected with SARS-CoV-2; SARS-CoV-2 has not fulfilled Koch’s postulates. People have died from COVID-19. This is evident from the excess mortality observed in 2020 compared to previous years before the pandemic occurred. Monoclonal antibodies that bind to SARS-CoV-2 have also been discovered and reported in published studies, and pathologists have been using such antibodies, as well as other techniques like in situ hybridization which do not require antibodies, to detect SARS-CoV-2 infection in human tissue. Several studies have shown that SARS-CoV-2 fulfills Koch's postulates, demonstrating that it is indeed the cause of COVID-19.

A message claims many physicians of Chang Gung Hospital, in Taiwan, are secretly under quarantine for COVID-19, indicating the local transmission and the lack of transparency of government data. All 14 physicians of Chang Gung Hospital have been taking appointments as usual. There is no evidence to support such a claim.

US builds biological labs only on the territories of other countries. According to the Federation of American Scientists (FAS), there are currently 13 operational or planned BSL-4 facilities within the United States of America.

Democrats to blame for Covid-19 related deaths. They control the drugs against the virus. The American Food and Drug Administration (FDA) is responsible for approving certain medications, not politicians. At the moment, Remdesivir is the only drug approved by the FDA for emergency use against the novel coronavirus. In June, FDA revoked hydroxychloroquine and Plaquenil, explaining that "this drug may not be effective to treat COVID-19 and that the drug’s potential benefits for such use do not outweigh its known and potential risks." Information about Gilead, Remdesivir manufacturer company, is public. The links between this team and the Democratic Party are not confirmed with any evidence.
China is in maximum alert for bulbonic plague. Up to the date of publication, there was only one patient infected with the disease; other three cases were recorded in Mongolia.

Coronavirus comes from a laboratory in Wuhan and is a commercial strategy of China. There is scientific evidence that rules out the possibility that the virus causing the COVID-19 disease has been synthetically recreated.
Banana blocks the entrance of the coronavirus in cells The World Health Organization has not reported the existence of foods that serve to "prevent" or "cure" coronavirus.

Infant deaths decreased dramatically during the lockdown, when the number of vaccines administered was reduced; vaccines are a cause of sudden infant death syndrome Vaccines are safe and scientific studies have found no association between vaccination and sudden infant death syndrome (SIDS). Blaxill and Becker’s report is based on incomplete data, as they did not account sufficiently for the lag time that occurs between a death and its reporting to the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. Their findings that child deaths have significantly decreased compared to previous years are therefore spurious and premature. The duo also failed to account for other factors which may have contributed to changes in child mortality, such as stay-at-home orders, which would have limited the spread of other infectious diseases besides COVID-19.

A sharepic states that since the beginning of the corona crisis 3,354 people died and 924,000 children are missing The death number is inaccurate and the number of missing children is inaccurate for Germany. How many children are missing globally can't be confirmed

A report by the Robert Koch Institute shows that no SARS-CoV-2 has been detected in Germany since April 13th The report is from a monitoring system for infectious diseases like influenza – it is not representative and doesn't show the numbers of Covid-19 cases

Face masks don’t “protect against covid19 and other viruses.” Centers for Disease Control and Prevention recommends wearing a face covering in public since the virus is transmitted mostly through droplets produced when people cough, sneeze and talk.
The leaves of the guava tree prevent and reverse the new coronavirus. As July 5, there were no drugs, plants or foods that had been scientifically proven to cure or prevent COVID-19.

The WHO confirmed asymptomatic persons can’t transmit the coronavirus and are not infectious The WHO didn't confirm this. Asymptomatic people (who never develop symptoms) can transmit the virus, as well as presymptomatic people (who didn't develop symptoms yet)

A report reinforces theories about 5G and microchips Regarding the implantation of microchips in humans for an alleged monitoring of the progress of COVID-19, there is no evidence or study to support this claim.

As part of vaccine trials, Dr. V.K. Srinivasan of Bharath Biotech took the COVID-19 vaccine Image shows a blood drawing procedure, and is mistakenly characterized as vaccination.

Bavarian politician Markus Söder (CSU) wants to withdraw licenses of doctors who don’t vaccinate patients against COVID-19 Söder talked about doctors who (without medical reason) give certificates to people so they don't have to get the mandatory measles vaccine. He didn't talk about Covid-19 vaccines. Further, Söder can't decide something like that.

An oximeter scans a person’s fingerprint to extract their personal data. The oximeter is an instrument that comes with sensors, it is used because it allows us to measure the heart rate or it also tells us the amount of oxygen that is reaching the lungs. It does not scan your fingerprints.

The American restaurant chain Pizza Hut, founded in 1958, is officially declared bankrupt due to the effects of coronavirus. The Pizza Hut restaurant chain did not declare bankruptcy, but the US company NPC International, which operates a group of branches of Pizza Hut restaurant chains, has filed for bankruptcy.

Henry Kissinger said that population reduction should be done by vaccines “for the common good”. IMSS training on prevention must be paid COVID-19 The authorities of the Instituto Mexicano del Seguro Social (IMSS) affirm that it is false that the courses on measures to prevent COVID-19 in Mexico have a cost and can be done by a third party..

A phrase that is attributed to the president of the Community of Madrid, Isabel Díaz Ayuso, who allegedly said that “the deaths from coronavirus are the fault of the doctors and not mine.” We have not found any interview, tweet or statement in which Díaz Ayuso has pronounced those words.The oldest reference that we have found of these alleged statements comes from a post on a web page published on June 23 and titled with the same sentence.

Messages stating that King Felipe VI of Spain has bought a new car of more than half a million euros “in the midst of the COVID-19 crisis” or “in the midst of a pandemic”. It is a hoax. Ghislaine Maxwell — the recently arrested associate of Jeffrey Epstein — has tested positive for COVID-19 while in jail. The original story is the product of a website that says its work is satire.

Banana contains a lectin that is a powerful anti-COVID19 agent, blocking the virus from entering the cell. Eating a banana a day is recommended. There is no scientific evidence to support the claim. There is microchip that will be implanted in the future coronavirus vaccine to control the population for political and economic purposes. It is technologically impossible.

Antibodies for the common cold produce a positive COVID-19 test. False-positive results from COVID-19 antibody testing are behind the COVID-19 cases reported in the U.S. The number of COVID-19 cases in the U.S. is a combination of both confirmed and probable cases. Confirmed cases are detected by highly specific molecular testing for SARS-CoV-2, whereas probable cases may involve antibody testing in part. It is correct that antibody testing is prone to false-positives, because such tests may also detect antibodies against other coronaviruses besides SARS-CoV-2, such as those that cause the common cold. However, the breakdown of COVID-19 case numbers clearly shows that confirmed cases, rather than probable cases, comprise the bulk of COVID-19 cases.

Doctor says chloroquine cures COVID-19 and wearing masks can turn your blood into acid, which can help the proliferation of the novel coronavirus. There is no evidence that wearing masks can do any harm and WHO recommends its use.
Brazilian congressman João Campos denied using elections fund in measures to prevent COVID-19. The congressman is openly in favor of the measure. His position against it was invented to attack him

There is a Nipah Virus outbreak in India amidst coronavirus pandemic, according to a warning form the WHO. WHO warned of Nipah virus outbreak in India in 2018. This old warning became viral as it was presented to be related to coronavirus.

A post stating that a local magazine in Ecuador revealed corruption in test purchase for COVID-19. Increasing social contact makes the coronavirus weaker. There is no scientific evidence that Increasing social contact makes the coronavirus weaker.

A graphic that the Argentine president, Alberto Fernández, showed about the fall in GDP and the deaths by country. The data presented in the table that the President showed last Friday is correct. São Paulo’s mayor bought 38,000 coffins with no public bidding. The buying of the coffins had a process of public bidding. In fact, they were bought before the pandemic hit São Paulo.

Oximeters can take your fingerprints and therefore steal your personal data. Melon and orange are effective medicines against COVID-19. There is no scientific evidence that either oranges or melons are effective against COVID-19

A post against vaccines and a future coronavirus vaccine shows the Prime minister of Australia pretending to get a vaccine but not actually getting it. The presidente of Salvador said that prisioners have no rights during coronavirus pandemic. There is not evidence to prove that Bukele said that statement.

A post, shared as a tale on COVID-19, featuring a photograph of a soldier carrying a donkey on his back claims the image is from World War II and the serviceman is carrying the animal through a minefield. AAP FactCheck found the post misrepresents the photograph. While the claimed "moral of the story" may appeal to common sense, the photo it claims to be based on is not from World War II and does not depict a soldier carrying a donkey through a minefield.
Messages distribute false information about the alert level in Costa Rica. The National Commission for Risk Attention and Emergency Prevention (CNE) denied the messages on its official Facebook page.

U.S. hospital laboratories falsify COVID-19 tests to inflate the number of positive results. Nurses sent unused swabs for COVID-19 testing and they all came back positive. There is no evidence that hospital laboratories have falsified the number of COVID-19 positives. While false-positives can occur, experts agree that they are a rare event. On the contrary, false-negatives are hard to control as they can be due to many different factors apart from test accuracy, including the type of specimen analyzed, the sample handling, or the stage of infection. Failing to correctly identify infected people would promote disease transmission and constitute a public health risk.

The Covid-19 protocol at Évora Maternity, in Portugal, consists of “covering the patient’s head with a bag”. It's not true that COVID-19 protocol at Évora Maternity consists of "covering the patient's head with a bag".
A post claiming a COVID-19 treatment available for just Rs 600 in India. Viral post is fake. A letter of AYUSH Ministry falsely viral in the form of a certificate.

5G base stations were created in Izmir during the new coronavirus epidemic period The base stations in the photos had already been there, they were not erected during the epidemic. 5G is not yet used in Turkey.
Doctor’s Claim That ‘No One Has Died From The Coronavirus’ In Europe Is NOT True A translation of a Leadstories fact-check on the claim show that COVID-19 has caused a lot of deaths.
Dabangg-3 actor Javed Hyder is selling vegetables for a living due to lockdown. The actor was doing tik tok videos for fun.

An Instagram post is claiming Covid-19 tests tainted with coronavirus have been in circulation for “many months”. A batch of test kits produced early in the pandemic by the US CDC was found to be faulty, with components possibly contaminated with the virus. This fault was detected during pre-use validation testing and the kits were not used on patients. No incidents of false results in patients occurred, according to the investigation.

Brazilian Supreme Court ruled that President Bolsonaro couldn’t determine actions to combat the pandemic of the new coronavirus. In recent decisions, the court found that states and municipalities have the legitimacy to enact social isolation measures and that the federal government can't act to reverse them. The court, however, didn't release the Federal Union from actions to combat the spread of the disease, according to statements by its ministers and a lawyer heard by Aos Fatos.

Brazilian Supreme Court decided that the federal government has no responsability in combating the COVID-19 crisis; this should be done by state and municipal governments. The court decided that the federal government could not interfere with state and municipal decisions on local affairs, but it did not say that the national government is not allowed to act.

A video on social networks in which you can see how two policemen removed a person from inside a grave. The message with which the images are shared claim that this is a man who had allegedly died with a coronavirus in Brazil and who had been buried alive. It is a hoax. The video has been circulating since January 2019, before the coronavirus pandemic, and the person they rescue is a young man who was in his father's grave.

Video shows the dead bodies of Covid-19 patients being dumped in the ocean in Mexico. 2018 video from Russia showing 270 paratroopers skydiving to create a world record. This video has no relation with COVID-19.

A website URL being circulated to claim Rs.2000 aid from the Indian government to its population as COVID-19 relief. It is a fraudulent link being shared on whatsapp which has no association with the government.

COVID-19 exposure notification from Google & Apple is a sensor inserted to trace every phone. COVID-19 exposure notifications is an API service jointly produced by Google and Apple and it is not a sensor nor it tracks the movements or sends out privacy data of users. Also in order for this service to be activated, a supporting app should be in place from the respective country's health officials and such an app is not available in Sri Lanka.

A video claiming that Italian newscasts broadcasted fake pictures and/or videos of coffins in Bergamo during the Covid-19 pandemic. The videos and pictures broadcasted by national newscasts were real. However, several images that circulated online didn't have anything to do with the COVID-19 pandemic.
Atlantico is the department of Colombia with the most ICU beds in the country. Is the third department with more critical care beds in the country.

Gas sensors show that wearing a face mask leads to oxygen deficiency and carbon dioxide toxicity. Cloth face coverings and face masks are generally safe. Except in the case of unusual environments such as confined or closed spaces, using face coverings or face masks is very unlikely to place someone at risk of oxygen deficiency. The gas sensors used in these videos are not intended for measuring rapid changes in oxygen and carbon dioxide levels that occur with breathing, hence the measurements shown in the videos do not accurately reflect oxygen and carbon dioxide levels of inhaled air. The pores in cloth coverings and face masks are large enough to permit gas molecules like oxygen and carbon dioxide to flow freely.

A videos shared on social media saying that drinking methanol prevents the spread of COVID19. Methanol, ethanol and bleach are toxic substances: drinking or inhaling them will not only not destroy the viruses present in the body but can damage internal tissues and organs.

An email from the Colombian Ministry of Health informing citizens they must take a compulsory COVID-19 test. The message is actually malicious and seeks to steal users' personal information such as passwords and bank details.

The UN wants to ‘impose’ abortion using the coronavirus as an excuse. The information used as evidence is from five years ago and was used by the CitizenGO Latam website to get signatures for an anti-abortion campaign.

Video of a doctor hitting a COVID-19 patient. The doctor’s blows are believed to have killed him The video was recorded in Russia 7 years ago, when the existence of the new coronavirus, that causes COVID-19, was not yet known.
Xiaomi is distributing free smartphones to students who are currently under lockdown and need a phone to study. The posts with this information are a phishing scam.

A letter with the logo of Aldi claims that the supermarket encourages people not to buy animal products because they cause pandemics The letter is not a statement by Aldi, but some of the claims about consuming animal products and pandemics are true

A Facebook user shows a picture of Angela Merkel meeting Ursula von der Leyen without masks or distance, suggesting this meeting was recently The meeting of Merkel and Von der Leyen was on January 18th

Marriage contracts have been frozen in Algerian municipalities due to the spread of Covid-19. The allegation is misleading, as Algeria did not announce the freezing of marriage contracts in the municipalities, but rather the first ministry in the country provided some measures to limit the spread of COVID-19. And in a statement on 29 June 2020, it approved the complete ban of any kind of family gathering, including the organization of weddings.
Hydroyichloroquine prevents patients from developing the worst kind of COVID-19 There is no scientific evidence that supports that.
Gargling with baking soda kills coronavirus. At the moment there is no scientific evidence to prove the effect of baking soda in the virus.

A Facebook post by a “Serena Williams” has been interpreted by some as being from the tennis champ. The Facebook post is indeed by a person named Serena Williams but not the famous tennis player. There is no suggestion that the original post was presented as being from tennis champ Williams, however some reshares have tagged the sports champion’s accounts.

A video which claims that infrared thermometers would be “killing us” by altering our central nervous system. The information is not correct. Infrared thermoters do not emit radiations, but they receive them instead. They are not harmful for human health.

Publications that claim that a Brazilian deputy has uncovered “the great farce of the sick and deceased of COVID-19” when discovering an empty field hospital. The full video, 55 minutes long, was originally uploaded on May 27 to YouTube, Instagram and Facebook by Rio de Janeiro state deputy Filippe Poubel. In the recording, Poubel complains that the São Gonçalo field hospital "should have been opened today, but it was not opened." In other words, he complained that the hospital center was not open, not that the COVID-19 pandemic was "a great farce" since there was no patient.

A WhatsApp message that the European Union wants to relax vaccination regulations so that the COVID-19 vaccine is available more quickly since “Gates and his accomplices seem to be in a rush to administer it” although “it probably equates to a genocide”. It is true that the European Commission intends to shorten the development deadlines of the vaccine against COVID-19, but this has nothing to do with it going to "cancel the rules", as the WhatsApp chain affirms. The EU intends to achieve this within 12 to 18 months, or even sooner, without affecting safety, quality or effectiveness.

A publication that says that the Governor of Jujuy (Argentina), Gerardo Morales, assured: “We are going to bring patients from other provinces” The Governor of Jujuy called not to rule out the possibility of that happening, but did not refer to specific plans. From the Government confirmed that there is no protocol in place for the transfer of people with COVID-19 to that province.

Denis Mukwege, Nobel Award laureate, resigned his post as head of a commitee to deal with the pandemic after being asked to forge the number of COVID-19 cases and deaths. On Twitter and through his press officer, Denis Mukwege denied ever making such statements.

Video from old city Hyderabad shows COVID-19 patients being treated outside the hospital. This video is from Lahore, Pakistan showing emergency patients evacuated due to a fire in the emergency ward of the hospital. This video does not show any COVID-19 patients.
Livfavir and Fabiflu are both medicines that can be used to treat COVID-19. The viral message regarding the medicine is fake. Livfavir is not certified to be sold in market as on now.

A viral video in which residents of Sololá try to open the zipper of a body bag, to make sure there was a corpse inside. Although the Ministry of Health assured that there was a corpse inside the coffin, the population could not verify that it was so because the protocol for handling corpses of the Ministry prevented it.

A Salvadoran doctor published a protocol for patients diagnosed with COVID-19 and the care they should take to avoid visiting a doctor and how to take medication if they tested positive. Although some of the recommendations may not be harmful to people, other medical experts always recommend going to health professionals to find out what treatments to use. They do not recommend self-medication. Some of her methods are denied in the note.

Video of a hospital crowded with COVID-19 patients in a Barranquilla hospital, in Colombia. The images, which have also circulated in Ecuador, Venezuela and Honduras, were taken in Ciudad Obregón, in Mexico.
A nurse is mistreating elders in Antioquia, Colombia. The post actually shows a photograph of singer Axl Rose, from Guns 'n' Roses.
Brazilian MPs unveiled the biggest COVID-19 hoax so far The Brizilian MP is angry because the hospital underconstruction is not ready yet for patients.
169 people in a Mumbai apartment tested positive for COVID-19 There was regular screening being conducted in the building and people did not test positive
Patanjali CEO denies saying that Coronil can cure COVID-19 The press release by Patanjali as well as the first press conference endorsed it as a cure

Red eyes are a rare symptom in coronavirus patients According to the OMS, conjunctivitis is a rare symptom in patients with coronavirus and is in no way a strong indication to believe that you have COVID-19

Ivermectin can prevent COVID-19. Ivermectin was included by Resolution No. 259, in the National List of Essential Medicines 2018-2020, and can be used for the treatment of patients with coronavirus (COVID-19), "under medical protocol and informed consent," according to a note from the Ministry of Health. It cannot be used without this consent.
A WhatsApp chain offering food aid in Spain called the “2020 social plan” for the COVID-19 health crisis. It is phishing, a technique that seeks to get hold of your data and, sometimes, your money.

A Facebook post claiming that the “50 million people” who died during the second wave of the Spanish flu (1918) had just got a vaccine. The post compares this situation with the new coronavirus, and warns people against getting a vaccine for Covid-19 when it will be ready. In 1918, when the second wave of the Spanish flu hit the world, the vaccine against the disease hadn't been discovered yet.
Dexamethasone cures covid-19. Evidence says that dexametasone may help as a treatment to critically ill patients of covid, but is not a cure.
WHO says that covid-19 has become endemic. WHO said COVID-19 may become endemic but is not yet.
Coronavirus dies in 26-27 degrees temperature, according to UNICEF. The message is falsely attributed to UNICEF. The fake post has resurfaced after a couple of months.

The use of masks causes us to inhale the carbon dioxide we breathe and to “poison the lungs”. A post is circulating on Facebook that maintains that the use of masks or masks prevents the carbon dioxide that we eliminate by breathing from being expelled and that, when inhaled, damages our lungs. Specialists point out that the tissues of the masks allow oxygen and CO2 to pass through.
A video where people, allegedly Covid-19 victims, are thrown out of an helicopter in Mexico. The video was shot in July 2018 and it shows a group of skydivers. It has nothing to do with COVID-19.

A post claims a COVID-19 vaccine has already been developed and will cause widespread infertility. The supposed information supplied by the “whistleblower” is an almost verbatim match with an unrelated, 31-year-old paper about anti-fertility vaccine research in India.
Bruno Covas, Mayor of São Paulo, admited using chloroquine. He banned the drug in São Paulo. Covas did not say he used chloroquine, neither did he not "forbid" chloroquine in São Paulo.
Italy, Spain and the United Kingdom “present zero cases” of Covid-19 to attract tourists. Italy, Spain and the United Kingdom are not claiming there is zero cases of COVID-19 to attract tourists.

A picture shows people walking in the streets with no masks and not respecting social distancing, which would prove that Covid-19 was a hoax. The picture was shot in 2013 during the New York Pride March. It has nothing to do with COVID-19.

The German parliament (Bundestag) decided to keep the containment measures (state of emergency) until March 31, 2022. The Bundestag didn't make such a decision. There is just a proposal of the Liberal Party (FDP) to lift the state of emergency. They also proposed keep up some of the important measures e.g. regarding training of medical staff until latest March 2022.

Suicides have increased 200% in the COVID-19 lockdown period. There are no official statistics or evidence to support the claim that the rates of suicide increased 200% during the period of lockdown (i.e. from 23 March to end of June).

The pandemic was a giant scam since only 56 deaths from COVID-19 caused the collapse of the global economy. The graph that was used a source for the claim in question presents the number of patients that had died from COVID-19 until May 9, 2020. Since then the number of dead people has grown significantly. Today the dead count from COVID-19 is over 500,000 worldwide.
Masks are dangerous Those claims are false, masks are not dangerous, say multiple experts.
Masks pose serious health problems Those claims are false, masks are not dangerous, say multiple experts.

Indian ayurvedic pharmaceutical Patanjali claimed that the ayurvedic ministry had now approved the sale of the COVID-19 ayurvedic medicine coronil produced by the company The AYUSH ministry had only acknowledged the receipt of the clinical trial documents from the company and did not approve the sale of the coronil COVID-19 medicine
A photo shows a meeting of Angela Merkel and Emmanuel Macron without masks or distance on June 29th The photo was taken on January 19th

A post claims a bus driver was hit by a rock after complaining about a passenger who entered the vehicle without a mask. The photograph was taken in 2015 in Recife, Pernambuco, four years before the pandemic. The bus driver was hit by a rock thrown by a man with mental problems.

Ginger Vapor with Coca-Cola cure COVID-19 The World Health Organization has repeatedly clarified that although home remedies can alleviate some symptoms of COVID-19 and be comforting, so far there is no medicine that can prevent or cure this disease.
A Russian doctor invented the Covid-19 vaccine, while an Iraqi parliamentarian scared the people. Misleading news.

Twenty-four Iraqi MPs were transferred on a private plane to Amman, Jordan after they were infected with the coronavirus. Misbar verified the news, and made sure it was not correct, as the official spokesman for the Jordanian government, Amjad Al-Adayleh, denied that a number of members of the Iraqi parliament were receiving treatment from the coronavirus on Jordanian soil.

Tanzania kicked out the World Health Organization (WHO) after goat and papaya samples sent to the agency tested positive for COVID-19. The WHO Africa Regional Office website lists a country office in the United Republic of Tanzania as of Tuesday, September 1. United Nations Tanzania's official website also lists a WHO representative in the country, doctor Tigest Ketsela Mengestu.

The Argentine Electoral Chamber announced that the legislative elections of 2021 will be eliminated. After the publication of a decision of the highest court in the country, it became viral on social networks that the voting calendar for next year would not be met. However, the Chamber hadn't said this. The judicial authority looked into COVID-19 in other countries that had elections in recent months and seeked to take into account possible barriers to ensure the elections.

Media uses photos of puppets on patient stretchers to scare the public. There is no evidence that any media outlet used this photo for their reporting about COVID-19. Its origin is unclear, maybe it was shot in Mexico and shows a medical training session.

The herb called mugwort cures the coronavirus in three days. There is no scientific evidence to back the idea that mugwort cures the coronavirus. People who consume it may feel a false sense of safety.

A publication asks for financial help to save the Los Pollos Hermanos restaurant in the midst of the coronavirus crisis. A photo of the actor Giancarlo Esposito, who plays the role of Gustavo Fring in the series Breaking Bad, circulates on the social networks of several Colombians who ask to promote the restaurant ‘Los Pollos Hermanos’. Although this is a joke, some people believed it.

A “face mask exempt card” shared on social media invokes the Americans with Disabilities Act and claims to excuse people from wearing face masks. The group behind the card — “Freedom to Breathe Agency” — is not a government agency, and federal officials say the ADA “does not provide a blanket exemption” from requirements to wear masks.
Television anchor Omkaar infected with coronavirus. TV anchor Omkaar is not infected with COVID-19.

Hydroxychloroquine is an effective treatment for COVID-19. The evidence showed that Hydroxychloroquine did not result in the reduction of mortality of hospitalized COVID-19 patients when compared with standard of care. So, there is no proof of this medication efficiency against COVID-19.
Alappuzha market in India closed due to discovery of COVID-19 positive patients in the area. The market was closed for heavy vehicles and no COVID-19 cases were reported in the area.
Video showing dead bodies of coronavirus patients in Osmania Hospital’s mortuary. Old video of Osmania hospital mortuary is shared as being recent.
COVID19 can be transmitted through mosquitoes. Experts dismiss the claim that COVID-19 can be transmitted by mosquitoes.

Leader of the Sadrist movement, Muqtada al-Sadr, was inficted with Covid-19, and died in Beirut. Muqtada Al-Sadr’s office denied the news in Iraqi newspapers and media sites, and the photo attributed to Muqtada Al-Sadr in the hospital is in fact Sheikh Sadiq Al-Zayer Al-Aqili, and published it on his page in June 2019 when he performed a surgery.

A test on video with a gas detector shows that face masks result in dangerous oxygen levels for the wearer. Experts — and the company that makes the gas detector — say the video’s test is scientifically flawed.
The plant known as luisa grass kills the coronavirus. The claim is backed by the measurements in kilohertz of the lemon verbena and the virus. It doesn't make scientific sense.
Breathing in the scent of an eucalyptus leaf strengthens the bronchi. Eucalyptus has no healing effect on the bronchi and does not cure coronavirus.

From June 26, Taipei Veterans General Hospital implements strict access control, including a ban on patients visits. The local transmission in Taiwan is worse than what the Taiwan health ministry reported. From June 20, Taipei Veterans General Hospital has opened time slots for patients' visitors. Visitors are required to make appointments in advance. But the visit is generally not forbidden.

Vice President Leni Robredo says the lockdown imposed due to the coronavirus should have been enforced as early as October 2019. Vice President Robredo did not say the quote attributed to her in the claim. There are no reports from credible news organizations or statements from the Office of the Vice President that contain this quote from Robredo.
Story claims to show a little girl who died of COVID-19. The uncensored image was taken in the United States long before COVID-19 was discovered, and actually shows a victim of domestic violence.
Drinking a mixture of turmeric powder, cloves, lemon and ginger called kashayam cures COVID-19 No scientific evidence backs this claim.

An Egyptian doctor says that the Tunisians’ immunity could be a new treatment for Covid-19. Misbar investigated the claim and found it to be false, as no Egyptian doctor has stated that the Tunisians' immunity may be a new treatment for the novel coronavirus. Likewise, Tunisia did not conduct firm research confirming that Tunisians have immunity to protect them from Covid-19.

Scientists found that 80% of world population is immune to COVID-19. Posts took projections made by British neuroscientist Karl Frisk who believes up to 75% of a countries population may not get in touch with the virus ever. This would change the number of infected people. However, he does not say that all these people is immune. Also, the fake news posts mislead WHO statements to suggest that asymptomatic patients do not transmit the virus - which is false.

Tamil National Alliance leader Sampanthan states that Tamil Nadu COVID-19 patients should be sent to Sri Lanka, as there are less patients in the country. TNA leader has never made a statement suggesting Tamil Nadu COVID-19 patients should be sent to Sri Lanka.

Infrared thermometers damage neurons. A viral video on WhatsApp and Facebook alerts about possible damage to the neurons of infrared thermometers that measure temperature at a distance. But thermometers do not emit X-ray-like radiation, as wrongly claimed in the video, and they do not harm the nervous system.
An image with a text urging citizens to stay away from Villa Pamphili area, in Rome, due to a recent new outbreak of Covid-19. The news was denied by local health authorities.

A video shot in an empty Brazilian emergency hospital, which would therefore infirm the presence of a new spike in Covid-19 cases in the country. The video is real and it was posted by Adriana Borgo, a Brazilian deputy for the State of Sao Paulo. However, Mrs. Borgo stopped the video before entering a restricted area of the hospital where patients couldn't be recorded due to privacy reasons. When the video was shot, the hospital was treating 407 patients.

WHO said that the novel coronavirus is losing potency. World Health Organization (WHO) didn’t say coronavirus is losing potency. The viral post was attributed to World Health Organization (WHO) but is fake.

A painting depicting children in face masks was created as a mural for the Denver airport in 1994, proving the COVID-19 pandemic was planned. The painting is not at the Denver airport, and is not from 1994.
WHO says that asymptomatic people don’t transmit coronavirus. WHO didn't say asymptomatic people are cannot transmit the virus. They said that it was in a first statement, that was corrected.
Infrared thermometers kill neurons. These thermometers don't cause any harm.

A grocery store worker who wore a mask for hours at a time got a lung infection from “breathing in her own bacteria”. Wearing a face mask for a prolonged period does not lead to CO2 intoxication nor oxygen deficiency, according to the World Health Organization. This conclusion was supported by a pathologist and an epidemiologist.

Dead bodies wrapped in these white cloths are those of the people who died of COVID-19 in Osmania Hospital, in the city of Hyderabad, India. The video showing dead bodies is from Osmania Hospital in Hyderabad, but it was recorded in 2013.

An Egyptian doctor publishes a picture of the hands of his colleague who works in the first line of defense to treat coronavirus patients in a hospital, and how it was affected by the long period of wearing protective gloves. Misbar checked the image and found the claim to be misleading, because the original photo showed the hand of an Indian doctor.

The first Syrian doctor dies in the Syrian capital, Damascus, as a result of infection with coronavirus. Misbar checked the story and found it misleading. As Dr. Maher Hussein Fakih is a Lebanese national, he died in the Dar Al-Shifa Hospital Kuwait.

Prolonged use of masks causes lack of oxygenation. Experts heard by Aos Fatos deny the harm mentioned by the pieces of disinformation and claim that the masks are produced to allow gas exchange with the environment.
China has been the source of four epidemics since 2006. It's not true that China has been the source of four epidemics since 2006.

The WHO has warned of an outbreak of Nipah in India “deadlier than the coronavirus”. Despite WHO warnings about the dangerousity of this virus, the last alert dates from 2018. The WHO has confirmed to Newtral.es that this is a hoax.

As of June 26, there is no scientific study proving that masks protect against the novel coronavirus. On the contrary, the research has shown that wearing masks reduces the risk of SARS-CoV-2 infection.

On the building of the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation is the inscription “center for the global reduction of the human population”. The photo is a montage that has been shared on social media at least since 2014.
Garlic and guava leaf cure COVID-19. As it has been found, garlic and guava leaf are actually supplies of traditional medicine that help to cope with multiple ailments. They do not cure coronavirus.
Infrared thermometers destroy neurons. It had already been said that they could damage the retina, but both that, and a possible involvement of the brain, are statements that experts deny sharply.
Publications linking COVID-19 to a ‘new world order’ in Colombian pages. They are based on religious prophecies and misleading data.

The Minister of Health in Colombia has confirmed that hospitals and clinics have a “macabre business”. In early June, Fernando Ruiz reported mismanagement of ICUs in some regions of the country. But in some publications, users have decontextualized their words.

The ban on motorcycle backriding, or having two people ride a motorcycle, has been lifted in the Philippines. Motorcycles are allowed only one passenger in areas that are still under community quarantine.

In 2011, the movie Captain America, shows the image of the coronavirus that causes COVID-19 The filming of Captain America (2011) captured the image of an Italian pasta advertisement in Times Square. It is not the image of a coronavirus.
Hospital in Pakistan is overwhelmed by COVID-19 patients Patients were evacuated as a fire broke out in the emergency ward

Osmania Hospital in Hyderabad cannot bear the burden of COVID-19 cases as corpses lay stacked outside the hospital Six-year-old video at Osmania hospital is falsely being shared with COVID-19 narrative
The German Robert Koch Institute (RKI) confirmed a COVID-19 death rate of 0.01 percent The RKI did not confirm such a death rate
São Paulo’s mayor, Bruno Covas, prohibited doctors from prescribing hidroxychloroquine. The medicin has been included in health treatment protocols since April 9th.

Italian doctors defied WHO rule not to conduct autopsy and found that the Covid-19 caused by bacteria and aspirin is a cure. The Italian Health Ministry never advised so and the advice on its website is against such treatments.
