Alkaline diets will help fight coronavirus. There is no scientific evidence to support that this type of diet is effective against the virus that causes the disease COVID-19. The World Health Organization does not recommend the consumption of any specific food to combat coronavirus.

A video that compares the progress of hospitals in La Matanza (Buenos Aires, Argentina). A video circulates in networks where the Argentine president Alberto Fernández is seen promising on March 24 to complete the works of the René Favaloro hospital of Rafael Castillo in 60 days, and a voiceover compares it with the current situation of a hospital that is not clarified which. Although the René Favaloro hospital was not inaugurated in the promised time, currently the works have already been completed, as confirmed by the Ministry of Public Works of the Nation. On the other hand, in the Néstor Kirchner hospital the works are not done.
Brazilian hospitals receive R$ 18,000 per death registered due to COVID-19. What the man says in the footage contradicts the information on a document he shows himself in the recording.

Prevention masks keep CO2 and turns the blood acid, which is good to coronavirus’ proliferation. Health authorities deny this claim. They say masks are good to prevent spreading the disease. Also, they allow changes of gases.

A picture allegedly showing Italian ministers having dinner at a restaurant. They are not respecting social distancing or any other safety measure aimed at stopping the spread of the new coronavirus. The picture is real but it was taken in December 2019, when Italy had no certified cases of the new coronavirus.

Infrared thermometers kill neurons and damage the eyes. Hugo López-Gatell Ramírez, Mexico's undersecretary for Prevention and Health Promotion, stated that infrared non-contact thermometers do not kill neurons, as has been said in social networks.
Coronavirus is found inside Pepsi and Cola bottles in China. PepsiCo has denied the claims and confirms that none of its beverages are affected by COVID-19 in China.
Dead bodies of COVID-19 victims are thrown in the sea off Mexico. This is a 2018 video from a parachute jump in Russia.

Ministry of AYUSH has removed Dr. Mujahid Hussain from service because he banned Baba Ramdev’s medicine Coronil. The ministry has clarified that it has not removed any doctor or medical officer from duty or service at any time in the recent past.
The woman shown in this photo holding a baby is COVID-19 positive. The photo is 35-years old and is falsely linked with coronavirus.
India’s AYUSH Ministry has certified Coronil medicine. AYUSH Ministry has not certified Patanjali's Coronil medicine for treating COVID-19.
Coronavirus dies in 26-27 degrees temperature, according to UNICEF. The message is falsely attributed to UNICEF. The fake post has resurfaced after a couple of months.

The Eiffel Tower pays tribute to the victims of COVID-19. The video circulating on networks is actually about the 130th anniversary of the Parisian monument. The tower itself was lit a few times during the pandemic to thank health professionals for their work, not to commemorate the victims.

Nebulisations with drugs for bronchitis and natural remedies cure COVID-19. On social networks, both Facebook and Instagram, a message circulates recommending a treatment against COVID-19, which includes mists, as well as tea with ginger, cinnamon, honey, lemon and chamomile. We tell you that this is false.
Antiradiation suits are needed to install 5G cellphone towers. The person who appears in the image is not using a special suit. And 5G workers do not have anti radiation suits.

Bolivia approved the use of chlorine dioxide, amid the fight against covid-19. The Bolivian government did not approve the use of chlorine dioxide, in fact it warned about the danger of consuming it due to the side effects it causes. He also clarified that there is no scientific evidence that this chemical cures COVID-19.

The book named Ahbarüz Zaman predicted coronavirus epidemic beforehand. There is no book named Ahbarüz Zaman by an author named Ibrahim Bin Salukiyye. There are two books named Ahbarüz Zaman that have survived to the present day; these are Arabic history and kalam works written by different authors on different dates.

According to Bill Gates, the COVID-19 RNA vaccine will permanently alter our DNA. RNA vaccines can also cause autoimmunity. Previous studies have demonstrated that RNA vaccines are generally safe. Studies examining the potential integration of nucleic acid vaccines into DNA have shown that RNA from a vaccine does not alter DNA. RNA from a vaccine is also very unlikely to cause autoimmunity, as RNA is short-lived, being quickly degraded by cells after it has been used to make a protein. Therefore RNA does not persist long enough to cause autoimmune disorders, which are chronic in nature. In fact, some nucleic acid vaccines are being developed to treat autoimmune diseases.

A clip from Mexico depicts the dumping of coronavirus patients corpses into the sea. Misbar's investigation of the video revealed that it does not depict the dumping of coronavirus patients corpses in Mexico, but rather paratroopers landing from a Russian MI 26 helicopter.

Brazilian hospitals receive R$ 18,000 for each death registered with “suspected COVID-19” The Brazilian Ministry of Health, the state government of Rio Grande do Sul and the city hall say that transfers are calculated based on the size of the population in each location and the level of complexity of health equipment. The volume of deaths or suspects of new coronavirus infections isn't taken into account.

Mayor of São Paulo, diagnosed with COVID-19, used chloroquine, the same drug that was banned by the municipal government. The only drug the mayor has claimed to have taken in his treatment is azithromycin, an antibiotic. Furthermore, the municipal government of São Paulo never banned the use of chloroquine. The mayor even announced in April that the drug would be used in municipal hospitals in the city, even without scientific proof of its effectiveness.

The Chinese embassy advised its citizens in a neighbourhood of Madrid to close the shops after new coronavirus cases in China. The Chinese embassy denied this claim to Newtral.es. Also, several shops deny having received that message and are still open.
There is no pandemic: the number of deaths evidences this, says Ostap Stakhiv. The pandemic is real, and the number of COVID-19 deaths is growing daily.
Masks are dangerous and do not protect against viruses. Masks are not harmful to human health and help slow down the spread of viruses.

WHO recently alerted to a flare-up of Nipah virus (NiV). This virus reported its last outbreak in 2018, in India. However, it did not cause more than 17 deaths in that country. The WHO statement quoted in the media and social networks is from that year.

The coronavirus the “Muy Interesante” Spanish-language magazine talked about in 2014 is the current one. The article does not discuss SARS-CoV-2, which causes COVID-19, but other types of coronaviruses discovered in 2003 and 2012.
Nebulized ibuprofen attacks the coronavirus. The study did not pass the initial phase and can generate false expectations and confusion in the population.

The Philippines has the lowest number of COVID-19 cases and fatalities in Asia. According to data from Worldometer, the Philippines has 32,295 total cases of COVID-19 as of June 25, ranking us 15th highest out of a total 49 countries in Asia. We are 10th highest in Asia for the total number of COVID-19 deaths at 1,204.
This video shows a minister looking at photos of parishioners who died of COVID-19 The video is unrelated.

A video circulating on social media proves that there is no COVID-19 patient in a hospital in Brazil where authorities claimed there were over 5,000 patients and 200 dead people from the pandemic. The video in question shows an ambush to a hospital under construction. The opening of the hospital took place many days after the incident depicted on that video.

A paramedic from the Ukrainian town of Rivne has cured the new coronavirus disease by the breath-holding technique. There is no evidence in favor of the breath-holding technique being efficient in COVID-19. Moreover, there is no proof that that paramedic indeed was sick with the novel coronavirus.
There is a lot of research proving that lockdowns are useless. Although there are economic consequences, lockdown measures are effective in decreasing the spread of SARS-CoV-2.

A post fabricates criticism of TV Globo and Flamengo, a Brazilian football club, about the return of the Rio de Janeiro championship during the COVID-19 pandemic. Neither statement is true.The Jornal Nacional, from TV Globo, didn't even talk about the game. Flamengo denied President Rodolfo Landim's supposed comment.

COVID-19 is a thrombosis caused by bacteria. The cure was found in Italy. COVID-19 is a respiratory disease caused by the SARS-CoV-2 virus. There is still no cure, according to the World Health Organization (WHO)

A video showing that authorities of a city in Paraíba were hiding medicine against COVID-19 to receive more money from the federal government. The recording shows a Prosecutor's Office operation to prevent the distribution of expired medicines. There is no connection between the transfer of resources from the federal government and the number of deaths.

A video shows Israeli doctors dancing after they managed to zero out the number of COVID-19 patients in the hospital. The original video was published by Shaare Zedeck Medical Center Jerusalem on April 29. The postings recommend exercises to improve heart activity and wish for a happy Jerusalem Independence Day.

A post claims that thieves in NSW and Victoria are using chemical-laced facemasks to knock out victims. Police in Victoria and NSW have not received any reports of criminals offering people facemasks doused with chemicals. The hoax post and simliar versions of the claim has circulated online and been debunked around the world since late March and early April.
Didier Raoult said China and the U.S. created COVID-19 Raoult's PR denied it, and scientits say the new coronavirus has natural origins

The spread of COVID-19 began last October with “contaminated” flu vaccines and the coronavirus remained latent in the body of the patients until it emerged months later. It is a hoax without scientific foundation. SARS-CoV-2 has nothing to do with the flu virus and having this vaccine injected does not increase the risk of contracting COVID-19.
Lottery employee is recorded stealing COVID-19 emergency federal aid from client in Brazil. The video was recorded in December 2018 and is unrelated to pandemic emergency aid.

Hospital in Brazilian city of Fortaleza closes Covid-19 ward due to lack of patients. The images were recorded on June 17 at the ECU (Emergency Care Unit) in the region, which, despite receiving patients with the disease, does not have an exclusive ward for them. That day, there were four suspected cases of infection at the site and officials celebrated the drop in patient numbers.

A Facebook post claiming that Google is creating new, original articles everytime users type a number followed by “new cases”, in order to keep the “pandemic hoax” alive. The information is not correct, Google is not creating new articles or search results. Being a search engine, it can only show content that already exist on the internet.

A publication comparing two photos and claiming that the images of cemeteries where people who died from COVID-19 are buried are recorded on a filming set with chroma and subsequently edited. It is a hoax. The image shared is from the Vila Formosa cemetery in São Paulo, the largest in Brazil, and the picture used is actually an illustration published in an image repository.

Posters and messages are circulating stating that in the last week “the Chinese community in Usera (Madrid) closed its stores again on the advice of its embassy after the outbreak of COVID-19 in Beijing.” There is no evidence for this claim: the Chinese Embassy says that "they have never recommended nor do they recommend the closure of shops to the Chinese population in Spain". In addition, several shops in the area tell Maldita.es that they have not received any recommendation from the Chinese Embassy, that the shops are not closing and that a large part of the Chinese shops in the neighborhood are open, the latter verified by Maldita in person.

Article circulating on social networks and that alerts about the supposed detection of rats destined for human consumption infected with coronavirus (56% of those analyzed) in some restaurants in Vietnam. The document to which they refer is real, however it is a preprint (a provisional publication waiting to be validated and published in a scientific journal), published in the bioRxiv open access repository, which is based on analyzes carried out between 2009 and 2014, in previous studies, already coronaviruses other than SARS-CoV-2, which causes COVID-19.

An image claims that deaths of coronavirus are not real. The image is a photo of a protest against the economy reopening in Florida, US. The bodies are not real, they represent the deaths of people with coronavirus.
A video of the Eiffel Tower illuminated in honor of Covid-19 victims. The video was recorded in 2019.

A Whatsapp message claiming that Covid-19 was transmitted to people through the 2019-2020 influenza vaccine. The news is fake: there isn't any scientific study which correlates COVID-19 and flu shot. The pieces of evidence quoted by the Whatsapp message are not reliable, and they've been contested by other scholars.
Video from Pune, India shows COVID-19 patient collapsing on the streets. This is a mock drill video conducted by Pune Municipal Corporation for COVID-19 preparedness.

Video from Pune shows COVID-19 patient collapsing on the streets and being taken away in an ambulance. The viral video, in fact, shows a mock drill conducted by Pune Municipal Corporation to check on response time in COVID-19 related emergencies.

Video shows a doctor from Breach Candy Hospital of Mumbai claiming that If you can hold your breath for a longer period without discomfort, you don’t have Coronavirus. Breach Candy Hospital has clarified to Fact Crescendo that the person in the video does not work for them. Experts have already debunked that being able to hold your breath for 10 seconds doesn't mean someone doesn't have coronavirus.

Meme shows Florida Surgeon General saying: Everyone should STOP wearing masks as they have now been found to be harmful to your health. The surgeon general actually issued an advisory two days earlier saying everyone in Florida “should wear face coverings in any setting where social distancing is not possible.”

You can self test coronavirus by a 10-second self check test. Post claiming that a 10 second self test can help you detect coronavirus is fake. This false information has resurfaced after a couple of months.

The mayor of Pereira hit the number of active cases of COVID-19 on May 24, but its comparison with previous dates is not accurate. According to the Mayor's Office, in 30 days active cases went from 94 to 20, but there is no report that fully demonstrates this.

Colombian oil company Terpel is giving away fuel because of the COVID-19 crisis. The information is completely false and is a form of fraud that seeks to obtain personal information from unsuspecting users, according to a statement from Terpel.

Pereira (Colombia) Mayor’s Office applied mandatory isolation before the National Government and did pay public service bills. The municipal isolation measure began five days before the national one and the Mayor's Office covered with utilities from public companies the expenses of water, energy, public lighting and cleaning.

Infrared or “pistol” thermometers can cause ophthalmic and neuronal damage. The signal emitted by these thermometers is neither noticeable nor harmful to the human eye. Temperature measurement using technological tools such as infrared thermometers contributes to the prevention of COVID-19 infections.

A blog post has been shared thousands of times in multiple Facebook posts which claim it shows a video of a baby who died after being infected with the novel coronavirus, which causes the disease COVID-19. The claim is false; the blog post in fact shows a photo that has circulated online since 2014 in reports about a man who killed his wife and children in New York City.

The photo shows the heart of someone who has COVID-19. The photo shows not the human heart, but the heart of the pig with cardiac cysticercosis, a parasitic tissue infection. COVID-19 does not cause such deformation in the human heart.

A letter from the UK Prime Minister, Boris Johnson, inviting the British people to express their opinion on requiring all people to wear under-the-skin chips. Misbar investigated the letter attributed to Johnson and found it to be false, as it was not issued by any government agency in the United Kingdom.

By revoking the permission to use chloroquine in hospitalized patients, the FDA expanded the use of the drug in the USA. According to US law, once a drug has been approved by the FDA for a particular use or disease, it can also be prescribed for other purposes at the doctor's discretion - it is called an off-label prescription. In the case of chloroquine and hydroxychloroquine, they are already approved to treat malaria, lupus and rheumatoid arthritis. The authorization for emergency use in hospitals, in practice, meant that the FDA gave a favorable opinion to the use of the substances, considering them promising in the fight against the new coronavirus.

The number of deaths in Ukraine in 2020 is less than in 2019, so there is no pandemic, and the lockdown was not needed. The number of COVID-19 deaths is growing daily. The pandemic is real, and the lockdown is needed.

Former Filipino Senator Antonio Trillanes IV said President Rodrigo Duterte created COVID-19 together with China. Senator Trillanes did not say this quote. He debunked the claim on his Facebook page, saying, "For info, this quote did not come from me. Please be vigilant against 'fake news' and fake posts."

The United Arab Emirates announce they have controled the COVID19 crisis on a video that show celebrations The original publisher of the video said it documents the national sanitizing program. There is no announcement by the UAE that it has controled the COVID-19 as of June, 24.
COVID-19 patients are roaming around in Pune A video of a mock drill to check preparedness is being shared as if it showed COVID-19 patients roaming around in the open

CDC report indicates that the COVID-19 mortality rate is incredibly low. The publication refers to the Proposed COVID-19 Outbreak Scenario Parameters and uses the numbers for the most optimistic scenario of the developments. However, one cannot use scenarios meant for technical purposes as reliable estimates.

Barack Obama and Dr Anthony Fauci gave a laboratory in Wuhan $3.7 million in 2015 for a ‘bat’ project This photograph shows Barack Obama and Dr Anthony Fauci visiting a lab in Maryland, USA, not in Wuhan. The US government never gave $3.7 million to a lab in Wuhan for a project about bats.

A video in which the man introduces and dubs another video from an interview with Stefano Montanari in the Byoblu video blog. Montanari calls himself a “nanopathologist” and claims that masks cause us to inhale the carbon dioxide that we expelled by breathing. This supposedly produces hypercapnia (excess carbon dioxide). Wearing a mask does not cause hypoxia or hypercapnia in healthy people, so it is not the origin of diseases such as cancer.

COVID-19 vaccine candidates will insert microchips in humans. The hoax comes from a misinterpretation of a Reddit message from Bill Gates in which he mentioned the possible need to use 'digital certificates' until a vaccine is found and even afterwards.

An image claims that chroma screen panels are being used to make up coronavirus deaths. The image has been manipulated. The real one is a video frame published by Atlas news Agency last April in the cementery of Vila Formosa, Brazil.
Bill Gates said that the COVID-19 vaccine will permanently change your DNA. The new RNA and DNA vaccine candidates are experimental  but in no way capable of modifying human genetic material.

A video refers to a supposed “NASA anticovid necklace”, a device that theoretically ionizes the air around the head, disinfecting it. There is no evidence that this device serves as protection against COVID-19. Air ionization is used in some environments to improve its quality, but there is no evidence that this collar can disinfect the air of SARS-CoV-2, something that the same companies that distribute it deny, and therefore replace the protection of the mask.

Bill Gates has said that the COVID-19 vaccine could kill 700,000 people. Gates is not referring to deaths, but to the number of people who could suffer some side effect if vaccinated against COVID-19.

Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez tweeted, “It’s vital that Governors maintain restrictions on businesses until after the November Elections because economic recovery will help Trump be re-elected. A few business closures or job losses is a small price to pay to be free from his presidency. #KeepUsClosed.” Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez didn’t tweet this.

A video with theories about the coronavirus during an anti-quarantine march in the Obelisk (Buenos Aires, Argentina). A video with more than 2 million reproductions circulates on Facebook and Twitter where a man reproduces conspiracy theories about the COVID-19 disease. These statements were denied by official entities, international organizations, scientists and fact-checking media from different countries of the world. In several of them the key characteristics of conspiracy theories can be noted.

A video of the doctor linked to the anti-vaccine movement, Chinda Brandolino, on the origin of COVID-19. In the video circulating on Facebook, the doctor disseminates various falsehoods that have already been verified and denied. In his presentation, he maintains that the pandemic is "invented" and that its purpose is to guarantee worldwide control of people. He also claims that there are cures for COVID-19, which is false since there is no effective specific vaccine or treatment for the disease so far.

Doctor says on video that prolonged use of masks acidifies the blood. The process, called hypercapnia, actually occurs when a large amount of CO₂ is inhaled, but, according to the Brazilian Ministry of Health and a specialist who talked to Aos Fatos, this wouldn't happen with the masks recommended today, as they have pores that allow gas exchange in breathing.
WHO said coronavirus is losing potency. World Health Organization (WHO) didn’t say coronavirus is losing potency. The viral post was attributed to World Health Organization (WHO) but is fake.

Samsung is giving free phones to students during coronavirus pandemic for online studies. No, Samsung is not offering free phones to students during coronavirus pandemic. The viral post is fake. Samsung has also asked to beware of such phishing scams.

COVID-19 cases are “up only because of our big number testing” in the United States. If increased testing were the only reason for a surge in new cases, the percentage of positive tests should be dropping or at least remaining about the same. That pattern did occur from early April to early June, a period when the availability of testing expanded significantly. However, that’s no longer the case. Since early June, the amount of testing being conducted has continued to reach new highs, yet the positivity rate has risen by a full percentage point.
The WHO alerted about a new outbreak of “Nipah” virus, which is more lethal than the novel coronavirus. The last outbreak of Nipah virus was on 2018 and the WHO has not compared the two virus.
COVID-19 is cured by gargling hot bicarbonate. The alleged treatment of gargling appears in a video that went viral on networks. But this is false and the woman who proposes it is not a doctor.

Claim that Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez tweeted that U.S. governors should extend COVID-19 restrictions on businesses “until after the November Elections.” There is no evidence Ocasio-Cortez sent the bogus message on Twitter.

In North Carolina, “you can be charged with a class H felony for wearing a mask and concealed carrying.” A viral Facebook post said "you can be charged with a class H felony for wearing a mask and concealed carrying.” A North Carolina law does prohibit people from covering their faces in public. But that law is currently suspended. And, even if it weren't suspended, experts say it wouldn't affect concealed carry laws.

A “face mask exempt card” allows you to cite the ADA and not wear a mask. The Justice Department has debunked the claim. The Freedom to Breathe Agency isn’t a real federal agency. The Americans with Disabilities Act, a federal civil rights law that prohibits discrimination based on disability, does not specifically say anything about face masks. While it’s true that businesses are not allowed to ask customers about their disabilities, and there may be some exceptions to the law, governments have broad authority to issue health mandates during a pandemic.

A man in Argentina makes claims like “in the US, doctors are paid $13000 thousand to say they got sick from COVID-19 and $39000 to put that ventilator on, the artificial respirator.” The man repeats in the video conspiracy theories that have been denied by fact checkers from different countries of the world, including Colombia. The claims he makes are false.

The British Embassy in Kuwait gives Bidoon doctors immigrant visas after passing the proficiency tests. Misbar verified the news and turned out to be false, and the Kuwaiti newspaper Al-Anbaa published an official denial of the news from the British embassy in Kuwait.

Video reveals a secret vaccine for the novel coronavirus, in the White House. Misbar investigated the video and found it misleading, as this dialogue actually took place between journalists in the White House, but they were joking.
The coronavirus will fade away on its own, so no vaccine is needed. It is the opinion of an Italian scientist Matteo Bassetti, which goes contrary to the position of the scientific community.

If you are licensed to carry a concealed weapon, wearing a face covering for coronavirus “removes your conceal carry ability.” No national law prohibits licensed concealed-carry holders from carrying a weapon and wearing a mask. Some states generally prohibit wearing a mask in public to conceal one’s identity. But states with those laws have said the laws don’t apply to wearing a mask to guard against spreading the coronavirus.
The WHO Deputy Director-General choked with broccoli to death an hour before the press conference about the coronavirus. This news was "created" by the satirical outlet.

The governor of Ceará, Camilo Santana, arrested a man who criticized the purchase of respirators for treatment of COVID-19. The video shows police officer Paulo José Monteiro da Cunha who was arrested on charges of military crime in Fortaleza, Ceará. Brazilian law prohibits military officials from criticizing superiors and government decisions.

Nurses from hospital Messejana, in Brazil’s Ceará, record a video celebrating the closing of COVID-19 room due to lack of patients Video was recorded in another health facility and does not shows closure of the COVID-19 area. In fact, the same health facility received new patients the very next day.

A picture with a quote attributed to the Nobel Prize Dénis Mukwege, where he says that he was obliged to classify all the recent demises as Covid-19 related deaths. The quote is fake: Mr. Mukwege has never said anything like it, as confirmed by his spokesperson.

A widely shared video in which the doctor Ángel Ruiz Valdepeñas, from the Hospital of Formentera, claims during a demonstration in Madrid that “there is no coronavirus pandemic” and that, therefore, “there is no point in either the mask or social distancing.” The Balearic Medical Association considers these statements "highly irresponsible" and announced that it would open an information file to the doctor. Furthermore, the pandemic is not over and there is no evidence that the coronavirus was created by humans as a "biological weapon".

A video showing a protest by doctors from La Rioja against Alberto Fernández, president of Argentina. The original video was recorded in Belgium, during a protest by hospital health personnel against that country's prime minister.

Bill Gates-funded vaccine got 1,200 girls sick in India. There is no evidence to support this. No lawsuit is being held against the founder of Microsoft over this issue, as the viral Facebook post hints.

A picture of the Italian Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte eating pizza in a crowded space where no one is respecting social distancing measures or wearing protective masks. The picture would have been taken during the Stati generali conference, which took place in Rome in June 2020. The picture is real but it was taken in May 2019. It is not related with COVID-19.

Information circulating across social media platforms claims that Nigeria’s Federal Government has approved to disburse 30,000 to citizens as Covid-19 lockdown funds. The site lacks credibility for the claims it has made. Besides, requiring users to share its links and provide their bank details makes the site more suspicious and questionable. In sum, its methods make it look like a typical site for fraudsters. The claim is FALSE.

Two photos which show human throats have been shared hundreds of times in multiple Facebook posts warning about the seriousness of the novel coronavirus, which causes the disease COVID-19. The photos have been shared in a misleading context; both images have circulated online before the COVID-19 pandemic; health experts have clarified that only a small percentage of COVID-19 patients are likely to develop the most severe symptoms.

A photo of a list of purported symptoms and treatments for the novel coronavirus, which causes the disease COVID-19, has been shared hundreds of times in multiple posts on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram. The purported remedies include a daily dose of vitamins; exposure to sunlight; and a diet of alkaline foods. The claims are false; as of June 29, 2020, experts say there is no known cure for COVID-19; AFP has previously debunked hoax claims about the purported coronavirus symptoms and remedies.

A short portion of an interview given by discredited researcher Judy Mikovits, in which she claims that a vaccine for COVID-19 will be deadly, warns against immunization, and advocates for a five-year moratorium to test all vaccines, has been watched tens of thousands of times on YouTube and Facebook. The claims are false; vaccine candidates go through three phases of clinical trials, are carefully monitored for adverse effects, and multiple doctors told AFP vaccines are safe.

A scientific study shows that cannabis is more effective at preventing and treating COVID-19 than hydroxychloroquine. The World Health Organization recognizes some therapeutic uses of cannabinoids. A recent scientific preprint reported that some cannabis strains might modulate the expression of ACE2, the viral receptor for SARS-CoV-2, in an in vitro study. However, the study does not present data on clinical outcomes in animals or humans (in vivo) during infection, nor does it test whether the cannabis extracts affect the infectivity of SARS-CoV-2. It is thus impossible to know whether these specific cannabis strains could prevent or cure COVID-19 in people. The study also did not compare the effect of cannabis extracts with that of hydroxychloroquine on COVID-19, so it does not provide any evidence for the claim that cannabis works better than hydroxychloroquine.
Quarantine is a special operation to create a concentration camp in Ukraine. Restrictive measures are introduced to slow down the spread of the pandemic, not to create a concentration camp.

Coronavirus is the most massive scam and is a robbery of Ukrainians. SARS-CoV-2 is not a scam. The virus has a natural origin. To fight the epidemics, the government has allocated a lot of money, although it is a necessary measure.

Despite the crisis the German government is taking two months of holidays. There is the usual summer break in parliamentary meetings, but in emergency the parliament will still gather. Not all members of parliament or government are on holidays, they are still working.
Photo claimed to show a child who has COVID-19. The boy in the photo was battling leukemia.

Samsung is giving free phones to students during coronavirus pandemic for online studies. No, Samsung is not offering free phones to students during coronavirus pandemic. The viral post is fake. Samsung has also asked to beware of such phishing scams.

A video of a nurse claiming that 60 percent of COVID-19 victims died from other diseases and that public authorities are increasing the numbers to receive more money. There is no record of any investigation into the alleged fraud. Government transfers are not related to the number of deaths by COVID-19.

Video shows Elisa Carrió, former deputy of the Nation for the Autonomous City of Buenos Aires, calling for a march for freedom. The filmed message that went viral now was actually shared by the former national deputy on October 13, 2019 on Twitter, to call the "Million March", prior to the presidential elections.

In the Philippines, the Office of the Vice President (OVP) donated spoiled food to frontliners at Diliman Doctors Hospital in Quezon City. The Diliman Doctors Hospital released a statement on Tuesday, June 23, denying the rumors. Vice President Leni Robredo also said the incident “never happened.”
COVID19 dead patients are dropped from a plane in Mexico. The video is from a parachuting video in 2018 long before the COVID-19 pandemic.

“Break the quarantine and this will be our future. Then don’t cry. (Photo from Ecuador) ”, says a photograph that shows piles of human bodies on the ground. The scene captured in the photograph happened in 2015, after a human stampede in Mina, Saudi Arabia. It has nothing to do with COVID-19 or Ecuador.
Social media posts shared thousands of times in the United States contain multiple false or misleading claims about face masks used to stop the spread of COVID-19, The claims are misleading.
A Japanese professor said that the coronavirus was fabricated in China. Tasuku Honjo has not made such a statement.
Coronavirus is a global fraud, and lockdown is genocide. The coronavirus is real, and lockdown measures help to curb the spread of the pandemic.

Outbreaks in slaughter houses are due to false PCR tests – the PCR test can show positive results for coronaviruses of cattle or vaccines for cattle PCR tests cannot react positive to coronaviruses of cattle or vaccines for cattle

Salty and sour foods cause the “body of the COVID-19 virus” to explode and dissolve. “Consuming fruit juices or gargling with warm water and salt does not protect or kill COVID-19,” the World Health Organization Philippines told VERA Files.

The title of an article suggests the low-cost steroid dexamethasone will heal anybody with COVID-19. The drug was found to be effective only on critically-ill COVID-19 patients that require ventilators and supplemental oxygen. There was no observed benefit on patients who did not require respiratory support.

Alberto Fernández (President of Argentina), on the increase in cases in Buenos Aires: “They wanted to go running, go running. This is the consequence.” The President related the growth of coronavirus cases in the Autonomous City of Buenos Aires to the relaxation of the quarantine for runners ordered by the Buenos Aires Government. However, according to the numbers of the City and the Province of Buenos Aires -where in the 40 municipalities of the AMBA it is not allowed to go running-, there is no correlation between flexibility and the increase in cases. Scientific studies enable the option of going for a run but, at the same time, recommend maintaining social distance. The same is maintained by the experts who advise Fernández.

“Joe Biden and the Democrats want to prosecute Americans for going to church, but not for burning a church.” We found no statements from Joe Biden or other leading Democrats suggesting that they want to prosecute churchgoers, but not people who set churches on fire. Biden and other Democrats have spoken out against the violence and destruction that took place at some Black Lives Matter protests.
Thyroce lab in Thane, India is sealed over false positive covid-19 testing. This lab was not shut down over false positiveCOVID-19testing.
A Facebook post which would list the ingredients for the Covid-19 vaccine. At the moment there is no vaccine against COVID-19. The list of ingredients is false.
Infrared thermometers damage neurons. The infrared thermometers use a very low intesity light not laser like the industrial ones, so they are not harmful in any way.

French President Emmanuel Macron exempts the French from rent, and electricity, water and gas bills, to tackle the coronavirus pandemic crisis. Misbar has verified the news which turned out to be misleading. The economic measures announced by the French President on March 16, when the country entered the stage of quarantine restrictions, did not include any exemption from paying bills, but it is about postponing their payment. Also, this delay is not for individuals or families, but rather for smaller companies.

Tunisia announces in the coming hours that its sea, air and land borders will be closed again to counter Covid-19. Misbar verified the news and found it to be false, as neither the Tunisian Ministry of Transport nor the Presidency of the government announced the possibility of closing the borders until next July.
EU Commission president Ursula von der Leyen proposed for workers to do without their salary in solidarity with the economy. Ursula von der Leyen never made such a statement.

A Facebook post makes several claims about the etymology of COVID-19. The name “COVID-19” is an acronym for coronavirus disease 2019 as announced by the World Health Organization. The post’s claims that Ovid is Latin for sheep and the letter C means to “see” are also false.

Biomagnetism cures coronavirus. Biomagnetism is an alternative therapy that uses magnets to create static magnetic fields and supposedly modify the magnetic fields of the body itself, thus relieving pain or healing diseases. There is no hard scientific evidence to back it up.

The Corona Cooking Survey shows that both men and women bake more often, that men enjoyed cooking more before quarantine, but that the difference with women has narrowed in recent weeks. Women in particular continue to find dining together more important. Because 80% of the participants to the survey were higher educated and predominantly women, this survey does not allow general conclusions to be drawn for the whole population.

A video showing a light show at the Eiffel Tower in Paris is shared with messages indicating that it is a tribute to the victims of COVID-19. It is a hoax. The video shows the celebration of the 130th anniversary of the Parisian monument in 2019.

An article stating that Italian authorities knew about a promising drug that could cure Covid-19, but they ignored it. The drug (dexamethasone) was known, but it was not reccomended by the WHO for COVID-19 patients. The WHO changed its position on June 16, after a study carried out by Oxford University proved that dexamethasone can actually have a positive effect on patients.

Senegalese doctor says chloroquine is the secret for a very low number of deaths by COVID-19 in Senegal. Senegal uses chloroquine as a treatment for COVID-19. Doctor Mussa Seydi defends the drug, but says it is not the only reason why deaths are such low.

Donald Trump said Brazil is the only country in which the Supreme Court is hampering the national government’s ability to deal with COVID-19. Also, he criticized Brazilian state governors. Trump did not mention in any occasion the Brazilian Supreme Court or governors, the entire quote is a complete fabrication.

João Doria, governor of São Paulo, said CoronaVac, the Chinese vaccine that will be tested in Brazil, will be tested only on elderly people, who will receive 1.5 thousand reais (around 250 American dollars). Doria never said that. The eligibility criteria for volunteers is not decided by state governors, but by the company and their partners in Brazil, Instituto Butantan. These criteria have not been fixed yet. Paying medical research subjects is illegal in Brazil.

Legislator from Nuevo León, Mexico says there are inconsistencies in COVID-19 tests. Michel Fernando Martínez Reséndez, specialist in Epidemiology and Infection Control from Tec Salud, said that the efficiency of the test result depends on when the procedure was performed, the type of test to detect COVID-19 and the protocols.
Photos claimed to show 1,200 people buried in Italy. The images were not taken in Italy but in Sri Lanka and were unrelated to the pandemic.

A viral image of a doctor who died from treating patients with coronavirus at the Llano de Corrientes Hospital, Argentina. A post circulates that mourns the death of "AnibalAnsalas" (sic) for caring for people with COVID-19 but the image of the professional corresponds to a Spanish porn actor.

WHO warned of a new Nipah virus outbreak. An alleged World Health Organization (WHO) warning circulated about the outbreak of a deadly infectious agent in India. Despite the fact that the Nipah virus exists, there was no alert about a recent outbreak by this international institution.

Muy Interesante magazine already spoke in 2014 about the current coronavirus, as some content that is being spread affirm. It's a hoax: the current coronavirus strain, SARS-CoV-2, is never mentioned in the February 2014 magazine article.

A picture which would show Vicenza football team supporters partying in the street after the team’s promotion, during the Covid-19 emergency in Italy. The picutre is real but it was taken in August 2019. It has nothing to do with the COVID-19 pandemic.

Nurse says Brazilian states and municipalities earn federal funding for every death recorded for COVID-19. The extra resource for combating the pandemic provided by the brazilian Ministry of Health varies according to the size of the population and the complexity of the service provided in the health units, not by the volume of deaths in the region.

When symptoms of COVID-19 appear, people should take azithromycin, ivermectin and Anitta. There is still no effective remedy against the infection, according to scientists, medical entities and health authorities. In addition, self-medication with these compounds can pose health risks.

Boldo tea and quina quina tea prevent and even cure COVID-19. According to the Brazilian Ministry of Health, no type of infusion is effective against infection with the new coronavirus. The Ministry and the WHO (World Health Organization) emphasize that there is still no specific medicine or treatment for the disease.

WHO says Coronavac, vaccine produced by Sinovac Biotech, hasn’t been tested anywhere in the world before Brazil. The vaccine has already undergone two phases of testing and was administered to 744 Chinese people.
The President of Madagascar said he received a bribe from the World Health Organization for having a cure for the coronavirus. Madagascar president did not denounce a bribe from the WHO.
The cure for coronavirus: ginger, lemon, onion and garlic. These natural ingredients do not cure the virus.
Top Georgian health official Gamkrelidze said there will not be a second wave of the coronavirus. Gamkrelidze hasn't made such a statement. He has not ruled out the possibility of the second wave.

A picture which would show a mother and her premature baby in a hospital, both infected with Covid-19. The picture is real, but it was taken in the UK in 2018. It has nothing to do with the new coronavirus.

The U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) says masks don’t work and violate OSHA oxygen levels. The U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) encourages workers to use face masks or cloth face coverings at work, in accordance with recommendations by the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention for reducing community transmission of COVID-19. At the moment, the use of face masks or coverings are not mandated by OSHA, but left to the employer’s discretion. Cloth face coverings are generally safe to use and do not lead to oxygen deficiency, since gas molecules like oxygen and carbon dioxide are much smaller than the pores in fabric and pass through the covering easily. By blocking much larger respiratory droplets, which carry the virus, face masks and coverings help to protect others in the community and limit COVID-19 spread.
Don’t buy fish in Egypt because it contains a new virus called SARS-COV-2. There is no evidence that fish can transmit COVID-19.

Iván Duque Márquez, president of Colombia, compares COVID-19 figures with other countries without due context. In his television program on managing the pandemic in Colombia, the president presents charts that ignore the differences between countries and omit some that are better.
Bill Gates, who is supporting COVID-19 vaccine research, visited in New Zealand during May. The Gates Foundation said Mr Gates has not been in New Zealand in 2020.

A picture from Beirut, the capital of Lebanon in 1918, as if history repeats itself during the days of the spread of the Spanish flu. Misbar checked the circulating image and found the claim misleading, because the original image shows the latest fashion trends of women for the year 1913, that is, taken before the spread of the Spanish flu that broke out in 1918-1919.
Fighting COVID-19, the authorities have banned everything favorable to health. The imposed restrictive measures do not violate people's right to health.
Few people have died of the new coronavirus, so one should not be afraid of it. It is wrong to compare deaths for various causes.

A video claims to have been recorded at the Hospital La Margarita, in Puebla. Images of patients in the hallway allegedly with COVID-19 and a hospital floor full of bags containing dead bodies. The fragment of the corpses in bags was registered in Guayaquil, Ecuador. It cannot be proved that the first part of the sea of the Hospital "las Margaritas", in Puebla.

A German doctor revealed a global terrorism conspiracy that employed the COVID-19 pandemic as a tool. Other than a few accurate remarks on the video in question, the speech is a collection of distortions both of statistics and scientific research.
Consuming seawater with lemon prevent the spread of COVID-19. Lemon seawater does not block the virus and does not prevent COVID-19 and experts warn of the risks that this practice could bring.
Congolese Nobel Prize Denis Mukwege said he doubted COVID-19 was real His PR denied this information.

A video claims that the novel coronavirus existed in 2003, citing medical journals. The article is about the virus that causes SARS.  The name "coronavirus" is used to refer to a group of viruses. The agent that causes COVID-19 is called SARS-CoV-2.
The CDC and other authorities in the US admitted to fake the Covid numbers The article puts numbers and statements into false context
SARS-CoV-2 is a “bacterial infection,” not a virus. Several studies and health institutions have confirmed that SARS-CoV-2 is a virus.
Video of patients dancing in a COVID-19 quarantine centre is from Mumbai. Video of patients dancing at COVID-19 quarantine centre is not from Mumbai, but Tripura.
Delhi police released this coronavirus guideline. The viral guideline document is falsely attributed to Delhi police.

The US government’s Center for Disease Control has officialized the emerging scientific evidence on coronavirus transmission with a rank of circumstances and enviroments by risk of contamination. The Center for Disease Control has not given those instructions.

Patricia Bullrich (former Minister of Security in Argentina): “Only 25% of Argentinian companies have come to have some help from the State”. The former Argentine minister was based on a single program of the national government, subsidized loans at a rate of 24%, which according to the Central Bank were delivered to "a quarter of the MSMEs of Argentina." There are other programs that benefit other companies, such as Work and Production Assistance (ATP). However, no official or private study estimates what percentage of companies received any state aid during the COVID-19 pandemic.
The Argentinian company La Campagnola closed due to quarantine measures. The Arcor Group confirmed that it did not shut down any of its plants during the pandemic.

A photo of Joice Hasselmann, Brazilian federal deputy (representative) who recently was diagnosed with COVID-19, walking on a hospital corridor without a mask. The caption states she is faking the disease. The photo was taken in March 2, 2020, when Hasselmann received a hysterectomy.

CoronaVac, a vaccine that is being developed in China and will be tested in Brazil, was only tested on monkeys. The first and second phases of clinical trials are undergoing in China, with human subjects.

CoronaVac, a vaccine that is being developed in China and will be tested in Brazil, is being funded by Bill Gates. CoronaVac and INO-4800, the one being funded by Gates, are different vaccines, being developed by different companies in different countries, with different technologies.

While the world was worried with COVID-19, Chinese companies were able to purchase Volvo, Pirelli, Thomas Cook and part of Mercedes Benz. All these companies are partly owned by Chinese corporations, in some cases controlled, but all these deals went through before COVID-19 was discovered.
CoronaVac, vaccine that is being developed in China and will be tested in Brazil, was not tested anywhere else in the world. The vaccine is currently being tested in China.

Two photos: one, of a swollen amygdala, the other, a healthy one. The caption says the first one is from a COVID-19 patient. The picture is from 1958, from a patient infected with Straptococcus bacteria. Amygdalitis is not a COVID-19 symptom, although it may occur as a result of secondary infection.

A text by C. S. Lewis, from 1942, talks about a “pandemic of fear”. It says the devil took many souls to hell because they became too attached to their earthly lives, through fear. The text was not written by C. S. Lewis, but by a Christian activist in 2020.

WHO establishes COVID-19 as a pandemic the day after receiving donations from Bill Gates. Bill Gates' first contribution to WHO regarding COVID-19 was made in February 2020, long before the pandemic was established. The second Bill Gates contribution was made in April 2020, after US President Donald Trump stopped funding for WHO. Regarding the designation of COVID-19 as a pandemic, this was done because the level of distribution and the number of victims had increased. In theory, COVID-19 also meets the criteria as a pandemic.

A picture stating that the governing parties in Italy voted against a proposal, supported by the League and other right-wing parties, to offer an economic reward to nurses and doctors who fought against the Covid-19 epidemic The Italian government has already approved an economic bonus for nurses and doctors. The League's proposal - which was actually rejected - basically wanted to add another bonus on top of the already existing one.

Gov. Gavin Newsom “has no legal authority” to make wearing face coverings mandatory in California. Gov. Newsom has broad authority under the California Emergency Services Act to issue health mandates during a pandemic. Two constitutional law experts said Newsom does, indeed, have the power to make face coverings mandatory under that act. They said unless face coverings are shown to be ineffective, Newsom’s requirement should hold up against legal challenges. Top public health officials and recent studies say wearing a face covering is an effective measure for reducing the spread of COVID-19 when people gather.

Joice Hasselmann, brazilian federal deputy, appears without a mask in a photo in the hospital even after a positive diagnosis of COVID-19 The image was recorded on March 2, when she was recovering from a hysterectomy, surgery for complete removal of the uterus.
President Trump’s claim that he inherited no ventilators from the Obama administration. There were 16,660 ventilators available in the Strategic National Stockpile.

5G antennas are being installed in Popayán, Columbia. A publication on Facebook claims that 5G antennas are being installed in the historic center of the Cauca capital, but this technology has not yet reached Colombia. And no, it is not responsible for COVID-19 either.
‘Laser’ thermometers damage the retina. WhatsApp audios and Facebook videos claim that the laser of the devices can affect the eyes. Ophthalmology experts contradict those versions.

“OSHA says masks don’t work” to reduce COVID-19 transmission “and violate OSHA oxygen levels.” No, OSHA does not say that 'masks don’t work' against COVID-19. OSHA recommends that masks be worn to help slow the spread of COVID-19. Masks aren’t a cure to prevent spread of COVID-19, experts say. But they are an effective tool in slowing transmission.

Video of a man dressed in white who recommends taking ivermectin, aspirin, and ibuprofen to treat COVID-19. That’s the formula they used in Australia. The Australian government did not approve ivermectin or any drugs to treat COVID-19. Although studies continue to be carried out to determine if any drug such as ivermectin is effective in preventing or curing COVID-19, there are still none that have proven its efficacy.

Doctors of a hospital in New Zealand are cheering in this video after they cure the last COVID-19 patient of their country and shut the COVID-19 ward. The video is from a place in Italy's Madonna delle Grazie where doctors cheered after no more COVID-19 cases were registered.

A picture of the Egyptian doctor, Mohamed Hashad, carrying an oxygen cylinder in an attempt to save the lives of Covid-19 patients in an isolation hospital in Egypt. He died after contracting coronavirus. Misbar investigated the image and found the allegation to be misleading, because it actually shows an Iraqi technical nurse named Wissam Al-Ghazi.

A German journalist is angry at the Tunisian government because it risks its people to save the tourism season. Misbar checked the news that was circulated and found it to be false, as there is no statement by a German journalist about the Tunisian government's decision to resume the tourist season.
From June 24, Ukraine is going to restore strict lockdown. Tougher lockdown measures may be re-introduced in some regions if necessary.

To be able to manipulate the lockdown measures, Ukraine has classified data on the general mortality rate. The number of confirmed COVID-19 cases provide sufficient grounds for quarantine restrictions.

PCR tests also detect common cold viruses. PCR testing is based on the specific genetic information (RNA sequences) of the novel coronavirus and therefore it does not detect genetic information of other coronaviruses that cause ordinary colds. Thus this test only tests positive for COVID-19.
This photo shows protective masks during the Spanish flu, in 1918 The picture dates back to at least 1913. Theses masks are rather fashion accessories than sanitary protections
WHO has admitted that a COVID-19 vaccine won’t work WHO did not say nor suggest this. The institution just mentioned immunity after infection may be temporary (regardless of vaccine or not).

A photo shows health professionals honoring a doctor killed during the fight against the new coronavirus. The photo shows a Chinese doctor Zhao Ju. He died in September 2016 of a brain aneurysm while volunteering in Tibet.

A post suggests a conspiracy in the testing of a Chinese vaccine against COVID-19 in Brazil. It says: “China has 1 billion people and is going to test the vaccine in Sao Paulo?” The number of inhabitants is not a suitable metric for determining vaccine test sites. Research needs locations with high potential of infection to speed up results. The Sinovac Biotech vaccine has also been tested in China before.

A video of a COVID-19 patient in a Brazillian hospital claims they are deliberately letting more patients dies and recording deaths as COVID-19. The patient shown in video was tested positive for COVID-19 and recovered a few days later. She did not die.
Azithromycin, nitazoxanide and ivermectin cure COVID-19 if taken when symptoms are first noticed. Health authorities say there is still no known cure for COVID-19.

A doctor claims she successfully treated 20 patients with ivermectin, and therefore there is a cure for COVID-19 At the moment of publication, studies with ivermectin were in their early stages. Health authories do not recognize ivermectin as an official treatment for COVID-19.
The governor of the State of São Paulo signed a partnership to produce a vaccine against COVID-19 in 2019. Discussions about a partnership to develop a COVID-19 vaccine started in April, 2020.

After the Brazilian Ministry of Health started using an early stage chloroquine protocol, the number of patients recovered from COVID-19 increased. The percentage of people who recovered from COVID-19 wasn't changed by the new protocol.

Cardinal Antonio Cañizares, from Spain, has assured that one of the vaccines that is being investigated against COVID-19 is made from cells of aborted fetuses. There are no "aborted fetus cells" used in biomedical research. There are two immortalized cell lines that come from cells removed during the analysis of two fetuses resulting from two medically aborted abortions in 1961 and 1966.
Photo shows cremation ovens being transferred to Yopal, Colombia. The barrels in the photo resemble liquid storage tanks, while the ovens, like crematoriums, are square-shaped.

The coronavirus causing COVID-19 has been existing since 2003. Despite the fact that the article in the newspaper Clarín de Argentina circulating on social networks is authentic, it does not refer to COVID-19. The virus that this press release talks about is the SARS outbreak that emerged between 2002 and 2003.

The federal police found thousands of reais inside the house of Pará state Health secretary. This money was supposed to go to COVID-19-related equipment. The video actually shows a police raid on other police officers accused of drug trafficking. Not related to the health secretary.

Burglars are pretending to be healthcare professionals. They visit houses offering free COVID-19 tests, and take the opportunity to ransack homes. The people shown in the picture are workers from the electricity company, not burglars or healthcare professionals. The photo was taken in 2018.

A video shows Camilo Santana, governor of Ceará in Brazil, saying expletives to explain why he is prorrogating lockdown measures. The video was dubbed, but, because he wears a mask, it's not easy to notice. Originally, he explained the situation in a professional manner.

A police officer from São Paulo rescued his mother while she was about to be buried alive. The video shows a police officer in Amazonas who invaded a hospital because he thought his mother was about to be buried alive. He watched a disinformative video on WhatsApp about a woman who was, allegedly, put inside a corpse bag while still breathing, and thought it was his mother because they wore the same dress. This particular video has been previously debunked too.

Infrared thermometers can cause damage to the retina. A viral chain on WhatsApp and Facebook alerts about possible damage with the "laser beam" emitted by thermometers that measure temperature without contact. However, thermometers do not emit laser beams, but instead have an infrared sensor that measures the temperature of people.

A picture with a quote attributed to Bill Gates, stating: “The vaccine won’t be safe, but let’s get it out quickly anyway, and worry about the consequences later” Bill Gates never said so. The quote comes from an interview Bill Gates did for BBC Breakfast, that has been distorted and misinterpreted.

An alleged statement from a College of Physicians of Spain in which the population is warned about COVID-19 and what is involved in assisted ventilation, and there is a “call for common sense” in the lack of confinement. There is no evidence that it is from a Spanish College of Physicians. From the General Council of Medical Colleges (CGCOM) there is no evidence that it is a text from any school in Spain. The alleged statement has also reached Latin American countries and a fragment of it has been circulating at least since April.
Coronavirus does not affect people with ‘O+’ blood type. The post claiming coronavirus does not affect people with ‘O+’ blood type is misleading.
Gates Foundation planting microchips during COVID19 swab testing. No, Gates Foundation is not planting microchips during COVID-19 swab testing. This viral post is fake.
The coronavirus is an amplified bacteria related to 5g. The coronavirus is not a bacteria and has no relation with 5G.

A picture showing Italian politicians eating together, not wearing masks and not respecting social distancing measures. The picture was alledegly taken during the “Stati Generali” conference in June 2020. The picture is real but it was taken in 2014. It has nothing to do with the COVID-19 pandemic.
This video of the Eiffel Tower shows a tribute to victims of Covid-19. The light show of the Eiffel Tower was held for its 130th anniversary in 2019, it is not a tribute to victims of COVID-19.

The EU has confirmed that 5G networks are harmful to people’s health. The EU has warned, precisely, that this statement is a hoax connected to the pandemic. EU regulations establish maximum levels of exposure to mobile networks that are 50 times lower than the limits from which health can be affected, according to scientific evidence.

Video shows police seizing money diverted from respirators at the home of the health secretary of the Brazilian city of Belém. The video was recorded during a police operation in the city of Barcarena (in the Brazilian state of Pará) against six military police officers accused of embezzling seized cocaine.
United Nations established the use of a microchip to identify people. The UN has not said anything related to microchips.

Mixing Suavitel, vinegar, Clorox and water helps neutralize the coronavirus. The recipe, although it does inactivate SARS-CoV-2, which causes COVID-19, thanks to the virucidal activity of only one of its components, can be dangerous to health. Clorox contains bleach.
Inhaling clove is a treatment for any virus that affects lungs. There is no scientific evidence that clove in any form can cure COVID-19 or any other virus affecting lungs

A widely shared video claims to show Brazilian lawmaker Filippe Poubel erupt in anger as he breaks into a field hospital that had claimed to have 5,000 novel coronavirus patients and finds it empty. In reality, the clip depicts the politician expressing his displeasure over a delay in opening a new COVID-19 hospital.
Brazilian MPs revealed the hospital claiming it treats 5,000 COVID-19 patients. The video shows the MP's visit to the unfinished field hospital, where no one is being treated yet.
Angela Merkel met the leaders of the German states without security distance or masks. The photo is old. At the meeting, Merkel didn't wear a mask - but other politicians did, and they kept distance.
A vaccine-test volunteer became sick and was censored by media The volunteer said it is not true.

Supreme Court released 32,000 prisoners because of COVID-19. Decision to take non violent prisoners into home prison is up to state courts. There was a recommendation from National Justice Council to do it so in order to prevent mass contaminations of COVID-19 inside prisons, but it was not a recommendation from the Supreme Court.

The Chinese authorities dumped dead bodies in the sea. These bodies were of patients who had died of coronavirus. The bodies are now washing up on the Hong Kong and Taiwan coasts. The video is from 2014 and shows the coast of Libya, Africa, where bodies had washed up after some people died in an accident.

An alleged alert issued by the WHO due to an infectious outbreak in India due to a virus called Nipah that would be “more deadly than COVID” as published by some Spanish media. It is a hoax: this piece of news is from 2018 and is shared as being recent.

Video of the president of the Catholic University of Murcia (UCAM), José Luis Mendoza, in which he falsely assures that the coronavirus was predicted at the 2012 London Olympics. The statements coincide with the diffusion of several publications that claim that the prediction was made in one of the performances London 2012 opening ceremony which, in fact, celebrated the British National Health Service (NHS, by its initials in English). Therefore, it is a hoax that the COVID-19 pandemic was predicted during it.

An audio where an unidentified person links the virus that causes COVID-19 with the massive flu vaccination campaign. There is no evidence linking the influenza vaccine to the coronavirus. We encounter fewer serious cases because we are now able to detect them earlier and treat them better, not because the virus has changed.

Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation building says “Center for Global Human Population Reduction” on its front. The image that circulates on social media is doctored. When searching for the place on Google Maps, it can be seen that the building of the civil organization of the founder of Microsoft does not have any facade like that of the viral image.
Gargling with warm water and salt cure the coronavirus. Gargling with warm water and salt does not eliminate the COVID-19.
Belgian doctors turn their back on WHO director. The Belgians medical personnel turned their backs on Belgian prime minister Sophie Wilmès.

Suicides ‘have increased 26% during quarantine in Medellín’, Colombia. The Ministry of Health of Medellín and the Northeast Regional of the National Institute of Legal Medicine and Forensic Sciences, entities in charge of giving this information and delivering the statistics, confirmed not having issued it.
Mine Phone Sayardaw predicted that COVID-19 infections could exceed 100 million worldwide. Sayardaw U Thukamainda, a close devotee of the monk Mine Phone Sayardaw has categorically denied the claim.
ICMR study claims COVID-19 cases to peak in mid November causing paucity of ICUs and Ventilators. ICMR has clarified that they have not conducted this study and also they find the study misleading.

A picture of the Italian Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte, allegedly taken at the “Stati Generali” conference organized in Rome during the Covid-19 pandemic. In the picture Conte is speaking closely with other people, none of whom is wearing protective masks. The picture was not taken during the "Stati Generali" conference: it dates back to May 2019, and it has nothing to do with COVID-19.

Facebook is using your pictures and posts in lawsuits against the company amid the COVID-19 pandemic. The post claiming that amid COVID-19 pandemic, Facebook has changed its privacy rules, allowing it to use pictures and posts shared by users in lawsuits against them is fake.
Egypt Ministry of Education says it will give the family of any student who dies of COVID19 5 thousand egyptian pounds. The ministry of education denied the claim.

Bill Gates, who has led harmful vaccination campaigns in developing countries, now plans to use COVID-19 vaccines to surveil the population. The Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation has committed millions to the improvement of health outcomes in developing countries through vaccination campaigns, becoming a prominent target of the anti-vaccine groups. During the last decade, the foundation has also been involved in the development of health-related technology which, along with its active support of the research of COVID-19 treatments and vaccines during the outbreak, has led to the growth of conspiracy theories worldwide. The claim that Gates wants to use COVID-19 vaccines to track the population is unsupported. The vaccines used in the initiatives funded by the Gates Foundation in Africa and Asia were approved and safe.

Video with the claim that members of Brazilian Parliament broke into a hospital and found it had no coronavirus patients. The video is real, but it does not show members of Parliament looking for coronavirus patients. Actually the local politician Filippe Poubel and his supporters broke into the hospital to prove that it was not yet operating as it was promised by Rio government.

SARS-CoV-2 mutated and became 10 times more infectious. There is no definition of "Novel Beijing coronavirus-D614G". The D614G is referred to as the name of the mutation in an experiment on COVID-19; not a real mutation detected.

WHO President Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus dances at a nightclub during the quarantine period. Misbar has investigated the video, which was released on June 12, and found that he is not the World Health Organization director, despite the physical similarities.
“WHO has changed its rules to call the coronavirus situation a pandemic.” – Dr. Jaroslav Belsky. The WHO has not changed the definition or description of the term "pandemic."

This coronavirus has an aversion for heat, humidity and UV rays. While there are certainly papers that support that theory, the WHO warns that "COVID-19 is contagious no matter how much available sunlight or temperature." and there are papers to back it up.  Meanwhile the spread of the disease in hot and humid Southeast Asia also continues unabated.

The new app to track infections in Germany (Corona Warn-App) is using your personal data and contacts on your smartphone in order to track and identify people. The app doesn't identify people and doesn't access personal data.

A 19 year old was diagnosed with a respiratory illness that was caused by a daily and prolonged use of a face mask at work that was imposed for COVID-19 protection. The case in question was shared thousands of times in multiple social media accounts, every one of which used a completely different name for the 19 year old. Further, comercially available face masks have large enough pores that are more than enough wide to allow the flow of molecules like oxygen and carbon dioxide thus. Finaly, the idea that breathing in bacteria that we exhale can cause diseases like pleurisy is not backed by any scientific study or official scientific or medical institution. In fact, if an individual exhales those bacteria it means that they are already in his system thus the original argument does not make sense.
The pandemic does not exist. Lockdown is pointless and harmful. The pandemic is real. Lockdown helped to curb the virus transmission.

Contact tracing apps have been secretly installed on every Android phone Contact tracing apps have not been secretly installed on all Android phones. A system known as exposure notifications have been developed by Google (and Apple) to support governments and health authorities who are developing contact tracing apps, but these are only activated if a contact tracing app is actually installed.

A post circulating on Facebook claims the latest research shows the mutation of COVID-19, D614G, makes the disease ten times more infectious. The claim came from American virologist William Haseltine's comment on the research of finding of D614G. The study itself doesn't prove if the mutation makes the COVID-19 more infectious.

Brazil’s health minister says cases with no confirmation of COVID-19 won’t be considered on death toll. Health ministery denies the minister said that. Also states that cases in which COVID-19 wasn't confirmed yet are classified as 'cases under investigation'. In that sense, they do not get countered on death toll

Brazilian Supreme Court denied order for army hospitals to treat COVID-19 patients. A decision in that sense was taken by a federal court, not the supreme court. Also, it determined that opening army hospitals for common population is a decision that has to come from governors and mayors, not from judiciary.
Video shows quarantined patients dancing in a COVID-19 center in Mumbai. The viral video is from the eastern state of Tripura. It is being falsely shared as being shot in Mumbai, Maharashtra.

Argentine President Alberto Fernández said that he respects distancing from people and that “all” his selfies are “one and a half meters away”. The Argentine President argued that “many times when I take selfies people think that I am surrounded by people; it is a projection problem ”. There are photos and a video in which the President does not respect the distance recommended by the World Health Organization (WHO) and the Ministry of Health of the Nation, and that it is not a problem of perspective of the photo.

A newspaper article stating that the Italian newspaper “Il Fatto Quotidiano” illicitly benefited from public fundings linked to COVID-19. The newspaper "Il Fatto Quotidiano" actually benefited from a special kind of loan regulated by the "Decreto liquidità", a law passed in response to the COVID-19 pandemic. However, it cannot be considered as "public fundings".

According to a statement appearing to be coming from WHO “There is no pandemic. The epidemic does not exist. No vaccine is needed. Healthy people do not need gloves, face masks and other protective equipment. There was no need for a lockdown and a curfew as well as the so-called contact tracing. The virus cannot survive on surfaces – such an isolation was only the demand of governments. Each and every organisation, fitness clubs, theatres, restaurants, cafes and bars can work at full capacity.” There was no such statement made by the WHO official. The statment was fabricated.

João Doria, governor of São Paulo, signed a contract with Sinovac to develop a vaccine against COVID-19 in August. Therefore, he knew all about the disease and is part of a Chinese conspiracy. Doria never said he signed a contract with Sinovac in 2019. What he actually said is that the partnership between Sinovac and the state government of São Paulo to test a COVID-19 vaccine, signed in June 2020, was only possible because a commercial representation was set up in Shanghai on August 2019.

A picture of the Italian Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte, allegedly taken at the “Stati Generali” conference organized in Rome during the Covid-19 pandemic. In the picture Conte is eating pizza while not respecting social distancing norms or any other safety measure The picture was taken in 2019, and it has nothing to do with COVID-19.

“If we stopped testing right now, we’d have very few cases, if any.” The swelling pandemic requires a more aggressive response than the White House has so far outlined. Halting testing wouldn’t eliminate COVID-19 cases. It would conceal them and could fuel an even greater crisis.

News stories referencing the number “322” and COVID-19 are proof cases tolls are being “synchronized”. The volume of media coverage and the number of local and regional government units around the world provide ample opportunities for cases or deaths to sum to any number. You can find this “connection” for any low three-digit number. A Google News search shows 322 isn’t even a particularly common tally.

“In a very real sense, (Oklahoma has) flattened the curve. … The number of cases in Oklahoma — it’s declined precipitously.” Oklahoma’s daily caseload has risen consistently in June, and to levels higher than at any point in the pandemic.
Schools will not open on September 1. In Ukraine, September 1 is the beginning of the school year. The claim is unsubstantiated. The government has not made such a decision.
The vaccine is not the final solution against the novel coronavirus. The vaccine can provide stable immunity, while the presence of antibodies does not prevent reinfection.

COVID-19 expenses reports have been set on fire in a Nuevo León building, Mexico. The treasurer of Nuevo León, Carlos Garza, reported that a building with information from the Nuevo León Undersecretariat of Revenue in Mexico had burned down but say that it was false that expense reports COVID-19 had been damaged.

Viral posts circulating in Africa claim Nobel Peace Prize winner Denis Mukwege resigned from the leadership of two COVID-19 task forces in DR Congo because he was told to manipulate patient numbers. The claim is false; Mukwege's resignation statement cited frustration at how the crisis was being managed, but nothing about fake patients. He has rejected the quotes attributed to him in the viral posts.

A Twitter post titled “Sakam da kazam”: “July 15 Elections Will Be Used for Vaccinating Voters Through the Project of Bill and Melinda Gates” Such news has never been published on the portal "Sakam da kazam", and the photo that manipulates the public is a rough photomontage. There is also a disclaimer about this from the portal's editor.
The Hague Tribunal has accepted a complaint against Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez for “genocide”. The Hague Tribunal has just registered the complaint.
Eating alkaline foods with high pH eliminates the coronavirus or prevents its spread. Alkaline foods neither protect from COVID-19 nor even alter the pH of the blood in any significant way.

Governor of São Paulo said he signed a contract with China for the production of a coronavirus vaccine in August 2019, which proves that the pandemic is a scam. The agreement between the government of São Paulo and China's Sinovac Biotech was signed on June 10 2020. In August 2019, the São Paulo government just opened a commercial office in Shanghai.

A video showing people in hospital beds on a street has been viewed thousands of times on Facebook alongside a claim it shows coronavirus patients who were moved outside a hospital in Pakistan because of an overflow of patients. The claim is false; the video in fact shows patients who were evacuated from a hospital in the Pakistani city of Lahore after a fire broke out.

Masks are useless, even harmful. The protection of the mask is not only about the wearer, but the aim is to prevent the spread. In addition, it is very difficult for medical and fabric masks recommended to be used by the general population to cause carbon dioxide poisoning.
There are reports circulating on social media that Bill Gates said that a new experimental mRNA vaccine could change patients’ DNA. There's no evidence that mRNA vaccines could alter DNA.

From the beginning of the coronavirus epidemic, it was clear that men were more severely affected than women. A subgroup with a particularly high risk now emerges: bald men. At least that is what Spanish researchers claim. On closer inspection, all the men in this study were older (60-plus on average) and we know nothing about their lifestyles or other conditions. This makes the conclusion misleading.
