Tata Digital Health is issuing a COVID-19 health kit that should be available in every household Tata digital health did not issue any notification regarding a COVID-19 kit.
Patients dancing in NSCI Quarantine center in Mumbai. Video is old and of a quarantine center in Tripura.
Maharashtra (India)’s CM Uddhav Thackeray announced reimplementation of lockdown. The viral video is an old one where Maharashtra's CM announced lockdown for the first time.

COVID-19 is disseminated intravascular coagulation, or pulmonary thrombosis, and ventilators and intensive care units (ICUs) were “never needed” in treating the disease because it can be fought with “antibiotics, anti-inflammatories and anticoagulants.” The disease is also caused by a bacteria that gets amplified by 5G technology. Thrombosis is only one possible effect of COVID. The drugs mentioned in the online posts were meant to address related infections in COVID-19 patients. The disease is viral and not bacterial in nature, and the claims about 5G having to do with the disease are unsupported.

“FREE HORSES!!!! 52 thoroughbred horses need homes. Will go to Sugarcreek this Sat. for slaughter. Gentleman died due to COVID-19 and his son wants nothing to do with them.” This is an outdated and misleadingly edited Facebook post that originated in 2011 after a longtime horse breeder died in Ohio.

“George Floyd’s ‘murder’ filmed before COVID-19.” George Floyd’s death wasn’t staged, and it wasn’t filmed before the coronavirus pandemic. He died on May 25 after a police officer pressed his knee against Floyd’s neck for nearly 9 minutes. Officers and bystanders can be seen wearing masks in video footage taken before Floyd’s death.

Brazailian parliament went to a hospital that should take in COVID19 patients and found it was empty. The original video shows a visit from a Brazilian parliament member to a hospital under construction that should have been used for COVID-19 patients and was delayed more than a month. The parliament member didn't criticize the government numbers or say anything about a conspiracy.

“Six months before the COVID ‘plandemic,’ Bill Gates had negotiated a $100 billion contact tracing deal with (the) Democratic congressman sponsor of bill.” There’s no evidence Gates worked with U.S. Rep. Bobby Rush on a $100 billion COVID-19 contact tracing bill months before the COVID-19 outbreak occurred. The bill proposed by Rush would give money not to Gates or his foundation but to organizations that provide COVID-19 testing, contact tracing or other services.

A post shared thousands of times on Facebook claims to show a map comparing the COVID-19 pandemic in the United States and Canada. This claim is misleading according to the map’s creators because it is comparing cumulative cases between countries with very different populations and population densities.

Tunisian dancer Nermine Safar is honored by the National Anti-Corruption Commission for its efforts to fight Covid-19. Misbar checked the story and found that the image was fabricated, as the name which appeared on the original certificate of appreciation, Moncef Al-Karimi, was deleted, and replaced by the name of Nermin Safar.

The decryption of the name “COVID-19” reveals the truth behind the pandemic. “CO” stands for control, “V” – for vaccine, “ID” – for identity. “1” means the first letter of the alphabet, and A stands for Artificial. 9 means the ninth letter of the alphabet, and I stands for Intelligence. To sum it up, it is about control over people with the help of digital identification, vaccines, and artificial intelligence. There is no evidence supporting this claim.

Health authorities like the World Health Organization and the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention discourage people from wearing face masks Health authorities like the World Health Organization and the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention now recommend that the public use face masks in shared spaces, like public transportation and grocery stores. This change in guidance occurred after several studies found that infected individuals can transmit COVID-19 even when not showing symptoms. Contrary to many viral claims, face masks do not cause oxygen deficiency or a toxic buildup of carbon dioxide. It is important to remember that cloth face masks, surgical masks, and even N95 respirators do not provide 100% protection from the novel coronavirus and therefore must be combined with other transmission control measures such as physical distancing and good hand hygiene.

Facebook is using your pictures and posts in lawsuits against it amid COVID-19 pandemic. The post claiming that amid COVID-19 pandemic, Facebook has changed its privacy rules, allowing it to use pictures and posts shared by users in lawsuits against them is fake.
Video shows COVID-19 patients lying dead on the ground in India. The video shows visuals from the Vizag gas plant leak where few people suffocated to death. It has no link to COVID-19.

A doctor at the SGRH hospital in New Delhi, India prescribed hydroxychloroquine tablet to prevent COVID-19 infection. The prescription is a fake one forging the handwriting, stamp and signature of the said doctor.

A purported government resolution has been shared in multiple Facebook posts in June 2020 claiming that the Philippine government has approved a motion to reimpose strict lockdown measures in Metro Manila, Cebu and Laguna. The claim is misleading and has been branded by the government as “fake news”; on June 15, authorities announced Metro Manila and Laguna would remain under its current, loosened lockdown restrictions until at least the end of June.

Philippines Vice President Leni Robredo questioned President Rodrigo Duterte’s imposition of a curfew in Metro Manila amid the COVID-19 pandemic. The post maliciously suggests there is disagreement between the two public officials over the imposition of a curfew. There are no official records or media stories on Robredo saying such a thing.

A picture showing Copacabana beach, in Brazil, full of crosses which make it look like a graveyard. The picture is real, but the beach was staged for a protest by a group of activists. The crosses do not mark real graves.

Image shows a policewoman who died of COVID-19 on the street, after she was refused a request to go home. According to the reconstruction of the events carried out by the government of Mexico City, the female police officer that appears in the image belongs to the Auxiliary Police of the SSC and operates in the Historic Center. She didn't die, she just suffered heat stroke.

Tunisian actress Sophia Sadiq died in Egypt, after she was infected with Covid-19. Misbar verified the news and it turned out to be false, as the Tunisian artist denied the news and told Radio Jawhara FM of Tunisia on Saturday 13 June that she is fine and in good health, and that what is being circulated is just rumors and false news.
“There is no pandemic. Terrorists Gates and Soros arranged the quarantine for world domination”. The new coronavirus pandemic is real. It was not prearranged.
Telangana (India) Minister Talasani Srinivas Yadav said lockdown will be extended. Telangana Minister Talasani Srinivas Yadav did not say that lockdown will be extended.
Mumbai’s KEM hospital prescribed list of medicines to self-medicate for COVID-19 The dean of the hospital said that the hospital did not issue any such statement on treating COVID-19
A message claims that ingredients in coffee can cure COVID-19 and that the deceased whistleblower Li Wenliang found its cure As of June 11, there was no cure for COVID-19

Social distancing is not being followed in Mumbai’s quarantine centers as quarantined patients are closely dancing with each other The video was shot in Tripura, in India, and not in the financial capital, Mumbai

A video shows that the governor of Pernambuco, Paulo Câmara, sent boxes containing alcohol gel and sand to the hospitals. The substance inside the boxes is not sand, but vermiculite. This is a recommendation from the National Civil Aviation Agency (ANAC) for transporting potentially flammable liquids in aircraft.The packages were sent from Brasilia to Rio Grande do Norte by the Ministry of Health.
Delhi public school selling face mask to students. Viral claim is false. DPS management denied this claim.
The list shows the medicines issued by a doctor in Gangaram (India) hospital to alleviate coronavirus symptoms. No, these medicines have not been prescribed by a doctor in Gangaram.

Photo of a man trying to ressurect his grandmother through mouth-to-mouth breathing. According to the caption, the photo was taken in Minas Gerais, Brazil. The photo is true and current, but it was taken in Mexico

H1N1 caused more deaths during the 2009 pandemic than COVID-19. Yet, nobody talked about it. Officially, 18 thousand deaths were confirmed during the H1N1 pandemic. Currently, more than 400 thousand deaths have been confirmed for COVID-19
Video shows the last COVID-19 patient exiting from the hospital in New Zealand. Video is, in fact, from Italy. It shows the closing down of a coronavirus ward in the town of Matera.

A photograph shows a baby breastfeeding on her dead mother who lost her life due to food scarcity during the lockdown. This is image is available since 2013 on the internet. It has being falsely shared as a recent Nationwide COVID-19 Lockdown.

Britain forbids sex between people who don’t live together. The British government has not introduced such a ban. The articles added to the existing law regulating quarantine measures do not contain a provision regarding sexual intercourse.

False positive result rate in PCR tests is 50 percent. PCR tests are one of the most reliable methods currently known. Also, there are not enough findings to conclude that PCR tests' false positive ratr is 50 percent.

Mouthwash prevents COVID19 Claiming that mouthwash can prevent you from becoming infected or preventing the transmission of the SARS-CoV-2 virus, because its components could inactivate the pathogen is misleading and can cause you to relax sanitary measures that do reduce the risk of contagion.

The text claims that there are 9 newly infected with coronavirus in Bitola. The official statistics published by the Ministry of Health do not state that newly infected people have been registered in Bitola in the 24 hours before publication.

A Facebook post that says that masks incubate cancer and that the risks of using them are hypoxia (lack of oxygen in the body) and hypercapnia (excess carbon dioxide), which could “cause poisoning in the flow blood, as well as physical and mental disorders.” Using a mask does not cause hypoxia or hypercapnia in healthy people, so it is not the origin of any other pathology.

A photo of the facade of the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation building that reads, in English, “Center for Global Human Population Reduction.” It is a hoax, the photo is a montage and in the building, which is in Seattle (USA), this phrase does not appear.

The photo of a beach with private and isolated compartments as if it were somewhere in the Algarve, the southern region of Portugal. In addition, it is related to security measures during de-escalation by the coronavirus. It is a hoax. The image is real but it is of a tourist complex that is located on the coast of Turkey and that already offered the cabins before the coronavirus crisis.

A video with a group of people cutting the bodies of various carcasses and vultures crowding around them to feed. In the text included in the video, the following is said: “This is what the media does not want you to know, in Asia they do not know what to do with so many deaths due to the coronavirus, they bury them, they burn them and now they give them to them feeding the vultures.” The video is neither current nor related to the coronavirus: it is from 2014 and shows a Tibetan funeral ritual.
Fewer than 100 people have died from COVID-19 in Ireland. Ireland's current death toll from COVID-19 stands at 1,703.

Lockdown policies are responsible for the high death rates in Spain, Belgium, Italy and France. This is the opposite: The high toll of deaths convinced several countries to choose lockdown as an emergency solution.

Last year, in China, a vaccine was compulsory and that vaccine supposedly hosts a digitized virus, is the one that causes COVID-19 and can be activated through 5G antennas. There is no evidence to support that the antennas of this telecommunications technology are linked to the COVID-19 pandemic. The WHO denied this theory and clarified that "viruses do not move through electromagnetic waves or mobile phone networks."

Ivermectin is the cure for COVID-19. Doctor supports the use of the drug to treat patients with COVID-19 but denies that it is the cure for the disease. Also, the person who's quoted said posts and bloggers exagerated what he had said about the drug.
Former Brazilian presidential candidate Fernando Haddad celebrates his birthday with a bunch of guests during the COVID-19 pandemic. Photo is from 2019.
The pandemic does not exist. Lockdown is pointless and harmful. The pandemic is real. Lockdown helped to curb the virus transmission.

Contact tracing apps have been secretly installed on every Android phone Contact tracing apps have not been secretly installed on all Android phones. A system known as exposure notifications have been developed by Google (and Apple) to support governments and health authorities who are developing contact tracing apps, but these are only activated if a contact tracing app is actually installed.

A post circulating on Facebook claims the latest research shows the mutation of COVID-19, D614G, makes the disease ten times more infectious. The claim came from American virologist William Haseltine's comment on the research of finding of D614G. The study itself doesn't prove if the mutation makes the COVID-19 more infectious.

Brazil’s health minister says cases with no confirmation of COVID-19 won’t be considered on death toll. Health ministery denies the minister said that. Also states that cases in which COVID-19 wasn't confirmed yet are classified as 'cases under investigation'. In that sense, they do not get countered on death toll

Brazilian Supreme Court denied order for army hospitals to treat COVID-19 patients. A decision in that sense was taken by a federal court, not the supreme court. Also, it determined that opening army hospitals for common population is a decision that has to come from governors and mayors, not from judiciary.
Video shows quarantined patients dancing in a COVID-19 center in Mumbai. The viral video is from the eastern state of Tripura. It is being falsely shared as being shot in Mumbai, Maharashtra.

Argentine President Alberto Fernández said that he respects distancing from people and that “all” his selfies are “one and a half meters away”. The Argentine President argued that “many times when I take selfies people think that I am surrounded by people; it is a projection problem ”. There are photos and a video in which the President does not respect the distance recommended by the World Health Organization (WHO) and the Ministry of Health of the Nation, and that it is not a problem of perspective of the photo.

A newspaper article stating that the Italian newspaper “Il Fatto Quotidiano” illicitly benefited from public fundings linked to COVID-19. The newspaper "Il Fatto Quotidiano" actually benefited from a special kind of loan regulated by the "Decreto liquidità", a law passed in response to the COVID-19 pandemic. However, it cannot be considered as "public fundings".

According to a statement appearing to be coming from WHO “There is no pandemic. The epidemic does not exist. No vaccine is needed. Healthy people do not need gloves, face masks and other protective equipment. There was no need for a lockdown and a curfew as well as the so-called contact tracing. The virus cannot survive on surfaces – such an isolation was only the demand of governments. Each and every organisation, fitness clubs, theatres, restaurants, cafes and bars can work at full capacity.” There was no such statement made by the WHO official. The statment was fabricated.

João Doria, governor of São Paulo, signed a contract with Sinovac to develop a vaccine against COVID-19 in August. Therefore, he knew all about the disease and is part of a Chinese conspiracy. Doria never said he signed a contract with Sinovac in 2019. What he actually said is that the partnership between Sinovac and the state government of São Paulo to test a COVID-19 vaccine, signed in June 2020, was only possible because a commercial representation was set up in Shanghai on August 2019.

A picture of the Italian Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte, allegedly taken at the “Stati Generali” conference organized in Rome during the Covid-19 pandemic. In the picture Conte is eating pizza while not respecting social distancing norms or any other safety measure The picture was taken in 2019, and it has nothing to do with COVID-19.

“If we stopped testing right now, we’d have very few cases, if any.” The swelling pandemic requires a more aggressive response than the White House has so far outlined. Halting testing wouldn’t eliminate COVID-19 cases. It would conceal them and could fuel an even greater crisis.

News stories referencing the number “322” and COVID-19 are proof cases tolls are being “synchronized”. The volume of media coverage and the number of local and regional government units around the world provide ample opportunities for cases or deaths to sum to any number. You can find this “connection” for any low three-digit number. A Google News search shows 322 isn’t even a particularly common tally.

“In a very real sense, (Oklahoma has) flattened the curve. … The number of cases in Oklahoma — it’s declined precipitously.” Oklahoma’s daily caseload has risen consistently in June, and to levels higher than at any point in the pandemic.
Schools will not open on September 1. In Ukraine, September 1 is the beginning of the school year. The claim is unsubstantiated. The government has not made such a decision.
The vaccine is not the final solution against the novel coronavirus. The vaccine can provide stable immunity, while the presence of antibodies does not prevent reinfection.

COVID-19 expenses reports have been set on fire in a Nuevo León building, Mexico. The treasurer of Nuevo León, Carlos Garza, reported that a building with information from the Nuevo León Undersecretariat of Revenue in Mexico had burned down but say that it was false that expense reports COVID-19 had been damaged.

Viral posts circulating in Africa claim Nobel Peace Prize winner Denis Mukwege resigned from the leadership of two COVID-19 task forces in DR Congo because he was told to manipulate patient numbers. The claim is false; Mukwege's resignation statement cited frustration at how the crisis was being managed, but nothing about fake patients. He has rejected the quotes attributed to him in the viral posts.

A Twitter post titled “Sakam da kazam”: “July 15 Elections Will Be Used for Vaccinating Voters Through the Project of Bill and Melinda Gates” Such news has never been published on the portal "Sakam da kazam", and the photo that manipulates the public is a rough photomontage. There is also a disclaimer about this from the portal's editor.
The Hague Tribunal has accepted a complaint against Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez for “genocide”. The Hague Tribunal has just registered the complaint.
Eating alkaline foods with high pH eliminates the coronavirus or prevents its spread. Alkaline foods neither protect from COVID-19 nor even alter the pH of the blood in any significant way.

Governor of São Paulo said he signed a contract with China for the production of a coronavirus vaccine in August 2019, which proves that the pandemic is a scam. The agreement between the government of São Paulo and China's Sinovac Biotech was signed on June 10 2020. In August 2019, the São Paulo government just opened a commercial office in Shanghai.

A video showing people in hospital beds on a street has been viewed thousands of times on Facebook alongside a claim it shows coronavirus patients who were moved outside a hospital in Pakistan because of an overflow of patients. The claim is false; the video in fact shows patients who were evacuated from a hospital in the Pakistani city of Lahore after a fire broke out.

Multiple posts shared thousands of times on Facebook in Nigeria claim to be giving out smartphones to help students attend online classes during the novel coronavirus pandemic. However, this is one of a growing number of scams aimed at increasing followers of social media pages and accounts.

Masks are useless, even harmful. The protection of the mask is not only about the wearer, but the aim is to prevent the spread. In addition, it is very difficult for medical and fabric masks recommended to be used by the general population to cause carbon dioxide poisoning.
There are reports circulating on social media that Bill Gates said that a new experimental mRNA vaccine could change patients’ DNA. There's no evidence that mRNA vaccines could alter DNA.

From the beginning of the coronavirus epidemic, it was clear that men were more severely affected than women. A subgroup with a particularly high risk now emerges: bald men. At least that is what Spanish researchers claim. On closer inspection, all the men in this study were older (60-plus on average) and we know nothing about their lifestyles or other conditions. This makes the conclusion misleading.
Tata Digital Health is issuing a COVID-19 health kit that should be available in every household Tata digital health did not issue any notification regarding a COVID-19 kit.
Patients dancing in NSCI Quarantine center in Mumbai. Video is old and of a quarantine center in Tripura.
Maharashtra (India)’s CM Uddhav Thackeray announced reimplementation of lockdown. The viral video is an old one where Maharashtra's CM announced lockdown for the first time.

COVID-19 is disseminated intravascular coagulation, or pulmonary thrombosis, and ventilators and intensive care units (ICUs) were “never needed” in treating the disease because it can be fought with “antibiotics, anti-inflammatories and anticoagulants.” The disease is also caused by a bacteria that gets amplified by 5G technology. Thrombosis is only one possible effect of COVID. The drugs mentioned in the online posts were meant to address related infections in COVID-19 patients. The disease is viral and not bacterial in nature, and the claims about 5G having to do with the disease are unsupported.

“FREE HORSES!!!! 52 thoroughbred horses need homes. Will go to Sugarcreek this Sat. for slaughter. Gentleman died due to COVID-19 and his son wants nothing to do with them.” This is an outdated and misleadingly edited Facebook post that originated in 2011 after a longtime horse breeder died in Ohio.

“George Floyd’s ‘murder’ filmed before COVID-19.” George Floyd’s death wasn’t staged, and it wasn’t filmed before the coronavirus pandemic. He died on May 25 after a police officer pressed his knee against Floyd’s neck for nearly 9 minutes. Officers and bystanders can be seen wearing masks in video footage taken before Floyd’s death.

Brazailian parliament went to a hospital that should take in COVID19 patients and found it was empty. The original video shows a visit from a Brazilian parliament member to a hospital under construction that should have been used for COVID-19 patients and was delayed more than a month. The parliament member didn't criticize the government numbers or say anything about a conspiracy.

“Six months before the COVID ‘plandemic,’ Bill Gates had negotiated a $100 billion contact tracing deal with (the) Democratic congressman sponsor of bill.” There’s no evidence Gates worked with U.S. Rep. Bobby Rush on a $100 billion COVID-19 contact tracing bill months before the COVID-19 outbreak occurred. The bill proposed by Rush would give money not to Gates or his foundation but to organizations that provide COVID-19 testing, contact tracing or other services.

A post shared thousands of times on Facebook claims to show a map comparing the COVID-19 pandemic in the United States and Canada. This claim is misleading according to the map’s creators because it is comparing cumulative cases between countries with very different populations and population densities.

Tunisian dancer Nermine Safar is honored by the National Anti-Corruption Commission for its efforts to fight Covid-19. Misbar checked the story and found that the image was fabricated, as the name which appeared on the original certificate of appreciation, Moncef Al-Karimi, was deleted, and replaced by the name of Nermin Safar.

The decryption of the name “COVID-19” reveals the truth behind the pandemic. “CO” stands for control, “V” – for vaccine, “ID” – for identity. “1” means the first letter of the alphabet, and A stands for Artificial. 9 means the ninth letter of the alphabet, and I stands for Intelligence. To sum it up, it is about control over people with the help of digital identification, vaccines, and artificial intelligence. There is no evidence supporting this claim.

Health authorities like the World Health Organization and the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention discourage people from wearing face masks Health authorities like the World Health Organization and the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention now recommend that the public use face masks in shared spaces, like public transportation and grocery stores. This change in guidance occurred after several studies found that infected individuals can transmit COVID-19 even when not showing symptoms. Contrary to many viral claims, face masks do not cause oxygen deficiency or a toxic buildup of carbon dioxide. It is important to remember that cloth face masks, surgical masks, and even N95 respirators do not provide 100% protection from the novel coronavirus and therefore must be combined with other transmission control measures such as physical distancing and good hand hygiene.

Facebook is using your pictures and posts in lawsuits against it amid COVID-19 pandemic. The post claiming that amid COVID-19 pandemic, Facebook has changed its privacy rules, allowing it to use pictures and posts shared by users in lawsuits against them is fake.
Video shows COVID-19 patients lying dead on the ground in India. The video shows visuals from the Vizag gas plant leak where few people suffocated to death. It has no link to COVID-19.

A doctor at the SGRH hospital in New Delhi, India prescribed hydroxychloroquine tablet to prevent COVID-19 infection. The prescription is a fake one forging the handwriting, stamp and signature of the said doctor.

A purported government resolution has been shared in multiple Facebook posts in June 2020 claiming that the Philippine government has approved a motion to reimpose strict lockdown measures in Metro Manila, Cebu and Laguna. The claim is misleading and has been branded by the government as “fake news”; on June 15, authorities announced Metro Manila and Laguna would remain under its current, loosened lockdown restrictions until at least the end of June.

Philippines Vice President Leni Robredo questioned President Rodrigo Duterte’s imposition of a curfew in Metro Manila amid the COVID-19 pandemic. The post maliciously suggests there is disagreement between the two public officials over the imposition of a curfew. There are no official records or media stories on Robredo saying such a thing.

A picture showing Copacabana beach, in Brazil, full of crosses which make it look like a graveyard. The picture is real, but the beach was staged for a protest by a group of activists. The crosses do not mark real graves.

Image shows a policewoman who died of COVID-19 on the street, after she was refused a request to go home. According to the reconstruction of the events carried out by the government of Mexico City, the female police officer that appears in the image belongs to the Auxiliary Police of the SSC and operates in the Historic Center. She didn't die, she just suffered heat stroke.

Tunisian actress Sophia Sadiq died in Egypt, after she was infected with Covid-19. Misbar verified the news and it turned out to be false, as the Tunisian artist denied the news and told Radio Jawhara FM of Tunisia on Saturday 13 June that she is fine and in good health, and that what is being circulated is just rumors and false news.
“There is no pandemic. Terrorists Gates and Soros arranged the quarantine for world domination”. The new coronavirus pandemic is real. It was not prearranged.
Telangana (India) Minister Talasani Srinivas Yadav said lockdown will be extended. Telangana Minister Talasani Srinivas Yadav did not say that lockdown will be extended.
Mumbai’s KEM hospital prescribed list of medicines to self-medicate for COVID-19 The dean of the hospital said that the hospital did not issue any such statement on treating COVID-19
A message claims that ingredients in coffee can cure COVID-19 and that the deceased whistleblower Li Wenliang found its cure As of June 11, there was no cure for COVID-19

Social distancing is not being followed in Mumbai’s quarantine centers as quarantined patients are closely dancing with each other The video was shot in Tripura, in India, and not in the financial capital, Mumbai

A video shows that the governor of Pernambuco, Paulo Câmara, sent boxes containing alcohol gel and sand to the hospitals. The substance inside the boxes is not sand, but vermiculite. This is a recommendation from the National Civil Aviation Agency (ANAC) for transporting potentially flammable liquids in aircraft.The packages were sent from Brasilia to Rio Grande do Norte by the Ministry of Health.

Covid-19 is the first step in turning the population into a “submissive flock.” Since pandemic is not man-made, any statement implying the opposite is false. This one, in particular, relates to conspiracy theories.
Delhi public school selling face mask to students. Viral claim is false. DPS management denied this claim.
The list shows the medicines issued by a doctor in Gangaram (India) hospital to alleviate coronavirus symptoms. No, these medicines have not been prescribed by a doctor in Gangaram.

Photo of a man trying to ressurect his grandmother through mouth-to-mouth breathing. According to the caption, the photo was taken in Minas Gerais, Brazil. The photo is true and current, but it was taken in Mexico

H1N1 caused more deaths during the 2009 pandemic than COVID-19. Yet, nobody talked about it. Officially, 18 thousand deaths were confirmed during the H1N1 pandemic. Currently, more than 400 thousand deaths have been confirmed for COVID-19
Video shows the last COVID-19 patient exiting from the hospital in New Zealand. Video is, in fact, from Italy. It shows the closing down of a coronavirus ward in the town of Matera.

A photograph shows a baby breastfeeding on her dead mother who lost her life due to food scarcity during the lockdown. This is image is available since 2013 on the internet. It has being falsely shared as a recent Nationwide COVID-19 Lockdown.

Britain forbids sex between people who don’t live together. The British government has not introduced such a ban. The articles added to the existing law regulating quarantine measures do not contain a provision regarding sexual intercourse.

False positive result rate in PCR tests is 50 percent. PCR tests are one of the most reliable methods currently known. Also, there are not enough findings to conclude that PCR tests' false positive ratr is 50 percent.

Mouthwash prevents COVID19 Claiming that mouthwash can prevent you from becoming infected or preventing the transmission of the SARS-CoV-2 virus, because its components could inactivate the pathogen is misleading and can cause you to relax sanitary measures that do reduce the risk of contagion.

The text claims that there are 9 newly infected with coronavirus in Bitola. The official statistics published by the Ministry of Health do not state that newly infected people have been registered in Bitola in the 24 hours before publication.

A Facebook post that says that masks incubate cancer and that the risks of using them are hypoxia (lack of oxygen in the body) and hypercapnia (excess carbon dioxide), which could “cause poisoning in the flow blood, as well as physical and mental disorders.” Using a mask does not cause hypoxia or hypercapnia in healthy people, so it is not the origin of any other pathology.

A photo of the facade of the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation building that reads, in English, “Center for Global Human Population Reduction.” It is a hoax, the photo is a montage and in the building, which is in Seattle (USA), this phrase does not appear.

The photo of a beach with private and isolated compartments as if it were somewhere in the Algarve, the southern region of Portugal. In addition, it is related to security measures during de-escalation by the coronavirus. It is a hoax. The image is real but it is of a tourist complex that is located on the coast of Turkey and that already offered the cabins before the coronavirus crisis.

A video with a group of people cutting the bodies of various carcasses and vultures crowding around them to feed. In the text included in the video, the following is said: “This is what the media does not want you to know, in Asia they do not know what to do with so many deaths due to the coronavirus, they bury them, they burn them and now they give them to them feeding the vultures.” The video is neither current nor related to the coronavirus: it is from 2014 and shows a Tibetan funeral ritual.
Fewer than 100 people have died from COVID-19 in Ireland. Ireland's current death toll from COVID-19 stands at 1,703.

Lockdown policies are responsible for the high death rates in Spain, Belgium, Italy and France. This is the opposite: The high toll of deaths convinced several countries to choose lockdown as an emergency solution.

Last year, in China, a vaccine was compulsory and that vaccine supposedly hosts a digitized virus, is the one that causes COVID-19 and can be activated through 5G antennas. There is no evidence to support that the antennas of this telecommunications technology are linked to the COVID-19 pandemic. The WHO denied this theory and clarified that "viruses do not move through electromagnetic waves or mobile phone networks."

Ivermectin is the cure for COVID-19. Doctor supports the use of the drug to treat patients with COVID-19 but denies that it is the cure for the disease. Also, the person who's quoted said posts and bloggers exagerated what he had said about the drug.
Former Brazilian presidential candidate Fernando Haddad celebrates his birthday with a bunch of guests during the COVID-19 pandemic. Photo is from 2019.

A graphic of Zee News TV channels claims that the Home Ministry of India has hinted at a complete lockdown in the country after 15 June. Railway and airway will come to a halt. The grpahic is morphed. The Home Ministry has not hinted at a complete lockdown and TV channel Zee News has not show any such news.
Two persons with coronavirus escaped from a hospital in Bogota. This image shows two famous youtubers, not two coronavirus patients.
The WHO banned autopsies and Italy changed the protocols for the coronavirus. WHO could not ban autopsies and Italy has not changed the protocols for the virus.
Indian boy predicted the coronavirus in 2019. Although the boy did speak of future disasters, he never mentioned the coronavirus or a pandemic.

Government of Colombia launched a survey on social media called “Return to face-to-face classes in schools and universities”. The Ministry of Education denied that the chain, which circulates on WhatsApp and Facebook, had originated from the entity, and recommended consulting the official channels.

Under the influence of hot weather, i.e., high air temperature, the number of patients with coronavirus was supposed to decrease. The novel coronavirus, if it even exists, dies under the high temperature. Hot weather does not affect the number of patients with COVID-19 or the survival of the novel coronavirus.

There are only 2 people infected with COVID-19 in clinic 2 of the IMSS in Monterrey, Nuevo León, Mexico. IMSS authorities, after monitoring hospital 2 in Monterrey, reported on June 14: 66 cases of health personnel with COVID-19 since the pandemic began, of which 35 were still active.

A video that appears to show a woman being attacked has been viewed tens of thousands of times in multiple YouTube posts and on various websites alongside a claim the footage shows a COVID-19 frontline nurse who was raped and stabbed to death. The claim is false; the footage was in fact taken from a sexual harassment awareness campaign video in India that circulated online years before the coronavirus pandemic.

Project approved by the brazilian Chamber of Deputies requires the use of masks inside homes. In fact, the text of the law project states that the obligation only applies to public spaces or private places accessible to the public (such as shops and churches).

A video has been viewed hundreds of thousands of times in multiple posts on Facebook, Twitter and YouTube alongside a claim it shows an Islamic call to prayer in Berlin after black clouds appeared in the sky. The posts claim the call was heard despite there being “no mosque” in the area. The claim is false; the video shows a call to prayer that was broadcast by a mosque in Berlin; the call was staged as a nearby church rang its bell in April 2020 as a sign of unity during the coronavirus pandemic.

Director of WHO is dancing in a night club in violation of COVID19 guidelines. The video shows another man not the director of WHO and was published as a meme by the original publisher, after tracking the video it was shot before the quarantine of COVID-19.

A photo of a handwritten letter which shows an Indian hospital’s letterhead has been shared in multiple Facebook, Twitter and WhatsApp posts alongside a claim that it is a genuine prescription issued by a doctor at the hospital for a COVID-19 patient. The claim is misleading; the hospital denied that the prescription was issued by one of their doctors and said the signature was forged.

A picture titled “The American Spring, People Revolt Against Trump, The Question Comes to Mind Where Coronavirus Has Gone?” Misbar verified the story and found the allegation to be misleading. The image is from hundreds of thousands of people gathered in the US capital, Washington, in March 2018.

Singer Mohamed Abdo has been infected with the novel coronavirus, and isolates himself in a hotel in Jeddah. Misbar checked the news, and found it to be false. The artist appeared on Al-Arabiya channel hours ago, confirming that his result was negative, and that the video circulated was during his return from abroad, and he went to one of the hotels that the Kingdom chose to perform examinations and health isolation, where he conducted a test COVID-19 before meeting his family.
Dexametazone could cure severe ill COVID-19 patients. That drug is still in clinical trials as of publication.

Gov. of Wisconsin Tony Evers “removed the American flag from the Capitol building”. The picture presented as proof was from a rally in support of reopening Wisconsin on April 24, 2020. Like most protests, that occurred on the West side of the building, where the flagpole atop the entrance is controlled by the state Assembly. The Assembly only flies the U.S. flag there when in session, and they weren’t that day. The additional detail about Evers ordering a flag to be removed is nonsense.

A purported screenshot of an Australian Department of Health webpage has been shared repeatedly on Facebook alongside a claim it is evidence that COVID-19 tests “cannot distinguish covid from a cold or measles or ebola”. The claim is misleading; Australian health authorities told AFP the image contains “selectively chosen information taken out of context”, and clarified that tests designed for SARS-CoV-2, the new coronavirus that causes the disease COVID-19, would not detect any other kinds of pathogens.
German doctors called the pandemic fake. The author refers to the personal opinion of one of the German officials, not to the results of the study.
Vaccines, chips, and 5G are interconnected and needed to establish control over people The statement is not proven.
“There is no coronavirus pandemic, there is only an epidemic of coronavirus tests” – David Crowe The new coronavirus pandemic is real. It is not the result of mass testing.

Quarantine has only worsened the situation, vaccination against coronavirus is pointless and harmful, says infectious disease specialist Nadiia Zholobak. Nadiia Zholobak has never made such a statement.
COVID patients playing cricket, dancing to ‘Lungi dance’ in Gachibowli stadium in India. The videos shared belong to different quarantine wards in India, not Gachibowli Hyderabad.

Taiwan Education Ministry has budgeted a relief package that included sending of up to 9000 New Taiwan dollars to every college student. Taiwan Education Ministry's relief package is only proposed to students who are facing difficulties. Not all college students.
Doctor from Delhi hospital prescribes a list of preventive medicines against COVID-19 The hospital refuted the claim and said the doctor's signature was forged.

People who arrived at Tirur, Kerala (India) from Mumbai in train, escaped from the sight of the authorities to avoid quarantine. The Tirur Municipality has refuted the news and have also filed a case against the perpetrators of this false information.

Claims from Spanish singer Miguel Bosé on the Bill and Melinda Gates foundation, that he made last Tuesday, June 9 through a Twitter thread on his personal account. The Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation has not been expelled from India and neither has the GAVI Alliance, of which the Foundation is one of its main partners. Also, the singer's allegations about vaccines are false.

Images of a man dressed in a hospital gown who seems to run away jumping a wall of the building. According to the caption, this man reported that he had gone to the health center to heal a wound in his hand when they assured him that he should be admitted for COVID-19 and that when “they were going to connect a ventilator, he decided to jump from the second floor and escape”. It is a hoax. The images are from November 2019, when the new coronavirus had not yet been discovered and the man is actually an alleged inmate trying to escape from a Mexico City hospital.

Spanish singer Miguel Bosé accused Gates Foundation to be expelled from India for their vaccines. Gates Foundation still works in India. Bosé based in a IG publication of a critiziced study from 10 years ago
A police officer in Bhagalpur Jail, India contracted coronavirus. This is an old video of a mockdrill in Bhagalpur jail which viral in the name of a coronavirus patient.
Indian Health Minister is playing a game during the COVID-19 pandemic. The picture of health minister playing game has no related with coronavirus, the picture is one year old.
Zee News claims that lockdown will apply again from 15 June in India. Zee News Editor denied this claim. Viral breaking news chyron is fake and the claim is also false.

Bill Gates faces trial in India for illegally testing vaccines. The recurrent hoax is that the co-founder of Microsoft and the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation illegally tested drugs with "devastating results" in the health of 30,000 children. This is false. On the contrary, the Prime Minister of India publicly expressed his gratitude to that foundation for the work related to health in that country.

Prominant National news channel (Zee News) newscard stating Lockdown will be extended again from June 15th, 2020. The newscard is a morphed one. The channel and government officials have confirmed the statement to be fake.

Spiritual leader cuts off tongue of a young girl as an act of sacrifice to ward off COVID in Banda, Uttar Pradesh, India. The girl herself cut off her tongue believing that it would ward off the threat of COVID-19 from her village, there is no communal angle to this incident.
Image of patients lying on rope-beds out in the open in a COVID-19 isolation ward in Pakistan. The viral image is available on the internet since 2018. It has nothing to do with COVID-19.

A TV news screenshot says the home ministry of India has indicated that the country will be under lockdown after 15 June. The government of India has clarified this is false news. There is no such decision has been taken.
Image claiming to be Sri Lankan Soldiers and Police having their meals on the streets during COVID-19 pandemic. Image shows Indian Police and Army personnel sharing their meals on a street.

A message stating that temperature checks can be dangerous for the eyes. There is no evidence that this is the case or that it is necessary to cover your eyes when your temperature is checked this way.

Irish Prime Minister Leo Varadkar is going to the Supreme Court to make the coronavirus vaccine mandatory for all people living in Ireland. A vaccine for COVID-19 does not yet exist and there is no way for Leo Varadkar to go to the Supreme Court on this issue.
São Paulo’s governor, João Doria, admits deaths caused by COVID-19 are recorded twice. This rumour was invented - the governor never said that.

OMS says people infected with COVID-19 without symptons do not transmit the disease. Interview with Maria Van Kerkhove, OMS technique director, was misunderstood. She said they don't know yet how COVID-19 is transmitted from people without symptons. She said studies about it are rare, but it was understood that transmition from people without symptons was rare. OMS came one day after to state clearly that people with no symptons sure can transmite the disease.
Video shows man holding bodies in sacks with only one hand. Video shows the making of a protest. Sacks were not filled with dead bodies from patients with COVID-19.

Brahmins (a Higher Indian Caste) chopped off a girl’s tongue as an offering to God to prevent COVID-19 infection. The incident is not related with Brahmins or caste system . The girl herself chopped off her own tongue as an offering to prevent COVID-19.

“Corona Virus claims a black belt. Chuck Norris, Dead at 80.” Chuck Norris felled by a tiny virus? Don’t believe it. Actor Chuck Norris is alive and well despite a hoax circulating on Facebook about his death. Multiple fact-checking outlets debunked the claim that Norris died of the coronavirus. Norris has been the subject of celebrity death hoaxes in the past.

The image shows COVID-19 patients and the state of coronavirus isolation ward in Pakistan. The image showing two people lying on one bed is from Pakistan but is doing the rounds of internet since 2018 i.e. before the coronavirus outbreak.
The laser of non-contact thermometers, which are used in public spaces during the coronavirus pandemic, affect the retina. The laser do not represent a danger to the eyes and retina.

“The ‘biological’ lab in Wuhan where the COVID-19 virus was created was ‘funded’ by President Barak Hussein Obama in 2015 to the tune of $3,800,000 American dollars. The money referenced was actually provided to a U.S. research group. Only $600,000 went to the lab as part of a U.S.-approved collaboration.

A Facebook post shared more than 25,000 times says face masks should only be worn by medical professionals or people who have become ill during the coronavirus pandemic. This is misleading; the World Health Organization guidance cited in the post is out of date, and US health authorities have long recommended that the general public wear masks.

Speaking about the danger of developing a COVID-19 vaccine without animal testing, lawyer and environmentalist Robert Kennedy Jr. said a dengue vaccine developed by the U.S. National Institutes of Health (NIH) was administered on children in the Philippines, making them more sick and even causing deaths. It was not an NIH-made dengue vaccine but Dengvaxia, produced by the French pharmaceutical company Sanofi Pasteur.

“The CDC just confirmed a 0.2% death-rate for COVID19.” The CDC has not “confirmed” any mortality rate for COVID-19. The Facebook posts draw on the low-end of a range of estimates the CDC published in May saying the fatality rate for those showing symptoms was between 0.2% and 1%, with a "best estimate" of 0.4%. The estimated overall mortality rate of those with and without symptoms would be 0.26%. Several health experts said they project the mortality rate is on the higher-end of the CDC’s estimated range, closer to 1%, which is 10 times more lethal than the seasonal flu.

WHO states new coronavirus does not spread via the asymptomatic carriers. Dr. Maria Van Kerkhove, COVID-19 Technical Lead at WHO, stated that “It still appears to be rare that an asymptomatic individual actually transmits onward.” A day later, she clarified, “I used the phrase ‘very rare’ and I think that it’s a misunderstanding to state the asymptomatic transmission globally is very rare. What I was referring to was a subset of studies. I was also referring to some data that isn’t published.” The misunderstanding caused a wave of manipulations even after the statement has been clarified.

Nuevo León has the lowest death rate in Mexico from COVID-19. The Nuevo León Secretary of Health, Manuel de la O, only takes data from the Mexican Epidemiology Directorate, without taking into account that at the local level the state has other figures that differ. In addition, the Mexican federal government updates COVID-19 deaths of up to more than a week in advance, so reports are constantly changing.

Facebook posts claiming to show vintage photographs taken during the Spanish flu pandemic more than 100 years ago have been shared thousands of times in Africa, Asia and the United States. While most of the images do depict life in various parts of the world during the pandemic, some are unrelated to the event and either were taken years earlier or later.

Existence of a vaccination summit may be a sign that vaccination will become mandatory in “third world countries”. Coronavirus vaccine will be tested on African population and then on the white population in third world countries in a mandatory order. This story about mandatory vaccination is manipulative and is aimed at sowing fear. Volunteers from 102 countries are involved in COVID-19 vaccine trials, whereas there are no regulations on mandatory vaccination amid clinical trials.
The video of doctors singing “Resistiré” with guitar and face masks happened in Mexico. This musical episode happened in a Spanish hospital.

The World Health Organization (WHO) concludes that a Covid-19 carrier is not contagious until symptoms of infection appear on them. Misbar verified the claim and found it misleading. Van Kirchhoff explained that her speech in the press briefing on June 8 about the scarcity of coronavirus transmission from a person who did not show symptoms of infection was understood incorrectly, and that it was not officially declared in the name of the World Health Organization.

The German government reopens its airspace and excludes all Arab countries from the procedure, except for Tunisia. Misbar checked the news that was circulated and found to be false, as Germany did not announce the reopening of its airspace with any Arab country, but decided on June 3 to cancel travel warnings on 29 European countries beginning in the middle of the month.

Claim that Sarah Huckabee Sanders tweeted, “It’s ‘odd’ that the ANTIFA insurgency happened just as COVID-19 loses steam It’s ‘odd’ that COVID-19 happened the moment impeachment failed. It’s ‘odd’ that impeachment happened the moment Russian hoax failed. The Russian hoax happened because Hillary lost? Notice the pattern?” Sarah Huckabee Sanders didn’t tweet this conspiracy theory, but an account using her photo did.
Using cypress and eucalyptus vapor as a treatment against COVID-19 works. Using cypress and eucalyptus vapor as a treatment against COVID-19 has no scientific basis.
BJP leader shares fake ads of Japanese novelist saying COVID-19 is man-made The statement was falsely attributed to a Japanese scientist.
Baking soda destroys SARS-CoV-2 by dissolving its lipid shell. There is no evidence that baking soda can dissolve the coronavirus lipid shell or treat the coronavirus disease.
Tanzania has developed a coronavirus drug called COVIDOL that can cure COVID-19. Tanzania Ministry of Health denied approving the remedy and warned against the use of untested remedies.

World Health Organization announcing that COVID-19 is losing its potency. The WHO said it has not published such information, maintaining that COVID-19 is still a lethal disease and that there is no evidence suggesting that it has become less potent.

Hot steam and tea cure coronavirus. The post claiming hot steam and tea cure coronavirus is fake. The normal human body temperature remains around 36.5°C to 37°C, regardless of the external temperature or weather or the steam you breathe.
There will be complete lockdown on June 15th in India. Zee News did not make any such claim regarding lockdown, this viral post is fake.

PCR tests were conducted on a journalist and his crew who attended late Minister Thondaman’s funeral as they had COVID-19 symptoms. PCR tests were conducted since the journalists had breathing difficulty hence as a precautionary measure as per the health officials and not on suspicion of COVID-19 infection. PCR tests were negative.

Dr Eliyantha White had developed a special medicine for COVID-19 and was planning to use it on Sri Lankan Navy personnel with the approval of the Prime Minister. Sri Lanka Navy confirmed they were not testing any medicine other than the recommended treatments given by the health officials from the Epidemiology unit, Ministry of Health. Prime Minister’s office also refuted the claim.

Images and texts that assure that the vice-president of the Spanish government, Pablo Iglesias, assumed the responsibilities of the nursing homes after the declaration of the state of alarm for the coronavirus. It is a hoax. The competition over residences did not pass into the hands of the Ministry of Churches; continues to be from the autonomous communities.
An image of a man that measures the fever with his hand in Quilmes, Argentina. Using a reverse Google image search, it was verified that the image was first published on June 1 in Malaysia as a meme.

An audio that claims that a group of criminals disguised as doctors robbed 3 houses in Flores, Argentina. According to the recording, the thieves presented themselves with the excuse of doing COVID-19 tests and there were 3 cases in that Buenos Aires neighborhood, but this was denied by the Ministry of Security of the City of Buenos Aires (Argentina).

A video of an Indian boy who predicted the coronavirus in 2019. Various media in Argentina published in the last week a supposed prediction of the COVID-19 of Abhigya Anand, a child astrologer from India, made in August 2019. The video does not mention the coronavirus or a pandemic. There is only talk of "generalized diseases around the world" and that, if it does not occur in the world, it will occur "especially in India", although events that did not occur such as wars between the United States and Iran, and between India and Pakistan, and even a Third World War.

Facebook posts circulating in Africa claim France has announced a ban on Africans travelling to Europe if they refuse “the European vaccine” for COVID-19. France’s foreign ministry rejected the claims and AFP Fact Check found no trace of such an announcement.
Pigeon feces slurry can cure coronavirus. No report suggests that pigeon feces slurry can cure coronavirus; viral claim is fake.

The Brazilian National Congress approved a law which demands you to wear maks inside your house during the COVID-19 pandemic. Police officers will be allowed to enter your house to verify if you’re wearing a mask or not. The bill approved by the Congress demands people to wear masks only in public spaces or privately-owned public areas (like stores, restaurants or cinemas). It does not include personal homes
The video allegedly predicted what would happen in 2020 beforehand. The video is about the political agenda of 2014. The epidemic in the video is Ebola, and the protests show Ferguson protests.

A video has been viewed thousands of times in multiple posts on Facebook and YouTube alongside a claim it shows that Jakarta Governor Anies Baswedan received an international award for “the best governor” in handling the novel coronavirus pandemic. The claim is misleading; the clip shows the governor taking part in a global online summit with other city leaders from around the world about responses to the COVID-19 crisis.
Asymptomatic people are very rarely contagious, said the WHO. While an executive from the WHO did say that, she retracted just the day after and said it was a misunderstanding.

Homeopathic doctor in Colombia gives out a prescription that according to him cures the coronavirus. Raúl Salazar published a video in which he recommended self-medication with anticoagulants, steroids and antibiotics to cure himself of the coronavirus. Authorities warn that self-medication is a health risk.

Spanish musician Miguel Bosé posted a Twitter thread pointing to the expulsion of the Gates Foundation and GAVI ‘pharmaceutical’ from India, polio and HPV vaccines and the implementation of a microchip vaccine. None of the allegations that Miguel Bosé posted in a Twitter thread about the expulsion of the Gates Foundation and GAVI ‘pharmaceutical ’from India, polio and HPV vaccines, and the implementation of microchip vaccines are supported.

An overseas Filipino worker (OFW) positive for the coronavirus was raped by her employer’s pet camel in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia, according to multiple website links shared on Facebook. The video embedded in the webpages is a doctored clip. The original report from GMA News was about an OFW raped by a policeman in Kuwait and was aired in October 2012 – over 7 years before the first case of novel coronavirus was first reported in Wuhan, China.

The WHO changed its mind about masks and now says that they can increase the risk of infection. The WHO didn't say that masks can increase the risk of infection. It changed its position about masks by now recommending community masks in areas with many infections. And it says that masks have to be used properly and alone can't protect you from COVID-19.
Egypt Ministry of Health says it has 600 thousand plasma donors for COVID19 patients. Egypt Ministry of Health refuted the claim officially to Fatabyyano.

COVID-19 is mutating and is now more contagious than before. Yale University epidemiologist Nathan D. Grubaugh, in a short statement to the journal Nature Biology, claimed that the mutations are not indicative of new, devastating virus.

Former candidate for the presidency of Brazil from the Workers’ Party, Fernando Haddad, posted a photo celebrating his birthday with guests during the pandemic. In addition to the image being recorded in 2018, Haddad celebrates his birthday on January 25.
Brazilian company owner who laid off employees because of the pandemic commits suicide. The news is from 2016 and has nothing to do with any pandemic.

“Plandemia”: This video claims that the coronavirus was created in a laboratory, and that it is a plan to reduce the population where vaccines and abortion are involved, among many other claims. The video mixes unsupported claims that cannot be proven or are false. COVID-19 is not a plan to reduce the population, it is a disease caused by a virus that came from nature.

The World Health Organization considers Tunisia the best African country to have succeeded in handling Covid-19. The allegation is false, as the World Health Organization has not ranked Tunisia the best country that has dealt with COVID-19, nor has it published any list of the best countries that have dealt with the virus.

According to a Greek journalist COVID-19 is not a pandemic since the dead count has only been 300,000 people and the WHO was defrauded by a private company to impose social distancing measures. The definition of a pandemic relates to the extent and ease of transmition not the number of cases or deaths. Also, the claim about the company that defrauded the WHO is indeed true but their relationship with the WHO was in relation to data mining and analysis for drug development and had nothing to do with providing consultation for measures of social distancing, thus the claim that this company influenced the WHO to suggest such measures has no basis in fact.
The UN plans to reduce population. No, the UN does not plan to reduce population.

Singer Miguel Bosé’s tweets involving Bill Gates, vaccines and 5G. The Spanish singer published a series of messages in which he claims that a "pharmaceutical company" owned by the Microsoft co-founder seeks to manufacture vaccines with microchips that can be tracked by 5G. In addition, he assured that for this reason the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation was expelled from India. However, none of what he says is based on scientific evidence, and they are a compilation of old misinformations along with new ones that emerged from the advance of the new coronavirus pandemic.

A message accompanied by a photo of a poster from the Government delegation in Navarra, Spain, stating “international vaccination center”. According to the message that is circulating, “these ‘International Vaccination’ posters are beginning to be placed in government delegations, it will be the protocol of the new normal” after the quarantine of the coronavirus. It also says that the virus “was only an excuse to get us a mRNA (genetic software) vaccine synchronized to a digital identity.” It is a hoax. The poster in the image has been on display since at least 2017 and is from an international vaccination center, a service where vaccines are administered and advice is given on "travel medicine", according to the Ministry of Health, from which these centers depend. Additionally, as of June 8, there is no licensed coronavirus vaccine.

The state government of Pernambuco, Brazil, shipped boxes of alcohol-based hand sanitizers to state hospitals, but there were only two bottles and a lot of sand on each box. The video was not shot on Pernambuco, but on Rio Grande do Norte. The hand sanitizers were sent by the Federal Government, not the state administration. The material sent along with the bottles was not sand, but vermiculite. The boxes were shipped this way because of fire hazard.

During an interview to an Australian newspaper, a WHO official said the institution never recomended social isolation. The interview is from April and she did not say WHO did not reccomend social isolation. Instead, she said lockdown does not work as a stand-alone measure. She also praised Australia and New Zealand, two countries that used lockdown as part of their anti-COVID-19 strategies.

A video of a “baile funk”, a kind of Brazilian party. On the caption, it is stated that the party was from last week, after the Supreme Court suspended police operations on Rio’s favelas during the pandemic. The video was originally published on March 11, a few days before any social isolation measure started to take place.

The WHO stated that asymptomatic cases of COVID-19 do not contribute to the spread the disease. Although a WHO director did say asymptomatic cases "rarely" transmit COVID-19, the organization itself said this only applied to "true" asymptomatic, and not to pre-symptomatic cases. Also, no one ever said it was impossible.

There has been no death due to COVID-19 in Israel as they mix lemon and baking soda in their tea. This combination kills coronavirus. As of June 9, Israel reported 298 deaths due to COVID-19, and a total of 18,089 cases. There is no scientific evidence that a mix of lemon and baking powder with tea can kill coronavirus.

An article stating that utility bills will be increased with a “Covid tax” aimed at helping people in need in Italy. An increase in utility bills has actually been proposed by two Members of Parliament, but the amendment was then withdrawn.

A video of a 14-year-old Indian boy named Abhigya Anand who was alleged to have predicted the coronavirus in 2019. The 14-year-old Indian boy featured by some media not only failed to predict the coronavirus, but made other predictions of which none have come true, such as World War III.

Travel restrictions between Denmark and Sweden are debated at the moment, and several Danish and Swedish politicians claim that the infection pressure for COVID-19 is lower in Skåne in Sweden than in the Capital Region of Denmark. There is nothing that support this claim, several researchers believe. There are no available figures indicating that the infection rate for COVID-19 is lower in Skåne than in the Capital Region, says Christian Wejse, associate professor of infectious diseases and public health at Aarhus University and departmental doctor at Aarhus University Hospital. "It is not a correct representation of the situation right now to claim that the infection pressure in Skåne and the surrounding area is lower than in the capital," he says.
Ugandan President Kaguta Museveni and Prime Minister Ruhakana Rugunda have tested positive for COVID-19. No news outlet has carried such reports, which would be headline news on any day.
China is now using special glasses instead of laboratory equipment to screen for coronavirus. These glasses are used to measure temperature and detect fever, not to screen for coronavirus.
UV rays from the sun can cure COVID-19. No, UV Rays from the sun cannot cure COVID-19. Viral post is misleading.

Kerala (India) temple offers special Puja for curing COVID-19 and a rate card for the specific COVID-19 prayer (rituals) has been created by the temple. The image used to make the claim is a photoshopped rate list of rituals performed by the temple. We have found the original photo and also spoken to the temple authorities.

DPS (Delhi Public School) is selling masks with its logo printed on it to students for Rs.400 each. The school authorities have clarified these masks have no association with them, some mask vendors have used the school branding on the masks without permission from the school authorities.

A picture claiming that, starting from September, teachers will have to call an ambulance if a student has a fever at school. The news is false, there is no official guideline stating that students with a fever will be taken from school to a hospital with an ambulance.

Vodka can reduce the risk of Coronavirus infection. The letter accompanying the claim is a fake letter. Alcoholic drinks, including vodka, also have no effect on the novel coronavirus. When a virus has entered someone's body, spraying alcohol or even drinking it will not kill the virus.

Swine flu virus is more dangerous than the novel coronavirus. The basic reproduction rate or R0 of the 2009 H1N1 virus is 1.46 while for SARS-CoV-2, the R0 is 2.5. The swine flu mortality rate is only around 0.02 percent, while the global COVID-19 mortality rate, according to WHO as of March 3, 2020, is around 3.4 percent

The body in this video is a COVID-19 patient whose internal organs have been removed. The video was a video recorded in April 2018, long before the emergence of the novel coronavirus at the end of December 2019. The body in the video was a murder victim. Sutures on the abdomen to the body of the body are autopsy marks. The hospital that autopsied the body denied that there was organ theft.

COVID-19 vaccines from the US will have microchips. There are no official reports on studies being done on a COVID-19 vaccine that will inject people with a microchip. According to the BBC, the rumors began in March, when Gates participated in an Ask Me Anything session on Reddit on COVID-19. In a response to a question on how businesses will operate moving forward, Gates said, "Eventually we will have some digital certificates to show who has recovered or been tested recently or when we have a vaccine who has received it."

CNBC reported that “Coronavirus patients without symptoms aren’t driving the spread of the virus” based on remarks by a WHO official at a press briefing on 8 June 2020. During a press briefing on 8 June 2020, WHO official Dr. Maria Van Kerkhove said that asymptomatic spread of COVID-19 is "very rare" while replying to a journalist's question. This was reported by CNBC as "Coronavirus patients without symptoms aren’t driving the spread of the virus." However, epidemiological experts have pointed out that this report is misleading, because patients without symptoms can and do transmit the infection, particularly in the case of pre-symptomatic individuals, who only develop symptoms later during infection and are not considered truly asymptomatic by the WHO's definition. A day later, Dr. Van Kerkhove clarified in a conference that her earlier remarks were based only on a small subset of studies and that it was a misunderstanding for her "to state that asymptomatic transmission globally is very rare."

Using laser thermometers to detect fever can damage the retina. Non-contact fever thermometers do not emit lasers, but instead detect heat radiation from a body. But there are laser thermometers for industrial use that can cause damage.

“Bald men are at greater risk of getting infected with coronavirus” The text does not provide evidence that "bald men are at greater risk of getting infected with coronavirus" With phrases such as "scientists say", "experts believe", "group of scientists", "according to doctors" the article tries to sound credible, but there is no data on who these scientists, experts and doctors are and where dothey say the facts written in this article.
Emmanuel Macron decided that African people couldn’t enter the European terroritory anymore unless they have been vaccined with the European vaccine. The quote is entirely made up.

Daddy Yankee gives out his money and created the charity ‘COVID-19 Pandemic’. A series of false profiles of the Puerto Rican singer seeks to deceive his followers with offers of money in the midst of the pandemic. On his official social media profiles, the artist does not offer this type of assistance.
Bill Gates was expelled from India due to his Polio vaccines. There is no evidence that polio vaccines in India cause paralysis on children and Bill Gates was not prohibited access in consequence.

Video shows celebrations in Tunisian hospitals because Tunisia is free from COVID19. The original video is from an Italian Hospital called Madonna delle Grazie after closure of COVID-19 ward. Tunisia did control the COVID-19 situation according to the Tunisian government.
A hot environment, ginger, and ginger can prevent a COVID-19 infection. There is no official treatment that can prevent COVID-19, according to the World Health Organization (WHO).

Germany’s government has sent China a €149 billion charge for damage caused by the pandemic. The figure was calculated and cited by the German tabloid Bild in an editorial published on April 15 that defended the responsibility of Chinese government officials for the economic losses of the new coronavirus pandemic. It is not, therefore, the value of an account sent by the government, just an element that illustrates the newspaper's arguments.

WHO says it never advised the application of lockdown as a measure to fight coronavirus. Social media posts distorted a statement by Margaret Harris, WHO's spokeswoman. In fact, she said that isolation measures alone would not be enough to stop the pandemic and would only be effective if combined with other actions, such as massive testing and tracking of confirmed patient contacts.

WHO said that asymptomatic patients don’t transmit the new coronavirus. In fact, Maria Van Kerkhove stated that, although there is not much data, contagion by asymptomatic individuals would be rare, but not impossible. A day later, directors of the institution said that the organization is convinced that asymptomatic people transmit the virus, but that conclusive data still remains on how common this contagion is.

Prime Minister of Latvia claims that one third of Covid-19 EUR 2 billion recovery budget is planned for unemployment support and other benefits. The claim is false. The actual state support planned for benefits is six times smaller.

Asymptomatic carriers of the coronavirus are not the source of infection. Indeed, on Monday, WHO representative Maria van Kerkhove spoke about observations concerning asymptomatic carriers of the virus and that transmission of the disease from them "seems rare" based on a certain number of reports. However she did not make clear statements or conclusions and this interpretation of her statement is manipulative.

The Tunisian national team player, Youssef El-Masakeni, did not comply with the quarantine imposed in his country. Misbar verified the circulating news that turned out to be misleading, as the head of the Quarantine Committee at the Ministry of Health, Mohamed Al-Rabhi, confirmed that the Tunisian national team player, Youssef Al-Masakeni, was subjected to compulsory quarantine for a period of 5 days and was allowed to complete the remaining period, 11 days, in quarantine at his residence.
New nipah virus is deadlier than COVID-19 according to WHO. Virus Nipah killed 18 people in India in 2018 and was first identified in 1998.

The image of a child trying to breastfeed on the dead mother lying on railway tracks in the state of Madhya Pradesh is from the Coronavirus lockdown. The image is from 2017 and has no connection to the ongoing lockdown. Many migrant workers who were returning to their homes in different states during the coronavirus lockdown lost their lives on the way due to hunger and thirst. The image is shared in that context.
Wearing a mask, when the temperature is above 26°C is strictly prohibited. Recommendations and rules for wearing medical masks do not include temperature restrictions.
Children are able to develop a “natural” herd immunity against COVID-19. The development of herd immunity in a "natural" way among children can lead to a large number of victims.

Suicide rates in Berlin rose 300 percent because of the lockdown. There are no up-to-date statistics about suicides in Berlin or Germany. The numbers cited in the articles refer to emergency call codes but are taken out of context.
French president Emanuel Macron announced a vaccine mandate for Africans willing to travel to Europe Foreign ministry denied idea.
A lab in Thane was closed for reporting false positive cases of COVID-19 The lab was not closed, but did stop collecting samples in that period.
COVID-19 can be cured with aspirin The post provides false information on many topics (5G, autopsy, cures)

Video shows a group of Muslim devotees spitting deliberately to spread coronavirus. People in the video are performing a Sufi ritual called Zikr. It involves heavy breathing with a meditative chant. It has nothing to do it with coronavirus.

A WhatsApp message claiming that Italian supermarket chain Conad is offering free shopping vouchers for €1.000 in Italy. The news is fake. It's part of a phishing campaing aimed at acquiring sensitive data from users.

Text claims that the director of the Public Revenue Office of the Republic of North Macedonia, Sanja Lukarevska, tested positive for coronavirus and went to the hairdresser. The information is false, and the photos used are ten months old. Lukarevska denied this piece of misinformation.

A WhatsApp message that states that COVID-19 means “Certificate of identification of vaccination with artificial intelligence”; which is intended through the disease to carry out an international plan for the control and reduction of populations. COVID-19 does not mean "Certificate of Identification of Vaccination with Artificial Intelligence", nor "it was launched in January 2020". Vaccines do not reactivate viruses.

A message that states that “An asymptomatic person is a HEALTHY person. He is someone who has a virus but his body developed antibodies. This is called” attenuated virus “, which means that he dominated the virus thanks to his healthy lifestyle habits. This person does not spread the virus, but communicates antibodies to the rest of the people and generates herd immunity. It is false that asymptomatic people do not spread the coronavirus.

The vaccine against the new coronavirus has existed since 2001. The viral post image refers to a canine vaccine that attacks another type of coronavirus. The strain that caused the current pandemic (SARS-CoV-2) was identified in late 2019.

An image of the Argentinian President Alberto Fernández with officials during the pandemic without masks and without respecting social distancing. The President traveled last June 5 to La Pampa and Neuquén, but the photo circulating on social networks was taken last year at the event for "Loyalty Day", in Santa Rosa, La Pampa.

Donald Trump published on his Twitter account that Brazilian president “Javier” Bolsonaro is a “great guy”, but that his COVID-19 policies are leading to a “genocide”. This tweet was published by a Brazilian user who changed his name, temporarily, to Donald Trump, not by Trump himself.

The Brazilian Ministry of Health forbade the expression “COVID-19 suspect” to be used on death certificates. The ministry officially recomends the use of this expression whenever there is suspicion, but not proof, that COVID-19 was the cause of death.
Former Brazilian presidential candidate Fernando Haddad threw a birthday party, with guests, while advocating for lockdown. Fernando Haddad was born in January. The photo is from 2019.
Drinking pigeon membrane slurry can cure COVID-19. Drinking pigeon membrane slurry won’t cure coronavirus. The viral post is fake.

A picture with an old man sitting on the ground, and a caption saying that while he was hospitalized for COVID-19 his house was occupied by a Roma family. The picture was taken in Greece in 2015: it has nothing to do with COVID-19. It is instead related to the 2009 economic crisis.

Facebook posts shared thousands of times claim that the novel coronavirus disease is caused by bacteria and can be cured with household painkillers. The posts also claim that Italian doctors found a cure for COVID-19 Both claims are false; Italy's health ministry told AFP Fact Check that the posts were “a hoax”. No cure has been found for the disease.

A Colorado bill is “removing exemptions” for parents who don’t want to vaccinate their children in order to attend school. The bill adds new requirements to opt out of vaccinations, but does offer medical and nonmedical exemptions for religious or personal beliefs.
Healthcare workers in this video turn their backs when the WHO director appears The person in the video is the Prime minister of Belgium.

Wearing masks for the coronavirus “decreases oxygen intake, increases toxin inhalation, shuts down immune system, increases virus risk, scientifically inaccurate, effectiveness not studied.” Studies show masks can curb spread of the novel coronavirus. Experts say the face coverings do not cause health problems.
ID2020 program is looking for world control and the mayor of Medellín, Colombia, is part of the plot. This is a conspiracy theory that has already been disproved.
