Ginger, honey, onion and aspirin recipe cure COVID-19. So far there is no proven cure for coronavirus.

Asian giant hornet have been killing people in several countries, in an attack worse than the COVID-19 pandemic. Contrary to the FB posts, news reports in May never mentioned any recent human deaths resulting from the Asian giant hornet’s sting. The hornets are sometimes called “murder hornets” because they can swiftly wipe out honeybee hives by decapitating bees. In a May 14 article, National Geographic reported that a person “likely would have to be stung by a couple hundred giant hornets” for its venom to be fatal.
Wearing masks increases one’s risk of coronavirus infection. Masks reduce the risk of infection and, hence, slow down the spread of the virus.
The influenza mortality rate is higher than the COVID-19 mortality rate. The COVID-19 mortality rate is higher than the influenza mortality rate.

MMS is the treatment for COVID19 and is available now in pharmacies in Iraq. MMS is a dangerous compound and no approved to treat COVID-19. Iraq Ministry of health refuted the claim, saying that this compound is dangerous.
Onion cures and prevents COVID19. There is no evidence that onions cure or prevent COVID-19, according to WHO.

Brazilian Health Minister said that ‘suspected of Covid-19’ can no longer appear on death certificates. The Brazilian Ministry of Health denied that the minister made statements similar to the misleading content. Aos Fatos also didn't identify records of similar determination in the official government and ministry disclosure bodies.

The WHO stated that asymptomatic spread of COVID-19 is “very rare”, therefore physical distancing and face masks are not necessary. The WHO uses the scientific definition of “asymptomatic”, which refers to people who never develop COVID-19 symptoms during infection with SARS-CoV-2. It is inaccurate to refer to all people who are not showing symptoms as “asymptomatic”, because presymptomatic people also appear healthy initially yet can still transmit the virus to others while showing no symptoms. As such, practicing physical distancing and using face masks or face coverings remain necessary for breaking the chain of transmission.

Latvian conspiracy web site uses Norway’s decision to suspend the smartphone app Smittestopp (“infection stop”) and claiming that similar app in Latvia is invading people’s privacy too. Latvian and Norwegian apps are not similar. Latvian app does not store location data and the records are not stored outside the app. Norway’s decision says nothing about the app created in Latvia.

German Chancellor Angela Merkel apologizes to German children because of the quarantine. Misbar verified this news and found it to be false, as two weeks ago, in its televised message, German Chancellor Angela Merkel did not give any apology to German children for not being allowed out due to quarantine decisions.
The Delhi Public School is selling face masks at Rs.400 and students have to buy these. The claim is fake. Delhi Public School said that they are not selling masks.

The New World Order has launched a pandemic because it plans to chip everyone in and introduce a single cryptocurrency The authors do not provide any factual evidence of their words, and their arguments are based on conspiracy theories.
Ramakrishna Hospital is sealed after its staff tested Covid-19 positive. Ramakrishna Hospital was not sealed after its staff tested COVID-19 positive. Hospital authorities clarified the rumours.

The use of a cloth mask for protection from COVID-19 can cause hypercapnia and cancer. There is no scientific backing for the claim that a mask can block oxygen and carbon dioxide molecules or that it causes hypercapnia or cancer.
American Congress resolution 6666 introduces forced quarantine and testing for SARS-Cov-2 The film recorded by American doctor Rashid A. Buttar contains false information.

Facebook posts shared thousands of times claim the coronavirus pandemic is a cover for a Gates Foundation-funded effort to implant microchips when patients’ noses or throats are swabbed during COVID-19 testing. This is false; the pandemic is real, the foundation denied the claim, and experts say there is a medical reason for the way swabs are used when testing for the disease.

Doctors from all over the world have elected hydroxychloroquin “most effective treatment against Covid-19”. While this poll does exist, it is an old one, dating from late March, where doctors expressed in the same time their lack of certainty about treatments and their effectiveness. Since then, late polls has shown that hydroxychloroquine isn't seen anymore as the most effective therapy.
Fisiol, mucosolvan and fluimucil are reccommended for COVID-19 treatment. This post addresses accurate information about COVID-19 treatment but also gives auto-medication tips.
Nanochips were found in COVID-19 vaccines. The photo and video show syringes with ID microchip tags for pets, not vaccines.

A meme posted on Facebook claims South Africa’s president and ruling party politicians recently celebrated a high-profile birthday and flouted lockdown rules in the process. However, the images were taken in previous years.

Multiple posts shared repeatedly on Facebook and Twitter claim COVID-19 means “see a sheep surrender” in Latin. The claim is false; Latin language experts dismissed the claim as “nonsense”; the World Health Organization (WHO) states COVID-19 refers to “coronavirus disease 2019”.
A school in Delhi is selling Facemasks for 400 rupees to students The school refuted the claim that they are selling these masks and somebody used their logo as it is readily available online

Text claims that “two epidemiologists from the Institute of Public Health of the Republic of North Macedonia tested positive for coronavirus.” The Institute of Public Health has denied the allegations, saying none of the employees tested positive for COVID-19.
Coronavirus is actually an expanded exosome caused by 5G. COVID-19 is a disease caused by a virus, not an exosome.

Multiple posts shared repeatedly on Facebook state Android users in Australia have been automatically signed up to COVIDSafe, the government’s COVID-19 contact tracing app, through an application programming interface (API) operated by Google. The claim is false; a cybersecurity expert said the API is “not an app”, and that the use of it is optional; the Australian government said the COVIDSafe app is available for voluntary download and cannot operate without being downloaded.

Chlorine Dioxide (CLO2) cures the bug that worries the governments all around the world so much. Chlorine dioxide does not cure COVID-19, there is no scientific evidence of its healing properties. This compound is used to disinfect surfaces and many governments consider it a substance that should not be drunk because it is dangerous to health.

Aerial footage of a large procession of people has been viewed hundreds of thousands of times on Facebook alongside claims that the video shows protests in the US during the COVID-19 pandemic. The claim is false; the video has circulated in media reports about people in Iran attending a funeral procession for military leader Qasem Soleimani in January 2020.

Forbes magazine ranked Tunisia as the most important tourist destination in the world after the Covid-19 crisis. Misbar checked the news and found that the translation is misleading, as Forbes did not classify Tunisia as the most important tourist destination in the world after the decline of COVID-19, but rather said that Tunisia is among the seven countries in the world, which has the ability to become one of the best tourist destinations in the world, after COVID-19 recedes.
Dawood Ibrahim died of Covid-19. Dawood Ibrahim did not die due to COVID-19. His brother clarified the rumours.

In photos circulating social media we see a woman carrying body bags of COVID-19 cases with extreme ease thus proving that COVID-19 deaths are staged. The photo is depicting empty, fake, body bags that were used as a prop in a protest for the public health measures taken for COVID-19 by the government in Miami.
Dr Uma Kumar of AIIMS gave an interview on coronavirus. Dr Uma Kumar of Aiims did not give this interview on coronavirus, the viral post is fake.

COVID-19 is not new and an old textbook gives out its treatment. The textbook does mentions the details of coronavirus but it is not related to COVID-19. Other strains of coronavirus existed from before but COVID-19 is a new strain in the coronavirus family. Its vaccine is not created as of now but clinical trials are undergoing.

A video where a man accuses the Italian Civil Protection and the government of Regione Piemonte of having distributed protective masks “poisoned” them with zinc pyrithione. Zinc pyrithione is commonly used as an antimicrobial for many kinds of textile products, among which protective masks. If used properly, it is not dangerous.
Boldo tea prevents COVID-19. The post has no links to any research or paper published. WHO says there is still no cure for COVID-19.
ICU units in Rio de Janeiro are closed because of lack of patients. Hospitals denied being closed and say they continue to receive patients infected with COVID-19.
Azithromycin and ivermectin are efficient medicines to cure COVID-19. Both drugs are effective in vitro but up to now have failed to cure COVID-19 on people.

Facebook post claiming that the government of Germany is giving €300 bonus a month for every child with their €130 billion stimulus package following the COVID-19 crisis. There is a €300 one-time payment for each child in a family. Reduction of VAT is temporary measure for 6 months.

A WhatsApp message that warns about the installation of an application called “COVID-19 ABTraceTogether”. The chain message asks the reader to to unfriend their friends on Facebook as well as delete their contacts’ phone numbers if they intend to use it because by doing so “everyone your contacts will be known “against” your will and knowledge”. This application does not exist in Spain, but belongs to a state of Canada, nor can it be downloaded or used in Spain.

A chain on plasma donation of recovered COVID-19: any person who has recovered can donate plasma to 9 people. For each recovered person who donates plasma, between three and four doses can be obtained, so it would be useful for three or four patients with coronavirus. Not all people who recover can donate, there are specific requirements that are reported to recoveries who call the receiving hospitals, foundations, and institutes.

List of recommendations from US virologist Robert Ray Redfield that has spread on social media. The list, which contains recommendations without scientific evidence to support them, wasn´t created by US virologist Robert Ray Redfield; it is authored by Faheem Younus, a medical doctor, and was manipulated, since in its original version it aimed to expose myths about the coronavirus.
A man says that coronavirus was created to keep people inside homes and install 5G antennas. The 5G technology has not been installed in Colombia and has no relation with COVID-19.

The Anhembi field hospital, in São Paulo, Brasil is empty. A video allegedly proves it. This video is a 3-minute edit of a longer video, in which the installations were shown. In the original video, it is clearly stated that the wing is only being kept as a backup, in case the number of cases grow. This part was cut. The hospital currently has more than 400 patients in it.
Tasuku Honjo, Nobel prize winner, stated that the SARS-Cov-2 was made in a lab in Wuhan, where he used to work. Honjo himself publicly denied ever saying that. He never worked in Wuhan.

Wearing a mask, the exhaled viruses will not be able to escape and will concentrate in the nasal passages, penetrate the olfactory nerves, and then transit to the brain. According to the peer reviews, the study is illogical and inconclusive.

Herbal medicine named mio coffee can treat COVID-19. This concoction consists of Moringa leaves, shallots, and Tolak Angin. Until now, research on the properties of Moringa leaves on patients with COVID-19 is still ongoing. In addition, there has been no research showing that onion can treat COVID-19.
Dr Uma Kumar of AIIMS gave the interview as shown in the video on coronavirus. Dr Uma Kumar of AIIMS did not give this interview on coronavirus; the viral post is fake.
Dr Uma Kumar from AIIMS Delhi gave interview regarding immunity boosting tips. Dr Uma denied this claim; she has not given the interview as shown in the viral post.

Data showing that socialist countries handle coronavirus better. The disinformation uses data from Vietnam, Venezuela and China. But the important thing when making comparisons is to understand that each country has different testing strategies, capacities and different avalanche systems.
The video shows people running to reopened Masjid Al-Nabawi. The video has been shared many times in the past. It does not show the opening moments of the mosque, which was reopened after measures.

It is possible to “boost” our immune system. The idea is not born with the pandemic, but numerous "miracle cures" to "strengthen" our immunity are making the round on social medias. Quite simply, the immune system is not a muscle that can be "strengthen" that easily, but a complex web of hundreds of molecules organized on many defense lines.

Hand sanitiser can go on fire if left in a car in hot weather. Hand sanitiser bottles can not go on fire if left in a car. The temperature inside the car would need to reach around 365 degrees Celsius for this to happen.
“COV 19” was found inscribed on a circuit board for a 5G mast. The claim is a hoax. The circuit board is from an old set-top TV box and has nothing to do with 5G.
Brazilia president Jair Bolsonaro was right about efficacy of chloroquine. There is no scientific evidence about efficacy of chloroquine and other drugs descripted on video.
Audio warns residents of Barranquilla, Colombia, that hospitals are infecting people with COVID-19 to collect compensation. The Mayor's Office has denied the claim.

Vice President Leni Robredo is shown in a quote card saying basketball can now be played under a more relaxed quarantine setup as long as players are three meters away from each other. She said no such thing. The fake quote even contradicts what she said during the May 31 episode of her radio show BISErbisyong Leni, where she said contact sports like basketball would still be disallowed under a more relaxed quarantine setup.

The death of the Egyptian actress Rajaa El-Gedawy after contracting Covid-19. Misbar checked the news and found it to be false. Al-Jeddawi's daughter, Amira Mokhtar, denied on her Facebook page the news of the death of her mother, who is still in ICU.

Face masks cause hypoxia; wearing it causes one to inhale too much carbon dioxide, which can make you sick. Experts say the face masks do not cause health problems. You would need an air-tight seal to cause hypoxia, and no mask does that.

Messages that claim that the Government knows where we are at all times thanks to an application that Google has installed on our phones. These are hoaxes. The Spanish government has not installed any application on its citizens' phones  without their knowledge. What appears on Android phones is technical documentation explaining how a potentiel exposure notification app would work if it were installed.
Vaccines and facemasks “kill” people. Many doctors and WHO firmly deny those claims.

UV rays from sunlight kill the novel coronavirus. The post claiming UV rays from sunlight kill coronavirus is misleading. Ultra-violet radiation destroys viruses, but there is not enough UV radiation in sunlight to accomplish this.

A text message states that Facebook would have taken advantage of the chaos created by COVID-19 to gain permission to use our personal pictures. The information is fake, Facebook is not changing any of its terms. The chain letter has been circulating online, in various forms, since 2012.

Pedro Sánchez, President of Spain, said this Wednesday, June 3 in the Congress of Deputies, that “today we have 0 deceased in our country as a result of COVID” and that Pablo Casado should be happy that “we haven’t had any death by COVID-19 over the past two days”. In Spain, two days have not elapsed without deaths due to COVID-19. The same Wednesday that Pedro Sánchez affirmed that, Fernando Simón announced hours later in his daily press conference that the day before, on Tuesday, June 2, a person had died due to the coronavirus in Castilla y León.

96.3% of the deaths registered in Italy by COVID-19 died from other pathologies. The percentage comes from a viral video of a speech by Forza Itala's Italian MP, Vittorio Sgarbi. The MP was basing himself on an existing study by the Italian Higher Institute of Health, but the data was poorly analyzed and presented. This number represents the percentage of people studied who died and had other pre-existing diseases when they died from the coronavirus. This does not mean that they did not die from COVID-19, but that when they died they also had other pathologies.

The use or abuse of the mask produces hypercapnia or hypoxia. The tissues of the masks or chinstraps allow gases to pass, including oxygen and CO2. There is no scientific study that indicates that the use of masks can cause hypoxia.

A WhatsApp message claiming that, once installed, the “Immuni” app (the Italian national contact-tracing application), will acquire users’ phonebooks. The Immuni app fully respects EU privacy policies, and it won't be able to access or acquire users' personal data.

Renata Vasconcellos, one of Brazil’s most famous news anchor, contracted COVID-19. She did not contract COVID-19. Although she did not anchor Jornal Nacional on Monday and Tuesday (June 1 and 2), she returned to the stand on June 3. She was gone for only 5 days, while the mandatory quarantine is of 14 days. Both her and Globo denied it.

Maria Virgínia Casagrande, first lady of the Brazilian State of Espirito Santo, was cured of COVID-19 after being treated with a protocol of hydroxychloroquine and azithromycin. This alledged protocol is not applied by the CIAS Hospital, where she was treated for COVID-19 and released after four days. This information was confirmed by Unimed Vitória, who manages the hospital.

A picture taken in Colombia which shows a girl who fainted. The caption claims that the vaccine for COVID-19 is starting to be distributed in poorer countries, but 200 girls fainted after the injection. The picture was taken in 2014 and it's related to the vaccine for the Papilloma virus (HPV). It has nothing to do with COVID-19.

The severity of the COVID-19 Case in Surabaya, Indonesia is caused by a “global elite conspiracy”. According to a number of experts and the COVID-19 Handling Team, there were four factors that caused the COVID-19 case in Surabaya, Indonesia to surge, including the increasingly massive tests, the magnitude of passenger mobility at Juanda International Airport, local transmissions, and the failure of lockdowns as expected.

Bill Gates’ coronavirus vaccine developed by Oxford researchers caused all test subjects to get coronavirus. Vaccinated animals did not develop an infection because of the vaccine, contrary to the claim. Preliminary results from small-scale animal studies suggest that the COVID-19 vaccine developed by Oxford researchers may protect against viral pneumonia. However, researchers did find viral genetic material in nasal passages of vaccinated monkeys. Therefore, some scientists have cautioned that the vaccine may provide only partial protection against disease and may not prevent virus shedding and its spread to unvaccinated individuals. Bill Gates is not the developer, producer or sole funder of the vaccine; financial backing for the production of the Oxford vaccine has come from several sources including the U.K. government. It is inaccurate and misleading to attribute the vaccine to Bill Gates alone.

Claim that Indian prime minister Modi said one crore (ten million) COVID-19 infected patients have been treated for free. PM Narendra Modi did not make this statement, the statement is misrepresented and is fake.

Yopal, Colombia, already has deaths from coronavirus A few weeks ago, the publication of a photograph that showed the alleged grave of a recent burial with the inscription "COVID-19" circulated on social media, although the photograph caused a stir, the health authorities of the department and the municipality were emphatic when pointing out that Deaths from the new coronavirus have not yet occurred.

Guatemalan Health Minister Hugo Monroy assured that the consumption of Red Bull mixed with alcohol was one of the causes of death in young people diagnosed with COVID-19. Evidence for the minister's statement was requested from the Ministry of Health, but there was no response. Health experts denied that a death from COVID-19 can be linked to consumption of Red Bull.

Italy has discovered that COVID-19 is a bacterium rather than a virus. It is untrue that the COVID-19 disease is caused by bacteria. Scientists have seen and analysed the virus, and identified that COVID-19 is caused by a virus rather than by bacteria.

“N95 masks block few, if any” COVID-19 particles due to their size. This attempt to discredit a fundamental piece of protective gear used and studied around the globe fails to account for several fundamental scientific principles. The COVID-19 particle is small, but it always exists bonded to larger particles of water, protein, mucus and other materials expelled by breathing, coughing, etc. These are all well above the 0.3 micron size of the N95 filter. The N95 filter also filters particles smaller than 0.3 microns very efficiently because particles under that size have a high amount of erratic movement and are electrostatically drawn to the mask fibers.

A video claims to show a “deadly insect attack” in China, India and Iran, in which the insect can supposedly kill a person with just one bite. Not true. The circulating two-minute footage is a composite of four clips that have little to do with insect attacks. Three of the clips show the aftermath of a poisonous gas leak in India, while one clip lacks proof to show it was indeed taken in the countries mentioned and that it was of an insect attack.

A meme shared thousands of times on Facebook claims people can suffer from reduced oxygen to their blood and brain, possibly leading to death, if they wear a disposable mask for too long. This is misleading; only a marginal decrease in oxygen saturation can sometimes be measured in people wearing a disposable mask, and several experts agree there is no evidence of long-term effects of breathing through a mask.

Horrific pictures of large numbers of victims of Covid-19. “Today, America’s Game has been exposed, a young man with an enveloped doll to look like a victim of the virus, but in reality they are all just dolls that have been wrapped and spread on the streets of America”, says the caption. The photo is taken from a protest event in the US state of Florida, in which protesters prepared forms resembling bodies lying in the street, The protest was against the state's policy of reopening economic sectors and social activities, despite the death of nearly 2,500 people due to COVID-19.

Gargling by salt water and inhaling hot water cures COVID19. There is no evidence yet support the effect of gargling with salt water or inhaling hot air as a treatment for COVID-19. As of publication, no specific treatment cures COVID-19 according to WHO.

David Icke’s claims that 5G poisons cells, and Bill Gates plans to control population with an invisible ink Second part of analysis reflecting on David Ice's interview is regarding his claims describing COVID-19 pandemic as an excuse and a conspiracy for 5G installation. In his statements he explains how 5G electromagnetic fields poison cells and trigger them to produce exosomes as an immune response, which is the reason why test for COVID-19 are positive. Allegations about Bill Gates and his plans to "control the population" through invisible ink have previously been denied and proven false. 5G, just as 4G and 3G, have no dangerous indications to human cells nor are they generally considered harmful for human health.
This video shows a 5G antenna component with Cov-19 mentioned on it The component's maker says its an internet TV router component, no link with 5G

Claim that despite the fact that the crisis headquarters in the North Macedonian town of Stip announced that the textile factories in Stip will be closed due to established cases of coronavirus infections, some of the factories are still working. The workers were in the textile factory that day, but not to work, but to be tested for coronavirus. This was confirmed on the Facebook profile of Kristina Ampeva from the association "Glasen Textilec". Also, the director of the State Health and Sanitary Inspectorate, Irina Sotirova-Buhova, denied the claim in a press conference.

A federal investigation in the city of Fortaleza, Brazil, made number of daily recorded deaths fall 90%. Official data shows a decrease lower than said on the post - it varies from 29% to 60%. Nevertheless, there is no link between a federal investigation launched to fight corruption and the number of cases.
There were no COVID-19 deaths in Belém, Brazil, on May 30 and May 31. According to the local health services, 11 people died of COVID-19 on these two days. Numbers are not final.
Madagascar’s president, Andry Rajoelina, accused the WHO of promising bribes if he “poisoned” an alledged local COVID-19 treatment. Rajoelina did not accuse the WHO of offering bribes.

A scientific study about the new coronavirus according to which asymptomatic people would not be contagious. The study was conducted in China and it monitored 455 people who got in touch with a 22-years-old asymptomatic patient who tested positive for COVID-19, claiming that none of them caught the disease The study that was quoted in the misleading article actually exists, and the 455 people who got in touch with the asymptomatic patient did not get infected. However, researchers do not state that "asymptomatic people are not contagious", and they claim that protective measures should always be adopted.

A Facebook post makes a series of claims about Italy “defeating” COVID-19 inclduign that it “nothing but intravascular coagulation (thrombosis)”.It also alleges that Italian doctors who performed autopsies “discovered” that COVID-19 “is not a virus” but a bacteria that causes death and the formation of blood clots. Based on the evidence, AAP FactCheck found the claims in the post to be false or unsupported by evidence.

A viral message circulating on WhatsApp claims that a vaccine would be available in September 2020, “thus ending speculation that the vaccine would not be available until 2021”. There are no guarantee that a vaccine will be available this year. Oxford is investigating a possible COVID-19 vaccine that could be available in 2 to 6 months, according to the university itself. Pharmaceutical company Astra Zeneca, with which the University of Oxford signed an agreement for the large-scale production and distribution of the drug, says that the first doses will be available in September. This is due to the speed with which the development phases of the possible vaccine are being carried out.

French “Stopcovid” case-tracking app has been secretly installed on smartphones. These are hoaxes. The French government has not installed any application on its citizens' phones  without their knowledge. What appears on phones is technical documentation explaining how a potentiel exposure notification app would work if it were installed.
This table shows death figures in France from January to April. The figures in the table are incorrect according to data from INSEE, the French national data agency.
A cure for COVID-19 was discovered in Italy. Italian authorities denied the claim.

Indian Home Minister Amit Shah said that the government transferred financial aid of Rs 530 million into the bank accounts of 410 million people during the coronavirus pandemic, which means Rs 1.29 for each person. The news channel misquoted the Home Minister's statement. Actually Amit Shah said Rs 530 Billion aid was given to 410 million people.

The US are working on secret biological weapon in Tbilisi-based Lugar Lab. Its researchers conducted reserch on bats back in 2014. As part of the research, in spring 2012 and 2014, researchers dressed in special clothes and using special methods collected 450 bats from eight parts of Georgia. The bats were transferred to a Bio-Safety Level III facility to study their pathogens. The diseases transmitted from animals to humans are always studied using this method. Such research is conducted worldwide, including in Russia.
President proposes pet tax to cover expenses for Covid-19. The misinformation about the new pet tax arose from a satirical portal, but users cataloged it as real and was taken up by other means.

Despite the fact that the government has not reported a possible resumption of work at the airport, there are airlines that already sell tickets for commercial flights. The Government denies having given a reopening date. The airlines still insist on selling airline tickets dated from July 2020.
The herb named “holy leaf” or “momo” cures COVID-19 and helps patients breathe. So far, there is no drug or treatment that cures or prevents COVID-19.

Google is secretly installing a COVID-19 app on mobile phones to monitor user’s movements in Spain. It is an API who will enableCOVID-19apps if the user decides to install them. This API will not save personal data and can be deactivated.
Drinking pigeon membrane slurry can cure COVID-19. Drinking pigeon membrane slurry won’t cure coronavirus. The viral post is fake.

“She’s just casually carrying a body with 1 hand..? Sure.. More evidence of coronavirus being a complete hoax with props & street theater.” No, this photo doesn’t prove coronavirus is a hoax. The photo shows a symbolic funeral procession to protest the reopening of businesses in Miami.

Japanese Nobel laureate Dr. Tasuku Honjo has said China manufactured coronavirus and he once worked at the Wuhan lab which later produced it. Dr. Honjo refuted the viral message as "false accusation" and "misinformation". He neither said China manufactured coronavirus nor did he work in any lab in Wuhan.

This cyclist died due to lack of oxygen he was wearing a mask. The cyclist with the initial H, according to the doctor's examination, died of a heart attack. The family also stated that H had a history of heart disease.

A mixture of alcoholic beverage Tanduay, disinfectant cleaner Zonrox, and other products like cologne and hand sanitizer can be used as alcohol or hand sanitizer. Experts and companies involved issued warnings against the mixture saying it could "form a dangerous chemical that has toxic effects" and "may cause serious harm."

Philippines Vice-President Leni Robredo said that playing basketball is allowed but a distance of 3 meters between each player would be required. Robredo did not say this quote, and the graphic used was manipulated from a quote card from GMA News, a local media outlet.

A report drafted by a scientific panel appointed by Germany’s Interior Ministry, declaring the COVID-19 pandemic is a “global false alarm”, was leaked by a former employee. The document in question was not leaked by Germany’s Interior Ministry, nor was it solicited or prepared by any unit of the Interior Ministry. The document represents the private opinion of a single ministry employee and several independent scientists who publicly disseminated it on the Ministry's letterhead without authorization. The German government does not agree with the assessments presented in this personal analysis.

Claim that Indian prime minister Modi said one crore (ten million) COVID-19 infected patients have been treated for free. Prime Minister Modi did not say one croreCOVID-19infected patients have been treated for free.

On May 13, the representative of Tolima, Colombia, for the Conservative party José Elver Hernández tweeted a claim in his Twitter account in which he asks Finagro and the Agrarian Bank for explanations about the resources for small entrepreneurs. The figures mentioned by José Elver Hernández are out of context, as the Office of the Comptroller General of the Republic made a wake-up call to Finagro on April 17 to readjust the conditions for the delivery of the Colombia Agro Produce (CAP) loan. Fact that resulted in the reimbursement of 33,000 million pesos to the funds that Finagro had destined for this initiative.
Smelling vinegar is not a definitive test to detect symptoms of COVID-19. Doctors indicate that loss of smell and taste are among the symptoms of COVID-19, but are not always caused by this disease.
Bill Gates says that the COVID-19 vaccine could kill 700,000 people. The statement was manipulated.

An article circulating on Facebook and Twitter claims that Nigerian schools will reopen on July 13, 2020, according to a government official. The claim is false; the author of the report admitted it was incorrect and Nigerian authorities have dismissed the claim.

The main epidemiologist of Sweden admitted a mistake in the fight against COVID-19. Based on the information of the original publication on Swedish radio and the data of the subsequent press conference, we can conclude that the statement that "Sweden's chief epidemiologist Anders Tegnell recognized the error of his proposed approach to the fight against coronavirus" is not true.

German Commission says the coronavirus is a global false alarm. The material is a mixture of real facts, unreliable information and speculation that belong either to the author himself or to sources that he does not provide links to. The site, which is most likely created to spread information about the coronavirus and earn money from it, contains mostly conspiracy articles.

Alkaline water prevents coronavirus contagion. "Alkaline water has pH levels above 7, but it does not have effects that cause the body to become alkaline on scales where COVID-19 cannot survive," answers the question from Bolivia Verifica.

Claim that Indian Prime minister Modi said one crore (10 million) COVID-19 positive patients have been treated for free. Prime minister Narendra Modi hasn't made this statement. This is a false claim going viral.

Video shows 106 dead bodies in Delhi’s Loknayak hospital, in India. The video which is going viral with the claim that it has been shot at the Lok Nayak Jayaprakash Narayan Hospital of New Delhi is actually of a hospital in Mumbai.

Text claims that the mayor of Stip (North Macedonia), Blagoj Bochvarski accused the citizens of Stip for the increased number of people infected with coronavirus in the town. An excerpt from a 20-second statement by Mayor Bochvarski has been taken out of context and misused for manipulation.

India’s Prime Minister Narendra Modi said in his ‘Mann Ki Baat’ radio address that one crore COVID-19 patients have been treated for free in the country. The prime minister was talking about the beneficiaries of a national health policy Ayushman Bharat which was launched in September 2018, and not COVID-19 patients.

India Today Ticker that says PM Modi has stated that India has treated 1 crore (10 million) COVID-19 patients for free. PM Modi was speaking about the Ayushman Bharat health insurance scheme and not about COVID-19 patients. The channel apologised and issued a correction a day later

After a police raid in Rio, the city administration reduced the official COVID-19 death toll by 1.177 The police raid mentioned in this piece of content had nothing to do with Rio's city administration or the COVID-19 death records. Although the city administration did change its criteria, which means 1.177 confirmed COVID-19 deaths were reclassified as "suspected cases", the cause was not related to any police raids.
A photo of a person carrying an alledged corpse with a single hand. The caption states this was a forged funeral. The photos are from a protest in Florida, US, not a funeral.

A video has been shared thousands of times on social media, claiming that circuit boards with “COV-19” inscribed on them are being fitted to 5G towers. The claim is false; Virgin Media, the company that distributes these boards, and an independent expert confirmed that the equipment is an aged satellite TV component unrelated to 5G technology.

Indian Prime minister Narendra Modi said 10 million COVID-19 patients have been treated for free in India. The news channel misquoted the Prime Minister Modi. He said that 10 million people have been benefited under India's Universal Health scheme over the past one-and-half year.

Gujarat CM Vijay Rupani said that his government provided ration to 650 million people during the lockdown. The new channel misquoted Gujrati CM. Mr. Rupani, in reality, claimed that 50 million people have been provided ration during the lockdown.

A COVID vaccine was developed in Naigaon, in the state of Assam (India). The headline of the article is misleading. A group of researchers are working to develop a vaccine for COVID-19, they haven't developed it yet.
Alkaline water cures the coronavirus. Consuming alkaline beverages or food doesn't cure the virus.
A beverage with aspirin, lemon and hot water cures the coronavirus. There is no scientific proof that aspirin and home remedies cure the virus. Self medication can be dangerous.

These images show bodies of COVID-19 patient dead in the streets in America. The image is from a protest in US where they used bags to represent dead COVID-19 patients in the street on May 27 in Miami. The protest was against the government response to the pandemic.

Italy did not follow WHO protocol and did an autopsy on a corpse that died from COVID-19 and realised that coronavirus is actually not a virus but a bacterium which gets amplified with 5G electromagnetic radiation that also produces inflammation and hypoxia, and multiple other claims. Vishvas news contacted Italian journalists, fact checkers and doctors to conclude that the claims about coronavirus recoveries in Italy are false. Claim that coronavirus is actually a bacteria and can be treated with antibiotics is false.
President of Mexico proposes to collect a tax of 500 pesos for each pet, to pay for social programs related to COVID-19. It's a joke from a satirical news portal.

Donald Trump has stopped 5G, has canceled Bill Gates’ ID2020 and H.R. 6666 COVID-19 Trace bill. Deployment of 5G network has not been stopped.  ID2020 and H.R. 6666 COVID-19 Trace bill are not canceled. Those and other claims in a popolar post circulating on Facebook in English and Latvian are false or misleading.
Coronavirus is defeated. There is a cure using antibodies. Scientists have only discovered the coronavirus antibodies that can become the basis of a new drug.

US President Donald Trump wanted to ruin Americans using coronavirus as a weapon. Thousands of people are protesting on the streets against that. The picture is more than three years old and from Spain.

Colombian Minister of Health said that Colombia has more ICU than Holland. In March, Fernando Ruiz stated that Colombia had 17 intensive care beds for every 100,000 inhabitants, however, the figure was not only for intensive care, but the sum of intermediate and intensive care. It also compares them with old figures in the Netherlands.

A Facebook page shared a post announcing that the United States of America will grant 5,000 Nigerians free work Visa for two years. The claim made by a Facebook page that the US government will grant 5,000 Nigerians free work Visa for two years is false. The Nigerian Embassy in the US has debunked the claim tagging it to be untrue.

Uganda Red Cross Society in partnership with the United States Agency for International Development (USAID). The Uganda Red Cross Society distanced only advertises vacancies on its website and on national newspapers.
Vodacom is offering Tsh80,000 to M-Pesa users as COVID-19 relief funds. The website that the promotion appears on uses the Vodacom and M-Pesa logos, but is not linked to either entity.
Sungkai leaves can treat COVID-19 patients. Research on the properties of sungkai leaves to cure from COVID-19 infections is still being done in Indonesia.
The post shows dead bodies of COVID-19 patients lying in the LNJP Hospital, Delhi (India). Video is from Mumbai's hospital and not from a hospital in Delhi.

A video claims to show Philippines Sen. Grace Poe heavily criticizing Pres. Rodrigo Duterte and his administration for their “inefficient COVID-19 response” compared to that of the private sector. That was not what Poe said. While the senator did praise the private sector for “act[ing] immediately” in response to the crisis, she did not discredit the government’s efforts. Neither did she condemn the Duterte administration “for being unprepared” in dealing with the COVID-19 pandemic. She made no mention of the president in her statement at all.

In Ukraine, the quarantine measures are gradually being lifted, and the number of infected decreases. Despite the quarantine measures are being lifted, the number of patients is growing daily as of early June.
Spain corrected their number of deaths by Covid-19 from more than 26.000 to 2.000. Spain corrected their number of deaths by 2.000. After that it was still 26.834.

For one day Sweden didn’t have any new death from COVID-19, so their strategy works. Sweden didn't report cases on one day, but that was because reporting was delayed. So there were new death cases on that day. The report leaves out this context

Ivan Arias, Bolivian Minister of Public Works, Services and Housing claims “[citizens] have to remove [their beards and mustaches] for their health and that of their families”, in order to protect themselves from Covid-19 There is no scientific support that affirms that the beard and the moustache are places of reproduction of the coronavirus.

An Egyptian cleaning worker died while working, wihtout knowing that he had Covid-19. Misbar checked the image and found it misleading, as it belongs to a Moroccan, not Egyptian, sanitation worker, and it was published on May 30 on Moroccan pages. Also, Misbar found an interview with him on the Chouf Moroccan channel, and he talked about the story of the incident and said that he fell while working because he suffers from hernia.

COVID-19 is not new and an old textbook gives out its treatment. The textbook does mentions the details of coronavirus but it is not related to COVID-19. Other strains of coronavirus existed from before but COVID-19 is a new strain in the coronavirus family. Its vaccine is not created as of now but clinical trials are undergoing.

Wearing a face mask caused a 19-year-old grocery store worker to be hospitalized for an lung infection, due to breathing in her own carbon dioxide and bacteria. A highly viral anonymous message circulating on Facebook makes numerous claims about face mask safety that have previously been shown to be unsupported by scientific evidence. Face mask filters are large enough to allow gas molecules such as carbon dioxide and oxygen to pass through freely, hence wearing a face mask is extremely unlikely to lead to hypercapnia. There is no scientific basis for the claim that breathing in one’s exhaled bacteria leads to infection.

Publications on social networks that claims that a coronavirus outbreak after the protests in the Barrio de Salamanca, Madrid, Spain. It is a hoax. The number of coronavirus infections reported in the last two weeks has decreased in the Salamanca district, Madrid, Spain.
The video of terrible conditions of a COVID-19 ward is from Delhi’s hospital. The video of the terrible conditions of the COVID-19 ward is from Mumbai city's hospital.

Video shows 106 dead bodies in Delhi’s Loknayak hospital, in India. The video which is going viral with the claim that it has been shot at the Lok Nayak Jayaprakash Narayan Hospital of New Delhi is actually of a hospital in Mumbai.

Deaths in Brazil by pneumonia are registered as COVID-19. The cause of the death is informed only after testing have a result. In that way, no person that died from pneumonia was registered as a casualty of COVID-19.

A picture claiming that Lidl is offering free shopping vouchers for €180 in Italy. The initiative is actually a phishing campaign, and it has nothing to do with Lidl. Consumers are not going to receive any free voucher from Lidl.
There were no COVID-19 deaths in Fortaleza, Brazil, on May 29. COVID-19 deaths are not immediately registered. On June 1, there were 20 confirmed COVID-19 deaths in Fortaleza as of May 29.

The use of masks for COVID-19 causes hypoxia. Edgar González Barreno, academic coordinator of the Community Medicine Program at the Rafael Landívar University and master in Public Health and Epidemiology interviewed by Fáctica, assured that a mask could not generate hypoxia in a person.
The COVID-19 pandemic caused the death of 0.003% of the world population. The numbers mentioned on the text are wrong.

The coronavirus ‘has been defeated with anti-inflammatories and anticoagulants’. In a video that went viral, one person claims that the coronavirus cure is ready. "It has been defeated," he says. But this is false, there is still no cure for COVID-19.
WHO has declared COVID-19 an endemic disease. The WHO has not stated that the coronavirus is endemic and the publications misrepresented statements by the organization's directors to affirm it.
“How many of you are aware that the female governor of Michigan is the niece of George Soros?” Gretchen Whitmer isn’t related to George Soros.
Photo of several members of the Government without maintaining social distance. The picture was not taken during the coronavirus crisis.
Orange, lemon and honey prevent from being infected by coronavirus. There is no food, drug or substance that can make people immune to Sars-Cov-2 as of publication.

The Spanish flu pandemic happened in 1914, before the First World War, according to the president of the Philippines Rodrigo Duterte. Contrary to Duterte’s claim, the Spanish flu outbreak began in 1918, four years after WWI started.

Egyptian actor Amir Karara was infected with Covid-19. Misbar verified the news which turned out to be false, as the actor Ahmed Salah Hosni confirmed in a tweet on Twitter that Amir Karara is in good health.

The CARES law dedicated to aid, recovery and economic security under the Covid-19 pandemic was submitted to the US House of Representatives, a year before the virus was discovered. Misbar verified the claim and found it misleading. The bill submitted to the US House of Representatives on January 24, 2019 does not include any reference to the coronavirus pandemic.

Morocco is studying the possibility of canceling Eid Al-Adha due to Covid-19. Misbar verified the news and found that it was misleading, as Moroccan Minister of Endowments, Ahmed Tawfiq, did not talk about the possibility of canceling the Eid al-Adha holiday in the Kingdom because of COVID-19. Rather, he said, it is still too early to talk about the occasion, and that no one knows what will happen.

Tuob, or the practice of inhaling steam from a basin of infused water while covering one’s head, is a cure or medication for COVID-19. Tuob does not kill SARS-CoV-2, the virus that causes COVID-19, said the Department of Health (DOH). The World Health Organization also said there is no known drug or preventive treatment for COVID-19.

Lionel Messi said “there was a planetary coup d’etat” with the coronavirus pandemic. There are no records that the player has made those statements in any media, nor did he publish that phrase on any of his official social networks.

A photo from the funeral of a recently deceased Sri Lankan politician, Arumugam Thondaman, has been shared thousands of times in multiple Facebook posts. The posts claim the image shows one of Thondaman’s daughters violated Sri Lanka’s mandatory coronavirus quarantine policy for travelers by attending the ceremony shortly after returning to the country from overseas. The claim is false; the image shows Thondaman’s other daughter, who resides in Sri Lanka and did not travel from abroad to attend the funeral.

A Facebook page posted that temporary hospitals in Guatemala would be closed, as people diagnosed with COVID-19 could isolate themselves at home. A statement they attributed to an authority in the Ministry of Health. The Ministry of Health denied having given these statements and explained that those who can stay home are those diagnosed with COVID-19, who are asymptomatic.

Video shows the Mexican Air Force throwing bodies of people infected with COVID-19 on the beaches of Acapulco. This video has been in circulation since 2018, it has nothing to do with deaths by COVID-19 and it was not even recorded in Mexico.

Facebook posts questioning the existence of the coronavirus, as no supermarket employee has been infected in the world. There are hundreds of COVID-19 deaths among supermarket workers in the US, as well as in the UK, France, Belgium.
Coronavirus stays in the throat for four days. Post claiming coronavirus stays in a throat for four days is fake, doctors denied this claim.

Egypt finds the cure for COVID-19, which is Redmisivir and starts manufacturaing the drug to distribute it to the public. Representative of the Egyptian Minister of Health said the claim is misinformation to Fatabyyano. Redmisivir is manufactured by an american inc. called Gilead science.
COVID-19 is the common flu, and the cure for coronavirus pneumonia is easy and cheap. COVID-19 is more dangerous than the flu. So far, there is no proven cure for COVID-19.

Multiple Facebook posts shared thousands of times by Filipino Facebook users make several false claims about a future vaccine for COVID-19, the disease caused by the novel coronavirus. The posts also make claims about a link between a potential vaccine and the rollout of 5G technology. The claims are all false, according to health experts.

The image of an intubated baby with a large chest scar has been shared tens of thousands of times on Facebook, with claims that the infant had recently survived heart surgery before testing positive for the novel coronavirus. This is misleading: the pictured baby had heart surgery in 2012 and the now seven-year-old child does not have COVID-19, his parents say.

WHO introduces online tests to detect new cases of Covid-19 in Egypt. The World Health Organization denied what was reported on social media about its creation of a diagnostic tool for COVID-19 online.
The fire incident at Rohini flyover in Delhi, India is caused by hand sanitiser. Fire incident was not caused by hand sanitiser in the car.

COVID-19 can be cured with eucalyptus oil. The effectiveness of eucalyptus oil in treating COVID-19 still needs further investigation. So far, research shows that Eucalyptus, a plant that is the raw material for eucalyptus oil, is indeed effective in killing the coronavirus. However, the study did not involve the coronavirus that causes COVID-19, SARS-CoV-2, but another type of coronavirus. Thus, Eucalyptus cannot be called a COVID-19 drug.
Tamil Nadu (India) government approved Thanikasalam Siddha medicine for COVID-19. Tamil Nadu government has clarified that it has not approved any such drug for treating COVID-19.
Video shows migrants looting food packets at Hyderabad Railway station, in India. The video is, in fact, from Delhi. The incident took place at the old Delhi station, not in Hyderabad.

Coronavirus can be sexually transmitted. According to WHO, there is no evidence that COVID-19 is transmitted through semen or vaginal fluids. But it is too soon to know. However, it can be passed on through kissing and close contact.
Image claims that a family committed suicide in Jodhpur, India with its picture going viral during lockdown. The viral post shows the incident that happened in 2017. It is not related to lockdown.

A picture that shows black bags, allegedely containing corpses of COVID-19 victims, which is considered to be “not authentic” because the bags are easily carried with one hand. The picture was taken in Miami (Florida) during a protest against the mismanagement of the health crisis by the US government. Therefore, the bags do not contain corpses, but the picture itself was not doctored: the scene was purposefully staged.

In recent days, a chain circulated through WhatsApp that urged entering the page colombia.ayudas.xyz to be a beneficiary of government aid. This message is a phishing attempt. It is a trick to get those who access the link on that page to enter data such as name, phone number and ID number, in order to compile information that can then be used for criminal purposes, according to Colonel Luis Atuesta, chief of the Cyber Center of the National Police.
Salaries of deputies in Guatemala are suspended due to the COVID-19 crisis. Authorities confirmed that the salaries have not been suspended.
Ivermectin is a drug that cures and prevents COVID-19. Neither ivermectin nor any other drug has been proven effective against the SARS-COV-2 coronavirus that causes COVID-19.

A video purporting to show several dead bodies lying beside coronavirus patients in a hospital ward has been viewed thousands of times in multiple posts on Facebook and Twitter alongside a claim it was filmed in the Indian capital of Delhi. The claim is misleading; the footage in fact shows the King Edward Memorial Hospital in Mumbai; it has circulated in several reports about the hospital’s COVID-19 ward.

Man seen in viral images was a COVID-19 patient who fell in love with his lady doctor. The two got engaged in the same hospital in Egypt. The pictures are part of a pre-wedding photo shoot. The couple has been engaged since 2018. Neither of them are infected with coronavirus.

Italian politician asked to take Bill Gates to the International Criminal Court. Sara Cunial's speech to the Italian parliament on the management of COVID-19 went viral. But it is full of misinformation and conspiracy theories.

CO2 emissions have been reduced by 8% in the first four months of 2020 because of COVID-19 related lockdowns. The Norwegian-based International Climate Research Center confirms through a peer-reviewed study that tons of CO2 in the atmosphere decreased between January and April. But there are claims that are not entirely true.

Mayor of El Espinal, Colombia ‘bought false tests for COVID-19’. According to the Invima list, the tests carried out in the Tolimense municipality are allowed and fall into the category of "rapid test".

Facebook posts shared thousands of times accuse authorities of lining the streets with empty body bags in a bid to fool people about the “fake” novel coronavirus pandemic. But the claim is false: the photo was taken at a US protest against the government’s handling of the novel coronavirus crisis.

Dr Anthony Fauci said a COVID-19 vaccine must be delivered to people without ‘proper studies’ being carried out. This is untrue. Dr Fauci never said that the vaccine should be distributed before studies are carried out.

A video has been viewed tens of thousands of times in multiple posts on YouTube, Facebook and Twitter which claim it shows US infectious disease expert Dr. Anthony Fauci admitting vaccines are “toxic” and can “make you worse” during a press conference about the novel coronavirus. The claim is misleading; in the video, Fauci explains the importance of clinical trials to ensure potential vaccines against COVID-19 are effective. AFP has previously debunked multiple claims that vaccines are harmful.

Coronavirus was created artificially. Actually, people are dying from the effects of 5G technology, according to Leonard Caldwell. The coronavirus has a natural origin. 5G technology has nothing to do with COVID-19.

A photo of a woman wearing an alleged body bag with only one hand is shared as a proof that the pandemic has been faked. The photo is taken out of context; it shows a protest with fake body bags on the street in Miami.

Dr. Leonard Coldwell: coronavirus was created artificially for mass chipping. The interview is mostly a mixture of manipulative, false, and half-true statements that are not supported by facts and modern science. Leonard Caldwell himself is a controversial figure in the literal sense — he contradicts even himself throughout the speech in the video being analyzed. The doctor is presented as an authority in medicine, but many of his achievements are doubtful and not proven

Multiple Facebook posts shared hundreds of times claim that Bill Gates’ “ultimate goal” is to “microchip the [COVID-19] vaccine” to create “virtual IDs”. The posts also claim the billionaire philanthropist was in New Zealand in May and June 2020 “to test and trial the COVID-19 vaccine”. Both claims are false; a Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation spokesperson dismissed the purported link between Gates and microchips; as of June 24, New Zealand authorities say there is no record of Gates visiting the country in 2020.

A WHO conference with no distancing, no gloves, no masks. Misbar checked the image circulated and found it misleading, because the picture is old, before the emergence of the COVID-19, as a global pandemic.

The Palestinian Ministry of Health publishes a segmented map of Palestine in proportion to the terms of the deal of the century. "This is an epidemiological map of the spread of COVID-19 in the West Bank, including Jerusalem, and the Gaza Strip, and not a historical or political map, as it indicates the number of infections in each governorate", says the director of the Information Department of the Palestinian Ministry of Health, Muhammad al-Awawda.
The Italian parliament has called on to arrest Bill Gates. The Italian parliament has never made such an official statement. The call to arrest Gates is the private initiative of an Italian MP.

The coronavirus is a bacterium that causes thrombosis, Italy defeated the disease and you should take Aspirine, Apronax, zinc and in general drugs that lower your blood pressure. It's a virus and causes a lung disease, thrombosis can be a complication. Self-medication is not possible.

Russian historian Andrey Fursov discusses the world after COVID-19. In this speech, among other things, he states that lockdown is the violation of human rights and that there is an epidemic of panic rather than a viral pandemic. This speech is full of misinformation statements. Lockdown measures are essential to curb the spread of the coronavirus, which poses risk to human lives.

An excerpt from a document from the Ministry of Health with the following message: “This document of March 5, from the Government of Spain, requires nursing homes to keep the elderly with COVID-19 symptoms, locked in their rooms, preventing them from going to the hospital to be treated. So they died alone! Tremendous! “ It is a hoax: this document is real, but it does not say that the confinement of the elderly in their rooms meant that they couldn't be taken them to the hospital.
Bill Gates, Melinda Gates, Anthony Fauci and the WHO are being charged with genocide. Bill Gates, Melinda Gates, Anthony Fauci and the WHO are not being charged with genocide.

A video which would show that the Immuni app (the application for contact tracing sponsored by the Italian government) is already active on our smartphones and, therefore, Italian people are being traced without their consent. This information is not correct. The Italian government hasn't released the Immuni app yet, and therefore it is not active and Italian people are not being traced. The interface presented as evidence in the video is real and it was developed by Google and Apple, but in order to be activated it needs the support of a governmental application, such as the Immuni app.
Chewing raw onions can cure coronavirus. The World Health Organization (WHO) and the Ghana Food and Drugs Authority (FDA) have dismissed the claim as false.
A vaccine for the coronavirus has been discovered. The World Health Organization (WHO) has said the claim is not true.
Vickvaporub eliminates coronavirus. Vicks Vaporub does not cure coronavirus.
An Italian deputy says that 96 percent of the deaths of coronavirus are for other diseases. The data is false and the deputy mislead the conclusion of a study.

A study by Bartomeu Payeras i Cifre shows a direct correlation between 5G networks and COVID-19 outbreaks and “demonstrates clearly the most likely probability that the COVID-19 hypoxic injuries and hospital admissions are directly related to electromagnetic radiation exposure by 5G networks”. Despite presenting himself as a biologist, Bartomeu Payeras i Cifre is actually a Spanish painter, and there is no record of scientific publications by him in the scholarly databases of PubMed and Google Scholar, except for two publications on marine microbiology in the 1970s. The COVID-19 pandemic is caused by the virus SARS-CoV-2. There is no data demonstrating a causal link between 5G rollout in the world and the global COVID-19 pandemic. For example, 5G is not available in the hardest hit regions of France and Italy.

COVID-19 is just common flu and was produced to make a profit. COVID-19 is different from the common cold. This disease is caused by a new coronavirus, SARS-CoV-2. There is also no scientific evidence to suggest that the coronavirus that causes COVID-19 is an artificial virus for commercial purposes.

Facebook post claims that the Latvian app Apturi Covid (Stop Covid) which was created to warn people who have been close to  an infected person, will be used so the government can track all the people from the contact list and record their locations. The app does not record prople in your contacts list or trace their locations, it is created just for epidemiological reasons to warn people who have been in close distance with infected persons. The app is completely voluntary.

Indian PM Narendra Modi has been selected as new chairmant of WHO. There is no such post as Chairman of WHO. Besides, the Indian health minister had been appointed as chair of the WHO executive board.
The fifth phase of lockdown will be more harsh and strict in the state of Gujrat, India. Gujarat Chief Minister Vijay Rupani himself ruled out such messages as baseless and untrue.

India’s Home Ministry has given permission to reopen schools and educational institutions across India. The viral screenshot is digitally edited. No such permission has been given by the Home Ministry to reopen educational institutions.

A female overseas Filipino worker (OFW) in Saudi Arabia was beheaded after testing positive for COVID-19, the disease caused by the novel coronavirus. The news clip embedded was from a 2015 report by GMA News – way before an outbreak of the novel coronavirus was first reported in Wuhan, China in December 2019.

In Italy, the cure for Coronavirus is finally found. Italy has not found the cure for the novel coronavirus. COVID-19 is caused by a virus, not bacteria. While the symptoms of COVID-19 can be treated with anticoagulants and anti-inflammatories, they are not a cure for the disease itself.

An article claiming that wearing protective masks in open spaces would have severe collateral effects that could eventually lead to cancer. Even though wearing protective masks for a long period of time increases the levels of carbon dioxide we breath, they are not dangerous and do not lead to cancer or other health problems.

5G towers have a ‘VOC 19’ component and cause coronavirus. In a video, a person claims to display a component called "VOC 19" inside a circuit board of a 5G tower. But it really shows a TV set-top box. Also 5G has nothing to do with COVID-19

An article states that Moderna found a vaccine for COVID-19, and it will produce a billion doses by December. Moderna is currently testing a vaccine with positive results. However, the vaccine is not ready yet, and the "billion doses" are just a projection, a possibility which still needs to be studied and implemented.

A picture, allegedly published by the press agency Adnkronos, shows a passenger car with the inscription: “COVID-19 deportation plan”. The picture is real, but is has been modified in order to add the inscription. The picture actually represents a passenger car which, in case of necessity, could be turned into an emergency hospital.
Portuguese energy company Galp is offering 3 months of free fuel to “help the needy”. It is not true that the oil company is offering free fuel to help poor people.
South Sudan had recorded 481 COVID-19 cases by May 20, after the announcement of 134 new cases in Juba. Data from the World Health Organisation shows that South Sudan had 282 cases at this point.

United States has given the Ugandan government USD 25 million to pay every adult USD25 a month for 3 months. USD 15 million will be used to respond to COVID-19, while USD 10 million was given to a nonprofit for direct cash transfers to the needy.

A Facebook post claiming that the Ugandan government is offering grants to local businesses in an effort to cushion its citizens against the effects of COVID-19 has been shared hundreds of times. The claim is false; the Facebook post appears on a page impersonating Uganda’s finance ministry. The ministry has flatly denied partnering with any organisation for purposes of offering grants to Ugandan entrepreneurs in the ongoing pandemic.
Migrants traveling to their homes from Mumbai during lockdown. Video is from Delhi's Anandvihar and not from Mumbai.
Scientists develop a vaccine that cures COVID-19 in three days. There is no vaccine for COVID-19 as of publication.

São Paulo’s governor João Doria said 215 countries have cases of COVID-19. As there is only 193 countries, the speech of the governor shows the numbers of pandemic are made up. The number said by São Paulo's governor is the same as displayed by WHO. That includes full recognition countries and areas that are partially recognized by countries.
Man found alive in burial bag in the Brazilian state of Bahia. The news is from 2014 and has nothing to do with the new coronavirus pandemic.

A post claims the plastic packaging containing COVID-19 masks began to decompose under the influence of chemicals in the masks. Masks do not affect the decomposition of the package. The package on the video is a biodegradable Oriflame package that decomposes itself within a few years, as claimed by the company.
Mumbai and Pune is going under military lockdown Post claiming Mumbai and Pune is not going under military lockdown is fake.

Rio de Janeiro’s City Hall revised data after Federal Police operation and decreased 1,177 deaths from official COVID-19 records. The discrepancy doesn't result from a review carried out at the behest of the Federal Police, but from the Municipal Health Department having decided to publicize the count of the number of burials in which the death certificate brings the disease as the cause of death. Before, the agency considered the occurrences confirmed by laboratory tests, just as the state government does.
Video shows a bank manager being fined for not wearing a mask in Bihar, India. The video is not from Bihar. It is actually from Rajasthan. It is falsely shared with the wrong claim.

Images show that Congress party ex-president Rahul Gandhi’s interaction with migrants was a preplanned photo-op Images of the interaction are being shared with wrong claim. The car in which the migrant seen seated was arranged by the congress party to send these migrants home.

An article stating that Moderna vaccines had “catastrophic results”. It is true that some people who took part in the vaccine trial suffered from side effects, but the vaccine is overall considered to be promising.

An Instagram post claims Microsoft founder Bill Gates said up to 700,000 people could die from a COVID-19 vaccine. The claim is false. Mr Gates makes no such statement that as many as 700,000 could die or be injured by a COVID-19 vaccine.

COVID-19 tests can be purchased to do the test at home with sanitary guarantees. The COVID-19 self-diagnostic tests are not authorized in Spain and this type of tests can only be used by healthcare professionals.

A blog article affirming that, since only 3,9% of Italian deceased patients who tested positive for the new coronavirus didn’t present any previous pathology, than COVID-19 can’t be defined as a “pandemic”. According to an Istat report, people who died of COVID-19 who didn't present pre-existing conditions amount to 4,1% of the total (data based on a sample of 3032 patients). However, the information has been misinterpreted: COVID-19 is a pandemic, and the mortality rate in Italy has increased by 49% in March if compared with the average of the five previous years.
Google has installed a secret app in phones to spy users. Google publicly announced the creation of an API in April to help tracking COVID-19.

One person has been stabbed during a protest against the government in the neighbourhood of Moratalaz in Madrid. According to Emergencias Madrid, the National Police and a district youth assembly there were two injured people, none by a knife.

An image of the Argentinian president, Alberto Fernández, with the governor of Tucuman (Argentina), Juan Manzur, that was taken during the quarantine. The image was taken last year during a party event to promote the candidacy of the then presidential candidate.

Italian doctors discovered that COVID-19 causes thrombosis instead of pneumonia by doing autopsies on the dead, which is prohibited by the WHO. According to an alleged newspaper article circulating on Facebook and WhatsApp, Italian doctors "disobeyed the order" not to perform autopsies on those who died from the new coronavirus, but there is no such mandate either from the international organization or from the Ministry of Health of that European country. On the other hand, it is not true that the respiratory disease of the SARS-CoV-2 coronavirus causes pulmonary thrombosis and not pneumonia: it can also cause thrombosis.
The cure for coronavirus: acetaminophen and gargling mouthwash. Acetaminophen doesn't cure coronavirus.
A Bolivian doctor found the cure for the novel coronavirus. The treatment that the doctor suggests is misleading because the virus does not express in same way in all patients.

Itapemirim, a bus company in Brasil, has declared bankrupcy due to lack of passengers during the COVID-19 crisis The company did not declare bankruptcy during the pandemic, although it is undergoing a judicial reorganization process since 2016.

The number of COVID-19 deaths in Ceará state, Brazil, fell by 90% after an operation by the federal police to investigate frauds with the death toll. Although the number of deaths decreased by 60% between May 25 and May 27, this kind of oscillation is quite common in a day to day analysis, and do not reflect, necessarily, a downward trend. Also, the federal police operation was about alledged mishandling of COVID-19-related funds by the municipal administration of Fortaleza, and had nothing to do with death registers, which are maintained by the Ceará state government.
Ceará police shot a surfer who was breaking lockdown on a beach in Fortaleza, Brazil. Although the video is real, it was shot in Costa Rica, not in Brazil.

The enhanced community quarantine or ECQ in several regions and cities in the Philippines has been extended until 6/15/2020. This is not true. The false post is an edited infographic originally uploaded April 24 by Nueva Ecija TV48 on its official Facebook (FB) page.

Tocilizumab is a drug that can cure 90% of COVID-19 patients, including critical patients. Research on the effectiveness of these joint pain medications in the care of COVID-19 patients is still being conducted by a number of scientists, both in China and in the US.

A Youtube video shared on facebook claimed that Lithuanian Health Minister banned a “cure from COVID-19” from Lithuania. The video claimed that hydroxychloroquine is a proven cure for COVID-19. Thus an order by the minister not to sell it without perscription was portrayed as a ban on "cure for COVID-19".

An article shared on Facebook claimed that the virus is fake and proven only by faulty testing. A claim that faulty testing is the only proof for pandemic is disproven by data from earlier weeks, where rate of confirmed cases greatly surpasses error rate for false positives states in the article.

Kerala government is providing free quarantine service only to religious minorities. The claims are baseless and were made by using edited screenshots of Janam TV's broadcast. We have confirmed with government officials about the scheme who have refuted it. We contacted Janam TV, who informed us that their graphics have been used for fake propaganda and they haven't published any such news.

Philippines President Rodrigo Duterte claimed in a late night address that Ormoc City Mayor Richard Gomez said he would not accept anyone returning from elsewhere to enter the city. Ormoc City Mayor Gomez only complained about the national government’s lack of coordination with the local government and did not say he was going to refuse the returning residents.

The mayor of Barranquilla, Colombia, said that the district has more ICUs per 100,000 inhabitants than Germany. Also that Barranquilla and Santa Marta together have more ICU beds than Peru. The city's mayor said the district has more ICUs per 100,000 inhabitants than Germany, which is true. Also that Barranquilla and Santa Marta together have more ICU beds than Peru, but this is not true.
Asymptomatic infected people “do not infect” other people. There is no scientific evidence that asymptomatic infected people "do not infect" other people.

COVID-19 is primarily a circulatory disease and can be cured without intensive care and use of respirators, a widely spread claim suggests. While experience shows that COVID-19 does indeed lead to an increased tendency for blood clots, two Danish researchers cannot say that the disease should be primarily a circulatory disease. Nor do they believe that there is evidence that the intensive care can be avoided with the treatment mentioned in the post.

A Kenyan Facebook page bearing the name and image of Kakamega Governor Wycliffe Oparanya with a post claiming to offer cash relief of Ksh15,000 to Kenyans in distress as a result of the COVID-19 pandemic. Governor Oparanya has disowned the page and said he is not giving out COVID-19 grants on Facebook.

Scientists in the United States have discovered a coronavirus cure “that works 100 percent”. Scientists at Sorrento Therapeutics have discovered an antibody that is effective in blocking the virus that causes COVID-19, and not a cure as claimed.

Ameera al-Taweel, a former Saudi princess and philanthropist, has partnered with the World Health Organization (WHO) to give out COVID-19 relief money on social media. There is no evidence showing that either the World Health Organization or Ameera aI-TaweeI are giving away money on Facebook.

Italian doctors have confirmed that COVID-19 is a bacterial disease and not caused by a virus as claimed by a number of authorities. Scientific and medical evidence shows that COVID-19 is caused by a viral infection.

French meterologists announced an historically hot summer with waves of heat. While this summer may be hotter than the previous ones, French meteorologists can't predict it as soon as May, and just said heat waves were possible.

The contact-tracing app “StopCovid” is installed on the sly on users’ phones. Privacy and contact tracing settings does exist but are related to Android and iOS operating systems, and are not related to the StopCovidinfo made by the government.

The COVID-19 lockdown measures were a waste of time. It caused more deaths than it saved. The lockdown has reduced COVID-19 burden on the healthcare system and was an effective measure in the fight against COVID-19.

Photo of a Syrian doctor who was beaten by the quarantined in a quarantine center in Damascus. Misbar checked the image, and found that it is not for a Syrian doctor, but rather for the Lebanese doctor, Muhammad Idibi, from the Tibnin Governmental Hospital, who was beaten inside the hospital's campus after providing advice that did not satisfy the patient, according to Ya Sur News, who published the image on August 18, 2019.

Image showing how roads to Dubai are covered with sand due to the spread of coronavirus and the imposition of curfews. Misbar checked the image, and found that it was showing one of the sand-covered roads in the Emirate of Dubai. However, the reason for this is not due to the application of the precautionary measures to prevent the spread of COVID-19, but rather due to a sandstorm that struck that area in early May.

The Japanese government will finance part of the costs of travelers to it in order to encourage tourism after the end of the coronavirus pandemic. Misbar verified the story and found it to be false. As the official Japanese tourism agency explained in its Twitter account, the Japanese government’s plan to finance part of the travelers’ expenses applies to trips inside Japan only.

COVID-19 is in reality the result of inflammation cause by a bacterium and therefore that can be cured by use of antibiotics. The Italian study which is being used as the source for the claim in question made no reference to COVID-19 being a bacterial infection.

Clarín anticipated the pandemic of the virus that caused COVID-19 in 2003. The image of a newspaper note circulating on Facebook was taken out of context and does not refer to the new coronavirus, which was identified in late 2019 in China.

“Vaccines are dangerous,” says the German homeopathic organisation Ärzte für Aufklärung, which campaigns against the coronary measures and against vaccines. They give four cases on her website that would show that vaccines can be dangerous. Three of the four cases are misleading, one is uncertain. Three of the four cases are misleading, one is uncertain.
Rahul Gandhi has suggested a possible way to reopen schools/colleges. The tweet is fake.

Vitamin supplements will protect you against COVID-19. The idea that dietary supplements "strengthen" our immune system is not new, but has found more echo during the coronavirus pandemic. Unfortunately, there is insufficient evidence to support it.

If we use the masks for too long, we risk developing a tumor. According to an "independent researcher" the masks cause hypercapnia preparing our body to have a tumor. Certified masks are made to avoid hypercapnia, otherwise the doctors and nurses who use it every day should always feel bad.

Rio de Janeiro’s mayor, Marcelo Crivella, announced a plan to start reopening commerce and services on June 1st, including schools. This plan is just a proposal made by business associations, not an actual government plan. There will be no reopening on June 1st.

A video shows a man being rescued, alive, from inside a tomb. The caption states he was buried alive, after being declared dead of COVID-19. This video is from January 2019, and, therefore, not COVID-19 related. The man entered his father's tomb to bid him farewell, after he was not able to attend to the funeral. He got trapped inside, though, and needed assistance to get out of the tomb.
