Bing Liu, a researcher who was about to discover a vaccine for COVID-19, was murdered in the US. Although a researcher named Bing Liu was killed in the US on May, he was not about to discover a vaccine for COVID-19. Instead, he was a computer scientist who was working with biologists on a research "towards understanding the cellular mechanisms of COVID-19 infection", according to the BBC. Authorities in the US claim that there's "zero evidence" the crime had anything to do with the research.

Video shows Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) members paying respect to doctors in Aurangabad, Maharashtra, India. The video is, in fact, from Surat, Gujarat. It is being falsely shared with the wrong claim.
Video shows a huge crowd of women rushing in a mall in Saudi Arabia after the COVID-19 lockdown was lifted. The video is from 2019. This old video is being falsely shared as a recent incident.

Maharashtra (India) Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari facilitated the travel of a model from Maharashtra to Dehradun during the COVID-19 lockdown. The letter to facilitate the travel was issued by Himachal Pradesh Governor's office. Maharashtra Governor has filed a complaint against the web portal for publishing fake news.

Hydroxychloroquine (HCQ) was developed by an Indian scientist named Prafulla Chandra Ray. Hydroxychloroquine ware first synthesized in the mid-1940s during World War Two. Ray had no direct connection with the discovery or manufacture of hydroxychloroquine.

A viral video of about 20 minutes long about the masks and the coronavirus uploaded to the YouTube channel of the family doctor Natalia Prego Cancelo. The video makes a dozen false claims about wearing masks about the possible harmful effects of wearing masks. The WHO recommends the use of masks.

An image of a surgical mask with various messages. The main one is that using it makes you breathe your own carbon dioxide. It's a hoax. The masks are not watertight: air enters through the sides and top and with that air oxygen enters and carbon dioxide is eliminated.
People given Murga punishment in Uttar Pradesh, viral during lockdown. Viral Video of people performing Murga Punishment has no connection with UP Police, this incident is from Pakistan.
Goverment to announce Military Lockdown in Mumbai and Pune Maharashtra government has no plan to enforce military lockdown in Mumbai and Pune.

In a mall in Saudi Arabia, there was a sale and as soon as the shutter was opened, many women entered together flouting social distancing norms. The video was uploaded on the internet in December 2019 and has no relation to the current lockdown. It was revived after Saudi Arabia eased lockdown restrictions from April 25, 2020.

C5N released foreign images of the coronavirus as if they were local In recent days, at the appointed time, the channel did not publish those images, but instead put other titles - some related to the coronavirus and others not - on the air.

A photo of a person with several puncture wounds on their arm has been shared hundreds of times in multiple Facebook posts that claim China and Iran were hit by a deadly insect “pandemic” during the coronavirus crisis. The claim is false; this photo has circulated in reports about a series of hornet attacks in China in 2013 -- almost seven years before the novel coronavirus was first detected.

Multiple online articles and social media posts published in May 2020 claim the Japanese government is set to subsidise trips for foreign tourists visiting the country by up to half of the cost after it lifts its coronavirus lockdown. The claim is misleading; on May 27, 2020, the Japanese government clarified the plan will only apply to Japanese residents making domestic travel, adding the details of the policy are still being finalised.

A Facebook post listing COVID-19 “survival rates” as 99.983% for the US,  99.956% for Spain, 99.944% for Germany, 99.957% for Italy,” 99.9655 for France, 99.972 for the UK and 99.75% for Russia. The claim is false. An epidemiologist advises that the percentage of a population that has not died from COVID-19 is not a “survival rate” and calculation of a survival rate would vary depending on what definition of illness is used.

Masks cause hypoxia or oxygen deficiency and also poisoning by inhalation of CO2. The masks can produce a sensation of difficulty when breathing, but they normally allow the entry of oxygen and the elimination of carbon dioxide.

“We’re down near the low end of per capita deaths … Most places are at 60 deaths per 100,000. We’re at 29.” Recent data from Johns Hopkins University shows the U.S. has had approximately 30 COVID-19 deaths per 100,000 people. Kernen got that basically right. But only a handful of countries are performing worse by that metric, and even fewer — three — have recorded more than 60 deaths per 100,000 people. Various databases show the U.S. has more COVID-19 deaths per capita than the vast majority of countries.

According to an Italian MP, Bill Gates had millions of women in Africa sterilized and “caused” a polio epidemic that paralyzed 500,000 children in India. The allegations are false. Bill Gates didn´t had millions of women in Africa sterilized "and caused" a polio epidemic that paralyzed 500,000 children in India.
The Gates Foundation wall has a sign of “center for the global reduction of the human population”. The image that circulates on social networks has been manipulated.

The French StopCovid App is tracking all your contacts, hence “you should delete my phone number if I’m in your phone’s contact”. The StopCovid app doesn't have access to the contact details registered in your phone.

A statement attributed to the Coordinating Committee of Agricultural, Commercial, Industrial and Financial Associations, from Guatemala, circulated on social networks, which guaranteed a convocation to a caravan against the measures that President Alejandro Giammattei has taken due to the COVID-19 pandemic. The Coordinating Committee dissociated itself from the motorcade that did take place.
The coronavirus is a bacteria which expands with 5G. The virus is not a bacteria and has no relation with 5G.

A video showing the corpses of three kids being placed in one body bag is claimed to be taken in Wuhan during its second wave of the COVID-19 outbreak. This is false. First, there is no proof the video was taken in Wuhan. Second, the clip has been circulating as early as February, rendering false the suggestion that it indicates a “second wave” situation.

A mix of warm water and salt can eliminate the Coronavirus. Gargling with salt water can indeed ease a sore throat, which is one of the symptoms of COVID-19. However, COVID-19 patients not only experience these symptoms. According to WHO, there is no evidence to suggest that salt water can eliminate the coronavirus in the body.

During the quarantine, the Black Pope died, Bill Gates was arrested, Benjamin Netanyahu was convicted of spreading the coronavirus, and Vladimir Putin and the FSB are arresting governors. The audio is a series of manipulations and adjusted facts that are not related to each other, and some of them are not even related to the coronavirus. The Pope (neither black nor white) did not die, the former head of the Jesuits died. Netanyahu is being tried on corruption charges, and the quarantine in Dagestan continues. Bill Gates again has nothing to do with it. All this is just another round of conspiracy theory.

A photo shows the installation of a hidden 5G antenna. The actual image was captured by photographer James S. Wood in Tucson, Arizona, in 2009, before the fifth generation of mobile telephony was implemented.

Bill Gates said ‘thousands of people will die with the COVID-19 vaccine’ The creator of Microsoft did talk about a possible vaccine, but did not mention deaths, but instead discussed its possible side effects and the difficulties in massifying it.

Qatar canceled all Air India Flights in their Vande Bharat Mission (Tto bring back Indian citizen from Qatar). The Embassy of India in Doha expressed that a few media channels were making a baseless claim about flight IX-374 from Doha to Thiruvananthapuram being canceled because of differences over landing and handling charges. None of it is true.

The Taiwan government will lift the mask-rationing plan on June 1. The price will rise from 5 to 7-12 New Taiwan Dollar per mask. On June 1. the Taiwanese government lifted a ban on the sale and exporting of domestic surgical masks. In the meantime, the government has kept requisitioning 8 million domestically produced masks per day for the mask-rationing program.

“According to the CDC, so far this year, Florida has had 1,762 deaths from COVID-19 and 5,185 from pneumonia. Average pneumonia deaths in Florida from 2013-2018 for the same time period are 918.” The CDC’s running tally of deaths for a given year can count multiple causes for each death. The single underlying cause is reflected in finalized year-end data issued the following year. The deaths in the 900 range refer to cases where pneumonia was the final underlying cause of death. But the number cited for 2020 includes deaths where pneumonia is one of the causes listed on the death certificate. Government officials have said that the national data on COVID-19 deaths is likely an undercount.

A video has been viewed thousands of times in multiple posts on Facebook and YouTube alongside a claim it shows an empty church in Italy after almost all of its congregants died from the novel coronavirus. The claim is false; the video shows a church in the US state of Mississippi during an online Easter service in April 2020.

A jail in Villavicencio, Colombia, has 95 percent of confirmed COVID-19 cases. Mayor Felipe Harman was right in the figure but did not clarify that he was talking about detected infections, which was important because the spread and detection measures are different inside and outside the prison.

An image of several bodies laying on the ground went viral on social media, where it is claimed that they are victims of the coronavirus in Ecuador. The image actually shows victims of a stampede in Saudi Arabia during hajj.

A chain message circulating through various social media communities in Buenaventura (Valle del Cauca, Colombia) claims that the city’s mayor, Víctor Hugo Vidal, received “the first complaint from the Office of the Attorney General for poor performance of functions (sic)” facing COVID-19. There was a “lack of authority and public administration,” says the publication. No ongoing investigation or inquiry against Vidal appears when searching on the website of the Office of the Attorney General of the Nation

Vaccines against the novel coronavirus are dangerous. Moreover, a mutation in the virus will make them ineffective. There is no vaccine against the new coronavirus yet. Moreover, mutations in the virus have little to no effect on the effectiveness of the vaccine.

Thaddée Ndikumana, Minister of Health of Burundi, contracted COVID-19. The denial was brought by an official from the Ministry of Health who attests that the Minister was in Kenya for treatment other than that of COVID-19.

Former interior secretary and 2016 presidential candidate Mar Roxas urged mass testing in light of the coronavirus pandemic, but also said those who fall sick should be brought to an island. He also supposedly chided medical frontliners and told them to do their jobs. There are no news reports from credible news organizations that carried this supposed quote by Roxas.

Sanitiser bottles inside a parked car triggered fire due to heat wave in Bhopal. The video claimed sanitisers are dangerous to keep inside a car and attributed the cause of fire to its alcoholic content. Citing scientific studies, it was disproved since summer heat peaks at 160 F (71.11 C) but a car would need to reach an internal temperature above 300 degrees Celsius (572 degrees Fahrenheit) to cause hand sanitizer to combust.

One of the people infected with the coronavirus in Egypt seeks to marry his doctor. Misbar verified the news and found it misleading, because the photo session belongs to two doctors who, in cooperation with the photographer Mohamed Salim, decided to seek the inspiration of hospital theme to document their celebration of the engagement.

German scientist claims chlorine dioxide can act against coronavirus. Chlorine dioxide does not cure COVID-19, there is no scientific evidence of its healing properties. This compound is used to disinfect surfaces and many governments consider it a substance that should not be drunk because it is dangerous to health.

A COVID-19 vaccination program is starting in Greece with the use of tuberculosis vaccine. The use of that vaccine for COVID-19 will be examined for efficacy in the context of a clinical trial, not a vaccination program.
Facebook user claims that Indian actor Aamir Khan announced a donation of 1kg bags of flour hiding 15,000 rupees each for poor families. The actor has denied the claim in a post on Twitter.

Qatar canceled all Air India Flights in their Vande Bharat Mission (Tto bring back Indian citizen from Qatar). The Embassy of India in Doha expressed that a few media channels were making a baseless claim about flight IX-374 from Doha to Thiruvananthapuram being canceled because of differences over landing and handling charges. None of it is true.

The Colombian city of Manizales had “its highest development peaks” after world wars. Not all the works he talks about were built with public resources, the city did not have to go into debt to rebuild the center, and an economist and historian agree that an economic crisis due to war cannot be compared to one due to a pandemic.
A lady police constable in Mumbai is suffering from coronavirus. The lady constable was not suffering from coronavirus but hypertension.

The coronavirus disease is caused by a bacterium that, in turn, causes thrombosis. Moreover, these bacteria get stronger under the influence of the 5G waves. COVID-19 is a viral disease that causes pneumonia and sometimes thrombosis. 5G has nothing to do with the new coronavirus spread.
Indian opposition leader Rahul Gandhi suggested that schools and colleges should reopen from 1st June on an odd-even basis. This is a fake tweet and Rahul Gandhi did not tweet any such news.

Indian politician Uddhav Thackeray has asked Christians to pray to Jesus to stop COVID-19. The video has been clipped from a longer video where Uddhav Thackeray, the Maharashtra CM was asking people of all faiths to pray from home and not only Christians.

A photo of Wilson Witzel, governor of Rio de Janeiro, having lunch at a restaurant by the sea. On the caption, it says that while the population of Rio is in lockdown, the governor is enjoying a fancy meal in Angra dos Reis. The photo was taken on May 2019. According to the press office of Rio de Janeiro's government, Witzel did not leave the capital since the crisis started.

An entire floor of Hospital Doutor João Lúcio Pereira Machado, in Manaus, Brazil, is empty after all the COVID-19 patients were cured. Although the number of patients did decrease and one particular room was cleared, it was not "the entire floor".

COVID-19 is a bacteria and not a virus according to a study by Italian doctors. The claims are baseless and were made by an unreliable Nigerian gossip website. The claims are medically inaccurate and misleading.

Video of Migrant workers escaping from a train carrying them to Assam in Nagaon, India by stopping the train. The video being shared is from Jalpaiguri in West Bengal and has got nothing to do with Assam.

Cannabis can cure COVID-19. There are no conclusive studies yet on the effect of cannabis on COVID-19 treatment. WHO has iterated that there is no evidence of a single medicine to treat COVID-19 currently.

Italy wants to charge Bill Gates with crimes against humanity. The call for Bill Gates to be charged with crimes against humanity was made by one independent member of parliament and does not represent the Italian government's position.
Migrant labourers in the state of Gujarat are protesting amidst the lockdown. The video of migrant labourers protesting is from the state of Telangana and not Gujarat.

Italy “went against the WHO’s ‘law’” against COVID-19 autopsies and “discovered covid is not a virus, but a bacterium” that “clots the blood and reduces the oxygen saturation.” Studies show COVID-19 is caused by the SARS-CoV-2 virus, not bacteria. The Italian Ministry of Health still identifies the disease as caused by a virus. WHO never “outlawed” autopsies of patients with COVID-19.

Photo shows governor of Rio de Janeiro having lunch at a restaurant in Angra dos Reis and disregarding the isolation measures. The photo used in the posts was recorded in May 2019, when the politician visited the city and participated in a police operation.

Video shows police officer shooting a surfer who disregards isolation measures in Fortaleza, capital of the Brazilian state of Ceará. The images were not recorded in Brazil, but in Playa Hermosa, Costa Rica, at the end of March 2020.

Man is buried alive in Brazil after being falsely diagnosed with COVID-19; video shows his rescue. The video that has been circulating in social media publications was recorded in January 2019 in Tarauacá (in the state of Acre) and shows the rescue of a man who invaded his father's grave and ended up being arrested.
The United Nations are promoting a website with a political and economic project called “New World Order”. It is a website owned by a private entity that has nothing to do with the United Nations.

Says the state “health secretary says don’t go to hospitals or clinics, now the tourism secretary says don’t recreate.” Tiffany claimed that Wisconsin officials asked residents not to recreate outdoors or go to the doctor. Officials from the Department of Health Services said that they recommended telehealth visits instead of in-person appointments, to combat the spread of COVID-19. Officials from the Department of Tourism said that they want residents to enjoy the outdoors, and have provided a toolkit to help them do it safely.

Claims that COVID-19 and quarantine are just a “circus” to hide and suppress yellow vests movement. Yellow vest protesters have no relation to the coronavirus. Besides their protests in Lithuania ended last year.

A predisposition to dementia increase the risk of a severe course of COVID-19. Researchers claim a link between positive COVID-19 tests and a particular gene that is more common in people with dementia. There were only 37 carriers out of 400,000 participants. You cannot draw any conclusions from this. In addition, it was not investigated whether these people developed a more severe form of COVID-19 after a positive test.

PCR Tests cannot show the novel coronavirus. Rapid tests currently in use have been developed to recognize antibodies that are released by the body when there is a COVID-19 infection, even though the level of accuracy is weak. While PCR tests with higher accuracy are used to find out the presence of the SARS-CoV-2 virus that causes COVID-19.

Dr. Rashid Buttar stating Dr. Anthony Fauci is responsible for causing the new Coronavirus pandemic; there are no deaths recorded caused by COVID-19. Fauci was one of many who warned of the possibility of a new pandemic, he did not cause it.

Mixing aspirin, paracetamol, honey and lemon cures COVID-19. A WhatsApp chain claims that the cure for the new coronavirus, discovered in Italy, is a mixture of two drugs, hot water and lemon. There is no scientific evidence that this is true. Do not self-medicate.
“You see suicide rates are skyrocketing now…” in the United States. There's no data to back claim of 'skyrocketing' suicides during shutdown.

A Facebook page, bearing the name and image of Kenyan Health Cabinet Secretary Mutahi Kagwe with a post claiming to offer cash relief of Ksh18,000 to Kenyans in distress as a result of the COVID-19 pandemic. Kenya’s Health Cabinet Secretary has disowned the Facebook page, stating that he is giving out relief money to Kenyans as an individual.

The Department of Social Welfare and Development (DSWD) in the Philippines is giving away P5,500 for every Facebook user due to the coronavirus crisis, according to a website link posted on Facebook. The DSWD did not release any announcement about giving cash to every Facebook user.

An image shared on social media claims vaccines are dangerous because they contain potassium chloride, the chemical used to stop the heart in lethal injections. This is misleading; it is a salt that is necessary for organs to function properly, and medical experts say the minimal amount used in vaccines will not harm recipients.

Italian doctors say coronavirus is bacteria. Thrombosis is a complication that can be seen in critical COVID-19 patients, but not the main cause of new coronavirus deaths. Antibiotics are not effective in treating COVID-19. Italian doctors did not share information about respiratory devices and intensive care units, as stated in the claim.
Shi Zhengli announced a new epidemic. Shi Zengli just explained what her job, as a virologist, was for - namely, preventing new epidemics. But she didn't announce any particular new viral hazard.

A study by Spanish biologist Bartomeu Payeras i Cifre proves that there is a connection between 5G and outbreaks of the coronavirus. The paper is not an official study, the author doesn't work at the University of Barcelona but is a 72 year old painter. His investigations have many errors and are not proving any connection between 5G and COVID-19.

96 percent of the people who died in Italy died of other causes than Covid-19. 96 percent of patients had underlying diseases, but the numbers don't demonstrate that COVID-19 is not the cause of death.

Chlorine dioxide healed 100 Covid-19 patients in Ecuador according to a study by Andreas Ludwig Kalcker. The article also states that Covid-19 is no lung disease but thrombosis and 88 percent of the patients given artificial respiration with ventilator die. Chlorine dioxide is not medicine, it can be dangeous. The alleged study from Ecuador is not credible. Furthermore, COVID-19 is mainly a lung disease and makes artificial respiration necessary for patients to survive. The number of 88 percent deceased patients was wrongly cited from a study.

WHO said vegetarians will not be affected by COVID-19, because COVID-19 need to have animal fat ��in order to �survive. WHO did not said this, and there is no evidence to show that a vegetarian diet prevents COVID-19.

Image showing actions taken by Italy on the beaches to reduce the spread of coronavirus infection. Misbar checked the image and found that the accompanying claim is incorrect, as it is not from Italy, but rather depicts a resort called Royal Makkas located in the Antalya province of Turkey.

Squadron of aircraft paints the flag of Italy to celebrate the registration of zero cases of coronavirus in the Italian city of Milan. The clips and photos are really recent, but they have nothing to do with the registration of zero cases in Milan, but, according to the description of the Italian Air Force page on Facebook, it is a greeting to all who suffer from this disease in the city.

The Tunisian Foreign Minister announces the imposition of a visa for Tunisians returning from abroad, whose value is 100 euros. The director of public diplomacy and media in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Burawi Limam, on May 25, according to the IFM radio station, confirmed the news was false.

In Japan, upon rexamination of the “Abenomasks” everyone was fussing about, only 12 were actually defective. While there were only 12 defective masks sent out to households, there were still 47,000 defective masks specifically for use by pregnant women sent out, according to the Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare as of May 14.

Every fifth participant of a clinical trial for vaccine mRNA-1273 got very sick Systemic symptoms of grade 3 (severe) were seen in 4 of 45 participants - that's not 20 percent. These symptoms are for example headaches, fatigue or myalgia that are strong enough to prevent daily activities

Every fifth participant of a clinical trial for vaccine mRNA-1273 got very sick Systemic symptoms of grade 3 (severe) were seen in 4 of 45 participants - that's not 20 percent. These symptoms are for example headaches, fatigue or myalgia that are strong enough to prevent daily activities

The Nuremberg Code – a set of research ethics principles for human experimentation – prohibits digital identification of population. The Nuremberg Code does not mention digital identification of population.
Quarantine and social distancing caused more deaths than COVID Information manipulates research and is not in accordance with medical knowledge
Due to the COVID-19 outbreak, Central Govt. has started the online processing of GST Refund. The viral claim is fake. It is a dubious web link passed on in the name of the Central Government.

Brazilian states receive a R$ 16,450 extra funding from the federal government for each COVID-19 death. According to the Ministry of Health, this extra funding based on COVID-19 deaths does not exist.
Brahma Bar, one of São Paulo’s most famous bars, is going to close after going bankrupt during the pandemic. According to the bar's management, they did not go bankrupt and will not close.

A video shows a group of police officers saluting anti-lockdown protesters in São Paulo. The video is real, but they were not saluting the protesters. Actually, they were doing the "Siren Minute", a sort of ritual done after a fellow officer dies during police operation. In this case, it was a 25 year soldier that died in a car chase on Saturday (May 23).

A WhatsApp message claiming that “COVID-19” would be an acronym for a program aimed at reducing the world’s population, with the aid of Artificial Intelligence. The program would have been presented at the World Economic Forum 2020, in Davos (Switzerland). The name "COVID-19" has been decided by the Who, and it indicates the characteristics of the disease ("Co"= corona, "Vi"=virus, "d"=disease" and "19" is the year of discovery). Furthermore, the Davos World Economic Forum 2020 didn't deal with the topic of population reduction.

Video shows a doctor claiming that If you can hold your breath for 10 sec without discomfort, you don’t have coronavirus. Medical Experts have clarified that being able to hold your breath for 10 seconds doesn't mean someone doesn't have coronavirus.
COVID-19 is a bacteria causing death due to thrombosis. COVID-19 is a virus and the theory is baseless and false without any proper source or credibility.

A poem signed by K. O’Meara beginning with the verse “and the people stayed at home”, supposedly written “about 220 years ago”, during the plague epidemic in 1800. It is a hoax. The title of the poem is "In the Time of Pandemic", it is inspired by the current coronavirus pandemic and the author is Kitty O'Meara, who published it on her blog on March 16.

Images of a protest in Villa Azul, Argentina, against the quarantine. Viral publications on social media and the Todo Noticias channel linked this video with Villa Azul, the Buenos Aires neighborhood located between the parties of Avellaneda and Quilmes that became one of the focus of attention of the pandemic. However, the images correspond to a protest in Puente Alto, south of Santiago de Chile.

“[U.S. Rep. Conor Lamb] said he would NOT vote for [Nancy Pelosi] for Speaker, and did.” On Memorial Day, President Donald Trump attacked a Democratic congressman from western Pennsylvania, labeling him an “American fraud” and accusing of supporting Nancy Pelosi for house speaker, even though he had promised voters he would oppose her. A quick search of Lamb’s voting record shows that Trump’s claim is not true. He was one of 15 Democrats in Congress who did not vote for Pelosi in the January 2019 speaker election. Lamb voted for U.S. Rep. Joe Kennedy III of Massachusetts instead.

Autopsies performed in Italy showed that COVID-19 is not pneumonia, but a blood clotting disorder (disseminated intravascular coagulation). Doctors have been treating COVID-19 wrongly, because ventilators and intensive care units were never needed; COVID-19 should instead be treated with antibiotics, anti-inflammatories and anticoagulants. The article contains numerous inaccuracies about COVID-19. Firstly, while coagulopathy (blood clotting disorder) does occur in some COVID-19 patients, the evidence to date indicates that viral pneumonia is the main cause of death in COVID-19 patients, not clotting disorders as claimed. Secondly, antibiotics, antivirals, anti-inflammatories and anticoagulants are already being used in current COVID-19 treatment protocols, contrary to the article’s suggestion that they are not. Finally, ventilators and intensive care units are crucial for treating COVID-19 patients, in spite of the article’s claim that these are “not needed”.
Mumbai policewoman felt dizzy and fell down as she tested positive for COVID-19. The Mumbai police clarified that the policewoman tested negative for COVID-19 and fell down because of other reasons.

A study shows that COVID-19 asymptomatics are not contagious. The study does not say that COVID-19 asymptomatics cannot infect other people. The study shows how preventive measures, such as masks and hygiene, can prevent infection from asymptomatic carriers.

Migrants in isolation in India threw away food because it was cooked by a Dalit cook. The claim is false, the migrants in isolation wanted to be served properly in sitting position but the cook denied to follow social distancing.
People in Saudi Arabia thronged store after lockdown was lifted. The claim is false. The video is older than Dec 2019.

Mumbai Police congratulated a couple for marrying inside their house amidst the coronavirus lockdown. The video is from Nashik (a city in the state of Maharashtra) and shows Nashik city's police congratulating the couple who married in their home.

COVID-19 is a bacterium that is easily treated with aspirin or a coagulant. The novel coronavirus is a newly a newly recognized strain in the family of viruses known as coronaviruses, which includes the viruses that cause the common cold as well as more severe diseases.

A study of 455 contacts of an asymptomatic carrier showed that none of the 455 were infected. The results prove that asymptomatic people cannot transmit COVID-19 and masks are therefore unnecessary. Some also claim that this shows COVID-19 is not contagious. Many Facebook posts have misinterpreted a study which examined the incidence of COVID-19 infections among 455 people who had been exposed to an asymptomatic carrier, claiming that it showed masks are not needed or that asymptomatic transmission does not occur. However, it is clear from reading the full study that all 455 contacts wore at least a face mask, except while eating or drinking, during exposure. In fact, the study’s authors concluded that “Effective prevention and control measures are helpful to prevent COVID-19 spread of asymptomatic carriers.” Scientific evidence also suggests that asymptomatic spread can and does occur.

A quote supposedly from Plato on freedom of speech went viral in China in February after the death of Li Wenliang, a medical doctor in Wuhan who tried to alert others to the coronavirus threat late last year. The same quote again became popular in Hong Kong in May, attributing it to Plato as well. The quote is not from Plato. Its author is likely to be Zhang Xuezhong, an outspoken Chinese legal scholar critical of the government, who was taken from home by the authorities in Shanghai in May.

The World Health Organization began in May to discourage the use of masks in public spaces, concluding that the coronavirus is not transmitted by air. The WHO does not reject the use of masks in public spaces, although it is not one of its recommendations, and has always said that it was not transmitted by air.
Thermal water treatments cure people infected with COVID-19. There is no scientific evidence that thermal water treatments cure people infected with COVID-19.
A pavilion will be opened in Fraga (Huesca) due to an increase in the number of COVID-19 cases. The pavilion is intended to take in homeless people who arrive seasonally.

The radio station Sonora announced in a program that the President of Guatemala, Alejandro Giammattei, would close the country for 15 days. The audio began to circulate on WhatsApp and went viral. President Alejandro Giammattei denied that this was an action he would take. He assured that it was a possibility but that if it happened, he would announce it himself to the population days in advance.

Social media commentaris claim a murder of a 37-year-old Chinese researcher studying COVID-19 at the University of Pittsburgh in early May could be a cover-up as he was about to reveal important findings, possibly the U.S. origin of the coronavirus. Local police’s investigation determined the murder suicide was a result of “a lengthy dispute regarding an intimate partner” and had nothing to do with Liu’s coronavirus research. The University of Pittsburgh's official statement also clarified the area of his research, which is not about the origin of the coronavirus.

Facebook and Instagram posts shared thousands of times claim that vaccines directly violate the Nuremberg Code, a set of research ethics principles for human experimentation established after World War II. This claim is false; medical ethics and legal experts said the principles, named after the Nuremberg trials, are compatible with vaccination.

Photos of lung show four stages of pneumonia, along with the descriptions of symptoms of each stage. The pictures are simulated images of lung, not related to pneumonia. Unlike cancer, pneumonia doesn't have various stages.

The situation in Tokyo remains critical with utilization rate of hospital beds as of May 11th at 91%. The Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare acknowledged that its original announcement of Tokyo Metropolitan Government was inaccurate. In a recalculation with the revised information released by the Tokyo Metropolitan Government, the hospital bed utilization rate was at approximately 50% as of May 7 and 43% as of May 12, which is "under 50%" even at the time of NHK's reporting.
Several posts on social media and online articles claim that COVID-19 is caused by a bacterium and can be treated with aspirin and blood thinners. COVID-19 is a virus, not a bacterium.

Consuming 3 times a day a mixture of the juice of 10 lemons, honey, ginger, onion and 10 garlic cloves is the recipe that “prevents the coronavirus” and helps “recover from the virus”. No one food or mixture of several prevents or cures COVID-19.

Thrombosis is the main cause of death for COVID-19 patients. Antibiotics can treat coronavirus patients. Respiratory failure is the leading cause of death for COVID-19 patients. Antibiotics are not effective against coronavirus, but only against collateral bacterial infections.

A video has been viewed tens of thousands of times in multiple posts on Facebook, Twitter and YouTube alongside a claim it shows police in India beating a man to death after he violated a nationwide coronavirus lockdown by “venturing out for food”. The claim is false; the video has circulated in reports about police beating an intoxicated man in India’s Madhya Pradesh state in an incident unrelated to the ongoing lockdown; police said two officers had been suspended over the incident for "assaulting" a man.

A meme on Facebook shows the number of currently infected people in the German states in percent. It is not possible to say how many people are currently infected in Germany, because the number of people who have recovered from the disease is not officially counted and reported.

An warning that a contact tracing app in Sweden that was secretly tracking friends and contacts of its users. The app was not accessible in Sweden and there were no evidence that anyone that did not personally and willingly accept the invite got tracked.

Montenegro is targeting Serbian citizens; as it reopens borders post COVID-19 restrictions to all except Serbian nationals. Some media outlets have manipulated news about Montenegro's decision to reopen its state borders on June 1st, subsequent to COVID-19 state entry restrictions. They did so by disseminated false news claiming the border decision was aiming Serbian citizens, those from Republic of Serbia, and Bosnian Serbs from the entity Republika Srpska, because they were the only ones banned from entry. This comes at a time of bickering over Serbian Orthodox Church in Montenegro. The fact is that Montenegro's decision was reflecting particularly on countries that had fewer than 25 coronavirus cases per 100,000 people. At the time of the decision those were Croatia, Albania, Slovenia, Greece, Germany, Austria, Czech Republic, Poland, and Hungary. Border, therefore, had been opened only for these 9 European countries, not for all but Serbia and Republika Srpska.

Coronavirus multiplies in sewage and pouring bleach in the sewage water would help. Pouring bleach, as said in the whatsapp message, would jeopardize researchers' analysis to make predictions through the COVID-19 RNA left in the sewage.

Axel Kicillof (Governor of the Province of Buenos Aires): 80 days after the first case, Argentina has 10,000 cases; Chile, 60 thousands and Brazil, 200 thousands. The data from the three countries coincide rounded with the reported cases, according to an observatory of the University of Oxford. However, this indicator depends a lot on the number of tests that are carried out, so it is not useful to compare the progress of the pandemic. There are other indicators, however, that do show a more critical situation in the South American countries compared by the Buenos Aires governor.

The video shows a man kissing a bat in a cave in Bursa, Turkey, regardless of the coronavirus. It is true that the man in Bursa entered a cave and kissed bats. But the video dates back to 2017 before the outbreak.

A video claiming that the Immuni app (the contact tracing application sponsored by the Italian government) is already operative and it has been installed and activated on people’s smartphones automatically. The "Immuni" app is not available yet, and therefore it hasn't been installed or activated. Apple and Google have introduced a general platform for contact tracing, but in order to work this needs to be integrated with a national application: the Immuni app which, as already explained, at the moment is not available in Italy.

A nurse from the city of Bucaramanga, Colombia, was attacked with stones by people who said she was going to infect them with COVID-19. The assault with stones to a nurse did occur, but in Mexico, not in Bucaramanga, Colombia.

Indian government is giving 5000 rupees as relief funds for every citizen during the lockdown. The Indian government is not distributing 5000 rupees, the website is dubious and this message is also circulating in Kenya.

A photo shows Gov. Gretchen Whitmer “on Mackinaw Island today ignoring mask and social distancing rules.” The photo doesn’t show Gretchen Whitmer breaking social distancing rules. It came from Whitmer's campaign when she was running for governor in October 2018.

Video shows brazilian military police officers saluting protesters against isolation measures in São Paulo. According to the São Paulo Public Security Secretary, the act was a tribute by the police given at the same time that a police officer killed while on duty was buried in the corporation's Mausoleum, in the center of the capital. The same gesture occurred in other locations where the agents were not in emergency services.
PCR tests cannot detect a new coronavirus. PCR tests detect the presence of genetic material of SARS-CoV-2 in the human body.

COVID-19, the disease caused by the novel coronavirus, is a form of bacteria that can be cured by aspirin. There is scientific consensus that COVID-19 is caused by a virus that belongs to the coronavirus family. Both the WHO and the Ministry of Health of Italy say there is no specific treatment or registered cure for COVID-19 to date.

Multiple posts shared thousands of times on Facebook, Twitter and YouTube claim that salt is an effective remedy against the novel coronavirus. The claim is false; health experts have said there is no evidence that salt can treat the novel coronavirus disease; as of May 2020, the WHO says there is no remedy for COVID-19.

There were “only 48” PCR tests in Tokyo on May 19th. The number of tests conducted by the Tokyo Metropolitan Institute of Public Health alone is indeed 48, however, if we include all PCR test centers commissioned by the Tokyo Metropolitan Government, there were 975 tests on May 19 and 712 on May 20.

Mulitple Facebook posts shared thousands of times claim the Italian health ministry has discovered COVID-19 is caused by bacteria. The posts go on to claim the health ministry discovered COVID-19 is exacerbated by 5G technology and can be cured using painkillers and antibiotics. The claims are false; the Italian health ministry said the posts were “a hoax”; the claims have also been widely refuted by international experts, who have found COVID-19 is caused by the novel coronavirus.
Ukrainians over 60 will not be allowed to work anymore. They should be under lockdown. The norm about isolating people over 60 was a temporary measure during the national lockdown in Ukraine.

Facebook user suggests that confirmed cases are suspected cases of COVID-19 whereas those declared positive are people who actually have the novel coronavirus. Individuals who test positive for COVID-19 are considered confirmed cases.

Because of the coronavirus economic crisis, Adidas went into bankruptcy. The Adidas bankruptcy rumor is a joke invented by Olympique Lyonnais' soccer fans dissatisfied with their team jersey designed by Adidas for the next season.

A video shows a man in Porto Alegre claiming his wife died of cancer, but the hospital claimed it was a case as COVID-19. Three different sources, including a close relative of the victim, stated that the case was never listed as COVID-19. She was suspected of COVID-19 at the time of death. This affected procedures like burial. However, the test was negative and the case was dismissed 24 hours later.

Prolonged use of face masks causes hypoxia. "The use of face masks does not cause hypoxia nor excessive intake of carbon dioxide. Masks are designed to allow proper breathing and oxygenation," WHO Philippines told VERA Files. Public health experts have also debunked the claim in fact check articles by several fact checking organizations across five continents.

A photo shows a baby named Kyle who was recently diagnosed with COVID-19 after getting open-heart surgery five days after being born. It maliciously uses the photo of New Zealander Cameron Bartle just two days after he underwent his first open-heart surgery at five days old, in August 2012. He is now seven years old.

Foo Fighters frontman Dave Grohl was diagnosed with COVID-19. No legitimate news organization has reported on the Foo Fighters frontman recently getting sick, much less contracting COVID-19. Its source -- a “Bild newspaper” -- also published its last feature on Grohl in January 2019.

An image of a cactus-shaped antenna claiming that it is a 5G antenna and that they hide them so that “people do not realize that they are radioactive and emit electromagnetic frequency waves”. The photo is not current, nor is it a 5G antenna. It is not taken either in Colombia or in Mexico, but in Arizona, United States in 2009.
Video shows Dean of Kasturba Hospital telling gargling with salt water kills coronavirus. This is a false video going viral, that doesn't show the dean of Kasturba Hospital.
Video shows migrants vandalizing public property in Surat during the COVID-19 lockdown. The video is actually from Kathua, Uttar Pradesh. It is being falsely shared as being taken in Surat.

Video shows a large crowd in the marketplace at Muhammad Ali road, Mumbai, violating lockdown. The video is, in fact, from Pakistan. It is being falsely shared as being shot in various cities in India.
Video shows women shopping in Delhi’s market during lockdown. This viral video is of Faisalabad in Pakistan, not of Delhi market.

Video shows a large crowd in the marketplace at Muhammad Ali road, Mumbai violating current COVID-19 lockdown in India. The video is, in fact, from Pakistan. It is being falsely shared in the name of various cities in India.

Video shows migrants staying in quarantine facilities in India refused to eat the food because it was cooked by a Dalit woman (low-caste group). Bihar Police clarified that women told migrants to eat separately maintaining social distance, upon which they created ruckus and kicked the food plates.

A video shared on Facebook showed the current situation in China as it battles the second wave of coronavirus infections. The video is not new. On February 14, UK-based tabloid Daily Express published an article about it saying the 3 young siblings in the video allegedly died of carbon monoxide poisoning.

The mayor of the municipality of Socorro, in Santander, Colombia, was arrested for manipulating contracts in the midst of the coronavirus pandemic. The police of the Santander department said that the photo of the mayor of the municipality of Socorro in which it appears that she was arrested for manipulation of contracts in the middle of the coronavirus pandemic is false.
RSS (a right-wing group in India) chief Mohan Bhagwat said that coronavirus has shaken his belief in religion. RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat has made no such statement.
A video which would show a “desperate mother” who lost everything during the pandemic. The video is real, but it was shot in 2017. It has nothing to do with COVID-19.
The chloroquine study published in the Lancet cost 50 million dollars. There is no reliable data to support this claim.

Horse meat infected with coronavirus is imported to Kazakhstan from Kyrgyzstan. According to the statistics Committee for January-March 2020, since the beginning of the year, Kazakhstan has not imported meat from Kyrgyzstan. According to the results of the examination, the novel coronavirus was not detected in horses. There are currently no scientific publications on cases of horse disease with the new SARS-Cov-2 coronavirus.

The experts at Nanavati Hospital are giving four common treatments to all patients: Vitamin C, dry ginger, turmeric and steam. No doctor from Nanavati Hospital in Mumbai has recommended the four treatments mentioned in the viral message to COVID-19 positive patients. The claim in the Whatsapp message is fake.

People in USA march and call for the arrest of Bill Gates. According to our research on this video, we find that videos of protests against lockdown in the United States have been fabricated and shared with misleading claims including Bill Gates’s arrest.

182 truck drivers who had tested positive for COVID-19 in Kenya were re-tested and found to be negative in Tanzania. Samples from the 19 drivers were retested and found to be negative after Kenya registered 182 cases at the Tanzania border.
Aspirin cures COVID-19. WHO says that there is no treatment or cure for COVID-19 at the moment.

Facebook posts shared hundreds of times in South Africa claim that criminals posing as government officials are going around to people’s homes and distributing face masks that are laced with chemicals to knock them out and rob them. However, local police -- like their counterparts elsewhere in the world -- dismissed the claim as a myth.

Russia raises the image of Christ to help it ending the pandemic. The video was shot in Russia, specifically in the city of Kamensk-Uralsky, but the image of Christ was raised in order to celebrate Easter.

The experts at Nanavati Hospital are giving four common treatments to all patients: Vitamin C, dry ginger, turmeric and steam. No doctor from Nanavati Hospital in Mumbai has recommended the four treatments mentioned in the viral message to COVID-19 positive patients. The claim in the Whatsapp message is fake.

People in USA march and call for the arrest of Bill Gates. According to our research on this video, we find that videos of protests against lockdown in the United States have been fabricated and shared with misleading claims including Bill Gates’s arrest.

A video from the American news channel Fox News in which the presenter says that the President of the United States, Donald Trump, has tested positive on COVID-19 after taking a test. It is a hoax. The video has been tampered with and the one who tested positive was a White House worker.

95 coronavirus deaths recorded in Ghana and total confirmed coronavirus cases jump to 6,989 on May 22. Official government data by the Ghana Health Service (GHS) on the coronavirus spread in the country contradicts the claim. Also The Vaultz Magazine has denied producing the image and described it as malicious.
The survival rate for COVID-19 is over 99.9%. There is no accurate way to measure the survival rate of COVID-19 yet.

People with COVID-19 have been misdiagnosed as having pneumonia and have been dying of thrombosis There is no evidence to back up the claim that patients are being misdiagnosed with pneumonia and should be treated for thrombosis instead. Pneumonia has been found to be widely linked to COVID-19.

A post of Cronica with statements by the President of Sweden on the Argentinian Government. The only Swedish official statement, in relation to the comparisons made by the Argentine president, Alberto Fernández, days ago, was through his embassy in Buenos Aires and did not contain that text. The image is coming from a website used to create false news headlines similar to those of the HD Cronica channel.

An image of a doctor who found the cure for the coronavirus. At the moment there is no cure for COVID-19 and the person who appears in the photo is Dr. Now, also known as Younan Nowzaradan, a doctor who helps people with obesity.

The President of Guatemala, Alejandro Giammattei assured that the case-fatality rate of the COVID-19 pandemic in the country was one third of that of the world. According to infectious and epidemiological experts, data are lacking to ensure that the case-fatality rate is correct and can be used as a positive argument.

A video is circulating on social networks showing an alleged death in Chiquimula, Guatemala. The video has the logo of a Chiquimula page, making it misleading. However, the video documents a drill carried out in Colombia.
Lactancy is not recommended because of risks to COVID-19 transmission from mother to child. With the right medical precautions, breastfeeding is still encouraged, even to mothers with COVID-19.

“Paraguay is the only Latin American country where virtual education is free during the pandemic”. Most Latin American countries have free platforms of educational content to cope with the closure of schools due to quarantine measures.

President Donald Trump tweeted, “Some oldies will have to die. We’re in God’s hands, folks! Liberate America!” There is no record of Trump tweeting the statement. The tweet comes from a satirical blog.
Italy found the cure to the coronavirus and the illness is due to 5G. There is still no cure for the coronavirus.

A Spanish study with 60 thousand subjects proved that lockdown policies are ineffective. Although the study itself exists, it does not say, in any moment, that lockdown policies were ineffective in the country

People knew about coronavirus even in 2003. However, unlike today, there was no panic, fines, or quarantine back then. SARs-CoV-2 is a new and previously unknown type of coronavirus. In 2003, there was a spread of a different coronavirus.

Brazilian state of Minas Gerais has fewer deaths than São Paulo even though it has not adopted quarantine measures. The simple comparison of numbers made in the publications generates a distorted interpretation because 1) the level of testing in both states was ignored, 2) it cannot be said that the two states are or are not fully implementing social isolation measures, and 3) the size of the population, the demographic density and the greater insertion of São Paulo in the route of national and international flights are also factors that influenced the worsening of the disease outbreak in that state, in comparison with Minas Gerais.

Flu shots are contaminated with dogs’ coronaviruses. Dolores Cahill, in an interview, says flu vaccines are contaminated with dogs' coronaviruses, but it's fake. Dog cell cultures are used to make some vaccines, but these cultures do not contain dog coronaviruses.

Cannabis could help prevent coronavirus infection. This is not a study that passed the peer review, it was conducted on artificial human tissues and not on real organisms. It is a classic preliminary research that may even fail. The authors themselves speak of the need for further studies and research.

A photo shows three men on crosses who “feel like they’re being crucified by being required to stay at home.” No, this crucifixion photo doesn’t show pandemic protesters. This photo is from at least two years ago.
Sloth bear seen in a house garden in Sri Lanka during the COVID-19 lockdown. This is an old video of slothbear in a garden in Tamil Nadu, India. It has no relation with lockdown or Sri Lanka.
A video shows a fight to get seating on the terrace of a bar in Spain under the state of alarm. The video was shot in 2016 and reflects a brawl that has nothing to do with the bar.

Dolores Cahill claims in an interview on TheHighWire that there is already a preventive strategy and treatment for COVID-19 through “nutrition, vitamins and hydroxychloroquine”, therefore social distancing is unnecessary. Contrary to Cahill’s claims, no therapeutic strategy has been proven effective to prevent or treat COVID-19 yet. Current evidence indicates that precautionary measures including frequent handwashing, cleaning and disinfection of frequently touched objects, use of masks, and social distancing are effective to help prevent the spread of COVID-19.

Video of a lockdown lifting celebration in Saudi Arabia. The video is a video of the police and residents of Al Naif and Al Ras, Dubai, United Arab Emirates, celebrating the lockdown easing on April 26, 2020.

COVID-19 is harmless and does not cause death. Until May 22, 2020, the number of deaths from COVID-19 in the world had reached 323,256 people and in Indonesia 1,326 people. Patients who die from COVID-19 are not only those who have comorbidities and old age, but also young age groups and without comorbidities.

Text claims that the North Macedonian Minister of Health Venko Filipce at a press conference held that day (21 May 2020) said that the patients infected with COVID-19 may have to pay a fee (co-payment) for hospital treatment. First of all, this is not a new press conference from 21 May 2020, but an old one from April 24, at which questions are asked by journalists about whether those who are being treated from COVID-19 in hospital will be exempted from co-payment for hospitalization. Second, the minister's response is that a financial construction will be made to free them from co-payments, regardless of whether or not they have health insurance. At the moment, neither the Hospital "8 Septemvri", nor the Infectious Diseases Clinic charge money for the treatment of coronavirus patients.

People in the city of Mumbai, India are not following social distancing, and have gone outside their homes to shop for the festival of Eid. The video is from a market in Pakistan, not India. The market was opened after the Pakistan government relaxed some lockdown restrictions.

Dr. Vele Markovski claimd that ventilators and quarantines are doing great harm in treating coronavirus, and that contamination level of SAR-Cov-2 is extremely low A Macedonian Medical University Professor and an Infectologist Vele Markovski presented his theories about ventilators and quarantines as a harmful coronavirus treatment. Shortly after this interview became viral spreading across the region. In his video he claims coronavirus was first discovered in 1965 and it is a familiar virus. SAR-Cov-2 was first discovered in 2019 in China, but other coronaviruses have previously existed. He continued claiming coronavirus was so benign that even medical students deliberately infected themselves to evaluate their clinical picture, and thus discovered it to fall into an ordinary cold category which many of us battle with four times a year. He also added contamination level of SAR-Cov-2 is extremely low, which is inaccurate and was proven false in earlier analysis.

People living in quarantine centre refuse to eat food as it was cooked by lower caste women. The video doing rounds on social media claiming that persons seen in the video refused to eat food cooked by a lower caste woman at a quarantine center is misleading. The Bihar police have ruled out any casteist angle to the incident.

There is a link betweek 5G networks and COVID-19. There is no link between 5G and COVID-19. First 5G network in the world is in South Korea, Wuhan is not the only Chinese city with 5G towers, 5G networks in France and Spain are still in their infancy.
5G wireless technology created the COVID-19 pandemic. The World Health Organization has stated that there is no link between the disease and exposure to 5G wireless technology.

20% of human volunteers for the test for a COVID-19 vaccine developed by Moderna have suffered serious adverse effects. Eight volunteers participated in phase 1 of the clinical trials and developed an immune response and are in good health, with no major sequelae.

Maroole Online Forum website claiming that 14 of the 25 confirmed cases of COVID-19 announced on May 7 are Oromo political prisoners. Ethiopian Federal Prison Commission has said no cases of COVID-19 have been confirmed among Ethiopian prisoners.
Lesotho has launched a COVID-19 remedy. Leso Oxi is a herbal concoction manufactured in Lesotho, where it is claimed to be effective against the flu, but it is yet to be tested against COVID-19.
People in Jama Masjid market breaking Indian COVID-19 lockdown due to Eid. Video is from Pakistan and not from Delhi.

Starting on May 20 this year, the Egyptian Minister of Health has placed herself in measures to isolate herself at home, as a result of suspected infection with the novel coronavirus. Misbar verified the news, and found it false, especially after the minister appeared on May 21, during the inauguration of the "Bashir Al-Khair" project, alongside President Abdel-Fattah El-Sisi. The Ministry of Health itself denied the news on its website.

A team of experts and scientists from the Faculty of Medicine in Rabat announce that a vaccine for Covid-19 is coming soon. There is no truth in the information spread about the development of an anti-coronavirus vaccine in Morocco. The development of a vaccine is a long and time-consuming process which does not take place overnight.
The outbreak of the novel coronavirus pandemic in Saudi Arabia will end on the 5th of Shawwal (June 2 2020). The image was fabricated.

People living in quarantine centre refuse to eat food as it was cooked by lower caste women. The video doing rounds on social media claiming that persons seen in the video refused to eat food cooked by a lower caste woman at a quarantine center is misleading. The Bihar police have ruled out any casteist angle to the incident.

A video on Youtube claims that European Commission’s implementing regulation (EU) 2020/666 gives ways to implant microchips to humans in the EU. The theory is linked to mass vaccination that “surely awaits” after the pandemic will receed. The EC's regulation actually talks about bodies designated under EU Directives that are able to certify medical devices. There is no mention of micro chip implants. The document concerns active implantable medical devices, such as heart defibrillators.
The prolonged use of masks can cause hypoxia. Masks retain particles, not gases. Therefore, masks do allow oxygen and carbon dioxide to pass through.

Decreeing the state of alarm because of Covid until June 30 would extend it throughout the summer. The state of emergency has a limited period of validity, the Permanent Deputation controls the Government when there is no session.

The Federal Government created voucher for poor people to buy gas canisters during the COVID-19 pandemic. This message was shared on WhatsApp with a link to the alledged online form people need to fill out to be eligible for the benefit. This is a phishing scam. This gas cannister voucher does not exist, according to the Ministry of Social Development.

A video show a corridor of healthcare professionals turning their backs to a passing car. On the subtitles, it says they were protesting against Bruno Covas, mayor of São Paulo. This video was not recorded in Brazil, but in Belgium.

The son of William Bonner, one of Brazil’s most well known anchorman, received a R$ 600 COVID-19 emergency allowance, destined to the poor, despite being the son of a wealthy man. He did not receive the allowance. Actually, some scammers used his CPF (a national identity number) on the entry form and managed to receive the benefit.
Chloroquine was invented by Gaspar Vianna, a scientist from Pará, Brazil. Chloroquine was synthetized by an Austrian researcher, who worked for Bayer, in 1934. Gaspar Vianna died in 1914.

99% of all COVID-19 patients in Itaperuna, Rio de Janeiro state, have been cured after being treated with chloroquine. On May 15, when this content was published, there were 13 people cured for 55 confirmed cases.

A post about the doctor Marcos Vargas of the Santojanni Hospital died from treating patients with coronavirus. The Buenos Aires hospital, through the Ministry of Health of the City, denied the post that is circulating. The image of the accompanying publication belongs to a Spanish porn actor.
Muslims flouting social distancing norms in Hyderabad. The video is not from India, but Pakistan.

A blog article stating that the WHO paid the president of Madagascar to “poison the cure for coronavirus”. Andry Rajoelina, the president of Madagascar, has never said that the Who offered him money to poison a potential treatment for COVID-19. When Afp asked him about the alleged quotes, he denied having ever accused the WHO.
Video shows police forces beating a man on roadside during lockdown. This video of police misconduct is two years old, it is now going viral.

To talk to India’s main opposition party (Congress) former president Rahul Gandhi, the Congress had hired people dressed as migrants who are facing trouble to travel to their homes amidst the coronavirus lockdown. India's opposition party's former president Rahul Gandhi had stepped out to talk to migrants who are facing trouble to travel to their homes amidst the coronavirus lockdown.

People in the city of Hyderabad, India are not following social distancing, and have gone outside their homes to shop for the festival of Eid. The video is from a market in Pakistan, not India. The market was opened after the Pakistan government relaxed some lockdown restrictions.

The COVID-19 pandemic “was set up in a meeting” in 2019 sponsored by the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation. The allegations are not true. There is no evidence that COVID-19 pandemic was combined in a meeting in 2019 sponsored by the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation.

A picture quotes pharmacist Stefano Montanari saying that wearing protective masks would make people breathe excessive levels of carbon dioxide, leading to respiratory acidosis and cancer. Wearing protective masks for a long period of time can increase the levels of carbon dioxide that people breathe. This, however, do not lead to respiratory acidosis. Furthermore, there is no conncetion between respiratory acidosis and cancer.

A blog article which says that the Italian doctors and experts in charge of the coronavirus emergency are the least respected ones in the international scientific community. It is true that Italian scientists have relatively low H-Index scores, but this doesn't mean they are not respected in their field. The H-Index indicates the number of active publications linked with a scholar and the quotes they received from others.

COVID-19 is being listed as the cause of death for people who did not have the illness when they died in Ireland. There is no evidence that deaths are being mis-categorised as COVID-19 deaths in Ireland or in any other country.

Member of Indian parliament Rahul Gandhi hired actors to act as migrants who he was helping during the COVID-19 lockdown. These were actual migrants walking from Delhi to UP and MP in India and this was not staged.

Myrtle Beach, South Carolina, reported 220,000 new coronavirus cases in 72 hours. As of May 20, South Carolina has reported nearly 9,200 positive cases of COVID-19. Besides New York, no state has reported over 200,000 cases to date.

Japanese Nobel laureate Dr. Tasuku Honjo said the new coronavirus was engineered in a Chinese laboratory. Honjo has not made comments to that effect, and he has called the claim “misinformation” in a statement.

Facebook allegedly removed a video criticizing Dutch social distancing rules. The video criticizing Dutch social distancing rules has not been removed by Facebook, but it has been tagged by the company as incorrect information.

A photo shows a Turkish MP wearing knitted mask in the Turkish parliement. The person wearing a knitted mask is Ukrainian deputy Liza Bogutskaya. Liza Bogutskaya wore the mask to protest the decisions taken by the cabinet.

Colombia ranks first in corruption in the middle of the coronavirus pandemic. A blog attributes this ranking to the NGO Transparency International, but this organization has not published this. Actually, this is a perception survey conducted by a US media outlet last January.
Pathogenic viruses do not exist, as the German biologist Stefan Lanka proved in front of a court. Viruses do exist and no, no lawsuit denied their existence.
Madagascar is leaving World Health organisation and encourages other countries to do so. Presidence of Madagascar and WHO denied this claim and there is no withdrawal procedure.

Worldwide research shows that hydroxychloroquine is the most effective drug against COVID-19. The source of the information cited is, in reality, a poll without statistical validity made by the online forum Sermo. The data, moreover, are from an old poll, from April 2.

Son of brazilian anchor Willian Bonner requested and received COVID-19 emergency aid of R $ 600. There is, in fact, an approved request in Vinicius Bonemer's name, but it's coming from a scamming attempt, according to the Jornal Nacional's anchor post published on Twitter in 21 May and to the Brazilian Ministry of Citizenship in response to Aos Fatos.
Bill Gates and Anthony Fauci seen walking in close proximity without mask during the coronavirus pendemic. This picture of Bill Gates and Anthony Fauci was taken in 2018, viral with fake claim.

There is nothing called “coronavirus” and it is just a hoax to pass Bill Gates’s vaccine. The novel coronavirus causing COVID-19 exists and was seen on microscopic imagery. The allegation about Bill Gates vaccine is not based on any evidence.

Georgian doctor created medicine Corvirant which treats coronavirus. It is unknown whether the drug Corvirant even exists at all. It has not passed any clinical trial. There are currently no drugs licensed for the treatment or prevention of COVID-19. Efforts are still underway to develop and evaluate medicines to treat COVID-19. Some specific drugs are being tested through clinical trials. Although the primary testing carried out by some companies proved successful, there is no COVID-19 vaccine available for massive use and further stages of clinical trials are still ahead. Scientists do not have an exact answer about when COVID-19 drug or vaccine going well with safety and efficacy testing will be available.
Wearing a mask during physical activity causes hypercapnia syndrome. There is no scientific evidence that physical activity causes hypercapnia.

The COVID-19 pandemic “was combined at a meeting” in 2019 sponsored by the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation. It is not true that the COVID-19 pandemic "was combined at a meeting" in 2019 sponsored by the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation.

Claims infrared thermometers to measure temperature of potentially infected with COVID-19 are hazardous, since they damage the so called “Third eye”. There are no scientific proof to say that thermometers may cause any damage to a person being checked.

Lithuanian parliament member said that there are some very serious reasons to believe that virus was made artificialy in a laboratory and everything is related to Gates and other millionaires plan to create artificial virus just to sell vaccines afterwards. Scientific community expressed their opinion that the virus is completely natural. There are no evidence of the contrary.
The use of face masks increases the risk of developing COVID-19. There is no evidence that the use of face masks increases the risk of developing COVID-19.

Claim that official data show that there were more deaths in Italy in 2019 than in 2020. The source used is wrong. According to ISTAT data, by analyzing a random sample of municipality it appears that in the first 3 months of 2020 there has been an increase of almost 7 thousand deaths. Italy registered 25,354 excess deaths from February 20 to March 31.

A viral video shared on multiple social media platforms shows a woman outside a US store making several misleading claims about the use of face masks including that they do not protect from COVID-19 and that their use makes you sick. Research backed by leading academic institutions and international health bodies recommends they be used along with other measures to help limit the spread of the novel coronavirus.
Video shows an overcrowded Madina market in Hyderabad, India, where people are shopping for Eid. The viral video is not from Hyderabad but Faisalabad in Pakistan.

Kenyan First Lady Margaret Kenyatta is giving out Ksh30,000 grants to help Kenyans during the COVID-19 pandemic. The post offering these grants was published on a Facebook account impersonating the First Lady, and charges a fee for interested applicants.

South Sudan President Salva Kiir and his first deputy Riek Machar recently became targets of tit-for-tat claims on Facebook alleging they had flown to foreign countries for COVID-19 treatment. For four days, rumours about the two men — bitter rivals since the 2013 civil war — flew thick and fast on social media. Allegations that they were abroad (and even dead in the case of Kiir) were finally put to bed with television appearances from their respective homes in the capital, Juba.

A celebration in Belgium of the Tunisian doctor, Mohamed Mourad, after recovering from the novel coronavirus, which he contracted while working at a hospital in Brussels. Misbar has verified the news that was circulated and found it to be misleading, as the heart doctor, Mohamed Mourad, is a Belgian of Lebanese origin, not a Tunisian, Egyptian, or Palestinian doctor.
In 2003, the media talked about the coronavirus and we already have a cure for the virus. This claim mixes up Sars-CoV-2, responsible for COVID-19, with another type of coronavirus.

Wuhan has imposed a second lockdown after a resurgence of COVID-19 cases. While the Wuhan government reported six new cases of COVID-19 as of May 10, the Chinese embassy in the Philippines confirmed through a text message to VERA Files that the city has not closed its borders again in May, a month after it re-opened on April 7.

Japan is suffering a second wave of COVID-19 cases after lifting quarantine measures. Only Hokkaido, the country's northernmost prefectural island, has experienced a second spike of coronavirus disease cases.

“Bill Gates Explains That The COVID Vaccine Will Use Experimental Technology And Permanently Alter Your DNA”. Bill Gates explained in his own blog post that there were many different types of vaccines being tested to create a COVID-19 vaccine, including experimental RNA and DNA vaccines. There is still no way of knowing what the COVID-19 vaccine will look like.

Fox News Report on US President Trump testing positive for COVID-19. The Original Fox News Report states that US President Trump's valet has been tested positive for COVID-19. The video is digitally tampered.
French champion of chloroquine Didier Raoult is leaving France to teach in China. His team denied the information, and the email adress informing his editor of the news is false.

Video and photo show that Indonesian President Jokowi attended a concert during the COVID-19 Pandemic The music concert that Jokowi attended in the video and photo was held in 2017, before the COVID-19 pandemic. The charity concert that was held by the MPR, BPIP, and BNPB on May 17, 2020 yesterday was also a virtual concert.

Top White House coronavirus adviser Dr. Anthony Fauci served on the Clinton Foundation’s board of directors for 20 years. There is no record of Fauci ever sitting on the Clinton Foundation’s board. A spokesperson confirmed he has never served on its board or worked for the foundation.
The image shows Los Angeles County Department of Public Health Director Dr. Barbara Ferrer looking sickly. The image has been digitally manipulated to make Ferrer look ill.

People who have received flu vaccines in the past three to five years will “probably test positive” for COVID-19. Medical experts refute the claim, and the Food and Drug Administration hasn’t observed any instances in authorized tests to date. Flu vaccines do not contain the new coronavirus.

A blog article stating that COVID-19 has been misdiagnosed, as the deaths would be caused by problems linked with thrombosis in the first place. According to the article, the two scientists who discovered this have received an “international prize” Thrombosis can be a problem linked with COVID-19, but it's not the first cause of death. Furthermore, the "prize" received by the two scientists is actually granted by the World Boxing Council, and it has nothing to do with science or medicine.

A Whatsapp message stating that Ikea is giving out €250 gift cards for free. The link for obtaining the gift card actually redirects the user to a form which collects sensitive data. It's a scam, and Ikea is not giving out free gift cards.
German police can enter homes and forcibly vaccinate people. This is not true, and there is no evidence of this happening.
Hydroxychloroquine cures COVID-19. Hydroxychloroquine hasn’t been proven to cure COVID-19 and is not used as a treatment for radiation sickness.

Video shows health professionals turning their backs on the mayor of the city of São Paulo. The video shared in the false publications actually shows a protest against Belgium's prime minister, Sophie Wilmès, as she arrived to visit a hospital in Brussels, the country's capital, on May 16.

Brazil has a 99.995% COVID-19 survival rate. Experts consulted by Aos Fatos affirm that this calculation cannot yet be done due to deficiencies in the accounting of infected and recovered from the disease.

After resigning from his post as Minister of Health, Nelson Teich said he could not work with Jair Bolsonaro because he couldn’t work with someone who put his own mediocrity and ignorance before science. Nelson Teich never said that. There's no reference to this sentence, or anything similar, in any news article, interview or speech. Via WhatsApp, Teich himself denied ever saying this.

The Brazilian mainstream media did not say anything after former president Lula said “fortunately nature created this monster called coronavirus”. Every Brazilian mainstream media outlet reported on Lula's setence. It was on the cover of Folha de S.Paulo's homepage for the entire morning on May 20.

João Doria, governor of São Paulo, said people need to choose between “lockdown or food” in an interview on Brasil Urgente, a national TV show. He did not say people need to choose between "lockdown or food". He said that following social isolation was a matter of life and death, and that, although confinement can be very taxing, specially to the poor, unnecessary exposure to COVID-19 is a deadly threat.
RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat said he has lost faith in religion due to coronavirus pandemic. RSS has denied Mohan Bhagwat made such a statement. The viral newspaper clipping is photoshopped.

A family friend of prominent playwright Ratnakar Matkari said he was infected with coronavirus through outside mild packages. Matkari's family has clarified that this is false information and this family friend has not spoken with the family.
US President Donald Trump tested positive for coronavirus. Donald Trump's valet has tested positive for COVID-19, not the President himself.
The Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) has issued guidelines about the post-lockdown phase. ICMR has denied issuing such guidelines. The viral message has been falsely attributed to ICMR

A doctor from Kasturba Hospital suggested to not wear masks all the time because otherwise, it could cause death. The hospital clarified that no such message has been released by any doctor of Kasturba Hospital. Expert of Indian Medical Association denied that the claims regarding the use of masks.

Mall in Saudi Arabia is crowded after the lockdown has been lifted. We could trace back the video to 2019. Some social media users had claimed that the video shows gathering in a store in Al-Shawqiyah, near Mecca, after it announced discounts.
RSS Chief Mohan Bhagwant’s said that COVID-19 shook his faith in religion. This is a false statement from Mohan Bhagwat. He did not make this statement.

No one died from COVID-19, but due to other previous illnesses, says a German doctor. The allegation is not true. There is currently a consensus in the scientific community on mortality caused by COVID-19.
Video claiming news channel Fox News reported that Donald Trump has tested positive for COVID-19. This is a doctored clip. Fox news did not air this segment.

The Philippines was the first country to declare a lockdown in Southeast Asia. Vietnam was the first country in Southeast Asia to declare a lockdown. In Asia, at least three other countries aside from Vietnam -- China, Saudi Arabia, and Mongolia -- imposed lockdown and quarantine measures ahead of the Philippines.

A post says that a bottle of alcohol gel left in a car caused a fire that damaged one of its doors. Several experts say that it is impossible that a traditional pack of alcohol gel can get on fire like that and damage a door.
A photo shows the a Turkish imprisoned COVID-19 patient, who is in intensive care unit. The photo was taken by AP in 2010 in Californian clinic.

The very first detailed report shows Turkey’s coronavirus outbreak was published in NEJM. There is no pre-print of an approved report published in New England Journal of Medicine on Turkey's outbreak.
Moderna’s COVID-19 vaccine is dangerous. The claim is unfounded, as vaccine trials are still ongoing, and no severe side effects have been reported so far.
