A microphone accidentally turned on in the White House recorded a discussion between journalists, revealing the whole truth about the new coronavirus. The journalists heard in the conversation were joking.

A WhatsApp message claims that Italy announced the cure for COVID-19. The Health Ministry of Italy did not make any announcement like this. The claim misrepresents the results and conclusions of a study made by Italian scientists that is pending of peer review.

The WHO said that Colombia is the most organized country in the prevention of coronavirus in America or the second in the world. There is no record that this international organization has recognized, evaluated and compared the performance of Colombia in terms of prevention of COVID-19 with that of other countries.
Doctors give their backs to São Paulo’s mayor, Bruno Covas, as protest against quarantine measures. Protest happened in Brussels and was against prime minister Sophie Wilmès.

The first test results for the Moderna vaccine are disappointing. Tests of the vaccine are still ongoing. "Moderna" did not report any severe side effects as a result of testing the new coronavirus vaccine.

Bill Gates admitted that he wants to vaccinate everyone because he makes 2000 percent profit with vaccines. The quote is taken out of context. Bill Gates was speaking of the social and economic benefits of saving lives with health aid.
Amazon is delivering economic help in Venezuela because of the pandemic spread of COVID-19. Amazon is not delivering any kind of packages or help in any country.

Michigan Gov. Gretchen Whitmer’s family spent May 20 at her second home, breaking her own stay-at-home orders. An image claims to prove that Gov. Gretchen Whitmer’s family spent May 20 at their second home in Elk Rapids, Mich. Until late April, Whitmer’s stay-at-home order prohibited Michiganders from traveling to their vacation homes within the state, to prevent the spread of the coronavirus. Whitmer spent May 20 in Midland, Mich., site of a major flood.
Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi was appointed as a chairman of WHO. No, Narendra Modi was not appointed as a chairman of WHO.

EUMM (European Union Monitoring Mission) is collecting biologial materials for dangerous experiments in the Lugar Lab alongside South Ossetian border. This is provied by the photos of medical car accompanying the mission patrols. Patrol cars of the EUMM have been accompanied by the ambulance cars since the day of inception and that it is an indivisible part of a security protocol.

Text claims that a family of four from North Macedonia should pay 680 euros for coronavirus tests if they want to travel to Greece. The protocol for travelling between Macedonia and Greece has not been determined yet and it is not yet known whether tests will be required and how much they will cost.

Claim that two-week isolation measures do not apply to North Macedonian President Stevo Pendarovski as they do to the leaders of SDSM and VMRO-DPMNE, Zoran Zaev and Hristijan Mickoski, after they were in contact with a journalist positive to coronavirus. President Pendarovski's Оffice informed that a member of his wider security team had a positive coronavirus test. The statement said that the person was on vacation last week, and the last time they were at work was 11 May this year and because they are part of the wider security team, there was no direct communication with the President. After the epidemiological analysis, President Pendarovski and his family members were assessed as second-line contacts, for whom isolation is not recommended according to the epidemiological protocol.

Michigan governor reopened Traverse City “so she could have her daughter’s open house.” Easing one of her COVID-19 stay-at-home orders, Gov. Gretchen Whitmer partially reopened a large swath of northern Michigan. The governor’s office said the reopening did not coincide with any Whitmer family event in Traverse City, which is in the reopened area.

The President of the United States of America Donald Trump has been tested positive for COVID-19. A viral video on social media claimed that US President Donald Trump has been tested positive for coronavirus is misleading. The video has been edited to spread misinformation.

Dr. Anthony Fauci said: “as soon as a COVID-19 vaccine is manufactured, it must be delivered to healthcare professionals for immediate human injection. Proper studies can be done later.” Fauci has said distribution and administration of a vaccine would only occur if the clinical trial shows that “in fact it is effective” and safe.

Several social media and streaming services are continuously trying to remove a video with an interview with American virologist Judy Mikovits. It happens on the grounds that the video spreads false claims about the coronavirus. Now the video also appear with Danish subtitles. The way Judy Mikovits is presented in the film is wrong. That she has previously been a researcher at the US National Institute of Cancer is true. And it is true that she was later a researcher at The Wittemore Peterson Institute in Nevada. But she was not fired from there because she made a discovery that shook the research community, as she claims in the video. Apparently, there was a strange XMRV virus spreading, and the virus, Judy Mirovits claimed, could be treated with a type of HIV medication. But other researchers failed to recreate Judy Mikovits startling results, and two years later the journal withdrew the article after researchers found that Judy Mikovits' results were simply due to coincidence, and therefore her results were not to be trusted. In the interview, however, Judy Mikovits says that you are even at risk of getting sick if you use face mask. Nonsense, experts say. If you are infected, you cannot become more or less infected. It may be more or less severe, but it is not due to mouthwashing.

A video claims that Bill Gates made a presentation to the CIA on COVID-19 vaccines for modifying the brain of religious fanatics. The video is an old video that has been in circulation since at least June 2011. It resurfaced in May 2020. The speaker making a presentation on vaccines to the CIA is not Bill Gates, according to a spokesperson at the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation.

Dr Robert Gallo confessed to being forced to create a virus to wipe out the African race. Dr Gallo was part of the team that discovered that HIV causes AIDS, and there is no evidence that the research was done under duress.

Uhuru Kenyatta Foundation is giving out Ksh10,000 to each Kenyan as lockdown relief funds. The site mentions the Uhuru Kenyatta Foundation, which does not exist, and asks applicants to share their bank details to complete the process.

Wearing a face mask for a prolonged period of time causes hypoxia and/or hypercapnia. Using face masks does not cause hypoxia nor excessive carbon dioxide intake. The World Health Organization (WHO) Philippines said there is no evidence that using face masks for a prolonged period of time causes any adverse effect on the brain or heart function.
Leopard is seen roaming in Delhi’s dwarka during the lockdown period. Video is not from Delhi, it is from Hyderabad where the lion was spotted.

“Why did the state do that with COVID patients in nursing homes? It’s because the state followed President Trump’s CDC guidance.” New York’s nursing home policy was not fully in line with CDC. The Cuomo administration issued an advisory March 25 that stated that nursing homes "must comply with the expedited receipt of residents” coming from hospitals, regardless of whether they are infected with the new coronavirus. The CDC warned nursing homes to keep COVID-19 out of their facilities and said nursing homes can admit coronavirus patients, but only if they are able to properly care for them. The Cuomo administration says that regulations that predate the pandemic require nursing homes to admit only those patients for which they can care. However, in the month following the March 25 advisory, nursing home operators felt that they had no choice but to accept these patients.

Photo of the Algerian doctor, Wafaa Boudissah, while he is working on admitting Covid-19 patients. Misbar checked the image which turned out to be misleading, as it shows Taylor Poynter, an emergency physician at the Chicago Hospital emergency room.

The President of the United States of America Donald Trump has been tested positive for COVID-19. A viral video on social media claimed that US President Donald Trump has been tested positive for coronavirus is misleading. The video has been edited to spread misinformation.

Amid COVID-19 pandemic, Bosnian Croats were targeted and penalized at the state border upon entry into Bosnia and Herzegovina A media outlets from B&H politicized travel restrictions for citizens holding dual citizenship - Croatian and Bosnia-Herzegovina returning into Bosnia-Herzegovina amid the COVID-19 pandemic. This false news was shortly after shared by numerous media outlets within Bosnia and Croatia. The truth is B&H Border Police and B&H Council of Ministers decided in March of 2020, in midst of the COVID-19 pandemic, that all foreign nationals (including EU nationals) will require a valid B&H passport for entry into B&H. Citizens holding dual citizenships - Croatian and Bosnian and Herzegovina's have previously used a Croatian state issued ID for border crossings between the two countries, which became superseded by the decision from BiH's authorities in March 2020. Politicized articles claiming BiH is treating Bosnian Croats as third grade citizens, penalizing them upon entry into Bosnia and Herzegovina is inaccurate. All those coming into the country who did not hold a valid travel document - a B&H passport - were consequently issued a fine with instruction to self-isolate at home for fourteen days.
The German government billed China for 130 billion pounds in “coronavirus damages.” The pictured headline is misleading. The German newspaper Bild actually created the mock invoice.

The Workers Party (PT) filed a lawsuit against the government, on the STF (Supreme Court), that demands the Federal Government stop purchasing chloroquine and hydroxychloroquine. Although the lawsuit mentioned on this post is real, it is not asking the government to stop buying chloroquine. Actually, they request, amongst several other things, that public authorities stop using official communication channels to promote any medication which has not yet been scientifically proven effective against COVID-19.

A video shows a man calmly lying down in a hospital bed and being tucked into an ambulance. The caption says this is proof that Brazilian authorities are forging COVID-19 cases The video was shot in Mexico, and, although the patient was very calm, he was infected with the SARS-CoV-2.

Metro Manila had an 83% rise in COVID-19 cases in one day. This is wrong; the rate of increase in the total number of confirmed cases in Metro Manila from May 16 to May 17 is less than 2.21 percent, far from Jay Sonza's claim of 83 percent, data from the Department of Health COVID-19 tracker show.

A piece of news claiming that the Italian government led by Giuseppe Conte would have “banned private property until 31 July”. The article misintrerprets and distorts some sentences taken from a real Law Decree issued during the pandemic which contains special norms aimed at managing the crisis. The Italian governement has not "banned private property", but it can confiscate PPE and hotel facilities in order to help healthcare professionals and host infected citizens.

A picture claiming that “Bill Gates’ vaccines” would have paralyzed 496k children in India. In 2000, the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation has actually founded a campaign aimed at defeating polio in India. The goal was reached in 2014. In about 1 case out of 2,7 million, the vaccine could cause paralysis. However, the number "496.000" is not supported by any piece of evidence.
A text claiming COVID-19 can be transmitted by mosquitoes. No, COVID-19 cannot be transmitted by mosquitoes. Experts and WHO dismiss the viral claim.

A chain that circulates through WhatsApp that says that the coronavirus is not a virus, “as we have been led to believe”, but is “a bacterium, amplified by 5G electromagnetic radiation that also produces inflammation and hypoxia”. It is a hoax. The disease is not caused by bacteria, and there is no evidence linking the coronavirus to 5G technology. Furthermore, clinical trials have already shown that the disease is related to thrombosis, and the World Health Organization (WHO) has not suggested banning autopsies on patients infected with coronavirus.

A content that claims that Microsoft co-founder Bill Gates has been detained by the FBI for “biological terrorism” since “he created the coronavirus to control us.” This is content published by The Betoota Advocate website, which on its Facebook profile is defined as a "satire" and "parody" page.

A video where a young man who speaks English with a British accent and who claims to be a telecommunications engineer who installs 5G towers claims to have found a piece on an electronic circuit that bears the inscription “COV-19”. The video is a hoax: what it shows is a component of a cable television set-top box from the company Virgin Media, as acknowledged by the company itself to Reuters.

“If you look at the one (hydroxychloroquine) survey, the only bad survey, they were giving it to people that were in very bad shape. They were very old. Almost dead.” Trump spoke as though there was only one study that found no benefit from hydroxychloroquine, and said it only looked at people “that were in very bad shape,” almost dead. There have been three studies, and all found no link between hydroxychloroquine and reduced deaths. All studies filtered out the impact of underlying health problems.

House Speaker Nancy Pelosi was in Wuhan, China, six days after “the impeachment HOAX failed.” There is no record of Pelosi traveling to China in February. She had public appearances in Washington, D.C., on the day the post alleges she was there.

The Express used a photo from before coronavirus lockdown to suggest people in Brighton were breaking social distancing rules. This is incorrect. Metadata from the photo shows it was taken during lockdown.

We have not heard of a single police officer dying from COVID-19 across the world. Incorrect. Many COVID-19 deaths among police officers have been reported worldwide, including at least one such death in the UK.

A post claims that the 1918 influenza out had a deadly second wave after quarantine restrictions were lifted. It is true the second wave of the pandemic was the most deadly, but it did not happen due to lifting of quarantine.

The survival rate for COVID-19 is 98.54% in the UK. We don’t know what the survival rate is yet, as we don’t know how many people have had the disease. This figure comes from a claim about the US which is a slight over-estimate based on available figures.
The body produces more cortisol when someone is wearing masks. The use of masks does not generates lack of oxygen and there is no relation between masks and the production of cortisol.
WHO has banned autopsies of people killed by COVID-19. WHO has not banned autopsies of people killed by COVID-19 and there is not general treatment for the virus.

“A lot of people can get an additional $2,400” from the CARES Act “and they can do it every month!” A radio station Instagram account gets to $2,400 a month by multiplying $600 times four weeks. But that amount is not available to all Americans. The $600 a week is for unemployed people eligible for federal help. The $600 a week benefit under the Federal Pandemic Unemployment Compensation is only available through the end of July.

Photo shows empty COVID-19’s service room at the Military Police Central Hospital in Rio de Janeiro. According to the Rio Military Police, there were 42 infected hospitalized at the institution on May 18 and the shared image actually shows the place where patients await test results.

Substances present in the boldo and in the quina plant treat COVID-19. The Brazilian Ministry of Health and the World Health Organization say that no type of tea has proven effective for treating COVID-19.

Video shows a paramilitary force unit taking charge in Mumbai to control the lockdown situation. Fact Crescendo geolocated the video which confirmed that is from another city called Pune in Maharashtra.
Popular Indian film actor John Abraham was caught violating lockdown while roaming in his Lamborghini. The images of John Abraham driving his Lamborghini date back from 2013.

Image of worn-out feet with blisters shows the plight of a woman migrant worker in the lockdown. The image was actually of a woman who had participated in a protest in 2018 in Maharashtra. It has nothing to do with recent migrating laborers' plight.

High dosage of Vitamin D is found to be effective as a cure or prevention measure for COVID-19. While there are few ongoing studies about Vitamin D deficiency and its effect on COVID-19 infection, there is no evidence that vitamin D is effective in treating or preventing COVID-19. WHO iterated that there is no single medicine to cure COVID-19.

Povidone Iodine is found to be effective in preventing COVID-19 infection. While there are ongoing studies about effectiveness of Povidone Iodine in COVID-19 treatment, there is no conclusive evidence that Povidone Iodine is effective in treating or preventing COVID-19. WHO iterated that there is no single medicine to cure COVID-19.

US President Donald Trump tested positive for COVID-19. There is no evidence that Trump has been tested positive for COVID-19.  The video by Fox News has been digitally tampered. The channel announced that the US President’s valet had tested positive for novel coronavirus.

Migrant labourers stuck at the Delhi-Uttar Pradesh border as they try to return home. The video is actually from October 2019 that was taken at the time of a recruitment drive for the Territorial Army held in UP’s Faizabad.

India’s main opposition party (Congress) general secretary Priyanka Gandhi arranged 1000 buses to take home the migrants stuck in the state of Uttar Pradesh. The image of buses arranged in a line on the road was taken in February 2019 during a fair organised by the state of Uttar Pradesh.

A Rohingya Muslim was terrified thinking a doctor had placed a gun on his head when the doctor was actually doing a thermal scan using a machine. The video is part of a longer clip made by Kenyan comedian Hussein Yussuf a.k.a Wariah Bahali Yake, for COVID-19 awareness.
Portuguese university discovered the cure for COVID-19. It is not true that a Portuguese university discovered the cure to COVID-19. The university mentioned in the post doesn't even exist.
Venezuela has the lowest rate of COVID-19 cases from Antarctica to the North Pole. Suriname has a lower case rate than Venezuela.
Priyanka Gandhi has started buses to help migrants travel during the COVID-19 lockdown. These buses were started by the Congress for the ease of the passengers to travel to the Kumbh Mela.

Multiple allegations on the bill drafted to Turkish congress named H.R. 6666. The purpose of the bill is to provide funds to local organizations to ensure that those at risk for COVID-19 to be tested, traced, and quarantined safely in their homes. Bill does not propose to enter the houses by force and to take children from their families. Tests and quarantine will be based on consent when necessary. The draft does not include a regulation on the COVID-19 vaccine. Bill Gates just mentioned the possibility that a digital certificate will show up in the future, indicating that people are being tested and vaccinated due to the new coronavirus; did not say it would be mandatory.

A photo of a queue of buses in India has been shared thousands of times on Facebook and Twitter alongside a claim they were organised by a leading opposition politician to transport migrant workers who were left stranded after a nationwide coronavirus lockdown. The claim is false; the photo has circulated in reports since February 2019 about a Hindu festival.

President Donald Trump “cancelled” the U.S. House bill on contract tracing and “expelled WHO.” The president doesn't have the power to "cancel" a bill, and he announced he would withhold payments to the WHO, which is headquartered in Switzerland, not the U.S.

The UN is asking for help from Donald Trump for serious human rights violations in Italy during the management of the COVID-19 pandemic. The UN has not asked for Donald Trump's help. A representative in Italy of an Ecuadorian association asked the American President for help via Twitter. Italian sites believed that the woman was a UN commissioner.
Video of leopard roaming on road during lockdown is from Delhi, India. Video of leopard roaming on road is from Hyderabad, not Delhi.

Claim that President Donald Trump is trying to make $451 billion in Medicare cuts “in the middle of a deadly pandemic.” Democratic super PAC uses familiar political play to hit Trump on Medicare. The timeline of events doesn’t support this statement. The $451 billion figure is accurate, but presented in a misleading way. It is not a direct program cut to beneficiaries. Instead, it is the result of lowering payments to providers. It also reflects a 10-year budget window.
Daughter of Santander’s CEO in Portugal shared a message about her father’s death from COVID-19. The communications office said the message was invented and that the woman denied thinking like that.

São Paulo’s governor João Doria ordered a recall of chloroquine and hydroxychloroquine from dugstores. The medecine is used as political tool to divide the governor and federal government. The state government said they receive the medecine and delivers to hospitals. State government has no control over drugstores.
There are no antibiotics to cure the coronavirus. This theory has no basis in any scientific study.

“The new Dane County lockdown policy… (has) effectively killed Badger football, hockey, and basketball for 2020.” Dane County’s phased reopening plan during the coronavirus pandemic puts restrictions on businesses and public gatherings. But it is unclear whether and to what degree the policy will impact sporting events at UW-Madison. The university is working with Public Health Madison and Dane County, as well as the Big Ten Conference, to determine how best to resume athletics.

Travel in public transport in Kyiv will rise after the lockdown is lifted. Neither private carriers nor the authorities have made the decision to increase the transport fare after lifting the lockdown.

Renowned cardiac surgeon Dr Devi Shetty has issued a list of 22 suggestions to be followed for one year to protect oneself against coronavirus. The viral message has been falsely attributed to Dr Devi Shetty. He has not issued the advisory.
Family of poor migrant commited suicide during lockdown in India. Old picture is falsely linked with lockdown; it is not recent.
Bill Gates spreads viruses to profit on vaccines. The claim has no factual support.

ID2020 is a criminal experiment. Elon Musk is responsible for making everyone wearing masks. The coronavirus was drawn in the computer program. ID2020 is a project on electronic passports. It is the WHO, not Elon Musk, that recommends people wearing masks to protect themselves from infecting. The new coronavirus is real and was captured through the microscope by the US National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases.

Articles shared thousands of times on Facebook and Twitter claim Rwandan President Paul Kagame censured the World Health Organization (WHO) for rejecting a herbal tonic touted by the Madagascan government as a cure for COVID-19. A presidential spokesperson dismissed the claim as “fake news”. No evidence was found to show Kagame made the comments. In fact, he has said his government is avoiding untested remedies.

South Sudan’s president and senior ministers have appeared in public in recent weeks wearing so-called “virus removal cards”, clip-on tags marketed as prevention against infectious diseases. AFP Fact Check found the items for sale online in various countries, including Lebanon, Malaysia and the Philippines. However, scientists warn the cards, which have been banned in the US and elsewhere, do not prevent COVID-19.

The Algerian President, Abdel Majid Taboun, awarded the National Order of Merit to the family of the martyr doctor Wafaa Boudissa, and her name was given to a hospital in the country. Misbar communicated with journalists on for the public Algerian radio, who denied the news and said that some sites shared it but it was not correct, and that they have not yet received any official statement in this regard.

A Jordanian health minister testifies before the millions, telling the world the truth about Covid-19. The man shown in the video clip is not the Jordanian Minister of Health, but rather a Jordanian journalist named Saleh Al-Rashed.
The World Health Organization shockes the world: alcohol does not kill the virus! This statement is fake.

A man sells snacks to Covid-19 patients in Ibn Zahr Hospital in Marrakech, without respecting health safety conditions. Misbar checked the video and found it misleading, as the patients who appeared in the video, according to the Regional Directorate of Health in Marrakech, were following treatment at Ibn Zahr Hospital and all recovered on May 14, 2020, and left quarantine after filming a video showing In it, one of the patients took on the role of a food vendor, and the rest took on the role of supposed customers.

Social media posts claim that actors were caught in the act staging fake COVID-19 cases. The man depicted in the photos in question wearing black was a private sector employee that was quarantied in a hotel and as soon as he developed symptoms for COVID-19 the public health authorities were called to transport him to the hospital. Due to the risk of contamination the man was placed on a special capsule and transported by ambulance to the nearest hospital.

A video from Portugal proves that there are no deaths due to COVID-19. In the coffin of an alleged victim there were only sand and rocks not a body. The video that is being shared is from 2017 and was shot as part of a police investigation in Brazil after allegations for insurance fraud.

Morgan Freeman says wearing facemasks is an experiment to identify the followers; a photo meme circulating on social media alleging that to be actor’s stance on facemasks during the pandemic Meme with Morgan Freeman allegedly saying how forcing people to wear facemasks is surely only an experiment to identify the obedient followers, appeared on Facebook. Raskrinkavanje have identified it to be shared mainly by Facebook groups with the conspirative narrative. In reality, Morgan Freeman has more than once supported the precaution measures, including wearing facemasks during the pandemic on social media, meaning that the textual part of the meme is completely baseless.
Bill Gates says the coronavirus vaccine will kill 700,000 people This is a manipulation of Bill Gates' statement

A video shows health workers turning their back in protest as an official car passes. Supposedly as if it were a protest against the Minister of Health of Spain, Salvador Illa or against the Minister of Equality Irene Montero at the Gregorio Marañón hospital. It is a hoax. The video is real, but the protest is in Brussels, Belgium, at the Chirec-Delta et Saint-Pierre Hospital and is against the Belgian Prime Minister, Sophie Wilmès.

Coronavirus remains in the throat for 4 days. Post claiming coronavirus remains in throat for 4 days is fake. This is no evidence proving this claim. Also, drinking water and gargling with salt water is good for sore throat but it cannot cure coronavirus.
A study states that people with blood type A are more vulnerable to get infected COVID-19, therefore those from this blood group need more protection. The WHO did not endorse this kind of studies.

A national radio claimed that the mayor of a municipality in Guatemala reported about 600 new cases of COVID-19. The mayor's statement was not the one that the radio transmitted through his social networks.

Video shows thousands of migrants gathered near Uttar Pradesh state Border violating social distancing. The video is old and unrelated to the current COVID-19 Lockdown, video dates back to October 2019 and is captured at a recruitment drive by the Territorial Army.

Video of migrants in a overcrowded train from Mumbai to West Bengal on 10 May 2020 amid COVID-19 social distancing restrictictions. This video is unrelated and dates back to 2018 from bangladesh, this video was of people travelling to an annual religious gatering called Biswa Ijtema.
Viral message showing roadmap to ease restrictions during COVID-19 is from India. Viral Message Showing Roadmap To Ease Restriction’s During COVID-19 Is NOT From India but from Ireland.

Chinese scientist who asked for the closure of Wuhan warned that the COVID-19 virus mutates every month. The study that is being disseminated on social networks was developed by Dr. Li, the conclusions drawn from this in these publications are false.

Bill Gates is doing “population control” with the coronavirus vaccine. A video misrepresents claims by the American businessman and adds false data and conspiracy theories to misinform on efforts to create a coronavirus vaccine.
Cannabis may prevent coronavirus from entering the body. The study was done on 3D tissue models; Human tests have not yet been done and have not even been reviewed by peer researchers.

The World Health Organization (WHO) said that no vegetarian has contracted COVID-19. The WHO made no such statement. There is no evidence that vegetarians fare better than non-vegetarians when it comes to COVID-19 infections.

Children in Oregon may be taken away if their parent or legal guardian tests positive for COVID-19. A spokesperson for the Oregon Department of Human Services said the claim “is absolutely untrue.” Oregon’s Child Welfare office does not consider the COVID-19 diagnosis of a caregiver a safety threat and sole reason for removing children from a household.
The video shows people celebrating the end of Saudi Arabia’s coronavirus lockdown. The footage actually shows a procession in Dubai, United Arab Emirates (UAE).
A video shows an evangelical pastor offering an invisible spiritual mask against COVID-19, H1N1 and HIV. The video is actually satiric. This "pastor" is actually a comedian named Márcio Américo.

STF, Brazil’s Supreme Court, forbade military hospitals to treat civilian COVID-19 patients. Five political parties opposed to Bolsonaro made the request. A regional Federal Justice branch denied a request to oblige a military hospital in Belém to cede room to civilian patients. This decision does not forbit the hospitals to open up to other patients if they want to, or even if state or municipal government oblige them to. The STF and the political parties have absolutely nothing to do with this story.

A photo of an empty hospital room. On the caption, it says that this used to be an “isolation room” for COVID-19 patients at the HCPM Hospital, in Rio. It says, also, there was now only one COVID-19 case in this hospital. According to Rio's Military Police, who run the HCPM, the room is just a regular waiting room, and there are still 42 COVID-19 patients in the hospital, as of May 18.

New evidence shows wearing a face mask can help coronavirus enter the brain and pose more health risk. There is no evidence or known biological mechanism for his claim that wearing a face mask increases risk of coronavirus infection of the brain. The statement that using face masks lead to serious health risks is also unsupported. While face masks and cloth face coverings do not provide 100% protection from infection, they still play an important role in reducing the risk of disease transmission by blocking infectious droplets containing the virus, which is the main mode of COVID-19 transmission.

Tasuku Honjo, a medicine nobel prize winner, said that COVID-19 is a synthetic virus that was made in china Tasuku Honjo refuted this claim in a message published by Kyoto University in 27 April 2020.

Claim that Fox news said that Trump tested positive for COVID-19. The original video is cut and edited to say that Trump tested positive for COVID-19. The original video announces a Trump Valet Tested positive for COVID-19 and Trump assured in a conference that he is fine and he hasn't tested positive for the disease.

Switzerland banned vaccination and someone named “Father Escobar” said that through vaccination, “Satan inserts a code into a human body.” Switzerland is still conducting vaccinations and "Father Escobar" is a fictional person. The source of information was a Russian satirical website 'Panorama pub'.

A video shot in Lugano (Switzerland) on May 15, 2020, where people are not wearing no masks or PPI. The video would confirm that the new coronavirus is not lethal. The video is real and it was actually shot in Lugano on May 15, 2020. However, people are not wearing masks because, according to Swiss guidelines, they are not compulsory in public spaces. The conspirancy theory linked with the video is unfounded.
Myanmar traditional medicine can cure the coronavirus. As of publication of this article, there is no proven cure for COVID-19.

A picture claiming that the UN would have accused the Italian government of “violating human rights” during the COVID-19 lockdown. The message was originally tweeted by Alicia Erazo, but she does not work/is not connected with the United Nations. She works for the "Comisionado International Derechos Humanos", an Ecuadorian organization.
A new virus in tomatoes is more dangerous than the novel coronavirus. Leading experts and virologists debunked the claim, and explained how plant viruses don't infect humans.

Photo of an Indonesian plane full of passengers while it’s forbidden to take a flight home at the moment. The photo shows Indians on a Singapore-Mumbai flight on May 10, 2020. The flight is part of the Vande Bharat Mission, an Indian government program to repatriate citizens from various countries in order to protect them from coronavirus COVID-19 virus transmission.

Video of West Sumatra residents, in Indonesia, throwing off Chinese tourists and burning their belongings during the COVID-19 pandemic. The video is a combination of footage from different events. One video does show the protest of West Sumatra residents related to the arrival of tourists from China in the midst of the outbreak of the novel coronavirus. However, a video showing the burning of a building was taken in 2018 and is in no way related to COVID-19.

Brazilian states receive federal funding for each death from COVID-19 registered. The Brazilian Ministry of Health reported that it doesn't make any transfers due to the volume of deaths from the new coronavirus. The Union's resources for states and municipalities are divided based on criteria such as the size of the population and the complexity of the service provided.

A traditional medicine from Myanmar was found to be effective in curing or preventing COVID-19. Dr. Myint Myint Than, a traditional medicinal expert and director from MOHS confirms that there is discussion about certain traditional medicines but the medicine in this specific post is not included in the list. She also said permission to treat COVID-19 patients has not been given even for the traditional medicines included in the list.

Letter issued from the Sri Lankan Ministry of Defense stating that there will be a pay cut from the May month’s salary of Armed forces based on the request letter from President’s Secretary. Members of the Armed Forces, Police and Civil Security Department are not required to donate a day's salary.

Deputy Inspector General Ajith Rohana has received his daughter who arrived from Kiev to Colombo, Sri Lanka, from airport runway and taken her home neglecting the quarantine measures. Ajith Rohan’s daughter is preparing for her final examinations which are to be held in June at Grodno State Medical University in Belarus and plans to return to Sri Lanka after the exams.

Video shows migrant workers raising “long live Pakistan” slogans when returning their home state during lockdown. Migrant workers were, in fact, saying "Sajid Bhai Zindabad". Fact Crescendo spoke to Sajid Siddiqui, whose name they were chanting. He told us that his party has facilitated the free return journey of many migrants.

Image shows long queue of buses of migrants that were denied permission to enter Uttar Pradesh by the state government. The viral image is old. It actually shows a long parade of buses as a part of Guinness World records attempt in 2019.

French government changed the law as to prevent citizens from suing it for its mistakes during the COVID-19 outbreak. While such an amendment exists, it was not the government's idea; and it mainly protects mayors rather than the government. It is still legally possible to fill a legal action against the French government.

People in the city of Mumbai were raising “Pakistan Zindabad” slogans in front of a political party member Abu Azmi. People were raising "Sajid Bhai Zindabad" in support of a political party members Sajid Siddiqui, Abu Azmi and Mumbai Police who had flagged off a special train to take migrants home amidst the coronavirus lockdown.
A Rohingya Muslim believes that the thermal scanner for testing COVID-19 is a gun that is being pulled at him. The video was made by a Kenyan comedian.

A post says that the flu vaccine increases the risk of being infected with COVID-19. The World Health Organization and several experts say that the the flu vaccine strengthens the immune system and there is no scientific evidence relating the flu vaccine to the new coronavirus.

Twitter posts accuse Dutch government ministers of flaunting social distancing rules. A recent picture allegedly showing Dutch government officials flaunting social distancing rules was actually taken in 2018.
Reopening schools has caused a flareup of contaminations in France. There is no known causal link between the reopening of French schools on May 11 and 70 cases of contamination.

Dolores Cahill in Computing Forever interview claims that taking vitamins C and D as well as zinc boosts the immune system against COVID-19, that hydroxychloroquine has been proven effective against COVID-19, and that COVID-19 patients who recover are immune for life, among others. Vitamins C, D and zinc are important nutrients, but these have not been shown to "boost" the immune system against COVID-19; scientific studies have not shown that hydroxychloroquine is effective against COVID-19; how long COVID-19 immunity lasts in patients who have recovered is still unknown - much more time is needed before scientists have sufficient data to determine how long immunity against the virus persists.
The prolonged use of masks can cause hypoxia. There are is scientific evidence to support this statement.

There was never any masks shortage in France, and this topic was absent from public debate in January, February, and even March, according to French president Emmanuel Macron. Healthcare unions were already concerned about lack of masks in February, when authorities did not recommended their widespread use already. And even if there was no shortage, masks could not be sold to individuals due to public requisitions, large importations had to be set up, and healthcare workers frequently complained about the lack of FFP2 and surgical masks.

An article claims that a nearly $50 million United Nations humanitarian aid package to Ecuador is conditional on the South American country legalizing abortions. This is false; the UN said there was no such condition, and abortion is already allowed under limited circumstances.

A video showing hundreds of frogs being sold from the back of a truck has been viewed tens of thousands of times in multiple posts on Facebook, Twitter and YouTube alongside a claim that it was taken in China after the country lifted its coronavirus lockdown. The claim is false; this clip actually shows frogs being sold in Thailand.

Two photos have been shared thousands of times in multiple Facebook posts which claim that Kawasaki disease is spreading among babies during the coronavirus pandemic. The claim is misleading; one of the photos has previously circulated in reports about a skin blister caused by a different disease; health authorities are still investigating cases of a Kawasaki-like condition observed in some children with COVID-19, and maintain that children remain “minimally affected” by the virus overall.

Photos of Australian $10 banknotes have been shared multiple times on Facebook and Twitter alongside a claim that the note features images representing coronavirus and the billionaire philanthropist Bill Gates. The claim is false; the Reserve Bank of Australia said the images on the notes instead show a tree native to Australia and Australian writer Mary Gilmore.

A video shows the situation in the Indian slum being extremely acute. No COVID-19 tests nor genuine figures are available there. The video was taken at the site of a gas leak incident in Visakhapatnam, not related to COVID-19.

A video in Facebook claims that drinking seawater helps to prevent COVID-19 contagion. The intake of seawater not only does not prevent contagion, but is potentially dangerous due to the high content of salt and microorganisms.
The coronavirus sticks faster on men with shaved heads or recently shaved heads. There is no such report from 24 Oras, a news program in the Philippines.

“While California is dying … Gavin (Newsom) is vacationing in Stevensville, MT!” Newsom has not been vacationing in Stevensville in recent weeks, his office said. The Montana governor’s office and Stevensville mayor said the same thing.

Texas and Florida have a “balanced budget” while California is “in debt $54 billion and New York is “in debt $6.1 billion.” Facebook post gets debt wrong in comparison of Florida, Texas, California and New York. States commonly take on debt to pay for construction and environmental projects. Debt is not the same as a budget shortfall. All four states have debt. The amount of state budget shortfalls due to the pandemic is a moving target. States can have debt and a balanced budget.
Image showing crowds gathering in Wadowice, Poland, to celebrate 100th birthday of John Paul II, breaking the social distancing rules. The image is from 2015.
Video showing “COV-19” writings on a piece of equipment installed in 5G towers in United Kingdom. The writing "COV-19" is not autentic and the piece of hardware is not related to the 5G technology.
The police joined a demonstration in the German city of Dresden against the coronavirus rules. The police was guarding the demonstration, not joining it.

COVID-19 deaths in Lombardy are due to flu vaccines. An article claims that the flu vaccines contain Sars-cov2 and killed COVID-19 patients in Lombardy. The article talks about scientific studies, but none of them confirms the narrative. There is no scientific evidence and the vaccines used in Lombardy contained inactivated viruses.

An Italian politician says that according to the science journal Nature the vaccine against COVID-19 is not needed because the virus changes rapidly. The scientific journal Nature does not say that the vaccine against Sars-cov2 is useless. The article talks about optimistic scenarios, where the virus could cause less harm in the future.
300 Monks found positive to COVID-19 in Jaipur, India. Viral claim is fake. Jaipur's District Collectorate denied this claim.

Influenza and coronavirus vaccines are more likely to cause upper respiratory tract infections. All COVID-19 tests shows positive result. There are plenty of evidence that coronavirus tests can show positive results as well as negative results if a person is not sick. Vaccines are not causing upper respiratory tract infections.

Vitamin D Supplements prevent health problems after coronavirus infection. This study was unable to establish a causal relationship between vitamin D and the severity of health problems after a coronavirus infection.

Face masks cause COVID-19 infection in the brain. There is no evidence to support the claim that wearing a face mask increases the risk of infection in the brain from SARS-CoV-2. Also, the claim that the use of face masks poses significant health risks is unsubstantiated.

UV-C lamps can kill 99.99% of all bacteria, viruses, and mold on any surface in ten seconds, yet is 100% safe for humans and pets. UV light is extensively used to decontaminate and sterilize water, air, and inanimate surfaces. Efficient decontamination of a surface by UV light depends on technical conditions such as optimal wavelength and irradiance, and appropriate exposure time and distance. In addition, UV light, including short wavelength UV-C, is hazardous to humans due to its mutagenic effects and ability to burn the skin. Due to these risks, UV light is safest and most effectively used under well-controlled conditions and cannot be recommended for decontamination in a home setting.
The salt wáter of beaches and chlorine used in swimming pools could stop COVID-19. There is not yet enough research related to the coronavirus and its relation to aquatic spaces.

German doctor Gérard Krause says lockdown measures kill more than coronavírus itself. The doctor did not say that exactly. The phrase was taken out of context. He was suggesting that authorities should not let COVID-19 make them forget about other diseases.

Herbal tea made of malunggay and kamias leaves is a cure for COVID-19, the disease caused by the novel coronavirus. The World Health Organization (WHO) says that while there are some Western, traditional, or home remedies that may provide comfort and alleviate symptoms of mild COVID-19, there is still no official cure for the disease as of May 29.

Indian government has created a roadmap to ease COVID-19 restrictions in five phases through a three-week review process. The original source of the five-phase ease in restrictions has been traced to the Government of Ireland. Ireland’s taoiseach (Prime minister), Leo Varadkar, confirmed a phased, five-stage exit over three months to ease COVID-19 restrictions.

Footage of a large crowd has been shared in multiple Facebook posts claiming to show migrant workers who were stopped at the Delhi-Uttar Pradesh state border during India’s nationwide COVID-19 lockdown in May 2020. However, the claim is false; the video has circulated online since at least October 2019 and is linked to local news reports about an Indian Army recruitment drive in Faizabad, Uttar Pradesh.

United States and China bribed Madagascan President Andry Rajoelina to poison COVID-Organics, a remedy devised by Madagascan researchers against COVID-19. According to the evidence, the Madagascan president spoke of the confinement of his population and not of a plot involving the United States and China.
Tanzania has reported 16,467 COVID-19 cases, 1,293 deaths, and 118 recoveries as of May 18. Government records show that Tanzania has 509 COVID-19 cases and recorded 21 deaths by May 13.
A mixture of lemon, ginger, and hot water can cure COVID-19. While the mixture has potential health benefits, it is not effective against the disease, which is spread by a virus.

Northern Ireland was testing for COVID-19 at a rate 10 times that of Scotland, reported on 9 May 2020. Northern Ireland’s test rate for the day of 8 May 2020 was about three-quarters (80%) that of Scotland.

A private plane is carrying Nabila Obaid and Nadia El-Gendy, who have remained in Beirut due to the novel coronavirus crisis. Misbar checked the image to find that it is outdated, and was published on January.

Indian government has created a roadmap to ease COVID-19 restrictions in five phases through a three-week review process. The original source of the five-phase ease in restrictions has been traced to the Government of Ireland. Ireland’s taoiseach (Prime minister), Leo Varadkar, confirmed a phased, five-stage exit over three months to ease COVID-19 restrictions.

Illegal immigrants are strolling around the country; however Bosnia-Herzegovina citizens with dual citizenship are deprived from entering the country A media outlet from Bosnia-Herzegovina (BiH) disseminated false news about illegal immigrants freely strolling around the country, when its own citizens are hesitant to enter BiH because of mandatory self-isolation. During the COVID-19 pandemic the country imposed state of emergency measures, following entrance restriction for foreigners, whilst BiH's citizens entering the country were required to self-isolate at home for fourteen days, not fifteen as indicated in the article. The article's author is intentionally or coincidently linking the two unrelated matters - one of BiH's citizens returning to BiH, and another illegal immigration in BiH. Immigrants and refugees coming into BiH are not using official border crossings, but illegal alternate routes, hence self-isolation imposed upon them is unrealistic. BiH has limited capacities to provide shelter for all illegal immigrants and thus many of them reside in the streets. International Organization for Migrations (IOM) has confirmed 1500 immigrants are  residing outside of official asylum centers in Canton Sarajevo, Bijača (border with Croatia), and Velika Kladuša (northern border between Croatia and Bosnia).
According to Plamen Paskov, all people on the planet will be by force vaccinated and get microchip injections. There is no evidence supporting this claim.

A photo of a pile of money. On the caption, it is stated that this money was meant to fund temporary hospitals in Rio, but it was stolen by an aide of governor Wilson Witzel. This pile of money was found in a Federal Police raid in a corruption scandal in Rio, but it has nothing to do with COVID-19 temporary hospitals.
Telecommunication masts are responsible for the spread of COVID-19 5G doesn't cause COVID-19. The equipment shown in the video is not related to the pandemic
Migrants are beating people up for money in Delhi. The video is of April 2020 and the accused are minors and not migrants.
The Indian government is not providing food to migrants. They are eating leftovers. The video is from August 2019 and is not linked to the migrants crisis related to the lockdown due to COVID-19.

A post that shows the level of radioactivity of 5G antennas in Argentina. The National Communications Authority (Enacom) and the telecommunications company Movistar denied the installation of 5G antennas in Argentina. Furthermore, the WHO "found no adverse health effects associated with the use of these technologies".

Argentinian doctor Mühlberger has the cure against COVID-19 Justice ordered the closure of the aesthetic health clinic run by Rubén Mühlberger, who is investigated for the validity of his registration and was arrested, after a series of irregularities, among which was the promotion of an "antiviral for COVID-19 ”(Sic). However, this is false. There are currently no proven cures against the new coronavirus, as noted by the World Health Organization (WHO).
Video shows doctors and nurses turning their back to the Health ministry of Spain as he arrives to a Hospital. The video was recorded in Belgium not in Spain.
The water in Botafogo’s beach in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, is clear and clean because of quarantine. There are natural causes for the clarity of water such as tides and shortage in rains.

WHO announced that Alcohol doesn’t kill the corona virus. WHO said in Q&A that the right concentration of alcohol can kill coronavirus on surfaces. WHO also recommends the use of alcohol based antiseptics to disinfect hands regurarly. WHO in their mythbusting section said that drinkin alcohol will not prevent or treat COVID-19 as well as covering the whole body with alcohol.
The new coronavirus causes thrombosis, not pneumonia. Thrombosis, along with pneumonia, is one of the medical repercussions of COVID-19.

A migrant travelling home amidst the coronavirus lockdown was eating food thrown on railway tracks because the ruling party BJP had not made arrangments for the hungry migrants walking their way to their homes. The video of a man eating food thrown on railway tracks was uploaded on the internet in August 2019, and has no relation to the lockdown or migrants.

A video shot in Belgium where a team of healthcare professionals turns its back to a black car that is passing between them, allegedly as a form of protest against the “COVID-19 hoax”. The video was actually shot in Bruxelles on May 17, 2020, but the healthcare professionals were protesting against Prime Minister Sophie Wilmer's mismanagement of the crisis. Mrs. Wilmer was actually travelling in the black car that passes between doctors and nurses.

Italian MP Sara Cunial says Bill Gates kills people with vaccines and “terminator” seeds, and that he is behind the COVID-19 pandemic. This video contains at least 5 fake or misleading information about vaccines, Bill Gates, and its role during the COVID-19 pandemic. Gates does not sell Monsanto "terminator" seeds to African countries, he did not paralyze half a million children in India, he did not sterilise millions of African women.

Multiple Facebook and Twitter posts shared hundreds of times claim the Australian state of Western Australia has recently passed a “COVID-19 Emergency Powers Act” that authorises forcible medical examination and vaccination in schools. The claim is misleading; a spokesperson from Western Australia’s Department of Health told AFP no such law has been passed during the pandemic; as of May 2020, the state has no COVID-19 vaccine programme.

A video shows a police woman threatening to use her weapon against people demonstrating against the coronavirus rules in Germany. The police woman meant pepper spray. She said "pepper", not "weapon" (in German, the words sound similar).

Bill Gates and Microsoft have patented a cryptocurrency from Satan (666) and a microchip tattooed to control humans. The microchip would be inserted with coronavirus vaccines. The patent is not complete. It does not have the number 666 and it is not a patent for a tattooed microchip. There is talk of a "patch" vaccine for COVID-19 which can have microcrystals that are colored with infrared, but are not microchips. The system works with an external sensor, such as a cellphone pedometer.
Madagascar president announced that WHO tried to bribe him to poison his miracelous treatment for COVID-19. There is no record of the president saying this in any interview.

Multiple posts shared repeatedly on Facebook and Twitter claim that seven countries, including the United States, Spain, Italy and the United Kingdom, have “survival rates” of more than 99.9 percent for people who contract the novel coronavirus. The claim is misleading; as of May 2020, several medical experts said global COVID-19 survival rates remain unknown for various reasons.
The coronavirus is not a virus but a bacterium. SARS-Cov-2 is a virus, not a bacterium, and this has been proven by hundreds of studies around the world. The virus genome has long been decoded.

Chlorine dioxide cures COVID-19. So far, the usefulness of that formula has only been demonstrated as a disinfectant for surfaces, but there is no evidence that it works to cure COVID-19. In 2010 the United States FDA warned about harm from chlorine dioxide.

A Facebook post shared thousands of times claims that Russian President Vladimir Putin ordered Covid-Organics, a herbal drink touted by Madagascan President Andry Rajoelina as a cure for COVID-19. The post claims that Putin urged Africans “not to follow” the World Health Organization (WHO), which has warned against untested traditional medicine. However, AFP Fact Check found no official reports from the Kremlin of any order and the Madagascan presidency denied the claims.

A video of a nurse shared thousands of times on Facebook during the coronavirus pandemic warns the public against continuously wearing face masks. Her claims that wearing a face mask could harm the body are misleading, according to medical experts.

There is no excess mortality in Germany according to the official data of the Office for Statistics. The numbers are presented in a misleading way. According to the Office of Statistics there was clear excess mortality in Germany in April. Instead of looking at the relevant time span where there were deaths by COVID-19 in Germany, the Youtuber looks at the whole year. He further doesn't take the very low flu season into account.

The Tunisian President, Qais Said, has ordered the dispatch of a medical delegation to Algeria to help it fight Coved-19. Misbar contacted the media official for the Presidency of the Republic, Reem Qassem, who confirmed that President Qais Saeed is undoubtedly supporting Algeria, but she is not aware of any medical personnel sent to support their efforts to combat COVID-19.

Video depicts how the Chinese continue to eat frogs, although it was the eating of wild animals that caused the creation of the corunavirus. The clip is from Thailand, not from China. Misbar has found the original video posted on Facebook since May 11, with comments in Thai describing residents' heavy demand for frogs.

American scientist Judy Mykowitz exposes facts about the US administration regarding coronavirus and accuses the US military of fabricating it in conjunction with the Wuhan Chinese laboratory. Her claim is false according to several scientific journals.

The WHO recommended completely “unspecific” tests for SARS-CoV-2. The WHO said that it is sufficient in regions where SARS-CoV-2 is widely spread, if PCR tests are considered positive if only one (of two) genetic target zones is tested positive. But this doesn't make the tests "unspecific".

According to a study conducted by the American Pentagon, everyone who has received the influenza vaccine are 36% more likely to get infected by SARS-CoV-2. The study in question was published at the summer of 2019 and analyzed data that were collected in the period between 2017-2018, meaning 2 years before COVID-19. The study reviewed and rejected the hypothesis that influenza vaccination increases the chance of becoming infected with another virus that affects the respiratory system. The researchers analyzed 4 types of coronaviruses non of which of course was or could be SARS-CoV-2.
5G networks worsen the COVID-19 spread. There are no scientific evidence about the relationship netwwen 5G and COVID-19 and WHO have included this in their myths section.
Migrant labourers are being denied entry in Uttar Pradesh by the UP government. This is a 2019 video of a recruitment drive in Faizabad, Uttar Pradesh and is not linked to the COVID-19 lockdown
An unidentified virus that has affected the tomato crop in Maharashtra is a deadly form of coronavirus. The virus in the tomato seeds is being studied and there is so far no link to coronavirus.
During the protest in the Salamanca district in Madrid, people sang ‘Bella ciao’. The audio of the video is manipulated.

90 percent of violence against women calls to 911 in Mexico are not true. It is false that in Mexico nine out of 10 calls to 911 related to violence against women are not true, as President Andrés Manuel López Obrador assured during the morning conference on May 15, 2020.

The “Plandemic” video that talks about the new coronavirus. The video features Dr. Judy Mikovits, an American anti-vaccination activist and former medical researcher, who says several misinformations regarding COVID-19.

An image of the Minister of Education and Vocational Training of Spain, Isabel Celaá, in which she wears a mask and, in a folder she holds with her hand, you can see wrappers of the free face masks of the Community of Madrid. The message that accompanies the photo states: “Thank goodness that Isabel Díaz Ayuso’s masks are not recommended, thank goodness …” It is a hoax, the image is a montage. The original photograph is from May 5 and the minister does not carry in her folder any packaging of the masks of the Community of Madrid.

An image in which you see members of the Government, including President Pedro Sánchez, speaking in a ‘circle’ without respecting social distance. It is a hoax that this image is recent. It is from January 30, when the Government signed the rise of the Interprofessional Minimum Wage (SMI) with unions and employers.
CCTV footage shows a robbery happened in Mumbai amid COVID-19 lockdown. The CCTV footage is from Delhi and has no connection to Mumbai.
Video shows a huge crowd of migrant workers gathered in Surat, India due to lockdown. The video is from Delhi and is falsely being attributed to different cities in India.

Archbishop of Colombo, Sri Lanka, Cardinal Malcom Ranjith filed a FR petition challenging the cremation of Catholics, who succumbed due to COVID-19. Cardinal Malcom Ranjith or Catholic Church never made such a statement. However a FR petition challenging the cremation of COVID-19 victims had been filed by a Catholic, Mr. Oshala Herath.

Image of a pristine waterfall claimed to be Kithulgala in Sri Lanka, inviting travel enthusiasts to visit the location, once the COVID-19 security measures eases out. Image is from Keralakundum falls in Kerala, India.

A Facebook page of the Philippines social welfare department posted a tentative schedule of the second wave of aid distribution for low-income families affected by the community quarantine during the COVID-19 pandemic. The social welfare department issued an advisory on May 15 clarifying two things: the account is not an official account of the agency, and there is still no schedule for the next tranche of cash assistance.

Claim that the Jordanian Health minister says COVID-19 is a conspiracy in a video. The man in the video is not Jordian Health Minsiter. He is a journalist as he himself explained in another post. The claims in the video about COVID-19 are wrong and doesn't have any evidence to support it.
COVID-19 is a man made virus, according to the video “Plandemic”. The claims in the video are incorrect. There is significant evidence to show that COVID-19 is not a fabricated virus.

A photo showing rows of passengers wearing face masks and shields on board a plane has been shared hundreds of times in multiple posts on Facebook alongside a claim it was taken in Indonesia during the coronavirus pandemic. The claim is false; the photo shows Indian nationals who returned home on a government-chartered flight from Singapore during the pandemic.

A photo showing rows of passengers wearing face masks and shields on board a plane has been shared hundreds of times in multiple posts on Facebook alongside a claim it was taken in Indonesia during the coronavirus pandemic. The claim is false; the photo shows Indian nationals who returned home on a government-chartered flight from Singapore during the pandemic.

Says a warning label on a box of disposable masks shows that they are ineffective at protecting against the spread of COVID-19. Mask box label is legitimate, but people are misinterpreting it. The N95 respirator offers the most protection against viral particles for the wearer because it can filter very small aerosol particles. But other masks, like the ones in the photo or homemade fabric masks, are effective in reducing the spread of the disease because they help stop asymptomatic individuals from unknowingly spreading the disease.

Video shows fight between inspectors and population over social isolation measures in Brazil. The video was recorded in September 2019, and the fight started after the seizure of a cart with alcoholic beverages. There is no relationship with the new coronavirus pandemic.

Left-wing parties in Brazil asked the Supreme Court to prevent the Army from making beds at the Military Hospital available for people with COVID-19. The court's advisory office denied such a hypothesis and there was no record of a decision similar to the one issued by the court until this April 18.

Photo shows former brazilian Health Minister Luiz Henrique Mandetta shaking hands with the governor of the state of Pará without masks, which shows that the pandemic is a scam. The photo used in social media posts that make this claim was taken in 2019, before the first case of COVID-19.

WHO officially recognized artemisia as a treatment for COVID-19. WHO did recognized that Madagascar was pushing artemesia as a treatment, but made clear it needed scientific evidence to be deemed a reliable cure.

Madagascar left the World Health Organization. The president of Madagascar, Andry Rajoelina, is indeed dissatisfied with WHO's refusal to recognize artemesia as a cure, but he never threatened to leave the health organization.
This picture show the young, pregnant doctor who died from COVID-19 in Algeria. Even if this Algerian doctor truly died, this picture actually shows an assistant doctor in the US.

Multiple Facebook posts shared hundreds of times claim China and Japan have re-entered a strict coronavirus lockdown in mid-May 2020 following a “second wave” of the virus. The posts were shared as a “breaking news” alert on May 16. The claim is misleading; as of May 22, Japan has begun easing lockdown restrictions; on May 18, China put one city in Jilin Province under total lockdown but it has relaxed restrictions in other parts of the country.

A video has been viewed thousands of times in multiple posts on Facebook, Twitter and YouTube in May 2020 alongside a claim it shows crows “coming to Texas” after “attacking Wuhan, China”. The posts were shared as countries worldwide continue to fight the spread of the novel coronavirus, which was first detected in Wuhan in December 2019. The claim is false; the video shows black birds swarming the US state of Texas in December 2016; the audio of the video in some of the posts has been manipulated.

Madagascar President Andry Rajoelina said that the World Health Organization (WHO) offered him $20 million to put toxins in their coronavirus remedy. Rajoelina did not make this accusation. Some posts containing the claim attached a photo of a newspaper article which said that Rajoelina made this accusation in his interview with France 24. However, in the said interview, Rajoelina made no mention of an alleged "bribery" by WHO. He discussed Covid-Organics and addressed criticism against the supposed remedy.

A photo of a petri bowl with germs is shared on Facebook with the claim that the bacteria are from a used face medical mask and show that wearing it is dangerous; you get breathing problems, skin problems or a sty at the eyelid. The germs in the petri bowl do not show that the bacteria are dangerous; indeed it may look the same when you just spit into the bowl. A medical mask has to be certified so it doesn't have side effects like breathing problems or a sty. Skin problems like pimples may occur.
The flu didn’t kill any Americans this year. The post is wrong. While COVID-19 has made assessing flu fatalities more complicated, thousands of Americans have died from influenza during the pandemic.

Ohio Gov. Mike DeWine released 4,300 prisoners and is now warning residents of a possible crime wave. Ohio Gov. Mike DeWine has not released 4,300 prisoners due to COVID-19 and there’s no evidence that he warned residents of a possible crime wave. Ohio has released 129 inmates early due to COVID-19, according to DeWine’s staff.

Some websites claimed that Madagascar quit the World Health Organisation (WHO) and has been offered 20 million dollars by the WHO to kill their Covid-Organics cure. Madagascar has neither quit the WHO nor has WHO offered it 20 million dollars to kill the country’s herbal drink, Covid-Organics. This was confirmed by the WHO country offices in Madagascar and in Ghana. Also, the France 24 interview purported to be the source of both claims reveals no such information.
The video shows lockdown violation, Muslims offering namaz on roadside. Video of Muslims offering Namaz on the roadside is old. This happened before lockdown.

Ethiopia reports 2144 new infections with the novel coronavirus, bringing the total number to 63,000. Misbar verified the news and found it to be false, because the total number of infections in Ethiopia as of the last announcement (on May 16th), according to the Ethiopian Ministry of Health, is 306.

Two American doctors demonstated through a scientific study that COVID-19 is a very simple disease that does not warrant the extreme public safety measures that have been employed worldwide. The doctors in question have no background in epidemiology. Moreover, the results of their analysis were not peer-reviewed nor published in any credible science journal and therefore do not consitute a credible source of information in the context of COVID-19.

The ID-2020 project is electronic fascism; it promotes the injection of nano-chips, including through the COVID-19 vaccine. The project facilitates access to personal data and does not involve nano-chips injections.
Steam therapy cures the coronavirus. After seeking clarification from officials of the Ghana Health Service(GHS) and the Ghana Medical Association(GMA), the claim is rated as unproven.

One out of three Dutch people is experiencing psychological issues because of the coronavirus crisis. The research population isn't a correct representation of the Dutch population of inhabitants; 83 per cent of the respondents is female and barely any young people took part in the research. Therefore, the conclusion that one out of three Dutch people is experiencing psychological issues because of the coronavirus crisis is invalid.
Drinking alcohol can help fight coronavirus. The World Health Organisation(WHO) and the Ghana Food and Drugs Authority (FDA) have dismissed the claim as false.
The coronavirus is an exosome related with 5G. COVID-19 or the novel coronavirus causing it are not "exosomes" and are not related to 5G technology.

Italy’s Ministry of Health has discovered that COVID-19 deaths are caused by a bacteria, not by the novel coronavirus. The official Italy's Ministry of Health states that COVID-19 deaths are caused by the SARS-Cov-2.

A video shows healthcare professionals in a hospital displaying hopeful message. The caption states the video was filmed at Moinhos de Vento Hospital, in Porto Alegre, Brazil, and that they managed to cure all the COVID-19 patients in their ICU and were, thus, celebrating. Although the video was shot at Moinhos de Vento Hospital, there are six COVID-19 patients in their ICU, and eight others under standard care.

The official Brazilial Civil Registry has showed that the total number of deaths in April decreased, instead of increased, between 2019 and 2020, during the COVID-19 pandemic. The total number of deaths increased in April, according to the Official Registry. Also, the 2020 numbers are still being updated, so the difference can be even larger than it shows currently.

Picture shows Bill Gates and White House health advisor Dr Anthony Fauci violating social distancing norms and not wearing masks. The picture was taken in December 2018 and has nothing to do with the coronavirus pandemic.

According to Alibaba Group co-founder Jack Ma, 2020 is the year of staying alive and not a time to “dream or plan”. The Alibaba Group has officially denied that Jack Ma issued such a statement. There is no record of Ma saying something like that.
Universal use of masks reduce coronavirus spread by 98.5%. There are not evidence about measuring the effectiveness of using masks but some research shows could reduce only between 5% to 19%.
Migrants in Mumbai robbed and killed a man for money due to the lockdown. This is a video of a robbery from Delhi in 2018 and is not related to the COVID-19 lockdown.

A video of an overcrowded Shramik train claimed to be from Mumbai travelling to West Bengal. The video is from Bangladesh in 2018 when Bangladeshi migrants were travelling in the special Bishwa Ijtema train.
A leopard was seen in Mumbai due to the lockdown and a lesser number of vehicles. The leopard was seen on the National Highway at Hyderabad and not in Mumbai due to the lockdown

Video shows a toxic insect attack in India during the COVID-19 pandemic. The six videos are from several different events and are not videos of poison insect attacks in India during the COVID-19 pandemic. Three videos were taken from a chemical gas leak at a factory in India. Two videos were not recorded in India, but in the United States and Colombia. While one other video has been circulating since 2018, long before the emergence of the coronavirus COVID-19 virus in Wuhan, China, in December 2019.

Video shows statues in India disposed because they cannot be saved from COVID-19. The video does show the disposal of a statue of Lord Ganesha in a river in India. However, the sinking of the statue is a part of a cultural festival in India, Ganapati Visarjan or Ganesh Chaturthi. The video was recorded in 2015, long before the coronavirus appeared in Wuhan, China, in December 2019.

Video of Islamic Ulema in Indonesia forced to get COVID-19 vaccine Injected. The contents of the video are pickups of patients who were positive for COVID-19 to be isolated in the hospital. The officer in the black robe in the video is a member of the COVID-19 Task Force Team. There is currently no COVID-19 vaccine.
This photograph of corpses is related to the coronavirus in Spain. This photograph of corpses is neither current nor related to the coronavirus, it occurred in Los Angeles in 2013.
The image of a police sign banning Spanish flags. The image is a montage. The original photo corresponds to a police checkpoint where you can read "stop, police checkpoint".

A photo of a demonstration where we can see a woman and her maid is shared as if it was a protest in Madrid against the government. The image is from Argentina and has been shared at least since 2008.

The headline claims that the Macedonian Minister of Health, Venko Filipce, after a party order of the President of SDSM, Zoran Zaev, prepared a protocol for the election campaign in the middle of the coronavirus crisis. Contrary to the claim in the text, the election protocol has been prepared by the Commission for Infectious Diseases, which includes several medical personnel. This Commission is the expert body from which every initiative and protocol originates for virtually every segment of life in the face of an epidemic, including elections.

A Facebook post blames China as the source of a series of deadly viruses, including COVID-19, that have spread around the world since 1957. AAP FactCheck found the Facebook post to be partly false. While COVID-19, SARS and bird flu outbreaks can be sourced to China, the H2N2 virus of 1957-1958 and the 2009 Swine Flu outbreaks did not originate in China. A third, the H3N2 virus of 1968-69, has not been conclusively sourced to China, while the claims relating to the origins of H5N1 (1997-2004), “2006 - Bird Flu” and Porcine Petrivirus (2013) are inaccurate.

The front page of a 1962 issues of “La Domenica del Corriere”, showing people moving around on small vehicles with a glass protection. The illustration would allegedly have predicted coronavirus and the social distacing measures adopted to stop the pandemic. The illustration is real and it actually comes from a 1962 issue of "La Domenica del Corriere". However, it has nothing to do with coronavirus and the small vehicles are presented as a possibile solution against traffic jams in congested cities.

An image of corpses in plastic bags in a morgue is claimed to be from Spain during the coronavirus crisis. It is a hoax: it is not a current image nor is it from Spain. It is a photograph taken in 2013 in Los Angeles, United States.
A video of street play showing Muslims responsible for spreading coronavirus. The clip shows a street play on social distancing which became viral with a false caption.
Muslims offering Namaz on road side during the lockdown in India. This is an old video showing Muslim people offering Namaz. It became viral recently with a false caption mentioning the lockdown.

Flu shots can make someone test positive for COVID-19. The claim made in the viral post is completely incorrect. If you’ve gotten flu shots in the past 10 years, this does not mean you will test positive for the novel coronavirus.

Switzerland has banned vaccination. This is an old hoax, made by satiric website Panorama.pub. Site owners changed the date of publishing and started to spread this fake as a new one related to the pandemic.

Video shows a huge crowd of migrant workers gathered in Maharashtra amid COVID-19 lockdown. The video is actually from Delhi. It is being shared falsely in the name of different cities of Maharashtra and Gujarat.

Image of worn-out feet/sole of migrant workers walking on streets in India amis COVID-19 Lockdown. The image was captured in 2018 and is from Pakistan. The image is of Children from a poor family in the Sindh province who were suffering from a disease due to which their feet were worn-out.

Serbian president Aleksandar Vucic claimed that in proportion to the number of citizens, Serbia is eight country in Europe by number individuals tested for coronavirus. According to Worldometers webiste, Serbia is ranked as 32nd country per number of tested citizens.

Video shows Dr. Anthony Fauci advising the public not to wear face masks to prevent spreading or being infected by the coronavirus. The posts show an outdated video clip of Dr. Fauci, who, like other health officials, recommends wearing a cloth face covering when distances of at least six feet can’t be maintained.

5g antennas were installed in Cali, Colombia, during quarantine. Neither 5G technology causes COVID-19, nor the images circulating on networks show this technology in Cali. It is really the infrastructure that is part of the expansion and modernization plan of the Emcali electricity network.

Migrant labourers are killing people in Delhi due to coronavirus lockdown. The men in the video are not migrants but two locals who have a criminal background. Cops told The Quint that the video was being shared with a misleading claim.

Claim that Dr. Fauci said every American should be microchipped. There is no evidence that Dr. Anthony Fauci has said every American should be "microchipped." Fauci has suggested Americans might someday carry certificates of immunity to COVID-19. Similar claims that Democrats and others are pushing microchips to fight the coronavirus have been debunked.

The novel coronavirus was “man-made.” No, the novel coronavirus was not “man-made.” Illinois Senate Majority Leader Kimberly Lightford said the novel coronavirus was "man-made." Research shows the genetic features of the virus rule out the possibility it was created or manipulated in a lab. In response to our inquiry, Lightford acknowledged she had no evidence to back up her statement.
A video of a man who passes out on the street and is then transferred by ambulance that was claimed to be from Nicaragua. The video actually shows a simulation in Colombia.

A post says that there were no cases of COVID-19 in Beijing and Shanghai. According to the data collected from the Johns Hopkins University, as of May 11 there were 593 infections in Beijing and 659 in Shanghai.
