A post claims that a virologist said in a television programme that the mortality rate of the new coronavirus is now 0.1%. That was not what the virologist said in the TV. He said that only in the future people could talk about a mortality rate of 0.1%.

A video allegedly shows Odessa (Ukraine) riot police refusing to restrain citizens protesting the lockdown. The video allegedly showing Odessa riot police throwing down their shields when confronted with an anti-lockdown protest actually dates back to May 2014.

Candace Owens claimed that the U.S. is not losing “tons more lives” in 2020 compared to 2019 and that the “increase [in mortality in 2020 is] virtually non-existent”. A comparison of the number of deaths from all causes in the U.S. during the first 17 weeks of 2020 reveals a higher mortality than for the same period in any of the previous five years. While the death count was comparable to previous years in the first two months of 2020, it increased rapidly in March and April. Comparisons of mortality are highly sensitive to how the data are gathered and presented, therefore any claims based on the data must always be presented in the appropriate context.

In this video, italian representative Sara Cunial tells the truth about Bill Gates and its will to control world population through vaccines and medical experiment. This video contains at least 5 fake or misleading information about vaccines, Bill Gates, and its role during the COVID-19 pandemic.

A photo of a purported notice announcing that people who were unable to take the Philippine government’s civil service exam due to the COVID-19 pandemic will automatically receive a passing mark has been shared hundreds of times in multiple Facebook posts. The claim is false; the Philippine Civil Service Commission (CSC) denied issuing the notice, and an online search found no such announcement about automatically passing delayed test takers.

A Facebook post shared 10,000 times claims no Americans died from the flu in 2020, suggesting that the national count of COVID-19 fatalities is exaggerated. This is false. Data from the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention show that more than 7,500 Americans are estimated to have died this year from influenza during the novel coronavirus.

Backriding in motorcycles is now allowed in the Philippines, where all areas are currently under some form of quarantine. Backriding in motorcycles is still not allowed in all areas under any type of quarantine based on the guidelines released by the Philippine government.

“Italian Parliament Calls For The Arrest of Bill Gates” A single member of the Italian Parliament suggested Bill Gates should be arrested. There is no evidence that calls to arrest Bill Gates are endorsed or supported by the entire Italian Parliament.

Posts and videos on Facebook say drinking or inhaling seawater prevents COVID-19. Seawater can present fecal contamination and other pathogens, so it is not suitable for consumption as it would need to be disinfected.

Multiple Facebook and Twitter posts shared thousands of times in May 2020 claim anyone in New Zealand who refuses to use a coronavirus contact tracing app has been banned from entering shops during the COVID-19 pandemic. The claim is misleading; as of May 27, the app named in the posts is not a contact tracing app and is not being used by New Zealand's government as part of its coronavirus strategy; to date, the government's only coronavirus contact tracing app is voluntary for businesses and the public; shops in New Zealand are also not required to record consumer information for contact tracing purposes.

Leader of Polish ruling party PiS Jaroslaw Kaczynski is planning to legalize marijuana due to coronavirus economic crisis. It was denied by party officials. Kaczynski has no legal power to single-handedly do such thing.
There is 5G equipment labeled “COV-19”. The device never had "COV-19" printed on it.

A meme on Facebook claims that when you wear a mask you inhale too much CO2 and less oxygen, increasing the risk of a lung disease. Furthermore, the mask gets full of bacteria and can’t hold back viruses. With a mask you don't inhale too much oxygen. It's unclear if a cloth mask increases the risk to get sick. Masks should be changed and cleaned regularly and may hold back droplets, which according to experts could lower the risk to infect others.
Alcohol gel bottles can explode in a hot car. Alcohol gel cannot self ignite through heat alone.

Muslims are violating the ongoing lockdown norms which prohibits religious gatherings. A two month old video showing Muslims offering namaz in Delhi has been passed off on social media calling it as a recent one. The video was shot before the imposition of lockdown in the country.

Posts shared thousands of times on social media list a number of adverse health effects linked to wearing face masks. Some of these claims are false, while others are misleading, public health experts tell AFP.

A photo of a Pakistani provincial chief minister has been shared thousands of times in multiple Facebook posts in May 2020 alongside a claim that it shows him violating social distancing rules during the coronavirus pandemic. The claim is false; the photo was taken in 2018 during a procession on Ashura, a Muslim holy day.
Medical masks and gloves are incredibly harmful. If appropriately used, masks and gloves help to prevent infection.
Ummy Mwalimu, Tanzania’s Minister for Health, has tested positive for coronavirus. The claim is based on a fake screenshot of a social media post by the minister.
Human testing of a COVID-19 vaccine is currently being conducted in Kenya. Kemri is working on its own vaccine, but has yet to start human trials.

President of the United States of America, Donald Trump, tested positive for COVID-19. Two employees of the White House contracted the coronavirus, however the American president and his vice-president were not tested positive.

Facebook posts shared hundreds of times claim that Madagascar’s President Andry Rajoelina called on African nations to leave the World Health Organization (WHO). Although the leader has criticised the agency for warning against a herbal remedy he recommends to treat COVID-19, AFP Fact Check found no public record of him making such a statement. The Madagascan presidency has also rejected the claim.

Facebook posts shared thousands of times claim that people in Lesotho are “immune” to COVID-19 because the country apparently created a remedy for the disease. The claim is false; a health ministry spokesman denied the southern African state had endorsed such a treatment while the head of the company that makes the tonic featured in the posts said it has not been tested to treat COVID-19.
Parrots eating from rice bag due to lockdown. Picture is old and has no relation with lockdown.
Coronavirus does not affect people with ‘O+’ blood type. The post claiming coronavirus does not affect people with ‘O+’ blood type is misleading.

Workers who worked from 1990 to 2020 have the right to receive the Corona relief of INR120,000 from Ministry of Labour and Employment. The Indian Government's Press Information Bureau's denied such a claim. A similar claim came from South Africa.

The Israeli Biological Institute is the first to develop an antibody to treat the novel coronavirus. Although the Israel Biological Institute has been able to develop an antibody to treat COVID-19, it is not considered the first on a global scale.
Stefano Montanari exposes the “truth” about coronavirus vaccination. The information provided in the video is not valid.

Muslims are violating the ongoing lockdown norms which prohibits religious gatherings. A two month old video showing Muslims offering namaz in Delhi has been passed off on social media calling it as a recent one. The video was shot before the imposition of lockdown in the country.

U. S. Army’s “Extermination protocol COVID-19 capsules” for Italy were discovered A manipulative photo of an discharged old capsule titled "Extermination Protocol COVID-19, U.S. Army, Destination: Italy" went viral on soical networks in the region. The unknown author of this photography is clearly suggesting that COVID-19 was created by the U.S. Army and the invented "extermination protocol," thus it is widely spread in Italy which counted (at-the-time) 32 thousand deaths due to the pandemic. Photomontage first originated on social media in Italy claiming the virus enclosed in capsules, near the coronavirus outbreak location were discharged from a plane with intent to poison everyone. Private Facebook accounts within our region reposted the conspiracies, but luckily, Italian fact checkers have soon debunked the news as false.

A newspaper article entitled “Vaccine against coronavirus causes new diseases” from 1989. The article is about infectious bronchitis in chickens, not about COVID-19. Moreover, it contains wrong information.

A viral WhatsApp image showcases a list of woud-be coronavirus infection hotspots in Ghana. The Ghana Health Service says the list is fake and should be disregarded. It is not a list of places declared as “hotspots” for coronavirus infections in Ghana.
Muslims are violating the lockdown in India by praying in the open. The video is from March 20, 2020, days before the lockdown was in place in India.

A woman feeding her kid in a train is a migrant in a deplorable state caused due to the lockdown. The video is a 2016 video from Bangladesh and is not linked to migrant movement due to the lockdown in India.

Document shows COVID-19 normalization plan prepared by the Presidency of Turkey It is an unapproved draft of the normalization planning. File contains some implementations are applied on different dates. The normalisation steps are announced weekly by the President, not monthly.

Several people broke the rules of lockdown when they gathered to offer Namaaz (prayers in Muslims) in an area in the city of Delhi. The video of people offering Namaaz was recorded before the lockdown was imposed in India.

Vila Formosa’s cemitery in São Paulo, Brazil, is opening graves to cause panic on population, but there are no burials. The graves remain open. Man who appears on video showing empty graves is not a government employee. The cemitery shown has two unities that have burials every other day. Video was shot in a day that did not had any burial. The opening of graves is part of government to adress the increase in number of deaths.

Boldo tea prevents COVID-19. There is currently no specific drug or treatment for COVID-19 according to WHO and brazilian Ministry of Health. Also, there are no studies that attest the benefits of infusing the plant.

Former Brazilian Minister of Health, Luiz Henrique Mandetta, appointed Tamiflu for patients with COVID-19, which would increase mortality by 50% There is a protocol on the new coronavirus that was implemented while Mandetta was minister, in March this year. The document, however, does not recommend Tamiflu (trade name of oseltamivir) for patients with COVID-19, but for mild symptomatic cases of influenza that can lead to complications. There is no evidence that the use of Tamiflu has reduced the chances of survival for patients with COVID-19.
The Colombian president annonced the extension of the lockdown. The president announced the extension of the economic emergency, not of the lockdown.
Mask made of copper oxide can be more effective to avoid COVID-19. Copper oxide is actually a toxic substance.
Boldo tea can cure COVID-19 in three hours. There's no scientific evidence that boldo tea has any effect on the virus.

Carrefour is offering a R$ 300 voucher for families in need during the COVID-19 crisis. This is a phishing scam aimed at WhatsApp users. Carrefour is not giving away R$ 300 vouchers to families in need.

A picture of a mansion. The caption says that João Doria, governor of São Paulo, wants you to be at home because he lives in this house. The mansion in the picture is located in Los Angeles, USA. Although João Doria lives in one of the biggest houses in São Paulo, it's not this one.

Video representing the plight of migrant workers in India during the current lockdown, where a woman with infant had to travel while sitting on the coupler between train bogies. While it is true that the migrant workers are facing a lot of problems due to the current lockdown in the country, the video can be traced back to July 2016, and is likely from Bangladesh.

Video showing a overcrowded Sharmik trains operated by the government of India for the travel of stranded migrant labourers during the current lockdown. The train in the video is not a Sharmik special train that is operated by government of India. The video is two years old and from Bangladesh.

Video showing people flouting lockdown rules in West Bengal, India. The video is an old one and is not related to the current lockdown. The same video was found to be on the internet at least since April 2019.

Photo showing the wounds on the feet of migrant labourers who had to travel all the way to their native places by foot due to the lockdown restrictions in India. While it is true that the migrant workers are facing a lot of problems due to the current lockdown in the country, and few travelled by foot, the photo is not related to current situation in India. The photo is available on the internet since 2018.

The headline of the article claims that Macedonia has three times more active coronavirus patients than China. There is no explanation for the assertion made in the title of the text. Macedonia cannot be compared to China, at least not in this way. Macedonia and China are at a different level from the development of the epidemic that started in the country 3 months later than China, so these figures are incomparable.

Group immunity will not be achieved soon according to an audio message circulating in Mexico. In social networks an audio circulates in which a young woman invites another person to a party that presumably will be attended by people with COVID-19 in order to infect the rest of the attendees, and thus obtain herd immunity. According to the audio, it is done in Sweden. However it is false that doing this type of events is a useful strategy against the new coronavirus.
Research proves that commercial mouthwash could protect against COVID-19. British scientists said this is under-researched and not proven,

Telecommunications worker exposed circuit boards being installed in 5G towers bearing markings that read “COV-19”. This video seems to be a prank since the piece of equipment visible in the viral video appears to be a piece of kit stripped from an old television or set-top box with one part later marked "COV-19."

The President of Argentina, Alberto Fernández, published a book stating that he has “the need for a poorer and more primitive, but more egalitarian society”. It is a fictional book that was presented within a humor segment of "Odisea Argentina", a program that is broadcast by "La Nación +" and is hosted by Carlos Pagni, although it was circulated as real, taken from context on social networks.

The Head of Government of the City of Buenos Aires, Horacio Rodríguez Larreta said: “With Macri half a country was going to die, this government knows how to do things well”. The image is edited and was manipulated to misinform.

A video (already removed from YouTube) in which a woman named Pilar Baselga assures that the Carlos III Health Institute of Madrid has said in a report that the SARS-CoV-2 coronavirus pandemic has ended. It is a hoax. The report of the Carlos III Health Institute number 26, published on April 27 and used by Baselga, does not consider in any case that the pandemic has ended. In fact, in subsequent reports published on April 30, May 4, May 7, and May 11, this organism continues to refer to the coronavirus as a pandemic.

The Spanish Police acts to sanction citizens on the street for carrying a Spanish flag or for protesting against the Government with a saucepan. The Spanish Police warn those who breach the restrictions of the state of alarm or violate the minimum distance obligations between people against the coronavirus.

Poland stands up against compulsory vaccination. This video has nothing to do with vaccination. The video was actually shot in the Polish capital, Warsaw. But for a different reason and at a different time. One version of the video was uploaded on July 24, 2017.
Video shows migrant laborers protesting in Surat, Gujrat. The video is, in fact, from Hyderabad city. It is being falsely shared in the name of Surat.

A couple committed suicide along with their daughter amid the COVID-19 lockdown in Gujarat. The viral video is from 2018. The couple had committed suicide after the husband lost his job and his father kicked him out of the house for it.

Video shows a huge crowd gathered in an American mall neglecting the social distancing during current pandemic. The video is actually old. It was shot at a mall in Brazil on the occasion of Black Friday sale in 2019.

News anchor of Malayalam news channel Twenty Four News claims Congress leaders demonstrating at Walayar check post came in contact with the newly detected COVID patient from that area. The news anchor has clarified to us that he has not made any such claim. We also spoke to Congress MP Remya Haridas who was present at the time of demonstration and she also told us that no outsider was allowed in their demonstration.
Viral Whatsapp message claiming to be a roadmap on easing lockdown restrictions in India. Press Information Bureau of India has clarified that this message is fake and not issued by the government.

A post on Facebook criticizes the effectiveness of face masks in protecting the wearer from COVID-19, the disease caused by the novel coronavirus. This is misleading; US health authorities recommend they be worn to stop the spread of the disease, not to prevent the wearer from contracting it.

“Cannabis may stop coronavirus from infecting people, study finds.” Cannabis extracts could be part of a treatment that helps prevent coronavirus — according to a preliminary study. The study has not been peer reviewed and it’s based only on lab testing. The lead researcher said more study, including testing on humans, must be done before any conclusions can be drawn.

Jorge Luis Sonnante published a 16-minute video that went viral on networks. In the video, Sonnante (who describes himself as a “deacon”, but gives falsified evidence of this charge) mixes several conspiracy theories, some meaningless, others already denied, about the pandemic caused by the SARS coronavirus -CoV-2. The Argentinian man, a frequent disseminator of disinformation, published a video with a patchwork quilt with false information about the COVID-19 pandemic.

A video shows a man in a face mask, safety helmet and hi-vis work top. The man claims he has been installing “5G masts” and has opened a 5G device and found a label that says “COV.19” on a component on the circuit board inside. The piece of circuit board is from a pay-TV set top box. The circuit board appears to have coaxial and SCART connectors used in audio-visual equipment and was manufactured by a TV and display components company.

Multiple Facebook posts have shared a purported roadmap for the Indian government’s plans to ease a nationwide coronavirus lockdown alongside a claim that it shows an official government announcement. The claim is false; India’s official Press Information Bureau said the government had not release any such plan and labelled the posts “fake news”; the dates included in the purported roadmap corresponded with the Irish government's "roadmap for reopening society and business" during the coronavirus pandemic.

Man collapses and dies on the road due to the novel coronavirus. The video is actually of a COVID-19 mock drill that was carried out in Colombia and is not actually an incident that happened in reality.
Overcrowded train carrying migrants from Mumbai to West Bengal, flouting lockdown norms in India. The video is as old as 2018 and is not from India but Bangladesh.

If masks prevent coronavirus, governors would have given them to prison inmates instead of releasing them. Experts agree that wearing facial coverings in close settings provides some measure of protection against spreading the coronavirus. Despite a claim on Facebook, New York, Michigan and California prisons all are providing masks to inmates, as well as staff, as part of their COVID-19 response. Certain groups of inmates are being freed early as a way to try to limit the spread of COVID-19. They include pregnant women with less than six months left on sentences for nonviolent offenses, and other inmates who are either over 60 with health issues or months away from being eligible for parole.

“Hydroxychloroquine cures this ‘virus.’ It just so happens this is the treatment used for radiation sickness!!” There is no cure or vaccine for the novel coronavirus. Some studies have found that hydroxychloroquine could help alleviate symptoms associated with COVID-19, but the research is not conclusive. Health officials have not listed hydroxychloroquine as a treatment for radiation sickness.
Having COVID-19 contagion parties will make the epidemic end faster. Having COVID-19 contagion parties will not make the epidemic end faster.

Data show that the brazilian state Minas Gerais has fewer COVID-19 deaths than Ceará even though it has not adopted isolation measures As much as it's true that the Ceará state officially accounts more infections and deaths from the disease than Minas Gerais, its population testing rate is much higher: 51.5% per 100 thousand inhabitants, against 10.2%.

COVID-19 deaths are caused by bacteria and therefore the disease should be treated with aspirin. WHO explains, in a review published on April 19, that there is no scientific evidence to prove the effectiveness of anti-inflammatory drugs, such as aspirin and ibuprofen, in the treatment of COVID-19.

Two Muslims boys were brutally beaten and forcefully fed alcohol by Hindu boys in India. The brawl started due to personal differences among the boys. No incident of foceful spitting inside the victim's mouth. He was not forcefed alcohol as well.

The Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) arrested billionaire Bill Gates on charges of biological terrorism after he allegedly created the novel coronavirus, the virus that causes COVID-19. There is no report from any legitimate news organization about Gates’ arrest as of May 21. The photo used in the article was also manipulated using a 2014 photo of American mobster Vincent Asaro.

Kozhikode District Magistrate audio clip claiming steam, saltwater gargling and drinking herbal tea can cure/resist COVID-19. We spoke to the DM's PA and he said the message circulating in DM's name is fake and they have reported it to Kerala Police Cyber cell. Besides the remedies suggested in the audio clip are not scientifically proven to cure or resist COVID-19.

A picture shows officials washing chicken with Chlorine and Ace, putting the population at risk of poisoning. The photo is from Honduras. In reality they show a process of denaturation of expired or expiring foods.

Dr. Fauci confirms to Congress how the vaccine increases the dangerousness of the novel coronavirus. An Italian pro-Trump site spread a small excerpt of Fauci's intervention in the US Senate. Fauci recalls the importance of experimentation and that a vaccine cannot be used without testing. The website used Fauci's sentences out of context.

A video of Italian politician Sara Cunial blasting Bill Gates as a “vaccine criminal” in speeches to parliament has been viewed tens of thousands of times on Facebook and YouTube. Her statements are riddled with misinformation. AFP Fact Check debunks some of the claims.

Philippines Senators Grace Poe and Risa Hontiveros have been silent over the coronavirus crisis, but were very vocal about the closure of ABS-CBN. Both Poe and Hontiveros filed bills and participated in deliberations over legislation that address the impact of COVID-19 in the Philippines. They have also extend assistance to frontliners and other citizens affected by the coronavirus crisis.

Prolonged use of face masks reduces the circulation of oxygen in the blood and can lead to death. Face masks are likely to cause rebreathing of exhaled carbon dioxide, but not significantly enough to cause death.
All employees of PNB Loni branch found coronavirus positive. Not all employees were COVID-19 positive. All were sent to quarantine as a precaution.

The vaccine from the artificial coronavirus will change the human genetic code, according to Rashid Buttar. Coronavirus has a natural origin, and the RNA vaccine is not able to change the human genome.
A claim that the Nobel laureate Tasuku Honjo had said that the coronavirus was manmade. Tasuku Honjo never said this and regretted being misquoted this way.

A Facebook post shared thousands of times claims the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention lied about the number of deaths caused by COVID-19 by combining the count with pneumonia and influenza fatalities. This is false; the CDC’s National Center for Health Statistics (NCHS) only records those who died from COVID-19 in its toll for the disease.

Coronavirus found in gutkha or chewing tobacco samples sold in Indian state of Maharashtra as raw material sourced from China. The image was photoshoped with an old TV channel screengrab with new text. No such broadcast made by the TV channel.

Dr Mikovits, an established scientist, revealed that Dr Anthony Fauci was paid to cover up the extent of the problem caused by COVID-19. Also she revealed that SARS-CoV-2 was created in a lab and that influenza vaccines increase COVID-19 mortality by 36%. There is absolutely no evidence of a cover-up by Dr Fauci regarding the alleged coverup of the COVID-19 pandemic. Also the claim that SARS-CoV-2 is lab made has been thoroughly debunked by many scientific studies thus far. Finally the study that is being employed as a source for the claim that influenza vaccines increase COVID-19 mortality by 36% is being misrepresented as that study examined the vaccines in relation to 4 types of seasonal coronaviruses that cause the common cold, not COVID-19.

5G base station motherboard with an inscribed COV-19 mark on it A photo of a motherboard that is allegedly installed in a 5G base station has been spreading on Facebook. The photo is actually part of old TV equipment with additionally engraved COV-19.  Fact checkers from Snopes were investigating the implied photo and video only to discover Hannstar's label  - a company which does not produce 5G equipment. The shown motherboard is a part of old TV equipment, but with engraved "COV-19" inscription that originally was not there, was manipulatively misused for spreading the already well spread conspiracy theories and links between 5G and COVID-19.

Every Indian citizen to get Rs.5000 as COVID-19 relief by clicking on this link given in the viral Whatsapp message. The link is a fraudulent link that is being used to collect data of Whatsapp users. The same message is being spread in Kenya only by replacing the amount and currency.

The governor of Rio de Janeiro, Wilson Witzel, ordered the collection of the drug ivermectin from pharmacies in the state. The Rio de Janeiro Health Department, Anvisa and a pharmaceutical entity denied the allegation. The shortage of the medicine was caused by a spike in demand after rumors that ivermectin cures COVID-19. There is no proven efficacy.

A publication claims that Bill and Melinda Gates didn’t vaccine their kids. The claim is not supported by any evidence, but it did go viral and has appeared on different web pages. Contacted by Maldita.es, the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation has answered us that "the statements are false".

Claims made in the viral video Plandemic include: that the virus was “manipulated” in a laboratory setting; that hydroxychloroquine is “effective against these families of viruses” and that wearing a mask “activates” the virus. These claims made by Judy Mikovits in Plandemic are untrue. The video has been removed by YouTube and Facebook for spreading misinformation about COVID-19.
The government is passing a law enabling it to get amnesty for faults commited during the COVID-19 crisis. The law doesn't change anything compared to the legislation already implemented.

An “interagency” Facebook page of the labor and social welfare departments in the Philippines says “online applications” for the second wave of the government’s financial aid during the COVID-19 pandemic is now open, asking netizens to comment their personal details. The country's Department of Social Welfare and Development and the Department of Labor and Employment do not share a singular page on FB. The two agencies have different social amelioration measures independent of each other.
Palm oil is a simple cure for the coronavirus. The post claiming palm oil is a simple solution for coronavirus is fake. There is no evidence to prove this. This has been falsely attributed to WHO.

A video of the new director of ANSES, in Argentina, criticizing those who do not comply with the quarantine The woman in the video is not the director of the Anses, but a Twitter user named "Anita Zen" (@anitazenok).

Face masks reduce immunity and help spread the coronavirus. Both chirurgical and homemade masks made of cloth allow passage of oxygen and have filters that unable particles potentially contagious. Used in accordance with medical recommendation, masks should be used to reduce contagion ratings.

Chloroquine is target of a conspiracy in benefit of medecine remdesivir. There are studies to verify efficacy of both medecines in the treatment of COVID-19 patients. Also, there are heads of state such as Donald Trump and Jair Bolsonaro that support chloroquine openly. Furthermore, there is no registry of the man appearing on the video being part of any study involving COVID-19.

During the coronavirus pandemic, Colombia is the country with more corruption according to a survey. The article is conflating two surveys. Neither of both conclude that Colombia is the country with more corruption.

Indian Government has a roadmap to ease lockdown restrictions in 5 weeks. The circulating message has been picked from Ireland's official government website and is being passed off as being from India.
A man collapses in 5 minutes after showing COVID-19 symptoms in India. This video is a reenacting video from Colombia and not linked to India.

A video that shows 4 allegedly empty hospitals in São Paulo. The video was shot in waiting rooms for elective procedures, which, precisely because of the COVID-19 pandemic, were mostly cancelled or postponed. The COVID-19 patients are in other areas of all four hospitals.

A picture showing many hospital beds, with patients on it, concentrated in very small area. The caption states that this is how public health was like in Brazil, in 2016, but the media never talked about it. This picture is from 2010 and was taken in Fortaleza, Brazil, after patients were evacuated from a hospital after a fire broke out. This was widely covered by the press at the time, as well as the state of public health in general.

Data from the Civil Registry shows that, between January 1 and May 12, the total number of deaths by respiratory causes remain basically the same. This article is based on the Civil Registry data collection, which is not updated on real time. Therefore, it is based on incomplete data.
Video shows women queuing up outside a wine shop in the city of Pune, Maharashtra (India) amid COVID-19 Lockdown. The video is not from Maharashtra. The video is actually from Bengaluru, Karnataka.
Video shows fishes washed up to the Indian shores during the lockdown. The video is actually from Mexico. Thousands of dead fishes washed up on the Acapulco beach there.

Pastor David Lah has escaped from quarantine center. Yangon region Minister for Social Affairs confirmed that David Lah is still in the same hotel, where he was originally transferred, undergoing the quarantine process.

DIG Police Ajith Rohana’s daughter has been repatriated to Sri Lanka from Dubai, as part of repatriation program to get back stranded students due to COVID-19, via a special flight sponsored by businessman Dilith Jayaweera. Ajith Rohana’s daughter has not returned to Sri Lanka and is pursuing her studies in Belarus.

Letter claiming that government had announced to give an allowance similar to the last drawn salary for the Sri Lankans who had returned to the country recently being stranded due to COVID-19. The letter drafted on the President Media letter-head had requested passport copy, salary particulars and bank details as instructed by Ministry of Foreign Affairs. President Media division and Foreign Ministry denied these claims as totally false and fabricated.

Telangana (India) Chief Minister violated lockdown norms and distributed gifts among Muslims to celebrate Ramzan. The picture used to make the claim is nearly five years old. Secondly, we found a sound bite of the chief minister where he himself said that no gifts will be distributed this year due to coronavirus.

A picture claiming that hairdressers’ products (e.g. shampoo, hair dryer) can “eliminate coronavirus”. The claims made in the picture (e.g: hair dryers' heat kills the virus, as well as shampoos and hydrogen peroxide) are largely inaccurate and, at the moment, we don't have enough scientific data to support them.

“Bill Gates already has his vaccine ready for you (against covic-19, ed.), And here’s the patent.” The patent to which Facebook users refer does not show that a COVID-19 vaccine already exists. Instead, it is a patent for a method for developing vaccines through a particular gene technology. Although the primary focus of the patent is vaccines for animals, the method can in principle be used to develop a vaccine against COVID-19. But the vaccine does not yet exist.

Images circulating on Facebook showing an article published in 2003 in the Clarín newspaper about the coronavirus. They are spread claiming that it is the same coronavirus that now causes COVID-19. It is a hoax: the article refers to a different coronavirus, caused by the SARS virus, which emerged in February 2003.

Graphs in which a comparison of deaths from different countries is allegedly attributed to a European report that blames the Government of Spain for deaths from coronavirus. It is a hoax. The alleged European report does not exist, the images come from a Twitter account called "Vamos a Ver", which also claims to belong to a Digital Journalist.

A video of a fight on a terrace of an establishment. It is shared with comments such as “after the crowded terraces of yesterday, today comes the fights for a chair !!! Welcome to Spain !!!!” or “Welcome Phase 1. Terraces at 50% You have to fight for a chair !!”. This video has not been recorded during phase 1 of the de-escalation, nor at any time during the coronavirus crisis. It was an incident that happened in Piera (Barcelona) in 2016.

As the AC in malls are shut due to Indian malls being shut due to COVID-19, leather of objects in showrooms has started moulding and people should not buy things from malls. The image is from Malaysia and not India.

González García, Argentina’s health minister, on the WHO clinical trial: “[We were chosen] for our characteristics and for how we have been working within the epidemic”. The national government received a special invitation from the World Health Organization (WHO) to join the project in the first instance. However, the policies taken by the Alberto Fernández administration against the new coronavirus were not the reason for the call, but rather the previous experience in clinical trials that Argentina has.

The photo shows Microsoft co-founder Bill Gates and top White House coronavirus adviser Dr. Anthony Fauci violating social distancing guidelines. The photo, taken in 2018, predates the ongoing coronavirus pandemic.

The photo shows former Vice President Joe Biden and Michigan Gov. Gretchen Whitmer violating social distancing guidelines on April 9. The photos, taken in September 2018, show the two politicians at a gubernatorial campaign event for Whitmer.

The photo shows a letter, purportedly from the California Department of Social Services, that mandates coronavirus testing for participants of state assistance programs and warns that children may be removed from the household if someone tests positive. The California Department of Social Services and other agencies debunked the fabricated letter.

A video with a text message, allegedly endorsed by Police forces, saying that the Police will rebel against the Italian government “if the situation goes on like this”. Facta newsroom got in touch with the Police press office, who said that the message has no connection whatsoever with the Police. The websites and social media accounts where it was posted are not linked with authorities as well.
A blog article stating that Bill Gates was arrested by the FBI for having created the new coronavirus. The news is unfounded, and it was not reported by any international news agency

By drinking Ayurvedic decoction, 6 thousand corona infected patients were cured. The decoction was given to those who were in the Quarantine Center after coming in contact with coronavirus positive people. It has been told by the Ministry of Ayush that this decoction increases your immunity and not kills the coronavirus.

The government of Telangana is distributing special gifts to Muslims during their festival of Ramzan, amidst the lockdown. The image of the gift from Telangana state government to Muslims during Ramzan, is very old, and not from 2020.
An image of a man carrying his old mother on his back shows migrants travelling to their homes in India, amidst lockdown. The image shows a Rohingya Muslim entering Bangladesh. It was taken in 2017.

President of Madagascar Andry Rajoelina claimed that China and the US asked to pay him for poisoning Covid-Organics, its drink against COVID-19. Andry Rajoelina never claimed that, and the Presidency formally denied it.

The Congress of Deputies -the Spanish lower house- has deleted the income of the MP’s from its website so that no one can see what they are earning in times of alarm and crisis for the coronavirus. Detailed information on what deputies charge is available to anyone on the website of Congress and has not stopped being available at any time.

Minister of finance praises Latvia’s COVID-19 state support for private business, saying that because of that the unemployment rate has risen much less than in the neighboring countries. The claim is false. The raise of the employment rate has been similar in all three Baltic states.
Video of People in Italy offering Namaz on the streets due to COVID-19. The video is from Peru and has nothing to do with COVID-19.

If COVID-19 was a serious illness, it would have wiped out the homeless population in the U.S. Recent reports published by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention have found high rates of homeless residents testing positive for the novel coronavirus, known as SARS-CoV-2.

An article attributes to the UN Secretary General, Antonio Guterres, a supposed call to create a global government with a single leader. The secretary general of the multilateral institution, Antonio Guterres, has not called to appoint a world president.

BCG (Bacillus Calmette-Guérin) vaccine, which is used to prevent tuberculosis, also serves to mitigate the damage caused by COVID-19. Studies on the efficacy of BCG vaccine in mitigating the damage caused by COVID-19 are not approved and, therefore, no conclusions can be drawn about coronavirus from the level of this vaccination in one country.

WHO statistics about 40 best countires responce to COVID-19 doesn’t include any Arabic country. WHO didn't make such a statistical ranking. the original photo is from Deep Knowledge Group website and the does include Arabic countries in the top 40 countries COVID-19 Safety Ranking.

“Due to the large number of people who will refuse the forthcoming COVID-19 vaccine because it will include tracking microchips, the Gates Foundation is now spending billions to ensure that all medical and dental injections and procedures include the chips.” No, the Gates Foundation isn’t pushing microchips with all medical procedures. We found no evidence supporting this claim.

A list of purported COVID-19 safety guidelines has been shared in multiple Facebook and Instagram posts that claim it was issued by the Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR), India’s leading research group on the novel coronavirus. The claim is false; the ICMR said it did not issue the purported advisory; an online search found the list was not included on ICMR's website or in guidelines from India's health ministry.

Those who were scheduled to take the civil service exam (CSE) on March 15, 2020 in the Philippines are deemed “automatically passed” due to the COVID-19 crisis. The Philippine Civil Service Commission did not release the document. On May 13, the Commission said they did not issue any directive to automatically pass registered examinees of the March 15 professional and subprofessional CSE – even if they did not actually take the test.
Image claiming that mosquitos will spread the coronavirus. WHO confirmed that coronavirus cannot be transmitted through mosquito bites.

Green or black tea with lemon and two spoons of fennel flower cures COVID-19. As of May 29, 2020, there is no specific cure for COVID-19 according to WHO. Black or green tea with lemon and fennel do not treat COVID-19.

COVID-19, the disease caused by the coronavirus, is not pneumonia but a form of thrombosis or blood clotting in the blood vessels. Multiple studies show that thrombosis or blood clotting is among the complications brought by COVID-19. However, not all COVID-19 patients exhibit this, and more studies are needed to determine the effectiveness and proper use of anticoagulants for treatment.

Says Nancy Pelosi tried “once again” to include abortion funding in the latest coronavirus bill. The HEROES Act doesn’t contain any mention of abortion services, and the proposed changes to funding rules aren’t specific to Planned Parenthood. The organization would be eligible for Paycheck Protection Program loans under the bill’s expanded eligibility guidelines for nonprofits.

There is a case of COVID-19 on the Rohero campus of the University of Burundi. The Institute of Applied Pedagogy says it is surprised by this slanderous information that has been shared on social networks.
Professor Didier Raoult revealed that the United States and China have created COVID-19. No official source mentions this assertion of the Marseille microbiologist.

Kenya had the highest cases of COVID-19 in Africa and the fifth-highest in the world on May 6. WHO data shows that South Africa had the highest number of cases in Africa and Russia ranked fifth worldwide on that date.
Indian Government has introduced a five-phase roadmap to combat Covid-19. No, the Indian Government has not introduced a five-phase roadmap to combat COVID-19.

By drinking Ayurvedic decoction, 6 thousand corona infected patients were cured. The decoction was given to those who were in the Quarantine Center after coming in contact with coronavirus positive people. It has been told by the Ministry of Ayush that this decoction increases your immunity and not kills the coronavirus.

Paid actor pretending to be suffering from COVID-19 A video shot from a port-town Tuxpan in a Mexican state of Veracruz, portrays a worker of a private fuel company who was, as many of his coworkers, preemptively isolated in hotels and hostels. After developing signs of COVID-19 he was transferred to a hospital, as shown in the video. The video picked up over million views on Facebook in our region, implying the depicted person  is a paid actor pretending to be suffering from COVID-19, enquiring about the price for such performance.

Missing COVID-19 blood samples discovered in the streets of Bihać, in northwestern Bosnia and Herzegovina Several media outlets reported on discovering "lost COVID-19 blood samples", without indicating on what basis authors claimed that these were blood samples for SARS-CoV-2 tests. Moreover, the tests in this particular Canton for SARS-CoV-2 are conducted by swabs - not by blood samples, which immediatelly refutes these claims.

Video shows Gujarat Police asking money (bribe) from migrants walking on railway tracks amidst nationwide COVID-19 lockdown. This video is 1 year old and shows Gujarat Police extorting money from illegal liquor peddlers. The constable was then suspended from his duties.

Prolonged use of protective masks causes hypoxia. Infectologist and pulmonologist consulted by Aos Fatos claim that hypoxia is caused by diseases, such as anemia or pneumonia, not by the use of masks, which are now mandatory in several cities to contain the transmission of COVID-19.

New York State Governor shows data that proves that isolation is ineffective against COVID-19. The American politician said, on May 6, that the majority of new patients hospitalized for the disease in the state were people who remained at home. Although true, the data was not cited to discredit the isolation, but to emphasize that precaution is necessary even among those quarantined. In the same interview, Cuomo also said that the social distance measures taken helped to reduce the number of new cases in New York.

University of Campinas’ field hospital, located in the state of São Paulo, was dismantled because of a lack of patients. The installation mentioned in the recording was transferred to another location in the same city, closer to the Municipal Hospital Dr. Mário Gatti. The staff of Unicamp's Hospital das Clínicas also denied that there was no demand from patients and reported that, in 40 days of activity, the emergency hospital received 546 people.

A picture showing Italian Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte eating in a crowded room, wearing no masks or PPE against the new coronavirus. According to the caption, the picture was taken on May 11, 2020, at the restaurant for Italian senators and representatives in Rome, which would be “the only open restaurant in the country”. The picture was actually taken in November 2019, when Prime minister Conte visited an FCA factory in Melfi (PZ). Also, there is no "restaurant" in the Italian Parliament but a canteen, which is operating when people need it.

A newspaper article claiming that “17 Regions had no new cases of coronavirus” in Italy. Looking at the official data provided by the Italian Health Ministry, all the Regions got at least 1 new case of coronavirus

A blog article claiming that, according to the European Parliament, 5G accelerates the COVID-19 pandemic. The European Parliament has firmly denied any link between 5G technology and COVID-19, and the WHO labeled this theory as one the most common cases of disinformation about the pandemic.

The Irish government is giving €350 to every resident in the country as part of its response to COVID-19. The Irish government is not giving €350 to everyone in the country. The Department of Finance said the messages circulating about this are a scam.

All Filipinos, whether poor or rich, are entitled to the government’s two-month subsidy of P5,000 to P8,000 during the COVID-19 pandemic. The emergency subsidy amounting to P200 billion is intended for “18 million low-income families” who are at risk of not earning a living during the pandemic.
Consuming chlorine dioxide cures the coronavirus. Several state health protection agencies and specialists claim that it is harmful and prohibit its use and marketing.

A doctor named “Marcos Vargas” died at the Muñíz Hospital in Argentina for treating patients with COVID-19. The hospital said that there is no doctor with that name or another who has died from COVID-19. Also, the image the post uses is of a pornnographic actor.

According to a publication that is spreading on social media, masks “should only be worn by those who are infected”. According to official guidelines, the use of masks "by anyone in closed indoor spaces with multiple people" is recommended.
Indian Council of Medical Research and a hospital in Delhi have come up with a 21 point list for preventing COVID-19 in the future. Both the institutes denied issuing any such advisories.

The Telangana state government is distributing Ramadan gift packs during the lockdown. Telangana state government declined the distribution of food packets and stated that the images which are being circulated are old.

Image of an old man carrying his mother and walking claimed to be migrants walking home due to the lockdown. This image is of Rohingya Muslims from Bangladesh and not related to the lockdown in India.

São Paulo’s governor João Doria’s disapproval rate reached 98% during COVID-19 lockdown. According to Datafolha, one of the leading pollsters in Brazil, 19% of the population of São Paulo State considered Doria's tenure as either bad or terrible on May 8. Ibope, the other leading pollster in the country, showed his disapproval rate in São Paulo City went from 44% on March 23 to 21% on May 5.

The total number of deaths in Brazil have decreased during the COVID-19 pandemic. This article is based on the Civil Registry data collection, which is not updated on real time. Therefore, it is based on incomplete data. By the time article was originally published, May 5, the number of deaths between March 1 and May 4 2020 was considerably smaller than in the same period in 2019. When our fact-check was published, a week later, the number of 2020 deaths, considering the same period, was significantly larger.

Image claiming to be a protest against pastor David Lah, who is believed to have conducted a religious gathering without adhering to social distancing measures resulting  in 70 COVID-19 confirm cases. Image has been found online since 2017, and the original photograph is from a Muslim religious event.

Due to the increase in excise tax by 70% for locally manufactured alcohol, the price of bottle of Arrack would be increased to over 3000 LKR, to discourage alcohol consumption once the liquor shops finally open after a long break due to COVID-19 precautionary measures. Excise department confirmed that there was no change in the duty for locally manufactured alcohol and the Arrack manufacturer also confirmed that the prices remain unchanged.

Image of group of people carrying a placard congratulating President and Prime Minister for eliminating coronavirus from Sri Lanka. Thi image is actually a photograph of SLPP supporters holding a placard congratulating Gotabaya Rajapaksa, hours after the presidential election victory on 17th November 2019.

Allowances of Members of Parliament in India have been increased by 49 thousand rupees during the pandemic. Actually the allowances of MPs have been cut by 30 percent. Due to which now they will get 49 thousand rupees, instead of 70 thousand as earlier.

Mumbai police issued a warning message about the possibility of an increase in crimes post lockdown. Mumbai police have clarified that the viral message is fake and they have not issued any such message.

Video shows a policeman taking bribe from migrating workers in Surat. The video is from 2019 and shows a policeman taking bribe from women who were peddling illegal liquor. It has nothing to do with the current pandemic.
Residents in Surat, India are protesting due to unavailability of food. The video is from Kathua and it shows the workers of Chenab Textile Mills demanding payment of their full salaries.

A family in Gujarat, India killed itself due to hunger and poverty during the COVID lockdown. The mother hanged herself after strangling her two daughters on 2 May in Gujarat’s Morbi on the suspicion that her husband was cheating on her.
A YouTube video claiming that in 2014 Bill Gates patenteted the vaccine againt COVID-19. The patents mentioned in the video refer to Sars-Cov-1, not Sars-Cov-2 (COVID-19).

A picture which states that wearing a protective mask is a “slow, inescapable suicide” because it leads to consuming a dangerous amount of carbon dioxide. Wearing a surgical mask for several hours can actually cause an increase in the levels of carbon dioxide we consume, but this is generally not dangerous and unlikely to cause severe health issues.

99.2% Italians who have arguably died because of COVID-19 have actually died due to another prexisting condition. Despite having the concomitant disease, the reason for those people's death is COVID-19.
There is no coronavirus in Belarus since they do not have quarantine there. In Belarus, COVID-19 cases have been registered, although there is no quarantine.

Not wearing a mask in public places is a criminal offence in Ghana, according to viral social media messages. The viral WhatsApp message is referring to legislation issued on 6 April 2020 in Kenya for offenders who contravene the rule to properly wear masks in public places. Neither the government of Ghana nor any mainstream media in Ghana have so far communicated such information.

According to the “Plandemic” documentary, the new coronavirus “was clearly manipulated”. Scientific evidence, like the Nature's paper published on march ruled out the posibility of the new coronavirus being created on a lab.

According to the “Plandemic” documentary, “the actual pandemic comes from the SARS outbreak”. 2003 SARS outbreak was caused by another coronavirus. The virus of the actual pandemic is called "SARS-COV-2" because of the genetic similarity between the COVID-19 virus and the SARS virus, but they are different deseases.

According to the “Plandemic” documentary, “the flu shots contain coronavirus”. The flu shots not contain coronavirus. In Paraguay the flu shots fight 3 kinds of influenza. COVID-19 is caused by coronavirus, other kind of virus.

Vice President Leni Robredo said it should not be people, but the virus, that should be restrained from spreading. Robredo did not make this remark, and the graphic was altered from a quote card produced by News5, a television programme in the Philippines.

Video shows that those who go to shopping malls are greeted with the “Coffin Dance” music. The original video shows a saxophone artist welcomes the people who come to the mall with a different music. Astronomia 2K19 from Stephan F, the music of the Coffin Dance meme, is added. The video is not from Turkey, but from Brazil.
Photo shows the queue in front of a shopping center in Turkey. The photo shows the queue in front of a mall in Israel, taken on May 7, 2020.
Indian Council of Medical Research and Sir Ganga Ram Hospital have issued a COVID-19 advisory. Indian Council of Medical Research and Sir Ganga Ram Hospital have issued no COVID-19 advisory.

A video with the caption “he doesn’t want to wait for another 14 days.” shows a guy falling from a building after grabbing high tension wire. The video was taken in 2018 about an incident under the influence of alcohol in India.

Taiwan is running out of gauze because all gauzes are manufactured in China. Gauzes in Taiwan are generally from China and some Southeast countries. Taiwan did run short of gauzes from January to April since China stopped manufacturing while Taiwanese hospitals stockpiled them. But the supply has been increasing since late April. There is currently no shortage of gauze in Taiwan.

Table shows that number of death records in Brazil in April 2020 was lower than in April 2019 and April 2018. The table that makes the comparison brings different data from those that appeared on Wednesday (13) on the Transparency of the Civil Registry portal, indicated by the posts as the source of information. The piece of disinformation also omits that the portal data, although reliable, is not consolidated. According to the database, the registry offices have up to 14 calendar days to update information on the platform, which does not mean that the deaths are consolidated after this period.
Antibodies produced by Llamas could help us find a solution against COVID-19 There is no evidence for this.

The Telangana government is distributing Ramadan gifts to Muslims during lockdown. The viral picture is five years old. To prevent crowds during the COVID-19 crisis, the KCR government is not distributing Ramadan gifts to Muslims this time.
Two men robbed gold and money, asking the victim to put on a mask. This is false. The claim comes from a Tiktok video.

Video of an RPF Jawan (low ranking member of the Railway Protection Force) collecting bribe from the migrants walking home on the railway tracks during the lockdown in Gujarat, India. The video is an old one. It is not related to any recent incident during the lockdown. As per an article published in July 2019, the video shows an RPF Jawan in Surat taking bribe from bootlegger women.

Video of an RPF Jawan (low ranking member of the Railway Protection Force) collecting bribe from the migrants walking home on the railway tracks during the lockdown in Gujarat, India. The video is an old one. It is not related to any recent incident during the lockdown. As per an article published in July 2019, the video shows an RPF Jawan in Surat taking bribe from bootlegger women.

Seventy-three Japanese police officers have been infected with COVID-19 after handling infected bodies. The National Public Security Commission did indeed make two seperate announcements: firstly that police found and handled 15 bodies of people who died of COVID-19, and secondly that 73 police members were infected with COVID-19. But neither case mentioned that the police officers caught the infection from handling infected bodies, nor has there been any media reports about such infections.

United States the only country on Earth that is protesting being on lockdown amid the coronavirus outbreak. There have been protests in France, Germany and Poland, Brazil, India and Australia, among others.
President of Madagascar Andry Rajoelina asked African countries to leave World Health Organization. Andry Rajoelina never claimed that, and the Presidency formally denied it.

Wisconsin Governor Tony Evers’ administration deemed dentists non-essential. The executive order from Gov. Tony Evers classified dental offices as essential. Dentists could individually choose how to operate when the order was in effect, but Wisconsin’s Department of Health Services recommends they follow CDC guidelines, which meant postponing elective procedures and visits.

$100B contact tracing bill “is about controlling/tracking population, not about coronavirus.” A Facebook post claims new federal legislation to support contact tracing “is about controlling/tracking population, not about coronavirus.” The bill strictly targets the novel coronavirus. It would provide $100 billion to organizations that do COVID-19 contact tracing and testing, or that offer services to people who are isolating at home.

The EU has demanded guarantees from Spain that imply cuts in civil servants’ pensions and salaries in exchange for granting aid to them in the face of the COVID-19 crisis. EU funds are not conditional on cuts in pensions or wages. The only requirement of the EU is that the beneficiary States dedicate those funds to finance the health costs of the pandemic.
Viral message on lockdown information attributed to Kozhikode Police, in India. Kozhikode Police has not sent out any such message.
Tweet by Assam Health Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma regarding newly found COVID-19 positive cases. The tweet is manipulated. The health minister has not tweeted anything as such.
WHO warns against NSAIDs Analgetics for COVID-19 patients. According to the WHO scientific brief published in 19 April 2020, there is no evidence that NSAIDs worsen disease for COVID-19 patients.

Anthony Fauci was on the Clinton Foundation board for 20 years and “currently serves on Gates Foundation.” Anthony Fauci never served on the Clinton Foundation board, according to the nonprofit. He also isn’t a member of the Gates Foundation leadership team.
Photo: Thousands of birds fall dead amid the COVID-19 pandemic. The images are from Italy, February 4. The birds died because strong winds knocked down their nests.

A photo has been shared repeatedly in multiple posts on Facebook and Twitter which claims to show gift bags distributed to Muslims during the holy month of Ramadan by India’s Telangana state government during the coronavirus pandemic. The claim is false, this photo has circulated online since at least 2015; Telangana’s chief minister has announced it will not distribute Ramadan gifts this year due to the COVID-19 outbreak.

The implementation of the enhanced community quarantine (ECQ) in certain areas is extended until June 15, 2020. As of May 25, there is still no announcement by the government about the extension of quarantine measures after May 31.

“Vaccines are in direct violation of The Nuremberg Code.” The Nuremberg Code addresses the treatment of human subjects in medical experiments and says nothing about the use of tested and approved vaccines on patients.

Wearing a traditional turban as it is done in the Songhoy (or Songhai) culture is both an ancestral practice and a preventive measure against COVID-19. No scientific evidence supports this; according to experts including two specialists in the management of COVID-19 in Mali.

Detainees in Mpimba central prison, Burundi, died due to COVID-19 and that some contracted the coronavirus. In Bujumbura, no deaths related to COVID-19 have been reported in Mpimba central prison, so far.

The federal government of Ethiopia blocked medical equipment meant to support Tigray Regional State in responding to the coronavirus disease The spokesperson for Tigray Regional State confirmed that they had received equipment, but that it was inadequate.

Neem leaves – commonly called “Maliyirinin or Jirikunanin” in bambara – mixed with lemongrass leaves can cure COVID-19. Experts have said that there is no evidence that a mixture of neem and lemongrass can cure COVID-19.

Wearing masks weaken your immune system because it prevents germs to get into your body. According to experts it is not true that your immune system is weakened when you are less exposed to germs. But it is not clear whether wearing masks all the time can increase your risk to get sick.

A message claimed that the Indian government plans to ease down the lockdown restrictions imposed in the country in five stages. The claim was copied from Ireland government's schedule and no such plan exists as per the Indian government statements.
Rashid Buttar, a well-known doctor from the United States, talks about the planned “pandemic.” Buttar's claims do not find scientific support.

Greece is the number one country in terms of how many coronavirus tests have been conducted for each confirmed case. The claim was based on insufficient data. Many countries both in and out of Europe had higher number of tests per confirmed COVID-19 cases.

A social media post requests Brazil’s governors and mayors distribute four medications for home treatment against COVID-19 The four drugs (azithromycin, ivermectin, hydroxychloroquine and oseltamivir) have no proven efficacy against COVID-19. Self-medication can cause serious health damage.
Animal coronavirus vaccine works on SARS-CoV-2 Information is misleading. Human coronavirus can't be cured using animal vaccine

Viral message shares the Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) latest guidelines on COVID-19. The message has been falsely attributed to Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) and the institution has denied any association with the message.
WHO and the government give money bonds to the population to cope with the quarantine. The WHO and the Mexican government denied the information on the delivery of money bonds to the population.

A video of a Brazilian man claiming that azithromycin and ivermectin cure people with COVID-19. Scientists are researching the effectiveness of these two drugs against the novel coronavirus, but still there is no evidence that they work. The use of drugs without medical prescription can cause serious damage to people's health.

A WhatsApp chain, as well as some websites say that Italy will let the elderly sick with coronavirus die. Health officials from Turin, Italy, issued a statement establishing some criteria for patients with coronavirus access to intensive care, in which it is mentioned that the patient must be less than 80 years old or have a score less than 5 in the Charlson comorbidity index.

A WhatsApp chain and a YouTube video ensure that inhaling eucalyptus through vaporizers, prevents and kills the coronavirus. Dr. Justino Regalado, deputy director of Pneumonology at the National Institute of Respiratory Diseases, comments that eucalyptus is not effective in eliminating the virus in environments and surfaces. Furthermore, the WHO and Mexican Institutions do not mention in their recommendations the use of eucalyptus, in any presentation; as a measure to prevent or eliminate the coronavirus.

Photo of three closed shops, with signs saying that people lost their job because of Alexandre Kalil, mayor of Belo Horizonte, Brazil, and his lockdown measures against COVID-19. The photo is from 2015, and the signs were digitally inserted on the image. It was also not shot in Belo Horizonte, but in São Paulo.

The Washington Post published a story saying that COVID-19 patient zero was an employee from a virology institute in Wuhan. The Washington Post did publish an article talking about safety concerns about this lab, citing American intelligence sources, but never stated that the "patient zero" was an employee. The Washington Post fact-checking service itself classified this information as false.

According to Civil Registry record, the number of respiratory syndrome deaths decreased, and not increased, between 2019 and 2020 in Ceará, Brazil. The time period considered was March 16 to May 10. The Civil Registry do not update their data in real time. It might take up to two weeks for a registered death show up in the stats. Thus, most deaths occured in May are still not registered, even some in April might not be in the system. Also, the numbers used by Fernandes are, actually, the total number of deaths. When considered respiratory syndromes alone, there were already more than 400 extra deaths in 2020.

Photo of a subway wagon full of people wearing masks. On the caption, it is stated that this photo was taken after São Paulo mayor determined traffic restrictions (only half of the vehicles are allowed to circulate daily) to increase social isolation. The photo predates the newer traffic restriction resolutions. It was first published on Facebook on May 4. The particular measure mentioned on the post started on May 11.
The government has banned autopsies on COVID-19 deaths. They want to hide the truth. The Government and the Ministry of Health have published guidelines for safe autopsies.
Bill Gates patented the Sars-cov2 vaccine in 2014. The patents registered before 2019 are for other coronaviruses, not for Sars-cov2.

The SARS-CoV2 virus weakens, it means that it is artificial. The Governor of the Veneto Region Zaia said so. There is no scientific evidence. Viruses can weaken, but the scientific community has shown that Sars-cov2 is not artificial.

People violate social distancing protocol in a temple festival in Alappuzha, India. Social distancing protocol was followed during the temple rituals. There was no festival organized this year due to COVID-19. Some people assembled at the gate of the temple for a glance of the deity. The image of this incident was shared with a false narrative.
Image of a doctor smoking while treating COVID patients in Gujarat, India. The image is not from Gujarat (India) but from Bangladesh and it is not related to COVID-19.
MHA has declared Guwahati as ‘Red Zone.’ The headline of the article is false as MHA has not declared Guwahati as Red Zone.

A video shows a Superintendent of police announcing the extension of Lokckdown in Maharashtra, India till May 30. Police have clarified that the viral video is old and is being misinterpreted. The SP in the video was actually talking about the lockdown between 14-30 April.2020

A video clip shows a doctor couple who died after treating 134 COVID-19 patients. The viral clip has been taken from a popular Mexican series “Triunfo del Amor” (2010). It is being shared with a false claim related to coronavirus.
Video shows people falling dead on street as the COVID-19 situation in India intensified. The videos were from the Vizag gas leak in India, and not related to COVID-19.

Video of United States Vice President Mike Pence allegedly delivering “empty boxes of personal protective equipment (PPE)” to a health facility. The video, which was cut short, was first broadcasted by the Jimmy Kimmel Live program, on ABC. In the full recording, Pence is seen joking around and leaves the empty boxes in the van.

Former President of the Government of Spain José María Aznar has moved from Marbella to Madrid, thus skipping the confinement, alledgedly to invite the President of the Community of Madrid, Isabel Díaz Ayuso to participate in a conference. It is a hoax. The session to which they refer is held online.
An image claims it shows the Grand Canal of the Italian city of Venice full of what the caption calls ‘pink swans’. The image is not real. It's a photomontage.

Video of member of Indian parliament Rahul Gandhi stating that the red zones are green zones and green zones are red zones amidst the COVID-19 situation. This is a 6 second clipped video of a longer press conference shared out of context to mislead users.
The departament of Guaviare in Colombia has 10 cases of coronavirus. No, Guavire has no coronavirus cases as of publication.

An official document approved by the Italian Health Ministry bans autopsies on COVID-19 deceased patients. The original documents has been misinterpreted. It states that "autopsies should not be conducted" on COVID-19 deceased positive patients when the cause of death is already known. Autopsies are allowed when the cause of death is not certain, and it needs to be further investigated. The exams can also be conducted for scientific purposes, in a limited number.

A video where an alleged “elite operative” would “tell the truth” about the rescue of Silvia Romano, and Italian woman who was kidnapped in Kenya in 2018 and has recently got back to Italy. The man in the video claims that the money used to paid the ransom were taken from a European fund aimed at helping Italian workers during the COVID-19 emergency. The man in the video is not an "elite operative" involved in Silvia Romano's rescuing operations. He's Gianmarco Saolini, a well-known spreader of fake news. He was not involved in the operations, and the claims he makes about the ransom and the whole operation are unfounded.

Singing and clapping on the balconies creates a risk of COVID-19 infection. Both the World Health Organization (WHO) and the Ministry of Health of the Nation did not include among the recommendations and prevention measures not to go out on the balcony.

The new coronavirus was created in a Chinese laboratory and Bill Gates financed its origin. The "ADN TV" program, which aired on channel C5N, showed a 2015 report by the Italian channel RAI in which it talks about a coronavirus created in a Chinese laboratory from bats and mice and that it could affect humans. However, the same RAI source details that the coronavirus they talk about in the published article has nothing to do with the cause of the current pandemic (COVID-19). There is also no evidence that the American businessman Bill Gates has financed the origin of the coronavirus through "Event 201".

An alleged audio of a Argentinian prisoner who claims that 1,900 inmates will be released from the Devoto prison as of Monday. There is no record that 1,900 prisoners are released as of Monday. In addition, there are currently 1,692 inmates in Devoto's prison, making the release of 1,900 people impossible.

President Donald Trump implemented “a travel ban that just didn’t work, 400,000 people got in from those countries that were subject to the restrictions.” Sen. Chris Murphy overstates travel from China after Trump restrictions. The number of people that flew directly in from China after Trump’s travel restrictions went into effect was reported in April to be around 40,000, not 400,000. Those travelers were American citizens and other authorized travelers who were exempted from the restrictions. That number is now higher, according to new U.S. Customs and Border Patrol data of both direct and indirect flights from China through mid May.
Over 300 people in Jaipur contracted COVID-19 after coming in contact with a indian monk who was smoking chillum. No such event occurred in Jaipur and the newspaper clipping is fake.

Migrants in Mumbai have flocked together and are walking back to their cities during the lockdown. The video is from Anand Vihar in Delhi when Delhi and Uttar Pradesh had agreed to allow migrants ot return home on March 28.

Government on India’s plan for exiting the lockdown in five phases. The government hasn't released any such plan yet. Secondly, we found that the plan doing the rounds on social media was very similar to that of government of Ireland.
Dr Devi Shetty has recommended these 22 steps to avoid coronavirus. The message has been falsely attributed to Dr Devi Shetty.

Cop is extorting money from migrant labourers who want to return home due to the lockdown. The video is from 2019 and it shows a railway protection force personnel accepting money from women bootleggers in Surat.

A photo has been shared hundreds of times in multiple posts on Facebook and Twitter alongside a claim it shows a placard with a message congratulating Sri Lankan leaders for “eradicating” the novel coronavirus. The claim is false; the photo has been doctored to include a COVID-19 reference; the original photo of a political placard was taken by AFP in November 2019 following President Gotabaya Rajapaksa’s election victory.

“Plandemic” — a slickly-edited, 26-minute interview with a discredited researcher — has been widely shared on social media. But the video, which YouTube and Facebook are working to remove for violating content standards, contains multiple false or misleading claims, including about the novel coronavirus, experts say.

A video recorded at an empty Holbæk Hospital shows that the coronavirus is a conspiracy because there are no COVID-19 patients. The Facebook user will have to look very long for coronavirus patients at Holbæk Hospital, as the hospital has no COVID-19 section at all. In this area, severe ill coronavirus patients are being transported to either the hospitals in Slagelse, Køge or Roskilde. Incidentally, most of the video is recorded in and around the entrance hall at Holbæk Hospital.

A U.S. House bill would give government the power to forcibly take your family members from your home and quarantine them. The House bill that would fund organizations to trace and prevent COVID-19 infections.

Senate Majority leader Mitch Connell said the Obama administration left no game plan for a pandemic. McConnell is wrong to say the Obama administration left “no game plan” to deal with a pandemic; the Obama team crafted a detailed document setting forth questions and policies that should be considered.

“Germany and the United States are the two best in deaths per 100,000 people, which, frankly, to me, that’s perhaps the most important number there is.” Trump’s comparison of COVID-19 deaths in Germany, US is wrong. “Deaths per 100,000 people” is a public health metric used to quantify the intensity of an epidemic. In this case, it shows how many people have died from COVID-19 while controlling for countries’ populations. Although the U.S. is showing a lower number than countries such as Spain and Italy, various datasets indicate that, per capita, the U.S. has far more COVID-related deaths than does Germany and many other countries, including Canada, South Korea, Iran, Russia, Poland and Switzerland.

Law firm prepares anti-government lawsuit for coronavirus mass murder in Spain. The law firm has denied it through its official Twitter account and the alleged plaintiff has assured that the lawsuit that has been published is false.
Coronavirus outbreak is due to 5G. WHO has denied the hoax that links 5G to the spread of the coronavirus.

The U.S. is the only country on earth that is protesting being locked down. People around the world have opposed mitigation measures designed to slow the spread of the novel coronavirus because of economic hardship and concerns over personal freedoms.

One photograph of an article of the Newspapers Clarín shows the apparition of COVID-19 in 2003. There were along the time three types of coronavirus, the one indicated in the article has the name SARS in the scientific community, this one is different from the present's virus, which actually it is called SARS-CoV-2.

The video shows the bodies of deceased COVID-19 victims washing ashore after some countries dumped them in the sea. The video shows the aftermath of a 2014 shipwreck off the coast of Libya. The Daily Caller News Foundation didn’t find any record of countries using mass sea burials for deceased coronavirus victims.

White South Africans have been banned from receiving government aid during the coronavirus pandemic. The criteria for social grants do not bar white South Africans from applying for or receiving them. A spokesperson from South African Social Security Agency (SASSA) confirmed the claim is “not true.”

Vice President Mike Pence was caught on a hot mic delivering empty boxes of personal protective equipment (PPE) to a Virginia health care center. The clip is selectively edited to make it seem like Pence delivered empty boxes of PPE for a publicity stunt. The full C-SPAN video shows that Pence delivered full boxes and did not touch or pretend to deliver the empty ones.

Experts in China found that the coronavirus can be spread through houseflies. According to WHO, there is no evidence or information to suggest that the COVID-19 virus transmitted through houseflies. The virus that cause COVID-19 spreads primarily through droplets generated when an infected person coughs, sneezes or speaks
The weight of the virus causing COVID-19 is 0.85 attogram. No study on the weight of the virus that caused COVID-19. The proposed calculation is also mathematically incorrect.

“Clearly, the Obama administration did not leave any kind of game plan for something like this.” Evidence counters McConnell claim that Obama team left no pandemic ‘game plan’ for Trump. Numerous Obama administration officials dismissed this statement. Ronald Klain, who was Obama’s Ebola response coordinator, tweeted a link to the plan. Kayleigh McEnany, White House press secretary for President Donald Trump, held up a hard copy of the Obama “pandemic playbook” during a May 14 press availability on the White House lawn.

The Brazilian state of Ceará had more deaths from respiratory diseases in 2019 and 2018 than in 2020.
