The publications make two mistakes: 1) they include deaths from non-respiratory causes in the comparison of deaths from respiratory diseases in Ceará and 2) they omit that the numbers from the platform that gathers data on death declarations registered in the country's registry offices are not consolidated and they are still being updated over time, both in the case of deaths that occurred in 2020 and in 2019.

The Brazilian state of Piauí was able to empty the COVID-19 ICU beds with the use of chloroquine. For five days in May, the institution didn't actually record serious cases of COVID-19, but patients have been medicated with an experimental cocktail that also includes other drugs, such as corticosteroids, according to the hospital's technical director, Justino Carvalho Jr.

Statistics of deaths per million inhabitants show that COVID-19 pandemic in Brazil is not serious. The publications don't consider that: 1) countries are at different stages of the pandemic; 2) there are population differences that prevent comparison, such as age and demographic density; and 3) the level of testing in Brazil is much lower than in other countries, which leads to underreporting of infected and dead.
According to WHO, no vegetarian has been affected by coronavirus because it needs animal fat in the body to survive. WHO has never issued such a statement.

A list of precautions has been issued by the Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR-Delhi) to stay safe from the COVID-19 virus. ICMR has not issued the list of precautions mentioned in the post. Also few of the precautions mentioned in the list are scienfically unproven.

The number of COVID-19 infection in Japan is 10 times higher than officially announced. The survey conducted by the social network app LINE only indicated how many people had symptoms indicative of a possible COVID-19 infection and did not actual confirm the number of people infected. In addition, the orginal source of this information mistakenly draws  conclusions by comparing the results of a survey of the Greater Tokyo Area (inclusve of three other prefectures) with total infections of the Tokyo Metropolitan area and applying this percentage to the whole of Japan.

There are no doctors in the hotels and other accomodation centers where people with mild case of COVID-19 are being quarantined in Japan. It is true that according the Japanese Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare manual these sites are considered recuperation centers where doctors do not need to be stationed . However, Professor Okada fails to mention that the Tokyo Metropolitan Government has stationed doctors in these hotels during the daytime, and the manual still requires nurses to be stationed there during the day.

Wearing face mask increases the risk of hypercapnia. Reasearch show that even though prolounged use of certain types of face masks might give headaches, home-made masks and surgical masks do not pose danger to experience increased blood CO2 concentration as suffering from hypercapnia do experience.

Judy Mikovit’s claims about the origins of COVID-19, flu vaccine and face masks from the documentary Plandemic retold in FB post. Seven claims related to Judy Mikovits and claims made in the documentary film Plandemic are false claims. Meanwhile, three other claims are not proven.

Alibaba founder Jack Ma calls 2020 only a “year of survival”. The quote is sourced from an edited video with a sound that is not the voice of Jack Ma. The original video was uploaded on the Chinese video platform, iQiyi, on September 9, 2019, before the appearance of the novel coronavirus in December 2019.

Remdesivir is authorized only as emergency treatment for hospitalized patients. Remdesivir, a drug originally developed to combat Ebola infection, was licensed for use only as emergency treatment in seriously hospitalized patients with COVID-19, while research continues into its overall effectiveness against the SARS-CoV-2 virus. .

Police violently forced a family from their home in the U.S. in handcuffs because they were in violation of House Resolution 6666. The incident shown in a video is unrelated to the coronavirus or proposed legislation. It happened in Ontario, Canada, and not the United States.

A video of three sloth bears has been viewed thousands of times on Facebook and Twitter alongside a claim it was captured in Sri Lanka during a curfew implemented due to the coronavirus pandemic. The claim is false; the clip has circulated in reports about sloth bears in south India since November 2019, before the COVID-19 pandemic; a Sri Lankan wildlife activist told AFP it would be "highly unlikely" to see sloth bears in the Sri Lankan town which was cited in the misleading social media posts.

Former President of the Government of Spain José María Aznar has moved from Marbella to Madrid, thus not respecting the lockdown, alledgedly to invite the President of the Community of Madrid, Isabel Díaz Ayuso to participate in a conference. It is a hoax. The session to which they refer was online.

The Spanish Tax Agency is sending an email to employers, who must fill out the attached document and return it in less than seven days to avoid the suspension of their businesses. This is a fraud to steal personal data.

The confidential list of experts that decides which Spanish regions can relax the mesures against coronavirus under the state of alarm has been leaked to the media. The list of health technicians who study which autonomous communities enter another phase has not been published by the Spanish Government nor leaked on social networks: it is being confused with the list of experts who prepared the Plan for the Transition towards a New Normality.

Claims Lithuanian government ruling on masks is illegal hence masks aren’t mandatory, unless stated by a separate law. Lithuanian government ruling on mask wearing was legal and there were fines for not wearing it at the time publication was published.

Claims that coronavirus is fake and Belarus is coping very well with this “pandemic of hysteria”. At the time false claim was made the number of cases of coronavirus infection in Belarus has increased from 933 in a day to reach 23,906 cases.

Alcoholic gel left in the sunlight in a car made the car door melt, as this picture shows. Even if alcoholic gel is inflammable, it is highly improbable that it can melt a car door after being exposed at sunlight, as an expert told AFP.

Articles claim that not wearing a mask in Canada during the novel coronavirus pandemic can lead to a Can$3,000 fine or jail time. This is false. Masks are required aboard airplanes and by certain stores, but AFP did not find any Canadian jurisdiction where wearing them on the street is mandatory.

An article that has been widely shared on social media warns healthy people against wearing face masks during the COVID-19 pandemic, citing alleged risks Experts say masks can help curb the spread of the disease caused by the novel coronavirus, and that the article contains multiple false or misleading claims.

“Autopsies prove that COVID-19 is” a blood clot, not pneumonia, “and ought to be fought with antibiotics” and the whole world has been wrong in treating the “so-called” pandemic. The novel coronavirus that causes the disease COVID-19 is a virus. Viruses do not respond to antibiotic treatment; antibiotics work only on bacterial infections. COVID-19 is primarily a respiratory illness that in some cases causes pneumonia. Another effect, according to the autopsies in Italy, is lung damage caused by blood clotting. But that doesn’t change the fact that COVID-19 is caused by a virus.
Hand sanitizer can burst into flames if you leave it in your car. It would need to be at a temperature of 400 degrees Celsius (752 degrees Farenheit) to take fire.
Two UK police forces used the same photo to illustrate two different crimes. This is incorrect. The tweet from Cumbria Road Police is real, the image of a tweet from Police Scotland is fake.

On a global basis, the COVID-19 has killed way less people than other major outbreaks. This image dates from early March, at the beginning of the global outbreak. Since then, COVID-19-related mortality has exploded and is on track to kill as many people as AIDS in 2020.

COVID-19 patients are dying from thombosis, not from a lung infection, hence UCA unit are useless, and people should be treated at home with antiinflammatory drugs. While around one COVID-19 victim out of three do suffer thrombosis, it's more a complication than a cause, and people still need to be treated of acute respiratory distresses.

Social media users posted photos of a 2003 Clarin article. They said it is proof that COVID-19 is nothing new. “The new coronavirus” that Clarín referred to in 2003 is SARS-CoV, which causes a different disease than COVID-19, which is the pandemic we are currently facing.

A picture with a quote from doctor Vincenzo Puro, who allegedly said that asymptomatic people cannot infect others, that the virus is not lethal and that the pandemic is a “hoax”. Puro's claims have been misinterpreted and decontestualized. On March 12, during a tv interview, Puro said that asymptomatic people are generally less contagious than others, but nonetheless they should always respect social distancing and protective measures. He also said that the majority of people positive to COVID-19 do not develop severe conditions, so the virus does not kill everyone but it focuses on the most vulnerable people.
Drinking salty water or water with vinegar will eliminate coronavirus. This won't help. There is no evidence that it has any effect on a person's ability to fight off COVID-19.

Claim that Bill Gates said that coronavirus vaccine will kill or harm 700 000 people. He did not say those words. He refered hypothetically to the total number of possible side effects of a vaccine applied to the entire world's population.

Bill Gates predicts 700.000 victims because of a COVID-19 vaccine. The quote is taken out of context. Bill Gates said that a COVID-19 vaccine should better not have any side effects - because even if only one in ten thousand people are affected, this may lead to 700.000 events worldwide if you vaccinate the whole population.

Geneticist and BiH university professor Damir Marjanovic says “the new coronavirus may have been artificially spread” The title of the article on the portal of one television manipulatively presented the statement of geneticist and university professor from BiH Damir Marjanović about the origin of the SARS-CoV-2 virus, which he gave in the television program of the same media. The manipulation added a tone of conspiracy theory to the statement and falsely claimed claim that the professor said that "The virus may have been artificially spread", which he did not said. After the reaction of Professor Marjanović, the title with the disputed claim was changed.

Multiple posts shared with a picture of a hand-cuffed Bill Gates being led away by FBI agents allege the US billionaire has been arrested for biological terrorism. This is false; the image is doctored and actually shows the 2015 arrest of New York mobster Vincent Asaro. The report was first published by a satirical website but was reproduced elsewhere as real news.
UNICEF says that the novel coronavirus stays in hands for 10 minutes. Viral message was not released by UNICEF; falsely attributed to the organization.
Israeli doctors say it is dangerous to wear masks outside. It is safe to wear masks outside, but at the same time one should keep the social distancing and hygiene rules.
Bill Gates has ordered the global COVID-19 pandemic. It is a conspiracy theory that has no proof.

Experts in China found that the coronavirus can be spread through houseflies. According to WHO, there is no evidence or information to suggest that the COVID-19 virus transmitted through houseflies. The virus that cause COVID-19 spreads primarily through droplets generated when an infected person coughs, sneezes or speaks
Rinsing your throat with water and vinegar will fight coronavirus Information provided in the graphics is not based on current scientific knowledge.
President Trump posted a tweet blaming President Obama for failing to prepare him for a pandemic and celebrating that there are still more people alive than dead. This is a fake tweet.
In Italy, 232 children have died from COVID-19. Official data indicate that until may the 10th, three children aged 0-9 have died from COVID-19.
Palm oil is a simple solution for coronavirus The post claiming palm oil is a simple solution for coronavirus is fake. There is no evidence to prove this. This has been falsely attributed to WHO.
Price of hydroxychloroquine-based medicine “Plaquenil” in France was multiplied by four. This information comes from a French parody website.

World Health Organisation only recommended testing among the general population in April 2020 during the COVID-19 crisis. World Health Organization recommended testing among the general population on March 6, and asked for it repeatedly since then.

Vitamin D helps against the coronavirus. New research on the coronavirus is constantly appearing, some of it still preliminary, which does not show significant results. Studies on vitamin D indicate that populations that have higher levels of that substance are less impacted by COVID-19. But both variables are observed in paralle, which means it is not enough to affirm that Vitamin D could help with the virus.
A video shows Delhi police apprehending a COVID-19 patient who was fleeing. The video is, in fact, of a mock drill conducted in the city of Barabanki. It is being falsely shared as a real incident.

Death of a young Sri Lankan nurse living in Adelaide, Australia was due to COVID-19. Death was not due to COVID-19 and the last instace of a COVID-19 related death  reported from Adelaide & South Australia was on12th April

According to a large scientific study, bee venom can protect people from COVID-19. The source used to back the claim in question is not a study but a letter sent to a scientific journal in order to present the writers assumptions regarding the alleged efficacy of bee venom to COVID-19. The writters assumptions and recomendations are not based on credible scientific evidence but rather on anecdotal evidence and accounts from apitherapy practicioners (apitherapy is an alternative pseudoscientific practice that uses bee products including bee venom as cures for a wide variety of medical conditions).

Barack Obama “is the first ex-president to ever speak against his successor.” Obama isn't the first ex-president to speak ill of his successor. Barack Obama called the Trump administration’s response to COVID-19 “an absolute chaotic disaster.” A Twitter post, retweeted by Trump, claims that Obama is the first ex-president to speak ill of his successor. From Hoover to Truman, Ford to Carter and beyond, ex-presidents have criticized the person who followed them into office.

A Tamil Nadu (India) DMK leader beat up a lady doctor who was on COVID-19 duty. This is a 2018 video of the DMK leader beating up a woman who was not a doctor and this is not linked to COVID-19. The leader was suspended from the party

The men of India’s railway minister demanding money from helpless workers for walking on the tracks. The video is originally from 2019 where a police officer was seen taking bribes from passengers and is not related to COVID-19.

Ghanaian President Nana Akufo-Addo claimed in a speech that his country had administered more COVID-19 tests per million people than any other country in Africa. AFP has found from available statistics that Ghana comes behind South Africa and at least two other African countries.
A Covid positive temple priest in the city of Jaipur spread coronavirus to 300 people when he smoked his pipe. No such incident has occured in the city of Jaipur.

Prolonged use of mask causes hypoxia, oxygen deficiency, fatigue and loss of reflexes. Prolonged use of masks is safe provided it is clean and of appropriate size. They should not be worn too tightly.

Advisory issued by the state police of Telangana (India) instructing people to be vigilant about the possibility of increase in thefts, due to the COVID-19 crisis in the country. The Telangana state police through their official Twitter account clarified that no such safety advisory has been released from the authorities, and urged not to spread such panic-inducing content.

Photo representing the suffering of a migrant worker during the current lockdown in India. While it is true that the migrant workers are facing a lot of problems due to the current lockdown in the country, the photo is not related to India. The photo is an old one. It shows a Rohingya man walking into Bangladesh.

Photo representing the suffering of a migrant worker during the current lockdown in India. While it is true that the migrant workers are facing a lot of problems due to the current lockdown in the country, the photo is not related to India. The photo is an old one. It shows Rohingya man walking into Bangladesh.

A woman who died of coronavirus woke up a month later. The woman was not dead, she was unconscious. Doctors mistakenly gave her family the ashes of another person. In addition, the original publication did not say anything about the connection of her illness with the coronavirus.

Dr. Anthony Fauci is “pushing” remdesivir as a potential COVID-19 treatment drug, because he “invented” it with Bill Gates and they stand to profit from it. Remdesivir was invented by the pharmaceutical company Gilead Sciences, which receives any profit from sales of the drug as a treatment for COVID-19.

Nancy Pelosi said “Congress shall not vote remotely because it is not secure!” while also saying that “Americans should all vote for president by mail!” Pelosi initially expressed concerns about technological, legal and other issues on the idea of allowing members of the House to cast votes remotely. But Pelosi has said she is open to the idea, if issues can be resolved, and backed a measure that requires the House study remote voting for its members. Pelosi is a prominent supporter of voters casting ballots by mail.

Facebook posts shared hundreds of times claim US President Donald Trump approved a $2.5 million fund for Madagascar to mass-produce a herbal remedy touted by the island’s president as a cure for COVID-19. The claim is false; there is no evidence Trump made any such statement, and while the United States did give Madagascar $2.5 million to tackle the outbreak, government information on the fund’s use does not include producing a remedy.

“This is what Bill Gates and George Soros want to do… secretly stick you with a chip while testing you for the coronavirus… the Dems have a bill on the House floor ready to vote on it to require this.” We found no evidence to support this claim.

Captions on a reuploaded video about the U.S. approving Remdesivir for emergency use say the drug will “end COVID-19.” The antiviral drug is not a miracle cure for the novel coronavirus. Remdesivir, whose safety and effectiveness are still being studied, can only be used in critically ill COVID-19 patients. Only the U.S., and just this May 7, Japan, have given emergency use authorization (EUA) for the drug, developed by biopharmaceutical company Gilead Sciences, Inc.

The largest coronavirus cluster in Indonesia is 10 thousand GBI and GPIB Priests from Italy and Israel. Of the total positive cases of COVID-19 in Indonesia as of May 8, 2020 which reached 13,112 cases, the number of GBI and GPIB pastors who were positive of COVID-19 did not reach 10 thousand people. The GBI and GPIB clusters are not the only dominant cluster in the transmission of COVID-19. Additionally, the transmission of the coronavirus is actually not related to any particular religion. These clusters occur because the religious activities that become these clusters involve many people or crowds, who are vulnerable to the transmission of COVID-19. Experts have recommended keeping a safe distance of at least 1 meter and avoiding crowds as one of COVID-19's precautions.
More than one hundred people in Quarantine center in Chin State, Myanmar, died. This is misinformation based on the death of an education officer of Chin state who suffered brain stroke.

African Union (AU) has validated COVID-Organics, a Malagasy remedy against 2019-nCov (the new coronavirus). The pan-African body has only agreed to collaborate with Madagascar to test the effectiveness of the remedy.

Video shows lockdown and social distancing violation outside a liquor shop in Delhi. This video is an old and unrelated video, the liquor shop shown in the video is closed currently due to the COVID-19 lockdown

With ongoing financial crisis due to COVID-19, Ski Lankan Cabinet had approved LKR 300 million to purchase vehicles. There is no cabinet decision to allocate 300 million for government vehicle purchases as clarified by the authorities

Image of a sample letter which had to be used while donating May month’s full salary by government employees’ as requested by Sri Lankan President Secretary P.B.Jayasundara as part of COVID-19 relief measures. No such form has been published and the President Secretary in a personal appeal had requested government employees to make a voluntary donation as per individual preference and ability

An image claims that food is being thrown and wasted by migrant workers while they are moving out from Maharashtra, India. The photo of food wastage was taken back in 2013 in Ahmadabad, Gujarat. It has nothing to do with the current migrant situation in Maharashtra.

Gujarat (India) chief minister Vijay Rupani’s resignation is accepted by the BJP high command. BJP has refuted the rumor of CM VIjay Rupani's resignation during the pandemic. These are baseless messages that went viral.

Migrants are defying lockdown and have taken to Ahmedabad’s streets in India. The pictures are from Telangana of May 4 when many migrants had flocked Hyderabad once they heard about the shramik trains.

A video showing a large gathering in Germany, allegedly during the COVID-19 pandemic. The video was actually shot in Chemnitz, Germany but it has nothing to do with COVID-19: it dates back to 2018, and it shows a large anti-migrants protest organized by the far-right.

Irish news organisations are organising a collective moment of applause for the government to praise its work in handling the coronavirus pandemic. No media organisations in Ireland are organising a national round of applause to show appreciation for the government's response to the COVID-19 crisis.

Under an 1866 Supreme Court ruling, stay-at-home orders are illegal in the United States and can be disregarded with impunity. No, that’s not a U.S. Supreme Court ruling. The post misattributed a quote from a 1935 Illinois Supreme Court decision about Chicago judicial salaries. The original quote refers to the Illinois Constitution and the laws that created the Municipal Court of Chicago, not the U.S. constitution. The Supreme Court has ruled in the past that the rights of a citizen can be restricted by the state for the “common good” during a health crisis.

A video clip of a leading opposition politician in India has been viewed thousands of times in multiple Facebook and Twitter posts alongside a claim that it shows him making a confusing remark about India’s system for classifying regional COVID-19 infections levels. The claim is false; the clip has been edited; the original video shows lawmaker Rahul Gandhi, the former president of the Indian National Congress (INC) political party, making a clear statement about the need for local control regarding COVID-19 classifications.

“Guess what, [children are] not at risk unless they have an underlying medical issue.” Pa. House Speaker Mike Turzai argued that children are largely protected from the ravages of the coronavirus because of their youth and would be safe if they return to school in the fall. A new study published in the medical journal JAMA Pediatrics found that roughly one in five children with serious cases of coronavirus had no underlying medical conditions. In New York City, 52 children sickened with the coronavirus have developed a serious condition called pediatric multi-symptom inflammatory syndrome.

Israel’s ambassador in Colombia says there is already an antibody that neutralizes COVID-19 and reduces the contagion index. These studies are in testing phase, some in human testing, there is no information conclusive or completely official about it success. That's why the OMS has not manifested about the veracity of them.

Some reporters visited the British Prime Minister Boris Johnson after he recovered from his illness. His home looks like an old abandoned military hut with very old brick walls. The living room was too small so brought out the tea tray for the reporters. All the cups are different. He met them with disheveled hair and casual clothes, but with the confident smile of a Prime Minister The video of UK's PM Boris Johnson doing rounds on social media is from 2018 when he was not even Prime Minister

An Air India flight deployed to bring stranded Indians back home is not following social distancing norms, even after charging a hefty amount for the flight. The video is of a Pakistani aircraft carrier, Pakistan International Airlines (PIA).

Video of migrant labourers coming onto the streets in Ahmedabad, India due to lack of rations provided to then during the COVID-19 crisis and lockdown regulations. The video is not related to Ahmedabad. It was taken in Tolichowki (Hyderabad) when migrant workers stuck in Telangana, due to lockdown, have come onto the streets asking the State government to send them to their native places.

The Government of India has released a five-phase road map to ease COVID-19 restrictions in the country. The five-phase road map in the message was not issued by the Government of India. It was issued by the Government of Ireland to reopen the country's economy and society.

A list of precautions issued by the Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR-Delhi) to stay safe from the COVID-19 virus. ICMR has not issued the list of precautions mentioned in the post. Also few of the precautions mentioned in the list are scienfically unproven.

House Resolution 6666 includes billions of dollars to fund forced quarantining for Americans who test positive for COVID-19. The bill just earmarks funding to improve Americans' health through mobile testing units in medically underserved areas.

A video has been viewed millions of times in multiple posts on Facebook, Weibo and Twitter alongside a claim it shows US Vice President Mike Pence delivering empty boxes to a hospital for a publicity stunt during the coronavirus crisis. The claim gained traction online after the the clip was aired on the US television show Jimmy Kimmel Live!, hosted by comedian Jimmy Kimmel. The claim is false; the clip has been edited from a longer video which shows that Pence made comments about delivering "empty" boxes as a joke; Kimmel issued an apology about the misleading video broadcast on his show.

Multiple posts shared hundreds of times on Facebook purport to show a list of notable viral outbreaks between 1950 and 2019 which “originated in China”. The claim is misleading; some of the viral diseases listed in the posts were first reported elsewhere in the world.

“THE HYDROXYCHLOROQUINE and AZYTHROMYCIN DID IT. They kill the coronavirus in four days at 100/100. Joy around the world. French scientist achieves the feat by finding the exact dose of these medicines that are well known in the world, are in great existence and are cheap.” Although studies are being done to find out the effectiveness of hydroxychloroquine and azithromycin, until May 20 there is still no evidence that these drugs “kill” the coronavirus.

A video shows how the police attacks two men in a supermarket because they didn’t want to wear masks. Some videos are edited, so context is missing. The two men in the supermarket heavily provoked the police and didn't follow instructions. After the incident, their flats were searched because the authorities suspected a politically motivated crime.
The coronavirus was invented to implant chips in humans. The coronavirus pandemic is real, and conspiracy theories about nanochip implantation have no evidence.

A TikTok video showing a woman buying liquor after the ease of the coronavirus lockdown in Mumbai claims that she is Bollywood actress Deepika Padukone. The woman in video is another actress, Rakul Preeth Singh and she was buying medicines, not liquor.
5G towers weaken our immunity and expose us to Coronavirus. There is no scientific confirmation that exposure to low-level electromagnetic fields of 5G is harmful to human health, according to WHO.
Belarus defeated coronavirus without quarantine. Belarus has not beaten the coronavirus. COVID-19 is still present in the country. Moreover, the COVID-19 cases data may be underestimated.

Passengers complaining about over charging and no social distancing on Air India flight. Video of passengers complaining about over charging and no social distancing belongs to Pakistan airlines, not Air India.

Some reporters visited the British Prime Minister Boris Johnson after he recovered from his illness. His home looks like an old abandoned military hut with very old brick walls. The living room was too small so brought out the tea tray for the reporters. All the cups are different. He met them with disheveled hair and casual clothes, but with the confident smile of a Prime Minister The video of UK's PM Boris Johnson doing rounds on social media is from 2018 when he was not even Prime Minister

An Air India flight deployed to bring stranded Indians back home is not following social distancing norms, even after charging a hefty amount for the flight. The video is of a Pakistani aircraft carrier, Pakistan International Airlines (PIA).

Massive protests against mandatory vaccination in Poland Footage of massive protests in Poland began spreading on Facebook unsuitably described as protests against vaccination, and were shared as news by local and regional media outlets. The truth is this video footage is three years old. It was broadcasted by a Polish City Council President, Marcin Golaszewski, on his Twitter account. Video was depicting thousands of people in Warsaw protesting against a law that entitled Polish Parliament greater authority in the election of judges to the Polish Supreme Court.
Actress Deepika Padukone was seen buying alcohol during the lockdown in India. The video is of another actress Rakul Preet Singh who had stepped out to buy medicines.
WHO envoy says COVID-19 vaccine can not be found. WHO envoy warns coronavirus vaccine "may" never be developed, not "can't".

A picture of a beach in Catania (Sicily) packed with people which was allegedly shot during the COVID-19 pandemic The picture was taken in Rio de Janeiro (Brasil) in 2013. Therefore, it has nothing to do with Italy or COVID-19.

American Vice-President Mike Pence was caught on a hot mic delivering empty boxes of PPE to a nursing home and pretended they were heavy. A video clip of Vice President Mike Pence featured in an episode of “Jimmy Kimmel Live” was deceptively edited. Pence delivered boxes of personal protective equipment to a Virginia nursing home, but Kimmel falsely suggests he pretended the boxes were heavy when they were empty. The clip cuts off before showing that Pence never lifted or touched any of the empty boxes.
Myanmar government announced the exact date for schools to reopen. We founded that no statement published on Ministry of Education website until May 8.

Despite the COVID-19 pandemic, the total number of deaths in Brazil decreased, rather than increased, when we compare the months of April 2019 and April 2020. This statement is backed by the national Civil Registry data. The Civil Registry website is not updated in real time. Usually, information regarding the total number of deaths registered in each unity take at least a week to be uploaded, often more. Therefore, numbers for April 2020 are still incomplete. Finally, at the this fact-check was published, the number of deaths in April 2020 was already higher than 2019.

A video that shows a skirmish on the street between São Paulo guards and street merchants. The caption states the guards were trying to take their merchandise away because they were not obeying COVID-19 lockdown. The video was shot on September 25, 2019.

TV Globo used images of a collective funeral for the victims of a shipwreck in Lampedusa, in 2013, to illustrate a story about deaths by COVID-19 in Italy. Although pictures from the Lampedusa shipwreck funeral were shared by social media users as if they were current, TV Globo never used it in their COVID-19 coverage. In fact, their fact-checking service, Fato ou Fake, debunked the very same story on March 19.

The total number of COVID-19 deaths decreased in Manaus, Brazil, from 150 to 2 after a visit from health minister Nelson Teich. This happened because he started to investigate fraudulent deaths. Neither the daily number of COVID-19 deaths in Manaus reached 150, nor it dropped after Nelson Teich's visit. On May 2, one day before Teich's visit, 11 deaths were registered. The following day, it grew to 28. On May 6, 73 deaths were registered.

Bill Gates is funding a vaccine in adhesive patch form. The vaccine contains a microchip that is going to be used to monitor people via 5G network. The vaccine funded by the Bill and Melina Gates Foundation is not an adhesive patch, but a regular, injectable liquid one. There are no evidence that it contains a microchip that allows you to be tracked down on 5G networks.

Australia’s COVIDSafe app tracks users’ locations. The text message is fabricated. A spokesperson for the Australian Department of Health confirmed that the COVIDSafe app does not track users’ locations.

Madagascar has found a “coronavirus medicine” that can “wipe out the virus at any stage within a period of six days.” There is no scientific evidence to support the claim that the “coronavirus medicine” can prevent or cure COVID-19.

A video shows a Maasai tribe member in Kenya whipping people who violate the country’s curfew during the coronavirus pandemic. The video shows a comedic skit meant to raise awareness about social distancing. No media reports about the Kenyan government enlisting the Maasai tribe to enforce the country’s curfew could be found online.
Burundi had 274 cases of COVID-19 and only one death on April 30. Official figures from authority organizations indicate that as of April 30, 2020, the country had 15 cases and 1 death.
Congolese researcher Jérôme Munyangi is at the base of the discovery of COVID-Organics. The remedy that makes so many waves was developed in a research center in Madagascar.

Emmanuel Macron said the African people no longer will travel to Europe, if they refused to use the European vaccine against COVID-19. Emmanuel Macron has not said anything like this. Europe is linked to Africa by political, commercial and diplomatic agreements.
Euphorbia hirta, commonly known as the asthma plant, cures COVID-19. Researchers at the University of Ibadan recommend that the plant can be used to manage COVID-19 symptoms, but it is not a cure

The implementation of enhanced community quarantine (ECQ) in several areas nationwide will be extended until May 25. As of Friday, May 8, the government's coronavirus task force has not announced an extension of the enhanced community quarantine beyond May 15. The graphic was also manipulated.
There is a document from Ibiza’s hospital that says it is necessary to “fatten up” the figures for COVID-19 infections. The document is a new classification for sick leave.

Positive tests for SARS-Cov-2 in recovered patients have shown reinfection. The emergence of cases of COVID-19 patients who tested positive for the SARS-CoV-2 virus after days or weeks of recovery could be due to the discovery of inactive fragments of the pathogen remaining in their body, as well as "false positives ”In the results of the exams carried out. With the information known so far, based on the review that specialists carried out to the cases detected in China, Japan and South Korea, it would be premature to affirm that a second positive test for the new coronavirus strictly means reinfection.

A video showing a portable ultraviolet light lamp as a product that “removes” the coronavirus “from your devices, mask, phone” in five seconds. The ultraviolet light that works against viruses is UV-C, which must act for more than five seconds to have an effect against viruses and bacteria, and its misuse is detrimental to our health.

A viral photo displays a vial of the vaccine, with text along the top that says, “Now this was 2001 tell me why 19 years later they say there is no vaccine share before they take it down again.” Social media posts featuring a photo of a vial of canine coronavirus vaccine is legitimate, but the vaccine is for a gastrointestinal issue in dogs and has nothing to do with COVID-19.

Article claims that those who partook in the Easter communion in churches and monasteries with the “same spoon” (metaphor for the Holy Communion) did not become infected with COVID-19. It is unknown at this time whether someone from the people participating in the holy communion got infected with COVID-19. To point out that there was no increase in the number of infected people after the communion, without determining the various reasons that could lead to a decrease in the number of patients with coronavirus, and attributing it to communion, is manipulative.

COVID-19 is a pretense for lobbies to enslave and reduce the amount of people on Earth. This text contains several wrong information about COVID-19, claiming, for instance, that the virus starts being harmless after 70 days, or that testing is useless.

The use or abuse of masks can cause hypoxia. Experts point out that the tissues of the mask allow gas to pass through and oxygen is a gas, and they also point out that there is no scientific study that indicates that the use of masks or mask can produce hypoxia.

An image showing a COVID-19 vaccine created in 2001. The image shows a canine vaccine produced by the pharmaceutical company Merck Animal Health, that is called Nobivac Canine 1-Cv and it attacks a type of coronavirus that affects dogs.
Chief Secretary of West Bengal was not following relaxing while the state was performing poorly as it fought COVID-19. This image is from 2013 and is being shared with a false context.

Finally, The Washington Times admits that Sars-cov2 was created in the laboratory. The conspiracy theorists confuse the Washington Times with the Washington Post. The WT publishes the old conspiracy theories already denied about the coronavirus.
More than 100 Nurses in Jhalawar (Rajasthan, India) resigned due to COVID-19 infected Jamaatis mistreating them. The Nurses in Jhalawar resigned due to less salaries paid to them

Mumbai Police and Bengaluru Police issued Advisory claiming that incidence of robbery and kidnapping to increase after lockdown is lifted. This message has not been issued by Mumbai Police and Bengaluru Police

COVID-19 virus is spreading via air in Yangon according to laboratory test. There is no evidence of COVID-19 spreading via air in Yangon City. An official from the Ministry of Health and Sports denied the claim stating that laboratory tests were not carried out to determine the airborne transmission in Yangon CIty. WHO has reiterated that while there might be a possibility of airborne transmission in special aerosol generating procedures in hospital environments, there are no cases so far reported of airborne transmission.
Images taken of current lockdown times showing how Colombo, Sri Lanka, skies have cleared as a result of the COVID-19 curfew. Showcased images are from Manila, Philippines
TikTok has been completely banned in the United States. Several US security agencies have banned TikTok from government-issued mobile devices. However, there is not any blanket ban on it nationwide.

The Italian government is prohibiting Christian masses while it allows prayers in Islamic Mosques. In Italy, Mosques are closed like any other social or religious venue. The falsehood refers to the practice of the Adhan, which keeps being conducted in Biella as it only requires one person to be physically present.
The use or abuse of masks can cause hypoxia. There is no scientific evidence to show that the use of face masks generates hypoxia.

“The mainstream media pretended there was a deadly surge in COVID cases thanks to Wisconsinites voting.” No, the media did not “pretend there was a deadly surge inCOVID-19cases” after Wisconsin election. This news broadcast gave no evidence of its claim about errant mainstream media reporting. Our review of state and national articles about the election found no references to a “surge” or anything close to that. Reports accurately listed the number of cases potentially related to the election and the caveat that we can’t know the origin of those cases for sure. The conspiracy implied by the use of “pretended” makes this even more ridiculous, since there isn’t proof any reporting was wrong in the first place.

Number of deaths by COVID-19 fell in the state capital of Amazonas, Manaus, after the visit of the Minister of Health. As much as the official data were not published on May 3rd, numbers on May 4th show an increase of 50 deaths compared by COVID-19 in comparison to May 2nd, which belies the posts' claims.

170 million people have signed up for emergency aid against COVID-19 in Brasil. According to a note published by the Ministry of Citizenship on May 5, 97.7 million brazilians registered for the emergency aid, and only 50.5 million were considered eligible to receive the benefit.
Migrant workers travelling in special shramik trains are wasting food. The migrant workers were not wasting food. They were not eating as the food was of a very low quality.

According to this radiologist, COVID-19 is a blood disease and not a pneumonia, and therefore respirators are totally useless. This text only relies on a controversial Italian prepublication, and draws hasty and imprecise conclusions on it.

This graphics shows that the number of death in France during first trimester 2020 with COVID-19 is relatively small compared to past years. Data used in this graphics and wrongly attributed to French national institute of statistic (INSEE) are false and badly interpreted.

A video of a row between passengers and cabin crew on board a plane has been viewed tens of thousands of times in multiple Facebook and Twitter posts which claim it was filmed on an Air India flight. The posts claim the the video shows the airline failed to enforce social distancing measures during the coronavirus pandemic. The claim is false; Pakistan International Airlines said the video was taken aboard one of its flights in April 2020; the video has previously circulated in reports about a Pakistan International Airlines flight.

“Entire city of Mumbai will be under military lockdown for 10 days starting from Saturday. So please stock everything. Only milk and medicine will be available.” It was clear after reading several media reports, including a clarification made by the Mumbai Police on Twitter, about the viral claim that the state government has not fielded army personnel in Mumbai to follow the lockdown. The announcement in the Marathi language does not mention the army anywhere, but appeals to the people to stay in their homes. Also, No official announcement has been made by the state government for complete lockdown in the entire Mumbai for the next 10 days.

Former Chief Justice of India Ranjan Gogoi tweeted that to compensate the economic loss occured due to coronavirus, no elections should be held in the country for the next 10 years because elections cost a lot of money. Ranjan Gogoi does not have a Twitter handle. He has made no such statement.

Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan read the COVID-19 curve upside down and said that it is flattening. News agency IANS picked the article from a satire website The Dependent. There is no truth to this claim.

Message claiming that the city of Mumbai will be under the military lockdown for the next 10 days to contain the spread of COVID-19 virus, and that only milk and medicine will be available during this time. The Mumbai police have termed the message to be a 'rumour' and clarified that the army is not being called out to the city. Mumbai government has also debunked the claim and clarifired that no army/navy personnel is being deployed for maintianing law and order in the city.

Video of passengers complaining about the overcharged tickets and the lack of social distancing measures on an Air India flight run by the Indian government to bring back its citizens stranded in foreign countries during COVID-19 crisis. The incident in the video took place on the Karachi-Toronto flight of Pakistan International Airlines. The video was not shot in an AIr India flight.
U.S. Vice President Mike Pence delivered empty boxes of PPE to a hospital as a publicity stunt. The clip in this Kimmel show mocking Pence was edited and taken out of context.

Ventura County public health director say that the California county will be forcibly moving people infected with COVID-19 out of their homes into quarantine. Department of Health confirmed to LeadStories this was a misunderstanding of an order that would offer housing to people in need.
President Trump sent out a tweet that included the phrase “Oldies will have to die” in connection with lifting coronavirus restrictions. The tweet came from a clear satire website.
A card claiming to exempt the holder from wearing a face mask in public the real deal, sanctioned by the government. Neither the DOJ nor ADA have circilated information confirming this.

Multiple Facebook posts shared tens of thousands of times claim that Thailand has “ranked no. 1 in the COVID-19 fight category” based on an international health security index. The posts add Thailand has the “lowest number of infected cases at present”. The claims, however, are misleading; the index cited in the posts, the Global Health Security (GHS) Index, was published months before the COVID-19 pandemic; Thailand also does not have the lowest number of COVID-19 infections in Asia or worldwide, according to multiple international authorities.

Multiple Facebook posts shared tens of thousands of times claim that Thailand has “ranked no. 1 in the COVID-19 fight category” based on an international health security index. The posts add Thailand has the “lowest number of infected cases at present”. The claims, however, are misleading; the index cited in the posts, the Global Health Security (GHS) Index, was published months before the COVID-19 pandemic; Thailand also does not have the lowest number of COVID-19 infections in Asia or worldwide, according to multiple international authorities.

Text in Lithuanian excerpted from a letter claims WHO measures are a genocide and pandemic isn’t real. There are no proof to claim that pandemic isn't real. In fact, according to the WHO, 3,517,345 cases of coronavirus and 243,401 deaths were confirmed worldwide when this post was published, on 5 May.

Says wearing face masks is more harmful to your health than going without one. There’s no evidence that wearing standard masks, such as surgical masks or ones made of fabric, is harmful to the general public. Some people with preexisting respiratory conditions may be at risk with prolonged use of tight-fitting masks, like N95 respirators. Those masks aren’t recommended for the general public.
This video of the French education minister answering a TV interview from its water closet is authentic. The video is a fake, made by a humoristic website.

There are dozens of posts on Facebook and Twitter that list a number of plants and foods that purportedly contain “natural azithromycin.” These claims went viral amid studies being done on azithromycin as a possible treatment against COVID-19. Azithromycin is a synthetic drug that is not found naturally in any of the foods listed. Furthermore, neither azithromycin nor any other drug or food has been proven effective in curing COVID-19.
A deer can be seen playing on a beach, user has claimed that this happened during the coronavirus lockdown in India. This is a video from France that has no relation with the lockdown.

Citizens of Kazakhstan and Russia will not be able to get a Schengen visa without using being chipped. The first site to publish this was panorama.pub, which has been well-known to our readers for a long time. The satirical publication is professionally engaged in creating fakes. And under each article there is a disclaimer that the news is made up.
Mass SARS-Cov-2 testing does more harm than good. Mass testing for the new coronavirus is not harmful to public health.
Nurses resigned due to COVID-19 because Jamati patients misbehaved with them. The nurses resigned due to low wage, no Jamati has been admitted to the hospital.
Eating meat products increases the risk of coronavirus, according to a WHO official quoted in the text. There is no evidence that meat causes coronavirus and the WHO official was misquoted.

“Entire city of Mumbai will be under military lockdown for 10 days starting from Saturday. So please stock everything. Only milk and medicine will be available.” It was clear after reading several media reports, including a clarification made by the Mumbai Police on Twitter, about the viral claim that the state government has not fielded army personnel in Mumbai to follow the lockdown. The announcement in the Marathi language does not mention the army anywhere, but appeals to the people to stay in their homes. Also, No official announcement has been made by the state government for complete lockdown in the entire Mumbai for the next 10 days.

The new coronavirus can be sexually transmitted A study done at China's Shangqiu Hospital showed the presence of the SARS-CoV-2 virus in the semen of patients suffering from or starting to recover from COVID-19. By republishing this news, some portals in the region reported that the virus was found in the semen of cured men, and some even “interpreted” it as evidence that the virus was transmitted sexually.

Supermarket chain, Melcom is giving out GH₵ 2,000 gift cards to every Ghanaian in response to COVID-19. Melcom has issued a disclaimer. Also, GhanaFact checks showed the link with the offer takes users to an unsigned cloned website of Melcom, which makes users vulnerable to data theft including credit card details, account login information and any other sensitive information.

If a person who is infected with the coronavirus doesn’t wear a face mask and someone who isn’t infected does wear one, this last person has a 70 per cent chance of being infected. When both parties wear a face mask, those chances are lowered to 1,5 per cent. The image offers a faulty interpretation of how face masks work. Face masks obstruct droplets of saliva and aerosoles (small particles of dust or liquid that float around in the air), through which the virus can spread. However, the effect of face mask usage in daily life depends on its correct use and other circumstances. Research on the effectivity of these face masks shows that the effects of usage are probably a lot smaller than the percentages shown in the viral image.

Coronavirus lives on the hands for 10 minutes, so putting a sanitizer in the pocket meets the purpose of prevention: UNICEF. The viral post attributed to UNICEF claiming that coronavirus survives in hands for 10 minutes is misleading. Though it is a good practice to keep a sanitizer along and clean your hands but there is no evidence that coronavirus stays in hands for 10 minutes. Also, the viral post is not issued by UNICEF.
Indian nurses resigned due to COVID-19 infected Jamati patients misbehavior. The nurses resigned due to low wages, not because of patients behavior.

Ghana’s electoral commission has postponed the 2020 elections to 2023 due to coronavirus. Ghana's Electoral Commission has dismissed the claim. Meanwhile the online platform in a disclaimer says all news articles it produces are "fiction and presumably fake news.”

A picture shows an eight-year-old boy infected with coronavirus. Prayers and shares on Facebook will help him. The viral picture has been circulating on the Internet for over one year. It has nothing to do with coronavirus.
Deepika Padukone was buying liquor during the lockdown in India as soon as the shops opened. It was another Indian actress Rakul Preet Singh who had stepped out to buy medicines during the lockdown.

Indian News wire agency IANS claims that Pakistani PM Imran Khan read an overturned graph and claimed that Pakistan was flattening its curve. The article that IANS picked up was a satire article from a Pakistani website called 'The Dependent'.

Wearing masks for a long period of time can cause hypoxia. To cause hypoxia, a mask would have to be tightly sealed. Ordinary masks are not tightly sealed, so fresh air does come inside it. Some professional masks are, but precisely because of that they have an air filter.

Adelio Bispo de Oliveira, a man who stabbed Bolsonaro back in 2018, has contracted COVID-19 while in jail. There are no COVID-19 suspect or confirmed cases in the Campo Grande Federal Prison, where he's currently imprisoned.

While COVID-19 tests on sick people take from 10 to 20 days to show results, on dead people the results are given instantly. This not true, and possibly a confusion due to the fact daily statistics include a grand total of COVID-19 deaths. Actually, this figure represents the number of deaths that were registered in a day, not the number of deaths that occured in that very day.

Barack Obama, former President of the United States, said that criminals shouldn’t have rights. There are no written or audiovisual records that the former President of the United States has said the phrase attributed to him.

A video claiming that COVID-19 only kills people who already had other diseases and treatment can be done at home with antibiotics. The statement is based on a study by Giampaolo Palma with 50 autopsies at Pope John XXIII Hospital in Bergamo, Italy. The study does not exist, as well as any scientific article signed by "Giampaolo Palma". Experts say that is no cure for COVID-19, and that there is no scientific evidence that patients in severe conditions can be treated at home with antibiotics. Data shows that COVID-19 kills people without other previous diseases.

100 nurses in Rajasthan’s Jhalawar (India) resigned because of Jamaatis who misbehaved with them. It is true that the nurses had resigned but not because of Jamaatis but alleging low wages, poor working conditions and no protective equipment for the ones working with COVID-19 patients.

Messages linking scientist Bing Liu’s death to “very significant findings” about the coronavirus he was supposedly about to make at the University of Pittsburgh. Police in Ross Township (Pittsburgh), where the event occurred, assure that it is due to a "long dispute over an intimate partner" and not to the scientist's work.

An SMS service offers a COVID-19 self-assessment. The page to which you send the SMS impersonates the Spanish Ministry of Health and the Carlos III Health Institute. It is a fraudulent page that encourages you to perform a test through a link that could download a virus to your device.

Drinking sea water prevents the spread of COVID-19. Drinking seawater could cause diarrhea, and gastrointestinal infections from parasites, bacteria, fungi, and viruses that are in seawater. In conclusion, it is harmful to health.

For a couple of weeks, an advertising image has been shared on WhatsApp inviting you to buy a supposed homeopathic medicine for the new coronavirus, developed in the city of Barranquilla. The alleged doctor who developed it is not accredited to practice the profession in Colombia. And the supposed laboratory where the homeopathic substance was "tested" does not exist.
Coronavirus is spreading in the air of Yangon, Myanmar. We contacted and interviewed to the spoke person of Ministry of Health and he answered it is not true.

Lacoteferrin prevents and helps prevent coronavirus. A laboratory paid for advertorials on one of its products as an effective treatment against pandemic disease, but the alleged evidence it presents does not prove it.
Prolonged use of face masks causes hypoxia. Surgical, fabric and N95 face masks allow carbon dioxide to pass through. Misusing this implement can increase the chances of contagion.

The Colombian national statistics department published a map of the number of people infected with the coronavirus per block. The entity denied the information on its social media accounts. The map they published really locates the vulnerability index by blocks of the population that can have more complications in case of contagion.

Two doctors in Bakersfield, California said at a press conference that isolation measures affect the immune system and that unrestrictive controls in countries like Sweden have worked. The medical community has proven that doctors' claims are false

The liquid squeezed from or a tea brewed of Siam weed, or Chromolaena odorata, is the cure for the novel coronavirus, according to Nigerian prophetess Dupe Oluwaniyi. There is no scientific evidence that Siam weed cures COVID-19, and no evidence that any current medicine can prevent or cure the disease, according to the World Health Organization.

A Facebook page claims that the Federal Government has announced Monday 1st of June 2020 as a resumption date for all schools in Nigeria. There is no scheduled date/day for resumption yet. If there is, the expectation will be for the government to publish the information in more accessible media channels for citizens.

A graphic purportedly shows a news bulletin about an alleged extension of a COVID-19 lockdown in the Philippines until May 30, 2020, has been shared repeatedly in multiple Facebook posts claiming to reference a government announcement. The claim is false; the date on the graphic has been digitally altered; the Phillipine news organisation that published the original graphic condemned the doctored image as “fake news”; as of May 10, the Philippine government has not announced any further COVID-19 lockdown extensions after May 15.

A widely-circulated image claims to reveal the ingredients contained in this year’s flu shots. The alleged ingredients include mercury, antifreeze, phenol, animal blood, animal viruses, and formaldehyde. Trace amounts of formaldehyde are present in flu vaccines authorized in the US this year, and the mercury-based product thimerosal is present in some of them. The photo’s list of ingredients is misleading and mostly inaccurate.
Drinking coffee can be beneficial against the coronavirus. No scientific evidence supports that coffee or any other food prevents or cures COVID-19.

The Spanish Social Security sends emails to some taxpayers to reimburse 345 euros. It is a scam attempt, a "phishing" case in which cyber criminals impersonate Social Security identity to access the victim's bank account.
“Dr. Fauci sat on Microsoft’s board of directors.” Microsoft says Anthony Fauci never served on the company’s board.

The government and Bill Gates have overshadowed the social profiles of De Donno, the doctor who experiments with plasma treatment in the Mantua hospital. Matteo Salvini: “Whoever touches Bill Gates’ business disappears”. Dr. De Donno had suspended his social accounts because he was unable to work in peace. His Facebook page had been suspended by an administrator.
A Sadhu (Sage) in Jaipur, India infected around 300 people by sharing Chilam. The District Collector of Jaipur has clarified that the viral news is Fake.

Image of water falling from a mountain range to a main road claiming to be Haputale – Beragala road, Sri Lanka, along with an invitation to travelers to visit the location once the curfew period is over. The image location is Malshej Ghat in India.

Violence against women in confinement by COVID-19 has not escalated, according to Mexican president Andrés Manuel López Obrador. The number of alleged female victims of intentional homicide, corruption of minors, trafficking and extortion have registered an increase in March 2020 (when the measures to contain COVID-19 were started), compared to the same month of 2019, according to the Last report of the Executive Secretariat of the National Public Security System (SESNSP) .Family violence and gender violence in all its forms other than family violence, according to SESNSP reports, registered increases of 23.4% and 100.7% respectively.

In the United States, a scientist who was developing a vaccine for coronavirus was killed. Bing Liu (full name: Bingfeng Liu) is not a virologist and did not work on the SARS-Cov-2 vaccine. He was investigating the effects of the virus on the body, as is evident from the University of Pittsburgh statement. Liu's specialty is autoimmune diseases, various tumors, cancer immunotherapy and T-cell work, as we can understand from his profile on the University's website and from the list of papers in which he participated. Police have found no evidence that this tragic event has anything to do with employment at the University of Pittsburgh, any work being done at the University of Pittsburgh, or the current health crisis. Although this is the impression that may be formed from some publications in the media and blogs.

“The CDC has recommended mail in voting. That’s what this whole pandemic is about: the election!”. The CDC recommended in March many ways voters could minimize contact with other people, including voting by mail. The CDC also recommended ways that in-person voting sites could adjust to the pandemic, such as encouraging early voting, drive-up voting and voting at off-peak times. Research shows that the virus’ genetic makeup precludes it from being man-made and, as such, there is no indication that the pandemic’s origin is in any way tied to American elections.

Coffins unearthed from a cemetery in Brazilian city of Belo Horizonte contained stones and pieces of wood instead of bodies, which highlights the farce of COVID-19 deaths. The city government denied the claim and the author of the recording also acknowledged that what he said was false. In the city, burials are carried out by presenting a death certificate or burial guide issued by a notary.

COVID-19 should not be treated with mechanical ventilators, only with antibiotics. So far, there is no indication of antibiotics (which fight diseases caused by bacteria) in the treatment of COVID-19. The text still contradicts the protocols of WHO and the Brazilian Ministry of Health regarding the use of respirators.

Mortality statistics over the past 5 years show there is no overmortality and no pandemic. The figures are right but the comparison doesn't stand. The data is provisional and on a time period that doesn't cover the pandemic.

A graphic shows the enhanced community quarantine in several provinces and cities in the Philippines has been extended until May 25. There has been no new announcement from authorities of a further extension of the ECQ, which was first imposed on Luzon last March 16 and extended till April 30.
Jimmy Kimmel tweeted a video which said VP Mike Pence carried empty PPE boxes. This video was manipulated to suggest Pence acrried empty boxes but he was joking. Kimmel apologized.

Image claims that the Soriana supermarket in Mexico closes the weekend due to a health emergency due to COVID-19. The image was not authorized by the supermarket company. Through a statement, the company Soriana reported that all its stores will continue to operate normally, with the exception of those located in Tabasco on May 9 and 10, clarified that its regular service is provided throughout Mexico.

Three videos have been viewed tens of thousands of times in multiple posts on Facebook alongside a claim they show people who died after contracting the novel coronavirus in India. The claim is false; the videos show the victims of a major gas leak at a chemical plant in India in May 2020.

A video has been viewed more than 100,000 times in multiple Facebook posts that claim to show a 5G mast burning in the Italian city of La Spezia. The claim is misleading; the video in fact shows a transmission tower in La Spezia with only 3G and 4G antenna; as of May 13, 2020, 5G has not been rolled out in the northwestern Italian city.

Multiple Facebook, Twitter and Instagram posts shared hundreds of times claim that wearing a face mask for an extended period of time could cause hypercapnia, a condition caused by a buildup of carbon dioxide in the blood. The claim is misleading; health experts in Thailand have said that as of May 2020, there is no evidence that wearing a mask for a long period can cause hypercapnia.

A video has been viewed more than 100,000 times in multiple Facebook posts that claim to show a 5G mast burning in the Italian city of La Spezia. The claim is misleading; the video in fact shows a transmission tower in La Spezia with only 3G and 4G antenna; as of May 13, 2020, 5G has not been rolled out in the northwestern Italian city.

Muslim women were caught shopping in lockdown. After closely studying the claim that is going viral on social media, we found that this video is from Karachi, Pakistan. The building that shows men and women jumping from the balcony is a 2015 video. The viral video has nothing to do with the coronavirus or India.

“Since the reopening of (the state of Georgia), we’ve seen our COVID rate skyrocket by 40%.” Stacey Abrams said after reopening, Georgia’s COVID-19 rate went up 40%. In fact, the number of cases fell 12% compared with the same period before reopening. It will take more time before the impact of reopening shows up in the data.

Video shows Army trucks carrying medecine and safety equipment sent from federal government to state government in Pará, Brazil. Trucks were carrying provisions for army headquarters. Operation had nothing to do with the COVID-19 pandemic.

Video of women fleeing from a quarantine center during the current lockdown in Shivaji nagar, Bangalore. The video was taken in Karachi (Pakistan) and it is not related to the current lockdown in India. The same video was found to be uploaded on YouTube and Facebook in 2015 with the title: ‘Sex workers fleeing after FIA raid at a brothel in Karachi’.

Judy Mikovits’ claims about COVID-19 origins, flu vaccine,  hydroxychloroquine and face masks from the documentary Plandemic retold in FB post. Mikovits' claims are ungrounded and without a scientific evidence.

“States like New York, Illinois and California have been vocal in their demands for funding to bail out their pension systems, which were failing long before the COVID-19 outbreak, and other programs that aren’t related to this crisis.” New York's pension system is one of the best-funded in the nation and has not asked for federal funds. Illinois' pension fund is one of the worst-funded in the nation, while California is about average. Economic shutdowns related to the pandemic have severely diminished tax revenues, which pay for many state services.
A new danger is coming: Asian hornets has killed 28 people in China. This blog entry is a copy paste of a 2013 article.

A video has been viewed thousands of times in multiple posts on Facebook and Twitter which claim it shows that US President Donald Trump tested positive for the novel coronavirus. The claim is false; the video has been edited from a Fox News report about one of Trump’s valets testing positive for COVID-19 published on May 7, 2020.
Claim that the coronavirus isn’t new as there is a canine coronavirus vaccine since 2001. Canine coronavirus and its vaccine are not related to human coronaviruses, including SARS-CoV-2.
Image claiming that Polish Church will get 4,6 billion zlotys from the government due to the coronavirus. It was denied by the government and Church officials.

In Tanzania, papaya, motor oil or a goat were tested positive for the coronavirus, according to president Magufuli. This shows that the PCR tests is very unrealiable. It is unclear which type of test was used. In general, infections of fruit or animals are highly unlikely. A positive test may also occur when the virus is present because of contamination. Experts in Germany say the PCR test is very reliable and false positive results are almost impossible
One can cure the new coronavirus by inhaling vodka fumes. There is no evidence that this is a working treatment. Moreover, trying this treatment on oneself it is potentially dangerous.

The novel coronavirus does not attach itself to disposable gloves. Wearing gloves is not a foolproof way to avoid infection. As soon as you touch an infected object, viruses can stick to your hands, whether you are wearing gloves or not. The virus cannot enter through the hands, only through the mouth and nose.
People in Chandni Chowk market are breaking COVID-19 lockdown because of Eid. Video is from Surat and has no relation with lockdown in Delhi.

Muslim women were caught shopping in lockdown. After closely studying the claim that is going viral on social media, we found that this video is from Karachi, Pakistan. The building that shows men and women jumping from the balcony is a 2015 video. The viral video has nothing to do with the coronavirus or India.

A viral photo displays a vial of the vaccine, with text along the top that says, “Now this was 2001 tell me why 19 years later they say there is no vaccine share before they take it down again.” Social media posts featuring a photo of a vial of canine coronavirus vaccine is legitimate, but the vaccine is for a gastrointestinal issue in dogs and has nothing to do with COVID-19.

Self-medicate COVID-19 using a home remedy with aspirin, lemon and honey. One should never consume medicine without doctors recommendation. The purporting home remedy is no cure or treatment for COVID-19.
The trucks shown in the video are carrying dead bodies of COVID-19 victims. These trucks aren’t carrying the bodies of COVID-19 victims; instead they are carrying beds for patients.

The former French ministry of Health (Agnès Buzyn) treated a famous movie producer (Raymond Blumenthal) with hydroxychloroquine. The producer indeed received Hydroxychloroquine. But the former ministry did not gave it to him (even if she was working in the same hospital).

A post, claiming that Switzerland, Ukraine, Czech Republic and Turkey left the “coronavirus project”. A Facebook post claimed that unlike Lithuania, Turkey, Ukraine, Czechia and Switzerland left the "coronavirus project" a.k.a ended quarantine. The post also claimed that countries "left the project" because unidetified organizations refused to pay them. However, official sources from said countries claim that qarantine measures are being eased, not terminated. The same is being done in Lithuania.

A video showing two men claiming that they were forced to change their mother’s death certificate from heart failure to COVID-19 in Guarulhos, state of São Paulo, Brazil. Posts claim fraud in statistics City hall and victim's family sources say the COVID-19 exam was finished after the time of death and the result was positive. So the change is the standard procedure. Notification is mandatory in Brazil.

A video from China, showing police officers with protective gear arresting a citizen who refuses to get out of his car. The video actually shows Chinese Police officers while they are arresting a citizen at a check point, but it was a practice session. The arrest was not real.

A video where Bill Gates is alledgely stating that vaccines are useful to sterilize and reduce the world population. According to Bill Gates vaccines would not "sterilize" the population, but rather they would help reducing the child mortality rate. Some theories (such as the child survival hypothesis) claim that this would eventually lead to a decrease in the world population.
Aromatherapy prevents the spread of COVID-19. There is no evidence that aromatherapy strengthens the defenses to prevent the spread of COVID-19.
Gargling with salt or vinegar water cures the coronavirus. The World Health Organization denied that gargling with water and salt or vinegar cures the coronavirus.
Fever is a necessary symptom to detect a coronavirus patient. The WHO and other health authorities do not identify a specific symptom to recognize a possible case of coronavirus.

Ozone serves as a disinfectant against COVID-19. Dr. Alejandro Macias, infectious medicine internist and professor at the University of Guanajuato, said that there is no conclusive evidence to show that ozone serves as a disinfectant against COVID-19.

A photo of Alberto Fernández with businessmen during the quarantine without respecting social distance. The published photo is not current nor was it taken during the period of social, preventive and compulsory isolation, but was taken on December 18, 2019.
Kenya is the first African country to receive a COVID-19 vaccine from the United Kingdom. The government has not announced any vaccine against COVID-19.

Video shows migrant going to their home states from Maharashtra, India, throwing food packets on the railway platform. The video is not from Maharashtra. It is from West Bengal. Migrants threw food packets because it was stale.

An Indian news channel claimed that coronavirus pandemic would affect 1.6 billion laborers in India. The screenshot of the news is being taken out of context. The news report, in reality, was talking about the 1.6 billion laborers of the World, not just India.

A video clip shows the hanging bodies of a mother and child who have committed suicide in Gujarat because they did not have food during the current COVID-19  lockdown. Gujarat Police have clarified that the video not from Gujarat. The video was also making rounds in Bangladesh a month before.
Video: Americans singing Indian National Anthem thanking India for giving hydroxychloroquine. The video is an old video shot by an Indian Youtuber and it is not related to COVID-19.

COVID-19 deaths in the Brazilian state of Amazonas fell after visit of new minister of Health. The minister's visit to the state occurred on May 3rd, when the Amazonas' government did not disclose the death data. On May 4, 36 deaths from the new coronavirus disease were reported — 11 more than on Saturday (2nd). On Tuesday (5th), the state announced another 65 deaths, 29 more than the previous day.

Popular chain store Penneys – also known as Primark – is reopening in Ireland on May 8th. Penneys is not reopening on June 8th in Ireland. The message is fake. The earliest that the chain store could open under the government roadmap is June 29th.

People held a ‘street party’ in Dublin on 1 May. The video was recorded at the beginning of April, not in early May. Further, while it is described as a street party, organisers say the event was supervised by police and social distancing was observed throughout.
People are pillaging a bank in Colombia as an effect of the lockdown. The video was recorded in November of 2019.

The President of Mexico, Andrés Manuel López Obrador, says that violence against women has not increased in lockdown by COVID-19 Emergency calls related to incidents of violence against women increased by 60.7% in March 2020 in the middle of COVID-19, compared to the similar month of 2019. Reports from the Executive Secretariat of the National Security System Public expose that gender violence in all modalities increased in crimes from 147 to 295, in March 2020 (when measures to stop COVID-19 began in Mexico), compared to the same month of 2019. The Secretary General of The United Nations, António Guterres, has recognized an alarming increase in violence against women worldwide.

Women of Shaheen Bagh, in Delhi, India caught red-handed carrying out a prostitution operation during the lockdown This is a 5 year old video from Karachi, in Pakistan, where women were seen running out a massage parlor that was raided. This is neither linked to the Shaheed Bagh incident nor to the lockdown in India.

Bangalore (India) police commissioner has warned people to be careful as incidents of thefts and kidnappings will be on the rise once the nationwide lockdown lifts. Bangalore police confirmed that they had not shared any such messages.

170 million people are receiving the COVID-19 monthly allowance paid by the Brazilian Federal government. According to Caixa Econômica Federal, 51 million people are registered to receive the allowance.

Video of an elderly woman, struggling to breathe, lying over what seems to be a plastic bag. According to the post, she was inside a bag at a hospital morgue and was rescued by her relatives. The woman was not inside a plastic bag. She was actually lying over a plastic sheet used to switch immobilized patients from one bed to another. Unfortunately, the woman actually passed away on May 5.

UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson met reporters after recovering from COVID-19. The video dates back to August 2018 when Boris Johnson, who was not the prime minister of UK, had offered tea to the reporters while avoiding questions about the then burqa row.

Use of air conditioning will be banned in Turkey because it increases the spread of the new coronavirus. There are some studies showing that the use of air conditioner increases the risk of COVID-19 propagation. However, its ban was not on the agenda as of May 7, 2020.

A fake Twitter account shared a video posted on November 21, 2019, the day the Colombian national strike began, as if it were current. The video was posted by the @ievyrincon account, which is described as a "Fake account" and masquerades as @levyrincon (taking advantage of the similarity between the uppercase "i" and the lowercase "l"), a left-wing influencer.

Four images have gone viral on social networks with the message:“Killed by COVID-19 thrown into the water in Ecuador would be causing fish deaths in Peru (Strong images). CHIMBOTE FISHERMEN MAKE SURE THE WATERS ARE CONTAMINATED AND ALERT TO NOT EATING FOOD FROM THE SEA ”. Three of the photos are from a shipwreck in Libya in 2014 and another is from Ecuador, but from 2017.
A video shows British Prime Minister Boris Johnson serving journalists tea after recovering from COVID-19. The video was taken in August 2018 and is unrelated to Johnson’s recovery from COVID-19.

Video of Chinese workers in Morowali protesting during the COVID-19 pandemic. The demonstration in the video did indeed take place at PT IMIP, Morowali, Central Sulawesi. However, the demonstration was held by local workers who are members of five trade unions in the area of PT IMIP, not by Chinese TKA on January 24, 2019

There are SARS-CoV-2 fragments found in non-potable water. Fragments or traces of the genetic code (RNA) of the SARS-CoV-2 virus found in non-potable waters (residual or used in irrigation) of European cities such as Paris and Rome do not represent a source of contagion for people who may have any contact with them.
