The CARES Act was introduced in January 2019, which proves the COVID-19 pandemic was planned in advance. The CARES Act was introduced March 25 as a substitute amendment, replacing the title and language of an older, unrelated bill.

Video saying that medical complications created by the virus are unexpected for a virus, therefore,anti-inflammatories are the solution. Those complications are well-known. Anti-inflammatories and antibiotics are well-used in those cases. But it tells nothing about the "why" of those complications or how they could be avoided. The video is only based on 1 observation and 2 opinions.

An image claimed that the Bill Gates vaccination program “deformed and ruined the lives of people in Africa.” The photograph of 3 children in blue t-shirts and blue shorts using crutches does not show any consequences of vaccination. On the contrary, the children in the photograph contracted polio, a disease that can be prevented by immunization.

When the COVID-19 vaccine is introduced, microchips will also be introduced into the human body, then 5G networks will come into play, through which the world’s elite will send various signals to nanochips that have settled in human organisms. They will want to send such a signal that only the a “Golden” billion will remain on Earth. The idea of introducing chips into the human body in general is not news, not a secret, but quite openly conducted by a number of scientific experiments aimed at possible" improvement " of a person with the help of technology. Mobile phones are a much more convenient tracking tool than chips, simply because they are more energy-intensive. It is these devices that should be feared from the point of view of privacy, and not the mythical "secretly implanted" nanochips. Nanovaccines and nanochips are completely different things. Nanochips cannot be controlled with 5G.

The number of coronavirus patients in the country can reach close to 30 million by August 15. Central Indian government is warning states. During the search, it was revealed that Cabinet Secretary Rajiv Gaba has discussed further strategies on lockdown including basic problems like the country's economy, civil security, prevention on coronavirus. There is no doubt that coronavirus cases are increasing rapidly in many states of the country. But there is no evidence anywhere that the cabinet secretary has told the states that by August 15, the number of coronavirus patients in the country will be 30 million.

American president Donald Trump announced that tests of injection of disinfectant to fight against the new coronavirus will begin in Africa. The American president has recently alluded to this method - which has moreover been very criticized - to combat COVID-19, he did not say that tests will begin in Africa.

Professor Tasuku Honjo, Nobel Laureate 2018 Medicine, supports the theory that the coronavirus is not natural and was invented by China. The words lent to the Japanese professor are invented and are far from the truth. He refuted the statement himself.
Video shows that social distancing is not being followed in Delhi. The video is from Surat, Gujarat where social distancing norms during the lockdown were not followed and is not from Delhi.
Photos taken in an open-air drug market in São Paulo show a crowd and people are not affected by COVID-19. All the pictures were taken in 2017 or 2018.

Photo shows that coffins are being buried empty in the brazilian state of Amazonas. The record, which has been used to suggest that the Amazonas state is inflating the death toll from the COVID-19 pandemic, was made in May 2017 in São Carlos (city of the São Paulo state) during a Civil Police investigation into life insurance fraud.

WHO has guidelines that encourage child masturbation. The misinformation was created by distorting excerpts from a document in the European section of the organization with guidelines for educators to act if questioned by students on sexual education topics, including masturbation. The guidelines, therefore, are not directed at children or encourage practice.

Ivermectin cures COVID-19. There is no scientific evidence that the drug, used against worms and parasites, cures an infection caused by the new coronavirus. None of the researches that study the effects of the drug has yet proved it can be effective in treating COVID-19. In addition, the woman that appears in the video claiming she was cured of the disease by using ivermectin doesn't provide any tests to prove she had the inffection or that she was cured of it.

Poem written in 1869 by Kathleen O’Meara predicted the pandemic of COVID-19. The real autor is a former professor from Winsconsin named Catherine O'Meara. She wrote it in March 13th, 2020, on her personal blog

Helder Barbalho, governo of Brazilian state of Pará, hides hydroxychloroquine in warehouse in order not to give to population and let people die. The photo used in the rumor was posted by the governor itself and shows the medicine acquired by the government to be delivered to hospitals. States's government says all the medicine acquired were held out as demanded
The White House is selling coins commemorating the COVID-19 pandemic. Commemorative coins are being sold by a private company not affiliated with the White House.

Coronavirus was invented and patented by researchers at the Pirbright Institute in 2018. This patent has nothing to do with the current coronavirus. It is for an avian virus, which infects poultry, and another which infects pigs.

Claim that a Japanese Nobel Prize-winning scientist said coronavirus is unnatural and man-made. This message is fake. Professor Tasuku Honjo never said this. He has described the message as "false accusations and misinformation".

Indian Police fighting with villagers who protested against the entry of a corpse to the village, suspected to be of a COVID-19 patient. The photos represent an protest in Kanpur, India in 2019 against the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) and are not related with COVID-19 outbreak

Kerala, India, minister K.T Jaleel still draws his salary as teacher even after quitting his job 14 years ago. The minister has clarified that he has not taken salary after retiring as a Professor to pursue politics and also provided the testimony of the principal of the college, where he was teaching.
Chlorine dioxyde is the cure for COVID-19. Chlorine dioxide can actually be dangerous for the health acording to FDA (Foods and Drugs Administration).

Supreme Court of India has banned everyone except the Government to share any message about the coronavirus. The government of India has clarified that such messages are false. SC has not given any such order.

A video of a young man from Gujarat claiming he has found a medicine that cures COVID-19. Gujarat Police has arrested the young man for misleading the public with a false claim about the medicine on COVID-19.

Surgical masks whose price has been limited to 0,96 cents do not comply with the EU regulation. In April, the Spanish Agency for Medicines and Healthcare Products regulated the manufacture and marketing of these types of health safety elements to meet demand.

There are “15 minors admitted” because of COVID-19 in the Infanta Sofía Hospital in Madrid and three in the “Talavera hospital”. The press department of the Hospital Infanta Sofía in Madrid and the Ministry of Health of Castilla la Mancha explain that there are no minors admitted in those hospitals because of COVID-19.

Madagascar does not have any cases of the coronavirus On April 16, Madagascar had reported 117 coronavirus cases to the World Health Organization (WHO). The nation has 128 cases at the time of publication.

South African President Cyril Ramaphosa asked all foreigners to leave the country by June 21 in response to the spread of COVID-19. South African officials have debunked the claim. The country will start reopening on May 1.

The video shows the FBI seizing coronavirus-infected face masks sent from China. The video shows the FBI seizing masks from a man who was allegedly stockpiling medical-grade masks and other equipment for a price gouging scheme.

Hydroxychloroquine “cures COVID-19” but there is a conspiracy by Biil Gates and Dr. Fauci to ban it. There is no evidence that Bill Gates and Anthony Fauci are conspiring in order to "hide" hydroxycloroquine.

A WhatsApp audio claims that the Infanta Sofía Hospital in Madrid has 15 children in serious condition due to COVID-19, and that there are three other children in the Talavera de la Reina Hospital. The doctor to whom the audio is attributed assures that he did not record it and the hospitals deny having children as patients because of COVID-19.

Bollywoof actor Aamir Khan has anonymously donated Rs 15,000 to people living in a slum. Speaking to The Quint, the actor's PR team refuted the claim. Later the actor took to Twitter to clarify that he hasn't done anything like this.

Screenshot showing that Rodríguez Larreta, head of government of the City of Buenos Aires, published a tweet against the “Hospital de Clínicas”. There is a publication circulating that shows an image of a supposed tweet published in the official account of Rodríguez Larreta, where it is stated: “Holding the Hospital de Clínicas when our citizens have health insurance programs is absurd. Investing so much money for those who come from the suburbs is an expense that does not make sense. ” This is false: the tweet belongs to a fake account.

In Argentina, an unemployed mother with 5 children received $ 41,015 in social plans in April. The data that is published in the circulating image and that refer to the month of April mixes benefits that were perceived in 2 different months.
In Brazil, people driving without masks will be given traffic tickets. No law has been approved forcing people to wear masks while driving.

Petrobras, a Brazilian petrol company, will be giving free gasoline to essential workers. You need to fill up a form to be elligible. This is a phishing scam. Petrobras is not offering free gasoline to anyone, the website where you fill out the form is not official.

A picture shows the Ibirapuera Gymnasium temporary hospital, in São Paulo, empty. The pictures were actually in Santo André. The temporary Ibirapuera Hospital received its first patients two days after the fact-check was published. Also, it is set on a tent on a football field right next to the gymnasium, not inside it.

Coffins of alleged COVID-19 victims were unearthed in Belo Horizonte, Brazil. There were only rocks inside. There is not a single record of any COVID-19 patient coffin being unearthed in Belo Horizonte.

Video of a mob in Marabá, Brazil, shouting at a man driving a backhoe. On the caption, it is stated that this man was opening graves for empty coffins. The video and the situation are real, but the man was not opening mass graves for empty coffins. He was doing ordinary construction work at a local cemitery.

A video of a teleconference between Rui Costa, governor of Bahia, Brazil, and the mayor from Porto Seguro. In the caption, it is stated that the governor asked the mayor to artificially increase the number of COVID-19 patients to 200, so she would get more money. The video is real and was published by the mayor of Porto Seguro herself on March 23. The governor doesn't ask her to artificially increase the number of victims.

A picture shows two man holding a coffin. The caption says that, if the coffin was full, they would not be able to lift it. The victim is real. She was a 67-year-old woman named Esther Melo da Silva, from Manaus, Brazil, and she died of COVID-19. We managed to interview her son in law. The picture was originally published by an independent news outlet called Amazônia Real. They published Esther's story. She was unable to find adequate care for 5 days before she passed away.

People come to your house, offer you to try a mask, which is in fact full of chemicals. This gets you asleep and these people rob you. It is an old rumor that spreads worldwide. A previous version of the rumor mentioned bottles of perfume instead of masks. We haven't found any actual situation in which this "technique" was used.

A teacher died in Eastern France after she had to take care of health workers’ children, who contaminated her with COVID-19. Someone close to the allegedly dead teacher wanted to hurt her. So he told her acquaintances and friends she was dead. These people believed him and spread the word before to correct themselves.

Professor Dr Tasuku Honjo, caused a sensation today in the media by saying that the coronavirus is not natural. Incorrect. Professor Honjo has denied saying this and there is no evidence that he ever did.
Brasilian doctor discovered a cure for COVID-19. Is is false that a Brazilian doctor discovered a treatment or a cure por COVID-19.
Dried ginger powder can cure COVID-19. According to WHO no drugs have yet been certified to treat the coronavirus. COVID-19 can be prevented through frequent hand wash.

The governor of Rio de Janeiro is paying a special COVID-19 monthly allowance, of BRL 836.00, to all inmates in the state. Meanwhile, the emergency COVID-19 for poor people who are not convicted criminals is only BRL 600. There is no special COVID-19 allowance for inmates in Rio state. This rumor started because the governor of Rio decided that families could transfer up to BRL 836 monthly in cash, in one lump sum, to their imprisoned relatives during the COVID-19. Ordinarily, they can transfer that amount every month, but at a maximum of BRL 104,50 per visit. There are small canteens in Rio state prison facilities, in which the use of cash is allowed.

A picture of a person, allegedly, holding a coffin with only two fingers. The post says it is phisically impossible that this coffin is full, because of the weight of a dead person. The picture was deliberately cut to look like the person was holding the coffin with just two fingers. In the full image, it is possible to see that the coffin was standing on an improvised table and two other people were helping out.
All India Majlis-e-Ittehadul Muslimeen (AIMIM) leader Waris Pathan threatened a cop to keep a mosque open during lockdown. The video is from 2016 and has no link to the coronavirus lockdown.
A market in Mizoram state of India is practising social distancing amidst ongoing lockdown. The image of the market is from a hilly region on Myanmar, and not India.

American students are siging the Indian national anthem, as a gesture of thanking India for supplying Hydroxychloroquine to USA. The video is three years old and has no relation to coronavirus or Hydroxycholoroquine.

Alfalfa is the only cure for COVID-19. There is no scientific research that support the use of Alfalfa in treating COVID-19 patients. WHO said that there is no specific cure for COVID-19 until 7 may 2020.

A WHO report states that ‘No vegetarian in the world was found to have been infected with COVID-19’. No such statement was made by any WHO representative or report. The WHO Representative in China has clarified that his quote was taken out of context. Also, WHO has advised people that they can consume meat products if they are cooked thoroughly and properly handled during food preparation

A message of key takeaways from an interview of HDFC bank MD & CEO Aditya Puri, where he has said how India will survive the coronavirus pandemic. A few points of the message have been taken from Aditya Puri's interview, but they are incorrectly associated with coronavirus. Most other points in the message are not said by Mr. Puri.

The image of a boy with serious injuries is that of a Tablighi Jamat COVID-19 patient who was beaten up by police in India after he misbehaved with the nurses in the hospital where he was admitted. The image of the boy with severe injuries is from July 2019. It has been falsely linked to coronavirus and Tablighi Jamat.

Prolonged use of the mask causes hypoxia. Although it is true that a face mask can generate unpleasant sensations, do not worry, it is normal and using it will not cause you to be deficient in oxygen.

A Legislative Assembly member Hafiz Khan made a nurse touch the feet of a Muslim and apologise to him. She was made to do so because she had made a comment that if the Markaz attendees had quarantined themselves, the situation that was not would not have arose. The image is of a nurse attending to the injured feet of a man.

Photo shows a broken refrigerator with 1500 viruses in Wuhan. China Daily deleted the post but the related news is still on the official website of the institute and the Chinese National Radio (CNR) site. Viruses are not kept “secretly” here, and SARS-CoV-2 could not have been among the viruses kept in the lab in the 2018 photo.
First recipients of a COVID-19 test vaccine is dead. The first person to try the vaccine, microbiologist Elisa Granato, was interviewed by the BBC after revelations of her death emerged.

President of Russia, Vladimir Putin, has ordered COVID-Organics and asked Africans not to follow the World Health Organization (WHO). This statement attributed to the Russian president is pure fabrication.
A tweet by Pakistani journalist Saadia Afzaal claiming that China has developed a COVID-19 vaccine. The claim is based on plans to conduct trials on an inactivated COVID-19 vaccine in Pakistan.

Researchers from Oxford University are offering Ksh100,000 to Kenyan volunteers for a COVID -19 vaccine trial. The Oxford University vaccine trial team makes no mention of the incentive in their plan to seek the approval of the Government of Kenya for vaccine trials.

Melinda Gates divorced her husband Bill because he created a toxic vaccine whose purpose is to destroy the African. The Gates couple has not divorced and continues to support health personnel and the scientific community.
Neem leaves — popularly known as “mwarubaini” in Swahili — can cure COVID-19. There is little evidence of neem’s efficacy against COVID-19, and experts have also refuted this claim.

Madagascar was COVID-19 free on April 28 after registering 100% recovery for all confirmed cases. There were 46 active COVID-19 cases on that date, according to the country’s Ministry of Public Health

Japanese family converts to Islam after they are cured from COVID-19. The photo shows a famous Japanese Muslim preacher named Ahmen Maeno. Nothing indicates he was affected by COVID-19 at time of publishing.

Various groups in the Philippines will conduct Labor Day protests on the streets despite the enhanced community quarantine. The Labor Day protests will be held online or at home through selfies, online programs, and/or noise barrages.
A vaccine for the novel coronavirus was available as early as 2001. The vaccine shown in the photo is used for dogs against canine coronavirus. It is not effective in preventing COVID-19.

Journalists admitted that the COVID-19 pandemic is a hoax. The dialogue between the two journalists in question that was mistaken as an admission that COVID-19 was a hoax was nothing more than a joke between two friends.
COVID-19 is a pretense for a invouluntary implemantation of microchips and legalization of pedophilia. The virus nor COVID-19 is not a hoax and there is no evidence to support other claims.
In Italy, 96,3% of people that died after developing COVID-19 died from other pathologies. Official data released by health authorities does not support this claim.

The post contains a COVID-19 conspiracy theory written by former South Carolina Rep. Trey Gowdy. There is no record of Gowdy writing the essay. He confirmed to the Daily Caller that he did not author it.

The photo shows bedding and food aid packages distributed in Rwanda during the coronavirus pandemic The photo predates the coronavirus pandemic by roughly half a year and appears to have been taken in Gambia.

People should ignore guidelines to wear masks, especially since the government doesn’t advise mask wearing for tuberulosis. COVID-19 is far more prevalent and deadly than tuberculosis in the United States.
Sweden has banned mandatory vaccination. Detailed information on what deputies charge is available to anyone on the website of Congress and has not stopped being available at any time.

Former Rep. Trey Gowdy wrote essay past on social media claiming the COVID-19 pandemic was planned to help Democrats in the 2020 election. Rep. Trey Gowdy confirmed that he did not write the post in question.

An article circulating on Facebook claims that Microsoft co-founder Bill Gates said a COVID-19 vaccine could kill almost one million people, citing an interview he gave. This is false; Gates was talking about vaccine safety and the potential for side effects, and gave a hypothetical figure to illustrate the number of people who could possibly be affected by them worldwide.

Rinsing your nose with saline solution could protect you from COVID-19. Nasal wash could help some patients in some cases, but no evidience that the action or a saline solution could protect you from COVID-19.

“Bill Gates admits his COVID-19 vaccine might kill nearly 1 million people.” The Gates Foundation is trying to develop a coronavirus vaccine. Gates spoke theoretically about how many people might suffer side effects from a vaccine, not about how many might die from it.
People who are sick with coronavirus continue to be injected with sea water. Many have been saved. Injecting marine solutions as a measure against SARScov2 can cause serious systemic infections.

WHO’s stance on the new coronavirus is changing and now supports the Swedish open policies Several media outlets in Bosnia and Herzegovina have shared an article from an American Infowars outlet recognizable for conspiracy theories, claiming WHO has formally taken a shift on combating measures against COVID-19 and "now supports Sweden's policy of non-closure." However, this is a misinterpretation of the statement for the media.

The claim was that ginger powder cured coronavirus positive patients in Mumbai, advised ayurveda as cure WHO said there is no conclusive evidence of any form of cure to coronavirus and the ayurvedic doctor declined to give evidence.

Applying mustard oil to the nostril will let the novel Coronavirus move to the stomach where it will be killed by the stomach acids. Applying mustard oil to the nostril does not make coronavirus move to the stomach.
Dried ginger powder can cure COVID-19. According to WHO no drugs have yet been certified to treat the coronavirus. COVID-19 can be prevented through frequent hand wash.
The “Di Bella” treatment method is useful for curing COVID-19. There is no scientific evidence to claim that the Di Bella Method is effective against COVID-19.

Recent mob attack on West Bengal police due to the lockdown in Howrah. The images are from 2014 where Bharatiya Janata Party members were found beating the police officials in Uttar Pradesh against the increasing crimes in the state.
One of the first recipients of a trial COVID-19 vaccine died. The first recipient, Dr Elisa Granato, was interviewed by the BBC after reports of her death first emerged. She said she is doing fine.

MTN Uganda is giving out 122GB of data to customers for free in response to COVID-19. The link with this offer directs users to download malicious software, and is not a valid promotion by MTN Uganda.
Pregnant mothers are more likely to contract COVID-19. The claim made on Facebook is not supported by any evidence.
Pope Francis is calling on all the faithful of his church to take the Malagasy remedy against COVID-19. The pope has not said this.

Doctor Didier Raoult reveals that the World Health Organization (WHO) in collusion with France is preparing to put poison in COVID-Organics. French microbiologist Didier Raoult has not made such a statement on the Malagasy remedy launched by President Rajoelina and supposed to prevent and cure COVID-19.

Instagram post shared with text claiming that the novel coronavirus originated in a laboratory. The virologist making this claim based his statement on a preliminary report that has since been withdrawn.

COVID-19 is fake and just a coverup for 5G technology. According to the World Health Organization (WHO), to date, there is no vaccine and no specific antiviral medicines against COVID-19. The claim that a "vaccine” contains a chip to give personal information to authorities is baseless and false.
A recipe with lemon, ginger, onion and garlic can cure the coronavirus. There is no evidence to prove that any food can cure or prevent COVID-19.

Unilever and Pampers are offering free cleaning and hygiene products to Brazilian families affected by the COVID-19. To be entitled to this help, you need to type your city on the comments of the post. It's a phishing scam. A chatbot pops up to anybody who interacts with these posts. Then, it induces people to visit a suspicious website, where they're asked to provide their Facebook login and password.

The COVID-19 death rate has been more than 10 times higher in São Paulo, Rio de Janeiro and Ceará (states in which governors are currently opposing Jair Bolsonaro) than in Minas Gerais (whose governor supports Bolsonaro). The numbers have been inflated to make Bolsonaro look bad. This is not true. Although the COVID-19 death rate has been lower in Minas Gerais than in other states, it is so by a much smaller margin.

Picture of an open coffin with nothing but a bag of sand inside. The caption states this picture was taken in Manaus, Brazil, and that empty coffins are being buried to induce the population to panic. The picture was taken in 2017, in the city of São Carlos, São Paulo. A local ring of petty criminals simulated a homeless woman's death after making several life insurance policies on her behalf. They were caught and the "body" was exhumed: it was just a bag of sand.

If you forward a WhatsApp message to 13 people, Rs.400 will be credited as balance under smart city scheme. It is an old message that resurfaces every year since 2016. There is no such scheme by the Central government that provides free data or balance to telecom subscribers.

Indiand entral government providing free scholarship and online tuition classes to school children. FactCrescendo spoke with the district education director for Alappuzha, Mrs. Dhanya R. Kumar who has clarified that this is a fake message and there is no such scheme from either the central government or state.

Indian Spritual Guru Mata Amrithanandamayi Charitable trust gifts India its first “Air Ambulance”. Mata Amritanandamayi charitable trust has clarified that they haven't donated an "Air ambulance" nor its hospital has "air ambulance" services.

Bollywood Superstar Aamir Khan donated Rs.15000 each to poor slum dwellers in one kg wheat flour packets. The claim is made by a Tik Tok user who has not specified the source of the news. The mainstream media has not reported anything as such neither has Aamir Khan or anyone close to him has made an official statement regarding this.
Old Dalit woman beaten up by Christian missionaries in Kerala. The image is from Bangladesh and the woman had sustained injuries in a domestic fight.
Arnab Goswami wets his pants when called upon by Mumbai Police for interrogation. The image used to make the claim is photoshopped.
Dr. Manish Patil died due to coronavirus in Maharasthra. No, the doctor shown in the viral post did not in Maharastha. The viral photo is from Uttar Pradesh.

A video showcasing successful trials completed for COVID-19 vaccine developed by PGIMER, in India. Trials for the vaccine have not been initiated yet and as per PGIMER it's too soon to declare the efficacy of the vaccine.

Image of a couple claimed as activists Peter DeMello and Siraj Bilsara shared in connection with Palghar lynching. The viral image is of TISS professors Anjali Monteiro and K P Jayasankar. Their photographs were put in a fake news post on social media on the Palghar lynching. They have complained to Mumbai police cyber cell.

Video showing a Muslim man throwing notes to spread coronavirus Police have clarified that the man has dropped notes by mistake without any reason, this person has partial paralysis in the one hand. The Muslim man does not have coronavirus, the medical tests revealed.

An image with an alleged statement by the Spanish writer Arturo Pérez Reverte about the coronavirus and confinement. It is a hoax. There is no record of any statement of the style made by him in interviews or on social networks. Furthermore, Arturo Pérez Reverte has denied it directly.
Chinese President Xi Jinping urging Africans to reject a coronavirus vaccine that has killed all the animals it has been tested. There is no approved vaccine or treatment for the coronavirus yet.

An image has been shared on Facebook in April 2020 alongside a claim that it shows Muslims praying on a street in the Australian city of Sydney. The image was shared as the city’s residents continued to face stay-at-home orders during the novel coronavirus pandemic. Comments from some Facebook users on the misleading post indicated they believed the photo was taken during the lockdown restrictions, In fact the photograph has circulated in reports since 2013 about people praying on a Sydney street during Ramadan. The same image has previously circulated with a misleading claim that it shows people praying on a street in the US.
All India Majlis-e-Ittehadul Muslimeen (AIMIM) leader Waris Pathan threatened a cop to keep a mosque open during lockdown The video is from 2016 and is not linked to the lockdown or coronavirus
An image of a market carrying out social distancing passed off as Mizoram, India The image is from Myanmar and not Mizoram in India as claimed by social media users.

Bill Gates is creating vaccines to make the earth’s population infertile. He discussed a plan to reduce the world’s population through vaccines during his 2010 TED talk. Bill Gates' quote is taken out of context. He discussed production of vaccines to reduce the death rate of children in developing countries.
The new cure for coronavirus: hot water with three aspirins and lemon. The hot beverage is not a cure for coronavirus.
The japanese doctor Tasuku Honjo says that coronavirus is not natural. Honjo didn't say that. Days after he rebuked the false claim.

Rui Costa, governor of the brazilian state of Bahia, asked Porto Seguro’s city hall to falsify the number of COVID-19 infected people to get federal funds. At no point in the video mentioned, Costa says anything similar. The governor said that estimates predicted Porto Seguro city would reach its maximum ICU beds occupancy when there were 200 active cases of the disease at the same time.

According to the headlines of an article shared as a screenshot, the first volunteer in the United Kingdom’s COVID-19 vaccine trial has died, two days after getting the injection. It's been widely reported that Dr Elisa Granato is still alive. She has changed her Twitter name to "Dr Elisa Granato - 100% alive" and the BBC has shared a video of her on Twitter, "very much alive", as she says herself.

CDC does not recommend wearing masks. The CDC revised its facemask guidelines in early April after studies indicated people who lack COVID-19 symptoms might be infected and transmit the virus to others.

A text message from a COVID-19 monitoring app says the government is aware the user is more than 20km from their home address and must explain why. The message, which originated in Australia, is fake. The actual COVID-19 app being used in Australia does not have geolocation capability and cannot track users' location.

Members of the Irish government’s national public health emergency team ignored social distancing rules at a recent meeting. The photograph of Ireland's national public health emergency team which shows people sitting close together is actually from earlier this year, before social distancing rules were introduced.
Nobel Laureate Dr. Honjo has claimed COVID-19 virus to be man made in Wuhan Laboratory. Dr. Honjo has denied the claims. The claims lack evidence and are baseless.
A nurse claims that Delhi govt has stopped funding for the hotel stay for doctors and nurses treating COVID-19. The lady in the video is not a nurse and the claims made by her are entirely false.
Muslim boy in Madhya Pradesh, India attacked by BJP workers for violating lockdown. There is no communal or political angle to the incident. Local boys attacked a man who was not Muslim but Hindu.

Coronavirus can in no way withstand heat, sunlight or other UV radiation. In other words, skin and surfaces are momentarily sterilized by sunlight or other UV radiation. US trials show that sunlight creates harder conditions for the novel coronavirus. But that doesn't mean sunlight sterilizes any surface in minutes. If the virus is stored in mucus, for example, it can easily survive longer. Believing that sunlight kills the coronavirus from surfaces in minutes can be "directly dangerous," says a professor of clinical microbiology.

Japanese Nobel Prize for Medicine claims that the new coronavirus “is not natural” and “was made in China”. It is not true that Tasuku Honjo claimed that the coronavirus was manufactured in the laboratory. He himself has publicly denied it.

Influenza vaccines contain the coronavirus and increase the spread of COVID-19. Influenza vaccines do not contain coronavirus and there is no scientific evidence to say that they increase the spread of Sars-cov-2.
The real cause of death is not pneumonia, but thrombosis. The virus is not a problem. Some patients died of thrombosis, it is a complication due to the virus circulating in the body.
The Japanese Nobel Tasuku Honjo has said that the coronavirus was created in China. Honjo never made these statement. The Nobel Prize-winning scientist himself denied these accusations.

Trump says that subjecting the body to ultraviolet light exposure and injecting disinfectant can be an effective treatment against the coronavirus. It would not only be ineffective, but harmful and, in the case of the disinfectant, dangerous. The following day, Trump denied the seriousness of his words and assured that he had been misinterpreted.

A viral video identifies banknotes as the reason for the increase in coronavirus cases in Nigeria. While we acknowledge the concerns of the sources of the claim and appreciate their efforts to encourage the hand-washing habit, stating that banknotes are the reasons for the spread of the coronavirus is not factual as there is no scientific evidence to support the claim.

Guidelines on how to use national identity card (NIC) as a curfew pass for essential requirements in Sri Lanka. The number concerned should be the last digit of the nine or 12 digit NIC number which is the same for both old and new National Identity Card.

28-year-old Dr Manisha Patil from Maharashtra died yesterday due to coronavirus. Manisha had examined 188 people and helped them recover, but she could not save herself from coronavirus. No female doctor had died in Maharashtra and the picture which is being shared with the claim is of Dr. Richa Rajput who is alive. She through a video called out this claim.

President Donald Trump is selling coronavirus-themed commemorative coins through the White House Gift Shop. Gift shop selling COVID-19 coins is not from the White House. WhiteHouseGiftShop.com is selling COVID-19-themed commemorative coins for around $100. The gift shop has a historical connection with the White House that dates back to the Truman administration, but it was taken over by a private company. The federal government is not affiliated with the shop and isn’t involved in any of its products or operations, its owner says.

Walmart, Amazon, Kroger, Target and Costco “have not had any reported (coronavirus) cases in the news.” Employees at big retailers have contracted COVID-19, and some have died. News reports from across the country have documented COVID-19 cases and deaths involving employees at all of these companies.

Nobel Prize in Medicine Tasuku Honjo say that the new coronavirus ‘was made in China’. "In the midst of the unprecedented pain, economic loss and global suffering affected by the COVID-19 pandemic, I am deeply saddened that my name and that of the University of Kyoto have been used to spread false accusations and misinformation," said Honjo. in a statement published by the University of Kyoto, where he works

News outlets are misusing a boy’s image to report the same child died of COVID-19 in three different countries. Social media posts do reference the deaths of three young people from COVID-19 in Europe. But the posts do not show that news outlets misused the same image of one boy to report the deaths of three children.

A video of a group of men leaving a mosque has been viewed tens of thousands of times in multiple posts on Facebook and Twitter published in April 2020 alongside a claim it shows Muslims who gathered to pray in the Indian state of Gujarat in defiance of a nationwide COVID-19 lockdown. The claim is misleading; the video has circulated in reports about a mosque gathering in the Indian state of Maharashtra one day before India announced a national lockdown.

Three photos have been shared hundreds of times in multiple posts on Facebook and Twitter alongside a claim they show improved air quality in the Sri Lankan capital of Colombo during a nationwide curfew implemented due to the coronavirus pandemic. The claim is false; the photos actually show the skyline of the Philippine capital Manila.

A photo, claiming that SARS-CoV-2 is an old virus, known since 2003. A video where a woman talks about and old Russian newspaper from 2003, discussin an outbreaks of a coronavirus. The article disucssed 2003 outbreak of SARS, not COVID-19.

“Governor Andy Beshear has authorized Kentucky teachers to make in-home visits. With parental approval, teachers will inspect the bedroom of each student currently enrolled in K-8.” No, Kentucky teachers won’t be conducting student bedroom inspections. This bedroom inspection bulletin is a hoax.

Indian government has started ‘Rashtriya Sikshit Berojgar Yojana’ to provide relief package of Rs 50,000 to all ration cardholders, int he midst of COVID-19 crisis FACTLY has found that there is no such scheme started by the Government of India. Also, the Press Information Bureau (PIB) has clarified the same and termed the message to be fake.

Joy Arakkal’, the owner of ‘Joyalukkas’ jewellery company, has died due to COVID-19 in the Middle East. The owner of 'Joy Alukkas' jewellery company is 'Joy Alukkas'; not 'Joy Arakkal'. Joy Arakkal is the managing director of UAE-based Innova group of companies. Arakkal has commited suicide in Dubai due to financial reasons.
Putting a mask below a pot of boiling water for 15s is a fast way to disinfect it. According to several experts, this is a dangerous and ineficient way to disinfect a protective mask after use.

Japanese schools re-opened then were closed again due to a second wave of coronavirus. Schools reopening depends on each prefecture. Schools only reopened on the northern island of Hokkaido, and stayed closed almost everywhere else in Japan.

Thai police arrested a cat for disobeying the curfew order. Thai government didn't impose a curfew on cats. No news regarding cat arrestation recently, either. The photo media outlet used was already online in 2016.

A family (husband, wife, child) committed suicide because they could not bear hunger. They were migrants travelling to their hometown during the lockdown, from a city named Surat in India. The image of the family committing suicide is from 2018, and the incident had taken place in Maharashtra.

A mosque in India that was distributing relief material to Muslims during the lockdown denied help to some needy Hindus who reached there, saying that there was no facility for Hindus. The mosque where the incident took place is in Bangladesh, not India.

The DNA of new coronavirus was manipulated in a lab. SARS-CoV-2 is not a DNA virus, it's genetic material is RNA. It is not possible to make changes on RNA with “CRISPR” tech. There is no evidence that the virus was produced in lab.

70 billion coronaviruses need to enter your body to get infected. There is no scientific evidence supporting this number, there is not enough data to determine the minimum infectious dose, but it is estimated to be hundreds or thousands.

Being able to “take a deep breath and hold it for 10 seconds,” means you are not infected with COVID-19. According to Dr. Sohtaro Mine, a postdoctoral researcher at a U.S. national research institute, "Whether you can hold your breath or not is irrelevant to whether you have pneunomia or any other inflammatory condition in your air passages"

Nobel Prize laureate Prof. Honjo says he’s “worked at a research institute in Wuhan for four years” and claims the novel coronavirus “is created by China”. Professor Honjo never said the novel coronavirus was created by China. Both Prof Honjo himself and Kyoto University, to which he belongs, deny he has ever said the virus was made in China.  Nor has Professor Honjo ever belonged or worked at any research institute in Wuhan, China.

Georgia Gov. Brian Kemp “mandates restaurants reopen”. Worries for restaurant owners are real, but post saying Georgia Gov. mandated reopening goes too far. Georgia Gov. Brian Kemp’s order said that restaurants can reopen if they follow 39 rules, including that employees wear face masks. Many Atlanta-area restaurants have chosen not to reopen their dining rooms due to concerns about health and safety. Many restaurants have sued their insurers after being denied business interruption insurance claims.

The Philippine government has a P120 billion aid package for “no work, no pay” workers. This is wrong. P120 billion is actually the amount of credit guarantees the government is offering small and medium-size enterprises planning to borrow from banks in order to finance operations that were halted as a result of the quarantine amid the pandemic.

Opening ceremony of 2012 London Olympics was a projection of coronavirus pandemic. The hospital beds apperaing on the scene during the opening show and Boris Johnson in a hospital bed prove that the spread of the disease was planned in advance. The hospital beds that appeared during the opening show of London Olympics in 2012 was a tribute to the UK NHS, and the patient in bed was the Queen of Hearts from Alice in Wonderland, not Prime Minister Johnson

Dr. Elisa Granato, one of the first volunteers to receive a potential COVID-19 vaccine in the U.K., has died. Granato has not died. The U.K. Department of Health and Social Care debunked the claim on Twitter, and so did Granato.

The Department of Homeland Security (DHS) plans to mobilize the National Guard to enforce a nationwide 14-day quarantine. There are no plans for a national quarantine. The DHS cannot mobilize the National Guard in this manner.

Harvard professor Charles Lieber was arrested for manufacturing and selling the new coronavirus to China Professor Charles Lieber was arrested for making false statements to federal authorities and concealing his connections to China, not for creating the coronavirus. The new coronavirus is not man-made or a biological weapon

French health care workers are putting on defective Chinese-made protective gowns. Public Assistance – Hospitals of Marseille, which operates the hospital where the video was filmed, has said the gowns were damaged in storage and were not made in China.
Mosquitoes can spread COVID-19 “from person to person.” Health agencies and entomology experts state there is no current evidence that mosquitoes can transmit the new coronavirus.

The Guatemalan president used the inclination of the COVID-19 infection curve as an argument that the virus containment phase has been successful. According to infectious and epidemiological doctors, using the angle of a curve as an argument is misleading for the population.

Claim that British PM Boris Johnson said that cotton swabs in inspection kits from China had being contaminated with the virus. Furthermore the parts contaminated with the virus are what are called probes and primers, and not cotton swabs. The inspection kit was supposed to be sent from Luxembourg to the UK but had not been delivered. The information source of the article cited by "VisionTimes" does not state that the contaminated parts were shipped from China.
Muslim men are being beaten during the lockdown in India. Madhya Pradesh worker beaten up by villagers; the men shown the post are not Muslim.

The claim was that the huge rally of eople in Ahmedabad for Namaste Trump rally was behind more coronavirus cases in the state of Gujarat in India The rally was held on February 24, 2020 when coronavirus was not speading yet in India. Gujarat reported its first case a month after the event.

28-year-old Dr Manisha Patil from Maharashtra died yesterday due to coronavirus. Manisha had examined 188 people and helped them recover, but she could not save herself from coronavirus. No female doctor had died in Maharashtra and the picture which is being shared with the claim is of Dr. Richa Rajput who is alive. She through a video called out this claim.
Guatemala performs 400 tests per a million people. The Health Department hasn't shared this data for weeks.

Guatemala’s president said that he decided to reduce the curfew time after a meeting with “the asociation of infectious disease specialists” The president did meet with the specialist but they suggested to mantain the curfew as it was

Nobel laureate Professor Tasuku Honjo said that new coronavirus was produced in the lab. Professor Tasuku Honjo did not make such a statement. It can be seen from Honjo's current resume, he has never served in Wuhan. Professor Honjo denied the allegations via university's official website.
The photo shows doctors who died from COVID-19. The photographs show portraits of healthcare workers who struggle with COVID-19 in Italy, taken by AP. Not the doctors who died because of COVID-19.

Viral audio clip of a Kannur based neurosurgeon suggesting remedies for the coronavirus. The neurosurgeon who was supposed to be the author of the clip stepped forward and denied that this was coming from him.

Carrefour is selling face masks in its physical stores above the maximum price set by the Government of Spain. The masks for which the Executive has established a maximum amount of sale to the public of 0.96 euros per unit are surgical, while those sold by Carrefour in its physical stores (as of April 28) are hygienic masks whose price has not yet been is regulated.
A video shows.a policeman guarding Hajipur Prison suffering from COVID-19. The video of a mock drill in Hajipur prison was shared with misleading context.

Video shows coronavirus infected notes scattered on Indore streets being sanitized. The notes were accidently scattered on the streets when it fell from a gas cylinder delivery boy. Police have checked the CCTV and confirmed the incident putting all the conspiracy theories to rest.

A blog site reported the demise of a trial volunteer of a potential COVID-19 treatment. Other than the unreliable nature of the blog consequent on the succesion of false reports present, Elisa Granato, a volunteer in a trial of a potential COVID-19 vaccine at Oxford University, said she is very much alive. The UK government has also said the same.

Alcohol gel for hands goes into auto-combustion if left in a car in the sun during a hot day. Alcohol gel only bursts itself to flames at 363 ºC. The temperature inside a car left in the sun on a hot day does not reach that.

A TV news segment shows empty coffins being buried in Manaus, Brazil, in order to spread panic among the population. The TV network said to be the original source of the news story denied having done any such coverage.

Tasuku Honjo, Nobel Prize in Medicine, said that the coronavirus “is not natural”. The Japanese doctor Tasuku Honjo - winner of the award for his research on cancer treatment - issued a statement denying such claim. The source of the misinformation was a fake Twitter account that bears his name.

Alberto Fernández, president of Argentina, proposed the creation of an aid for those with house arrest. A supposed proposal from the Argentine President made on Twitter is circulating on Facebook but in reality, it is a false Twitter account, which clarifies in his biography that it is a "fake" account.

Alcohol flasks or alcohol-based hand sanitizer left inside vehicles can ignite with the sun heat. The self-ignition point of the substance (when it burns even without contact with a spark or flame) is more than 300º C, according to specialists heard by Aos Fatos. The average temperature of cars exposed to the sun reaches 65º C, according to a study by the State University of Maringá.

Immunologist and Nobel winner Tasuku Honjo said the new coronavirus isn’t natural and was created by the Chinese. In a statement from the Kyoto University, the 2018 Nobel Prize for Medicine said that his name has been used to spread misinformation about the origin of the virus. In addition, Aos Fatos found no record in the international press that Honjo said anything similar about the coronavirus origins.

The use of 3 drugs for respiratory disease vía nebulization helps to the treatment for COVID-19. At least three doctors ruled out that the drugs mentioned in the message have an effect on COVID-19. National regulations also do not include them in possible treatments.

Picture of a hospital in Santo André, Brazil. It says in the caption that, despite the COVID-19 crisis, the hospital has no patients. The picture was taken the day after the hospital was opened, April 18. Now, on April 28, there are 47 patients in this unit.

Video of Byculla (Maharashtra, India) MLA Waris Pathan threatening police to open a mosque during the Indian lockdown. The video used to claim that Byculla (Maharashtra) MLA Waris Pathan is threatening Police to open a mosque is an old one and is not related to any recent incident. It is related to an argument which erupted in November 2016, between Byculla MLA Waris Pathan and local Police over the volume of loudspeaker in a mosque.

Japanese Nobel laureate professor Tasuku Honjo who had worked for 4 years in Wuhan laboratory said that coronavirus was synthetically manufactured in Wuhan laboratory. Professor Tasuku Honjo is working as a Deputy Director at the Kyoto University, Japan. The university has issued a statement refuting the claims circulating on social media and the professor has never worked in the Wuhan Laboratory.
Pragya Kathua, a comedian from Odia, has died. Pragya Kathua himself has clarified that he is alive.
A video showing a Muslim woman misbehaving with doctors in India. This video is from Pakistan. It is not from India.
Donald Trump’s claim that the USA had more testing than all other countries combined. The USA has tested about 5 million people; the rest of the world 25 million people.

5G technology is the cause of the coronavirus. This alleged theory is based on a wrong definition of viruses and has false data to support it. There is also no relationship between magnetic fields and pandemics.

A video published by a Columbian page on Facebook, which has been shared more than 34,000 times on that social network, claims that a German newspaper “has sued China.” What is certain is that on April 15 the German tabloid BILD published an editorial, which today rests on its website and which can be accessed with paid subscription, in which they demand the government of Xi Jinping economic reparation for Germany for the damage caused by COVID-19, which according to experts, would have originated in the Chinese city of Wuhan.
Picture shows clothes of those who have died of coronavirus in China. Beijing is now shipping these clothes to Africa. The picture is at least seven years old and has nothing to do with coronavirus.

A Kenyan senator is giving away cash to all Kenyan citizens to help them through the COVID-19 outbreak. The senator’s communication aide has said that the Facebook page and posts making these claims are fake.

Walmart, Kroger, Amazon, Target and Costco had no reported cases of coronavirus in the news. There have been numerous news reports across the country involving each of these retail chains, as well as a number of news reports about stores being forced to close for cleaning.

Sign outside the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation says “Center for Global Human Population Reduction.” There is no such center run by Gates -- nor is there any evidence such a center exists anywhere, run by anyone.
Coronavirus mortality rate been proven to be 0.03%. Several doctors and researches said this number is not fully representative.

An official government announcement details how COVID-19 restrictions will be eased in Ireland from early May. The photograph of the government announcement is fake. No decisions have yet been made on any changs to restrictions in Ireland.

Walmart, Amazon, Kroger, Target and Costco stores — while staying open during the COVID-19 pandemic — “have not had any reported cases” of employees contracting the coronavirus. There have been news reports across the U.S. of workers at those companies becoming infected or dying of the disease.

Nobel Prize winner and esteemed Japanese immunologist Tasuku Honjo said the virus behind COVID-19 is “completely artificial” and was manufactured in China. Honjo disproved this in a 4/27/2020 statement published by his home institute in Kyoto University. He said his and his institution’s names are being used “to spread false accusations and misinformation.”

A Filipino scientist has produced a vaccine for COVID-19. The Philippines' Department of Health said that as of 4/28/2020 the group behind the Fabunan vaccine has not applied for registration with the Food and Drug Administration, so the vaccine cannot be used.

The coffins with the bodies of the dead of Bergamo were not a hoax. The authors of the video base their theories with hoaxes (such as photos of Lampedusa coffins exchanged with those of Bergamo) and wrong information. The video was used to support anti-vaccination theories.
Applying mustard oil in your nostrils will kill coronavirus. We spoke to some doctors and medical experts who rubbished the claim and said there is no study to back this claim.

Huge crowd on the streets of Delhi during Ramzan while there was no crowd during the festival of Navratri. One of the photographs which was used to claim that the streets in Delhi were empty during Navratri was actually from Jammu.
Roti with stamp distributed during lockdown in India. These rotis were distributed during 2014's election in Uttar Pradesh state, India
A Facebook post defending the government’s role in current NHS equipment shortages was written by Jennifer Saunders. No, this post was not written by Jennifer Saunders.

The NT$30,000 subsidy to Taiwanese labor is actually from the recipients’ own labor pension. The fund source of the NT$30,000 labor subsidy is the Government's special budget of COVID-19 bailout bill up to NT$150 billion.

Five Air Force officers were identified as COVID-19 patients on April 25th. Air Force Director of Health confirmed the statement to be false. First COVID-19 infected patient from Air Force was reported on 27th of April.

Since all students are covered under student insurance, have no fear in attending school – Sri Lankan education Minister. False statement attributed to the Education Minister. Minister even hinted that the school reopening date could be extended due to the ongoing battle against COVID-19 outbreak.
Cuban scientists discovered that eucalyptus can help prevent and treat coronavirus. There is no scientific evidence that proves eucalyptus helps prevent and treat coronavirus

Indian Prime Minister said world will be free from coronavirus in a month. Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi told the people that with restraint and vigilance, there is 'hope' that the world will come out of the danger of coronavirus before Eid. PM Modi did not say anywhere that the world would be freed from Coronavius in a month. It became clear in our investigation that Dainik Jagran has published the news with a misleading title.

Costa Rican government will give $1 million to scientist Christian Marín’s company for research on COVID-19. The Ministry of Science, Technology and Telecommunications (Micitt) and the National Center for Biotechnological Innovations (CENIBiot) - the agency that directs the research - confirmed to La Nación the falsity of the posts.

A viral WhatsApp message suggests that lemongrass tea kills COVID-19. Lemongrass is not the proposed cure for COVID-19; if it were accurate, perhaps the altruistic Dr Li would still be alive today, presumably as a first-hand user and witness of the efficacy of the tea. More so, there is no proof of CNN’s involvement as no such publication or report has originated from the organization. Again, since there is no cure for the novel coronavirus yet, security resides in prudent scepticism of news relating to treatments and cure of COVID-19 that do not include statements of approval by WHO and other relevant health authorities.

A video has been viewed thousands of times in multiple posts on Facebook and Twitter alongside a claim it shows a Muslim politician in India urging a police officer to open a mosque in order to allow people to pray during the nationwide COVID-19 lockdown. The video has actually circulated online since at least 2016 in reports about a noise complaint at a Mumbai mosque.

A picture of an empty field hospital in Brazil. Post claims that COVID-19 crisis is not real. The photo shows a field hospital in Santo André, Brazil. The first publication in social media was made a few hours after the medical operation began. The COVID-19 sector in city's main hospital was fully occupied in April 2020.

Video of Byculla (Maharashtra) MLA Waris Pathan threatening Police to open a mosque during the existing lockdown impplemented to contain COVID-19 spread. The video used to claim that Byculla (Maharashtra) MLA Waris Pathan threatening Police to open a mosque is an old one and is not related to any recent incident. It is related to an argument erupted in November 2016, between Byculla MLA Waris Pathan and local Police over the volume of loudspeaker in a mosque.

The largest hole in the ozone layer over the Arctic region has healed due to the COVID-19 lockdown. The ozone layer healing has nothing to do with the lockdown and was driven by unusually strong and long-lived polar vortex.
Japanese Nobel laureate Tasuku Honjo declared that coronavirus is man-made and is created by China. Tasuku Honjo has made no statement about coronavirus.

“So 2 doctors from Bakersfield discover that coronavirus mortality rate is 0.03%. 13x less deadly than what was previously thought! Their analysis has since been banned from YouTube.” Two doctors from Bakersfield, California, called for an end to statewide shutdowns and said testing data showed the infection fatality rate in California to be 0.03%. Experts said their calculations were faulty because the data they used to extrapolate to the entire state was “not representative of the state of California.” Video of their press conference was removed from YouTube. Leading medical associations “emphatically condemn(ed)” their findings in a statement.

A Kenyan government minister showed his middle finger to coronavirus “idiots” during a televised press conference. Kenya’s interior ministry principal secretary did apparently call people arrested for violating the government's strict lockdown measures "idiots", but he said this on radio, not on TV or at a press conference. And the photo used in the social media posts has been digitally manipulated. It is an old photo from February 2019, where the government official was raising his index finger, not his middle finger.

A photo showing scores of green parrots sitting on sacks of grain has been shared thousands of times in multiple posts on Facebook and Twitter alongside a claim it was taken during a nationwide coronavirus lockdown in India. The claim is false; the photo has circulated online since at least March 2014.
Japanese Nobel laureate Tasuku Honjo, who worked in Wuhan for four years, claimed that SARS-CoV-2 was human-made. Tasuku Honjo has refuted any link to the claim. He didn't work in Wuhan.

Says Dr. Anthony Fauci’s name appears on “4 U.S. patents for a key glycoprotein” used to “create the current COVID-19 epidemic.” Jerome Corsi, a conservative author and conspiracy theorist, wrote on his blog that Dr. Anthony Fauci’s name appears on four patents for a protein linked to the novel coronavirus. Three of the patents Corsi cited are active. They deal with a potential treatment for HIV and are owned by the Department of Health and Human Services. There is no credible evidence that COVID-19 is related to HIV or was created in a lab. The coronavirus’ genetic makeup precludes the possibility that it was man-made.
Japanese Nobel laureate Tasuku Honjo, who worked in Wuhan for four years, claimed that SARS-CoV-2 was human-made. Tasuku Honjo has refuted any link to the claim. He didn't work in Wuhan.
German physician Wolfgang Wodarg claims the coronavirus is harmless. Scientific evidence does not support this statement. The virus is not harmless.

A ‘hot-mic’ conversation of journalists in the White House is used to state that the journalists know and joke about the coronavirus being a hoax. Journalist in question refuted the claims and clearly stated that the conversation between him and the other journalist was misinterpreted.

Young people “have a greater chance of being killed by the HPV vaccine than COVID-19.” No deaths have ever been linked to the HPV vaccine. While young people are less at risk of dying of COVID-19 than older adults, some younger people have died from the virus.
A Whatsapp message claims that Japanese immunologist Tasuku Honjo said: the coronavirus is not natural. Tasuku Honjo didn't say this and published a statement saying that the claim is false.

Thousands of doctors say hydroxychloroquine cures coronavirus. DA has warned against use of hydroxychloroquine with COVID-19 patients because of severe risks, including death. And second, Fauci did not say a "vaccine" would be rushed without proper study.
Video shows a baby was delivered with its amniotic sac because the mother has COVID-19. The video is true, but was in Costa Rica in 8 january. Before the first case the COVID-19 in the region

“Children don’t seem to be getting this virus.” Children do contract the coronavirus. Hundreds of cases in people 17 and under have been reported in Wisconsin, and tens of thousands in the U.S. But early evidence shows that children are not at higher risk for the virus, and in most cases, experience milder symptoms than adults.

Says if you’re refused service at a store for not wearing a mask “call the department of health and report the store. Masks are suggested, not required.” Post falsely claims people should report Pennsylvania stores that refuse to serve maskless customers. Essential businesses in many states require that all employees and customers wear masks while inside the store. They must do so by law. The Pennsylvania Health Department, whose number was included in the post, said that businesses that are not following guidance regarding wearing a mask are what should be reported.
The coronavirus vaccine is ready and works in 3 hours (picture). There is no vaccine against coronavirus, and in the photo shows the tests, not a vaccine.
COVID-19 mortality rates are exaggerated by 20 times, according to test results in New York. The results of the study are preliminary and unrepresentative.

An audio message circulating in India claimed that in Wuhan, China, many people recovered from coronavirus without going to hospital after drinking ot water and steam inhalation. WHO stated that there is no final treatment for coronavirus and the claim was misleding to shun hospitalization.

Indian Prime Minister said world will be free from coronavirus in a month. Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi told the people that with restraint and vigilance, there is 'hope' that the world will come out of the danger of coronavirus before Eid. PM Modi did not say anywhere that the world would be freed from Coronavius in a month. It became clear in our investigation that Dainik Jagran has published the news with a misleading title.
Nobel Prize Tasuku Honjo says the coronavirus was created by man in Wuhan. He never said that and has no relationship to any lab in Wuhan.

Claim that GloboNews, a Brazilian news channel, reported that a criminal died of COVID-19 while in exchanging gunfire with the police. A screenshot showing the caption “proves” it. The screenshot was doctored. The image was taken from a news report about a rainstorm in Rio de Janeiro, in 2019

A video of a car on fire. In the caption, it says that alcohol-based hand sanitizer caused the fire. Although the video is recent, the fire started on the engine. According to local firefighters, there was no hand sanitizer inside the car

A video of a speech by Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus. On a voiceover, a man says that he is warning Brazil that imported masks from China and India are contaminated with the SARS-Cov-2 He never said anything like that. On the speech in question, dr. Tedros was talking about the severity of the crisis, and how even developed countries took misguided decisions that led to tragedy
There has been vaccine for coronavirus (COVID-19) since 2001. the vaccine is for a different type of coronavirus.
This photo shows bodies of COVID-19 victims. The image was taken in the aftermath of the 2004 Boxing Day Tsunami in Thailand

A video of an alleged virologist named Judy Mikovits in which she launches numerous theories about the new coronavirus Compilation of explanations to the claims of the alleged virologist Judy Mikovits, most of them are misleading or have no scientific evidence.

Videos in which trucks are seen whistling through the streets of Ourense, Spain, with a caption claiming that it is a protest against the Spanish Government. It is a hoax. On April 25 there was a truck march in Ourense, but it was a tribute to the professionals who fight against COVID-19.

Images of families breaching the safety distances related to the coronavirus this April 26 in Spain. Several of the images were taken with a deceptive perspective that makes it seem like people are closer than they really are.
Content claiming that the first woman in the UK to try the experimental coronavirus vaccine has died. It is a hoax. She has denied it herself and the UK Department of Health and Social Assistance.

Several versions of a message saying that, according to Italian doctors, the SARS-CoV-2 virus was being “badly fought against”, since the cause of death would not be pneumonia, but rather “Disseminated Intravascular Coagulation (thrombosis)”. Yes, COVID-19 sufferers can develop thrombosis, but there is no evidence that thrombosis is the "true" cause of death from COVID-19.

Indian company Jio offering 25GB of free data daily during the COVID-19 lockdown. The message claiming Jio offering free 25GB data daily during COVID-19 lockdown is fake. No, Jio and Facebook have not rolled out any such offer for Jio users.

COVID-19 is a big pharma fraud and a treatment has existed for years now (stem cell therapy). Stem cell therapy that has been used over the years in treatment of various ilnesses, has recenly been used to treat a coronavirus patient in the US and other 7 patients in Israel. The company says more trials are under way.

A video about the coronavirus circulates in WhatsApp that, when opened, hacks the cell phone “in 10 seconds”. There is no evidence that all phones, with different operating systems, can be hacked at the same time by a video.
Nostradamus predicted the coronavirus. The text in the image doesn't appear in the book Prophecies of Nostradamus.

Alberto Fernández, president of Argentina: “We are the country with the least deaths in the world”. Argentina registered a number of deaths that is below the world average and very far from the figures of the most affected European countries, but it is not the one with the fewest deaths worldwide.

The owner of the Indian jewellry group Joyalukkas died due to COVID-19. The Joyalukkas founder is healthy. There was a confusion between the company and Joy Arakkal, a Dubai-based businessman who died of COVID-19.

A viral video shows food aid provided by the national government, but that aid is financed with the budget of private companies and civilians. Food aid corresponds to the campaign 'Helping does us good', which is led by the First Lady, but is supported entirely by contributions from civil society and the private sector.

A WhatsApp chain said that the Japanese scientist Tasuku Honjo claimed that COVID-19 was created by man. The scientist never made that claim. The Twitter user who sent the information was impersonating the Japanese professor and the scientific consensus is that the SARS-CoV-2 virus has a natural origin.

An image has been shared hundreds of times in multiple posts on Facebook which claim it shows a government text message about a new coronavirus contact-tracing app in Australia. The claim is false; Australian authorities said the purported text message was a hoax; the Australian Federal Police said it had launched an investigation.

Chinese researchers call the novel coronavirus only one of 1,500 viruses stored in Wuhan lab. In the official website of the Wuhan Virology Institute, information is indeed listed that they store more than 1,500 types of viruses. However, to date, there is no evidence that the coronavirus that causes COVID-19, SARS-CoV-2, is from the Wuhan Virology Institute. In fact, according to studies of the professor of immunology and microbiology at the Scripps Research Institute, California, USA, SARS-CoV-2 is the fruit of the natural evolutionary process.

WHO says coronavirus transmission Is no longer happening just through droplets but also in the air. At the time of publication, on its official website, WHO said that the coronavirus was generally transmitted through contact with droplets from the respiratory tract of infected people, not through the air.

Romanian president Klaus Iohannis says a school reopened in France for an experiment and it failed. Many pupils were positive. Such an experiment didn't take place. An analysis was led beyong pupils and teachers from a high-school, while it was closed. The school never reopened.

An official document details the instructions for schools in the post-lockdown period in France. The document signed by the rector of the French Academy of Nantes has been widely shared in recent days to denounce measures that were inapplicable after May 11. Except that this document was not intended for the end of the lockdown.

Videos showing American students singing the Indian national anthem to thank India for supplying hydroxychloroquine. It was a 2-year-old video. A YouTuber, Anisha Dixit, had made this video to celebrate global freedom and diversity on the occasion of 71st Independence Day of India.

A coronavirus positive patient found in Jamnagar, a city in the state of Gujarat. District collector of Jamnagar has clarified that there are no coronavirus cases found in the city. The viral news is a rumour.

Photo of a Hindu woman attacked by RSS members for offering Sehri to a Muslim Kashmiri girl during the Indian lockdown. The photo of the injured woman was found to exist on the internet at least since February 2020, while the image of a woman offering Sehri to a Muslim Kashmiri girl was claimed to be captured on 25 April 2020. Hence the events are not related to each other.

Photo of a Hindu woman attacked by RSS members for offering Sehri to a Muslim Kashmiri girl during the Indian lockdown. The photo of the injured woman was found to exist on the internet at least since February 2020, while the image of a woman offering Sehri to a Muslim Kashmiri girl was claimed to be captured on 25 April 2020. Hence the events are not related to each other.

Photo of people following social distancing in a market in Manipur (India). The photo claiming to show people following social distancing in a market in Manipur (India) was actually captured at the Kalaw market in the Shan state of Myanmar.

Dr. Elisa Granato, the first volunteer for vaccine trials in UK, has died. Dr Elisa Granato is alive and well confirmed by a video conversation with a UK journalist. Dr Elisa Granato had also tweeted from her personal account refuting the false claims.

Japanese Nobel laureate professor Tasuku Honjo who had worked for 4 years in Wuhan laboratory said that coronavirus was synthetically manufactured in Wuhan laboratory. Professor Tasuku Honjo is working as a Deputy Director at the Kyoto University, Japan. The university has issued a statement refuting the claims circulating on social media and the professor has never worked in the Wuhan Laboratory.
Political leader from Andra Pradesh made a nurse touch his feet: Image. The nurse in the image is just trying to stop blood coming from the feet of a diabetic person.
Pune Doctor Megha Vyas dies of COVID-19. The woman's name is Megha Sharma and she died of severe pneumonia. Also, she was not a doctor.

Indian Actor Aamir Khan gives Rs. 15000 to poor people in 1Kg wheat flour. The claims are fake and have been going around on social media with names of different organizations and celebrities. There is no official statement from Aamir nor any reports in the media.
Central indian government likely to reduce the age of retirement of government employees to 50. Government has clarified they are neither making any such move nor even discussing it.

Multiple Facebook posts claim that aspirin, lemon juice and honey have been combined to make a “home remedy” for COVID-19 in Italy. The World Health Organization (WHO) has warned against self-medicating for COVID-19, saying there is no current medicine that can effectively treat the disease; official guidance released by the Italian Ministry of Health about the coronavirus does not mention the purported home remedy.

White South Africans are banned from getting COVID-19 government aid, says the headline of a news article. The article draws attention to a civil society group raising funds to buy groceries and other supplies for poor white communities in South Africa affected by the COVID-19 pandemic. The South African Social Security Agency has confirmed that the claim in the headline is false, and that denying one race group government aid would be unconstitutional. The criteria for receiving the COVID-19 social grant have been published by the Department of Social Development, and do not include any mention of a grant recipient's race.
Late herbalist known as “Dr. Sebi” was correct in saying viruses don’t exist. Sebi's claim is not based in science and there is no evidence of his claims.
First volunteer for COVID-19 Vaccine in UK, Dr. Elisa Granato, is dead. Dr. Elisa Granato is alive and healthy and gave interviews to debunk the rumor.

Dr. Manisha Patil died due to COVID-19 while treating coronavirus patients in Maharashtra, India. This is Dr. Richa Rajpoot from Kanpur who is healthy and alive. She is not a COVID-19 treating doctor.

Message warns the population about the danger of drinking water as a transmitter of COVID-19. COVID-19 can subsist in potable water, but in the other hand, Superior Institute of Sanity from Italy states “this not involve risk to people’s health”.

Michigan Gov. Gretchen Whitmer “has just been stripped of her emergency coronavirus powers by her state legislature.” Two bills passed in the Michigan Senate would limit the scope of Gov. Gretchen Whitmer’s authority to impose a state of emergency. As of April 29, neither bill had passed the state House of Representatives. And the governor has said she will veto any legislation that restricts executive power during the coronavirus pandemic. Whitmer’s stay-at-home order does not prohibit the sale of any particular product, as the Instagram post claims.

“We’ve tested more than every country combined.” The United States has performed more coronavirus tests than any other single country. But it has not done more “than all major countries combined.” The raw tally of coronavirus tests isn’t a good metric, experts say. When you control for population, or consider other meaningful statistics, the United States is still far behind on its COVID-19 response.

The CDC recommends that only people with COVID-19 symptoms should wear masks. A Facebook post claims the federal Centers for Disease Control and Prevention does not recommend that people who are healthy wear face masks to protect themselves from respiratory diseases, including COVID-19. That was the CDC’s advice — until a change made April 3. Now, to guard against the spread of the coronavirus, the CDC recommends nearly everyone wear a face covering when out in public and where social distancing is more difficult.

Tasuku Honjo, Nobel Prize in Medicine 2018, said that “the coronavirus is man-made”. There is no trace of these statements in the media and Aluk Humar, a member of Honjo's team, published a denial on his Facebook page.
Muslims are protesting on the streets during quarantine. The video is from 2018 and is corresponds to Al mawlid, an annual festivity in the Islamic calendar.
According to scientific research, smoking protects against coronavirus. There is no scientific evidence to say that smoking and nicotine prevent Sars-cov-2 infection.

The COVID-19 pandemic was used as a cover-up of the Starlink project by Elon Musk, which launched dozens of satellites. Starlink project started in 2015 and it lauched its first satellite in 2018. WHO declared COVID-19 a pandemic and as a result of this disease hundreds of thousands have died.
McDonald’s is reopening in the UK from Monday 27 April. Incorrect. McDonald’s has said it has no plans to reopen at this stage.
In the United Kingdom, the woman who was tried for the coronavrus vaccine has died. Vaccine trials have taken place in the United Kingdom, but the woman who has been tried is alive, not dead.

“The (corona)virus just isn’t nearly as deadly as we thought it was.” Reputable scientists warned early in the outbreak that there was not a totally accurate picture of how deadly the coronavirus was. There’s still not. It’s misleading to compare, as Carlson did, the early reported case fatality rates, which reflect deaths among confirmed COVID-19 patients, with more recent infection fatality rates that estimate the death rate for all infected people. COVID-19 still appears more lethal than the seasonal flu, experts said. Infection fatality rates that may seem small can lead to mounting death tolls.

Minister of Health claims that only one case of COVID-19 registered in Lithuania. A two month old video where Lithuanian Minister of Health claimed that only one case of COVID-19 was discovered in Lithuania. The video was from early March when the quote was true, but it was used to illustrate situation in late April when there were over a thousand confirmed cases.
