This wagon bears the inscription COVID-19. The manufacturer of these wagons, in the United States, assured that the image was manipulated since none of their vehicles carry such a code.

Consuming colloidal silver prevents or serve as a treatment for the new coronavirus. Health authorities in the United States have pointed out that consuming collodial silver is neither effective nor safe to use against any disease.
The new coronavirus is not dangerous – the illustrative example is the Diamond Princess statistics. The conclusions from the Diamond Princess case can't be generalized.

The Brazilian Navy established a treatment protocol for COVID-19 patients with mild symptoms using Invermectin. The Brazilian Navy stated that this alledged protocol was just a proposition, and it was not being used in any of their hospitals.

Screenshots showing chyrons of two TV channels say that people belonging to the Brahmin and Rajput castes cannot get infected by COVID-19 because their blood is warm. The claim has no scientific basis. The TV channels have now shown any such news; the screenshots of channel templates are doctored to add the fake text.

Vladimir Putin released 500+ lions on the streets of Russia to ensure that people stay indoors during the coronavirus pandemic. The picture of a lion roaming in the streets was taken in 2016 in South African city Johannesburg. The viral post with text about Russia was edited with a mobile app.
Video shows Canadian PM Trudeau’s wife in quarantine. The woman seen in the video is not wife of Candian Prime Minister.
Russia released 500 lions, forcing people to stay indoors given the COVID-19 pandemic. The lion seen in the picture is from Johannesberg, South Africa.

A WhatsApp forward claimed that a vaccine for coronavirus has been discovered. It also claims that the treatment for coronavirus is mentioned in India’s Intermediate Zoology book. The viral forward reads, “It is not a new disease as it is already mentioned in the Intermediate Zoology book along with its treatment. It happens sometimes that many great scientists and doctors do not focus on lesser-known books as they are mostly busy with famous books. (Book name: Zoology, Writer: Dr. Ramesh Gupta, Page No. 1072.) Friends, this is not fake news so I request you to kindly share it maximum so all coronavirus patients are treated in time.” The virus discussed in the viral claim is not the novel coronavirus but SARS. The WHO has clearly negated the discovery of any vaccine that can cure COVID-19. In an answer to the question, “Are there any medicines or therapies that can prevent or cure COVID-19?”, the WHO replies, “While some western, traditional or home remedies may provide comfort and alleviate symptoms of COVID-19, there is no evidence that current medicine can prevent or cure the disease."

Coronavirus will be cured within 2 hours by drinking bitter gourd juice. Neither the WHO nor the Indian Ministry of Health has mentioned any such remedy for coronavirus. The Press Information Bureau of India has also marked it fake.

Russia has unleashed over 500 lions to ensure that people stay inside their homes amid the coronavirus outbreak. The image on social media has nothing to do with Russia or the Russian president. The image is from South Africa’s Johannesburg, and the lion seen in the viral image was brought for film shooting by a production crew.

A WhatsApp forward claims that the COVID-19 vaccine is ready, was announced by U.S. President Donald Trump, and will be launched next Sunday. It also claims that the vaccine discovered by the U.S. scientists can cure a COVID-19 infected patient within 3 hours. With the WhatsApp forward, the alleged image of the vaccine is also being shared. The image shows a COVID-19 test kit and not a vaccine that can cure the virus. We checked President Trump’s Twitter handle, Facebook page and Instagram profile but didn't find any such announcement by the U.S. president.

Italy’s Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte broke down publicly due to the ongoing coronavirus pandemic. The image on social media is of Brazilian President Bolsonaro and not Italy's PM Giuseppe Conte. The claim shared by several social media users and media outlets is false.
Aspirating boiling water vapor for five minutes deactivates the coronavirus. Doctors say it does not deactivate the virus. The WHO says there is no vaccine yet.
Lemon and bicarbonate kill the virus. Official sanitary authorities debunk that claim

Photographs of the Army in Dublin city centre show that the country is about to go into lockdown. The photographs show the Army setting up mobile testing centres in Dublin city centre, not preparing for the country to go into lockdown

US military brought the virus to Wuhan on October 2019. The US CDC director said the flu started in October in the US, and that some apparently flu-related deaths were in fact due to COVID-19. He does not say that COVID-19 started in October in the US.
Polish telecommunications provider PLAY has installed 5G antennas during quarantine. They were installed before the quarantine was introduced.
Russian president using lions to ensure people stayed indoors in Russia. The lion is roaming on a Johannesburg street as part of a film production in 2016.

Channel 4’s Jon Snow is infected with coronavirus. Jon Snow was on self-isolation after an Iran assignment in late February, has reported to work after a 14-day period, and continues to be part of the Channel 4 News. As of 3/22/20, he has not contracted COVID-19, verified from his Twitter account and verified news sources.
Initial lack of evidence for human-to-human COVID-19 transmission unusual. We lined up the tweets from WHO and showed there was a progression from not knowing the transmission is human-to-human.
Tom Hanks died, confessed admiration for Trump. Story published by a clear death-hoax website.
Helicopters Are Spraying Disinfectants To Try To Eradicate coronavirus. This is false information being spread on Facebook.

A tent will be set up next to the Viamed de Calahorra hospital (La Rioja) to carry out rapid tests for coronavirus. The claim is false. A tent will not be set up next to the Calahorra hospital for rapid coronavirus tests.
The government of Spain is going to declare a state of emergency. There is no proof that Spain would enter a state of emergency starting March 23, when the viral audio was spread.

Riots in London due to the unavailability of food items. The United Kingdom will be locked down by tonight. Army soldiers take to the UK streets. The video is not related to coronavirus but with London riots that happened in 2011. The 2011 England riots, more widely known as the London Riots, were a series of riots between 6 and 11 August 2011, when thousands of people rioted in cities and towns across England, saw looting, arson, and mass deployment of police, and resulted in the deaths of five people.
Aspirating boiling water vapor for five minutes deactivates the coronavirus. Doctors say it does not deactivate the virus. The WHO says there is no vaccine yet.
Lemon and bicarbonate kill the virus. Official sanitary authorities debunk that claim

Photographs of the Army in Dublin city centre show that the country is about to go into lockdown. The photographs show the Army setting up mobile testing centres in Dublin city centre, not preparing for the country to go into lockdown

Poison spray for coronavirus from Malaysia and Singapore by air. Indonesian Minister of Communication and Information Johnny G. Plate, Malaysian Army, and Head of Batam City Health Office Didi Kusmaryadi have denied the rumors.

The Peruvian Social Security is offering monetary help to some people included in a list to endure the quarantine. The government is offering exceptional aid for people in extreme poverty, but that message is a fraud, according the Social Security authorities.

Social media posts suggest Zimbabwean police flogged churches who gathered in defiance to warnings encouraging social distancing. The video is neither related to the coronavirus nor church activities. It is a November 2019 video of Zimbabwean police dispersing supporters of the main opposition political party.

“Boil some orange peels with cayenne pepper, stand over the pot, breathe in the steam so all mucus can be released from your nasal passages … Mucus is the problem, it’s where the virus lives!” Orange peels and cayenne are not proven to treat COVID-19, and neither is boiling them.
The photo shows the funeral of Turkish deceased general Aytac Yalman due to COVID-19. The photo was taken in 2006 at the funeral of someone who died of hemorrhagic fever.

A video shows coronavirus patients at an airport in China and gauges how serious the situation is. The video is not of the coronavirus infected patients of China or Italy, but of the mock drill conducted at Blas Dian Airport in Decar, Senegal, last year.

A drug made from cow urine or pigeon membrane can cure coronavirus. No evidence has been found which can prove that the pigeon membrane can cure the coronavirus. The WHO has not mentioned this, either.

Five helicopters will disinfect the Netherlands to extinguish the coronavirus. Citizens have to stay inside. Different versions of this message have been circulating since March 10. The Dutch police force has confirmed no such measures have been or will be taken.

Coronavirus is infectious in the air for 8 hours and everyone must wear a face mask. Coronavirus may remain in the air 1-3 hours, and face masks are not required for everyone, just healthcare workers.

An image has been shared thousands of times in multiple posts on Facebook alongside a claim that it shows a medicine created by U.S. scientists that can cure the novel coronavirus. The claim is false. The photo shows a COVID-19 test kit developed by a South Korean company. As of March 2020, international health experts have said there is no "cure" or vaccine for COVID-19.

A photo has been shared hundreds of times in multiple Facebook, Twitter and Instagram posts alongside a claim that it shows Italy’s president crying over the novel coronavirus epidemic that has claimed thousands of lives in his country. The claim is false. The photo shows Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro getting emotional during a Thanksgiving speech in December 2019.

A video shared thousands of times on Facebook claims to show police in Zimbabwe beating churchgoers because their place of worship refused to close to prevent the spread of COVID-19. The claims are false. The video was filmed before the virus outbreak. It shows opposition supporters being dispersed after gathering to hear their leader.

A purported emergency notice from Australian authorities has been shared hundreds of times in multiple posts on Facebook and Twitter. It states people can receive free home visits from doctors during the novel coronavirus pandemic. The claim is false; Australian health authorities denied issuing the notice, adding the hoax had prompted “unnecessary phone calls” that had overwhelmed public health units.

A viral WhatsApp voice note in Nigeria claims that the coronavirus could kill up to 45 million Nigerians. This is misleading, as data from the WHO and the Nigeria Centre for Disease Control (NCDC) shows. The message makes several other false claims, which we debunk.

Russian President Vladimir Putin released 800 lions and tigers across Russia to stop people from leaving home. The original photo was taken on 4/11/16 in Johannesburg, South Africa, in a movie shooting locale.
Science Minister Pedro Duque was hospitalized due to coronavirus in Denia. Pedro Duque itself denied it in El Objetivo while de chaintext was viralizing

DRC president, Felix Tshisekedi, has suspended the payment of rents and water and electricity bills because of coronavirus. AFP dug into governmental speeches and announcements since the outbreak of coronavirus, and there is no mention of suspension of bills. The team of the DRC's president denied to AFP having announced such economic measures.

A photo showing nurses raising their middle fingers against the French government, with a caption against the French President. The woman who took the picture explained to AFP she aimed to point out the coronavirus, not the French government. Analysis of the medatada allowed AFP to confirm she was the one who took the photo.
Vladimir Putin “released 500 lions to monitor the quarantine.” This is false and is a meme.

One photograph of the meeting of the Bolivian health minister, Anibal Cruz with delegates, hints that they are hiding current figures of the infections with COVID-19 to the population The photo hints that in Bolivia are 1,000 people infected with COVID-19. But in Bolivia are registered 61 one cases as of 3/27/2020.
President Giammattei said that the country has 10,000 COVID-19 tests. Guatemala had received 1,000 tests from WHO-PAHO and now has 622.

Photo of the “crying president of Italy” with a caption stating Italy was not prepared to deal with the coronavirus outbreak despite having adequate health facilities. The world leader in the photo is not the president of Italy. He is Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro.

Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced a 14-hour curfew as the virus lives for 12 hours on surfaces. Research shows the study found the new coronavirus can live in the air for several hours and on some surfaces for as long as 2-3 days. These studies are not peer reviewed.
Celebrities spreading misinformation about coronavirus and the Janata curfew in India. The celebrities shared posts that were already debunked about the 12 hour curfew on 3/22/20 in India.
“Go to 2020census.gov and fill out this census form so you can get your stimulus check.” Your response to the U.S. Census won't affect whether you get a federal stimulus check.

A screenshot of a Nigerian television station showing a breakdown of “472 confirmed cases” has been shared on Facebook, Twitter, and WhatsApp alongside claims it shows novel coronavirus cases across the country. The image is being shared out of context: It shows figures for Lassa fever, not coronavirus.

A video has been viewed hundreds of thousands of times on Facebook, Twitter and YouTube alongside a claim that it shows a drone launching fireworks at people who breached a curfew in Malaysia during a nationwide coronavirus lockdown. The claim is false; the video's audio has been manipulated to include a man speaking in Malaysian; the original clip shows a prank that was staged by a Brazilian influencer in Brazil in July 2019.
Polish telecommunications provider PLAY has installed 5G antennas during quarantine. They were installed before the quarantine was introduced.
Belgium Health Minister has banned group sex due to coronavirus outbreak associated with orgy. This information is based on a satire article.

Three photos showing coffins lined up in an enclosed space have been released on social media with a message about the coronavirus pandemic in Italy. “This is Italy,” he said. The images correspond to migrants killed in shipwrecks in the Mediterranean in 2013.

There is science behind Indian Prime minister Modi’s 5 p.m. clapping initiative: Clapping generates vibration which can kill coronavirus. Also, 3/22/20 is Amavasya. There is no scientific evidence to prove that vibration from clapping hands can kill coronavirus. The Press Information Bureau of India has clarified that the message is fake. Also, Amavasya is not on 3/22/20.
Photo of coffins of coronavirus patients who died in a single day in Italy. The picture is from Italy but is seven years old and has nothing to do with the coronavirus outbreak.
Dolphins and swans return to Italy waterways after COVID-19 lockdown. Dolphins and swans spotted on Italy's waterways has nothing to do with the coronavirus lockdown.
Clapping together at 5 p.m. will create a vibration which will destroy coronavirus. There is no proven evidence that vibration created by collectively clapping can destroy coronavirus.

The Brazilian doctor Drauzio Varella defends that the population doesn’t need a lockout. The video includes outdated information about the COVID-19 crisis and creates confusion by mixing real recommendations, about how not to create panic, with others now ineffective, about how to maintain a normal life. Sites also amplify misinformation and use false titles to disorient. In a note on its website, the team that works with the doctor classified this type of disclosure as "disservice" which, according to them, is "confusing the population".

After coronavirus pandemic, Chinese president said it’s China’s time to lead the world. The excerpt highlighted on social media is from a speech by Xi on October 18, 2017 at the opening of the 19th Congress of the Chinese Communist Party, which takes place every five years. In the speech, Xi Jinping spoke about the achievements of his first government and said that he wanted to further strengthen China's role on the international stage.

Egyptian Health Minister arrive in Italy with secret coronavirus cure. Egyptian ministry of health denied any intention to visit Italy, and Misbar could not find any report published in the Foreign Policy regarding the claim.
Trump faints, is infected with coronavirus. A video shows a sudden fainting of U.S. President Donald Trump while making a speech before a group of people. It is an old video dating back to 2016.
A video shows chaos in London while coronavirus spreads. Misbar investigated the video and it turned out to be old, dating back to August 2011.
People rioting on the streets of London due to economic crisis in the wake of coronavirus outbreak. The viral video is almost nine years old and from the London riots in 2011.

A video of police arresting a man has been viewed thousands of times on Facebook and Twitter alongside a claim it shows police in Italy detaining a man who flouted a national lockdown during the novel coronavirus pandemic. The claim is false; the footage in fact shows police arresting a knife-wielding man in the Brazilian city of Sao Paulo.

Two malaria medications work to treat COVID-19. President Donald Trump announced that the FDA already has a treatment for COVID-19. In his announcement, he mentioned two drugs used to treat malaria as well as an antibiotic. However, a comprehensive review of available scientific evidence shows hydroxychloroquine and chloroquine have not yet shown sufficient efficacy for treating respiratory disease caused by the novel coronavirus. These medications are still in early-phase clinical trials for treating the disease.

Voice message of a so-called ombudsman that says that internet may collapse in Argentina. The official ombudsman denied that the message came from his office and the National Institute of Communication advised for a rational use of the internet but did not recommend to stop sending videos via Whatsapp.

Turkey helped Italy with 200.000 masks and other equipment but nobody took notice. Important context is missing. It was not a humanitarian aid delivery. Italy bought 200.000 masks from a company in Turkey and they were blocked at the customs for more than two weeks before Turkey decided to let them be exported.
Russian government has unleashed lions on the streets to impose a public curfew. The viral bulletin is digitally edited and the lion in the image was a part of a movie shoot from South Africa.

Doctors and nurses in Italy are dying and are lying dead on the ground due to the coronavirus outbreak. The image does not depict dead doctors and nurses in Italy. It is a part of a demonstration by youngsters to spread awareness about coronavirus in Bogota.

Chancellor Angela Merkel knew of the pandemic since 2013; the virus is from a laboratory. A risk analysis was published by the German government in 2013 about a fictional coronavirus named "Modi-SARS“. It didn't foretell of this pandemic. Scientists say the virus originated in nature.
Drinking alcohol beverages can help prevent COVID-19. Photo being spread online is of is a fake hospital news release saying alcoholic beverages would help reduce the risk of getting coronavirus.

Italian Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte said, “We have lost control, we have killed the epidemic physically and mentally. Can’t understand what more we can do, all solutions are exhausted on ground. Our only hope remains up in the sky. God, rescue your people.” The quote attributed to Italian Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte is fabricated. The image accompanying the post shows the president of Brazil, not the Italian prime minister.

A photo of a group of people holding a banner that bears the Chinese and Malaysian flags has been shared thousands of times on Facebook and Twitter alongside a claim it shows Chinese doctors arriving in Malaysia to combat the novel coronavirus, COVID-19. The claim is misleading. The photo shows medical supplies donated by China that were delivered to a hospital in Malaysia.

Italian Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte broke down amid COVID-19 deaths in his country. The image is old. The man in the image is not Italy’s Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte but shows Brazil’s President Jair Bolsonaro who was overwhelmed while speaking about an attack on him

A Facebook post in Australia claims sufferers of respiratory conditions can access a “rescue pack” of medication by asking a general practitioner. AAP FactCheck found the Facebook post to be misleading. “Rescue packs” containing steroids and antibiotics are a UK scheme available only to certain people. The federal Department of Health confirmed that people in Australia with pre-existing COPD conditions can only access a “rescue pack” of medication if it has been previously prescribed.

Multiple Facebook and Twitter posts shared thousands of times by Australian social media users claim people with pre-existing respiratory conditions will be given a “rescue pack” of medication from their general practitioners during the novel coronavirus pandemic. The claim is false; Australia’s Department of Health dismissed the rumor as “misinformation”, adding that patients will not receive “rescue packs” from their doctors unless previously prescribed.

A photo of a man and woman embracing has been shared on Facebook and Twitter alongside a claim that it shows two Italian doctors who died from COVID-19 after contracting the disease from the patients they treated. The claim is false; this is an Associated Press photo of a couple kissing at an airport in Barcelona, Spain.

A Twitter user claimed that Russia released 500 tigers to keep people inside during lockdown. The image shared by the claim-source was generated from a meme maker website. The original image of the lion was taken in Johannesburg, South Africa, in 2016.
“In Chicago, COVID-19 actually lowered the death rate.” Deaths in Chicago increased in March 2020 compared to previous years, despite a decline in murders.

In a video made by Dr. Mario Pesaresi, he recommends water steam to deactivate the coronavirus. There is no evidence of the impact of water steam on coronavirus. The WHO and CDC indicate there is no conclusive evidence to determine whether heat impacts the virus.

An image shows a Spanish scientist asking Cristiano Ronaldo and Messi to find the cure for COVID-19. The woman in the picture is not a scientist, but an ex-member of previous Spanish governments. It was taken in April 2008 and was never related to the new coronavirus or to the football players.
WHO confirmed COVID-19 as airborne. The WHO insists COVID-19 is not spread as airborne in everyday life.

Second-hand clothes and blankets sold cheaply in African markets are infected with coronavirus. The photo is at least 10 years old. China imports mostly new clothes to Africa, but WHO, Harvard Medical School and other experts advise it is safe to receive goods from COVID-19 affected areas.

A statue of the Virgin Mary from Loreto will be carried by a plane over Italy to ask for the pandemic of COVID-19 to stop. The picture was taken in January and is related to a specific event that has nothing to do with COVID-19. The Loreto cathedral has denied that such an event will take place.
Army to be deployed to respond to COVID-19 pandemic. Army explained the vehicles were returning from a canceled military exercise.
One Polish telecommunications company used the quarantine as a cover up to put 100 5G antennas in Gdynia. They were installed long before the coronavirus outbreak.

A WhatsApp forward claimed that a vaccine for coronavirus has been discovered and that the treatment for coronavirus is mentioned in an Intermediate Zoology book. The viral forward reads, “It is not a new disease as it is already mentioned in the Intermediate Zoology book along with its treatment. It happens sometimes that many great scientists and doctors do not focus on lesser-known books. (Book name: "Zoology," Writer: Dr. Ramesh Gupta, Page No. 1072.) Friends, this is not fake news so I request you to kindly share it maximum so all coronavirus patients are treated in time.” The treatments mentioned in the viral page of the book are not for coronavirus but  for common cold caused by a coronavirus. The viral claim that there is pre-existing medication for coronavirus is misleading.

Riots in London due to the unavailability of food items. The United Kingdom will be locked down by tonight. Army soldiers take to the UK streets. This video is of riots that happened in Peckham, London. With a Google search, we found several global media reports on the London riots. It was clear from these reports that the video viral on social media shows the 2011 London riots.

Riots in London due to the unavailability of food items. The United Kingdom will be locked down by tonight. Army soldiers take to the UK streets. The video is not related to coronavirus but with London riots that happened in 2011. The 2011 England riots, more widely known as the London Riots, were a series of riots between 6 and 11 August 2011, when thousands of people rioted in cities and towns across England, saw looting, arson, and mass deployment of police, and resulted in the deaths of five people.

Drauzio Varella, one of Brazil’s most famous doctors, stated in a video on 3/22/20: There’s no coronavirus crisis; this is just a strong cold. There’s no reason for changing your routine unless you are infected. The video was actually published on 1/30/20, when Brazil had no confirmed cases of COVID-19. Varella himself said, in a video published a month later, that the situation had changed and the previous video did not represent his current opinion on the matter.

Riots in London due to the unavailability of food items. The United Kingdom will be locked down by tonight. Army soldiers take to the UK streets. The video is not related to coronavirus and shows London riots in 2011. The 2011 England riots, more widely known as the London Riots, were a series of riots between August 6 and 11, 2011, when thousands of people rioted in cities and towns across England, saw looting, arson, and mass deployment of police, and resulted in the deaths of five people.

Yves Levy, husband of the former french health minister Agnès Buzyn, inaugurated the P4 laboratory of Wuhan in China, where the coronavirus was created. The virus wasn't created in Wuhan's P4 laboratory.

Multiple Facebook and Twitter posts shared thousands of times by Australian social media users claim people with pre-existing respiratory conditions will be given a “rescue pack” of medication from their general practitioners during the novel coronavirus pandemic. The claim is false; Australia’s Department of Health dismissed the rumor as “misinformation”, adding that patients will not receive “rescue packs” from their doctors unless previously prescribed.

A photo of a man and woman embracing has been shared on Facebook and Twitter alongside a claim that it shows two Italian doctors who died from COVID-19 after contracting the disease from the patients they treated. The claim is false; this is an Associated Press photo of a couple kissing at an airport in Barcelona, Spain.
Robbers pretend to test for COVID-19 and use it as pretext to rob houses. The Montreal police confirmed that this type of crime is not happening.
The COVID-19 cases have reached a peak and people must not go outside even for groceries. In Canada, people are still allowed to go out to buy groceries.

Famous Brazilian doctor posted for people “not to panic” about COVID-19 and keep up with their lives. The video was recorded in January. More recently he said he was safe at home because he was part of the risk group.

Helicopters are spraying disinfectants to stop the spread of coronavirus. This is a false rumor spreading on social media, as well as through popular messaging services. NYC Emergency Management declared it a hoax.
IPhoto shows people falling dead on Italian streets from COVID-19. This was a stolen photo dating back to 2014 of a Holocaust remembrance project.
Black people are immune to the coronavirus. COVID-19 does not affect races differently as far as symptoms and infectiousness. Reports from around the world show the virus affecting all people.
Boiled orange peels with cayenne pepper are a cure for coronavirus. There is currently no cure, and this has not been medically verified as a viable treatment.
COVID-19 stands for “Chinese Originated Viral Infectious Disease.” The CDC explains the virus's name has nothing to do with China.
NY Governor Andrew Cuomo did not reject buying 16,000 ventilators in 2015. The report in question did not make any recommendations for buying ventilators.

Photos show leftist groups Anakbayan and Kilusang Mayo Uno (KMU) holding a rally amid the Luzon-wide enhanced community quarantine. The photos were taken during a rally held on February 4, more than a month before Luzon was placed under enhanced community quarantine.

A claim that neem leaves can cure the novel coronavirus and relieve its symptoms has been shared thousands of times in multiple Facebook posts. Malaysia’s Ministry of Health and medical experts say there is no scientific evidence to support the claim. International health authorities also say there is no cure for COVID-19 as of April 2020.

Air cleaner removes the virus from the air and surfaces. Full page ad in national newspaper in Denmark. The air purifier may in theory kill viruses with its UV light, but several researchers are skeptical about whether the product will in practice be able to remove the new coronavirus from air and surfaces and whether it could ultimately reduce the spread of infection. . The manufacturer also states that he cannot document that the air purifier is actually acting on the new coronavirus that countries around the world are currently trying to fight.

In Japan, coronavirus was defeated with the drug Avigan. In Japan, this drug is not purchasable. The drug is not used for the flu. There are studies, but used in patients with mild symptoms. Japanese authorities say it doesn't work for patients with severe symptoms.

One can destroy the new coronavirus by doing the following breathing exercises. Although breathing exercises can improve health in general, and hence, the resistance to many infections, breathing exercises do not prevent SARS-CoV-2 from getting into the organism.

A memo from the St. Luke’s Hospital of Kansas says drinking alcohol lowers the risk of getting infected with COVID-19. Vodka is most recommended for drinking, cleaning and sanitizing. The hospital said the letter is not authentic or valid. No health authority has also recommended drinking vodka and other alcoholic beverages as a preventive measure against COVID-19.

A photo set on Facebook shows several countries mobilizing their military to maintain public order during the COVID-19 pandemic. This is inaccurate. Not all photos in the post were of military forces mobilized to maintain public order during the COVID-19 outbreak. Some showed military medical teams while one image showed soldiers manning a military base, not a checkpoint on a highway.

Giving high doses of vitamin C to patients with COVID-19 has proved to be effective in combating the disease. At the moment there is only one clinical trial investigating a posible relationship between the administration of high dose vitamin C in the context of treating COVID-19. This clinical trial is still recruiting volunteers and has not published any data to this day. In addition, no scientific paper or clinical trial has confirmed that administering ultra high doses of vitamin C is effective for any condition.

“I see no time in the history of this country when perfectly healthy people have been basically confined to their homes or only able to do essential things as in Kansas City or St. Louis.” Many cities during the Spanish flu outbreak enacted similar restrictions. In Missouri, people were restricted on what they could do. Public gatherings were prohibited. Closed or canceled non-essential businesses, in-person churches and sports events also occurred then and now.

A video shows Zimbabwean police beating people gathered at a church service, who were in defiance of the ban on public gatherings during the COVID-19 pandemic. The video shows Zimbabwean police violence against supporters of the opposition party, the Movement for Democratic Change, gathered in Harare in November 2019.

A video shows healthcare workers dancing in a hospital. The caption says it was filmed in Israel after all COVID-19 patients in the hospital were cured. The video was shot in an Israeli hospital, but they were celebrating the beginning of Pessach.

Doctors are including “COVID-19 suspect” on death certificates because hospitals receive 18.000 Brazilian reais for each registered COVID-19 death. The Ministry of Health does not send money to hospitals or local health authorities based on the number of COVID-19 deaths.

A video shows healthcare workers celebrating in a hospital. The caption says it was filmed in Messejana Hospital, in Fortaleza, Brazil, after all COVID-19 patients were cured and a whole hospital wing was closed. The video was shot in Fortaleza, but at a health center, not at Messejana Hospital. They were celebrating the fact that the number of COVID-19 cases fell on that particular week, but there are still a few patients being treated.

João Doria, governor of São Paulo, tested positive for COVID-19. Until June 22, Doria did not contract COVID-19. He was tested on five occasions, the last of them on June 18, and the result was negative. His press office provided a copy of the exam.

A video claimed that clapping from balconies during Janata Curfew in India was sound therapy meant to ward off evil spirit. Indian authorities asked people to emulate the Italian model to instill confidence among people and to pay tribute to the medical staff fighting coronavirus. There was no "sound therapy" intended.

A message claimed that Russia released 500 lions on streets to keep people confined to their homes due to Covid-19 outbreak. Russia has not imposed any lockdown when the claim was made and the video was two years old. It is unrelated to the coronavirus pandemic.
Clapping hands in during the Janata Curfew in India kills Coronavirus. The claim that clapping hands during Janata curfew will kill the virus is FALSE.
Video shows Coronavirus leaving the world thanks to clapping hands. There is no evidence that Clapping hands kills coronavirus.

A drug made from cow urine or pigeon membrane can cure coronavirus. No evidence has been found which can prove that the pigeon membrane can cure the coronavirus. The WHO has not mentioned this, either.

Riots in London due to the unavailability of food items. The United Kingdom will be locked down by tonight. Army soldiers take to the UK streets. The video is not related to coronavirus and shows London riots in 2011. The 2011 England riots, more widely known as the London Riots, were a series of riots between August 6 and 11, 2011, when thousands of people rioted in cities and towns across England, saw looting, arson, and mass deployment of police, and resulted in the deaths of five people.

ID2020 Alliance aims to microchip all allowing vaccine administration Allegations drawing parallels with ID2020, vaccines, microchips, etc., began disseminating online throughout the region long before the official pandemic proclamation. The initial stories did not entail claims contingent to COVID-19. However, as pandemic was progressing, this story has been subsequently updated with various other elements, including yet non-existent vaccine for COVID-19.  The terminology used in linking the ID2020 Alliance and COVID-19 includes "Digital Certificate"and "Quantum Dot Tattoos" often portrayed as the same in meaning. The truth is that “Quantum Dot Tattoos" does not exemplify "Digital Certificate" nor the "microchip implant", yet they were connected in this conglomerate of a story. All of the theories are solely conspiracies and scientifically unsubstantiated.

USA and NATO stole half of million of coronavirus tests from Italy Accusatory headlines have been circulating online, pointing fingers at the U.S. for allegedly "stealing" half-a-million tests for coronavirus from Italy, during these dire times, and placing them at a NATO base. Analyzed articles led readers to a conclusion that the mentioned "tests" were forcefully confiscated, as if it was not for a trade deal but unallowed act. Billboards followed in East Sarajevo appealing on public: "Say NO to NATO! NATO's airplanes took half-a-million coronavirus test." Italian newspaper La Repubblice headline read: "Half-a-million swabs produced in Italian company Brescia is in the United States" was used as a source for this claim. The facts differ from what was published. Our regional media outlets have misused phrase "tests." La Repubblice's article referred to a partial, not the whole testing equipment - swabs only, which is only a part of a testing kit. Moreover, Italian newspaper La Repubblice never used an expression "scandalous", unlike the regional media outlets, despite the author's concern regarding the conducted sale to the U.S.  NATO aircraft did dispatched the purchased equipment from Italy to the U.S. but solely due to a halt of commercial flights.

A video shows coronavirus patients at an airport in China and gauges how serious the situation is. The video is not of the coronavirus infected patients of China or Italy, but of the mock drill conducted at Blas Dian Airport in Decar, Senegal, last year.
The King of Spain has plagiarized his COVID-19 speech from a book. A picture shows a fragment of the King's speech and the image of a book as if the king had plagiarized his words from a writer.
The schools in Bizkaia in Spain do not close until September. The Education ministry of The Basque Country denies this claim to Newtral.es.
A video posted on Twitter shows a group of Chinese people converting to Islam under the argument that Muslims are immune to COVID-19. The claim is false. Islamic people are not immune to COVID-19.
A photo showing hundreds of people in the Montparnasse train station in Paris, despite confinement measures due to the novel coronavirus. The photo was taken on 5/26/19.

A letter from the French ministry of Education saying summer holidays will be postponed because of the coronavirus outbreak. Clues in the letter shows it is a fake (for instance, the signature) and Jean-Michel Blanquer, minister of Education, denied on Twitter publishing such a letter. He also denied any change in the holidays' schedule.
Sophie Trudeau is sharing her COVID-19 experience. Video is of a woman from London and not Sophie Trudeau.
A positive COVID-19 patient recently met Narendra Modi. A 2018 picture is being shared with a false narrative.
A line of coffins suggesting they are from Italy currently. This image from 2013 shows migrants dying in a shipwreck.
Cow urine is helpful to fight coronavirus. No scientific evidence backs the use of cow urine to fight viruses.

The Colombian government just made it official that all citizens will receive 350,000 pesos a week for staying home to prevent the proliferation” of COVID-19. It is false that the Colombian government is giving 350,000 pesos to stay at home.

Banglore Municipal body (BBMP) will be spraying medicine in the air to kill coronavirus. The BBMP Commissioner, the mayor and PIB Fact Check India have clarified that the viral message is a rumor and the BBMP has no such plans to spray medicine for COVID-19.

Sick COVID-19 patients at the airport runway in Senegal. Video is old and not from Italy. It actually shows a  mock drill carried out on 11/28/19 at Blaise Diagne Airport in Dakar, the capital of Senegal. It has nothing to do with coronavirus.
Image claims that dead bodies from Italy are kept in a room. The image is from a Cairo Mosque which was turned into a makeshift morgue in 2013.
Consuming alcoholic beverages may help reduce the risk of infection by the novel coronavirus. Drinking alcohol does not protect you from coronavirus infection, according to the WHO.
Coronavirus will be cured after a 14-hour curfew. The novel coronavirus has different life spans on different objects. However, it can live up to 2 to 3 days.
Bitter gourd juice can cure coronavirus. Bitter gourd juice cannot cure coronavirus. There is no cure for coronavirus as of this date.
“Only India can resist coronavirus” — Saudi Crown Prince Mohammad Bin Salman. Saudi Crown Prince Mohammad Bin Salman has not made any such statement.
Bill Gates and the Vatican have a plan to depopulate the world with a coronavirus vaccine. Video clip is taken out of context from a 2010 Gates TedTalk.
US Homeland Security mobilizing National Guard to combat coronavirus. National Guard refuted claims.
Joe Biden tested positive for coronavirus. Another news publication refuted the false claim.
Coronavirus cases linked to 5G rollout. Overlaps in the map between 5G and cases can be explained by population density.
Elderly COVID-19 patients won’t have access to respirators Several hospitals reached out by Maldita denied the claim.

Seeing the rise of novel coronavirus in India, the WHO has recommended the government of India lockdown the country from 4/15/20 to 6/15/20. We reached out to one of the representatives in India, who dismissed the claim and clarified that WHO has not made any such recommendation.

A WhatsApp video claims that the lady shown is the wife of Canada’s PM Justin Trudeau. In the viral video, a lady can be seen describing her improved condition because of medication and also warns to not take chances. The lady in the viral video is not Canadian PM Justin Trudeau’s wife Sophie Grégoire Trudeau but a British national named Tara Jane Langston.
The King of Spain has plagiarized his COVID-19 speech from a book. A picture shows a fragment of the King's speech and the image of a book as if the king had plagiarized his words from a writer.
The schools in Bizkaia in Spain do not close until September. The Education ministry of The Basque Country denies this claim to Newtral.es.
A video posted on Twitter shows a group of Chinese people converting to Islam under the argument that Muslims are immune to COVID-19. The claim is false. Islamic people are not immune to COVID-19.

Doctors are giving out “rescue packs” for people with pre-existing respiratory conditions. There is no evidence that doctors in Ireland are giving out packs containing steroids and antibiotics to people with pre-existing respiratory conditions, such as asthma or COPD. On the contrary, doctors have advised that such a move would not be safe, given the different needs that each patient would have.

“If you are in Las Vegas and you get a knock on your door from NV Power, 2020 Census or CVD-19 testers, do not open your door. They are robbing people at gunpoint.” Las Vegas police said they have received no such reports. Similar rumors are being spread around the country.
If people violate the quarantine measures in Ukraine, they will be imprisoned. According to the law on coronavirus in Ukraine, there is no such measure.
Pets can transmit the new coronavirus. The is no proof that pets can transmit the new coronavirus, although the droplets with the virus can stay on pets and, then, get into the human organism.
Pets can transmit the new coronavirus. The is no proof that pets can transmit the new coronavirus, although the droplets with the virus can stay on pets and, then, get into the human organism.
Fill out a 2020 U.S. Census form to receive an economic stimulus payment. U.S. government payments for coronavirus relief will be determined by tax returns, not Census information.

Rinsing throat and nose with warm and salt water will prevent the new coronavirus. Rinsing the throat and washing the nose with salty water may slightly alleviate a cold. However, it does not help with respiratory diseases, including COVID-19. The effectiveness of such treatment or prevention of the new coronavirus is not proven.

A photo circulating on Facebook in Nigeria appears to show President Muhammadu Buhari shaking hands with the nation’s Code of Conduct Bureau Chairman Mohammed Isa while both men are wearing face masks — seemingly against precautions during the novel coronavirus pandemic. The image was doctored using an old photo, taken long before the pandemic.

The death of Kobe Bryant overshadowed the news that an American drugmaker was hustling to make a vaccine for coronavirus, and 200 people died of COVID-19 in August 2019 in the USA. An article about American drugmakers working on a new vaccine to counter the rapidly spreading respiratory virus was published in the American daily newspaper, USA Today, on 1/24/20. But it didn't mention a death toll of 200 in August 2019.

Worshipers were beaten by policemen because they gathered in a church. We found the same video published on Twitter in November 2019, so before the outbreak of coronavirus. The caption was "Zimbabwe riot police attacked opposition party MDC Alliance supporters today who had gathered to hear leader, Nelson Chamisa, give his Hope of the Nation Address." Other pictures on Twitter and within AFP archives allow us to match the video with this anti riot police operation.

A Chinese woman in Mombasa was attacked and killed after showing flu-like symptoms and refusing to go to hospital. The article uses an image from the 2013 Westgate terror attack in Kenya, and police in the area also had not received any information about the attack.

22 travelers in Uganda for the EU-Uganda Business Summit scheduled for early March had refused to go into quarantine. The 22 travelers had refused to go into quarantine and opted to travel back to their home countries, but they were not in Uganda for the conference as claimed.

It is recommended to disinfect everything you buy with bleach to prevent infection from the coronavirus. It is not recommended. Experts say it is better to focus on washing your hands and to follow the official recommendations.
Chloroquine could cure coronavirus. There is not enough conclusive evidence to point out chloroquine as a cure treatment.

Stocks of “medical masks” made in Woippy, in Moselle, by a company are being blocked for lack of “agreement of the government,” in spite of a shortage of masks in France. Facebook users did not answer to AFP. Their publications mention a place that does not exist. The Woippy mayor told AFP he does not know about a company that is making masks in his city.
Quotes Joe Biden as saying “people who have never died before are now dying from coronavirus.” The quote was first misattributed to President Donald Trump. Joe Biden didn't say it either.

“19 Tigers fans got infected with COVID-19 in NY.” Although it is true that members of the group “Libres y Lokos," a bar of a Monterrey soccer team, made a trip to New York to witness the game of Tigres versus New York City FC, it is false. As of 3/20/20, it has been confirmed that 19 people from the Blue-Blue Bar have contracted the new coronavirus as indicated by an audio circulating on WhatsApp.

People with type O blood are more resistant to COVID-19. "It circulates on social networks and in various media portals, a note that ensures that a study establishes that certain blood groups are more resistant (or even immune) to the COVID-19 virus. This information is deceptive. This clinical trial is a preliminary study published on the medRxiv portal, a free online archive and distribution server for complete (unpublished) manuscripts from the medical, clinical and health-related sciences."

Russia unleashed more than 500 lions on its streets to ensure that people are staying indoors during this pandemic outbreak. Russian President Vladimir Putin has not released lions in order to keep people inside during the COVID-19 pandemic.

A purported warning from Australian hospitals has been shared thousands of times in multiple posts on Facebook that using petrol pumps can enable the spread of the novel coronavirus. The claim is false. Australia’s Department of Health said it did not issue the purported advisory; scientists say the virus is unlikely to survive on petrol pumps outside as sunlight and lack of moisture generally kill it; motorists are advised to regularly wash their hands to avoid infection.

Coronavirus can live only up to 12 hours on any surface. According to a scientific study, coronavirus was stable on some surfaces (like plastic and stainless steel) for up to 72 hours (3 days). Also, the WHO website states the virus "may persist on surfaces for a few hours or up to several days."
Video of Canadian PM Justin Trudeau’s wife who is suffering from COVID-19. Woman in the video is not the wife of Justin Trudeau but a COVID-19 patient from London.

Autohemotherapy cures COVID-19. Auto-hemotherapy is not among the prevention or treatment measures for the new coronavirus recommended by national and international health authorities. Documents from medical entities and Anvisa (Brazilian National Health Surveillance Agency) published before the COVID-19 pandemic already warned of the risks of the practice, which has no scientific backing and may create health risks.

The Brazilian government initiated the registration process for the coronavirus financial aid by WhatsApp. The message has been accompanied by links that can be used to steal personal data and redirect users to suspicious websites. The false information was denied by the Brazilian government and Ministries of Citizenship and Economy.
Putin declares: “Comply with quarantine or face prison for five years.” Exaggerated sanctions imposed on anyone who refuses to comply with the quarantine in Russia.
Coronavirus is nothing but Sarin Gas. The claim that the outbreak is nothing but a cover for Sarin Gas leaks from an American lab in Afghanistan is false, according to the WHO.
U.S. Army sells food just like the Egyptian Army. The photo, which shows the U.S. Army distributing free food in New York, is misleading.
Pollution rate decreased in the aftermath of the coronavirus outbreak. Misbar found the claim is misleading; the pollution rate did decrease in some cities.
Janta curfew or nationwide for 14 hours will break the chain of coronavirus spread and see a reduction of 40% of cases. There is no scientific proof to the claim.

A drug called Favipiravir is a cure for coronavirus, and people are advised not to go inside their homes wearing shoes because they can bring the infection home. Favipiravir may help treat those who have mild symptoms of COVID-19 but not those who are more severely ill. The director of the Spanish Center for Emergency Coordination Fernando Simon said on 3/16/20 that there was no need to leave shoes outside of the home. The same opinion is held by the head of the Italian Institute of Health, Silvio Brusaferro, and Fabrizio Preljasko, a virologist at the University of Milan.

A chart comparing those infected and killed by the coronavirus in Argentina and Spain. The data on the chart is incorrect and it is not advised to compare and make projections with information from different countries experiencing the pandemic in different stages.
Lukewarm water with lemon or water with lemon and bicarbonate are preventive measures for COVID-19. There is no scientific evidence that hot water or vitamin C prevents COVID-19.

Croatia to be put in “total quarantine” due to secret deal between authorities and the Red Cross. The Red Cross doesn't have anything to do with implementing quarantine rules, nor did they attend a secret meeting with the Croatian government.

Biden campaign claims a top CDC official was “silenced.” Messonnier’s remarks on 2/25/20 may have caught the attention of Wall Street and caused angst in the White House. But we cannot find evidence of her being immediately silenced, as Klain claims in the video.

Denmark passed from 200 new cases of COVID-19 in one day to only 26 cases. These numbers are not in line with the national authorities. It was never reported there were 200 or 26 news cases in one day in Denmark. As of 3/19/20, there were 75 new cases in the country.

Korean drama predicted the occurrence of COVID-19 in 2018. The Korean series didn't talk about COVID-19 but used SARS as a reference in creating a highly lethal coronavirus with very different death rates, symptoms and incubation period.
There are more than 6 000 coronavirus infections in Ukraine. The government hides the real numbers. The real numbers in any country are unknown. The aim of such claims is to spread panic.
Pets can transmit the new coronavirus. There is no proof that pets can transmit the new coronavirus, although droplets with the virus can stay on pets and then infect humans.

The quarantine in Italy showed more clean waters in Venice with fish and a dolphin. The claim is false. The image of a dolphin was taken in another Italian city, Cagliari, in the Sardinia island, and not in Venice. It was not due to the quarantine.

Muammar Gaddafi predicted the current coronavirus pandemic, and warned it would be created by the same people who would then sell  the “antidotes.” In a speech to the UN General Assembly in 2009, the late Libyan leader did speculate about the creation of viruses and expressed his concern about the sale of vaccines. But he did not say the quote attributed to him, and he did not "predict" coronavirus.

A post shared thousands of times on Facebook lists companies whose chief executive officers have allegedly stepped down during the novel coronavirus crisis. Some of the 19 CEOs remain in their positions, while the announcements that others were leaving came before the virus emerged in late 2019.
A video from a British broadcaster shows Italian coronavirus victims got taken down. The report is still available on Sky News and was not removed.

Italy’s president was caught on camera crying over and regretting country’s coronavirus response. The man in the video is not Italy's president. It was an older video of Brazil's president at a Thanksgiving service.

Coronavirus life span in a single place is 8 hours, and the Janata Curfew in India is for 14 hours. Thanks to 12 hours of Janata Curfew, the virus will be killed. Social distancing is important, but the viral post claiming a 14-hour break will kill COVID-19 Is misleading.

This is a self-check test for coronavirus. Holding your breath for 10 seconds isn't a coronavirus "self-check test." Keeping your throat moist and drinking water every 15 minutes cannot kill coronavirus.
Egypt discovered a treatment for COVID-19. Egypt MOH refuted the claim to Fatabyyano and later on its official Facebook page.

Kazakhstanis could have had the coronavirus in the fall or winter 2019, but due to the lack of test systems at that time, the disease remained undetected. There is no convincing data to support this hypothesis. Neither the statistics of pneumonia incidence, nor the statements of authorized persons give grounds to believe that Kazakhstani people had the coronavirus long before the first cases were registered. Antibody tests have shown that the claim is unfounded.

Media outlets duped the public saying coronavirus killed the same man twice. The man was both a police officer and professor, and two different stories used each title in the headline. However he did die of coronavirus complications.

A photo that has gone viral in social media shows a military convoy transporting people who died from the COVID-19 pandemic in Italy. The photo in question is depicting a neighborhood in Paris and has no relation with the COVID-19 pandemic.

An African plant called “vernonia” “kongolo bololo” or “ndolè” is useful against COVID-19. Nothing proves that this plant, that can be found in Central Africa, is a solution to cure or prevent COVID-19.

Oregano essential oil protects against COVID-19. A 2003 lab trial of dubious quality examined whether oregano essential oil can knock out coronaviruses. At that time, there was no mention of the current coronavirus. So there is no evidence for this claim.

India’s National Security Council, Prime Minister’s Office has released a list of restricted activities after the Coronavirus outbreak. The press release with the list of restrictions on activities is issued by the government of Malaysia, and not by the Indian government.
Dr. Devi Shetty released a controversial audio clip on COVID 19. VIral audio features the voice of Dr. Santosh Jacob, Not Dr. Devi Shetty of Bangalore.
Photo shows coffins from coronavirus outbreak in Italy. It is an old photo of African migrants who died in a shipwreck in 2013.
Education Ministry will approve the exams of every student in Spain. The Ministry of Education debunks this claim.
Vladimir Putin accused the “rest of the leaders” of having a plan to “reduce the world population.” The subtitles are manipulated.
People are committing suicide due to the quarantine in Spain. National Police of Valencia confirms that the images shared are from last year.
A Facebook post suggests that China has created the new coronavirus in order to kill 1% of its population. There is no evidence that supports this claim.

Don’t take NSAIDs. This medicine worsens the symptom. The French health minister has made a similar statement while the health authorities of EU, UK and Taiwan said there is no enough evidence to support that claim.
If you see a person wearing a white wristband, leave him alone. He is under quarantine. Electronic wristband are implemented in Hong Kong, not Taiwan. The picture is miscaptioned.

The symptoms of the first nine days when one contracts COVID-19. COVID-19 patients don't have the exact same symptoms. The most common symptoms are fever, tiredness and dry cough. Some patients may have aches and pains, nasal congestion, runny nose, sore throat or diarrhea.
Many foreigners wiped their saliva onto the handle of Taipei’s metro to spread COVID-19. The videos were filmed in Hong Kong and Brussels, not in Taiwan.

The spokesman for Chinese Foreign Ministry Zhao Lijian: American CDC admitted that COVID-19 patients were misdiagnosed as flu. U.S. Army is responsible for the outbreak in Wuhan. China's Foreign Ministry spokesman Zhao Lijian tweeted and commanded.
University of Vienna declares Ibuprofen makes the COVID-19 disease worse. University of Vienna denied the research. The relation between Ibuprofen intake and COVID-19 is still under investigation.
Dr. Yavuz Dizdar’s multiple allegations around the COVID-19. Dr. Dizdar is an oncologist, not an expert in the field. The allegations are based on the interpretation, not scientific evidence.
An audio clip suggests that the WHO has advised a lockdown. A source from the WHO confirmed that the organization has not put out any such information as heard on the viral audio clip.

Saddam Hussein talked about coronavirus to his cabinet and army in the nineties. He said that America has threatened him to spread this virus if he doesn’t follow their command. The viral video is a doctored version of the original video shared by Associated Press in 2015. The audios of both the videos are different not only in terms of their content but voice as well. In the original AP video, Saddam Hussein does not mention the word ‘virus’ or ‘coronavirus.’

Hospitals are advising people to wear gloves at petrol pumps. The hospital named in the message confirmed that it did not issue this advice, and health authorities, including the Chief Medical Officer, said the public is not being advised to do this.
Gargling with warm salt water can cure from the coronavirus. Post claiming gargling with warm salt water can save from coronavirus is fake as per health organizations and experts.
Claim that the outbreak of COVID-19 is not real. WHO, CDC, ECDC, Ministry of Health as well as multiple other agencies claim the outbreak is real.
Claim that the outbreak of the virus was caused by 5G. No proof to link 5G network with the outbreak of the virus.

Elderly people who are caught wandering outside in Brazil will have their pensions canceled by the government. INSS (government body responsible for paying the pensions to retirees) says no such measure has been considered.

Photos show Maju Coutinho (a well known Brazilian journalist) walking around in Leblon beach with her boyfriend, even though she is urging people to stay inside during the pandemic. Pictures are from 2019.
Burglars are disguised as health agents to invade and rob apartment buildings in Belo Horizonte and Goiânia. Police forces from Goiás and Minas Gerais deny these claims.
Atacadão, a supermarket chain in Brazil, is distributing goods for free. You might get them if you leave a comment on the post. This is a scam used for acquiring Facebook logins and passwords.
“The chloroquine stock in Paris hospitals was robbed”. The chloroquine stocks had lowered drastically, but there have been no robbery.

This graph compares coronavirus deaths with other diseases. Specialists emphasize that the comparison is misleading because it is a new virus that is still spreading and has not reached its "maximum circulation" like the other diseases mentioned.

Romania is introducing a new law that will penalize breaking the quarantine with 15 years of imprisonment. 15 years of imprisonment is the maximum length of punishment for those who knowingly spread the contagious disease and their action results in death of others. Breaking the quarantine will be punishable up to 3 years of imprisonment or fine.

COVID-19 was created in a lab to be used as a biological weapon. Nature Medicine magazine published on 3/17/20 that scientists have found COVID-19 is very different from other coronaviruses. There is no evidence of it being manipulated or created in a lab but it is a product of "natural selection." Sources are all-Moscow related and alt-right, with conspiracy theories and antisemitism approaches
India will go under lockdown from 4/15/20 to 6/15/20. The Government Of India says this audio is fake and has no authenticity.

Viral post claims that a COVID-19 infected patient was found in Hsipaw township hospital in Myanmar. Both ministry of health and sports and Hsipaw township medical superintendent have stated the patient had not contracted the COVID-19.

“Gale of the wind” and “Neem Tree” leaves are good medicine to protect from the coronavirus. As stated by WHO still there is no official remedy or cure for COVID-19, while some of the traditional methods have symptomatic improvements.
Pope Francis ran away at a public meeting due to coronavirus fear. This video dates back to 2019 and is not related to COVID-19.

After COVID-19 outbreak in europe Muslims and non-Muslims have come out in the streets shouting praises for Allah and reading Kalma. Fact Crescendo found the viral video to be unrelated. The video dates back before the outbreak of COVID-19 in Europe. This is a demonstration march by the citizens in Hamburg, Germany in solidarity with Uyghur Muslims.

Saddam Hussein predicted the coronavirus outbreak 40 years ago. The video is edited and was shot before the Iraq war. In the video Saddam Hussein can be seen discussing prospects of war with his military advisors and son Qusay. There's no mention of coronavirus in the actual video.
Eight COVID-19 patients in Ghana have recovered. The Ghana Health Service has rejected reports that 8 coronavirus patients in Ghana have recovered.
Persons with blood type A are more prone to coronavirus. There is no scientific evidence to show that people with blood type A are more likely to get ‘COVID-19’.
People with type A blood are more prone to get the new coronavirus. The study is preliminary and there is no scientific evidence that supports the relation between type blood and Covid-19.

There’s definitive proof that chloroquine, hydroxychloroquine, are effective against COVID-19. Studies have shown some early promise, but it's not entirely solid to say the treatments work against coronavirus.
Fox News won Pulitzer for coronavirus coverage. Claim made on website that is clearly labeled as satire.
WhatsApp chain sent by a doctor at Vall d’Hebron Hospital (Barcelona) about coronavirus That doctor didn't write the chain, which makes some inaccurate claims.
Video recorded by a Muslim resident in Spain who accumulates supplies for coronavirus The product brands shown in the video are Dutch.
El País publishes that Renfe is proposing an ERTE for its employees due to the coronavirus. El Pais has not published this article and Renfe denies an ERTE is being considered.
These remarks were made by Spanish Health official Fernando Simón “9 days ago” These remarks were made on January 31, not 9 days ago.
MIlitary planes are going to fumigate the region of Comunidad Valenciana to disinfect it from coronavirus Ministry of Defense said there is not going to be such action.

Speech from Spanish King Felipe VI about coronavirus was plagiarized from the book “Palmeras en la Nieve” or “Las Palmeras.” It is not the king's speech about coronavirus, but a speech from years ago about Catalonia. This speech was later included in the book "Las Palmeras." There is no plagiarism.

A WhatsApp forward claims Prime Minister Narendra Modi called for a 14-hour long “Janta Curfew” on 3/22/20 from 7 a.m. to 9 p.m. because the lifespan of the coronavirus in one place is only 12 hours and if we all follow the Janta Curfew religiously, then the chain will be broken There is no clear information on the lifespan of the novel coronavirus. However, various studies have suggested a similar lifespan as that of other coronaviruses. PM Modi’s motive behind calling for a "Janta Curfew" was to curb the spread of novel coronavirus and the government has not claimed the Janta Curfew is called to kill the virus. The claim is misleading.

Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister YS Jagan Reddy has claimed that Paracetamol is the only medication for coronavirus. It is evident from our findings and Dr. Pandey’s testimony that Paracetamol can help with coronavirus symptoms but cannot entirely cure it. We also found there are many medications that can help with coronavirus.

The United States of America threatened Iraq with coronavirus in 1990. According to the AP Archive description, Saddam Hussein said, “If God wills it and we have to run after the enemy, then we will do it.” Also, in AP’s description, we found that Saddam Hussein did not use the word "coronavirus" in the original video.
Education Ministry will approve the exams of every student in Spain. The Ministry of Education debunks this claim.
Vladimir Putin accused the “rest of the leaders” of having a plan to “reduce the world population.” The subtitles are manipulated.
People are committing suicide due to the quarantine in Spain. National Police of Valencia confirms that the images shared are from last year.
The new coronavirus created by China in a laboratory to “kill 1% of its population”. There is no evidence that coronavirus was created to kill 1% of Chinese population.

Don’t take NSAIDs. This medicine worsens the symptom. The French health minister has made a similar statement while the health authorities of EU, UK and Taiwan said there is no enough evidence to support that claim.
If you see a person wearing a white wristband, leave him alone. He is under quarantine. Electronic wristband are implemented in Hong Kong, not Taiwan. The picture is miscaptioned.

The symptoms of the first nine days when one contracts COVID-19. COVID-19 patients don't have the exact same symptoms. The most common symptoms are fever, tiredness and dry cough. Some patients may have aches and pains, nasal congestion, runny nose, sore throat or diarrhea.
Many foreigners wiped their saliva onto the handle of Taipei’s metro to spread COVID-19. The videos were filmed in Hong Kong and Brussels, not in Taiwan.

The spokesman for Chinese Foreign Ministry Zhao Lijian: American CDC admitted that COVID-19 patients were misdiagnosed as flu. U.S. Army is responsible for the outbreak in Wuhan. China's Foreign Ministry spokesman Zhao Lijian tweeted and commanded.
University of Vienna declares Ibuprofen makes the COVID-19 disease worse. University of Vienna denied the research. The relation between Ibuprofen intake and COVID-19 is still under investigation.
Dr. Yavuz Dizdar’s multiple allegations around the COVID-19. Dr. Dizdar is an oncologist, not an expert in the field. The allegations are based on the interpretation, not scientific evidence.
An audio clip suggests that the WHO has advised a lockdown. A source from the WHO confirmed that the organization has not put out any such information as heard on the viral audio clip.

In an Ethiopian Airlines flight from Italy to Addis Ababa airport this evening, most of the passengers are infected with the virus, and there is no strength except in God. The visuals actually pertain to a mock rescue drill that took place at Blaise Diagne Airport near the town of Diass, Senegal. The incident dates back to 28 November 2019 and was a simple simulation aimed at evaluating the capacity to respond to various crises that may arise during airport operations.

Saddam Hussein talked about coronavirus to his cabinet and army in the nineties. He said that America has threatened him to spread this virus if he doesn’t follow their command. The viral video is a doctored version of the original video shared by Associated Press in 2015. The audios of both the videos are different not only in terms of their content but voice as well. In the original AP video, Saddam Hussein does not mention the word ‘virus’ or ‘coronavirus.’

Janta curfew in India will help break the chain of transmission. The WHO has maintained that it is not certain how long the virus that causes COVID-19 survives on surfaces, but it seems to behave like other coronaviruses.

Hospitals are advising people to wear gloves at petrol pumps. The hospital named in the message confirmed that it did not issue this advice, and health authorities, including the Chief Medical Officer, said the public is not being advised to do this.
Gargling with warm salt water can cure from the coronavirus. Post claiming gargling with warm salt water can save from coronavirus is fake as per health organizations and experts.

The original form of the Corona COVID-19 virus after being enlarged 2,600 times Both ministry of health and sports and Sipaw township medical superintendent have issued patient had not contracted the COVID-19.

Video of the American Army distributing the coronavirus in China. The man in the first video is a train passenger in Belgium who is drunk. The man in the second video is a company manager in Hong Kong who intentionally made a parody video. The narrative that contains the conspiracy theory "the American army is the spreader of the coronavirus COVID-19 virus to China" comes from one Chinese official who has not been able to prove it.

Gargling with warm water and salt or vinegar can kill coronavirus. An image shared on WhatsApp claims that gargling with warm water and salt or vinegar can kill COVID-19. There is no evidence that asserts the claims. The WHO says there is no medicine or household remedy to treat coronavirus.

President Donald Trump tried to buy a vaccine developed in Germany. In an audio, a woman said that Trump tried to buy a vaccine that was developed in Germany. However, the German CureVac Laboratory denied the allegations on 3/16/20.

A WhatsApp message resembling an Nigerian CDC circular says Nigeria has not placed a travel ban or provided quarantine measures for travellers from countries with coronavirus cases. When the message was received, Nigeria was yet to establish travel restrictions; it has since imposed them on 13 high-risk countries. Contrary to the claim, have always been quarantine measures for migrants into the country.
University of Vienna declares Ibuprofen makes the COVID-19 disease worse. University of Vienna denied the research. The relation between Ibuprofen intake and COVID-19 is still under investigation.
Spain is the European country where the coronavirus is more lethal. Spain is not the European country where the coronavirus is most lethal; it is Italy.

Spaniards need to carry a work certificate or purchase receipts to justify to the Security Forces why they have taken to the streets under the state of alarm. It is not mandatory, but it helps to facilitate police controls.
Chloroquine cures COVID-19. Studies on chloroquine are ongoing and are not conclusive.

A post has been shared tens of thousands of times on Facebook and Twitter which claims that a factory in the Australian city of Melbourne has been hoarding essential supplies including baby formula, toilet paper and hand sanitiser for export to China during the novel coronavirus pandemic. The claim is false; police said the accusation was "false". The company cited in the misleading posts also refuted the claim.

Chloroquine was forbidden by a French government decree in January. The legal decree did not forbid chloroquine, but sets up a new requirement for a prescription. This change followed a recommendation of the National Agence of Medicine (ANSM), made on 12/13/19, before the outbreak of coronavirus.

A post giving a nurse’s advice not to be infected by coronavirus. The nurse is called Claire Magne and works at hospitals in Toulouse, or in Marseille, depending on publications. Quoted hospitals in the publications both denied to AFP having a Claire Magne working for them.

An audio circulating on WhatsApp says the way to end the COVID-19 pandemic is by “creating herd immunity groups.” Supposedly, it is a group of people who, thanks to their “positive thoughts and diet,,” manage to “alkalize their body” and prevent the virus from spreading. Immunity is not achieved through food or the mind.
Deputy of the Movement to Socialism (MAS) in Bolivia, Juana Quispe Ari: USA created the anthrax disease. Medical information about the disease explains why this is not true.
Bolivian Government Minister, Arturo Murillo, said that COVID-19 “is a type of cold”. The Bolivian former minister of Health, Guillermo Cuentas Yañez replies: “In no way it is a cold”.

The Whatsapp audio that states absolute quarantine in Bolivia is from Andrés Rojas, the CEO of Bolivia TV. Bolivia Verifica contacted the deputy of Movement of Socialism (MAS), Franklin Flores, who denied that the audio is from Bolivia. He also explained that when it (The state of Bolivia) comes to emergency, no law projects are carried out.

Ugandan landlords have been asked by the government to stop collecting rent as citizens stay home to fight COVID-19. A letter allegedly from State House Uganda directing landlords in the country to stop collecting rent as Ugandans stay home to fight COVID-19 is not authentic.
An article claims that a Kenyan died from COVID-19 on 3/20/20. The article is false.

An image of coffins showing the victims of COVID-19 in Italy. A Facebook post with an image claiming to show the victims of COVID-19 in Italy uses a photo of the coffins of African immigrants who drowned off the coast near Lampedusa in 2013.
Persons with blood type A are more prone to coronavirus. There is no scientific evidence to show that people with blood type A are more likely to get ‘Covid-19’.
An image of coffins in Italy. The image was taken in 2013.

President Rodrigo Duterte said COVID-19, the disease caused by the novel coronavirus, is only transmitted through contact with other people. The novel coronavirus is known to spread mainly from person to person, but it can also spread through infected surfaces or objects.

U.S. President Donald Trump said in a White House briefing on 3/20/20 that chloroquine and hydroxychloroquine, which are often used to treat malaria, have been approved by the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) for treatment of COVID-19. Chloroquine or hydroxychloroquine is FDA-approved for treating malaria, lupus and rheumatoid arthritis, but not COVID-19. There is no official cure for the disease as of 3/25/20.

Says truck drivers are being turned away from fast-food restaurants during the COVID-19 pandemic. Truck drivers are having issues getting meals at some fast-food chains with shuttered dining rooms. Their rigs can't fit in drive-thru lanes and they aren't allowed to walk up and order at the window.
This picture show dozens of coffins in Italy because of the coronavirus. This pictures has been taken in 2013, it has no links with the current pandemia.
It is forbidden to be more than one in a car in France during the lockdown. You have to follow some rules, but it is not always forbidden.
1720, 1919, 2020… Every hundred years, a pandemia “cleans” the Earth. Multiples pandemia occurred outside of this timeframe.
The French Education Minister has postponed the summer holidays because of the coronavirus outbreak. The minister said the measure is not being considered at the moment.

“Wisconsin is the only state where all Republicans voted against protecting its citizens.” Wisconsin is indeed the only one of the 50 states where all Republicans voted no. But it’s a bit of an exaggeration to describe that vote as “against protecting its citizens.”

“Fish tank additive may treat coronavirus.” Fish-tank cleaners containing chloroquine cannot be substituted for prescription drugs used to treat malaria. The FDA says you should not take chloroquine unless it has been prescribed by a doctor and obtained from a legitimate source.

Romania is introducing a new law that will penalize breaking the quarantine with 15 years of imprisonment. 15 years of imprisonment is the maximum length of punishment for those who knowingly spread the contagious disease and their action results in death of others. Breaking the quarantine will be punishable up to 3 years of imprisonment or fine.

Italian doctor saying no one has died from coronavirus. The source is from late February when the coronavirus outbreak in Italy wasn't that significant. At the moment, this doctor has changed his position on coronavirus and casualties.

Audio message warns of the arrival of COVID-19 at Suba hospital in Columbia. Health entities in the capital confirmed that this is misinformation. So far, there are no cases of coronavirus in the Suba hospital.

Audio clip of a conversation claiming that Government of India will announce shutdown of the country in the coming days from 4/15/20 to 6/15/20 in the wake of the coronavirus outbreak PIB found the audio clip of the phone conversation discussing a "complete lockdown" of the country to be fake. WHO India has also confirmed the audio is fake.

People shouting “Allahu Akbar” in Europe after the coronavirus outbreak. The video is not related to the COVID-19 outbreak in Europe.
