It was found on the internet since 1/13/20, and the first COVID-19 case in Europe was reported on 1/24/20. The video was taken in Germany, where the first COVID-19 case was reported on 1/28/20.

Government of India has announced a “National Lockdown” in the country from 3/20/20. The Government of India has not announced a "National Lockdown" in the country from 3/20/20. PM Modi, in his recent address to the nation about the coronavirus outbreak, asked people to practice social distancing and to stay home as much as possible for the coming few weeks to combat COVID-19. The Press Information Bureau (PIB) said the message is fake.

Indian PM Modi is providing free masks to people under Swachh Bharat Mission to protect them from the coronavirus outbreak. The website in the post is dubious and there is no government scheme of PM Modi under which free masks are being provided to people. The Press Information Bureau (PIB) said there is no central government scheme that provides free masks to people to protect them from the coronavirus outbreak.

Recently, Petrol companies reduced Rs. 6.40 on petrol and on Diesel Rs. 6.80. The petrol and diesel price have not reduced by Rs.6:40 and Rs.6.80 respectively. Petrol and diesel prices have come down by about Rs.2 in the last three weeks.
Saudi English-language magazine Sayidaty addresses novel coronavirus since 2013 The magazine addressed the Middle East respiratory coronavirus back then, which means the claim is misleading.
Brazilian President declares “Gaza is the only coronavirus free city”. Misbar investigated the claim and found that the Arabic translation accompanying the video is fake.

Italian prime minister Conte: we lost control over the coronavirus, everything is in the hands of God. Misbar investigated the claim and found that it is fake; no such statement had been released from the PM on any official record.
Video shows a woman falling down in Jeddah. Misbar investigated the video and found that the woman is mentally unstable, which caused her to fall, according to Saudi authorities.
Coronavirus fears in Germany result in large crowds outside the supermarket. The viral video is 9 years old and has nothing to do with COVID-19.
Donald Trump said, “People are dying who have never died before” The quote has been on the internet for over a decade attributing it to different people at different times.

Not a single Muslim died of coronavirus in China. There is no such claim made by China so far that not a single Muslim has died of coronavirus. China has not released a list of people who have died from coronavirus.

You shouldn’t open your windows. A study published in the New England Journal of Medicine warned that the novel coronavirus remains viable for up to three hours in the air, four hours on copper coins, a whole day on cardboard surfaces and as long as two or three days on plastic surfaces or stainless steel faucets. This scientific data went viral on social media as an oversimplified, false message: “The virus no longer spreads simply by being in contact with infected people or in places where the infected have been. The virus is now in the air. We have entered a new phase, ” reads an audio message sent around on Whatsapp. However, research by the United States National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases published in the New England Journal of Medicine mentions no such new phase. To date, the WHO reports that the viability of the novel coronavirus in the air does not imply that the contagion is like measles, which can live up to two hours in the air after an infected person has coughed or sneezed.

The coronavirus Aid, Relief, and Economic Security Act gives members of Congress a pay increase. No version of the coronavirus Aid, Relief, and Economic Security Act grants pay raises for members of Congress.

Because of the COVID-19 epidemic, an ice rink is turned to a morgue in Mulhouse (France). The rumor that spread on social networks was denied by the city, the president of the hockey team and by a witness with photos. Also, an ice rink would not be an efficient morgue.
Five helicopters are spraying disinfectants over German cities. There are no helicopters spraying disinfectants over Germany and there are no plans to do so.
Favipiravir is a miracle cure for COVID-19. Favipiravir is among the drugs being tested to treat COVID-19 but there's no proof it can cure the disease.
Arbidol is a miracle cure for COVID-19. Arbidol is among the drugs being tested to treat COVID-19 but there's no proof it can cure the disease.

A post claims that there are no cases of the new coronavirus in Russia. In the day that the post was published there were already 147 people infected with COVID-19, according to the national authorities.

Using hot air from a hair dryer on sinuses can prevent and treat COVID-19 No evidence supports this theory. Directing hot air to sinuses will make them dry which cause tiny tears that may increase the risk of COVID-19.
A runny nose is not a COVID-19 symptom. A fever and dry cough are the most common symptoms of COVID-19. Runny nose also one. In Thailand, 25% of patients had a runny nose.

A video has been viewed thousands of times on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and YouTube in March 2020 alongside a claim that it shows police in Spain detaining people during a lockdown due to the coronavirus pandemic. The claim is false. The video has circulated in reports about an anti-government protest in Azerbaijan in October 2019.

Romania has changed the law so that those who break the quarantine will face 15 years in prison. 15 years is maximum potential punishment (from 7 up to 15 years of imprisonment) but not for those who break the quarantine; it is for those infected who willingly spread contagious disease resulting in the death of other people.

Recording of a conversation where one claims to be a friend of the WHO India Director’s brother, Saurabh, who gave him information that India will go into a complete lockdown mode from 4/15/20April to 6/15/20. WHO’s official in SEARO confirmed the viral audio on social media is "fake."
Bitter gourd juice can cure coronavirus in just two hours. PIB India clarified that this viral message is fake. According to the WHO, there is no cure for coronavirus.
A photo of coffins of dead people as a result of the new coronavirus. The images were taken in October 2013.
People with type A blood are more prone to get the new coronavirus. The study is preliminary and there is no scientific evidence that supports the relation between blood type and COVID-19.
Persons with type A blood are more prone to the coronavirus. There is no scientific evidence to show that people with type A blood are more likely to get COVID-19.
Coronavirus is spreading rapidly on gas pumps. Experts confirm it can spread on gas pumps but not more than on any other location.

Retirement cut for elderly people who take to the streets during quarantine. Message circulating on WhatsApp simulates a Social Security statement and cites a provisional measure, which is unrelated to the COVID-19 pandemic.
Ambev company will distribute hand sanitizer to the population. The company will distribute alcoholic gel to health establishments, not to the entire population.

Using sauna or aiming a hairdryer at one’s nose will kill the coronavirus. Expert in infectious diseases said it won't make any impact against coronavirus, and the heat could be damaging if excessive.
Belgium’s health minister banned sex inside or with 3 or more people. This is a satirical article.
Bill Gates has access to your DNA and ownership in WHO. Gates is not behind testing because each country does that themselves.

Coronavirus is an illusion and the cause of COVID-19 is the 5G signal. The virus was found in the secretions of patients all over the world which is detected by PCR. COVID-19 is present in countries that didn't support 5G until now.
If everybody was vegan, we wouldn’t see a coronavirus epidemic. Infograph in English. It's impossible to prevent coronavirus on a planet co-inhabited by humans and animals.

Cattle vaccine proofs that coronavirus has existed for years and that there already is a vaccine. Photo showing the cattle vaccine produced by the American medical company ScourGuard 4KC. "The coronavirus is not new at all, and cattle have been vaccinated against the virus for years," reads a statement that is widely shared on social media. But there are two different branches of the same virus, which is why vaccination for cattle does not work against COVID-19 disease, which is currently ravaging the world.
The PCR tests have a false result in 30 to 50 percent of cases, they are not reliable. There is no proof for this claim, experts say the test is reliable.

Muslim Doctor died while treating people infected with coronavirus in Delhi The viral post is fake. The muslim doctor, as shown in the viral post, did not die while treating people infected with coronavirus in Delhi.
A sanitary Glade product says it is effective against the coronavirus. No studies have yet been done to demonstrate Glade effectiveness on COVID-19

The Mexican government is going to spray the residents with toxic substances. They will also inject villagers with COVID-19. Consequently, some residents closed roads. The authorities have already denied these claims. This disinformation is a mixture of other false statements that have also already been denied.

The new coronavirus was patented by the Pasteur Institute. Although the Pasteur Institute has a 2004 coronavirus patent, it is not related to COVID-19. In fact, the fact that virus patents are filed does not mean that they have been created.

A video has been viewed thousands of times in multiple posts on Facebook and YouTube alongside a claim that it shows Chinese citizens converting to Islam as a result of the novel coronavirus pandemic. The claim is false; the footage actually shows an Eid-al-Fitr prayer in the Chinese city of Xining in 2015, years before the pandemic.

Scared of Coronavirus, many people in China have converted to Islam and are offering Namaaz (prayers in Islam). The video of a large number of people offering Namaaz in China was uploaded on YouTube in 2016.
Ibuprofen is not good as a possible COVID-19 treatment. The University of Vienna denied the research. The relation between Ibuprofen and COVID-19 is not clear yet.
Cuba has a vaccine against the coronavirus called Interferón. The interferon is a drug used in certain countries to mitigate the spread of COVID-19, but it is not a vaccine.
Cuba’s health ministry, Dr. Hala, has given the vaccine against the coronavirus to China. For the moment, there is no vaccine against COVID-19.
The parks of Adra, in Spain, are being fumigated with poison. Local and national police explain to Newtral.es that it is not true.

Katy Perry, Madonna and Black Sabbath shared videos of Italy’s flash mob with fake audio. All the videos have real images but fake audios. In the first case – Katy Perry – Italians are singing the song Roar instead of the national anthem (real video). In the second case – Madonna and Black Sabbath – Italians are singing I rise or War pigs instead of Macarena (real video).

Coronavirus stays in throat for four days before arriving lungs. Gargling with salt water or vinegar kills the coronavirus. There is no evidence that rinsing your mouth with salty water or vinegar can prevent COVID-19.
A magic remedy to prevent COVID-19: mix brown sugar, ginger, garlic, and Chinese leek, boil them and drink it. There is no evidence that the recipe can prevent or cure COVID-19.
Remedy recipe: (1) boil tea with bitter melon. (2) Lemon juice with salt or Chinese mesona There is no evidence that the recipe can prevent or cure COVID-19.
Video shows how American soldiers spread coronavirus during 7th CISM Military World Game in Wuhan. The video happened in Brussels on march. It has not happened in Wuhan or Taipei.

Italians played the Chinese national anthem to thank China. People yelled “Grazie Cina”. It's a video of Italian expressing gratitude to medical staff. The soundtrack of "Grazie China" and the Chinese national anthem was edited into the original video
A dog in Hong Kong died of COVID-19. Vets shared the test results with Teyit. Dog's tests were negative for COVID-19.
Video shows a balcony party in the Turkish capital Ankara due to quarantine. The video is originally from Spain and manipulated with a Turkish song on top of it.
Korean series My Secret Terrius predicted the outbreak in advance. The series was about an international conspiracy, not an outbreak. The fictional virus was quite different from the current one.

Sitting in the sunlight will help cure coronavirus. The answer to this statement, according to doctors, is more than just true or false. Professor Ramanan Laxminarayan, Director of Centre for Disease Dynamics, Economics and Policy (CDDEP) said that, “We do not know how heat will affect this coronavirus as of yet. Usually, respiratory pathogens disappear in the summer and in the heat, but we have seen many cases in tropical countries too.”
Giant hornets migrated to Europe due to the outbreak of coronavirus. The authors of the article stole older material on hornets and climate change and wrote headline about coronavirus
Photo shows row of coffins in Italy. Claims that this is how Bergamo in Italy deals with the dead from the virus. The photo was taken in 2013, amidst the migration crisis.
Video showing police beating people in China, linked with the outbreak. The video shows police beating people in Hong Kong. The video was shot on the last day of August 2019.
COVID-19 existed before 2019. This is false because the coronaviruses affecting cattle or canines differ from the new virus strain affecting humans, for which no vaccine exists.

Hot air from saunas, hair dryers will prevent or treat COVID-19. This is false because an expert said these methods would not be effective, while a cell biologist said there is no evidence the virus can be treated via heat.

A purported advisory has been shared repeatedly in multiple Facebook, Twitter and WhatsApp posts that claims a disinfectant will be sprayed into the air overnight in India in an effort to kill the novel coronavirus, COVID-19. The posts urge residents to remain indoors during the spraying. The claim is false; Indian authorities said the advisory was "fake" and that no such measure had been announced.
In France, Mulhouse’s ice rink has been converted into a morgue. Mulhouse city hall and a hockey club, which is used to practising on this rink, had denied the claim.

People who replied to a French government text with texts saying they won’t respect confinement measures are now facing justice. The Nanterre Court denied having received any instruction to prosecute senders of these messages, and the messages present many inconsistencies.
The RDC government canceled every future exams for pupils, because of coronavirus. The minister of Education, Willy Bakonga, denied this claim to AFP.
Netflix is offering free access to anyone in Brazil during the coronavirus crisis. Netflix is not offering free services during the pandemic. The URL used is not a Netflix domain.
Petrobras (Brazil’s largest oil company) is closing its refineries from March 24th onwards. The alleged press release did not come from Petrobras. Refineries are not going to be shut down for now.
A man claims his dog was vaccinated for coronavirus, thus the SARS-Cov-2 is not really a new virus. Canine coronavirus (CCov) and the novel coronavirus are not the same virus.
Uber will suspend operations for 10 days in Brazil due to the pandemic. The alleged announcement did not come from Uber, and the company will not stop working during the crisis.
Popular Cardiologist Devi Shetty talking about symptoms of COVID-19. The person in question is a different doctor and not the famous cardiologist.
India asked for restriction of movement. The notification is from Malaysia and not India.
India spraying pesticides at night to prevent COVID-19. Officials stated that no pesticides were being sprayed.
Image claims to show dozens of coffins of Italians who have died from COVID-19. The photo actually shows the caskets of African migrants who died in a 2013 shipwreck off the coast of Italy.
Spaniards are violating quarantine rules. The video was recorded in October 2019 days before the exhumation of the remains of the dictator Francisco Franco.

The WHO recommended that all countries go into quarantine to combat COVID-19. In networks and the media, it has been stated that the World Health Organization, WHO, "recommended that all countries declare themselves in quarantine to combat COVID-19". However, the WHO itself denied it.

A video shows the Russian leader Vladimir Putin, giving a speech with captions that make him seem like he is rebuking world leaders. A video shared on Facebook and Twitter in which Vladimir Putin, the President of Russia, is seen giving a speech in front of a crowd. The video comes with Spanish subtitles that make it appear that he is criticizing the leaders of other countries for their recent actions. Some social network users even shared the video as if this were Putin's response to how other countries are handling the crisis.

The coronavirus was created in a biological laboratory in Wuhan. There is no evidence that 'the coronavirus comes from a biological laboratory in Wuhan,' as claimed by Mexican youtuber Alexander Backman.

Polish charity organisation WOSP has withdrawn its donation to coronavirus fight in Poland. There was no decision of backing down whatsoever. WOSP couldn't possibly donate the money it collected during public gathering as there was clearly stated goal for that gathering that can't be changed afterwards. WOSP is involved in many activities supporting coronavirus fight.
You no longer need to have contact with someone to get the coronavirus. Please click the link to read the full article

Donald Trump said about coronavirus, “People are dying who have never died before.” Ernest Hemingway said it.

IDH Hospital, the main center in Sri Lanka for treating COVID-19 patients, is in shortage of number of essentials. We contacted both doctors and health officials and confirmed that there is no shortage of goods at the hospital as of yet and the messages were fabricated.
Clean your throat with salt water or vinegar to cure coronavirus. Experts confirmed this is a false claim.
Spanish minister of agriculture called out football players for earning too much and showing lack of solidarity. The minister never made the statement attributed to her.
You should leave your shoes outside, as they carry the virus. Official sources say this is not true.
These images show coffins of COVID-19 victims in Italy. Images in question were actually taken in 2013.
Chinese claim that the virus was created in 2015 in US. There is no evidence that supports this claim.
Ibuprofen aggravates patients with the new coronavirus. There is no scientific evidence that conclusively proves ibuprofen aggravates coronavirus patients.
5G technology caused the coronavirus. Historical events were conflated, and did not back up claims with real evidence.
WHO director overstated COVID-19 fatality rate as higher than flu. CDC data and doctors said that coronavirus has a much higher mortality rate than flu.
Walmart is closing hundreds of its stores. This story is several years old, and there has been no recent announcement.
Cristiano Ronaldo bought private island to escape coronavirus. Ronaldo's management company confirmed it was false.
Trump said “people are dying who have never died before”. Searches in databases of the phrase never show up. Other fact checks confirm fabrication.
Obama family flown to private island to escape coronavirus pandemic. Website has visible disclaimers saying it is purely satire.
Link takes viewers to application for FEMA assistance in the US. Link just takes you to a meme picture.
WHO director overstated COVID-19 fatality rate as higher than flu. CDC data and doctors said that coronavirus has a much higher mortality rate than flu.
5G technology caused the coronavirus. Historical events were conflated, and did not back up claims with real evidence.
Cuba has a vaccine against the coronavirus called Interferón. The interferon is a drug used in certain countries to mitigate the spread of COVID-19, but it is not a vaccine.
Cuba’s health ministry, Dr. Hala, has given the vaccine against the coronavirus to China. For the moment, there is no vaccine against COVID-19.
The parks of Adra, in Spain, are being fumigated with poison. Local and national police explain to Newtral.es that it is not true.
Drinking water every 15 minutes helps to avoid the contagion of cononavirus. It is false that drinking water every 15 minutes helps to avoid COVID-19 by "cleaning" your throat.

Katy Perry, Madonna and Black Sabbath shared videos of Italy’s flash mob with fake audio. All the videos have real images but fake audios. In the first case – Katy Perry – Italians are singing the song Roar instead of the national anthem (real video). In the second case – Madonna and Black Sabbath – Italians are singing I rise or War pigs instead of Macarena (real video).

Coronavirus stays in throat for four days before arriving lungs. Gargling with salt water or vinegar kills the coronavirus. There is no evidence that rinsing your mouth with salty water or vinegar can prevent COVID-19.
A magic remedy to prevent COVID-19: mix brown sugar, ginger, garlic, and Chinese leek, boil them and drink it. There is no evidence that the recipe can prevent or cure COVID-19.
Video shows how American soldiers spread coronavirus during 7th CISM Military World Game in Wuhan. The video happened in Brussels on march. It has not happened in Wuhan or Taipei.

Italians played the Chinese national anthem to thank China. People yelled “Grazie Cina”. It's a video of Italian expressing gratitude to medical staff. The soundtrack of "Grazie China" and the Chinese national anthem was edited into the original video
A dog in Hong Kong died of COVID-19. Vets shared the test results with Teyit. Dog's tests were negative for COVID-19.
Video shows a balcony party in the Turkish capital Ankara due to quarantine. The video is originally from Spain and manipulated with a Turkish song on top of it.
Korean series My Secret Terrius predicted the outbreak in advance. The series was about an international conspiracy, not an outbreak. The fictional virus was quite different from the current one.

Sitting in the sunlight will help cure coronavirus. The answer to this statement, according to doctors, is more than just true or false. Professor Ramanan Laxminarayan, Director of Centre for Disease Dynamics, Economics and Policy (CDDEP) said that, “We do not know how heat will affect this coronavirus as of yet. Usually, respiratory pathogens disappear in the summer and in the heat, but we have seen many cases in tropical countries too.”

China recognizes Palestinian doctor as discoverer of coronavirus vaccine Not a single report was discovered about the discovery of the coronavirus vaccine by Palestinian doctors. Even the doctor who claimed to be the inventor of the vaccine, Manar Saadi Al-Sheenawi, was not found in the Google search engine. In addition, until now, the WHO has not announced the discovery of any vaccine that can treat COVID-19.
Drinking water every 15 minutes helps to avoid the contagion of cononavirus. It is false that drinking water every 15 minutes helps to avoid Covid-19 by "cleaning" your throat.

An audio message shared by Whatsapp users affirms that COVID-19 dies at 27° Celsius. It is still unknown whether weather and temperature will affect the spread of COVID-19. According to the United States Center for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), it is currently unknown whether the spread of COVID-19 is reduced in hot seasons.

An audio broadcast on Whatsapp indicates that garlic helps to overcome diseases such as the coronavirus. According to the World Health Organization (WHO), garlic is a healthy food that may have some antimicrobial properties. However, no evidence has been obtained that eating it protects against COVID-19.

An audio message shared by Whatsapp users affirms that COVID-19 dies at 27° Celsius. It is still unknown whether weather and temperature will affect the spread of COVID-19. According to the United States Center for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), it is currently unknown whether the spread of COVID-19 is reduced in hot seasons.

Beverages like ‘akpeteshie’, a local Ghanaian brewed spirit made from sugarcane or palm wine, can be used as a substitute for hand sanitizers. Herbal and local gin bitters often do not meet the required alcohol content for an effective hand rub. Thus, they may not be good substitutes for hand sanitizers against the COVID-19.
Allegations that garlic and a cold shower helps to avoid COVID-19. Doctors say garlic, coal and cold shower don't prevent COVID-19.
Martial law is imminent in United States. U.S. governments are not planning to implement martial law; National Guard is providing aid and support for communities.

A video of US President Donald Trump and a top US pharmaceutical executive speaking at a press conference has been viewed thousands of times in multiple Facebook, Twitter and YouTube posts alongside a claim that it shows them announcing a vaccine for the novel coronavirus, COVID-19, was “ready” to be administered. The claim is false; neither Trump nor the pharmaceutical executive make any reference to a vaccine being "ready" for distribution; as of March 2020, the World Health Organization (WHO) states there is not yet a vaccine for COVID-19.

A screenshot of a purported internal email disclosing that a bank in the Pakistani city of Rawalpindi was closed after an employee tested positive for the novel coronavirus, COVID-19, has been shared on Facebook, Twitter and WhatsApp. The claim is false; the bank said in a statement that “no employee at any” branch had tested positive for COVID-19, and that all branches remained “open and fully operative.”
Homemade recipes for alcohol gel. Making alcohol gel at home is not recommended by medical authorities; it can be ineffective and dangerous.
Netflix is offering free access for those in quarantine. Netflix has not announced free access; message on WhatsApp is a phishing scam.

Posts circulating on social media claim that Ugandan and Kenyan authorities have instructed landlords to stop collecting rent due to the novel coronavirus. The claim is false; the countries have issued public guidance amid the pandemic, but there has been no official communication on rent payments and government officials dismissed the reports.
Crocodiles were spotted swimming in the canals of Venice without the bustle of tourists. The photo is a composite image making up of two photographs.
The canals in Venice have become cleaner after the shutdown, attracting schools of fish and dolphins. The video was filmed in Cagliari, Italy, a harbor city 743 kilometers away from Venice.

Four men were tested positive to COVID-19 in Cameroon and ran away from the hospital. These four men published many videos on Facebook to debunk this claim. They also told AFP they lived in Italy. Cameroon's Health ministry also told AFP those four men don't belong to the group of people who are in quarantine in Cameroon.
A private lab was denied authorization to perform COVID-19 test. The government only authorizes the National Lab to perform COVID-19 tests.

Gargling salt water can protect against against COVID-19 by washing down the virus into the gut. Gargling salt water is not a recommended protective measure against COVID-19, and has been debunked by the World Health Organization.

Tanzanian club spokesman Haji S. Manara was infected with COVID-19 during his tour of The Netherlands. Tanzania's Simba Sports Club spokesman Haji S. Manara does not have COVID-19 as claimed, and he was tested after leaving Spain and when he entered the Netherlands.

The World Health Organization is offering free internet for the public to access information about COVID-19. A link circulating on WhatsApp claiming that the World Health Organization is offering free internet to help people access information on COVID-19 is a hoax.

Fake quote of Senator of the Philippines Francis “Kiko” Pangilinan saying he wants children to be exempted from the lockdown. Pangilinan did not say the quote attributed to him. News5 also said the graphic did not come from any of their official social media accounts.

Agnès Buzyn, former french minister of Health, took chloroquine out of a list of drugs that could be sold over the counter when the coronavirus started to spread. The decision was taken before the COVID-19 crisis began.

Claim that “there is no” COVID-19 virus. The coronavirus is real and infecting thousands of people around the world. As of March 19, COVID-19 had infected more than 191,000 people around the world and resulted in 7,807 deaths.

The federal government is “preparing to mobilize the national guard,” “dispatch them across the US with military” and “announce a nationwide 1 week quarantine for all citizens.” There is no evidence that the federal government is set to announce a lockdown. White House officials have repeatedly said it’s not something they’re considering at this time.

For coronavirus cases “in the U.S. 38% of those hospitalized are under 35.” The CDC reported that between mid-February and mid-March, 20% of the hospitalizations for coronavirus were for patients age 20-44 and 18% were age 45-54.

“Huge! Results From Breaking Chloroquine Study Show 100% Cure Rate For Patients Infected With The coronavirus.” A French study of 20 COVID-19 patients indicates the drug might help treat the coronavirus. But it is no “100% cure.”

According to Art. 116 of the Constitution, a “state of emergency” will be implemented in Mexico that will limit the free movement of people to combat the #COVID-19 epidemic. The mentioned article is in the Spanish Constitution, not in the Mexican. Article 116 of the Spanish Constitution speaks of the state of alarm. And to avoid leaving you in doubt, constitutional 116 (the one in Mexico) talks about the division of powers, not "states of emergency."

Video broadcast on networks allegedly shows the ‘first killed by COVID-19 in Ibagué’, in Columbia. The images were taken out of context. It is actually the first coronavirus patient in this city to be discharged from the hospital.

Video of passengers infected with coronavirus on an Ethiopian Airlines flight from Italy that reached Addis Ababa airport. The video is of an ‘Emergency Exercise’ at Blaise Diagne International Airport (Senegal) in November 2019. So, the video is of a drill that was conducted a month earlier before the first coronavirus case was detected in China.

Press Release on movement restriction for COVID-19 outbreak by National Security Council, PMO (India). The press release in the post was issued by the Malaysian Government, not by the Indian Government.

BBMP (Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike) will be spraying medicine in the air after 10 PM tonight in order to kill COVID-19. The BBMP Commissioner and the Mayor have clarified that the message is just a rumor and the BBMP has no such plans to spray any medicine for COVID-19.

Scientists have found that drinking bitter gourd juice can cure coronavirus. The World Health Organization (WHO) or the Ministry for Health & Family Welfare (India) hasn't announced that drinking bitter gourd juice will cure coronavirus. The Press Information Bureau (PIB) has clarified that the message is ‘fake’.

This video shows goats affected by the coronavirus. The video is an old one. It was taken before the recent coronavirus outbreak. Also, the Minister for Animal Husbandry, Dairying and Fisheries has clarified that there is no evidence to show that eating mutton can transmit coronavirus.

Gargling warm water with either salt or vinegar can eliminate coronavirus. The World Health Organisation (WHO) or Indian government has not mentioned anywhere that the gargling of warm water with salt or vinegar can eliminate coronavirus. Indian government’s Press Information Bureau (PIB) has also said that the message that was circulating on social media is fake.
An audio clip claiming to be of renowned heart surgeon Dr Devi Shetty is going viral on Facebook, Twitter, and WhatsApp. The viral clip has been falsely attributed to Dr Devi Shetty.

Indian government to spray medicine in the air overnight to kill coronavirus. There is no such government order for residents of Chandigarh, Bengaluru, or any other city that government would spread medicine in air to destroy coronavirus.
Leader of North Korea Kim Jong-Un visits an infected woman without wearing a mask. The photo dates back to April 2018.
French company produces the first coronavirus drug. There no cure for COVID-19 as of now and the proposed drug has dangerous side effects when used without doctor consultation.
This photo of coffins in Italy is linked to the coronavirus. The photo shows deaths due to the migrant crisis, several years ago.

Qatari Deputy Minister of Health leaves an Interview because of coronavirus The claim isn't true. While in an interview, the host broke his chair which made the interviewee stand to help him. The video shows this.

Videos showing police raids or army raids against people who don’t respect confinement measures in Algeria or Morocco. The video was shot on March 7th, 2020. It shows the dispersal of an anti-government demonstration by the security forces, with no link with confinement measures or coronavirus.
Most of the passengers in an Ethiopian airlines flight from Italy are infected with coronavirus. The viral video is from a mock drill from Senegal.

Says imposters in hazmat suits are going door to door in Stockton, California, saying they are checking residents for fever or COVID-19, but they “will enter your home and physically attempt robbery.” Posts around the nation warn people not to open their doors to imposters who say they are doing coronavirus testing but actually want to rob the residents. Like other such claims, this one about an alleged scam in Stockton, Calif., is false, according to police.
Drinking bitter gourd juice cures the coronavirus. There is no proven evidence from any research so far which establishes that bitter gourd juice cures coronavirus.

A photo making the rounds on social media claims to show people who have died from the coronavirus in Italy. The coffins in the photo are those of the victims of the Lampedusa maritime tragedy in 2013.

A Russian drug called Arbidol, cures coronavirus. The claim for medical advice has been invented, the analysis says, and the WHO is definitely not putting the drink on its list of recommendations.Although there have been some clinical trials showing that Arbidol has anti-influenza and some other viral infections, both the WHO and the US Food and Drug Administration have not put it on their lists of drugs to treat viral illnesses.

Interferon, that has been bought by the Venezuelan and Salvadoran governments, are proven effective in treating coronavirus. Before those two countries even registered cases of infected people, the Venezuelan and Salvadoran governments bought the antiviral called Interferon to "cure" possible future patients. But there is still little scientific evidence in regards to the efficacy of this medicine, and it cannot be used for all infected patients.

COVID-19 was invented and patented years ago by the Institut Pasteur, a French medical research center The patent, filed in 2004, relates to vaccinal research on SARS-CoV-1, responsible for the SARS epidemic in 2002 and 2003, and not the SARS-CoV-2, that causes the current COVID-19 epidemic.

During the pandemic, Macedonian citizens will have no bread. The information was sharply denied by the Minister of Economy Kreshnik Bekteshi, who assured there is enough flour and wheat and imports from Serbia, Bulgaria and Hungary are also allowed.
Vladimir Putin says that world leaders are trying to reduce the population. The Spanish subtitles on the video are manipulated and the video is from 2016.

List of UNICEF recommendations against COVID-19 includes drinking hot water. All the recommendations issued by Unicef are focused on the care of children and families during the pandemic. None of those included in the viral chain belong to or were cited by Unicef.
Video shows Italy turning to Islam after giving up by the Italian authorities The video is from a protest in Hamburg, Germany, in solidarity with Uyghurs, which was held 18 january 2020.

Biden claims that Trump eliminated the White House pandemic office. One can see the dueling narratives here, neither entirely incorrect. The office — as set up by Obama — was folded into another office. Thus, one could claim the office was eliminated. But the staff slots did not disappear and at least initially the key mission of team remained a priority. So one can also claim nothing changed and thus Biden’s criticism is overstated.
WHO offers free data for coronavirus info. The post is false and links in the post lead to an external website, potentially with harmful malware.
Italian Prime Minister Conte has foregone 20% of his salary due to COVID-19. Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte decided to cut his salary on October 2018, months before the outbreak of COVID-19 in Italy.

The Italian National Guard has declared that it will apply a stricter set of rules, called BLS-4, if COVID-19 has not been contained by April the 15th. The authorities have officially denied this fact.

Utility companies Manila Electric Company (Meralco) and Maynilad Water Services Inc are waiving their billings for March 2020 due to the coronavirus crisis. The graphic did not come from the official channels of Meralco and Maynilad. The two utility services are only offering an extension for payments, not cancellation of fees.
Study proves wrong conspiracy theory that China created coronavirus for economic purposes. Scientists have shown that SARS-CoV-2 characteristics indicate a natural origin.

A purported advisory has been shared repeatedly in multiple Facebook, Twitter and WhatsApp posts that claims a disinfectant will be sprayed into the air overnight in India in an effort to kill the novel coronavirus, COVID-19. The posts urge residents to remain indoors during the spraying. The claim is false; Indian authorities said the advisory was "fake" and that no such measure had been announced.
Drink water every 15 minutes to avoid coronavirus. It is false that drinking water every 15 minutes helps to avoid COVID-19 by "cleaning" your throat.
Drinking water every 15 minutes helps to avoid the contagion of coronavirus. It is false that drinking water every 15 minutes helps to avoid COVID-19 by "cleaning" your throat.

An audio shared on WhatsApp indicates that the coronavirus “is a psychosocial” and “a political war”. Coronavirus is not a "psychosocial" or "political war". To date, the COVID-19 virus has caused nearly 21,000 deaths in 187 countries where nearly 462,000 cases have been confirmed, according to the latest report released on Wednesday, March 26 by the World Health Organization (WHO). This was one of the audios that circulated on WhatsApp the day that Peruvian President Martín Vizcarra declared the national emergency and ordered the closure of the borders.

An audio broadcast on Whatsapp indicates that garlic helps to overcome diseases such as the coronavirus. According to the World Health Organization (WHO), garlic is a healthy food that may have some antimicrobial properties. However, no evidence has been obtained that eating it protects against COVID-19.

An audio message shared by Whatsapp users affirms that COVID-19 dies at 27° Celsius. It is still unknown whether weather and temperature will affect the spread of COVID-19. According to the United States Center for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), it is currently unknown whether the spread of COVID-19 is reduced in hot seasons.

A purported advisory has been shared repeatedly in multiple Facebook, Twitter and WhatsApp posts that claims a disinfectant will be sprayed into the air overnight in India in an effort to kill the novel coronavirus, COVID-19. The posts urge residents to remain indoors during the spraying. The claim is false; Indian authorities said the advisory was "fake" and that no such measure had been announced.

The quarantine will last until the end of May in Ukraine. The official sources on the day when the news appeared have not published such information. The authors of the article confused the end date of the tax holidays and the end day of the quarantine.

Indian City Bangalore Municipal Corp. requested people to stay at home and lock down houses as they will be spraying medicine to kill coronavirus. Municipal commissioner of the city said he has no such plans of spraying medicines to kill COVID-19.
Shoes are an important vector for the transmission of coronavirus. A virologist confirmed that shoes are not a significant vector of transmission.
Drinking water every 15 minutes prevents the coronavirus. There is anything about drinking water in the list to precaution measures recommended by the World Health Organization.
Using a non-dominant hand to open doors is a way to prevent coronavirus. Doctors recommend washing hands or using hand sanitizer.
Italian prime minister cries because there is nothing they can do to treat COVID-19 and the situation is out of control. No such statement of despair was made by the Italian prime minister.

A WhatsApp message said that coronavirus has pH range 5.5 to 8.5; hence, people can counteract its effect by consuming fruits to neutralise the pH activity. Expert advice suggests that the novel coronavirus, SARSCov2 does not have its own pH. Besides, the coronavirus referred to in the referenced article was not SARSCov2. More so, the pH attributed to the fruits by the author, suggesting they were alkaline was wrong; our findings show that they are acidic.

Tank engine apparently freighting coronavirus. Image showing a tank engine with ‘COVID-19’ stenciled on the side. The picture is misleading. Also, according to the guidelines, the text is placed on the wrong area of the tank.

Coronavirus vaccine just around the corner. Numerous Danish news reports stating that all kinds of vaccines are just about ready. It is clear from Danish authorities and experts that there may continue to be long-term prospects for Danish doctors to vaccinate exposed, for whom the coronavirus can be fatal.

Add ‘ICE’ (in case of emergency) to your phone contacts so paramedics will know who to call. Old chain letter on Facebook going viral again during the coronavirus epidemic. Neither medical officers, the corps, nor the police recommend that you do so. On the contrary, the police ask that it be left to the police to contact relatives of an injured person.

A Whatsapp message that pretends to be from the German Robert Koch Institute advises to take 100 grams of alcohol a day because this would help to desinfect the throat and kill the coronavirus. To drink alcohol doesn't help to prevent an infection, indeed it can even weaken the immune system to consume too much alcohol

Claim that Sweden has refused to fight coronavirus. The measures taken by Swedish authorities to fight the novel coronavirus are not the most stringent ones. However, making a claim that Sweden refused to fight the coronavirus is false.

A 2015 study is the proof that SARS-CoV-2 was made in a lab from combining two other viruses and that was the way it spread. The virus that is mentioned in the study in question has significant differences with SARS-CoV-2, there is no evidence that these two viruses are connected in any way or that SARS-CoV-2 was made in a lab.

A widely shared image on social media of people dressed in military fatigues walking through Clapham Junction claims to be proof that the government is locking down the area or London more widely because of the new coronavirus. This is not what the picture shows. The people pictured are not troops but are students at a military preparation college (MPC) based at a nearby Army Reserve Centre.

Philippines Vice President Leni Robredo is shown in a quote card to be advising the public to “suck in their cough” to prevent spreading the novel coronavirus. There are no reports of Robredo making such comments. The quote card is a tampered version of a graphic by media organization GMA News Online.
A video shows the Italian air force air show related to the coronavirus crisis in the country. Although the video is authentic, it dates from 2019 and is not linked to the new coronavirus.
Milk helps fighting the new coronavirus. Milk alone does not help fight the new coronavirus, but it can contribute to a balanced diet.
Gargling with warm salt water prevents Coronavirus. coronavirus cannot be cured by gargling with warm water, saltwater or vinegar.

The pandemic was planned. Economic crises are related to sunspots. Borders were never closed as a result of diseases. The claims about the planned pandemic and the relation between economic crises and sunspots are unsubstantiated. History has examples of closing borders to prevent the spread of diseases.
Helicopters are going to spread ‘medicines’ against the coronavirus in Spain. The Spanish Defense ministry denied the claim.

France has suspended payment of rent and taxes for citizens due to coronavirus crisis. The measures announced by President Emmanuel Macron are for small businesses in difficulty and include both payment deferrals and cancellations.
The exams to access university in Valencia region will be delayed to August 10, 11 and 12. The Valencian Government debunks the hoax on its official social media accounts.
The army is requisitioning coronavirus protection material in Catalonia. The Defense ministry denies the claim.

France has suspended payment of rent and taxes for citizens due to coronavirus crisis. The measures announced by President Emmanuel Macron are for small businesses in difficulty and include both payment deferrals and cancellations.
Helicopters are going to spread ‘medicines’ against the coronavirus in Spain. The Spanish Defense ministry denied the claim.

Peru has just nationalized hospitals and clinics. The Peruvian government gave a temporary order to centralize all the medical resources under the Ministry of Health authority during the emergency, but it does not include the property of clinics and private services.
There is a Russian medicine that could be use against Sars-Cov-2. It is not the case.
This picture showing lots of coffins was taken in Bergamo in 2020. The picture has been taken in Lampedusa in 2013.
Novel coronavirus is being spread via Coca-Cola. No evidence shows that the virus can be transmitted via food. Coca-Cola products are inspected.

Novel coronavirus can survive 9 days on the road; you should keep your shoes out, a doctor from Milan says. There is no Milanese doctor that says that. No evidence shows the exact survival time of the virus on the road.
Clorox Already Knew About coronavirus And coronavirus Isn’t A New Virus. The claim that the new coronavirus was known beforehand on a Clorox label shows that it kills human coronavirus is misleading.

The UNHCR said ‘migrants and illegals’ in Malaysia were resisting COVID-19 testing. The claim is false; UNHCR officials in Malaysia said the alleged statement is fake and condemned the erroneous claim for stoking “unnecessary fear and distrust”.

Javier Ortega Smith, from VOX, has said that he prefers to be infected by the new coronavirus than to “have homosexualism”. This is false; provincial health officials and the mall administrator told AFP that no cases are connected to the mall to date.
This video shows a brawl this week which took place in a supermarket in Aubervilliers, in France, because of coronavirus. This scene actually took place in May 2019, according to a police source.
This photo shows French nurses holding a sign to denounce police violence. It's a photomontage.

Facebook post claiming that French animal shelters “are overwhelmed by the abandonment of dogs and cats due to the coronavirus”. SPA president told AFP the claim was false. However, he fears a saturation of shelters, closed to the public because of containment measures.

Claim that the coronavirus was created and patented in a French institute (Institut Pasteur). The video author refers to a patent filed in 2004 but this patent concerns another type of coronavirus. Moreover, filing a patent for a virus does not mean that it was created.

Rodrigo Maia, president of the lower house of the Congress in Brazil, voted a law that forbids the president to close borders. The law is not about borders but about the rights of migrants in Brazil. And Maia didn't vote "yes" on it.

“Coronavirus victims are buried in the morning this Wednesday in Italy. Rest in peace.” The image was taken in 2013 by Tullio M. Puglia, for Getty Images. The coffins were used for the bodies of African refugees who died on a shipwreck near Lampedusa, south Italy.
Goats in Ajmer, Rajasthan were found to be COVID-19 positive. The video is old and unrelated to COVID-19.
Indian cricketer Sachin Tendulkar asked for meat shops to be banned in lieu of COVID-19. Claim was falsely attributed to the cricketer.
COVID-19 passengers being disembarked at Senegal airport. Video was of a mock drill for dealing with hostage situations.
The COVID-19 has been invented by a big French public medical institute (Institut Pasteur). Big confusion between the 2003 coronavirus and the COVID-19.

Cali in Colombia is going to be quarantined; for 14 days all commerce, supermarkets, shopping malls will be closed, no one can enter or leave by land or by plane. At the time of this publication, there had been no quarantine or trade closure in the Valle del Cauca capital, as a viral audio claimed.

A photo shows coffins of people who died because of coronavirus in Italy, and that the virus is dangerous and you should stay inside. The photo is old and shows coffins of migrants who drowned at a boat accident at Lampedusa in 2013. But the appeal to stay inside to avoid infection with coronavirus is correct.
Jobcenters (for unemployed people) close from today on in Germany. The jobcenters are not completely closed, they offer personal contact in emergency cases.
Retaining your breath for 10 seconds will help you detect the coronavirus. It is not a valid test.
People with A-blood type are more prone to get coronavirus. Study is not peer-reviewed and should not be published as established information
Egyptian doctor has invented a fluid to treat coronavirus. WHO has not informed about any cure or treatment specific to COVID-19.
Maracaibo in Venezuela is the safest city to avoid coronavirus because it’s too hot, said Unicef. Unicef said it hasn't published this kind of information.

COVID-19 is no worse than other outbreaks that have occurred in “every election year,” suggesting that the new coronavirus is being “hyped” to hurt President Donald Trump. Most of the dates cited to defend those conclusions about previous outbreaks are misleading or incorrect.

Australian researchers have found that bananas can help prevent infection of COVID-19. The post is false. There is no proof that bananas can boost one’s immune system and prevent the disease caused by coronavirus. At present there are no medicines to cure COVID-19.
Hot air from hair dryers can kill the coronavirus. Blowing hot air from a hair dryer is not a cure nor a preventive measure against coronavirus. There is no cure for coronavirus as of now.

Kitchen foods plus morning sunshine can prevent and cure coronavirus. At present there is no evidence to prove that eating kitchen foods like onion, garlic and lemon does prevent or cure COVID-19 and the same is not recommended by WHO.
Man contracts COVID-19 by eating mutton. It's a fake news card and the news channel has denied publishing any such news.
A video shows Chinese police crackdown on suspected COVID-19 patients. This is an old video from Hong Kong showing riot police storm a metro station to crack down on political protesters in the city.
Image of coffins from Italy showing carnage due to recent COVID-19 outbreak. The image is 7 years old and shows dead bodies of African immigrants who died while entering Italy.

Oman is releasing a special chemical into the sky to eradicate coronavirus with military helicopters. The Oman health minister said that they had never conducted such operations with military helicopters. When the same message went viral in India, the Press Information Bureau has said that it is a fake message.

With self-checkup you can find out if you are infected with coronavirus. Neither the World Health Organization (WHO) nor the government of India has stated anywhere that the coronavirus infection can be evaluated by the breath test as mentioned in the post. Some doctors have also mentioned that breath test cannot help in finding out if the person is infected with coronavirus.
A train carrying vaccines with the inscription “COVID-19.” Content seems to be digitally edited, and there is no inscription in that location on such trains.
Trump Is Promising To Send Americans Checks – Only After Checking People’s Social Media History. This is a false tweet, though there have been real suggestions to have a stimulus package.

“Ministry of Health ITALY released a small video, HOW the virus spreads!!!… BEST VIDEO. Please see ..how innocently it spread. SOAP is the remedy CLEAN/ WASH ur Hands always” The viral video was not released by the health ministry of Italy in the wake of coronavirus but has been on YouTube for a long time. We reached the conclusion that the viral claim is ‘Misleading’.

The viral video claims to show the visuals of China police personnel trying to control the patients allegedly suffering from the pandemic. The viral video has nothing to do with the coronavirus outbreak and is related to police storming the metro in the wake of Hong Kong protests.

Coronavirus can be cured by sniffing clove and camphor and by drinking water, the virus will go to the stomach and the acid in the stomach will kill the virus. Dr. Mohammad Imran, an Ayurveda doctor, said, “It is merely a rumor which has gone viral on social media .There is no scientific evidence which backs the claim that sniffing clove and camphor can cure coronavirus. However, natural camphor and clove does have certain health benefits as it can cure fungus and bacteria”.

As coronavirus outbreak surges, PM Narendra Modi has decided to facilitate fellow countrymen with free masks under the ‘Swacch Bharat’ scheme. The government has not announced any such scheme under which it is aimed to provide free masks. The viral webpage may be a part of the decade-old phishing technique or it may be an attempt to collect the data. However, the intent behind creating this webpage is not yet clear but it is crystal clear that the webpage does not belong to Indian govt and might be a venture of some fraudulent organization.

Chinese intelligence officer says the novel coronavirus as a biological weapon invented by China. The viral post also claims that the damage caused by the pandemic is being normalized by the Chinese officials. The website which has published the alleged testimony of the said Chinese intelligence officer has published the report with the headline, “CORONA UNMASKED: Chinese Intelligence Officer Reveals True Magnitude of China’s Fake “Coronavirus” Crisis – 包含中文字符版本”. The story published by the Reddit community No Sleep is just a horror story and does not have anything to do with reality. The community itself terms it as a storytelling platform and not a true story publisher.
Helicopters are going to spread ‘medicines’ against the coronavirus in Spain. The Spanish Defense ministry denied the claim.

France has suspended payment of rent and taxes for citizens due to coronavirus crisis. The measures announced by President Emmanuel Macron are for small businesses in difficulty and include both payment deferrals and cancellations.
La Paz, Gregorio Marañon or 12 de octubre hospitals are closing because the are over capacity. Madrid government denied it.
The exams to access university in Valencia region will be delayed to August 10, 11 and 12. The Valencian Government debunks the hoax on its official social media accounts.
The army is requisitioning coronavirus protection material in Catalonia. The Defense ministry denies the claim.
La Paz, Gregorio Marañon or 12 de octubre hospitals are closing because the are over capacity. Madrid government denied it.

France has suspended payment of rent and taxes for citizens due to coronavirus crisis. The measures announced by President Emmanuel Macron are for small businesses in difficulty and include both payment deferrals and cancellations.
Helicopters are going to spread ‘medicines’ against the coronavirus in Spain. The Spanish Defense ministry denied the claim.

Peru has just nationalized hospitals and clinics. The Peruvian government gave a temporary order to centralize all the medical resources under the Ministry of Health authority during the emergency, but it does not include the property of clinics and private services.
There is a Russian medicine that could be use against Sars-Cov-2. It is not the case.
This picture showing lots of coffins was taken in Bergamo in 2020. The picture has been taken in Lampedusa in 2013.
Novel coronavirus is being spread via Coca-Cola. No evidence shows that the virus can be transmitted via food. Coca-Cola products are inspected.

Novel coronavirus can survive 9 days on the road; you should keep your shoes out, a doctor from Milan says. There is no Milanese doctor that says that. No evidence shows the exact survival time of the virus on the road.

Countries that are the most affected by the coronavirus are along the same latitude. The fact that large countries cannot be represented by a single latitude is conveniently ignored. Also, all of the cities and countries cited in the examined claim are not situated along 40 degrees of latitude.
Clorox Already Knew About coronavirus And coronavirus Isn’t A New Virus. The claim that the new coronavirus was known beforehand on a Clorox label shows that it kills human coronavirus is misleading.
Indonesian President Joko Widodo locked down 10 cities The Indonesian President Joko Widodo has not yet chosen to quarantine or lockdown as a way to deal with the COVID-19 pandemic.

People in this video are falling because of the coronavirus The people in the three videos fainted due to other causes, such as epilepsy and fatigue. Two of the four videos also did not occur in Jakarta, but in Bali and Singapore.

Novel “The Eye of Darkness” predicts the coronavirus as a biological weapon from China There is only one similarity about the virus in this novel with the coronavirus, namely the name Wuhan. The rest, regarding the incubation period, death rates and so on, is very different from the pandemic that is happening now.

If we want to protect ourselves from the coronavirus, we must back away from all the climate change efforts we’ve been making. Some preliminary scientific publications report that COVID-19 may be less prevalent or less contagious in warm and humid climates. However global warming does not occur at a pace or magnitude that would prevent further propagation. Scientists emphasize that virus propagation primarily depends on other factors such as existing immunity and there is currently no way to reliably predict the spread of COVID-19 on a warmer Earth.

China has successfully tested an anti-coronavirus serum made in Egypt and presented in Beijing by the Egyptian Minister of Health. It's false. Neither Egypt has delivered a COVID-19 serum to China, nor has any treatment been released against those infected with the virus in either country.
The spread of COVID-19 can be prevented with a “home-made vaccine” based on fruits and other ingredients. This is a hoax for citizens to open a potentially dangerous attachment.
A hospital in Murcia in Spain has made a citizen appeal to make surgical masks. That has not happened.

A video of a fire erupting inside a vehicle has been viewed hundreds of times on Facebook, Twitter and on messaging app Line in March 2020 alongside a claim it shows an explosion that was sparked by an alcohol-based disinfectant used during the novel coronavirus pandemic. The claim is false; the video has circulated in media reports about a car explosion in Saudi Arabia since at least 2015, almost five years before the novel coronavirus, COVID-19, was first detected in the Chinese city of Wuhan in December 2019.

All fruit and vegetable markets in the Indian city of Chennai and across the state of Tamil Nadu have been ordered to close in an effort to curb the spread of the novel coronavirus. The claim is false. Chennai’s municipal authority called the social media posts “fake” and Tamil Nadu chief minister said stores selling “essential items” such as groceries are allowed to operate as normal despite a nationwide lockdown.

Claim that an American soldier was intentionally spreading the novel coronavirus in Wuhan during the seventh CISM Military World Games in October 2019 with a video clip of a man purportedly smearing saliva on the handrail on a train. The video is authentic but it was taken in Brussels, Belgium, on March 10, 2020. The man is not an American. According to media reports, the man was arrested by the police on the same day.

List of first COVID-19 patients in Guatemala with their personal information. The list was authentic (as confirmed later on by the Ministry of Health) but we explained that to share private information is not only risky for those in the list but illegal.

As the US government moved to approve a $2 trillion stimulus package to address the impact of the novel coronavirus outbreak, a short block of text outlining Canada’s alleged response to the outbreak flourished on social media. The claims about school closings and economic support are misleading; no province has officially closed schools through the end of the year, only individuals directly impacted by COVID-19 are eligible for financial aid, and mortgage relief is granted by banks on a case by case basis.

The Social Security System (SSS) in the Philippines “approved financial aid worth P20,000 for every member,” to assist those affected by the novel coronavirus pandemic. The SSS has not announced such financial aid for every member. On its official Facebook page, the SSS denied the claim, saying it was "fake news."

“China is to blame because the culture where people eat bats and snakes and dogs and things like that, these viruses are transmitted from the animal to the people and that’s why China has been the source of a lot of these viruses like SARS, like MERS, the Swine Flu and now the coronavirus.” Experts said Cornyn's assertion that Chinese culture is at fault is inaccurate, as the threat of viral transmission from animal to human is not unique to China, and the risk of this kind of spillover is growing globally as humans come into closer contact with animals.

Five Helicopters will spray disinfectants into the air to eradicate the coronaviruses. Similar rumors have circulated in multiple languages in many countries, including South Africa, India, USA. The version circulating in Taiwan connected to America. New York City Emergency Management Department has tweeted that the rumor is false.

President Donald Trump tweeted, “I ordered the Treasury secretary to send checks to Americans! First however, we will go through your social media history from the last 4 years and search for any post with #NotMyPresident in it. I wouldn’t think of offending you with a check if I’m not your president! #MAGA” Americans could receive a $1,000 check as part of an economic stimulus package that isn't yet finalized. Donald Trump didn't tweet that he would vet who gets the checks based on whether they support him.

President Donald Trump said, “People are dying who have never died before.” We searched a number of databases and found no evidence that Trump, on March 18, said, “People are dying who have never died before.”

The coronavirus “snuck up on us,” adding that it is “a very unforeseen thing.” Members of the Trump administration have been sounding the alarm for months. Public health experts have been warning for years about the threat of a pandemic.

2019 coronavirus can live for “up to 3 hours in the air, up to 4 hours on copper, up to 24 hours on cardboard up to 3 days on plastic and stainless steel.” Preliminary research indicates that COVID-19 can live for up to three hours in the air, four hours on copper, 24 hours on cardboard and three days on plastic and stainless steel.
Chennai municipal corporation has asked all vegetable and fruit markets to shut down. No such order was issued. All vegetable and fruit markets are open in Chennai.

Video of American President Donald Trump announcing that Roche Medical Company will launch the vaccine for COVID-19. In the video, American President Donald Trump hasn't said that Roche Medical Company will launch the vaccine for COVID-19. He announced FDA’s approval of a coronavirus ‘test’ developed by a company ‘Roche’ to increase and accelerate the country’s capacity to test for the virus.
Coronavirus was found in meat (mutton). The photo in the post was edited. Also, the photo was taken five or six years ago. WHO and FSSAI have also mentioned that properly cooked meat can be consumed.
Blowing hot air through a hairdryer will cure coronavirus. There is no proven evidence that applying hot air through a hairdryer will cure coronavirus.
Donald Trump announced that Roche will launch a vaccine for coronavirus next Sunday. Donald Trump never said this. Roche has only emergency approval from the FDA for coronavirus tests.
Military helicopters sprays pesticides against the coronavirus in Egypt. No such decision has been made by the Egyptian military forces
A video shows Chinese people celebrating overthrowing the coronavirus. The video is old, dating back to 2019, and shows martial arts tournaments during a spring festival in China.
Egyptian sterilization team dances to the beats of Bent Aljeeran. The video is misleading. It was shot in Iraq, not Egypt.
Due to the fear of coronavirus, Muslims in China are offering Namaz in the open street. The viral video is four years old and has no relation to coronavirus.

Old “Martinelli” and “Whatsapp Gold” hoaxes surface in Belgium in wake of the coronavirus infodemic. Messages circulating on Whatsapp of people sharing "insider" information (self-declared government officials) on the virus percolate quickly. A localized version of the Martinelli & Whatsapp Gold hoaxes surface in Belgium as well, adding further confusion and unrest.
A boy is called COVID-19 in Monterrey, Mexico. As of March 18 we do not have records of people bearing that name in Monterrey, México.
This poem describes people applying social distancing during a plague outbreak from the 19th century. The poem has been written by an American woman on her blog on the 16th of March.

This text critically observes the behavior of the religious communities in Macedonia toward the Government’s recommendations to reduce the risk of spreading the coronavirus by limiting contacts and movement. The religious communities do not respect the government's recommendations. Last Friday, the Islamic Religious Community and the Macedonian Orthodox Church did not take any steps to close the doors of religious buildings for the mass gathering of their believers.

A sensationalist headline, misleading readers: “Disturbing video: A proof that only today there are 349 dead in Italy, stay at home.” This text operates with outdated data.The figures published in the text are from 14 March. The article was published on 16 March at 11.12 pm, which means that at the time of publication on the Internet, the data from 15 March were available, i.e. 1,809 dead and 24,747 infected in total.

Author Chen Ming-Fang, the daughter-in-law of renowned doctor and medical professor Dong Da-Cheng, shared her own experience recovering from COVID-19. The content was originally from a Facebook post by a Seattle coronavirus survivor, Elizabeth Schneider. Chen Ming-Fang said in an interview with TFC that she did not write that post.
Audio allegedly from a CEO of a major hospital in São Paulo, Brazil, gives a higher number of deaths from coronavirus than officially announced. The CEO denied the audio was his.
China planned coronavirus. This fake news boasts the conspiracy theory that China made coronavirus in order to have economic benefits. There is no evidence for it.

São Paulo city hall schedules coronavirus tests by phone. City hall says the falsehood related to a phone number to schedule tests came from the misinterpretation of a local law addressing the coronavirus crisis.
Wash your throat with salted water and apple vinegar to cure COVID-19. WHO and other medical institutions say this is not a cure.

Spanish scientist (and former minister for agriculture) says that people should go to Ronaldo or Messi for the cure, as they are better paid. It's a meme. The former Spanish minister for agriculture never said this.

Evidence shows the WHO director-general overstated COVID-19 fatality rate All evidence says the WHO director-general was on point. This is a ultra-conservative false spin on what the director-general said, getting many facts and medical numbers wrong.
5G Technology believed to have caused the coronavirus. The claim is false, not backed by scientific research, and many dates given to back up the theory are wrong or misleading.

In Ecuador, Maritza Frías, former director of the Teófilo Dávila Hospital in Machala, and Mauro Calle, former manager of this health center, concealed official figures of those infected. Please click the link to read the full article
Coronavirus phase 4 involves war code. Please click the link to read the full article
France will pay rent, light and gas during quarantine for its citizens. France is only paying for small companies that are not earning enough.
Helicopters and military aircraft spraying and disinfecting the streets at 11 p.m. in Spain Air Force and Ministry of Defense sources deny it.
Some of Madrid hospitals close because they are “too full” because of the coronavirus. Madrid's health ministry says it is not true. Hospitals are still working and accepting people.
In Spain, La Paz, Gregorio Marañon or 12 de Octubre hospitals are closing because the are over capacity. Madrid authorities denied the claim.
There is a Russian medicine that could be use against Sars-Cov-2. It is not the case.
Drinking alcohol helps against the new coronavirus The fact that drinking alcohol can protect from new coronavirus has no clinical support.
Drinking hot water every 15 min helps fighting COVID-19. Regular drinking of water, sauna and hot towels do not help fighting COVID-19.

American fast-food chain Hardee’s is advising truckers to walk up to drive-thrus during coronavirus pandemic. A spokesperson from parent company CKE Restaurants said it advises against walking up to drive-thrus for safety reasons.

An investigation team from France discovered what is hidden about COVID-19, the virus was made by the Pasteur Institute in Wuhan. The document in the claim is talking about a patent registration for a vaccine that is intended for SARS by the Pasteur Institute in 2004. SARS was present in China in 2003.

The atheist Italian doctor Julian Urban and his colleagues have converted to Christianity in the wake of the COVID-19 crisis. There is no (Italian) doctor called Julian Urban (or any variation on that name, like Iulian Urban). COVID-19-doctors converting to Christianity over the last few weeks isn't unthinkable, but there is a great lack of verifiable information.

Coronavirus stays in the throat for a long time and dry out the mouth; you should use a gargle made of vinger and high salt solution to get rid of the virus. Coronavirus doesn't stay in the throat for a long time; gargling is not effective as a cure for COVID-19. There is no specific treatment for the disease.

There is nothing called coronavirus and COVDI19 is caused by sarin gas. Doctors all over the world managed to extract the virus from the patients. the symptoms and the spread of COVID-19 is correlated with the virus and its effects and has nothing to do with the sarin gas or any effect of gas.

These at-home coronavirus testing kits are real. Three health-care companies — including Everlywell —  partnered with labs that were approved under the FDA emergency guidelines to perform COVID-19 diagnostics.  However, there was an FDA update on March 21, which clarified that at-home sample collection is not covered under the Administration’s Emergency Use Authorization.

Chinese scientist Ms Shih Zhengli warned that mosquitoes can spread COVID-19 and turn the virus into mosquito-coronavirus. Ms Shih has denied making this claim. The expert said the COVID-19 transmission via mosquito is very unlikely. Plus, the Taiwan Blood Foundation has taken the precaution- blood donor who just returns from abroad must postpone the blood donation for 28 days.
Video claiming:  panicked shoppers in Italy storm supermarket amid coronavirus pandemic. The video was filmed in 2011, nearly a decade before the COVID-19 pandemic.

U.S. government using the cover of the coronavirus pandemic to remove end-to-end encryption so officials would be able to listen to everyone’s calls and see everyone’s private messages. The EARN IT Act, should it become law, would strip companies of immunity against prosecution -- and allow them to be sued -- if they do not participate in a "best practices" program. But such a program is yet to develop, and this hasn't already been enforced.

A Tokyo hospital destroys all the PCR-tested samples and tells patients instead that they have tested negative. Unless all organizations involved in the process of PCR testing collaborate in systematically destroying samples, it would be impossible for one hospital to destroy all their PCR-tested samples, as tweet claims it has. Furthermore according to both the Public Health Center and the COVID-19 Call Center, both say they "have received no reports of any such destruction of samples".

An image has been shared in multiple posts on Facebook, Twitter and Reddit alongside claims that it shows trucks carrying COVID-19 relief that were set on fire by rebels of the New People’s Army (NPA), the armed wing of the Communist Party of the Philippines. These images have circulated online since at least 2015 – years before the COVID-19 pandemic – in posts about supply trucks targeted by NPA rebels.

A video claims Australian scientists said bananas can prevent COVID-19. While it is true that researchers from the University of Queensland are currently developing a vaccine for COVID-19, neither the ABC News Australia report nor a press release from the university about the research made mention of bananas.

A university clinic in Vienna conducted a research which linked COVID-19 with the drug ibuprofen. The majority of patients with severe symptoms had used this drug. The Medical Department of the Vienna University has not conduct the study in question or any other study of this nature. Also, the assertion that every Italian with serious complications of COVID-19 had taken ibuprofen is not confirmed.
The Cuban antiviral Interferon Alfa 2B is used in China to treat patients with the new coronavirus. Although they are treating patients, it is neither a vaccine or a cure.

Diagnostic test in South Korea is less accurate compared to other countries’ test. The accuracy of the test depends on the amount of virus detected. Therefore, depending on inspection time, if small amount of virus is detected, the result of test could be less accurate. However, this is also same with other methods.

The coronavirus has been known since 1976 and has been treated with arbidol, dibazole, and ribomunil. There are many coronaviruses. SARS-CoV-2 is a new one. So far, there is no proven cure to treat COVID-19, the disease caused by the new coronavirus.

Forest bacteria can help against the spread of COVID-19. The company BioOrg claims to make and keep classrooms coronavirus free by atomizing forest bacteria. There is no evidence that it is effective against coronaviruses.
COVID-19 is treated with intravenous injections of vitamin C. Clinical trials of this method are still ongoing, and there is no effective drug against COVID-19.
Video shows Chinese cops arresting Coronavirus patients. Video from Hong kong protests is shared as being from China.
Police have “free entry into houses and buildings” in Malaga to identify possible coronavirus infected people. Police denied this claim on the Twitter account.
Niño Jesús hospital has been left without COVID-19 to care for children and young people in Madrid. The hospital denied this claim to newtral.es.
Madrid enables 915,038,030 to request prescription drugs. The government denied this claim.

A whole floor of the main Peruvian hospital is infected with COVID-19 and they decided to close the place. It is false that Peruvian government decided to close a floor at the main national hospital due a general contagion of COVID-19

Italy official Giulio Gallera: China lies to us. The date China provided is false. Italy has become Wuhan and the medical system has a breakdown. The Health and Welfare Regional Minister in Lombardy, Giulio Gallera, didn't give such statements in the interview.
The photo shows the aid crew from Cuba to Italy. Cuba has sent aid to Italy but the photo is was taken in 2015.
Cristiano Ronaldo donated his hotel to be turned into an hospital. Ronaldo did not announce this and his partners denied it.
Coronil drops can help cure coronavirus. Leading homeopaths say little is known about the composition of this medicine and it is careless to recommend it for coronavirus

Police asked shops selling alcohol to restrict opening hours on St. Patrick’s Day to lower the risk of house parties where coronavirus could be spread. Police make an annual request of shops not to sell alcohol before 4 p.m.on St Patrick's Day, but it has nothing to do with coronavirus.
A man is touching a push-cart with his tongue to spread the virus outside Lidl in Lithuania. The video is most likely shot in Lebanon and definitely not in Lithuania.
A train marked “COVID-19” was spotted in the U.S. The photo was doctored.

Philippine Vice President Leni Robredo says bats are the “enemy” in the novel coronavirus pandemic. The claim is false. The graphic has been doctored from an earlier Inquirer.net post in which Robredo was quoted about confusion surrounding the government’s response to the coronavirus outbreak.

Cristiano Ronaldo will convert his hotels into coronavirus hospitals. The claim is false; a spokesperson for the hotels said the claim was “inaccurate”; Ronaldo has also not mentioned any such plan on his social media platforms.
The Indian government is distributing free face masks. The claim is false. The Indian government said there is no such plan in place and the linked website is not an official government site.

The Australian prime minister is about to announce a national lockdown. The claim is misleading. The Australian Prime Minister’s Office refuted the details of the post.
