Australia's government told its citizens on 3/18/20 not to travel abroad and warned those already overseas to come home but did not order a "lockdown." AFP found the wording of the misleading posts was identical to Malaysia’s announcement of a nationwide lockdown.

This photo shows a Sri Lankan airline pilot who tested positive for the novel coronavirus. The claim is false; the local health authority told AFP the pilot is not pictured in the photo; the man wrongly identified in the posts denied the claim.

Russian supermarkets are imposing pre-filled trolleys with basic food in the midst of the coronavirus crisis. Auchan Russia told AFP photos had been taken during a special event earlier in the week and that there are no pre-filled trolleys for customers because of coronavirus.

35 people infected by coronavirus are being treated in Ivory Coast within a military station. The French embassy in Ivory Coast and the Ivory Coast government denied this claim to AFP. Mediapart told AFP it has "no information" about this.

Photo showing the poor condition for people who recently arrived in the country and were quarantined because of the novel coronavirus. The photo was first published in February 2017 on TripAdvisor to denounce the poor accommodations at a hostel in South Africa.
Water boiled with garlic cures coronavirus. There is no scientific evidence of this cure.

Israel has already developed a vaccine against COVID-19 Migal Galilee Research Institute, in Israel, is one of many labs trying to develop a vaccine for COVID-19. They claim their vaccine might be ready for tests in 8-10 weeks, as of 3/17/20.
Avoid drinking cold water during the pandemic; be exposed to sunlight. Neither is proven to have any effect on the disease.
Universal Church of the Kingdom of God is selling 500 Brazilian “blessed” hand-sanitizer bottles. The image was digitally altered to include fake information and the Universal church logo.

Brazilian singer Preta Gil was singing in a carnival “bloco” while infected with coronavirus. She very likely caught the coronavirus seven days after her last public concert, while singing at a wedding that has become a major hub of COVID-19 dissemination. As of 3/1/20, the date of her last public concert, there were only two cases confirmed in the country.

A mixture of vinegar and fabric softener is a better disinfectant than alcohol. Even when vinegar and quaternary ammonium included in some fabric softeners do have some antibacterial properties, its mixture is not more effective than alcohol in inactivating viruses and killing bacteria. This mixture is not included in the official recommendations to fight COVID-19.
Staff of two Mumbai hotels have COVID-positive cases. Both the hotels denied having any such cases as of 3/17/20.
President Donald Trump announced a vaccine by Roche Diagnostics. Roche Diagnostics received FDA approval for testing kits, not a vaccine.
Narendra Modi is giving free masks in India. A fake phishing website was set up in the name of Narendra Modi.
Coronavirus patients were being arrested in Punjab, India. The video is of a mock drill.
The military is coming to Paris because of the coronavirus. The military movements are normal and not associated with the coronavirus.
Another rumor claims the military is coming to Paris because of the coronavirus. These are normal military movements and unrelated to the coronavirus.
Ibuprofen enhances the coronavirus. The WHO assured there is no proven evidence that the use of ibuprofen can aggravate the health of coronavirus patients.
An image of people lying on the street is related to coronavirus. The image was taken in Germany during an event commemorating the victims of the Nazi concentration camp in Katzbach.
Gargling with warm water and salt removes the coronavirus. The WHO says there is no evidence that rinsing your mouth with saline "provides protection against this disease."

Cuba discovered a serum that cures COVID-19. This discovery was denied by an Egyptian official, whose last name is the same as that attributed to the Cuban Minister of Health in the disinformation, and who is actually called Portal Miranda.

A study establishes the relationship between Ibuprofen and the severity of the virus infection. Apparently Ibuprofen facilitates the reproduction of the virus. There is no scientific evidence that Ibuprofen worsens the coronavirus.

“17 at 6:00 am, the state of emergency begins throughout the national territory” in accordance with “article 116 of the Constitution”, in Colombia. WhatsApp chain that alerts state of emergency by COVID-19 is from Spain.

“17 at 6:00 am, the state of emergency begins throughout the national territory” in accordance with “article 116 of the Constitution”, in Colombia. WhatsApp chain that alerts state of emergency by COVID-19 is from Spain.

Although Germany closes its borders refugees and migrants may still come in and they will not be medically checked for coronavirus. Asylum seekers may under certain circumstances still come to Germany, but they are not the only persons allowed to cross the border. And there will be medical checks if they are infected.

An image shows a “Spanish biologist” who claimed that footballers who earn millions of euros should research the cure for coronavirus. She is not a Spanish biologist. Isabel García Tejerina is the former Spanish Minister of Agriculture.
Helicopters are going to spread chemicals against the coronavirus. This is a false claim circulating in many Spanish-speaking countries, from Spain to Honduras.
Coronavirus patients develop lung fibrosis but you can diagnose by holding your breath. Fibrosis has many other symptoms and it is harder to diagnose than holding your breath for 10 seconds.

The WHO approves anti-malarial drug Chloroquine for COVID-19. Fact Crescendo found the claim published by Economic Times to be false. The WHO has not declared, approved or recommended the anti-malarial drug Chloroquine as a treatment for COVID-19.
Thailand CDC announces green chiretta can cure coronavirus. Curing COVID-19 with green chiretta is not recommended by the WHO or Thailand CDC.

Traditional cures and self-checks for the coronavirus. There is no scientific evidence to prove that drinking water washes down COVID-19 and gargling with warm water and salt or vinegar eliminates the coronavirus. A she self-check breath test for coronavirus is also baseless.

Video of police in China taking into custody suspected COVID-19 patients in the country. The video shows police in Hong Kong taking into custody demonstrators who were protesting against a controversial bill that would have allowed extraditions to mainland China.

After husband tested positive for coronavirus, wife fled from Bangalore to Agra in India. The woman went to her parents' place in Agra on 3/9/20, and her husband tested positive for coronavirus on 3/12/20. She didn't enter Bangalore city. Karnataka government has also clarified that the woman didn't flee to her parents’ place.
5,000 million Rupees fund allocated by Telangana CM KCR for coronavirus prevention is entirely funded by Central Government. The entire fund is not provided by the Central Government.

Video of President Donald Trump announcing that Roche Medical Company will launch the vaccine for COVID-19 next Sunday. In the video, American President Donald Trump didn't say that Roche Medical Company will launch the vaccine for COVID-19. He announced the FDA’s approval of a coronavirus "test" developed by a company named Roche to accelerate the country’s capacity to test for the virus.
2,000 people died of COVID-19 on 3/15/20 in France. According to the WHO, 36 people died of COVID-19 in France on 3/15/20, note 2,000 people.

Gargling with lukewarm water mixed with salt/vinegar will remove coronavirus. Press Information Bureau (India) has clarified that coronavirus cannot be treated by gargling with warm water mixed with salt and vinegar.
Tips for the new coronavirus: Holding breath and drinking water. There is no scientific evidence to indicate that holding breath and drinking water every 15 minutes kills coronavirus.
China finds a vaccine for the new coronavirus. This claim is false.
A dog vaccine can be used against coronavirus in people. There is no approved vaccine for coronavirus.
15 minutes in a sauna will kill the coronavirus. An infectious disease epidemiologist debunked this
Eating bananas prevents coronavirus. The video splices together clips to make incorrect and misleading information.
Italy has mandated no treatment of all elderly patients for coronavirus. The guidelines to ration care to those with higher survivability are only suggestions at this point.

All U.S. citizens are entitled to $700 per week to stay at home to avoid spread of coronavirus. U.S. citizens may get some economic relief from Congress at some point, but that could still be a few weeks away as of 3/17/20.

List comparing diseases with coronavirus. The comparison of outbreaks is misleading as it doesn't take into account the rate of infections, timeframes of the outbreaks and the rapid rise in the number of COVID-19 cases.
COVID-19 is a scripted narrative to justify closed borders or force residents to remain home. The claim is debunked as a conspiracy theory.

Football player Cristiano Ronaldo turned all his hotels into hospitals to help coronavirus patients and is paying doctors and the staff. A spokesperson for the hotel denied the claim stating, "We are a hotel. We are not going to be a hospital. It is a day like everyone else, we are and will remain a hotel." The news was also denied by HRT, Gol, Haber, Pogled, Flash and Hayat, while the Sport and Magazine plus portals deleted their articles.
Madrid enables 915,038,030 to request prescription drugs. The government denied this claim.
Niño Jesús hospital has been left without COVID-19 to care for children and young people in Madrid. The hospital denied this claim to newtral.es.
Here are the measures that Mercadona will implement due to the coronavirus crisis. Mercadona Communication Department says nearly all the points of the message are false.
Police have “free entry into houses and buildings” in Malaga to identify possible coronavirus infected people. Police denied this claim on the Twitter account.
Spanish politician Ortega Smith said “I prefer to get the COVID-19 than being gay”. It was posted by a satirical website, but it viralized as real.
Spanish politician Ortega Smith said “I prefer to get the covid-19 than being gay”. It was posted by a satirical website, but it viralized as real.
Police have “free entry into houses and buildings” in Malaga to identify possible coronavirus infected people. Police denied this claim on the Twitter account.
Niño Jesús hospital has been left without COVID-19 to care for children and young people in Madrid. The hospital denied this claim to newtral.es.
Madrid enables 915,038,030 to request prescription drugs. The government denied this claim.

A whole floor of the main Peruvian hospital is infected with COVID-19 and they decided to close the place. It is false that Peruvian government decided to close a floor at the main national hospital due a general contagion of COVID-19

Italy official Giulio Gallera: China lies to us. The date China provided is false. Italy has become Wuhan and the medical system has a breakdown. The Health and Welfare Regional Minister in Lombardy, Giulio Gallera, didn't give such statements in the interview.
The photo shows the aid crew from Cuba to Italy. Cuba has sent aid to Italy but the photo is was taken in 2015.
Cristiano Ronaldo donated his hotel to be turned into an hospital. Ronaldo did not announce this and his partners denied it.
Coronil drops can help cure coronavirus. Leading homeopaths say little is known about the composition of this medicine and it is careless to recommend it for coronavirus

Police asked shops selling alcohol to restrict opening hours on St. Patrick’s Day to lower the risk of house parties where coronavirus could be spread. Police make an annual request of shops not to sell alcohol before 4 p.m.on St Patrick's Day, but it has nothing to do with coronavirus.
China finds a vaccine for the new coronavirus. This claim is false.
Cristiano Ronaldo turns hotel into hospital for coronavirus. The manager of the hotel owned by Ronaldo has denied the rumors and stated that the hotel  will remain a hotel.

Video shows Chinese police crackdown on coronavirus patients. The video dates back to August 2019 during anti-government protests in Hong Kong. The visuals pertain to an incident of police crackdown at Prince Edward station in Kowloon where the police personnel and riot police arrived after reports of a tussle between pro-government and anti-government protesters.
It is advisable to leave outside the shoes used on the street to prevent coronavirus. It is an unnecessary preventive measure because it is excessive.
Sanitary technicians are going to inspect houses and seize cash. It is not true that technicians and police agents have "free entry" into the homes.

Philippine Vice President Leni Robredo says bats are the “enemy” in the novel coronavirus pandemic. The claim is false. The graphic has been doctored from an earlier Inquirer.net post in which Robredo was quoted about confusion surrounding the government’s response to the coronavirus outbreak.

A flyer offers official advice about the novel coronavirus from a Veterans Affairs (VA) healthcare system in the U.S. state of Oregon. The flyer is fake. It was not issued by the Roseburg VA and health experts told AFP the advice it contains is misleading.

A photo of a room lined with coffins shows Italian nationals killed during the novel coronavirus pandemic in 2020. The claim is false. The photo shows coffins for a group of dead migrants at an Italian airport in October 2013 after their boat sank off the coast of Italy.

A “Spanish biological researcher” says “You give the footballer 1 million euros a month and a biological researcher 1,800 euros per month, and you are now looking for a coronavirus treatment. Go to Cristiano Ronaldo or Messi and they will get you a cure.” A quote published with a photo of this so-called “Spanish biological researcher.” The woman in the photograph is not a Spanish biologist researcher, but Isabel Garcia Tejerina, an ex Spanish minister. The photo was taken during an interview in 2018, long before the outbreak of coronavirus.

Jeanine Áñez, actual president of Bolivia, has COVID-19. The team of Bolivia Verifica checked the image and verified it is not real. The Coordination Director of the Ministry of the Presidency, Marco Julio, confirmed that the president’s health condition is good.
Information about a complete quarantine in Guatemala. Those were measures taken by the president of Bolivia, not the president of Guatemala.

14 University of Nairobi students have tested positive for COVID-19. An article by Times Live claiming that 14 students from the University of Nairobi are infected with coronavirus cites a non-existent news story by KTN News.

Senator of the Philippines Risa Hontiveros says she is “ready to get coughed on,” and that “the police and military are more frightening than dying from the virus.” The senator did not say what was attributed to her in the graphic. She dismissed the graphic as "fake news" on her social media accounts.

Philippines Vice President Leni Robredo says “bats, not the virus, are our enemy.” The vice president did not say this. Robredo’s camp said it is a fake quote, and the Facebook accounts failed to cite Rappler as their source.

A photo showing coffins and describing them as coffins of people who died because of the coronavirus. The photo was found in the AFP archives. The coffins belong to dead migrants in the Mediterranean Sea in 2013.

The WHO coronavirus test “was a bad test.” A review found the WHO’s test did not give false positives when similar viruses were present. The White House provided no evidence that the WHO test fell short.
Sweden has stopped fighting against the new coronavirus. The headline is manipulative.

“All U.S. citizens are entitled to $700 USD per week to stay at home to avoid the spread of COVID-19 novel coronavirus, starting 3/17/20.” Americans could receive a check for $1,000 or more as part of an economic stimulus package amid the coronavirus pandemic. A Facebook post about weekly $700 checks is a hoax.

“I’ve always known this is a real, this is a pandemic. I’ve felt it was a pandemic long before it was called a pandemic.” In January, President Trump said there were no worries about a pandemic. In late February, he said the virus was “very much under control.” Trump did activate federal measures to contain the spread in late January.

“People are going door to door in Colorado Springs stating they are COVID-19 testing so they can rob people!” Colorado Springs police said they’ve received no reports of robbers pretending to offer coronavirus testing.

“U.S. deaths since 1/22/20: COVID-19, 27; flu, 4,700; abortion, 118,000.” The post’s numbers are inaccurate, but abortions do far outnumber deaths from COVID-19 and flu. The COVID-19 number is likely too low, and the flu number is too high. The number of abortions is roughly accurate.

Says it was “unquestionably” not within his “legal authority” to postpone Illinois’ primary election by changing the date or shifting to vote-by-mail. It’s difficult to know for sure that Pritzker could not have done anything to delay the March 17 election. But experts told us the governor spoke correctly in describing the limits of his powers under existing law.
Novel coronavirus can be eliminated by drinking lots of water and gargling with warm water mixed with salt or vinegar. There is no evidence to support the claim.

Nostradamus predicted the coronavirus pandemic. The book "Prophecies of Nostradamus" doesn't include any of the words that are now being spread. The prophecies that record the words "plague" and "dust" are different from the one that circulates in the image that went viral.

Video of police in China taking into custody suspected COVID-19 patients in the country. The video shows police in Hong Kong taking into custody demonstrators who were protesting against a controversial bill that would have allowed extraditions to mainland China.
The new coronavirus is a biological weapon. There is no evidence this claim is correct.
Syrians Are Gathering Regardless of coronavirus Outbreak. The photo is old, dating back to 2019.
Ethiopian Plane Carries People Infected With coronavirus. The video is misleading and has nothing to do with COVID-19. The plane in the video belongs to Senegal Air, not Ethiopian.
Emirati singer Ahlam’s Mask Is Crowned With Diamonds. The claim is a joke from a fan called Mannol, who shared a Photoshopped image of a mask crowned with diamonds.

In the United States, WIC receivers still only get one type of food during a pandemic. Individuals qualifying for WIC cannot swap out food items, but the specific rules differ state by state, especially during a crisis like COVID-19.

Nancy Pelosi tried to secure taxpayer funds for abortion through a coronavirus bill. Pelosi never inserted abortion funding in a coronavirus bill. However, some conservatives said failing to specifically say money couldn’t be used for abortions would leave open the possibility that federal money could be used for abortions.

If you can hold your breath for 10 seconds without coughing or chest pain, you are good, you don’t have COVID-19, and If your nose is clogged or runny, it’s just a cold. Dr. Robert Legar Atmar told CNN these claims are not accurate. Someone with an acute viral infection breathes with difficulty because the airways are irritated. Being able to hold his/her breath for 10 seconds does not mean he/she is not infected with coronavirus.

If you are infected with the new coronavirus, for high fever you should not take Ibuprofen (Brufen) or Paracetamol. Adults should drink a strong black coffee every few hours. There are no clinical trials or practice data that would suggest that brufen should not be taken with COVID-19 infection. The specialist pneumophysiologist and family medicine doctor, Dobrinka Granzov-Kozlina debunked the fake news about drinking coffee against coronavirus.

Army trucks are deployed in Paris and in other large French cities because of the coronavirus epidemic. Photos show military vehicles on the highway near Paris. The French Ministry of Armed Forces denies any link with the coronavirus epidemic and explains that it is a routine logistical operation.
If you can hold your breath for more than 10 seconds, you are not infected by coronavirus. Holding your breath for 10 seconds cannot confirm whether or not you are infected with the coronavirus.
Water in Venice begins to become more crystalline, thanks to the ban in Italy by COVID-19. The event happened in Cagliari, Sardinia, 874 kilometers from Venice
The executive order to restrict worship in South Korea for prevention of epidemics is religious oppression. It is possible to forbid by Korean infectious disease prevention law.

There is censorship against the use of chloroquine as a treatment. A French scientist promoting chloroquine and hydroxychloroquine have generated enthusiasm for this "treatment" and accusations that the French government, or the Big Pharma, are hiding this cure.

U.S. President Donald Trump or presidential candidate Joe Biden referred to the novel coronavirus pandemic as a time when “people are dying that have never died before.” This claim is false. There is no record of either man saying this, and letters from Ernest Hemingway show the phrase can be traced to the famed U.S. author.

President Trump’s use of data for deaths from swine flu and seasonal flu. Trump is comparing apples and oranges. The figures he cites for the swine flu and seasonal influenza are after-the-fact estimates that try to account for all excess deaths that could be, in some way, attributed to a flu infection. Studies indicate that the official lab counts may be missing as many as 9 in 10 deaths.

Having a beard increases your chances of getting coronavirus. The CDC never told anyone to shave their beards. A 2017 graphic circulating the web from the CDC was put out to show the effectiveness of masks with facial hair. The work-place graphic is unrelated to the current coronavirus.

Sweden refused to fight the coronavirus. Sweden has not abandoned the fight against coronavirus, although it has taken less stringent measures than other countries. Some of the statements in the article are fabricated.

Taking a hot bath, breathing in hot steam or using a hand dryer to blow hot air up the nose are effective ways to prevent COVID-19, according to a lecturer in health sciences faculty at Ghanaian university. There is no evidence to support these claims, which counter WHO recommendations.

Warm water with salt prevents the new coronavirus infection, killing it in the throat. There is no scientific evidence to support this theory. Several experts say there’s no connection between drinking water and the virus.

An image shows a train transporting the COVID-19 virus. The dark wagons in the image are used to transport oil and must obey the 4 letters and 6 digits rules. That does not happen with the word “COVID-19” that appears in the image. If the train was transporting the virus, it would mention “Sars-Cov-2” and not “COVID-19”.

A hospital in Debar (North Macedonia) was left without an epidemiologist. The claim was denied by the Ministry of Health, which pointed out that there is an epidemiologist in the Debar hospital and there is no shortage of staff.

Some portals published a photo that they claim was taken on the buses of the Public Transport Company in Skopje. The photo shows a person in protective equipment in a public transport. And that was enough for someone to claim that this is how the buses in Skopje are disinfected against the coronavirus in the presence of passengers. A simple Google photo search shows that this photo was not taken in Skopje, but in Poland.

Fiocruz (Brazilian health organization) did not share text informing that coronavirus is bigger than other virus; that the virus dies on temperatures such as 26ºC or 27ºC; warm water with salt kills the coronavirus in your amygdala; hot plates are the best to kill the virus Fiocruz denied sharing this information.

Brazilian government releases R$ 470 for people in Bolsa Família (poverty addressing program) to buy masks and hygiene products. Ministry of Economy promised a increase of R$ 3 billions on the social program, but there was no help to buy masks and cleaning products.
The coronavirus was created the Institut Pasteur in France and patented in 2004. The patent was for the 2003 SARS vaccine.

Philippine Vice President Leni Robredo says bats are the “enemy” in the novel coronavirus pandemic. The claim is false; the graphic has been doctored from an earlier Inquirer.net post in which Robredo was quoted about confusion surrounding the government’s response to the coronavirus outbreak.
Oman is releasing pesticides in the air through helicopters to eliminate coronavirus. Oman's Health Ministry clarified it is not conducting any such operation with helicopters.
Drinking water every 15 minutes will protect people from coronavirus. The WHO has clarified that drinking water is important for overall health but does not prevent coronavirus infection.
3,000 Ecuadorians are infected with coronavirus. Please click the link to read the full article
Coronavirus will not be covered by private health insurance in Ecuador. Please click the link to read the full article
Madrid has enabled the phone number 915038030 to request prescriptions. The region of Madrid says it is a hoax.
Niño Jesús Hospital is now “clean” of coronavirus to take care of children and young people in Madrid. The hospital and the health ministry say the claim is false.
Police has “free entry in houses and buildings” in Malaga to identify possible coronavirus infections. Malaga and police authorities debunk the hoax on their official Twitter accounts.
Javier Ortega Smith, from VOX, has said he prefers to be infected by the new coronavirus than to “have homosexualism”. The claim is from a satire website.
Spanish politician Ortega Smith said “I prefer to get COVID-19 to being gay.” The statement was posted by a satirical website, but viralized as real.

“While all COVID-19 news has been going on, the U.S. government has been sneakily trying to remove end-to-end encryption” which means “the government will be able to see all of your messages and listen to all of your calls.” A bill under consideration by Congress, the EARN IT Act, would make it easier for law enforcement to demand information from technology companies about certain users of their services. The bill would not grant unlimited access. Any request would have to be premised on a link to suspected child exploitation.

Did Donald Trump attempt to steal a COVID-19 vaccine from a German company and refuse testing kits from WHO? Reports that Trump tried to pay a German company for the rights to a vaccine are not confirmed, and the U.S. government did not refuse tests from the World Health Organization.

Genefir Haller, the woman who voluntereed to try one of the COVID-19 vaccines, is dead. Genifer appeared on CNN after taking the vaccine ensuring that she is doing OK and the vaccine didn't harm her or anyone surrounding her.

Unclear official guidelines from authorities regarding outdoor activities in Denmark. Televised news report showing people outdoors in close proximity to each other casusing social media outrage Many are confused about whether to be outside, calling the coronavirus experts' advice ambiguous. You may want to get out of your apartment, but you need to keep away from people around you.
Georgian homeopath discussed a homeopathic drug with crocodile blood that cures coronavirus. Homeopathy is an alternative medicine with no proof that it cures any disease.

Philippine Presidential Spokesperson Salvador Panelo said South Korea imposed a “total lockdown” to control the spread of COVID-19. South Korean officials did not impose a “total lockdown” in dealing with the spread of the COVID-19 pandemic but a widespread testing campaign.

The internet will collapse globally due to the new coronavirus outbreak. A total shutdown of the world wide web is not a possible eventuality as the internet is composed of different nodes of information sharing and not a central machine with an on/off switch. While the strain on the web in Greece and other countries around the world is indeed serious, we are not even close to a point where we need to worry about a collapse of the internet due to the new coronavirus.

The danger of contracting the new coronavirus is extremly low for people living in Greece. Even in cases of infection the risk of transmiting the virus to other people or having serious complications is extremely low. Both the possibility to infect other people and the possibilty of complication from COVID-19 are a reality. In addition, the use of a surgical mask as a preventative measure in order to not infect other people is an effective tool.

Thieves disguised as doctors and nurses entering houses with the excuse of testing for coronavirus. There are no reports about these thieves disguising themselves as nurses; The text emerged in Madrid, Spain, where there are also no complaints about it.

The Uruguayan Air Force announced that it will spray disinfectant from a helicopter to eradicate the new coronavirus. The rumor is false. They never claimed that they will spray the city to eradicate the new coronavirus.
Spanish biologist compares salaries of footballers and doctors looking for COVID-19 vaccine. The person to whom the statement is attributed never said anything like it.
In Ukraine, utility bills are deferred for two months due to the quarantine. In Ukraine, one should pay one's utilities even during the quarantine.

Harvard scientists explain: Here’s how you can cure the coronavirus yourself before the vaccine comes out and a WhatsApp message states: “The Ministry of Health has approved an immediate 350 euro reward for those staying home.” The first child that lost his life because of coronavirus. The information in the WhatsApp message was denied by the Minister of Health and Social Affairs. The British media article was about an infected child, not a child who lost his life. There is no exact data so far, but according to WHO, children are less at risk of coronary heart disease when they contract the novel coronavirus.

A conpiracy theory about a news report from the correspondent in Finland for the Swedish public service TV. The news anchor in the studio received instructions in her ear piece that a sign language interpreter was on her way and that they needed to repeat some of what the correspondent had said.
Cristiano Ronaldo turned his hotels into hospitals for COVID-19 patients. Cristiano Ronaldo did not turn his hotels into hospitals.

Medical University in Vienna has published a study about Ibuprofen and coronavirus. There was no such study, Medical University of Vienna denied it and rated is as fake news. Relation between ibuprofen treatment and worsening conditions of patients with COVID-19 is still researched but unproven at the moment.
Egypt Health Minister has given China the vaccine against the coronavirus. WHO states that as of 3/16/20, there is no vaccine or drug to prevent or treat COVID-19.
The Portuguese soccer player Cristiano Ronaldo decided to turn his hotels into free hospitals This claim is false.
Italy from the space during a flash mob in March 2020. The picture was taken 2014.
Turkish Ministry of Health issued a document that shows radical measures against COVID-19. The document is fake and the signature in the document belongs to famous boxer Vitali Klitschko.
Women’s inhouse gatherings are banned due to the outbreak. The ministry of family did not issue an order banning women's gatherings.
New virus stays at the throat level for four days. The virus attaches to human cells and does not wait to replicate itself. It is not possible to push the virus into the stomach by drinking water.
Turmeric And Lemon Help Fight Against coronavirus. There is no evidence proving this claim.
Coronavirus patient arrested in Punjab This is a mock drill video from Mansa, Punjab.
The word “coronavirus” used on various sanitary products suggest that the outbreak of COVID-19 is a planned operation. The term "coronavirus" describes a group of viruses known to man for decades.
Gargling warm water with salt and/or vinegar kills SARS-CoV-2. There is no proof that salt and/or vinegar can kill the coronavirus.

COVID-19 fits a pattern of viral outbreaks every 100 years. The claim is false because the infographic contains inaccurate information about historical viral outbreaks and ignores other epidemics that do not fit the assumed pattern.

Clinics in the Philippines are turning away people with COVID-19 symptoms, because of a advisory from the department of health. The claim is false. The Philippine Department of Health denied issuing the advisory.

Red soap and white handkerchiefs are good against the coronavirus. The recommended practices are misleading; health experts told AFP there is no scientific basis for many of the claims, which include using red-colored soap and white handkerchiefs, as well as obtaining specific light bulbs.

Israel allegedly developed a COVID-19 vaccine. The claim is misleading. The image used to illustrate a vial of the new drug is originally a stock picture while the MIGAL Research Institute in Israel, despite having a head start, continues to work on a vaccine for COVID-19.

A video on Facebook and YouTube purports to show billionaire businessman Jack Ma praising China’s response to the outbreak of the novel coronavirus. The video has been doctored. The original video shows Jack Ma at a meeting of former Alibaba employees in 2018, at least one year before COVID-19 was first detected in the Chinese city of Wuhan. The voiceover in the clip is from another clip which shows a different man speaking.

A photo shows two military vehicles transported by a truck on the highway, near Paris, to be used for the French population’s confinement. The vehicle transporter and the army told AFP it was a routine trip, unrelated to COVID-19.

On 3/16/20, Macron announced a quarantine for all cities in France and will announce later during the day the passage to “stage 4” of the epidemic. Stage 4 means back to normal and Emmanuel Macron has not yet announced a quarantine.

A legal decree in France, published on 3/15/20, sets the ground for the use of the army in the fight against the novel coronavirus. If using the army in the fight against the novel coronavirus is possible, it has nothing to do with the legal decree published on 3/15/20, according to the Ministry of the Armed Forces. This legal decree only simplifies the management of soldiers deployed to work for other organizations, according to the Ministry.

Coronavirus stays in the throat 4 days before reaching the lungs and gargling lukewarm water with vinegar and salt can kill it. Water temperature, salt and vinegar have no impact on the coronavirus, according to experts interviewed by the AFP and recommendations from WHO and health authorities in several countries.

You can self-diagnose COVID-19 by holding your breath for 10 seconds, and avoid COVID-19 by drinking water constantly. COVID-19 causes fibrosis in the lungs. None of this is true. COVID-19 does not cause lung fibrosis, which renders the "hold your breath" argument senseless.

Drinking water and gargling with salt or vinegar eliminates the novel coronavirus. According to the Brazilian Ministry of Health and experts consulted by Aos Fatos, this information is false and may worsen the patient's condition. Information on social media omits that there is still no drug or treatment to cure COVID-19.

Israel has found a cure and a vaccine for coronavirus. The video report shared with these posts shows the process of developing a vaccine that, according to the scientists, may be available in May. At no time does the video claim the drug already exists or that a cure for the infection with the new coronavirus has been found.
Indian industrialist tweets that a specific mask can kill viruses. The mask is an anti-pollution mask and its effect on COVID-19 is not scientifically explained.
Cristiano Ronaldo’s hotels to be turned into quarantine centres in Portugal. Footballer's hotel chains denied the claim.
Chinese police crack down on suspected coronavirus patients. Video is originally from the Hong Kong protests.

A video shows Italians or French people singing Madonna, Katy Perry, Britney Spears or Aya Nakamura songs on their balcony because of the lockdown measure in France and Italy. The video was shot in Torino (Italy) and people are singing and dancing La Macarena.
The ice skating rink in Mulhouse will be used as a morgue. The claim is false.
An official decree taken by the government says the military will have to help in the hospitals. The text is a transposition of an old law into a decree, and is unrelated to the coronavirus.

Ibuprofen worsens coronavirus infection. Ibuprofen could worsen some conditions but there is no proof it includes COVID-19. Spanish health authorities have communicated that Ibuprofen is not contraindicated to treat first or mild cases.

President Donald Trump in the next 48 to 72 hours will impose a nationwide “mandatory quarantine.” The White House’s National Security Council addressed the claim in a statement on Twitter, saying: “Text message rumors of a national #quarantine are FAKE. There is no national lockdown.”
Gargling water with salt or vinegar “eliminates” the coronavirus. There is no known treatment for the new coronavirus,according to the WHO.

Coronavirus pneumonia is similar to a dry cough and hot weather, garlic and hot water are remedies for COVID-19. There is no scientific proof that hot and humid weather conditions or drinking warm water and consumption of garlic, onions and other spices can prevent the spread of novel coronavirus infection.

Claims of cures for COVID-19 from multiple countries. While some drugs have provided symptomatic improvement, there is no confirmation that any medications currently being tested across different parts of the world are a definitive cure for COVID-19. The WHO confirms there has not been any definitive vaccine or antiviral drug developed to prevent or treat COVID-19.
Photo of meat (mutton) affected by coronavirus. The image is photoshopped. There is no proof that coronavirus is present in mutton.

Office Memorandum of the Indian Ministry of Health and Family Welfare declaring holidays to the states of Maharashtra, Gujarat, Uttar Pradesh and Sikkim in the wake of COVID-19. The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare has not declared holidays in the states of Maharashtra, Gujarat, Uttar Pradesh and Sikkim. The Office Memorandum with such information is fake.
35 Italians tourists don’t want to leave Ethiopia and go back in Italy because of the coronavirus. Testimonies appear invented and the sources quoted do not exist.
30 cases of new coronavirus in the city of Barranquilla, in Colombia. As of 3/16/20, the Health ministry has not confirmed any cases of coronavirus in Barranquilla.
Saline water kills the new coronavirus. There is no solid scientific evidence to indicate that mouthwash and saline water kills coronavirus.
All baby formula providers are shipping formula for free during the coronavirus outbreak. Statements issued by Enfamil and Gerber confirm this is a hoax.

Coronavirus Outbreak Prompted Gun And Ammunition Policy Changes At Walmart. Walmart had already changed its ammunition sales policy on 9/3/19, a month after a gunman killed 22 people at one of its stores in El Paso, Texas.
Dallas student celebrating spring break collapses from coronavirus. The claim is from a fake news generator website.
Coronavirus is the least deadly virus. The chart, published by Business Insider, issued a correction on the chart exaggerating its figures.
Cristiano Ronaldo is turning his hotels into hospitals to fight coronavirus. Ronaldo's management company denied the claim.
WalMart reducing hours of operation. WalMart website confirms
Tanker train marked with “COVID-19” on its side. The photo was digitally manipulated
CDC warns people that morel mushroom increases coronavirus risk by 200%. User who published made clear this was a hoax.

Police have not issued any “domiciliation order” in Madrid to stay at home under a fine of 1000€. The National Police have denied on its Twitter account this document that forces the citizens of Madrid to remain at home from 9 p.m. to 9 p.m.

EFE news agency published a tweet announcing that the Government will impose fines of 300,000 euros on people who travel to other regions. EFE news agency denied it published the tweet and Newtral found no proof that the agency published the tweet.
“A looting” in a supermarket due to the coronavirus. The images were recorded three years ago in the supermarket chain HiperDino.
Irene Montero is coughing on someone during the 8M women protest. The subtitles are manipulated. Irene Montero and the concerned person deny the false claim.
Egypt Health Minister has given China the vaccine against the coronavirus. WHO states that as of 3/16/20, there is no vaccine or drug to prevent or treat COVID-19.
Insurance companies stop covering traffic accidents because the coronavirus. The UNESPA Business Insurance Association deneid it.
Insurance companies stop covering traffic accidents because the coronavirus. The UNESPA Business Insurance Association deneid it.
Egypt Health Minister has given China the vaccine against the coronavirus. WHO states that as of 3/16/20, there is no vaccine or drug to prevent or treat COVID-19.
The Portuguese soccer player Cristiano Ronaldo decided to turn his hotels into free hospitals This claim is false.
Italy from the space during a flash mob in March 2020. The picture was taken 2014.
Turkish Ministry of Health issued a document that shows radical measures against COVID-19. The document is fake and the signature in the document belongs to famous boxer Vitali Klitschko.
Women’s inhouse gatherings are banned due to the outbreak. The ministry of family did not issue an order banning women's gatherings.
New virus stays at the throat level for four days. The virus attaches to human cells and does not wait to replicate itself. It is not possible to push the virus into the stomach by drinking water.
Turmeric And Lemon Help Fight Against coronavirus. There is no evidence proving this claim.
Coronavirus patient arrested in Punjab This is a mock drill video from Mansa, Punjab.

Coronavirus detection is possible by holding your breath for 10 seconds Infection can be determined only through laboratory tests. No health organization, such as the US CDC, the WHO and the Ministry of Health, have included fibrosis as a symptom of COVID-19.
Drinking alcohol can kill the coronavirus According to the WHO, when the virus has entered a person's body, spraying alcohol or even drinking it will not kill the virus.
Uber services in Ghana were suspended because of the pandemic. Uber services are still available in Accra and other parts of the country.
A military Humvee labeled “COVID-19 quarantine team” was on Interstate 696 in Michigan. The same image has been shared and described as a vehicle spotted in Ohio and London in the United Kingdom.
EFE has published that those who move from one Spanish region to another under the state of alarm will be fined up to 300,000 euros. The EFE did not publish this measure.

Insurance companies will stop covering auto accident policies under the alarm state. Auto insurance coverage to third parties and to all risks will continue to be assumed by insurers as before the declaration of the state of alarm.
Helicopters will spray Spanish cities to disinfect them from coronaviruses. This claim is a hoax. The Spanish Government has no plans to spray cities.

President Giammattei said the economic activity would be limited but didn’t mention call centers and maquilas. Maquilas and call centers continue operating and there are many complaints of COVID-19 risks from their workers.

President Donald Trump is “announcing tomorrow that the U.S. is going into quarantine for the next 14 days.” There was no evidence by 3/16/20 that the federal government was set to announce a nationwide lockdown. President Trump said he was not considering it and that the government is thinking about additional measures to prevent the spread of COVID-19 in some hotspots around the country.

President Donald Trump “will evoke (sic) what is called the Stafford act” and “order a two week mandatory quarantine for the nation.” There is no evidence that the federal government is set to announce a nationwide lockdown. President Trump said on 3/16/20 that he was not considering it. The Stafford Act authorizes aid to state and local governments and is commonly used during hurricanes. It does not mandate a nationwide lockdown.

“Now, as it stands, our health care system has adequate ventilators, ICU beds, medical professionals.” Experts said all evidence points to the U.S. being short on hospital beds, ICUs and ventilators, assuming COVID-19 continues to spread. The U.S. could take any number of actions to increase the number of hospital beds, supplies and medical staff available.

Claim that Dr. Anthony Fauci’s statement that the coronavirus death rate is 10 times that of the seasonal flu is “a claim without any scientific basis.” It is not yet known what the death rate from COVID-19 will be. Early data indicate it is more than 10 times higher than the death rate for the flu.

“Sunlight actually can kill the [novel coronavirus].” This is a common theory because sunlight contains ultraviolet rays, which can kill bacteria. However, experts say the sun's UV light isn't intense enough to rely on as a disinfectant.

Video shows problems faced by Chinese police while catching coronavirus-infected people. The video has nothing to do with the coronavirus pandemic. It was shot last year in September during Hong Kong's ongoing pro-democracy protest.

Flu vaccine increases coronavirus risk 36%, says military study. More research is needed to provide a conclusive answer to the question of whether the flu shot increases the risk of non-influenza viral respiratory infections. While the flu vaccine cannot prevent COVID-19, it still provides several indirect benefits. It reduces cases of flu and flu complications that require hospitalization, in turn reducing the burden on the healthcare system, which has become strained during the COVID-19 pandemic.

Details of three coronavirus positive cases reported in Kothapet (Hyderabad, India). Dr G Srinivasa Rao (Director of Public Health, Telangana) said the viral message is false. Rachakonda Police tweeted that a FIR has been filed in the Chaitanyapuri PS (Kothapet area) on the person who spread the fake news.
One can get free masks from the government to fight coronavirus by filling this form in the web link. These are dubious web links. The government is not making any such offer.

Israeli Minister of Health provides information on coronavirus to Palestinians. The claim is misleading. There is information on the Israeli minister of health website in Arabic, but all of it is preliminary in comparison with what it is published in Hebrew.
President Trump: Swiss company Roche discovered a cure for coronavirus. The video is out of context and the claim is fake.

Video shows the arrest of the first coronavirus case in Jordan. The video shows the arrest of Tamer, the first Jordanian who tested positive for COVID-19, after he escaped his quarantine. The spokesperson for the General Security Forces said the video is fake, even though Tamer was arrested on 3/15/20.
Photo shows the solidarity of Italian people against the coronavirus. The photo dates back to 2013.
Photo shows Palestinians’ solidarity with Italy. The photo shows Israel's solidarity, not Palestine's.

A post on Facebook and Twitter claims an official advisory was issued by Singapore’s Ministry of Health about the first symptoms of the novel coronavirus. The claim is false. A spokesperson for the Singaporean health body told AFP it had not issued such an advisory.

Stage 4 of the epidemic means “quarantine for all cities in France.” Stage 4 of an epidemic in France means a gradual return to normal. France is still in Stage 3 as of 3/16/20, according to authorities and medical experts.

The US House of Representatives raised a question of ‘Korean COVID-19 Diagnostic’. At a hearing held on March 11~12, lawmakers demanded a quick resoposne to US government because they evaluated that diagnostic test in South Korea is excellent.

A headline about the closure of the airport in Skopje: “The Airport Also Closed: 26 passengers from Skopje Airport returned, foreign nationals”. Because the measure of complete closure applies to Ohrid Airport, it is possible the reader will think this has happened to Skopje Airport as well. The ban on entering the country according to the government decision that is enforced refers to the countries exclusively at high risk for COVID-19. Therefore, it is not true that the airport is closed to everyone, as the headline suggests, but only to these passengers.

A large group of citizens in the Republic of North Macedonia — every member of the party Social Democratic Union of Macedonia (SDSM) — is quarantined, allegedly because they were in contact with the director of the Skin Clinic in Skopje, infected with COVID-19. There is no confirmation that the entire party membership of the SDSM has been quarantined.

A headline reads: “Chaos in Debar: Roadblocks, fires, apocalyptic scenes in Macedonia”. Of course, the entrance and exit from the city are strictly controlled and only citizens with proper documentation can leave the city - in case they need urgent medical care that they cannot get from the local health care. But there are no barricades, which can be seen in the photos, nor any apocalyptic scenes.
Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro declared a national holiday due to coronavirus. The "national holiday" was a prank shared by users on WhatsApp.
Nostradamus predicted the coronavirus pandemic. There is no reference to such prophecy in Nostradamus' works.
Brazilian beverage company Ambev stops beer production. Ambev denied any stop in its production.

A video on Facebook and YouTube purports to show billionaire businessman Jack Ma praising China’s response to the outbreak of the novel coronavirus. The video has been doctored. The original video shows Jack Ma at a meeting of former Alibaba employees in 2018, at least one year before COVID-19 was first detected in the Chinese city of Wuhan. The voiceover in the clip has been taken from another clip which shows a different man speaking.
Italian doctors recommend taking off shoes when you get home. Please click the link to read the full article
Christine Lagarde says the elderly are living too long. Please click the link to read the full article
Ecuadorian President Lenin Moreno and family quarantined in luxury Galapagos home. Please click the link to read the full article
Insurance companies in Spain cease to cover traffic accidents due to coronavirus. The Insurance Business Association UNESPA, which includes 200 companies in the sector, has debunked the hoax.
Insurance companies stop covering traffic accidents because the coronavirus. The UNESPA Business Insurance Association denied it.
COVID-19 is caused by 5G. The doctor in the video makes scientifically false statements about the coronavirus.
No evidence that 5G is being forcibly installed in schools. Schools have been closed, but there is no evidence it's to install 5G. It is to protect against the pandemic.

The government is closing businesses to stop the spread of coronavirus even though “the numbers are nothing compared to H1N1 or Ebola. Everyone needs to realize our government is up to something …” Any suggestion that the coronavirus isn't real or that it’s part of a government conspiracy is a false claim.
Photos show animals returning to clear Venice canals. Yes, these photos of clear water in Venice are real. However, the dolphins were not in Venice like one twitter user suggests.

A charitable hospital in Pakistan charged patients for novel coronavirus tests. The claim is misleading. The hospital, founded by Prime Minister Imran Khan, denied charging a fee, saying in a statement that eligible patients have been receiving free tests. The health minister of Punjab also denied the claim.

Train with the name of COVID-19 in september 2019 in America that carry the gas responsible for COVID-19. The image is photoshopped. The type of train on the picture follows a naming pattern and there is no train registered with this name or any similar names.

The photo claimed that violators of quarantine in the Philippines were trapped in wooden fetters. The photo was taken in Córdoba, Colombia. The indigenous, Zenú, were punished by police for disregarding quarantine rules.

President of the Philippines Rodrigo Duterte ordered a mandatory “no work with pay” policy for one month. There is no regulation mandating companies to implement a "no work, with pay" policy. Further, ABS-CBN News did not air or release a report on such a policy.

Breathing deeply in a sauna for 20 minutes kills coronavirus. Infograph in English quoting a “doctor” (Doctoral Degree in Education with a specialization in Psycholinguistics). A sauna is unfortunately not a safe way of feeling better if you have fallen ill with the coronavirus that is flourishing around the world right now. And regardless of whether the virus has settled in the upper or lower airways. If you draw the warm air into the lungs, the body will try to lower its temperature to prevent injury.

Hot bathes and sweating treatments can cure the disease; the virus dies at 40 degrees and the immune system gets stronger with every degree of fever. The claims of Andres Bircher are false or unproven. Taking a hot bath can't kill the virus and the "strength" of an immune system can't be measured.
There is a train wagon carrying the sign “COVID-19” which is used to carry and spread the disease. The photo in question is doctored.

The new coronavirus survives on shoes and other surfaces. Although experts advise by "common sense" to clean and disinfect clothing that may have been in contact with the virus, there is still no certainty of how long it remains alive outside the human body
If you are not a carrier of the virus, surgery masks should be worn inside out. By all means, one should wear a medical mask for the inner layer to be inside.
Israeli scientists developed a vaccine for the novel Coronavirus. Israeli Scientists did not discover any vaccine for COVID-19.
Nostradamus predicted COVID-19. Please click the link to read the full article
A message chain claims that Stanford hospital gives advice to drink water every 15 minutes in order to prevent COVID-19. In a statement, Stanford hospital distanced itself from the fake message.
The Portuguese soccer player Cristiano Ronaldo decided to turn his hotels into free hospitals Cristiano Ronaldo has never decide to turn his hotels in to free hospitals.

Four young people have been hospitalized with coronavirus, exacerbated by the use of Ibuprofen. The claim is not based on fact. It did not match the description of any patients in the hospital in question, and misrepresented the dangers of Ibuprofen.

Claim that football star Cristiano Ronaldo has converted his hotel chain into coronavirus hospitals. A spokesman for Cristiano Ronaldo’s hotel chain, the Pestana CR7, denied the report by sports newspaper Marca. Marca deleted the original report and social media posts. Ronaldo has not publicly commented on the report.
Ugandan president announces the postponement of elections. The claim is false. An electoral commission official labeled it “nonsensical."

A video shows how the coronavirus is transmitted between people The claim is false. The video was produced by a regional hospital trust within the UK’s public healthcare system, the National Health Service (NHS), in May 2010 about how infections spread in hospitals.

In France, a picture shows policemen spraying tear gas on nurses and a text criticizes Macron’s treatment toward health employees. The image is said to have been taken "yesterday," during massive demonstrations in favor of the public health services in France in March 2019. The photo was taken in 2010, before Macron was president.

Cristiano Ronaldo will convert his hotels into coronavirus hospitals. A spokesperson for the hotels said the claim was “inaccurate." Ronaldo has also not mentioned any such plan on his social media platforms.

In Spain dozens of people faced beatings and shoves with the police because they prevented them from going to a mass to pray against COVID-19. The video has nothing to do with the coronavirus, nor with the state of alert decreed in Spain. The video was originally released on 10/14/19, before any reports of COVID-19 in the world.
European and South American flights cause chaos at Mexico Airport, due to coronavirus. The video was recorded in December and is not related to COVID-19.

China benefited financially from new coronavirus Contrary to the article, the country's stock exchanges have suffered from the pandemic. Two of its most important indices -- the CSI 300, which brings together the largest companies in the Shanghai and Shenzhen stock exchanges, and the compound Shanghai -- have fallen 8% and 0.94% since the beginning of the year. In addition, the coronavirus outbreak caused a reduction in economic activity in China, with a sharp drop in industrial production and retail sales and an increase in the unemployment rate in the first two months of 2020.
Chinese intelligence officer reveals coronavirus is a bioweapon. The story originated from a Reddit thread which discusses horror stories inspired by true events.
Indian Daily Reports That Wife Of A Positive Patient Ran Away, did not comply with the authorities and tested positive. The Indian daily misreported this information. She did not flee.
Audio claiming India would be put under a complete lockdown. The government dismissed claims of such a lockdown.
Nostradamus predicted the coronavirus pandemic. The text used as proof is not found on Nostradamus' writings.
A ship from China is anchored in Santa Marta, in Colombia. The Yuan Shun Hai ship is not anchored in Santa Marta and is not from China.
Holding your breath for 10 seconds will tell you if you have COVID-19. This is not an approved method for testing.
There are 30 cases of COVID-19 in Barranquilla, but the government is hiding them. As of 3/15/20, there were no confirmed cases.
Gargling with hot water and salt can prevent COVID-19. There is no scientific basis for this claim.
China has successfully developed a vaccine ready to combat the coronavirus. China announced the vaccine began in a clinical trial, not that it was developed successfully.

A video shows an Italian doctor who says that nobody died from coronavirus in Italy, that it’s not more dangerous than a flu. The video is from February 2020 when there were only 11 deaths by coronavirus in Italy. It is not possible to say whether people with prior diseases die only because of the virus. But studies show that healthy people have also died.
Cristiano Ronaldo will turn his hotels into hospitals. Information was published without verification and denied.

Lombardia, Italy, asks Cuba, China and Venezuela to send doctors. Gallera explained later that Venezuelan doctors weren't related to Maduro but to Piccola Venezia, a local Italian-Venezuelan NGO. China sent doctors with no relations and Cuba, not Gallera, offered to help a week before his speech.
COVID-19 arrived in the U.S. by train. The photo has been manipulated.
Cristiano Ronaldo turned his hotels into hospitals. The claim is false.
A meme posted offers mixed advice — some true, some false — about coronavirus protection. The claims in this meme are muddled.

Left-wing Spanish politicians Irene Montero and Pablo Iglesias have private sanitarian services waiting in front of their homes. Madrid's Health Department, the emergency medical service and PODEMOS say this claim is false.
A message chain claims that Stanford hospital gives advice to drink water every 15 minutes in order to prevent COVID-19. In a statement, Stanford hospital distanced itself from the fake message.
The Portuguese soccer player Cristiano Ronaldo decided to turn his hotels into free hospitals Cristiano Ronaldo has never decide to turn his hotels in to free hospitals.

Four young people have been hospitalized with coronavirus, exacerbated by the use of Ibuprofen. The claim is not based on fact. It did not match the description of any patients in the hospital in question, and misrepresented the dangers of Ibuprofen.

“Bill Gates told us about the coronavirus in 2015.” In the 2015 TED talk featured in the video, he never actually uses the word coronavirus, nor does he mention COVID-19. But his comments do sound prescient. He talks about an epidemic and we're now in the midst of a pandemic. People could be infected with COVID-19 and not show symptoms for days, if at all. And it’s mainly spread between people in close contact through respiratory droplets when someone coughs or sneezes.

COVID-19 is large in size, where the cell diameter is 400-500 micrometers. For this reason, any mask can prevent its entry. The cell diameter is around 120 nanometers. The surgical mask can protect the wearer from sprays and large-particle droplets, but not against infection with coronavirus. People should wear a mask if taking care of a person with suspected COVID-19 infection.

A video showing a man infected with coronavirus and touching pieces of bread in a supermarket in Europe. It's a set-up video, published by a humorous American Facebook page, called "The Philly offensive." The author of this page explained he hates when people touch bread in supermarkets, but does not mention coronavirus.
Guatemalan Ministry of Health is hiding a COVID-19 case in a hospital in the city of Amatitlán. There were no hidden cases in Amatitlán.
Helicopter of the armed forces disinfects the streets at night. This claim is false.
Graphics with information about COVID-19 containing UNICEF branding and inaccurate information. A series of infographics with UNICEF branding making claims about COVID-19 are not from the UN agency.
A situation update allegedly from Kenya’s Citizen TV stating the number of COVID-19 cases. A post about COVID-19 in Kenya that contains a screenshot of a Facebook post by Citizen TV is fake.

A meme shows an image of fully stocked shelves of toilet paper, purportedly during the 2009 H1N1 outbreak, above barren shelves during the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic. The post is misleading. The image of the stocked shelves is a screenshot from U.S. news footage shot in 2020, not in 2009.

A video viewed more than 2.4 million times on Facebook urges people to inhale steam to “kill” the novel coronavirus. Experts say that doing so will not treat or cure the viral infection, and could in fact be harmful.

A video has been viewed thousands of times in multiple posts on Facebook, Twitter and YouTube which claim it shows Chinese police arresting people infected with the novel coronavirus. The claim is false; the video shows police arresting pro-democracy protesters at a subway station in Hong Kong in August 2019.

Research made by scientists from the University of Queensland in Australia has proven that bananas improve your immune system and help prevent COVID-19. The University of Queensland dismissed the claim as false. In an email to Rappler, the university’s communication team said: “The video is fake and we would strongly discourage people from sharing this information. We would suggest you share your concerns with the social media platforms.”
Cristiano Ronaldo transformed some of his hotels into hospitals to fight COVID-19. Cristiano Ronaldo refuted those claims.

A large crowd in Paris protested against the lockdown. It was an anti-government demonstration conducted by yellow-vest activities. As the protest took place on 3/14/20, the French government had not implemented the national lockdown.

The spread of the new coronavirus was planned by the Rockefellers years ago. Scenarios are widely used as analytical methods in simulations. Scenario, which elaborates on the pandemic threat, has nothing to do with the global conspiracy. It is about futurology and possible crisis response management.

The WHO offered the testing kits that they have available and to give it to us now. We refused them. We did not want to buy them.” The WHO never offered to sell test kits to the United States. The CDC opted to develop its own coronavirus test and did not use the WHO’s protocol for the test.

President Donald Trump “cut funding to the CDC,” “fired the Pandemic Response Team,” “refused WHO tests” and “wasted two weeks calling this outbreak a ‘Democrat hoax.’” Trump did attempt to cut the CDC’s funding, but Congress prevented it from happening. While officials in charge of the U.S. response to pandemics did leave in 2018, it’s unclear if they were “fired.” The U.S. was not on a list of countries receiving COVID-19 tests from the WHO. But the U.S. does not usually rely on the agency for diagnostic tests, and the testing delay was due mainly to an error with the CDC’s protocol. While Trump has called the Democratic response to the coronavirus a “hoax,” he has not used the term to describe the virus itself.
The claim that there is a cure from the new coronavirus. The name of the drug is decametoxine. There is no proof this drug can be used in the treatment of coronavirus.
Pandemics happen every 100 years. Global pandemics do not occur every 100 years as God's or nature's scourge. The authors of this claim have selected only those pandemics that fit their assertion.

The quarantine will last until the end of May in Ukraine. The official sources on the day when the news appeared have not published such information. The authors of the article confused the end date of the tax holidays and the end day of the quarantine.

“COVID-19 started because we eat animals.” Scientists think COVID-19 originated in bats and then jumped to another animal host, possibly pangolins, before spreading to humans. As of now, there is no evidence that eating meat is the source of the coronavirus outbreak.

“George Soros owns the WuXi PHARMA LAB located in Wuhan, China, where COVID-19 was developed and conveniently broke out.” George Soros has invested in WuXi in the past, but he does not own it. Research shows the genetic makeup of COVID-19 precludes it from being man-made.
Coronavirus is just “the damn flu.” Coronavirus and the flu do have similarities in spread or symptoms but there are big differences in the death rate and treatment ability.

“So Oscar Health, the company tapped by Trump to profit from covid tests, is a Kushner company. Imagine that, profits over national safety.” Oscar Health does have ties to the Kushner family through Jared Kushner and more directly through Jared’s brother, Joshua Kushner. Oscar Health created a website for finding coronavirus testing locations. The project was launched on the same day that Trump announced a similar partnership with Google.
Says businesses will give you free baby formula during the coronavirus outbreak. Several formula makers have released statements saying the rumor is a hoax.
Ibuprofen can be an aggravating factor; one should use Paracetamol instead. Based on currently available information, the WHO does not recommend the use of of Ibuprofen.
Actor Tom Hanks died due to coronavirus. Tom Hanks and his wife are recovering from the coronavirus.

The Italian medical sector is angry at Ronaldo. The first claim deals with attributing a tweet to a Spanish biology researcher who blames her government for the poor salary biologists receive, while the second claim deals with the content of the tweet itself that Cristiano Ronaldo receives one million euros, unlike doctors who receive 1,300 euros per month. The news is misleading.

Ronaldo Bought an island to isolate himself from coronavirus. Misbar confirmed the news is false. Cristiano Ronaldo did not buy an island to isolate him. After suspending the Series A matches due to the outbreak of COVID-19, he returned to the Portuguese island of Madeira, his hometown in the Atlantic Ocean.

Bahraini women escape from quarantine. A video depicts Bahraini women escaping quarantine and the police are chasing them. The video depicts part of the clashes that occurred between protesters and the Bahraini police during the protests that broke out in 2012.

Supermarkets in Germany will only open two days a week. A screenshot shows a report from the media outlet Focus. Supermarkets are open like usual. The screenshot is doctored; Focus did not report this claim.

The photo of a pornography actor is used to represent a health professional. Several posts on Facebook and Twitter, some with up to 24,000 interactions, present Ángel Muñoz, popularly known as "Jordi el Niño Polla," as part of various teams to deal with the coronavirus pandemic.

Study from Queensland Australia says that eating a banana a day prevents COVID-19 because of Vitamin B6. The university refuted this claim. There is no scientific research confirming a banana or Vitamin B6 prevents COVID-19 infection.

President Vucic claimed that according to the EU decisions, Serbia cannot import medical equipment from the EU countries. Exports of medical equipment outside of the EU are subject to an export authorization by member States. Serbia can import such equipment but it requires an authorization.

Drugs used against malaria (Hydroxychloroquine, Azithromycin) can cure COVID-19. The medicines used by medical doctor to cure the disease, but people shouldn't find for curing themselves because it could be a life-threat by its side-effect.
You can test a quality of reusable mask blowing a lighter as you wear it. Blowing lighter is not a way to test mask quality. Blowing power varies. Beware of burning your mask.
Footballer Ronaldo is turning his hotels into COVID-19 hospitals. There is no evidence that Ronaldo's luxury hotels in Portugal are being turned into hospitals.

No coronavirus in Nigeria yet, according to pastor. The Nigeria Centre for Disease Control reported the country’s first case of coronavirus on 2/27/20 – more than two weeks before the pastor's video was posted on YouTube. A second case was confirmed on 3/9/20.
Cristiano Ronaldo is going to transform his hotels into hospitals. The claim about the Portuguese football player is not true, sources close to the hotels and the player confirmed.

Video shows Italian people greeting and clapping for China during the COVID-19 emergency. The video has been edited by adding the Chinese National anthem and a voice saying "Thank you China." But the video is not related at all to China. Instead, people clapping are supporting Italian healthcare personnel during an organized flash mob.
Nostradamus predicted the current COVID-19 pandemic. The text attributed to Nostradamus does not exist in his book.
State of emergency begins on  3/17/20, according to article 116 of the Constitution. The text is from Spain.
Quarantine may last for several years. The information has no official support.
“Amoxi” Capsule, made in US, is the only medicine that can completely cure COVID-19. Amoxicillin has nothing to do with COVID-19. It's an antibiotic drug for killing bacteria, not a virus.
Did genetic mutations cause the coronavirus to become more dangerous. Infectious disease specialist said no proof that mutation specifically caused virus to be more dangerous.
Two psychics and a book about CIA have predicted the COVID-19 pandemic. These people anticipated certain aspects of the crisis, but it doesn't mean they predicted the pandemic.

In the Philippines, Bagong Alyansang Makabayan (Bayan) Secretary General Renato Reyes was spotted panic buying in an S&R Branch. Reyes dismissed the claim as false, saying the photo was taken two years ago.

Dettol is an effective disinfectant for COVID-19. Disinfectants based on chloroxylenol or Dettol report that they are active against coronaviruses. By that they actually mean other viruses of the coronavirus family. They could not yet investigate whether Dettol also works against the current coronavirus.

The coronavirus pandemic was planned by Rockefeller back in 2010. There is no evidence that anyone has planned the pandemic. The scenarios described in the Rockefeller Foundation report are mere assumptions.

It was claimed that Israelis discovered vaccine for Coronavirus and no more deaths will be there The Defense Ministry of Israel denied the claim as its team is still closing in on developing a vaccine for the coronavirus.

Specific compounds can be used effectively to prevent and/or treat every viral infection including the new coronavirus. The organisation responsible for the disemination of those rumors has a history of pseudoscientific assertions regarding miraculous ""natural cures" for diseases like Multiple Sclerosis and all forms of cancer. Both their past assertions as well as the current ones regarding natural ways to cure COVID-19 don't have any scientific basis.

Having a patent on a virus means we have created the virus. The patent as not related to this coronavirus. The claims are coming from a misunderstanding of what the word "patent" means in 2020, and especially in life sciences.
Cristiano Ronaldo transformed his hotels into hospitals for COVID-19 patients. Cristiano Ronaldo did not say this and is not planning to do this.
Viral image with differences between a cold, the flu and COVID-19. The symptoms are not accurate.
Catalonia universities give all course credits to its students after classes being suspended. The education ministry in Catalonia denied this claim.
Spanish home office has not issued a statement announcing the complete closure of Madrid, the Basque Country and La Rioja. Home office denied the authenticity of the document.
Felipe Gonzalez, ex-prime minister of Spain, says the Spanish coalition government cannot face the COVID-19 crisis. The Twitter account is a parody.

The current coronavirus has been “manufactured” in Wuhan. There is no scientific reason to support this claim. The international scientific community condemns conspiracy theories and recalls that the current coronavirus originated in wildlife.
An American soldier has been paid to spread COVID-19 in Europe. The man is sheriff's deputy Rick Grimes, the main character of "The Walking Dead," and the image is a thumbnail from the first episode.
Turkish President Erdoğan will declare a curfew due to COVID-19. The item in the Hurriyet newspaper is manipulated. President Erdoğan's speech did not cover such a measure.
Two COVID-19 patients were executed in North Korea. The content belongs to a parody account. As of 3/14/20, there is no declared COVID-19 case in North Korea.
Italian air force’s air show to motivate the public under quarantine. The video was shared in September 2019, before the outbreak. The Italian army has no such plans

Ireland is going into a full lockdown. Despite two messages which were widely shared on WhatsApp, the country did not go into a full military lockdown with the army patrolling the streets. Shops have not been restricted in their opening hours and public transport has not been canceled.

A photo claims that military vehicles are combating COVID-19 in Palermo, Italy. Sicilian media wrote that the military was indeed driving through Palermo, but vehicles were coming back from a military exercise and had nothing to do with the virus. As of 3/14/20 there is a handful of confirmed COVID-19 cases in Sicily.

A graphic claims that gargling warm water with salt or vinegar can eliminate the novel coronavirus. The claim is false. International health authorities and experts do not list gargling as an effective remedy or prevention method for COVID-19.

37.000 US soldiers are entering the EU while everybody is busy with the coronavirus; the soldiers are immune. The Nato exercise Defender Europe 20 is no secret exercise; there are only 29.000 US soldiers and media reported about it for months. Further, it was stopped because of the coronavirus outbreak. Soldiers are not immune.

The University hospital in Vienna found out that Ibuprofen speeds up the spreading of the coronavirus. The voice message is not true and it is not clear whether Ibuprofen can have a negative effect. There is no proof so far that it affects COVID-19 patients

Drinking lots of water and gargling with warm water and salt or vinegar eliminates the coronavirus. The claim has not been confirmed by any health institution. The WHO says there is currently no specific treatment, drug or vaccine for COVID-19, although some home remedies may provide comfort and alleviate symptoms.

Quotes by Finnish national health authorities between January 20 and March 3 are taken out of context. An image with the title "THL and coronavirus in the news" is being circulated in social media, gathering comments from the National Institute for Health and Welfare on coronavirus from January to March. The statements by THL experts appear to be largely inaccurate when removed from context. The list is misleading. Its purpose is to undermine the credibility of the responsible authority, THL, without providing verified information.
Corporations invented the coronavirus. There is no evidence to support this claim.
Curfew issued for Bossier city due to coronavirus. The article says it's a joke and a prank.
CEO Resignations Are Linked To Global Conspiracy. Some CEOs have stepped down since the coronavirus outbreak, but there's not evidence to suggest it's linked to a global power issue.
Coronavirus is found in crab legs. The image is not from a real broadcast; it came from an app that lets people create their own stories.
Military on streets of Philadelphia preparing to invoke martial law and bring citizens to FEMA camps. Lt. Col. Keith Hickox, the state public affairs officer, said the information was false.
Article overstates threat of coronavirus. The claims in the article are not backed by science.

Drinking lots of water and gargling with warm water and salt or vinegar eliminates the novel coronavirus. Spread the information as you can save someone. According to GMA news report, gargling with water and salt will provide no protection against or cure for the 2019 novel coronavirus. The report also included a statement from Dr. Eric Domingo: “I think this is a home remedy that has been followed for many, many generations and I don't think there’s going to be any harm in doing it. Saline gargle has always been advocated to improve mostly symptoms of sore throat. I don't think there is any evidence that it will kill a virus."

Eating salt on the onion will eliminate the coronavirus. According to the WHO, eating onions increases the immune system but is not related to treatment of the coronavirus. A cure for this virus has not yet been discovered.
Viral image with differences between a cold, the flu and COVID-19. The symptoms are not accurate.
