There are one hundred children infected with COVID-19 in the main hospital in Lima. Authorities denied the information of one hundred children infectec with the virus in that hospital, the main public facility for the treatment of children in Lima.

Turkish President Erdoğan will declare a curfew due to COVID-19. The item in the Hurriyet newspaper is manipulated. President Erdoğan's speech did not cover such a measure.

Ireland is going into a full lockdown. Despite two messages which were widely shared on WhatsApp, the country did not go into a full military lockdown with the army patrolling the streets. Shops have not been restricted in their opening hours and public transport has not been canceled.

A post shows a rail freight tanker with “COVID-19” stamped on one side. The image has circulated globally but it is false, the tanker operating company said. Railinc, a corporation that manages an industry-wide database, said there is no such mark as “COVID-19.”

Gargling salt with water “eliminates” the 2019 novel coronavirus. Local and international health authorities have said there is no proof that gargling water with salt eliminates the novel coronavirus. There is no known cure.

Former senator Antonio Trillanes IV allegedly posted a tweet saying that President Rodrigo Duterte is to blame for calamities the country has been facing, including the novel coronavirus pandemic. The tweet came from an account posing as Trillanes. Using his official Twitter account, the former senator explained how the username of the account is different from the one he’s using.
Astrologers had predicted the appearance of a coronavirus in 2020. Horoscopes and astrological forecasts have no scientific basis.

“Italy has decided not to treat their elderly for this virus.” Italy, second only to China in the number of COVID-19 cases, hasn't decided to stop treating elderly COVID-19 patients. The elderly are a lower priority because they are less likely to survive, and hospitals are overwhelmed with coronavirus cases.

Says that “over a 45-minute period that we had the press conference” on the coronavirus on March 13, 2020, the stock market set “an all-time record.” The Dow had a record-high point increase on the day Trump declared a national emergency in response to coronavirus, with the surge accelerating during his late-afternoon news conference. But that followed a record point decrease the previous day. And it was followed by a sharp drop by the opening of the next trading day, which saw continued declines before closing.

After husband tested positive for coronavirus, wife fled from Bangalore to Agra in India. The woman went to her parents' place in Agra on 3/9/20, while her husband was confirmed positive for coronavirus on 3/12/20. She did not enter Bangalore city. Karnataka government has clarified that the woman did not flee to her parents’ place.

French Fans Cheered With Joy When President Macron Announced Holiday To Fight coronavirus. Misbar determined the video shows England fans during a football match between the Wales and England national teams.
Video From The German Government To Its Citizens About coronavirus. The video is old, and was posted in 2010 by the University Hospitals Birmingham Hospital via its online platforms.

Leaving half an onion in your home will “catch” the coronavirus and prevent people from getting it. Onions are not a way to prevent the coronavirus from entering your home. The claim that onions can help prevent illness has been around since the 1930s.

Before reaching the lungs, the coronavirus remains in the throat for three or four days and at this time the person begins to cough and have a sore throat. If you drink a lot of water and gargle with warm water and salt or vinegar, you can remove the virus. The WHO does not recommend drinking or gargling with any liquid as a prevention method. Also, it can damage the throat.

Drink water a lot and gargle with warm water and salt or vinegar to eliminate the virus. The virus infects a cell, not just the throat. Water cannot clean the virus from an infected cell, and cannot reach the respiratory system.

A Cuban vaccine cured 1.500 people infected with the new coronavirus. There is no vaccine available, according to health authorities. Experts estimate it will take about 18 months to develop and test a vaccine that can be safe for human beings.
The Simpsons had already predicted the coronavirus pandemic. The claim is false. The images used to illustrate this were manipulated and are not original images from the series.

Gargling warm salt water or vinegar prevents coronavirus infection. The claim is false. International health authorities and experts do not list gargling as an effective remedy or prevention method for COVID-19.
There are 100 children infected with COVID-19 in the main hospital in Lima. Authorities denied the informaton about the main public facility for the treatment of children in Lima.
There are 100 children infected with COVID-19 in the main hospital in Lima. Authorities denied the information about the main public facility for the treatment of children in Lima.
If you drink water with lemon, it prevents the new coronavirus. There is no scientific evidence to support this theory. Health authorities have not made any recommendations regarding water and lemon.

LGBTQ people in the US are demanding to be treated first for coronavirus. Pulpit and Pen quotes a Reuters article about an open letter signed by more than 100 LGBTQ rights groups, calling on organizations handling the global coronavirus pandemic to remember “that LGBTQ+ communities are among those who are particularly vulnerable to the negative health effects of this virus." But it doesn't ask for anyone to be given priority treatment.

Stop taking NSAIDs as it increases the effect of the virus on the body and causes the spread of COVID-19. There is no studies shows that NSAIDs increase the spread of COVID-19. WHO said that until now it doesn't recommend against the use of NSAIDS.

Check list of symptoms for COVID-19, regular flu and seasonal cold. Photo comparing the symptoms of COVID-19, regular flu, and seasonal cold. WHO given as source. Are you affected by COVID-19, influenza or a simple cold? You can quickly get that clear by studying a graphic presentation of symptoms of one, the second or the third. But the checklist is highly misleading. You can't make it as simple as it is in the otherwise well-meaning look-up, health researchers say about the graphics.

A video with thousands of shares and more than 1.5 million views on Facebook claims to show FBI agents seizing masks infected with the novel coronavirus. The clip shows a raid on the home of a man in New York arrested for allegedly coughing on FBI agents while claiming to have COVID-19 and lying to them about hoarding and selling medical supplies.
COVID-19 is a vaccine that is ‘activated’ and spreads with the 5G. The cause of COVID-19 is the SARS-CoV-2 coronavirus. There is no scientific evidence that 5G causes harm to health

Multiple Facebook and Twitter posts shared hundreds of times claim the World Health Organization (WHO) reported that no vegetarian has contracted the novel coronavirus. The claim is false; the WHO denied issuing the report; as of May 2020, health experts have said there is no scientific evidence to suggest that a vegetarian diet prevents infection from COVID-19.
Says kitchen worker in viral video is potentially spreading coronavirus by blowing into food containers. This video appeared online as early as 2017.

Daniel Radcliffe is the first celebrity to test positive for Coronavirus. The claim was coming from a parody Twitter account. The imposter Twitter account has been suspended for spreading misinformation.
Vodka can reduce the Coronavirus threat. Vodka cannot reduce COVID-19 infection.

They are not looking for volunteers to be infected with COVID-19 in British laboratories for 4,000 euros. Headlines shared on networks do not specify they will inject other coronavirus strains, 0C43 and 229E.

Zhong Nanshan: Shower may cause coronavirus infection, according to cases in Hong Kong and the Diamond Princess. Zhong said "sewer" but it was translated as shower in Chinese in one wechat account. Taiwanese media misunderstood as "shower" and interviewed Taiwanese officials and experts about it.
The Minister of Defense of Japan posted a tweet to thank Taiwan for donating 500,000 face masks. It is a fake tweet.

Asterix comics in 1981 mentioned coronavirus; French people knew the outbreak in advance. Coronaviruses had been known for awhile and the term no only refers to COVID-19. Asterix comic books in 1981 did not mention coronavirus. The issue from 2017 did refer to coronavirus, but it is not related to the current outbreak.
A Turkish citizen in Yozgat ate yogurt and soap together to get rid of the virus. The claim was first published on an parody site. There is no such citizen or doctors in Yozgat as mentioned.
The health service in Ireland is asking people to stockpile food. The claim is not true. The supply chains in Ireland remain robust
Ireland is going into a ‘Status Red’ lockdown with the military patrolling the streets. The claim was untrue. Ireland has not gone into lockdown
COVID-19 Breeds Rapidly In Toilet Paper. The post is fake and is from an unauthentic website.
A photo claimed that a Lithuanian town of Mazeikiai is being cut off from the rest of the country due to outbreak of COVID-19. The original photo shows a sign about a road maintenance project.

A Facebook post claimed that a message from Stanford hospital gives advice to drink water every 15 minutes in order to prevent COVID-19 A statement from the Stanford hospital disclaimed the fake message.

An image claims that hundreds of infected people are hidden in Lithuanian hospitals, and were taken to crematoriums. The original message was published by a prank-generating Facebook account and repackaged to look as if it was real.

Claim from an “uncle” who “graduated with a master’s degree” and worked at Shenzhen Hospital offers advice on COVID-19 symptoms and treatment. Based on the evidence, AAP FactCheck found the post to contain a mixture of true and false claims. A runny nose, sputum, dry cough and pneumonia can be symptoms of COVID-19 however not everyone infected with the disease will have them. Disease expert Professor Collignon says temperatures around 26 to 27 degrees C won't kill the virus; however, UV light from the sun can be effective in drying out the virus. Understanding of how long COVID-19 survives on surfaces is limited, with the WHO referring to previous studies of other viruses to estimate a range of a few hours to a few days. Drinking warm water, avoiding iced drinks and gargling warm salt water are not treatments or preventions, but staying hydrated is important and gargling may relieve sore throats. The timeline for progression of COVID-19 symptoms is partly accurate but not everyone will experience all of these symptoms or in that order. The  delicate tissues behind the nose are likely starting points.
Ancient herbal drink is an effective remedy for the novel coronavirus. Experts advise against using herbal remedies to treat the coronavirus
Consuming silver particles will prevent or treat COVID-19. This is false because the US regulators say it is not safe for use against any disease.

Image contains a 2015 photo of Tom Hanks and the ball in the movie ‘Cast Away’. The claim is false; the image has been doctored using a 2015 photograph of Hanks and a stock photo of a hospital ward; the doctored photo emerged on a satirical website.
False COVID-19 hotline number shared in Canada. 811 is not an official public health hotline in Ontario, and the provincial ministry of health is not organizing home visits, a spokeswoman told AFP.

Israel has no cases of the coronavirus because it developed a cure. Official WHO data and Israeli media reports state at least 298 people have been confirmed with the disease as of 3/16/20. Israel has implemented travel restrictions and closed businesses in response to the spread of COVID-19. Various countries have been working develop a vaccine for COVID-19 and WHO guidance currently states there is no cure for the virus to date.

A photo shows full vegan supermarket shelves, next to empty ones, with a caption saying “even at a time of coronavirus, no one wants to eat vegan”. The photo had been circulating on the Internet for over two years.
After the closure of schools in France, President Emmanuel Macron announced classes next summer to catch up. Emmanuel Macron has not made this announcement, published from a fake account.
Cuba developed a coronavirus vaccine. Cuban medication has been used for treating COVID-19 in China, but it is not a vaccine and the substance has been discovered elsewhere.
Holding your breath without coughing will determine if you have COVID-19 The claim is false. Difficulty breathing is a feature of any respiratory illness and not a sign of coronavirus.
Books predicted the coronavirus before it happened. One book does have a close enough accurate representation; the second is a work of fiction.
India announced holidays for four states. No such letter was issued by the government.
Israel and USA have come up with a vaccine. Israel has found a vaccine with properties similar to COVID-19; San Diego had developed an algorithm.
Viral video suggests the two cases of coronavirus in Ghana tested negative. The video is not new. It was part of a news item published by Citi TV on 2/6/20, when two suspected cases tested negative.

Dettol sanitizer can kill the coronavirus. Dettol has been tested and found to kill coronaviruses such as Middle East Respiratory Syndrome (MERS) and Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome (SARS). However, the manufacturer of Dettol, Reckitt Benckiser Group plc(RB), says it has not yet tested its products on the novel coronavirus and could not confirm whether Dettol is effective against the new coronavirus strain.

A misleading chart being spread on Facebook, erroneously dubbing the new coronavirus the “least deadly virus.” The chart cites old data about coronavirus cases and deaths, and it contains an error that makes COVID-19 look less fatal than the 2009 H1N1 “swine flu” outbreak.
Indian Ministry of Health and Family Welfare issued an office memorandum declaring compulsory holiday in four Indian states. Ministry of Health India has denied the notification.
A scientific paper published in Nature in 2015 shows that the new virus was developed in labs. The authors state that viruses similar to SARS have been detected in populations of bats.
Image showing Italian doctors exhausted and sleeping. Images that were used belong to a campaign in Mexico for health workers' rights.
Propolis cures COVID-19. There is no evidence to support this claim.
A secret invasion of 40,000 American troops immune to COVID-19 is ongoing in Europe. This claim is false.
COVID-19 is human-made, and an American biological weapon Scientific research shows the virus is not human made.
Croatian president tells people to buy in bulk for at least 2 weeks. The president did not say you should buy food to sustain you for two weeks.

People are panicked about a COVID-19 case at the Dakar Airport. The footage has nothing to do with the coronavirus pandemic and was taken out of context from Senegalese TV footage showing an exercise.
Saddam Hussein explaining what is coronavirus about. Sound has been edited. It's a video from 2003 where Saddam Hussein is talking about the USA/Irak war.
Saddam Hussein explaining what is coronavirus about. Sound has been edited. It's a video from 2003 where Saddam Hussein is talking about the USA/Irak war.
Healthy ministry sent an email about the new coronavirus. Colombian Ministry of Health said the email was false.
The coronavirus scare began after impeachment. The outbreak began in China in late 2019, and led the WHO to declare a global health emergency on 1/30/20, before the final impeachment vote.
Supermarkets are recalling coronavirus-infected toilet paper. The CDC said that coronavirus is spread through respiratory droplets. There are no reports of toilet paper recalls.
Man did pass along coronavirus infection at a WalMart in Louisiana. The man in the photo who posted it admitted the claim was a joke.
NYC did implement a citywide quarantine. NYC Mayor Bill de Blasio tweeted it was a false alarm.
Spanish Ministry of Interior is closing off Madrid. The ministry of Interior has denied releasing the statement.
Drinking hot beverages prevents coronavirus infection. Fluid intake has nothing to do with the infection process.
Audio from WhatsApp that says there are a doctor and two nurses hospitalized on the ICU in Terrassa (Barcelona) The hospitals in Terrassa deny this situation.
Film “Coronavirus” predicted the current pandemic The original title of the film in Korean is "Gamgi" (Cold), "Flu" in English, and is translated into Spanish as "Virus."

A viral message listing false and unrelated statements about coronavirus has falsely been attributed to the United Nations International Children’s Emergency Fund (UNICEF). No such advisory has been released by UNICEF. Not much is known about novel coronavirus as it is a newly found coronavirus.

Israel has manufactured the coronavirus vaccine According to Israel, work at the Biological Institute will take time. Fifty of the most senior researchers and scientists are working hard to prepare a vaccine. The image circulated with the claim is a reference image, available on shutterstock.

They are not looking for volunteers to be infected with COVID-19 in British laboratories for 4,000 euros. Headlines shared on networks do not specify they will inject other coronavirus strains, 0C43 and 229E.

Zhong Nanshan: Shower may cause coronavirus infection, according to cases in Hong Kong and the Diamond Princess. Zhong said "sewer" but it was translated as shower in Chinese in one wechat account. Taiwanese media misunderstood as "shower" and interviewed Taiwanese officials and experts about it.
The Minister of Defense of Japan posted a tweet to thank Taiwan for donating 500,000 face masks. It is a fake tweet.

Asterix comics in 1981 mentioned coronavirus; French people knew the outbreak in advance. Coronaviruses had been known for awhile and the term no only refers to COVID-19. Asterix comic books in 1981 did not mention coronavirus. The issue from 2017 did refer to coronavirus, but it is not related to the current outbreak.
A Turkish citizen in Yozgat ate yogurt and soap together to get rid of the virus. The claim was first published on an parody site. There is no such citizen or doctors in Yozgat as mentioned.

Central government has announced blanket holiday for schools/colleges in 4 states in India. The Ministry of Health issued a clarification on Twitter and called the viral “official memorandum” fake. Further, sources in the Health Ministry also confirmed to The Quint that the circular has not been issued by the ministry.
The health service in Ireland is asking people to stockpile food. The claim is not true. The supply chains in Ireland remain robust
Ireland is going into a ‘Status Red’ lockdown with the military patrolling the streets. The claim was untrue. Ireland has not gone into lockdown
COVID-19 Breeds Rapidly In Toilet Paper. The post is fake and is from an unauthentic website.
Singapore checks the saliva of Indonesian arrivals at Changi Airport. The COVID-19 swab test is only intended for tourists who have symptoms such as fever or other respiratory ailments.

A Twitter post claimed Cristiano Ronaldo is transforming his string of hotels to hospitals to aid in the fight against COVID-19. A spokesperson from the hotel denied the claim and there is no such statement present on any of the footballer’s media accounts.

Advice about coronavirus prevention and remedies, allegedly from Stanford Hospital. Almost all advice listed in the original and widely spread Facebook messages was false. Facebook did not label these messages as misinformation in English or Dutch.
Staff of Gold Coast Hospital in Australia has gifted a volleyball to Tom Hanks in quarantine. The image has been morphed to claim that Tom Hanks was gifted a volleyball.

An infographic has been shared thousands of times in multiple Facebook posts which claim it shows a nine-day timeline of the symptoms of the novel coronavirus. This infographic is misleading; it was not distributed by an official health authority and health experts say COVID-19 symptoms vary in duration and severity.

Evo Morales (ex-mandatary of Bolivia) has COVID-19. Morales continue his normal activities. On 3/12/20, he posted on his Twitter account. Followers of the political party Movement to Socialism (MAS) did not refer to the health condition of the ex mandatary.

A post shared more than 165,000 times on Facebook includes a video of a woman turning a baby wipe into a face mask to “protect against coronavirus.” The company that sells the wipes says they should not be used in this way, and health experts also recommend caution.

Eleven coronavirus patients visited malls and hotels in Metro Manila that are part of a “confidential list.” The DOH has dismissed the claim as fake. The malls and hotels in question have not posted any advisories regarding possible infection.

A vaccine for the 2019 novel coronavirus has been found and there will be no more deaths due to the coronavirus. As of 3/20/20, there is no vaccine or cure for the disease caused by the 2019 novel coronavirus and there have been 217,510 cases and 9,020 deaths, across 157 countries.
Drinking “water a lot and gargling with warm water and salt or vinegar eliminates” the coronavirus. These claims have not been proven scientifically.

In South Florida “all children and adults must remain in their homes” due to coronavirus. Announcements from several major local governments in south Florida had no complete lockdown announcements. Governor Ron DeSantis closed bars and nightclubs statewide.

“President Trump, COVID-19 coronavirus: U.S. cases 1,329; U.S. deaths, 38; panic level: mass hysteria. President Obama, H1N1 virus: U.S. cases, 60.8 million; U.S. deaths, 12,469; panic level: totally chill. Do you all see how the media can manipulate your life.” As of 3/17/20, numbers that suggest H1N1 was worse than COVID-19 are misleading. It’s too early to calculate how deadly the coronavirus will be, but there are signs it’s much worse.

Says The New York Times exposed the “real reason behind coronavirus hype: Crash the market to harm Trump’s re-election chances.” There's no evidence the coronavirus was manufactured. The New York Times story was an analysis of how current events may influence the election.
Sex helps prevent coronavirus. There is no proof that sex can help fight the new coronavirus.
Juventus player Paulo Dybala denies contracting coronavirus. Paulo Dybala, on his Twitter account, denied on 3/13/20 that he had contracted the virus.
After contracting coronavirus, did Tom Hanks get Wilson’s ball In quarantine? The original image is from a video published in February 2015.

Aajtak news channel claims that consuming the herbal plant Tulsi will cure coronavirus. The WHO has not confirmed the claim. Aajtak channel has not run this information. The viral photo with channel logo is fake.

An article about “An Italian doctor working in China gives advice on avoiding infection.” The article is filled with outdated and false advice on how to cure the virus. None have been officially confirmed by the WHO or any other relevant institution.
Drinking cold water, hot drinks or alcohol protects against coronavirus. These claims hold no medical value.
Picture shows the Mecca totally empty. The picture is designed by an artist.
Saddam Hussein explains what coronavirus is about. The sound has been edited. The video from 2003 shows Saddam Hussein talking about the US/Iraq war.
Audio from WhatsApp that says there are a doctor and two nurses hospitalized on the ICU in Terrassa (Barcelona) The hospitals in Terrassa deny this claim.

A post says that if you hold your breath you can tell if you are infected with COVID-19 or not. A pulmonologist and member of the National Public Health Commission assured that this exercise doesn’t have any clinical applicability and it’s not safe. You can do the exercise, pass it and be infected with COVID-19.

Get the disease now to gain immunity. Infograph mimicking official information. "If you are infected with coronavirus, take a stroll in the sauna and breathe deeply for 20 minutes and kill the infection." This is how recommendation sounds on the web. But the council does not have teams in reality, say experts, who at the same time state that instead, it is very easy to risk infecting others.

Denmark has more coronavirus cases per capita than China. One should be careful about letting the number of infections express how coronavirus is spreading in Denmark. And one should also be careful to compare the figures across countries as they are made up in vastly different ways

Citi TV interview with Korle Bu CEO discredits confirmed coronavirus cases in Ghana. The management of Citi TV has in a statement called on the general public to disregard efforts to suggest that there is no confirmed coronavirus case in Ghana. Meanwhile GhanaFact also used Invid Video Verification to authenticate when first the video was published.

We can neutralise the new coronavirus SARS-CoV-2 by exposing ourselves to the sun and drinking hot beverages. The use of a mask is not effective and the virus itself is a threat to our life only if we are part of a high risk group. There is no medical proof that exposure to the sun or drinking hot beverages work as a means to neutralize SARS-CoV-2 since the virus needs a lot more heat to be neutralized than the temperature the human body tolerate and a hot beverage does nothing to increase our body temperature. Also, the protection offered by a mask depends on its type and the virus is not dangerous only to people with pre-existing conditions.

The Greek government and parliament knew about the new coronavirus pandemic before it occured and thus, in the summer of 2019, rushed to make the new penal codes instructions regarding the protective measures in case of a disease outbreak official. The law regarding the penalty for breaking the rules a government can impose to limit the spread of a disease have been in place since 1950.
Vitamin C will protect you from the coronavirus. This is not true, both experts and global health organizations strongly deny that Vitamin C will protect you from the coronavirus.

Advices from the university Tec de Monterrey scientists (Mexico) to prevent the new coronavirus. Most of the advice presented was useless and most of the councils do not have scientific support and the authorship of the message was denied by the institution.
The coronavirus outbreak is over in China. That claim is misleading because China has accumulated more than 80,000 cases.

Video shows Bahrainian women running from hospitals where they were being quarantined because of COVID-19. The video dates back from 2012 showing women running from the police after protests in Bahrain.

A photo has been shared hundreds of times in multiple posts on Facebook and Twitter alongside a claim it was taken during the “Spanish flu” pandemic between 1918 and 1920. The claim is misleading; the photo has circulated in reports about fashion in 1913, about five years before the 1918 influenza pandemic; a spokesman for German photo agency Süddeutsche Zeitung Photo told AFP the photo shows “nose veil” fashion in 1913 after the Balkan war.

“It’s actually the safest time to fly.” Older Americans and those with chronic conditions are advised to reconsider all travel plans to avoid COVID-19. The State Department is advising all citizens to reconsider travel abroad.

Claim that COVID-19 has been around for a long time, with a photo of an animal vaccine labeled “coronavirus.” The coronavirus affecting these animals is different from the virus that appeared a few months ago in China, for which there is no vaccine.
Podemos spokesman Pablo Echenique is not in intensive care after getting infected with COVID-19. The tweet imitated El Mundo's official account.
Education Ministry announces all students are passing the actual course without making exams because of coronavirus. The education ministry issued another document that was manipulated.

The smell of tea tree oil can kill coronavirus in nostrils, according to a study of an Austrian university. It works in a lab, but there is no evidence to prove that smelling oil for 15 minutes can kill the coronavirus.
Councilor Pen White-Chung said coronavirus is from the USA based on a Chinese academic study. The information is based on an unfounded claim shared by China officials.
President Donald Trump admitted the flu cases in the USA are actually infected with the coronavirus. The video is a clip of Trump's speech, but the subtitle and caption are false.
Chinese people prayed with Muslims due to fear of COVID-19. The video was shared in June 2019, before the outbreak.
Turmeric and lemon can cure the coronavirus. Medical practitioners and the WHO say this claim is false.
Drinking water every 15 minutes will protect you from getting coronavirus. There is no medical evidence to support this.
You can check for coronavirus by holding your breath for 10 seconds. There is no evidence to support the claim.

Elderly people are left to die in an Italian hospital near Milan. Information was based on an audio message circulating via WhatsApp. The message was posted by Il Giornale, which later retracted it. Niguarda hospital released a statement claiming the information was false.

Airports and train stations in Lithuania are being closed down. The article used a statement by the government claiming that schools are being closed. Authors of the misleading article added information about airports and train stations in a headline but used the government's statement as main text.

COVID-19 is cured with hot water and baking soda. Mortality statistics indicate that seasonal flu is at least 60 times less deadly than COVID-19 (based on current data). Hot water and soda have no proven effects to help combat the novel coronavirus.

Claim that disease outbreaks and pandemics correspond with election years. Based on the evidence, AAP FactCheck found no correlation between election years and virus outbreaks. The outbreaks of SARS, Bird Flu and COVID-19 do not line up with the dates claimed in the post. In the case of Zika virus, the disease has had multiple outbreaks since 2014 in parts of Oceania and in Brazil. Bird Flu, MERS and Ebola have not been reported in Australia and have not been a significant feature of local political discussion or debate. Considering overseas elections, such as U.S. presidential elections, there is also no consistent pattern of outbreaks occurring in election years.
Photos show empty shelves at supermarkets. The photos have circulated online since 2015.

A video purports to show body bags for virus victims in Italy. The video previously circulated in media reports about people who died after contracting COVID-19 in Iran; a man recording the video can be heard stating that he is inside a mortuary in the Iranian city of Qom.

Warm drinks kill the coronavirus, the virus dies when the ambient temperature is higher than 26ºC, gargling warm water helps treating the disease and the virus stays on your hands for 10 minutes. None of these claims have scientific support.
Mexicans can call the Mexican government to get a COVID-19 test at home. The UIES line was enabled only for suspicious cases and not for the general population.

3,500 Italians potentially infected with the novel coronavirus arrived in Brazil in a cruise ship The photo shared with misinformation is from the Costa Fascinosa cruise, and the company responsible for the vessel reported that all of its passengers in Brazil are from South America. The ship left Italy on 11/17/19, passed through France and Spain and has been on the Brazilian coast since 12/2/19, two months before Italy confirmed its first coronavirus case.

The Brazilian government released additional money for beneficiaries of Bolsa Família, a national conditional cash transfer programme. The Ministry of Citizenship, responsible for the program, denied on its social networks that there will be such a release and stated that it only announced the inclusion of 1.2 million families in Bolsa Família. Messages circulating on WhatsApp with this misinformation link to fake websites.
News channels suggest drinking tulsi and noni juice will help prevent the novel coronavirus. A morphed screenshot of the news channel was used to support the false claim.

Argentine President Alberto Fernández said that coronavirus dies at 26 degrees Celsius. The WHO maintains that the virus can be transmitted in all climates and "the virus is too new for us to know how a warmer climate could affect transmissibility." According to the CDC, it is not yet known whether climate and temperature affect the spread of COVID-19.

Argentine President Alberto Fernández said “the WHO recommends hot drinks because heat kills the virus” The organization did not issue any recommendation on the consumption of beverages for the prevention of coronavirus. Experts deny this advice and say that it could be harmful.

Hot lemon juice prevents coronavirus. The claim is false. The publication allegedly written by "Laila Ahmadi of China, Faculty of Medical Sciences, Zanjan University" is false and that university is not located in China.
Iranians have published a report saying that coronavirus is a biological warfare. There was no such report and claims about coronavirus being biological warfare have been debunked.

Consuming onion and salt followed by a glass of water can cure coronavirus. There is no scientific evidence to prove that onion, salt and water can be used to cure COVID-19. There is no cure for coronavirus.
Consuming salt and onion can cure the novel coronavirus. Sri Lankan health department officials have officially dismissed the claim.

Most countries affected by COVID-19 are along the same 40-degree north latitude. The 40-degree north latitude passes through some of the countries most affected by COVID-19 but does not pass through half of the locations in the post. It does not touch Wuhan (Hubei Province – where around 60% of all the positive cases are reported), which is at around 30-degree north latitude.
Indian President Ramnath Kovind pouring gaumutra (cow urine) on globe to prevent coronavirus. The 2017 image is false.

A worker at the Prince hotel in Mehdipatnam (Hyderbad, India) has tested positive for coronavirus. The claim is fake. In Telangana state, as of 3/12/20, only one confirmed case of coronavirus is reported and the person who tested positive is a software engineer.
Drinking water in which garlic was boiled will cure you from COVID-19. There is no evidence to support this claim.
OMS staff member is spreading coronavirus on purpose. The man is an astrophysicist, and he is touching the woman because she is his girlfriend, and she is sick.
Jair Bolsonaro has the new coronavirus. Health authorities have not confirmed the case and they are the ones who can test.
Garlic heals the new coronavirus. The WHO said there is no evidence to prove this claim.
The U.S. presidential election is canceled due to coronavirus. The federal government has made no such announcement about canceling the U.S. presidential election.
Australian hospital staff rolled in a Wilson volleyball to keep Tom Hanks company in quarantine. This claim is from a satirical website. The photo is old and unrelated to Tom Hanks' illness.
A former and controversial CIA officer said coronavirus was made in a lab. The quote was pulled out of context and was speculation, not fact.

Viral audio from WhatsApp in which a doctor from the hospital Fundación Jiménez Díaz in Madrid claims that there are two young patients in very bad condition because of coronavirus and there are no more respirators in intensive care units. In an internal document, the head of intensive care unit explains that the young patients have no pathologies related to coronavirus and there are respiratories for all patients.
Zamora has canceled Holy week due to the coronavirus. It's a false article created on 12minutos, a site for satirical articles.
Catalonia, Valencia and Aragon cancel classes in schools, colleges and universities because of coronavirus outbreak. The article was not published by El País.
Tuit reports that Brazilian president Jair Bolsonaro has tested positive for the coronavirus. This is a fake Twitter account pretending to be Folha de São Paulo.
Audio from WhatsApp that says there are a doctor and two nurses hospitalized on the ICU in Terrassa (Barcelona) The hospitals in Terrassa deny this situation.
China has announced the success of Egyptian serum form Dr. Hala, Health Minister of Egypt, against coronavirus Egyptian Health Ministry denied it.
Podemos spokesman Pablo Echenique is not in intensive care after getting infected with COVID-19. The tweet imitated El Mundo's official account.
Education Ministry announces all students are passing the actual course without making exams because of coronavirus. The education ministry issued another document that was manipulated.

Drinking water every 15 minutes will protect you from getting coronavirus. There is no medical evidence to support this.
You can check for coronavirus by holding your breath for 10 seconds. There is no evidence to support the claim.

A video of Chinese people fighting for Muslim scriptures to not get infected by coronavirus. The video has been circulating since 2014, before the coronavirus was first reported in late December 2019. It shows Christians in China opening their Bibles for the first time

Private health insurance for public workers does not cover expenses related to coronavirus. The statement published by Independent Union of the Tax Agency of Spain on 3/12/20 is real, and the public institution (MUFACE) affirm that all its insured (public workers) have 100% coverage in expenses related to COVID-19.
Vitamin C protects against the spread of the coronavirus. Lemon in hot water fights cancer. COVID-19 arises from the fusion of genetic material of a snake and a bat. These claims are not proven.
Says Tom Hanks has a volleyball to keep him company while he’s quarantined. The image of Tom Hanks holding a Wilson volleyball during his COVID-19 quarantine is from a satirical Australian website.

Of the Trump administration’s European travel restrictions that exempt the U.K.: “Well, you can just get into the Chunnel, and you’ll be in the U.K.” It isn't that easy to get around the restrictions by taking a train linking England and France.

A video has been viewed hundreds of thousands of times on Facebook, Twitter and YouTube alongside a claim it shows a shaman curing a novel coronavirus patient in Malaysia. The claim is false. The video has circulated in posts about a hospital in Indonesia since at least October 2018, more than one year before COVID-19 was first detected in the Chinese city of Wuhan.

A fake quote of Vice President Leni Robredo suggesting to “inhale cough back” to prevent the spread of the 2019 novel coronavirus. The vice president did not say what was attributed to her in the graphic. News5 said the graphic was edited using their template.
If you donate blood, “they HAVE to test you” for coronavirus. Blood donors don’t get a coronavirus test if they donate blood.

“During the 2009 swine flu outbreak, Biden made reckless comments unsupported by science & the experts. The Obama Admin had to clean up his mess & apologize for his ineptitude.” During the 2009 swine flu outbreak, Biden said he would advise his family against traveling in confined places and said when one person sneezes “it goes all the way through an aircraft.” Scientists say that’s not how germs spread. Biden’s comments were met with backlash and his spokesperson issued a clarification.

Donald Trump claims Joe Biden “was in charge of the H1N1 Swine Flu epidemic which killed thousands of people. The response was one of the worst on record. Our response is one of the best, with fast action of border closings and a 78% approval rating, the highest on record. His was lowest!” Joe Biden was not in charge of the Obama administration’s H1N1 response. Trump overstated public confidence in his administration’s response to the coronavirus and downplayed confidence in the Obama administration’s response to H1N1.

Says Nancy Pelosi was “caught trying to include abortion funding in bill to combat coronavirus.” The U.S. House passed a measure that provides federal funds to people affected by the coronavirus. The bill covers reimbursement laboratory costs for COVID-19 testing. Some raised concerns that language was needed to ensure abortion services weren't eligible to receive funds. The language was amended by Democrats to limit reimbursements to COVID-19 expenses.

In 2007, “The Simpsons” predicted Tom Hanks would contract coronavirus in 2007. In the closing credits of “The Simpson Movie,” Hanks says: "This is Tom Hanks, saying, if you see me in person, leave me be." The movie is about an environmental crisis. There’s no reference to any kind of outbreak.

“The CDC can detain anyone with a fever indefinitely. Vaccination (is) a way people could get out of detention.” In the United States, people can't be quarantined for just a fever; they have to be shown to have been exposed to one of a specific set of diseases. Most quarantines are voluntary, not by force of the government. Vaccination is not a ticket out of quarantine. Most quarantine decisions are up to states and localities, rather than the CDC.

COVID-19 came to the United States in 2019. The first confirmed COVID-19 case in the United States was reported on 1/20/20. The patient was a man who had recently returned to Washington state from Wuhan, China.
The new coronavirus dies when a temperature around is 26-27 degrees Celsius. The virus doesn't die when the temperature is around 27-28 degrees Celsius.
Saint Luke’s Hospital of the USA says consuming alcohol can reduce the risk of COVID-19. Saint Luke's Hospital has not issued this advisory.
Live stream about the infected foreigners coming to Ukraine from Italy, which went viral. The passengers on that plane were not infected and some of the information by the speaker was false.

Coronavirus first infection In Jeddah.. The first infection with COVID-19 in Jeddah, a woman from an Asian country showing symptoms of suspected coronavirus, and falling on a street. The Emirate of Makkah Province denied, on its Twitter account, what was circulated about the infection of a Chinese woman with the virus.
The novel coronavirus after 2,600 times magnified. The image is enlarged to show mites, not coronavirus.

The virus can be overcome by drinking hot water every 15 minutes, avoiding cold drinks and ice cream, going out in the sun to kill the virus, and with the “self-diagnostic guideline” — if you hold your breath for 10 seconds and then you do not cough, you do not choke, you do not feel any tension in the lungs, you have no cystic fibrosis in the lungs and the situation is reversible. These claims are false. The virus enters the oral cavity and the nose, so drinking hot water will not carry the virus to the stomach. Viruses are destroyed at higher temperatures than those normally tolerated by humans, and even sun exposure and body heat have no effect.
Prime Minister Ana Brnabic claimed that the number of respirators is a state secret in all countries. Information about number of respirators is available in many countries.

A doctor from North Macedonia states that the new coronavirus outbreak  is a conspiracy against humanity or a conspiracy of the pharmaceutical industry for profit, and that the new coronavirus is not dangerous. The text contradicts recognized authorities and institutions, such as the WHO, which has  declared a pandemic of the new coronavirus and confirmed its seriousness.

Cuba has developed a vaccine against coronavirus. Cuba is working on a vaccine option, but it is not ready for distribution; Facebook posts mention Interferon Alfa 2B, a medicine used against hepatitis.

Drinking tea and hot water kills the virus; lemon slices in warm water may save your life; it’s recommended to keep your money in a sealed plastic bag; a conspiracy theory suggests China is benefiting from the pandemic; vinegar is good for cleaning your hands. Coronavirus has already spread to countries with hot weather; water with lemons does not help prevention; the WHO recommends washing your hands after touching your money; Asian markets have been operating in low marks because of the pandemic; the WHO recommends using alcohol gel and soap to clean your hands.
A YouTube video claims to show mass animal killings linked to coronavirus outbreak. The pig footage dates back to 2018 and the poultry footage did not depict contaminated animals.
KFC San Marino Shopping (Guayaquil, Ecuador) employee with COVID-19. Please click the link to read the full article
Policemen in China chase COVID-19 in a subway station. Please click the link to read the full article
UNICEF’s advice on preventing COVID-19 Please click the link to read the full article
Spain ex-King Juan Carlos I has the coronavirus. The claim was tweeted from a fake account pretending to be Spanish newspaper El País.
The new coronavirus dies at a temperature of about 26-27 degrees Celsius. The virus doesn't die when the temperature is around 27-28 degrees Celsius.

If you can hold your breath for 10 seconds then you don’t have fibrosis and therefore no infection. Picture of text in English describing the method. The recommendation to hold your breath for 10 seconds is shared in several different social media posts. Supposedly, it can reveal if you have pneumonia, which is one of the symptoms if you have been infected with the coronavirus, COVID-19. But closing your mouth, holding your nose for ten seconds, and waiting for you to cough or not, you can't use for anything, experts say.

Researchers in Taiwan provided a series of checks we can perform ourselves as a form of self-diagnosis for the new coronavirus every morning. These instructions have appeared in many posts, most of which have different possible authors with the majority claiming the original source is Stanford University which has already publicly denied authorship of those guidelines.

Drinking water with lemon can prevent COVID-19. The claim is false; experts told AFP that there’s no proof this is effective in preventing the disease and that practising good hygiene is the best way to stay healthy.

Drinking alcohol and smoking helps preventing the new coronavirus from infecting the organism. Drinking alcohol and smoking weaken the immune system and increase the risk of complications from COVID-19.
Jair Bolsonaro tested positive for COVID-19. Please click the link to read the full article
In Colombia, “First Child registered as Yair coronavirus Mosquera.” The screenshot of the alleged note from Caracol has been broadcast on social networks.
Seven ambulance workers are infected with coronavirus in Catalonia. Health ministry of Catalonia confirmed there are no ambulance workers infected.
Pedro Sánchez has a medical team of 14 people to take care of him since the coronavirus crisis. The medical team has been in the presidential house since 1997, and has nothing to do with COVID-19.
Retirement benefits reduced by 50% in April in Italy. The public statement was fake. The national social welfare institution has never shared that document.
A video claims to show coronavirus being extracted from a man’s upper lip. A botfly larva is being extracted from the man's lip in the video.

Uganda did not deport 19 passengers from high-risk COVID-19 countries. Ugandan authorities did not deport 19 passengers on a KLM flight from Amsterdam to Entebbe. The passengers did not show severe flu-like symptoms.
American CDC admitted that coronavirus originated in the U.S. Many COVID-19 patients were misdiagnosed as coronavirus. The claim that coronavirus came from the United States is false.

Water company: More chlorine has been added to tap water to prevent coronavirus. Let the water rest for two hours before using it. The water company did not release such a statement and did not add to the water.

Indonesia Only Prohibits Migrants from Iran, Italy, and South Korea and Allows the Entry of Chinese Citizens Restrictions on the entry of migrants from China have been done earlier by the government, on 2/5/20. In addition to stopping flights to and from China, the government has temporarily suspended the issuance of Visas and Arrival Visas for Chinese citizens.
Is this COVID-19 Virus Prevention Information Really Originating from UNICEF? UNICEF has denied this post and information circulating in a number of countries, including Indonesia.
Cow urine and feces can treat COVID-19. No health organization has confirmed drugs or vaccines to prevent and treat COVID-19.

The map shows the first COVID-19 case diagnosed in Kayseri, Turkey. The Johns Hopkins map shows the geographical centers of the countries, not the places in which case are diagnosed. Metadata shows the details.
UNICEF published health advice on COVID-19. UNICEF did not publish the text. The medical advice in the text is not scientifically-based.
Coronavirus dies at a temperature above 26-27 degrees Celsius as per UNICEF. The claim was not issued by UNICEF.

Photo of vegan food products left on otherwise bare supermarket shelf is related to COVID-19 outbreak and panic buying. Based on the evidence, AAP FactCheck found the Facebook post to be incorrectly linking the supermarket shelf image to the novel coronavirus outbreak. The image of a supermarket shelf full of vegan foods while the shelves on either side remain empty has nothing to do with the outbreak. The photo was taken in 2017 in the United States when Hurricane Harvey hit the southern state of Texas.
Chart compares COVID-19 with other longstanding diseases. The graphic is misleading and risks underplaying the danger of COVID-19, which is a new disease with a fast-rising mortality rate.
Viral claims that holding your breath can test for COVID-19. The claims are false because the World Health Organization and other experts said there was no evidence to support these claims.

Imported second hand clothes from Europe, Asia or America could spread the novel coronavirus in Africa. Experts told AFP the novel coronavirus does not survive long enough outside the human body, and could not survive on long journeys.

Hold your breath 10 seconds to check if you are infected with the novel coronavirus. Only a test made by labs can detect the novel coronavirus, according to the WHO and some experts interviewed by AFP.
Vitamin C and lemon water prevent coronavirus. There is no recommendation from the WHO or scientific evidence to support this. There is no vaccine or medication for COVID-19.

Japanese doctors claim drinking water every 15 minutes prevents COVID-19. No Japanese advisory has been issued regarding frequent consumption of water. The WHO has clarified that drinking water will not prevent a coronavirus infection.
Muslim People in China seeking refuge in Islam by reading Quran to save themselves from COVID-19. The video has existed since 2013, long before the outbreak of COVID-19.
Anti-Malaria Drug Chloroquine Is A Cure For coronavirus. This claim is false. There is no scientific evidence to prove that Chloroquine can cure COVID-19.

No more deaths from COVID-19 as Israeli scientists have discovered a vaccine. Various vaccines proposed by Israeli scientists and other researchers across the world are under development and are yet to be cleared for production and distribution. Israel’s MIGAL Research Institute is also in the process of producing a vaccine for COVID-19. According to the WHO, as of 3/11/20, there is no vaccine for COVID-19.
AIIMS (Indian medical institute) team has said that Toddy has medicinal properties to cure coronavirus. AIIMS team did not make the statement.

Iran’s head of judiciary: The first centers that volunteered to suspend activities in response to the coronavirus outbreak were religious Institutions and those connected to the clergy. Weeks after the outbreak, holy shrines and mosques refused to close down.
Holding your breath for 10 seconds can determine if you have COVID-19; drink water every 15 minutes. The article lists myths that contradict WHO recommendations.
Racist scene against Chinese people in the metro in Belgium. Vidéo is an excerpt of the Youtube channel "Would you react" with actors.
Demonstrations against Chinese people in Italy. Anti-fascist demonstration on February 22 in Roma.
Racist scene against Chinese people in the metro in Belgium. Vidéo is an excerpt of the Youtube channel "Would you react" with actors.
Why it’s dangerous to make your own hand sanitizer at home. DIY videos don't' tell you it's dangerous.

A case of new coronavirus was confirmed in the city of Ibagué, in Colombia. Health authorities had not confirmed the case and they were the only ones to be able to do so because they are the ones who can test.
Coronavirus found in toilet paper. This claim was created by a prank generator, and the CDC did not cite it as a way coronavirus spreads.
Gargling salt water and vinegar will kill the virus. Pulmonologist debunked the memes, and CDC offers real advice about how to say safe.
Malaga closes nurseries due to coronavirus. The image a manipulated screenshot of an El Mundo article.

Neuroscientist Rodolfo Llinás says that if you can last 10 seconds without coughing and without discomfort it means that there is no fibrosis in the lungs and therefore no coronavirus infection. Rodolfo Llinás claims he did not say that and there is no evidence the recommendations are effective.

“Arsenic album-30 homeopathic medicine can prevent coronavirus. Information given by Ministry of AYUSH.” According to the WHO, there is no evidence that any medicine can stop or cure the coronavirus. The WHO does not recommend any medication, including antibiotics, as a prevention or treatment of COVID-19. The AYUSH Minister Mr. Padnaik never claimed that arsenic album 30 can cure coronavirus.
Seven ambulance workers are infected with coronavirus in Catalonia. Health ministry of Catalonia confirmed there are no ambulance workers infected.
Pedro Sánchez has a medical team of 14 people to take care of him since the coronavirus crisis. The medical team has been in the presidential house since 1997, and has nothing to do with COVID-19.

American CDC admitted that coronavirus originated in the U.S. Many COVID-19 patients were misdiagnosed as coronavirus. The claim that coronavirus came from the United States is false.

Water company: More chlorine has been added to tap water to prevent coronavirus. Let the water rest for two hours before using it. The water company did not release such a statement and did not add to the water.

In addition to stopping flights to and from China, the government has temporarily suspended the issuance of Visas and Arrival Visas for Chinese citizens.

The map shows the first COVID-19 case diagnosed in Kayseri, Turkey. The Johns Hopkins map shows the geographical centers of the countries, not the places in which case are diagnosed. Metadata shows the details.
UNICEF published health advice on COVID-19. UNICEF did not publish the text. The medical advice in the text is not scientifically-based.
Coronavirus dies at a temperature above 26-27 degrees Celsius as per UNICEF. The claim was not issued by UNICEF.

Indian yoga guru Baba Ramdev has been infected with coronavirus. A photo of Ramdev is from 2011 and shared with a false caption. It was taken in Dehradun after the yoga guru broke his nine-day fast. He had been on a hunger strike demanding a tougher law against corruption and seeking the return of black money stashed abroad.

The virus dies with high temperatures, teas fight COVID-19, holding your breath for 10 seconds proves you are not infected, drinking a lot of water stops the coronavirus, any mask can avoid contagion, coronavirus does die when “exposed to the sun.” These claims are false, according to the WHO and medical experts.
Madrid is going to close its borders due to the coronavirus. The claim is denied by the Spanish police on Twitter.

“NYC man drops dead in middle of street — suspected coronavirus!” New York City Police say a man was taken to the hospital after falling and hitting his head. He was in stable condition and it was unrelated to coronavirus.

The health insurance industry has “agreed to waive all co-payments for coronavirus treatments.” Health insurance companies said they will waive costs for coronavirus tests, not treatment. A shortage in diagnostic supplies means that testing is limited.
Are pools open in Guatemala? Can coronavirus be transmitted in a pool? Pools were closed by the Swimming Federation of Guatemala to avoid infections.

“MSNBC actually said on air ‘I hope enough people die from coronavirus that it harms Trump’s re-election.’” MSNBC panelists compared former President George W. Bush’s response to Hurricane Katrina to President Donald Trump’s response to the coronavirus outbreak, and speculated it could hurt his popularity.

Neuroscientist Rodolfo Llinás says that if you can last 10 seconds without coughing and without discomfort it means that there is no fibrosis in the lungs and therefore no coronavirus infection. Rodolfo Llinás claims he did not say that and there is no evidence the recommendations are effective.

Audio from WhatsApp in which the head of Cardiology at the Gregorio Marañón Hospital states that we are in a moment of uncontrolled coronavirus infection. The public health authorities of the Community of Madrid have said the audio belonging to the head of cardiology at the Gregorio Marañón Hospital is false.
China is supplying the Quran to people to read after the coronavirus outbreak. This seven-year-old video has no relation to coronavirus.

“The Eyes of Darkness” predicted the coronavirus outbreak. "The Eyes of Darkness," published in 1981, predicts the emergence of COVID-19. In the book's new edition, the author talks about a biological weapon, a virus called "Wuhan 400", originating from the same city in China. He did not mention COVID-19 or its main symptoms such as shortness of breath and high temperature.
A picture of the Chinese President in Wuhan without a mask. The image is old and has been posted on the official Chinese news agency Xinhua website since October 2018.

About 1,000 people wait to enter the Military Medical Academy (VMA) in Belgrade for examinations. People came for routine check-ups and only their temperature was measured. Many people were only accompanying those who went for a check-up and were not allowed to enter thus causing queues outside.

A viral screenshot of a story allegedly published by the BBC claiming Ghana has recorded its first confirmed coronavirus case. The claim was denied by the BBC correspondent in Ghana and the Ghana Health Service. The misinformers modified the HTML codes from the BBC website to create the false headline and story.
President Vucic claims that no one said coronavirus is the “funniest” virus. The video of renewed doctor claiming that coronavirus is the "funniest" virus exists and is available online.

Welfare Ministry for the Region Lombardy has said that “China lied to us” and “all of the data provided by the Chinese government are fake.” The Welfare Ministry never made this statement. It simply stated that COVID-19 is spreading faster than what forecasts suggested.
A doctor says coronavirus doesn’t kill or cause the common cold. The doctor's claims contradict official information from the WHO.
The coronavirus was created in the laboratory and is a biological weapon. The claims are based on the opinions of two men who are not virologists, but rather conspirationists.
Panic scene in Germany with people rushing into a supermarket. The video was made during the sales.
Demonstrations against Chinese people in Italy. An anti-fascist demonstration took place on 2/22/20 in Roma.

If your nose is running you don’t have COVID-19. The virus dies at 27 degrees celsius, thererfore you should drink hot water or tea. The most common way to get infected is to touch surfaces. Every normal mask can filter the virus because it is very big. The claims are false or unproven. A running nose can be a symptom of COVID-19. The virus doesn't die at 27 degrees, it can live with much higher temperatures. Drinking hot beverages doesn't cure or prevent the disease.

Marijuana is a cure for the coronavirus. This statement is untrue because there is no evidence of positive effects of marijuana against the new coronavirus and the claim comes from a translated version of a satirical article originally published in Spanish.

200 new cases of COVID-19 registered in Lithuania. People are “cleansed with bleach” at the Vilnius international airport and taken to a small tent-town nearby. One COVID-19 case is confirmed in Lithuania as of 3/10/20. Officials claim there was no such "explosion" in cases.

Purported government advisory lists shopping malls and hotels in the Philippines that the department of health advises against visiting during the novel coronavirus epidemic. The Philippine Department of Health said the purported advisory is fake.
Senegal doctors have come up with a serum against the coronavirus. The Senegal government has denied this claim; at present there is no treatment or vaccine against the novel coronavirus or COVID-19.

Professor Jean-Jacques Muyembe, an expert who discovered Ebola, says black skin is “so efficient that it can not be infected by novel coronavirus”. Professor Muyembe denied to AFP having said such a statement.
Vitamin C and warm water with lemon are effective ways of preventing COVID-19. Vitamin C and warm water have no known effects on the novel coronavirus.
This video shows a coronavirus patient in Mexico persecuted by the press. The video was recorded on 2/18/20 at the Instituto Nacional Cardiopulmonar, Tórax de Honduras.

Video shows a WHO official inappropriately touching a female attendee during a briefing session in China about the novel coronavirus outbreak in Wuhan. Same video was also used with another claim that the man is an Australian politician. Video was taken out of context. The man in the video is a 2006 Nobel Prize laureate in physics, Professor George Smoot, not someone from WHO or a politician. The clip shows Smoot attending a business conference in Julu County in Hebei Province in China in June 2018 with his significant other who had a sore back at the time.
Drinking hot tea can prevent coronavirus infection. Drinking hot tea has no effect on the novel coronavirus.

Argentinian Health Minister said there is no possibility the coronavirus exists in Argentina. Recommendations of Dr. “González Ayala” are circulating on WhatsApp. Dr. Silvia González Ayala denied that she was the author of the recommendations and said that she will file a criminal complaint.The text has several false claims.

An audio is circulating on social media claiming it’s from the Colombian scientist Rodolfo Llinás offering some recommendations to know “if we have the infection” of the COVID-19 coronavirus. Audio by Rodolfo Llinás with recommendations on the COVID-19 is false.
Tips against coronavirus like holding your breath and drinking water. These tips don't prevent infection with coronavirus.
Fake coronavirus pandemic is a cover-up for the “5G disease.” There is no link between 5G technology and the spread of the coronavirus.
Coronavirus is actually chemtrail lungs. Chemtrail lungs do not exist as a condition.

Every U.S. election year has a disease outbreak. WHO data doesn't match the dates in the post, and many diseases originate outside the U.S.
10,000 deaths In virus outbreak in Michigan, Washington, Idaho, North Dakota, Missouri, Mississippi. The CDC counted 25 deaths and 647 confirmed coronavirus cases in the United States as of 3/10/20.
Thieves in Palma (Spain) are pretending to be doctors to steal in people’s houses. National and Local Police explained that there is no complaint that describes a similar case.
Gang in Vitoria pretending to be doctors to steal from people’s houses. Local and regional police said they have no complaints about such assaults.

The head of Coordinated Emergences, Fernando Simon, has said that is better to get coronavirus now, because later there will be no space in hospitals. Simon did not make the statement; it is satire shared as real.

Madrid’s government has announced students will have to make-up classes during summer. Madrid's government hasn't announced the students will have to make-up classes during summer: the shared photo is fake.

Regional government of Castilla-La Mancha announced in Twitter the closing of schools until April 1. Regional government did not make the announcement; the image was manipulated.

Spanish Education minister Isabel Celaá wore purple latex gloves on a Women’s Day demonstration because she was afraid of the coronavirus. Other women politicians did this years before the coronavirus.
Madrid ex-mayor Manuel Carmena has coronavirus. This false claim was made by a fake Twitter account pretending to be Spanish newspaper El País.

Post says Harvard scientists say the coronavirus is “spreading so fast that it will infect 70% of humanity this year.” An epidemiologist at Harvard University projects 40%-70% of adults could catch coronavirus in the coming year.

Many critics of President Rodrigo Duterte slammed his administration for “slashing” P10 billion from the funds allocated for the Department of Health (DOH) in the 2020 national budget. The National Expenditure Program (NEP), also known as "the President’s budget," initially proposed a lower budget for DOH for 2020 compared to 2019. This was eventually increased in the approved 2020 General Appropriations Act (GAA) or national budget after deliberations in Congress.
You can kill the coronavirus by drinking hot drinks. Experts firmly refute the claim.
You can monitor yourself for COVID-19 with a breath test. Holding your breath for 10 seconds is not a proven test for COVID-19.
A group prays in The Squares of Italy to get rid of coronavirus. The prayers took place in Italy, but the photos were published 11 years ago.

Sisi Raised The Numbers of coronavirus Cases in Egypt in the Hope of Billions from the World Bank. "When I announced a $10 billion grant to the countries in which coronavirus was prevalent, President Sisi called me and confirmed 8,000 cases of infection in his country," the World Bank president said at a conference. Misbar found the news to be false and that the World Bank announced an initial financing package worth $12 billion to tackle COVID-19 in more than 60 countries in the world.

A statement says: “Serbs have ‘lion’s genes’ that protect them from coronavirus, unlike Italians who have ‘weaker genes'” by pulmonologist Branimir Nestorovic. Nestorovic claims that he did not make this statement, nor did he think Serbs had superior genes, but only different ones.

While everybody is busy with coronavirus, authorities in Görlitz, Germany, secretly brought asylum seekers into the city. It was not a secret mission but the normal transfer of 23 asylum seekers from an initial reception site. This happens regularly.
Vitamin C kills viruses. There is no evidence that Vitamin C can kill viruses or fightsCOVID-19.
The Japanese Government gives out 40 masks to every household, free of charge. This claim is false.
UNICEF ​​advises not to eat ice cream because it reinforces infection with the new coronavirus. UNICEF has released an official statement confirming this information is false.

A Macedonian coronavirus patient, the director of the Skin Clinic, was at the wedding of the Secretary General of the Social Democratic Union of Macedonia. A phone call to the Secretary General of SDSM confirmed she was not present.
A patient infected with coronavirus was killed by drug dealers. Facebook post saying a patient with coronavirus was shot by drug dealers in Rio de Janeiro was a prank.
Tips against coronavirus include holding your breath and drinking water. These tips do not prevent coronavirus infection.
First patient healed in Algeria. The man is from Morocco and appears in a TV ad for a hospital in Morocco.

Madrid’s government has announced students will have to make-up classes during summer. Madrid's government has not made this announcement; the shared photo is fake.
Holding your breath for 10 seconds can determine if you have COVID-19 and you should drink water every 15 minutes. There is no medical and scientific evidence of this claim.
Onion could be used to cure COVID-19, as it did for the Spanish Flu in 1918. The story is unscientific.
Does Mexico have confirmed cases of COVID-19? Johns Hopkins coronavirus Resource Center records show Mexico has COVID-19 cases.
The World Health Organization is not recruiting staff to fight COVID-19. The WHO has dismissed this claim, which has been posted on a site not linked to the organization.

A coronavirus vaccine for cows shows that the virus behind the current outbreak is not new. This is a different coronavirus from SARS-CoV-2, the virus that causes COVID-19. coronaviruses are a large family of viruses that can affect a range of species.

A video where a woman dressed like a Chef prepares food with only one glove, and she blows on it with no protections. The video would have been shot in Africa during the COVID-19 pandemic. The video was shot in 2015, and the woman is an employee of the Brazilian supermarkets chain Angeloni. She was not respecting the sanitary norms, but this is not connected with COVID-19.

Flu vaccine does not increase the risk of a coronavirus infection. Some studies seem to show that the flu vaccine increases the risk of other viral respiratory infections, but a larger and more long-term study was unable to confirm these results.

Antibiotic azitromycin cures COVID-19. In case of a mild infection with the coronavirus, antibiotics are useless. The rumor that the antibiotic azithromycin might work in severe cases remains to be investigated. Even for the treatment of pneumonia, this is currently not a top choice.
Holding your breath is an effective way to self-diagnose for COVID-19. Being able to hold your breath for ten seconds or not doesn't tell you if you're infected with the coronavirus.

Spraying from the air triggers “chemtrails (chemical trails) lung” problems Media outlet named "With The Truth Against Lies" has been writing about non-existent disease called "chemtrails lung disease" for years. COVID-19 had become a part of the story about this invented disease at the beginning of March. The new claim about this "disease" is that COVID-19 is actually a cover up for the real "chemtrails pandemic". Chemtrails lung disease does not exist, neither do chemtrails as such. Therefore the link between this "disease" and COVID-19 is utterly groundless.
The bill for a coronavirus test in the US is 3.000$. The CDC is not making people pay the test by now.
This Lysol disinfectant against coronavirus shows the virus is not new. The disinfectant refers to the other types of coronavirus.
A doctor named Lupita Yamamoto Lupercio found the coronavirus vaccine. The person pictured is Sandra Oh, an actress from "Grey's Anatomy." There is no vaccine against coronavirus yet.

Israeli scientists at the MIGAL Research Institute have developed a vaccine for COVID-19. Researchers at the MIGAL Institute in Israel have announced a breakthrough in research, but they have not developed a vaccine.
Secretary of Health in Mexico recommends taking Vitamin C to prevent coronavirus. This false information was disseminated by a brand of nutritional products.

A prostitute contracted COVID-19 and her 86 clients have been quarantined in the brothel in Spain. The claim is from a fictional content outlet. Spanish government and mainstream media did not release such a statement.

Pier Luigi Bersani: None of the confirmed cases are related to China. coronavirus might have occured in Italy before China. In the interview, Bersani did not say the virus originated in Italy. Prince of the United Arab Emirates was infected with the coronavirus in early March 2020 The Prince of the United Arab Emirates, Mohamed bin Zayed, is still active and not quarantined as of 3/9/20. The Twitter account that spread the false information has been closed.

COVID-19 can be killed over 37 degrees Celsius. There is no confirmed information on what temperatures are dangerous to the virus.
Anti-malaria drug Chloroquine is a definitive cure for COVID-19. A study found the molecule showed "apparent efficacy" in treating the disease, but trials are still ongoing.

Costco recalls toilet paper because it’s infected with the coronavirus. The notice is not authentic, according to a statement from the wholesaler, and the brand of bath tissue in question is not listed on official recall websites.
Donating blood in the U.S. can get you a novel coronavirus test. The two organizations that collect the most blood in U.S. said they were not testing for COVID-19.
Employer covered up part of a poster on virus prevention that advised people to stay home when sick. The part covered up on the poster advises people to avoid large gatherings.
Authorities in the Philippines seize fake cigarettes that were spreading coronavirus. Video shows Philippine customs seizing cigarettes in May 2018.

Video claims to show a hotel collapsing in Chinese city of Quanzhou after it was used as a coronavirus quarantine facility. The video has circulated online since at least April 2017 about a hotel demolition in China’s Jiangsu province.
Video shows reciting Namaaz and Quran is the only treatment for COVID-19. The video is a "viral test" from Aaj Tak's show.
UNICEF advises a certain set of steps to follow for coronavirus. UNICEF has not released this advisory and most of the claims are not scientifically proven.
Hundreds of Italian families are running away from the virus to Africa. There is no proof of this assertion.

Availability of a kit for coronavirus self-diagnosis. A Facebook advertisement selling surgical masks links to a webpage where they sell also a kit for coronavirus self-diagnosis. Hand sanitizer will “do nothing for the coronavirus.” The CDC says hand sanitizers with 60% alcohol can be used to prevent contracting and spreading the virus.
Viral claims propagating UNICEF message about coronavirus. UNICEF denied issuing the images.

In an Aaj Tak news report, the Chinese prime minister said, “Reading Quran and offering namaz is the only cure for COVID-19.” It is a clipped video of Aaj Tak’s fact-check. In the full version, Aaj Tak debunked the claim and concluded that no such statement was made by the Chinese PM.

Iran’s former president Mahmoud Ahmadinejad: It is clear to the world that the mutated coronavirus was produced in a lab, manufactured by the warfare stock houses of biological war belonging to world powers. This claim is baseless.

The French health minister underestimated the risk of contamination in France. The French Health minister said that the risk of seeing the virus spreading in France was almost equal to zero, but it was at the very beginning of the outbreak in China and her statement was consistent with the data she had.
Freshly boiled garlic water is a cure for coronavirus. There is no cure.
Department of Homeland Security official says illegal border crossings may spread coronavirus. No officials were quoted to confirm this headline.
A NYC Man With Suspected coronavirus Drops Dead in the Middle of the Street. As of 3/9/20, there were no confirmed deaths in NYC.
Gang in Madrid is pretending to be doctors to steal from people’s houses. Neither the National Police nor the local police have any complaints about this issue in Madrid.
Coronavirus was caused by a mysterious vaccine activation distributed in China by chemtrails and activated by 5G. It is a combination of old conspiracy theories.
EvAU’s exam is postponed to June 18 in Madrid. Madrid's government has not made this announcement; the viral image is a set up.
Spanish actress Cristina Pedroche has promised to show a breast if the number of coronavirus infections reaches 1,000 in Spain. The false claim is from a satirical website.
