Post says “President Trump has come into contact with a potential coronavirus sufferer!” There is no evidence President Donald Trump came into direct contact with a coronavirus sufferer.
Post says “being exposed to the sun for two hours” kills the 2019 coronavirus. There is no evidence that sun exposure kills the 2019 coronavirus. UNICEF has debunked a post that makes this claim.

“(Former U.S. President Barack Obama) set up anti-pandemic programs in 47 vulnerable countries as a way to protect against something like the coronavirus. Do you know that Trump closed 37 of them?” News reports in early 2018 said the CDC was preparing to scale back its anti-pandemic programs in some countries because an early source of funding was running out and the agency didn't expect to receive new money from the Trump administration.The spending bills that lawmakers ultimately passed provided more money for those CDC programs than Trump’s budget requests.

The Department of Health (DOH) reports fake cigarettes that spread coronavirus have reached the Philippines. The DOH did not issue any advisory on the transmission of the coronavirus through fake cigarettes or that they have reached the Philippines.

“An entire family” in Santolan, Pasig, is “confirmed to be infected” with the novel coronavirus, according to what looked like a breaking news graphic from GMA News. Pasig City Mayor Vico Sotto called the graphic a “fake ‘GMA’ post.” The social media team of GMA News said they did not release the “JUST IN” graphic that circulated online.

Chinese eating exotic animals is the cause of the 2019 novel coronavirus, as shown in photos shared on Facebook. Some of the photos were not taken in China. As of 3/13/20, the coronavirus source is not confirmed.
A second version of the coronavirus is spreading and it is far more dangerous. Mutations of the virus exists, but it is uncorrect to claim that a "second version" would be more dangerous.
This laboratory is giving money to people who would agree to be infected with the novel coronavirus. This experiment pertains to another coronavirus and has no link with COVID-19.

Says 80% of novel coronavirus cases are “mild.” The website Information is Beautiful published a chart showing that 80.9% of novel coronavirus cases are "mild." But reports from the World Health Organization and the U.S. CDC found that mild cases account for 75-to-80% of all cases.
“Coronavirus — 22. Clintons — 39.” Conspiracies linking the Clintons to deaths are unsubstantiated.
Madrid’s government has announced students will have to make-up classes during summer. Madrid's government hasn't announced this and the shared photo is fake.

Arab medieval historian Abu Al-Hassan Al-Masoudi predicted the present crisis. Misbar verified several editions of the book "Akhbar Alzaman," and did not find this text, which differs in the way he wrote poetry from the way Abu Hasan Almasoudi wrote his historical narration of Akhbar al-Zaman. Also, the number of pages in the largest editions did not exceed 280, so page number 365 does not exist as the fake post claims.
Turkish President Erdogan revealed a mask that kills coronavirus in a minute. This information is not mentioned in the Turkish media.

Palestine, Egypt, or Lebanon have succeeded in developing a coronavirus cure. The claim is fabricated, and circulated from time to time in the same formula, but with a change of the country and the doctor.

Gargling with Betadine kills germs or reduces their numbers in the throat before they go down to the lungs, and a statement by Eleni Jamarely, professor of infectious diseases, claims that HIV is transmitted more easily from the new coronavirus through the spoon at communion. This is incorrect because, according to the CDC, HIV infection in such a case is possible only if a person has an open wound in the mouth. Gargling with Betadine is dangerous because it is not said which Betadine product should be used. There is a special Betadine mouthwash product, whose efficiency on the novel coronavirus has not been proven yet and which can cause allergies for some people. Any other type of Betadine product can have counter-effects.

The Mayor of Skopje, Shilegov, returned from Madrid three days ago, and the government passed a decree requiring all passengers from Spain to be tested for coronavirus and placed in a 14-day quarantine. It is impossible to confirm the photo. The article includes misinformation. The government has not adopted a decree ordering all passengers who were in Spain to be tested for coronavirus and to be placed in a 14-day quarantine.
Availability of a kit for coronavirus self-diagnosis in Italy. As of 3/9/20, there was no legal kit for coronavirus self-diagnosis. Only government authorities are authorized to do it.

A kit for coronavirus self-diagnosis is available. A Facebook advertisement selling surgical masks links to a webpage for coronavirus self-diagnosis kits. As of 3/9/20 there was no kit developed legally for coronavirus self-diagnosis. Only government authorities are authorized to test for it.
Zinc lozenges are proven to protect against COVID-19. No scientific proof for this claim.

Danish politician says Greta Thunberg gets special treatment in the European Parliament as she, despite the current outbreak, is allowed to speak. Greta Thunberg were treated specially when she were allowed to visit the European Parliament, although all visits were canceled. But it is not at all correct that all visits were canceled.
The headline of a newspaper with a phrase from the Bolivian chancellor about the coronavirus. The headline from the newspaper regarding the coronavirus is a photomontage.
This photo shows the novel coronavirus. The photo is a magnified photo of a weevil.
Drinking warm water with lemon protects against the novel coronavirus. Health experts say there is no proof this is effective.
The Colombian government is closing the border with Venezuela, even though they said they’re not going to do it. The government had not closed the border as of 3/8/20, but did so a few days later.
A person fainted in Cali’s bus terminal because of COVID-19. It's a photoshopped image.
The mayor of Buga, Valle del Cauca, said: “I invite the people of Buga to keep calm and to live each day as if it was the last.” The mayor never said this.
States are imposing mandatory leave and statewise school closures due to coronavirus. Though schools have closed since this announcement, at the time of its original posting, it was not true.

A post has been shared on Facebook, Twitter and Whatsapp claims a regional government in India has recommended that the juice of bitter gourd, a vegetable often used in traditional medicine, is an effective treatment for the novel coronavirus. Indian authorities call it “absolutely false" and health experts said there is no evidence the vegetable is an effective remedy for COVID-19.
Former Iraqi President Saddam Hussein talks about the coronavirus. The video is fabricated.
Hot air application through a hairdryer on the face to heat up nostrils and the sinus kills the novel coronavirus. The claim is false.
5G is accelerating the spread of the new coronavirus. There is no evidence that 5G Wifi networks are linked to the new coronavirus.

An Italian doctor who worked at the Shenzhen hospital in China issued a series of instuctions for locating and treating the new coronavirus SARS-CoV-2. There is no medical evidence to suggest that the text circulation social media was authored by an "Italian doctor working in a hospital in China". Furthermore, these instructions are a collection of unproven hypotheses with no medical basis.
Elderberry syrup protects against the coronavirus. Elderberry syrup is said to improve the immune system, but this is not scientifically validated.

Quarantine video is allegedly from different cities in Turkey. The video is from Sakarya, not Istanbul, and the patient was isolated on inspection, not diagnosed. There is no case in Turkey as of 3/7/20.

An image has been shared in multiple posts on Facebook and Twitter alongside a claim that it shows China administering the “world’s first new coronavirus vaccine” after the global outbreak of the novel coronavirus, COVID-19. The claim is misleading; the photos in this image have circulated in reports about China testing a potential COVID-19 vaccine.

Smoking prevents you from getting infected with the coronavirus. The WHO says smoking does not protect a person from COVID-19 infection and warns it can actually cause health conditions that increase the risk of severe coronavirus illness.

Photos purport to show the collapse of a temporary hospital in Wuhan. The photos show the collapse of a hotel in Quanzhou, south of Shanghai, where people infected with the novel coronavirus were in quarantine.
Telangana Ministry in India distributed homeopathic tablets claiming to prevent COVID-19. There is no scientific evidence to support the claim that arsenicum album prevents coronavirus.
Cocaine cures COVID-19. The claim is false. There is no vaccine or medical treatment available for COVID-19. Cocaine is a stimulant and an addictive drug.

Parviz Nouri Sayha claims he has made the medicine for coronavirus. Our investigations show that almost everything this person who calls himself “professor” claims is fake and unfounded. His resume and bibliography are filled with fabricated items

People can’t use the right of withdrawal at work because of the outbreak. French labor law experts say the risk of being infected with the virus at work can be a reason to refuse going back to work in some cases, but not all.

Did the coronavirus mutate and became more aggressive? Chinese scientists discovered this coronavirus has two different types and that the second type could be more aggressive. But this is only a theory, never tested in lab and French scientists believe there no important mutation of the virus yet.

As of 3/7/20, Tanzania and Zambia had confirmed fist cases of the new coronavirus. At the time, the MP said there were no reported cases in Tanzania. The WHO didn't confirm cases in either country as of 3/7/20.
Coronavirus patients are being caught on highways in China. The video is not about the coronavirus patients being caught, but of the training and mock drill given to the SWAT team in China.

Quarantine video is allegedly from different cities in Turkey. The video is from Sakarya, not Istanbul, and the patient was isolated on inspection, not diagnosed. There is no case in Turkey as of 3/7/20.

A video purports to show panic-stricken travelers infected with the novel coronavirus at an airport in Senegal. The images are from a security exercise simulating a hostage-taking at Dakar airport in November 2019.

A Facebook post shared 25,000 times features an image of a letter purportedly from a U.S. hospital recommending people drink alcohol to help reduce the risks of novel coronavirus infection. Saint Luke’s Hospital in Kansas City did not issue the letter, according to its staff.
“More people have died from knowing Hillary (Clinton)” than from coronavirus. The claim is false.

A video has been viewed thousands of times in multiple Facebook posts which claims to show the Koran being distributed to people in China after it lifted a “ban” on the Islamic holy text following the outbreak of the novel coronavirus, COVID-19. The claim is false; the video has circulated online since at least 2013 with reports about people receiving copies of the Bible in China.
Graphics or social media cards supposedly from UNICEF contain tips and information on how to prevent and combat the coronavirus outbreak and COVID-19. The graphics and the tips are not from UNICEF

Research by the Saint Luke’s Hospital of Kansas City found that consuming alcoholic beverages may reduce the risk of infection by coronavirus. Vodka was the most recommended drink. The hospital says the claim is false. The WHO does not recommend alcohol consumption to prevent the coronavirus.

U.S. hospitals are preparing for 96 million coronavirus infections and nearly half a million deaths, leaked documents reveal. An infectious disease expert presenting to the American Hospital Association estimated there could be as many as 96 million cases of COVID-19 in the U.S. in a year. But there is no indication that hospitals are preparing for an outbreak of that magnitude, as this headline suggests.

An Egyptian writer predicted the new coronavirus six years ago. The Egyptian writer, Dr. Ahmed Khaled Tawfiq, foretold the novel coronavirus in his book "Shorbet Hajj Dawood" in 2014, about the presence of the virus in Egypt. Misbar has verified the news, which is misleading.

Vietnam was the first country to contain and develop a quick test for SARS and COVID-19. The claim that Vietnam was the first country to contain SARS and develop a quick test kit is mostly legitimate. The claim that WHO says it takes four years to develop a test kit appears to be inaccurate.
A video says COVID-19 is caused by 5G. The link between 5G and COVID-19 is not explained in the video and it does not hold any scientific value.

An image has been shared alongside a claim that shows China administering the “world’s first new coronavirus vaccine” after the global outbreak of the novel coronavirus, COVID-19. The photos have circulated in reports about China testing a potential COVID-19 vaccine.

An image has been shared in multiple posts on Facebook and Twitter alongside a claim that it shows China administering the “world’s first new coronavirus vaccine” after the global outbreak of the novel coronavirus, COVID-19. The claim is misleading. The photos have circulated in reports about China testing a potential COVID-19 vaccine.

Former diplomat Henry Kissinger encouraged mandatory vaccination, in order to facilitate radical sanitary measures such as forced sterilization or genetic modification. Those declarations are pure invention : there have been no conference about "eugenism" at the WHO in February 2009, as being claimed by the publication, and no such declarations, confirmed Kissinger Associates, the consulting firm of the former US diplomat.

Tanzanian President unmasks false pandemic. The pandemic is real, but the issue of the papaya, the goat and the quail that tested positive for COVID-19 is developing within a political dispute in Tanzania. It cannot be proven to be false or true.
Increasing border controls will stop coronavirus from spreading. Neither the WHO nor the CDC estimate that closing borders will stop the coronavirus
Emirates has suspended flights to Johannesburg after South Africa announced its first case of novel coronavirus. The claim is false.

The consumption of pig causes COVID-19 entry into Indonesia. COVID-19 spreads in Indonesia because there are Indonesian citizens who have contact with foreign citizens previously exposed to the coronavirus. Research shows that pigs carry only one virus that can be transmitted to humans, namely the H1N1 virus that causes swine flu.

Turks are not going to be infected by COVID-19 due to their genes. Distribution of the ACE2 protein among nations is not clear. Referred anthropologist was a Nazi and classified people by measuring body parts, not by genetic analysis.
A COVID-19 case has been diagnosed in Yedikule Hospital, Istanbul. The lab report is outdated and shows other mild coronaviruses were found in the case

Claim that photos show dogs being killed in China as part of efforts to combat COVID-19. The post is partly false. While there are media reports concerning pets being killed in China because of fears over the spread of COVID-19, they remain unverified and have been denied by authorities. The photos accompanying the post are unrelated to COVID-19. The WHO says there is no evidence that companion animals/pets can be infected with COVID-19 despite a single case in Hong Kong of a dog testing “weak positive."

People who died after being infected by the novel coronavirus can’t receive any mortuary care. The HCSP (Haut conseil de la santé publique) told AFP not all mortuary care is forbidden for victims of the novel coronavirus. Embalming is forbidden but mortuary basic care can still be processed with additional precautions.
Alcohol-based hand sanitizer can influence results in a breathalyzer test. Spreading alcohol-based hand sanitizer does not affect the breathalyzer test.

Chinese President Xi Jinping visited Muslims to understand why they are not contracting COVID-19. The viral video is a combination of three clips of Xi Jinping visiting the northwest region of China in 2016.
Two local celebrities in Argentine are infected with coronavirus The celebrities denied the claim.

A case of coronavirus was confirmed in Cali in Colombia, and a video shows doctors treating patients in a bus station. The video shows a drill organized by Cali's transportation authority, to prepare in case coronavirus arrives in the city.
A case of coronavirus was confirmed in Sincelejo in Colombia. There is a possible case in Sincelejo which hasn't been confirmed as of 3/6/20.

Aaj Tak channel aired a program that said drinking alcohol or smoking weed can cure COVID-19. Aaj Tak channel did not telecast such a program. The photos were taken from a fact-check episode debunking the claim and conclude that neither alcohol nor weed can cure COVID-19.
The mayor Of Buffalo told people to evacuate due to the coronavirus outbreak. The mayor denied this claim when he responded to a Facebook post spreading the misinformation.
CDC sponsored Facebook post asking for help with “escaped” coronavirus patient. The post was created by a fake CDC account.
Holding your breath for 10sec can determine if you have COVID-19 and you should drink water every 15 minutes. There are no medical and scientific evidences
Medical Center in El Cachorro (Sevilla) closed due to a possible coronavirus infected person. The claim is false. Emergencies official channel of Sevilla denies it.
Medical report of Hospital General Universitario Santa Lucía de Cartagena (Murcia) from a person with possible coronavirus. The medical report is old, and refers to another kind of coronavirus.

It is a designed virus ordered to laboratories by Christine Lagarde when she was in the IMF. She said that “old people live too long and this is a risk for the global economy. We must do something, urgently.” There is no proof Lagarde said this.
Increasing border controls will stop coronavirus from spreading. Neither the WHO nor the CDC estimate that closing borders will stop the coronavirus
Emirates has suspended flights to Johannesburg after South Africa announced its first case of novel coronavirus. The claim is false.

COVID-19 spreads in Indonesia because there are Indonesian citizens who have contact with foreign citizens previously exposed to the coronavirus. Research shows that pigs carry only one virus that can be transmitted to humans, namely the H1N1 virus that causes swine flu.

Girl infected with coronavirus found dead in her apartment in Delhi. The incident in the post does not pertain to a coronavirus case in Delhi but is related to the death of a 22-year-old woman in Tamil Nadu’s Chettipedu.

A television news report about a US biotech company runs alongside a claim that the company successfully created a vaccine for the COVID-19 within “three hours.” The U.S. biotech company said the vaccine requires human testing and will not be available until at least the end of 2020.

Bloggers say Nancy Pelosi delayed coronavirus funding so “Dems could campaign on it.” President Donald Trump signed an $8.3 billion emergency spending bill to address the coronavirus on 3/6/20. There is no evidence House Speaker Nancy Pelosi delayed the bill for political ads.

If the coronavirus gets in your mouth, “drinking water or other liquids will wash them down through your esophagus and into the stomach. Once there, your stomach acid will kill all of the virus.” There is no evidence that drinking water helps to prevent coronavirus infection. Health officials and media outlets have debunked the claim.
“Anybody that wants a test (for the coronavirus) can get a test.” The CDC says health care providers decide whether someone gets tested for coronavirus.
Pope Francis contacted coronavirus. The Vatican confirms Pope Francis has not contracted coronavirus.
WhatsApp message suggests holding your breath for 10 seconds and drinking water every 15 minutes will fight the coronavirus. There is no scientific evidence of this.
Qatar shed Iranian fruits fearing coronavirus. Misbar did not find any official country data on the disposal of Iranian fruit on the market.
China did not apologize to Muslims in a song. This is a fake translation.

38 % of Americans won’t buy Corona beer due to the coronavirus. There is nowhere in the study that several media refer to 38 percent of Americans not buying coronavirus beer. Instead, it says 38 percent of 737 beer-drinking Americans will in no case buy coronavirus beer, but that doesn't mean it can be generalized to the overall population. There is also no indication that the lack of desire for the Mexican beer is due to coronavirus, as other media also writes. There can be many different explanations that 38 percent of the respondents do not want to buy the beer, for example that they do not like it.

Wuhan sulfur dioxide emission map shows NASA forecast. The map, made with data from NASA, is a forecast of sulfur dioxide and volcanic gas emissions based on archived data, not a current or real-time record of the increase in gas.

Homeopathic product Oscillococcinum protects against COVID-19. The homeopathic medicine Oscillococcinum, which is sold against flu-like symptoms, is not recommended to protect against the coronavirus. That is pointless, even producer Boiron confirms.
86 clients of a brothel in quarantine after a prostituted tested positive in coronavirus. This claim was a satire shared as real news.
Two Chinese nationals in Kenya have been killed after allegedly escaping from quarantine at the Nairobi Airport. The reports are false.

Every election year has a disease; coronavirus has a contagion factor of 2 and a cure rate of 99.7% for those under 50 it infects. Every year in the U.S. is an election year, if taking into account midterm elections as well as presidential elections, and contrary to the claim, not every election year has had a disease outbreak. The transmissibility of the coronavirus, represented by the “basic reproduction number," is still under study. Currently, the basic reproduction numbers reported for the virus causing COVID-19 range between 2 to more than 6.

The coronavirus outbreak is caused by 5G technology. There is no link between COVID-19 and 5G technology. The cause of the disease is proven to be a novel coronavirus. 5G technology uses low-energy radio waves, which do not damage DNA or cells unlike ionizing radiation

Shanghai government officially recommends Vitamin C for COVID-19. Intravenous high-dose Vitamin C has been used to treat patients with COVID-19 in certain Chinese hospitals, but it has not been recommended by the Shanghai government. .

UNICEF recommendations: coronavirus is large in size where the cell diameter is 400-500 micro and for this reason any mask prevents its entrance. There is no need for pharmacists to sell muzzles. The virus does not settle in the air but is grounded; it is not transmitted by air. The message is misleading and has the potential to cause fear in India.
The WHO has issued an alert against buying holy colors from China The WHO hasn't issued an advisory against buying Holi colors from coronavirus-hit China.
Monkeys are stealing food from a hospital in South Africa. The video was taken before the COVID-19 crisis in a different part of the country.
A Shaheen Bagh protest in India was claimed to have coronavirus. Hospitals in Delhi confirmed that no Shaheen Bagh protest had tested positive for COVID-19.
Chinese government is killing people who refuse to be evacuated. Video is an edit from four videos taken out of context.

A herbal tea can cure symptoms of coronavirus, even if it is a bioterrorism weapon. This claim is false. A "doctor" in nanotechnology and an antivaccine Venezuelan activist said coronavirus can be cured by electromagnetism and/or herbal tea. He also claimed he cured President Chávez from cancer but then died because he didn't follow his treatment.

The test for coronavirus costs US$3,000 in the United States. The only tests approved by FDA and CDC in the U.S. were provided for free. There may be secondary costs such as hospitalization or medical consultation.
Runny nose and coughing sputum are not symptoms of COVID-19. In advisories issued by WHO, "runny nose" and "sputum production" are symptoms of COVID-19.
Precautionary measures suggested by UNICEF. The viral message was not issued by UNICEF. Some measures suggested in the message contradict the WHO’S view on COVID-19 and have no scientific evidence.
Medical book states that coronavirus is just a common cold. COVID-19 is more dangerous than the common cold.

Does France underestimate the outbreak? On social networks, many users claim that the number of coronavirus cases in France is underestimated, because there are fewer tests in France than elsewhere. This international comparison is not relevant.

A confidential governmental document proves that the government has decided to postpone local elections in France because of the outbreak. This document is fake. The government did not make this decision.
Donating plasma or blood is free testing for the coronavirus. Currently the test for coronavirus is free.
Novel coronavirus has a 99.7% survival rate. The CDC does not confirm this.
The coronavirus test costs $3,200. Patients will not incur costs when tested by the CDC.
A patent that is being shared to claim COVID-19 is old. The patent is related to SARS, not COVID-19
No work in several regions of Spain due to coronavirus. The link takes you to a picture of a monkey.

There is an anti-Chinese protest in Italy due to COVID-19. The demonstration was for an anti-Fascist event to commemorate the victim of racism, Valerio Verbano. It was filmed on 2/22/20 in Rome.

President Donald Trump tweeted, “Coronavirus vaccine from Israel! Stock market up! Economy even stronger now! Besides US, Israel best at inventions: Judaism, olives. Wonderful vaccine, will stop Corona DEAD around world. Can’t make vaccines when being bombed, not have been possible without peace I created in Israel!” President Donald Trump did not tweet this.

Viral claims propagating UNICEF message about coronavirus. Mr. Jeremy Sprigge, communication specialist for UNICEF Sri Lanka, confirmed that “these messages are not UNICEF statements and henceforth FALSE."
Precautionary measures suggested by UNICEF. The viral message was not issued by UNICEF. Some of the measures have no scientific evidence.
The Success of an Egyptian serum in treating coronavirus. The Egyptian Ministry of Health denies that China has officially announced the success of the Egyptian serum to cure COVID-19.
Crown Prince of Abu Dhabi Mohammed bin Zayed is infected with coronavirus. There is no official news about bin Zayed's infection with the virus.

Four cases of coronavirus were reported in the West Bank. Four cases of COVID-19 were recorded among tourists in Beit Jala in the West Bank. Ma'an News Agency modified the facts with other news entitled "Coronavirus In Bethlehem and the Ministry of Health is Calling For Calm and Waiting For Instructions."
In Kuwait, he sneezed during Friday sermon, and the worshipers expelled him. The video is old and was circulationing before the appearance of the virus.

The vaccine against the new coronavirus was created before the disease appeared; three people who recently arrived from China in Sarajevo Canton are under medical supervision and have brought COVID-19 to Sarajevo. The British National Health System and the WHO report there is no vaccine yet for COVID-19. As of 3/5/20, there was no confirmation of a coronavirus positive finding in the three patients, and for several days thereafter results were found to be negative.

A post says that there is a movie that predicted the pandemic and it’s called “Coronavirus”. The image is false, is manipulated and it uses the cover of the movie “The flu” with the wrong title. There’s no movie called “Coronavirus”.

Article says that the Vatican confirmed that the Pope and two assistants have coronavirus. There’s no official statement from the Vatican saying that Pope Francis is infected with COVID-19. Pope has felt ill, but not with the coronavirus.

NHK World’s Chinese language service calls COVID-19 the “Novel Japanese coronavirus”. What was said on NHK World in Chinese was “a summary of the novel coronavirus infection situation in Japan”, this was mistranslated by some in Japan as "Novel Japanese coronavirus".

An image from The Simpsons predicted the novel coronavirus. The claim is false because the montage features shots from two different episodes, one of which has been digitally altered to include the words “corona virus”.
There is a connection between 5G and Covid-19. There is no proof that there is any connection between 5G and COVID-19 or that 5G can be harmful for people.
Vitamin C is a miracle cure for the novel coronavirus. There is no cure or special treatment for coronavirus as of publication.

Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi: China has no faith, no election and no freedom. China has only GDP but is losing it. Besides, nothing left in this country but violence and lies. According to Narendra Modi's official social media account and Indian media, Modi did not make such a statement.

Videograph shows COVID-19 is more dangerous than former outbreaks. The video is cut at the beginning and the end. The whole video shows COVID-19 is not as dangerous as the former outbreaks or other causes of death.
Cow dung and cow urine can cure coronavirus. Dr Sumit Ray, a Senior Consultant, Critical Care Medicine, said that there are no scientific studies to support these claims.
Consuming large doses of Vitamin C can stop the spread of coronavirus. There is no evidence that consuming large doses of Vitamin C cannot stop the spread of coronavirus.
Photos show a well-stocked vegan shelf while other items are cleared out. Circulated online since September 2017, the photo shows panic buying after Hurricane Harvey in the U.S.
UNICEF releases coronavirus prevention guidelines. UNICEF has not released an advisory; many of the claims are contrary to health experts' advice.

This video shows panic buying in the United States, during the coronavirus outbreak The video has circulated online since November 2019, weeks before the novel coronavirus was first detected in the Chinese city of Wuhan.
This is a photo of the first Moroccan infected with the virus. The photo is from an advertisement for an opthamologist clinic in Algeria.

COVID-19 was created in 2014 by an English institute. A viral video denounces that the Pirbright Institute of the United Kingdom, created the virus that causes COVID-19. The institute denied the rumors, noting that the virus strain they work with to make a vaccine is different from the new coronavirus.
The first dog was infected with coronavirus. A dog in Hong Kong was tested weakly positive for coronavirus but didn't show any symptoms so far.

The Simpsons predicted the coronavirus pandemic years ago. Other than the "Osaka Flu" infecting many residents of Springfield, the events of the 1993 episode "Marge in Chains" have no similarities with the COVID-19 pandemic.

The common cold is the only type of coronavirus. Coronaviruses can cause different illnesses in animals and humans, including the common cold. However, they can also lead to severe diseases such as Middle East Respiratory Syndrome (MERS) and Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome (SARS).
Officials say coronavirus killed 200 in Iran. The number of deaths in official reports as of 3/3/20 were lower than stated in this article.
New coronavirus was registered in 2018. It was another type of coronavirus that doesn't affect humans.

Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi: China has no faith, no election and no freedom. China has only GDP but is losing it. Besides, nothing left in this country but violence and lies. According to Narendra Modi's official social media account and Indian media, Modi did not make such a statement.
Lonely Ka’bah from Tawaf after Saudi Arabia makes policy on coronavirus. Activities around the Ka'bah located in the Grand Mosque, Mecca, proceed as usual as of 3/4/20.
Masks from Wet Wipes effectively prevent coronavirus transmission Wet tissue material makes dust, dirt and bacteria stick more easily.

Videograph shows COVID-19 is more dangerous than former outbreaks. The video is cut at the beginning and the end. The whole video shows COVID-19 is not as dangerous as the former outbreaks or other causes of death.
Cow dung and cow urine can cure coronavirus. Dr Sumit Ray, a Senior Consultant, Critical Care Medicine, said that there are no scientific studies to support these claims.
Consuming large doses of Vitamin C can stop the spread of coronavirus. There is no evidence that consuming large doses of Vitamin C cannot stop the spread of coronavirus.

“Man visited Albany, N.Y., days before dying from coronavirus.” The image was manipulated to look like it is from ABC News. There is no evidence one of those individuals who died from COVID-19 had recently been to Albany, N.Y.

“The State of Florida has announced measures that all workplaces with 10 employees or more are to have paid mandatory leave to avoid the spread of COVID-19 coronavirus starting on March 6, 2020. All schools are to close for 2 weeks also from March 6.” As of 3/5/20, Florida is not shutting down schools and businesses for two weeks.

The media “pulled down an entire shelf of goods so that they can present the news of people buying stuff in a hysteria over the coronavirus.” An image claims to show a news reporter staging a shot of empty grocery store shelves. The photo is a hoax from Romania.

“The Obama administration made a decision on testing that turned out to be very detrimental to what we’re doing” on the coronavirus. The “decision” Trump talks about had its roots in a 2004 law, when George W. Bush was president. The FDA’s policy pre-dated the Obama administration.
The Obama administration “didn’t do anything about” swine flu. The Obama administration responded with two emergency declarations, triggering billions in spending and other public health responses.

“With regard to the cost, let me be very clear: HHS has designated the coronavirus test as an essential health benefit. That means, by definition, it’s covered in the private health insurance of every American, as well as covered by Medicare and Medicaid.” Pence’s claim over simplifies what is involved in making this coverage assurance because a large swath of private health insurance falls beyond these categories. His statement fails to acknowledge the need for action at the state level and from the private sector.
Vitamin C and warm water with lemon can prevent COVID-19. Vitamin C and warm water with lemon have no known effect on the novel coronavirus.

European Health Organization (EHO) announced that eating beef can cure coronavirus. There is no official institution with the name European Health Organization (EHO). Also, no authority in the European Union has announced that eating beef will cure coronavirus.
Prince of Qatar is infected with coronavirus. The Emir of Qatar has been bedridden for several days, and his temperature is high, indicating that he has COVID-19. But the claim is false.

A fabricated circular for the Lebanese Ministry of Education regarding the end of the school year. The Lebanese Ministry of Education and Higher Education has announced the end of the school year for all different levels of education, after the outbreak of COVID-19 and the appearance of several cases. The circular is false.
Gaza Strip Is coronavirus-free. 17 cases of COVID-19 in the Gaza Strip as of 3/4/20.
Rapper Eminem contacted coronavirus. The post is a hoax.

The coronavirus is a bioweapon by the USA, says German politician Wolfgang Gedeon in a Parliament speech. International scientists, the WHO and German Robert Koch Institute see strong evidence that the coronavirus is of natural origin and its outbreak is related to bats.
Trump’s effort to blame Obama for sluggish coronavirus testing. There was no “Obama rule,” just draft guidance that never took effect and was withdrawn before President Trump took office.

The media group Globo published a photo of the dead of the Lampedusa shipwreck as if they were COVID-19 victims. The image shows coffins of immigrants killed in the tragedy on the island of Lampedusa in 2013, but Aos Fatos found no evidence that the Globo group used the record outside its original context. G1, a site that belongs to Globo, denied misinformation that circulated in March and attributed the same image of coffins to the pandemic.

The first coronavirus case in North Macedonia was a well-known fashion designer. Due to the mass dissemination of the misinformation, Pandeva (the designer) addressed the public through a video message posted on her Facebook profile and denied that she was ill.
