Vitamin C prevents coronavirus. Researchers reject that there should be any evidence to suggest that vitamin C intake can prevent COVID-19. With a healthy level of vitamin C, you can shorten a cold, but that does not mean that you can prevent or treat COVID-19 by consuming large amounts of vitamin C.

A dog was quarantined in Hong Kong after testing positive for the new coronavirus. The information from the first case of the new coronavirus detected in a dog is true. On the other hand, there is a canine coronavirus that is different from the one that began to be detected in Wuhan

Drinking sips of water prevents the new coronavirus. WHO maintains that there is no evidence of this and specialists consulted by AFP explain that the virus is only detected with a laboratory test and that drinking water does not "wash" it.

China names COVID-19 the ”Japanese pneumonia”. This is a widespread mistranslation of a sentence in a Chinese report that read "日本新型冠状病毒肺炎疫情不断变化" and which means "the situation with infections of the novel coronavirus in Japan is constantly in flux."

An audio clip claims Kenya has recorded 63 cases of COVID-19. The audio clip was edited and taken out of context. It was part of a training exercise by the Ministry of Health to prepare for a likely outbreak ahead of the opening of a quarantine center in Nairobi.
Pope Francis and two of his aides have been infected with COVID-19. The Vatican and the embassy said the pope recently fell ill with a common cold.

Japanese Asahi Shimbun TV: USA caught COVID-19 before Wuhan, according to American CDC The original news clip suggested that there could be some COVID-19 cases being misdiagnosed as flu in the U.S. But it didn't mention that COVID-19 originated in the U.S.

A study published by two Chinese research institutions suggest that human semen can cure COVID-19. The screenshot of the report circulated online was digitally manipulated. The original report suggested another medicine could be the cure, not human semen.
Turkish raki prevents COVID-19. The video clip was doctored. There is no evidence that shows raki prevents the disease.
People queue outside an Aldi supermarket in Germany to buy food in fear of the new coronavirus. The 2011 video shows the opening of an Aldi store.
Ads are selling masks protecting against COVID-19. U.S. authorities don't recommend wearing masks and the doctor does not speak about COVID-19.
Multiple allegations on how to protect oneself from the new coronavirus. Many of the practices detailed in the post are misleading and inaccurate.
Multiple allegations on how to protect oneself from the new coronavirus. Many of the practices detailed in the post are misleading and inaccurate.
A man is hospitalized after eating a bat. This photo that has circulated in an online fundraising page features a man with a lung condition unrelated to the novel coronavirus.
Russia said COVID-19 is man-made. The Russian Ministry of Health denies making such a statement; the document states COVID-19 is a “recombinant virus” which can form naturally.

The coronavirus has been discovered in poultry. Sri Lankan authorities said the coronavirus has not been discovered in poultry. The photos were taken from various unrelated reports online and show chickens sickened with other diseases.
A Nigerian taxi driver threatens to spread COVID-19. The claim originated from a parody account and has been denied by the man pictured and by government officials.
A Nigerian taxi driver threatens to spread COVID-19. The claim originated from a parody account and has been denied by the man pictured and by government officials.

The photos show Indians bathing in cow dung to prevent infection. The photos show participants at an annual cow dung festival held in the southern region of India in October 2019, several weeks before COVID-19 was first detected in the Chinese city of Wuhan.
Video shows Wuhan residents lining up for death certificates. The video previously circulated in reports about Wuhan residents gathering to collect free vegetables.
There is a case of coronavirus at the School of Architects of Madrid. The event depicted was an exercise.
There is a case of coronavirus at the School of Architects of Madrid. The event depicted was an exercise.

Claims that drinking boiled garlic water cures novel coronavirus. Medical experts told AFP there was no evidence to support the theory about drinking garlic water; international health organisations do not recommend the remedy and have said there is no specific antiviral treatment for the new strain of the novel coronavirus.

The Simpsons predicted the coronavirus outbreak. The frames were taken from different episodes, about the Osaka flu and the housecat flu. One of them was digitally manipulated to include the word "coronavirus."

Vinegar is more effective than alcohol-based hand sanitizers for killing the novel coronavirus. Vinegar is not effective as a hand sanitizer. Its effects on breaking up the fat protection around viruses are very limited. Alcohol and soap are very effective as protection.
Drinking hot water prevents the COVID-19 This information is false. Health authorities do not recognize hot water as a preventive measure and experts point out that it could be counterproductive.

A health expert surmises that the new coronavirus might not spread in Nigeria because of the hot temperature. Warmer air holds more moisture, preventing airborne viruses from traveling as far as they would in dry air. But it is not confirmed if the new coronavirus is vulnerable to hot temperature.
A new case of coronavirus has been confirmed in Tulcán, Ecuador. Please click the link to read the full article
This video was supposedly developed by the Ecuadorian Health Ministry to encourage people to wash their hands constantly. Please click the link to read the full article
A brothel in Spain was under quarantine. The claim is from the satirical website Cerebrother.
An image shows Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer criticizing President Trump’s restrictions on foreign nationals traveling to the U.S. from China. The tweet was fake.
The government — or specific states such as Michigan or Florida — has mandated that employers and schools close for two weeks. No such announcement has been made.
Pope Francis and his two aides have been infected with the new coronavirus The pope tested negative.

The CDC recommends men shave their beards to be protected against the new coronavirus. A 2017 CDC infographic shows how facial hair could interfere with respirator masks. The graphic is unrelated to coronavirus protection and the CDC has not recommended people should shave their beards to ward off the virus.
A bovine vaccine can be used to inoculate people against coronavirus. There is no approved coronavirus vaccine.
Patents mean deadly diseases and viruses were created or invented in a lab. The patents are for possible treatments or vaccines, some of which were tested but did not work.

You can’t get infected by kissing the hands of a virgin or saint statue. Kissing the hands of a virgin or saint statue is a tradition of the Holy Week in some parts of Spain, but it is not free from viruses and therefore can be a way of infection.

An audio clip claims Kenya has recorded 63 cases of COVID-19. The audio clip was edited and taken out of context. It was part of a training exercise by the Ministry of Health to prepare for a likely outbreak ahead of the opening of a quarantine center in Nairobi.
Pope Francis and two of his aides have been infected with COVID-19. The Vatican and the embassy said the pope recently fell ill with a common cold.

Japanese Asahi Shimbun TV: USA caught COVID-19 before Wuhan, according to American CDC The original news clip suggested that there could be some COVID-19 cases being misdiagnosed as flu in the U.S. But it didn't mention that COVID-19 originated in the U.S.

A study published by two Chinese research institutions suggest that human semen can cure COVID-19. The screenshot of the report circulated online was digitally manipulated. The original report suggested another medicine could be the cure, not human semen.
Spices can ward off the new coronavirus. Spices can increase endurance but there is no evidence that they can prevent or cure coronavirus.
Coronavirus can be transmitted through imported goods The virus cannot live outside the human body for a long time.
Coronavirus dies in temperatures 26-27C and when exposed to sunlight. There are no studies to support this claim.
Turkish raki prevents COVID-19. The video clip was doctored. There is no evidence that shows raki prevents the disease.

Bloggers say the Vatican reports that Pope Francis tested negative for the coronavirus before a second test came back positive. An Italian newspaper reported that Pope Francis tested negative for the coronavirus. The Vatican has not confirmed or denied the report.

Video shows President Donald Trump saying COVID-19 is the Democrats’ “new hoax.” The video makes it look like Trump called coronavirus “their new hoax.” There was nearly a full minute between when the president said “coronavirus” and “hoax” during a 2/28/20 rally in North Charleston, S.C.
Drink (warm) water or gargle every 15 minutes to rinse the new coronavirus down. There is no scientific evidence that drinking warm water can prevent the new coronavirus.

Images of BJP men smearing cow dung on one another after their party leader Suman Haripriya said cow dung may help cure coronavirus. Assam BJP MLA Suman Haripriya made those statements on 3/2/20. But the images are from the Goraihabba festival celebrated in Thalavadi (Tamil Nadu) on 10/30/19.

UNICEF circular on coronavirus prevention. Misbar checked the educational bulletin attributed to UNICEF and found it to be false, and completely different from the original bulletin found on the official website of the organization.
Vitamin C can cure COVID-19. The claim is not based on medical evidence.
This video shows dead coronavirus victims amassed in the Bergamo (or Brescia) hospital. The video was recorded in Ecuador at the Los Ceibos General Hospital in Guayaquil.
Ecuadorian doctor develops a vaccine for COVID-19. Please click the link to read the full article
Two cases of coronavirus have been reported in Loja, Ecuador. Please click the link to read the full article
Azuay governor in Ecuador seeks the cure of COVID-19 in indigenous medicine. Please click the link to read the full article

Video claims that “The health system is collapsing” in North Macedonia. A false claim in the video 4/3/20 is that Macedonia has by far the lowest number of tested compared to other countries. Data for 4/4/20 shows Macedonia is the second country in the region in terms of the number of tests conducted for COVID-19 per million inhabitants. Another false claim is that the number of cases per capita is the highest in Macedonia from the entire region, but as of 4/7/20, the number of cases per capita in Macedonia is somewhere in the middle compared to the whole region.

Uganda has recorded its first coronavirus case from Chinese nationals at the Entebbe Regional Referral Hospital. As of Mar 3rd, Uganda’s Minister of Health, Dr Jane Ruth Aceng,stated that they were all tested negative, and that Uganda is yet to record a COVID-19 case.

Shave your beard to protect yourself from the new coronavirus. US health authorities did not recommend shaving your beard to protect yourself from the new coronavirus; At no time do they refer to the need to shave facial hair.
The pope has COVID-19. The Vatican press office announced the pope has a common cold and is continuing his schedule.
Whatsapp message contains multiple health advises. The text message is based on advice lacking scientific evidence. The WHO does not confirm any of them.

Man critical with novel coronavirus in Barhalganj, India. There is no confirmed case of the novel coronavirus in Barhalganj, a town in Gorakhpur, Uttar Pradesh.The man did not get infected with coronavirus in Barhalganj by consuming chicken.
Alcohol kills the coronavirus. The claim is fake.

Outbreak of COVID-19 is a worldwide fake. The fatality rate is too low for an epidemic. The WHO admitted causing the SARS outbreak in 2003. There are thousands of confirmed cases around the globe. The virus is confirmed in multiple labs. The fatality rate is greater than that of some of pandemics in the 20th century.
This photo shows a brothel in Europe where people have been quarantined. The claim originated on a satirical website based in Spain. The photo is of a nightclub in Marbella.
These are seven “evil” things COVID-19 is “afraid” of. The claim is misleading; health experts say such practices are only effective when applied properly and can be harmful if used incorrectly.
A runny nose and sputum secretion are not symptoms of novel coronavirus. The WHO listed these as possible symptoms.
Israeli scientists have developed a COVID-19 vaccine. Israel's Migal Institute said it was still working to develop a vaccine. The photo is from a stock photo website.
12 pieces of advice for coronavirus, including symptoms, transmission, how to neutralize the virus. Most of the advice is false or unfounded.
Plant-based cure for coronavirus discovered in Iran. The plant-based product has not been approved or submitted for approval to Iranian authorities, according to the official news agency.
Disinfectant gel causes cancer. There have been no credible studies to prove this, according to health experts.

Twitter users said Adutwumwaa Bitters cure coronavirus. Producers of the medicine, Adutwumwaa Herbal Industries Limited, have stated that their product does not cure coronavirus. The WHO says there’s no cure, vaccine or antiviral medicine to prevent or treat coronavirus.
Constant sex kills coronavirus. Sex cannot kill or cure coronavirus. But close contact with an infected person will expose the partner to the disease.

Viral photo in Nigeria suggests former President Obasanjo said there is no coronavirus in Nigeria and that the minister of health lied. President Obasanjo's spokesperson, Kehinde Akinyemi, refuted allegations attributed to Baba; a moniker often used to describe the former head of state. A Google reverse image search revealed that the "Fox News writer" (the source) used the image out of context.
Ministry of Health confirms new case of coronavirus in Santa Elena province, Ecuador. Please click the link to read the full article

A bovine coronavirus vaccine, for cattle, is proof that the novel coronavirus isn’t “new” and is evidence of “how much the media controls people.” The cattle vaccine has nothing to do with the COVID-19 virus.
Journalist claims a coronavirus patient was murdered. The tweet did go out from a TV reporter, but was doctored to claim that a murder investigation was underway at the nursing home.
U.S. Vice President Pence urged people with coronavirus to go to the police. This claim is false; Pence never said this.
The Ministry of Health in Spain issues advice about the coronavirus outbreak. The Ministry of Health has not issued an alert.

3.000 people from Elche (Spain) are infected with the coronavirus after coming back from Milan’s international footwear industry fair. As of 3/2/20, there are no coronavirus cases in Elche; the Ministry of Health has not released a statement claiming any cases.
The pope has COVID-19. The Vatican press office announced the pope has a common cold and is continuing his schedule.
Whatsapp message contains multiple health advises. The text message is based on advice lacking scientific evidence. The WHO does not confirm any of them.

Man critical with novel coronavirus in Barhalganj, India. There is no confirmed case of the novel coronavirus in Barhalganj, a town in Gorakhpur, Uttar Pradesh.The man did not get infected with coronavirus in Barhalganj by consuming chicken.
Alcohol kills the coronavirus. The claim is fake.

Ambulance health care workers are transporting a coronavirus patient in The Hague (The Netherlands), dressed in white protective suits. Medical personnel and news websites had already stated this patiënt was not infected with the coronavirus.

Post says “sanitizer will do nothing for the coronavirus.” Although they are not effective against all viruses, hand sanitizers with high alcohol content have proven effective against human coronaviruses.

Post says two patients at Valley Regional Medical Center in Brownsville, Texas, “are being looked at” for possible coronavirus infections. Health officials say there are no coronavirus patients in the Rio Grande Valley as of 3/3/20.

The United States is “actually screening fewer people (for the coronavirus than other countries) because we don’t have appropriate testing.” The CDC has stopped publicly reporting the number of tests it’s administered. As of March 4, the United States has lagged behind other nations in terms of coronavirus testing.

U.S. Senator Lindsey Graham says President Trump “probably knows more about medicine and specifically viruses than any of the so-called scientists at the NIH and CDC.” Senator Lindsey Graham did not say this.The quote was fabricated by a Twitter account that has posted fake statements in the past.
“Coronavirus hoax: Fake virus pandemic fabricated to cover-up global outbreak of 5G Syndrome.” No credible evidence shows the current coronavirus spreading around the world was fabricated.
Multiple videos claim garlic and onions can prevent and cure infection from the novel coronavirus. This claim is false. The WHO says garlic cannot prevent or treat COVID-19.
Images show the Great Mosque of Mecca empty. The images are fabricated.
Notice for preparing emergency drugs was released on social media for alumni of Seoul National University College of Medicine. This did not happen.

In North Korea, a person was allegedly shot by local authorities when he violated the quarantine rule and went to a public restroom. Due to complete state control of information and news in North Korea, claims about COVID-19 cannot be verified. This claim is not confirmed.
There are cases of coronavirus in the Amazon forest. Please click the link to read the full article
Local hospital in Ecuador says first COVID-19 patient didn’t have coronavirus. Please click the link to read the full article

With the spread of the new coronavirus, information spread that the government had been producing masks with a Japanese flag in response to the lack of masks. This mask was launched in 2015. The Ministry of Health and the manufacturer denied the fact.
Ecuadorian youtuber Raùl Alvarez Guene was supposedly infected with COVID-19. Please click the link to read the full article
Facemasks prevent coronavirus infection. Health authorities do not recommend using a face mask unless there is direct contact with a positive diagnosis.
Indonesia has provided 1,000 free tickets for nationals to return home from abroad. The Foreign Ministry dismissed the reports as a hoax.

This is a video of panicked shoppers storming a supermarket amid the coronavirus pandemic. The claim is false; the video was filmed in Germany in 2011, nearly a decade before the coronavirus pandemic broke out.
Four patients infected with the coronavirus are hospitalized in Sri Lanka. Only two suspected patients were hospitalized and both later tested negative.
Classes in Ecuador are suspended because of coronavirus. Please click the link to read the full article
There is a new case of coronavirus in Latacunga, Ecuador. Please click the link to read the full article
Pope Francis and two aides tested positive for coronavirus. The Vatican does not confirm this.
An alkaline diet can prevent coronavirus infection. No food or diet, alkaline or otherwise, can prevent the infection
Facemasks prevent coronavirus infection. Health authorities do not recommend using a face mask unless there is direct contact with a positive diagnosis.

“Florida hospital reports a coronavirus ‘infestation’ with multiple confirmed patients.” The U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention presumptively confirmed two cases of the 2019 coronavirus in Florida.
Photo shows a man wearing a “government issued Saint Laurent hazardous materials suit.” The image was posted by a self-described parody account.

“Shands Hospital of Gainesville, Florida, has confirmed its first case of coronavirus.” As of 3/2/20, the CDC has confirmed two cases of COVID-19 in Florida. Shands Hospital in Gainesville  has not confirmed a coronavirus case.
Post says no one has died from the coronavirus in the United States. As of 3/3/20, nine people have died from the coronavirus in the United States. The first death was on 3/1/20.

The coronavirus is “simply the common cold.” The 2019 coronavirus is part of a family of viruses that produce illnesses ranging from the common cold to more critical diseases such as SARS or MERS. It is a new virus not previously identified.
This video was shot in a mall in Germany during the coronavirus pandemic. The video was filmed years before the pandemic.
The Vatican confirms Pope Francis was infected with coronavirus. The claim was denied by the Vatican.
The coronavirus Is spreading in Egyptian schools. Misbar found the video shows a poisoning incident at the Technical Secondary School for Girls in Sherbin City, Dakahlia Governorate, north of Cairo.

Beware of Yellow Rain (Agent Orange) coming with a storm from China. It brings chemicals and the coronavirus. Yellow Rain is not a real rain, it's how to call an chemical weapon in the past. Even a storm is coming, it's unable to bring virus from China to Thailand.

Bill Gates is working on an electronic chip to implant under human skin in order to locate and control people. This is a common conspiracy theory, but Bill Gates never claimed working on this kind of project.

Oklahoma police planning to set up roadblocks to enforce a mandatory COVID-19 vaccination law and slap micro-chipped bracelets on people. A video featuring conspiracy blogger Greg Evensen is showing a speech from 2009.

Taiwanese president and former president were infected. The former president died. The images of screenshots and official documents are doctored or forged. President Tsai made a public speech at a 2/28/20 memorial event.

Police in China have killed 25,000 COVID-19 patients so far. None of the four clips spliced together shows cops “shooting” COVID-19 patients. One is of a road crash; another features not gunshots, but the explosion of Lunar New Year fireworks in the background.

COVID-19 came from Chinese people eating human babies, in an effort to improve their skin. The claim is false and baseless. The photos are a decade old; some show a Chinese man "eating babies" as protest art in 2000.
Photo of Iranian officials visiting the vice president after she contracted COVID-19. The photo has circulated since 2014, after one of Iran's vice presidents was injured in a traffic accident.
Vatican says Pope Francis has been infected with the novel coronavirus. The Vatican said the pope recently fell ill with a common cold..
14 points of expert advice about coronavirus, including symptoms, prevention and how it spreads. Research does not support the claims.
Mongolia donates 30,000 sheep to China during the coronavirus epidemic. The videos circulated before Mongolia announced the donation on 2/27/20.
Volcanic ash can kill the coronavirus. The WHO says there is no evidence of this.
Germany gave medical protection equipment like masks to China, now it’s missing in Germany. Germany sent protection equipment to China twice in February.
The coronavirus is more dangerous for animals than for humans. There is no proof that animals can get or spread the new coronavirus.
A video shows people storming an Aldi supermarket to buy groceries because of coronavirus fear. The video was made in 2011 and shows people eager to buy laptops at an Aldi store in Kiel.
This virus must be old because the label on a bottle of disinfectant from 2015 shows “coronavirus“. The coronavirus family is known for decades, so older disinfectants  display its name.
Local news channel in Ecuador confirms more people are infected with coronavirus. Please click the link to read the full article
Health Ministry in Ecuador confirms three new cases of coronavirus. Please click the link to read the full article
Pope Francis is infected with coronavirus. Please click the link to read the full article
Drinking warm water or tea can prevent contagions. Studies do not prove coronavirus is affected by temperature and or inanimate objects.

Doctors recommend carbon filter face masks to prevent coronavirus spread. Video claim is false. The FDA and CDC concluded they are not effective for children and are not recommended for home use. The videos are used to sell the masks to people concerned about the coronavirus outbreak.
Garlic water can treat coronavirus. The WHO says there is no evidence to confirm this claim.
Pangolin is the original cause of COVID-19. The information from scientists who first pointed to pangolin as the cause of the infection has been corrected.

Russia announces the closure of airspace and suspends all incoming and outgoing flights to China. The Russian government had imposed a temporary and partial ban on the movement of Chinese nationals. All Russian airlines, with the exception of national airline Aeroflot, stopped flying to China on 1/31/20. Ikar airline will continue flights between Moscow and China. All planes arriving from China will be sent to a separate terminal in the Moscow Sheremetyevo airport. Aeroflot reduced the frequency of flights to Beijing, Shanghai, and Guangzhou until 2/29/20.

Taiwanese president and former president were infected. The former president died. The images of screenshots and official documents are doctored or forged. President Tsai made a public speech at a 2/28/20 memorial event.

Police in China have killed 25,000 COVID-19 patients so far. None of the four clips spliced together shows cops “shooting” COVID-19 patients. One is of a road crash; another features not gunshots, but the explosion of Lunar New Year fireworks in the background.

COVID-19 came from Chinese people eating human babies, in an effort to improve their skin. The claim is false and baseless. The photos are a decade old; some show a Chinese man "eating babies" as protest art in 2000.
A video says the Vatican confirmed Pope Francis and two aides tested positive for coronavirus. The Vatican has denied the report, saying the pope has a “slight illness.”

President Barack Obama “waited six months to call swine flu an emergency after thousands died.” The Obama administration declared swine flu, or H1N1, a public health emergency six weeks before H1N1 was declared a pandemic. No H1N1 deaths had yet been recorded in the United States.
The Vatican confirmed that Pope Francis and two aides tested positive for coronavirus. The Vatican denied allegations that Pope Francis contracted COVID-19.

CDC recommends men shave their beards to be protected against the new coronavirus. The claim is based on a CDC chart created in 2017 to advise medical workers on the best practices for wearing a "filtering facepiece respirator" during contact with viral patients. It was not intended for the general public - nor specifically for preventing the spread of the coronavirus.
Pope Francis was diagnosed with coronavirus. The pontiff tested negative for COVID-19 after showing flu symptoms.

A video shows a man with COVID-19 spitting on grocery store items. Tracing back to the earliest copy of the video online, there is no information that the person is positive for COVID-19. The blurry clip likewise makes it difficult to determine what the person was doing to the grocery items.
Video of a person infected with coronavirus being detained by the police. This video shows a drill. It was shot 2/21/20 at Henan Tongbai by the police and the emergency response team.
Barcelona’s council issued a notification of a new focus in two neighborhoods. The council denied the claim on its Twitter account.
The wife of a Chinese shop owner in Totana (Murcia, Spain) has coronavirus. The claim is not true.
A video of chaos in a shop claims people are panicking after the first confirmed case of coronavirus in Lithuania. The video was made in May 2018 in Romania, during a sale at a supermarket.
Doctors in Japan advise people to drink water every 15 minutes to prevent an infection. The WHO says drinking water does not prevent novel coronavirus.
Vitamin helps against COVID-19. Health experts told AFP there is insufficient evidence for this claim.

Election years in the United States coincide with major disease outbreaks. Several years of discovery or the associated spread of a disease do not match election years, national and international health organizations said.
The Cambodian prime minister has COVID-19. The photo is from 2017; the prime minister was treated for something else.
Beef meat is the best vaccine against COVID-19. There is no evidence to prove this.
Tips against coronavirus like holding your breath and drinking water. These tips don't prevent infection with coronavirus.

Shaving facial hair ensures safety from COVID-19, further attributing the message to the CDC. This information was directed to workers who use respirators in carrying out their tasks and has nothing to do with preventing the spread of coronavirus.
Video of a roof full of bats claims it is the source of coronavirus. The video was recorded in Florida in 2011, not in China.
Coronavirus patients in China are caught by officials on a highway. The video shows a mock drill. The China SWAT team in the video is "practicing" how to deal with coronavirus patients.
Chinese police use a fishing net to arrest a man with a high fever. The video shows a police training exercise.
Florida man is arrested for robbery using cough as a weapon. The photo was created using a prank generator site.
Summer temperatures will make coronavirus disappear. Not enough is known about the coronavirus to prove this claim.
“Spanish newspaper ABC reports there are two possible COVID-19 cases in Gines and Benecazón (Seville, Spain). ABC has not published this article
A man with a gas mask at a supermarket in Lugo (Galicia, Spain). The photo was taken in Austria, not Spain.
The wife of a Chinese shop owner in Totana (Murcia, Spain) has coronavirus. The claim is not true.
Authorities should implement temperature tests to travelers from China. There is no evidence the tests are precise enough to detect infections with no fever.
Video of a person infected with coronavirus being detained by the police. This video shows a drill. It was shot 2/21/20 at Henan Tongbai by the police and the emergency response team.
Barcelona’s council issued a notification of a new focus in two neighborhoods. The council denied the claim on its Twitter account.
The wife of a Chinese shop owner in Totana (Murcia, Spain) has coronavirus. The claim is not true.
Jackie Chan is quarantined because of the coronavirus. Jackie Chan states that he was not quarantined.
Clients of a brothel in the Spanish city of Valencia are quarantined after one of their employees tested positive for coronavirus. The claim is not true; it is a humor article.
A “poll finds 38% of Americans say they will not drink Corona beer because of the virus.” The poll was conducted by a PR firm which did not release full details about it.

“The coronavirus has made it to Mississippi and the lady that caught it wasn’t around anybody with it, which means it is airborne. If the wind blows it in your direction, you’ll have it also.” According to the CDC and Mississippi, there are no confirmed COVID-19 cases in the state as of 2/28/20. Researchers believe the disease is spread person to person.

“Every election year has a disease” — SARS in 2004; avian flu in 2008; swine flu in 2010; MERS in 2012; Ebola in 2014 and 2018; Zika in 2016 and the coronavirus in 2020. Most of these diseases were discovered and spread before the election years and were minimally mentioned during campaigns. SARS, avian flu and MERS had virtually no effect on the U.S. during election years.
COVID-19 is just a big flu. It is too early to make this assumption. Statistics show COVID-19 is not a generic virus.
It is best to shave your beard to avoid being infected by the coronavirus. Unless you are in contact with people infected by the virus at work, there is no need to shave your beard.
A man with a gas mask at a supermarket in Lugo (Galicia, Spain). The photo was taken in Austria, not Spain.
Coronavirus patients in China are caught by officials on a highway. The video shows a mock drill. The China SWAT team in the video is "practicing" how to deal with coronavirus patients.
It is possible to self-diagnose by holding your breath for 10 seconds. There is no medical evidence to support this claim.

Chinese experts warn about a scar in the lung caused by COVID-19. This is more severe than SARS 17 years ago. There is no evidence to support this. A Thai medical doctor insists that not every COVID-19 case damages the lungs.

The German government made a “secret plan” about coronavirus in 2012 that foretold the pandemic. There is no secret plan but a public risk assessment of the German government in 2012 contained a hypothetical epidemic of a fictional coronavirus named Modi-SARS.

The next thing that we will run short of, following masks, is toilet paper. On Feb.28, the industry association released a statement categorically denying rumours that its production capacity fell (in the wake of the novel coronavirus). "Most (of Japan's) toilet paper and tissue paper are produced in domestic factories, and neither supplies nor production have been impacted by the novel coronavirus," it said.
Consuming alcohol is an effective measure against COVID-19. The post making this claim contains a doctored screenshot from a CNN broadcast.
Sevilla’s university has suspended classes because of coronavirus on 2/27/20. The university denied this claim on its Twitter account.
Dr. Gerardo Dovakin found a vaccine against coronavirus. Dovakin is an actor, not a doctor.

Honduras’s first confirmed case traveled to Taiwan earlier, which means there is a severe community transmission in Taiwan. As of 2/27/20, Honduras has no confirmed cases of COVID-19. A Taiwanese traveler had suspected infection, but tested negative.

Taiwan has severe community transmission. Many people have died. As of 2/27/20, there is no evidence indicating the Taiwan government has hidden real COVID-19 figures or information. The Taiwan Central Epidemic Command Center (CECC) has a daily press conference to update the latest confirmed case number and has been transparent.

The outbreak in Taiwan is out of control. President Tsai ordered a corpse burned in front of the presidential office. It is a photo of a self-immolation incident in 2015 in front of the presidential office.
Iranian clerics wear masks after the outbreak. The photo is outdated and manipulated. It was taken at the funeral of Kasem Sulemani.
Drinking water every 10 minutes can send the virus into sthe omach and kill it. The digestive system cannot stop the respiratory system's work and the course of infection.
The WHO has issued an alert against buying holy colors from China The WHO hasn't issued an advisory against buying Holi colors from coronavirus-hit China. The claim is fake.
Video shows Chinese officials detaining an infected citizen who refused to be tested. The video shows an exercise, not a real event.

A “Lithuanian doctor” gives advice to those potentially infected with the coronavirus. The information is false since instructions to stay at home if infected were not given out by any of the authorities.
Health authorities say shaving a beard protects from COVID-19. It's a 2017 graphic about how professionals should wear tight-fitting masks.

Airport in Karachi suspends all international arrivals during coronavirus epidemic. Pakistan's civil aviation authority confirmed international arrivals weren't cancelled at the time; photo corresponds with one that circulated about flights suspended at the airport in March 2019
Chloroquine cures COVID-19. Chloroquine showed signs is not a cure for COVID-19.
Video shows a person infected with coronavirus being detained by the police. This event is not real, it's a drill. It was shot 2/21/19 at Henan Tongbai by the police and the emergency response team.
A case of coronavirus in the Argentine province of Santiago del Estero was confirmed. There are no confirmed cases of coronavirus in Argentina as of 2/27/20.
A case of coronavirus in the Argentine province of Chaco was confirmed. There are no confirmed cases of coronavirus in Argentina as of 2/27/20.

An Argentinian doctor discovered a vaccine for coronavirus in Spain The statement is false. The man in the attached photo is an actor. The WHO says "there is no vaccine and no specific antiviral medicine to prevent or treat" the coronavirus.
The WHO says the coronavirus might be spread by food. The WHO has no evidence that infections from food are possible.
Coronavirus is not reproducing in warm places. Other coronaviruses have begun to die when the temperature is over 56°C but there are no studies about COVID-19.
Bleach and chlorine can be used to prevent the coronavirus. The WHO confirms bleach and other disinfectants might work to kill the coronavirus.

Iran’s deputy Health Minister: This year we have had 13,200 flu cases which caused the death of 108 people. Our population is a fourth of the U.S. population. Last year, they had 28 million flu cases which resulted in 16,000 deaths. Yet nobody is restricting travel. Flu death rate in the U.S. is less than 0.1% and the deputy minister’s comparison of flu and COVID-19 is misleading.

The cover of a book titled “Tintin in Wuhan” shows the character standing in an old Chinese market wearing special suits, while people are wearing masks. This is a doctored image made from the frames of two different Tintin books.

French far right leader Marine Le Pen says the EU didn’t act against the outbreak The EU has activated the civil protection mechanism, launched aid programs, mobilized funds for research and called for more international cooperation and coordination.

Lysol products can kill the novel coronavirus. While Lysol products are advertised to kill 99.9% of bacteria and viruses, including coronavirus, the company is referring to previous strains of the virus. There is no known cure for the novel coronavirus strain.
A monkey is been infected with the coronavirus in this photo. The photo is a capture of a video taken at least two months before the first COVID-19 symptoms were experienced.
Lectures have been suspended at the University of Sevilla due to coronavirus. The university stated the document is false.
There is a new case of COVID-19 in Sacedón (Spain). The town office denied the claim.
El Pais said there is a possible case of coronavirus at the hospital Gregorio Marañón in Spain. El País has not published that article and the typography doesn't match.
An article in El Pais says there is a case of coronavirus at the School of Architecture of Madrid. El País did not publish this article.
First case of coronavirus in Alcalá de Henares (Madrid). One screenshot shows a false article created in an app; the other has not been published by El Mundo newspaper.
A brothel with 86 customers was quarantined after a prostitute tested positive for the coronavirus. This was a satirical comment.
Sevilla’s university has suspended classes because of coronavirus on 2/27/20. The university denied this claim on its Twitter account.
Dr. Gerardo Dovakin found a vaccine against coronavirus. Dovakin is an actor, not a doctor.

Honduras’s first confirmed case traveled to Taiwan earlier, which means there is a severe community transmission in Taiwan. As of 2/27/20, Honduras has no confirmed cases of COVID-19. A Taiwanese traveler had suspected infection, but tested negative.

Taiwan has severe community transmission. Many people have died. As of 2/27/20, there is no evidence indicating the Taiwan government has hidden real COVID-19 figures or information. The Taiwan Central Epidemic Command Center (CECC) has a daily press conference to update the latest confirmed case number and has been transparent.

The outbreak in Taiwan is out of control. President Tsai ordered a corpse burned in front of the presidential office. It is a photo of a self-immolation incident in 2015 in front of the presidential office.
Iranian clerics wear masks after the outbreak. The photo is outdated and manipulated. It was taken at the funeral of Kasem Sulemani.
Drinking water every 10 minutes can send the virus into sthe omach and kill it. The digestive system cannot stop the respiratory system's work and the course of infection.
The WHO has issued an alert against buying holy colors from China The WHO hasn't issued an advisory against buying Holi colors from coronavirus-hit China. The claim is fake.

”America has been vaccinating cattle for coronavirus for years, yet the news tells you it’s new and going to kill you all, so go buy a mask.” The vaccine for cattle won’t help humans and won't protect against this new form of coronavirus.

“The blood test for coronavirus costs $3,200.” The CDC isn't charging for coronavirus testing but patients could be stuck with associated costs, such as a trip to the emergency room. In Florida, a man who worried he was infected initially faced a $3,270 bill even though he never received a coronavirus test.

Starting in March, if you travel outside of the United States you won’t be allowed back in the country “due to high risk of the coronavirus.” As of 3/6/20, there is no mandate that states Americans are barred from returning to the U.S. from anywhere overseas.

“‘Akira’ is a 1988 movie about an apocalyptic event taking place months before Tokyo 2020 Olympics, showing the WHO advising Japan to postpone the Olympics because of a pandemic risk.” The movie does not include a pandemic and the WHO is never mentioned.

Iran buries coronavirus victims in Iraq; a video from the Najaf Cemetery. Video shows the burial of Iranians who were infected with COVID-19 in Al-Ahwaz cemetery. The video is from 2019, and depicts the burial of Mohamed Nasri who died of CCHF in Al-Ahwaz in 2019.
Football player Alexis Sanchez is infected with the new coronavirus. Misbar confirmed this statement is false.

Keeping your throat moist will wash the coronavirus down to your stomach where the virus will die. The WHO and Dr. Norberto Francisco, chief of clinical trials and research at the Lung Center of the Philippines, say drinking water will not prevent a coronavirus infection.

A video accompanying a claim shows bodies being removed from a hospital in Iran during the novel coronavirus pandemic. The claim is false. The video has circulated since August 2019 and depicts a funeral procession for pilgrims who died during the annual Islamic pilgrimage to Saudi Arabia's Grand Mosque.
Eat herbs, curmin, like people in India, and you will be safe from COVID-19. This claim has no scientific proof.

Each side of protective surgical masks has different functions, indicated by colour, and you should choose the way you wear by whether you are ill or not. This is incorrect. Generally, if they have a coloured side, you should wear your mask with this pointing outward—but always read the manufacturer’s instructions to be sure.

A book published in 1981 said that in 2020 a severe pneumonia-like illness would spread across the world, and calling it “Wuhan-400”. These lines are from two different books: one is from a book of predictions by a psychic published in 2008 that predicted a pneumonia-like illness, and “Wuhan-400” is a fictional disease from a sci-fi book published in 1981 that bears little similarity to the new Wuhan coronavirus.
Ministry of Economy and Finance in South Korea and pharmaceutical companies had a secret meeting. There was no meeting.
New cases of coronavirus in Madrid are linked to two universities and a club. The photos about coronavirus were manipulated.

Italian Red Cross gives the recipe for making amuchina (hand sanitizer) at home. Italian Red Cross has never shared such a recipe. It could be useful only to disinfect vegetables.
A post says “hair weave and lace fronts manufactured in China may contain the coronavirus.” The U.S. Food and Drug Administration has found no evidence that the virus is spreading via imports.

“Coronavirus: Florida man arrested for robbery using cough as a weapon.” The screenshot of “breaking news” is originally from a satirical news site. A news generator watermark is visible in the top right corner, which means the image was created.

The CDC recommends men shave their beards to protect against coronavirus. A 2017 CDC infographic shows how facial hair could interfere with respirator masks. The graphic is unrelated to coronavirus protection and the CDC has not recommended shaving beards to ward off the virus.

China took advantage of the coronavirus crisis to buy back stocks from its technology companies belonging to foreign investors. There is no evidence to support the claims in this story, published in 2014. It was not the Chinese but the Russian president at the time, and the emergency was not the coronavirus. The country, the president, the currency and the reason for the emergency were changed.

The Russian CDC admitted that COVID-19 is human-made. The original document from the Russian health ministry only mentions that COVID-19 is a recombinant virus. It doesn't suggest the COVID-19 is a human-made virus.
Photos show many corpses floating in the river in Tainan, a Southern city in Taiwan. They are staged photos from Korean movies "Deranged" and "Train To Busan".

Hair Weaves And Lace Front Wigs Made In China Likely To Contain coronavirus. There is very little chance of coronavirus spreading this way, and there have not been any reported cases of this happening.

Having 14 face masks is enough. They can be reused every 14 days since the incubation period is 14 days. Single-use-masks should not be reused.

Chinese are converting to Islam to avoid the coronavirus. The video is a religious activity carried out by ICDO in the Philippines that circulated on the internet before the coronavirus was first reported in December 2019.
A video shows a crow attack and a jumbo mosquito in China during the coronavirus plague. The video was edited by combining several different videos and images.

Taking a hot bath is an effective remedy against COVID-19. Health experts say there is no evidence that bathing in hot water can prevent the virus. The WHO warned that bathing or showering in very hot water can be “harmful."
Exactly every 100 years, a viral epidemic breaks out. The epidemics have not arisen exactly 20 years after the beginning of each century.

This bottle of disinfectant gel proves that the coronavirus existed before 2019. Different strains of coronavirus existed years before COVID-19, which explains why the term "coronavirus" is written on the bottle.

Africans are more resistant to COVID-19. Dr. Ngumbau Kitheka, a resident doctor at the Kenyatta National Hospital, told PesaCheck there is no scientific evidence to suggest black people have a better chance of fighting the virus, stating that the disease is likely to affect those with weaker immune systems.
The coronavirus outbreak in Georgia is caused by the EU-Georgia Association Agreement. Scientists agree that the SARS-CoV-2 is not a man-made virus and it originated in animals - most likely in bats.

The novel coronavirus only survives in cold weather and hot ginger tea or salabat can cure COVID-19. The coronavirus pandemic can be dramatically slowed, or stopped, with the immediate widespread use of high doses of vitamin C. Maintaining an adequate intake of vitamin C is important for staying healthy. Although some studies have shown a reduced incidence of the common cold in individuals undergoing severe physical stress, such as marathon runners.

Coronavirus has been found in broiler chicken. The claim is fake.
Autopsy reveals a Wuhan doctor was murdered in his sickbed. There is no source cited in this report. Other news outlets confirmed Li Wenliang died from the coronavirus.
The new coronavirus “causes sudden death syndrome.” There is no evidence the virus causes sudden death syndrome.
Dettol cleaners can kill the coronavirus. The coronavirus causing the current outbreak is new and there is no cure for it.
In a photo of Pakistani Prime Minister Imran Khan and Chinese President Xi Jinping, Imran Khan is wearing a mask. The image was edited.
A video says weed kills coronavirus. The news clip was created through a meme generator. The WHO has stated there are no cures for the virus.
China killed pigs over fear of coronavirus. The video is misleading.
The 1918 influenza pandemic is falsified. That pandemic was real and took more than 50 million lives.

There is a patent for the new coronavirus. A post claims the Pirbright Institute in the UK applied for a patent for the novel coronavirus outbreak, but documents show the institute holds a 2015 patent for avian influenza virus, also a coronavirus.

Government of the Philippines gave out free masks on the streets. The government of the Philippines donated face masks to several organizations but didn't distribute face masks for free on the street as of 2/7/20.
The WHO announced that among many medicines, the best coronavirus killer is nicotine. The WHO hasn't made this recommendation. There is no cure for COVID-19.
If you have a runny nose or cough, you don’t have COVID-19. Runny nose and dry cough are two symptoms of COVID-19.
A video shows the Vietnam government giving out free face masks on the streets. The video documented a charity event organized by a motorcycle group, not the Vietnam government.

China is planning to kill coronavirus patients. There is no information to prove that China plans to kill over 20,000 patients who have been infected by the coronavirus.

Sanitizer manufacturer Dettol knew about the new coronavirus before it was reported. Dettol label mentions it kills coronavirus, but does not refer to the current strain. The products have not been tested for the new strain.

Thai department of health published an infographic on how to properly wear face masks. Ministry of Health denied this.

This video shows workmen uncovering a bat-infested roof in the US state of Florida in 2011. The Asterix comic books and The Simpsons predicted the coronavirus outbreak. Coronavirus has been around since the 1960s. The Simpsons image was edited.
Tencent revealed the real number of deaths. The screenshot is questionable.

Taking chlorine dioxide helps fight coronavirus. Chlorine dioxide does guard against the coronavirus or against other diseases and is harmful.

Chinese president visits a mosque and says prayers about the coronavirus outbreak. The video was taken in 2016, before the coronavirus was first reported in Wuhan in December 2019.

China has sought to kill 20,000 coronavirus patients to control the spread of the virus. There is no evidence to support the claim, which originates from a suspicious website.

Professor Wong Kin-Chung offers tips to delay the progress of COVID-19: Rinse mouth with cold salty water; drink water and red wine; take Vitamin C; eat chicken soup, shiitake mushrooms, astragalus, codonopsis and ginseng. There is no evidence that those items can prevent COVID-19. Wong Kin-Chung cannot be confirmed as a medical professor, doctor or nutritionist.
Tencent claims that over 24,000 patients have died in China. Screenshots can be manipulated; the number is not confirmed by the government.

20 million Chinese people convert to Islam after learning that COVID-19 doesn’t affect muslims. COVID-19 affect muslims and doesn't discriminate by religion. There is no evidence of the conversion of 20 million Chinese people to islam.
Ultimo (Italian singer) has coronavirus. As of 2/6/20 in Italy, there are only 2 cases of coronavirus (2 Chinese citizens).
Woman eats bat soup contaminated with coronavirus in China. The video was recorded on the island of Palau, Micronesia in 2016.

People infected with coronavirus die in the street while doctors travel through the infection zone. The images are from different events. The first photo corresponds to a performance in Germany and the second portrays two doctors caring for Ebola sufferers in Uganda.
Share this post on Facebook, and get free face masks. Taiwan FactCheck Center has shared the post but didn't get any feedback. The post was not deleted or revised.
WHO calls for isolation of China due to the coronavirus. The WHO does not recommend restrictions on travel or trade with China.
Video shows an infected baby with a doctor. Video was uploaded on 1/14/20. There was no reported case at that time. It does not fit the COVID-19 quarantine protocol.

Chinese Premier Li Keqiang had dinner in Wuhan during the epidemic. The photo was taken in 2013 in Sichuan.
The Dettol disinfectant label says COVID-19 was tested. COVID-19 is a family of viruses.

Research shows that parts of the HIV genetic code have been inserted into the new coronavirus. Researchers from India claim to have found HIV genetic sequences on the novel coronavirus, and speculate that it might indicate the new virus was artificially created. These genetic sequences can be found in many different viruses, including some other strains of coronavirus.
Xi Jinping visits a mosque for coronavirus. The video is from July 2016.
China asks for permission to kill 20,000 infected cases. There is no evidence about this.

Coronavirus has not “hit” Ghana. There are reports of two suspects exhibiting symptoms of the virus, but both men tested negative, according to Dr. Asare, chief executive officer of Korle-Bu Teaching Hospital.
President Xi Jinping visits Masjid to pray for coronavirus victims. The video is from 2016 and shows Xi Jinping visiting a mosque.
Video shows people behaving abnormally in China due to coronavirus. The video is old and does not show the recent coronavirus outbreak.

Coronavirus was created in a laboratory in Wuhan. There is no evidence to support this claim.
Vitamin C stops or slows novel coronavirus. There no known cure for coronavirus and no evidence to suggest Vitamin C can treat or prevent it.
China is seeking court’s approval to kill all who tested positive with coronavirus. The National Health Commission of the People’s Republic of China makes no mention of any such case.

A Bulgarian doctor claims that alcohol helps cure or prevent the new coronavirus. The WHO says an alcohol-based hand sanitizer is recommended. It is a well known fact that there is no cure for the virus.
You can’t transmit the virus to other people if you don’t feel its symptoms. The French health minister corrected this misinformation.
China seeks approval from the court to kill over 20 000 coronavirus patients. There is no evidence to support this claim.
Coronavirus found in broiler chicken No evidence proves this claim. The WHO has clarified that meat cooked properly can be consumed.

The health insurance fee in South Korea will increase because of the treatment cost for Chinese patients. The cost of treatment for foreigners will be paid from the state budget, not by insurance companies.
Several posts say that coronavirus deaths are linked to 5G technology. There’s no scientific evidence to support this theory. People die because they were infected with the virus SARS-CoV-2.
The new coronavirus can be cured with a bowl of garlic water. There’s no scientific evidence to support this theory and there is still no cure to the COVID-19 disease.

The novel coronavirus contains “pShuttle-SN” sequence, proving laboratory origin. The pShuttle-SN vector was designed by researchers seeking to develop a potential SARS vaccine. The new coronavirus does not contain a sequence from the pShuttle-SN vector.

Label on disinfectant says the new coronavirus strain is not new. The disinfectant can only eliminate other types of coronaviruses that are found on hard and non-porous surfaces. It is not effective on the new coronavirus.

When the first group of Japanese evacuated from Wuhan to Tokyo, each evacuee took one ambulance. Among 206 Japanese evacuees being withdrawn from Wuhan on 1/29/20, 199 took seven buses and five took ambulances to the hospital for further examination.
Chinese kill their pets due to epidemic anxiety. A photo of a dead dog was verified. There is no evidence of a massive pet killing in China.
Boiled garlic water can protect from COVID-19. Health experts refute claims that drinking boiled garlic water cures novel coronavirus.
Tinospora crispa plants can treat COVID-19. Philippine health experts dismiss the claim that tinospora crispa plants can treat novel coronavirus.
There is a case of COVID-19 in Alberta, Canada, on 2/5/20. Authorities deny it.
A case of the novel coronavirus was registered in a hospital in Maranhão, Brazil. It was a different type of coronavirus, HCoV-OC43, which causes regular colds.
This is a market in China where bats and snakes were served as food. The market was in Indonesia.

Doctors confirm the novel coronavirus may arrive in Brazil through AliExpress packages. Specialists agree it's unlikely that a virus would survive more than a few hours outside a host, on a solid surface.
A study is linked to coronavirus. The study was linked to filoviruses and had the minimal role of Wuhan virology institute.
“Coronavirus epidemic in Poland.” There is no claim or statement by Polish officials of an epidemic
Coronavirus has infected broiler chicken. There is no evidence that broiler chicken has been infected with coronavirus.

Dettol sanitizer can kill tthe coronavirus. The company knew about the coronavirus back in 2019. The Dettol bottle refers to the previous strains of coronavirus, not COVID-19. The manufacturer cannot confirm levels of effectiveness against the new strain.

The novel coronavirus can be cured by one bowl of freshly boiled garlic. The WHO has issued a clarification that garlic may have some antimicrobial properties but there is no evidence it can protect people from the novel coronavirus.
Videos show pigs being buried in China due to the coronavirus outbreak. The videos are old and not related to the recent coronavirus outbreak.
Children under 8 are immune to the novel coronavirus. WHO reports indicate children as young as 2 have been infected.
Health Canada has advised that keeping the throat moist by drinking water can prevent infection. There is no scientific evidence from Health Canada to support this claim.
Coronavirus is caused by bat soup. There is no evidence that eating bat soup causes coronavirus.

Farts were recorded by infrared temperature sensors recently installed in airports and train stations to monitor temperatures of passengers amid the coronavirus outbreak. The farts were added digitally.
Rinsing your mouth with salted water will prevent coronavirus infection. A doctor's team has debunked the claim
First case of coronavirus in San Vicente del Raspeig (Alicante, Spain). There has been no case detected in Alicante.

Cow urine cures coronavirus. This claim made by Hindu Mahasabha President Swami Chakrapani is misleading.

Videos show pigs being buried in China due to the coronavirus outbreak. The videos are old and not related to the recent coronavirus outbreak.

People from Wuhan can share a laundry room although they are in quarantine. People in Wuhan should clean their clothes in their room, by themselves.
When transporting patients, people who wear only a facial mask violate safety measures. They also use ambulances with negative pressure ventilation equipment.

Drinking boiled garlic water cures novel coronavirus. The claim that drinking boiled garlic water cures the coronavirus is wrong according to health authorities. International organizations do not recommend the remedy.

Sri Lanka has eradicated coronavirus. One patient recovered but experts said it's not enough to mention eradication.

COVID-19 comes from rhino horns. The origin is unknown and rhino horns cannot hold any virus.

Pigs mulled in China are blamed for coronavirus. The video is from the African swine flu outbreak in China in 2018-19.

Photos show coronavirus is found in broiler chicken. The photos are outdated and have nothing to do with the coronavirus. They are about sick chickens.
Video shows bat infestation under a tiled roof, the source of coronavirus in Hubei, China. The video is 8 years old and not from China.

A coronavirus victim was secretly cremated. The boxes photographed at Tianhe International Airport in Wuhan contain protective clothing bought by the Zall Foundation to help control the coronavirus.

Coronavirus can be transmitted through sweat from Chinese canned food factory workers. Transmission of the coronavirus is only possible through close contact and body fluid when sneezing and coughing.
A photo shows infected people in China. The photo was taken in 2014 in Frankfurt in memory of Holocaust victims.
Chickens cause coronavirus. There has been no confirmation of a link between chickens and the new coronavirus. The WHO has said that it is looking into animal sources.

Alibaba Group founder Jack Ma gave US$5 million to a Filipino student who developed a vaccine for novel coronavirus. No vaccine has been developed to stop the new coronavirus. Jack Ma's donation to a Filipino student cannot be confirmed.

The novel coronavirus “will not spread” in the Philippines due to the country’s high temperature and relatively high humidity. The World Health Organization (WHO) told Rappler that 2019-nCoV "has spread to countries with both hot and humid climates, as well as cold and dry."

Israeli spy Dany Shoham claims the new coronavirus is linked to the Chinese secret program for the production of biological weapons at the Institute of Virology in Wuhan, the epicenter of the infection. On 1/29/20, two credible media outlets denied the claims. Foreign Policy says the Wuhan virus is not a laboratory bio-weapon, stressing that conspiracy theories are spreading faster than the coronavirus itself.
Coronavirus has killed 112,000 people and infected 2,800,000 in China. Currently, the coronavirus has killed more than 400 people and infected over 20,000 in China.

It’s a video from 7/5/11 by a Miami based roofing company, Istueta Roofing. The bats in the video were found under the tiles during the process of replacing a roof for a customer in Miami.

Dettol sanitizer can kill coronavirus. The company knew about the coronavirus in 2019. The coronavirus mentioned on the Dettol bottle is the previous strains of coronavirus, not the 2019 novel coronavirus. Dettol has clarified that it cannot confirm effectiveness against the new strain.
Three photos show coronavirus hospitals In China. The photos are misleading.
South Korean presidential Blue House forbids the term “Wuhan pneumonia.” The information was based on guidance from the WHO.
Drinking water will prevent coronavirus. Facebook posts claimed that drinking water will prevent the coronavirus; however, according to health authorities that is wrong
A video shows a doctor fainting in the operating room after being infected with the new coronavirus. According to Chinese media, he fainted after performing surgery for 17 hours.
The coronavirus is in Cecina, a city in Tuscany, Italy. As of 2/3/20, there are no coronavirus cases in the city of Cecina.
The coronavirus is in Arezzo, a city in Tuscany, Italy. As of 2/3/20, there are no coronavirus cases in the city of Arezzo.
27 patients with coronavirus are in a Rome hospital. As of 2/3/20, there are no coronavirus cases at the Umberto I Hospital in Rome.
A photo shows the novel coronavirus. The image is not a photo of the coronavirus; it is graphic rendering.
The new coronavirus is as dangerous as the plague and cholera. At present, this claim cannot be confirmed.
Scientists “are shocked to discover that weed kills coronavirus.” The CDC reports there is no specific antiviral treatment recommended for the novel coronavirus.
“The coronavirus was engineered by scientists in a lab.” There is no evidence that the coronavirus was created in a lab.

Coronavirus contains “HIV insertions.” This claim is based on a study comparing short protein sequences between the 2019 novel coronavirus and HIV, likely to give false positives. The authors did not check for potential similarities between COVID-19 and other organisms. These short protein sequences were similar to many other organisms, not just HIV.
The Wuhan coronavirus was leaked from the Wuhan P4 lab. The claim is speculation and quoted from an outdated study.
A video shows the Wuhan market. The video was filmed in Indonesia, not Wuhan.
A photo shows a Japanese professor who says Taiwan doesn’t need to join the WHO. The man in the photo is Japanese adult video star Shigeo Tokuda.

In a video, the Chinese prime minister offers namaz (prayer) during the coronavirus scare. The 2015 Associated Press video shows the former Malaysian prime minister taking part in Friday prayers in Beijing’s Nan Xia Po Mosque during a five-day trip to China.
There is an herbal cure for COVID-19. Health experts in Sri Lanka say there is no evidence asafoetida or other herbal medicines can protect people from infection.
A photo shows people who died from the virus in Frankfurt, Germany. No, this is a 2014 photo of people participating in an art project in Frankfurt, Germany
A video shows bats, the main source of the coronavirus, on many roofs in Hubei district. The 8-year-old video from Miami, Florida, is not linked to the coronavirus.

The common flu kills 60 times more people than the coronavirus every year. The common flu should not be compared to the coronavirus because influenza is seasonal and predictable with vaccines. The the new coronavirus is still an unknown, but according to current information, it has a higher mortality rate than the flu.
3 preliminary studies that went viral are incorrect. They are three authentic publications, but they were either too preliminary, or social networks overstated their conclusions.
A viral image suggests that cocaine kills coronavirus. According to the WHO, there is no cure for the new coronavirus.

Two Italian scientists, named Concetta y Francesca, were the first to isolate the new coronavirus in Europe Those two doctors were not the first ones to isolate the new coronavirus in Europe. The isolation was achieved before them in France, but also in Japan, Australia and China.
There are cases of the news coronavirus in Maturín city. As of February 2, no COVID-19 cases had been reported in Maturín.
A viral video is depicting the condition in which animals are being stored in the Wuhan market. The market depicted in the video in question is from Indonesia, not China.
Vitamin C can “stop” the new coronavirus. There is no evidence that Vitamin C can stop or treat the new coronavirus.

Chlorine dioxide kits sold online under various “MMS” names — Miracle Mineral Solution, Miracle Mineral Supplement, Master Mineral Solution — will cure the coronavirus. MMS does not cure coronavirus infection and can be dangerous.
The new coronavirus contains HIV “insertions” and shows signs of being created in a lab. This claim from a poorly done study was retracted. There is no evidence that the new virus was bioengineered.
The new coronavirus can be cured by drinking one bowl of freshly boiled garlic water. There is no known cure for the new coronavirus.
A video shows pigs buried in China because of the coronavirus. The video is a year old; the pigs were buried after the outbreak of African swine flu.
A video shows a bat-infested roof in Hubei, China, claiming to be the source of the new coronavirus. The video was shot in Miami, Florida, in 2011.
A video shows a new hospital for coronavirus patients in China. The video has been available on the internet since 2018 and does not show the new hospital for coronavirus patients in China.
Chinese politician Xi Jinping has said that Chinese scientists found a cure for the coronavirus in cow urine. Chinese politician Xi Jinping did not make the statements about cow urine.

A photo shows coronavirus victims in China. The photo from 2014 shows people lying down in a pedestrian zone in Frankfurt, Germany, as part of an art project remembering victims of the Katzbach concentration camp.
The Korean Government took every facial mask from factories and sent them to China. Some sellers made this false claim to consumers.
Bill Gates helped fund a patent for coronavirus. The Pirbright Institute said the patents involve infectious bronchitis virus only, and the Gates Foundation did not fund that work.
Scientists from Australia create the first vaccine for novel coronavirus There is no vaccine for the coronavirus.
A video shows a doctor fainting in the operating room after being infected with the new coronavirus. There are no evidences to support that information.
A video shows pigs buried in China because of the coronavirus. The video is a year old; the pigs were buried after the outbreak of African swine flu.
Garlic soup can cure the coronavirus. According to the WHO, there is no cure for the new coronavirus.
Dettol can kill the new coronavirus. The company said coronavirus cannot be eliminated by using its liquid soap.

The new coronavirus is as dangerous as the plague and cholera. At present, this claim cannot be confirmed.
Scientists “are shocked to discover that weed kills coronavirus.” The CDC reports there is no specific antiviral treatment recommended for the novel coronavirus.
“The coronavirus was engineered by scientists in a lab.” There is no evidence that the coronavirus was created in a lab.

Coronavirus contains “HIV insertions.” This claim is based on a study comparing short protein sequences between the 2019 novel coronavirus and HIV, likely to give false positives. The authors did not check for potential similarities between COVID-19 and other organisms. These short protein sequences were similar to many other organisms, not just HIV.
The Wuhan coronavirus was leaked from the Wuhan P4 lab. The claim is speculation and quoted from an outdated study.
A video shows the Wuhan market. The video was filmed in Indonesia, not Wuhan.
A photo shows a Japanese professor who says Taiwan doesn’t need to join the WHO. The man in the photo is Japanese adult video star Shigeo Tokuda.
Garlic water can cure the new coronavirus. There is no proof that garlic water is a coronavirus cure.

In a video, the Chinese prime minister offers namaz (prayer) during the coronavirus scare. The 2015 Associated Press video shows the former Malaysian prime minister taking part in Friday prayers in Beijing’s Nan Xia Po Mosque during a five-day trip to China.

“You’re more likely to die of influenza right now” than the 2019 coronavirus. Based solely on the numbers, you're more likely to die if you get the 2019 coronavirus than if you get the flu. But, as of March 10, the flu is more common in the United States than the coronavirus.
Pigs are being burned alive in China to control the coronavirus. A year-old viral video is not about the coronavirus in China.

The religious beliefs of some Macedonian citizens are being used to create panic and misinformation about the new coronavirus by citing Russian texts portraying it as the beginning of a worldwide catastrophe. Totalitarian and authoritarian regimes around the world have often supported the dissemination of prophecy stories that foretell disasters and conspiracy theories as a means of keeping subjects in a state of constant fear. Such stories are often republished because they attract attention.
“The Simpsons” has predicted the coronavirus since 1993. The episode refers to a virus called the Osaka Flu, transmitted through a factory in Japan. The name of the virus in the video was fabricated.

A post says that WHO has advised against unprotected sex with animals to prevent a coronavirus infection. The image attributed to the World Health Organization was digitally manipulated. The recommendation was never to avoid unprotected contact with wild and farm animals.

Italy is the first European Union country to isolate the coronavirus. France was the first European country to isolate the coronavirus.

“When using a medical mask, you’re supposed to wear the white side out when you’re not sick.” Global health agencies and medical mask producers agree that the colored side of the mask should always be worn on the outside.

In the bottle of a specific Dettol product there is a mention on the coronavirus from October of 2019, which means that the company knew about the outbreak before it occurred. The term "coronavirus" does not apply solely to SARS-CoV-2, it describes a group of viruses that share certain traits. One of those viruses is SARS-CoV-2 but its not the only one. Including SARS-CoV-2 there are about 7 more coronaviruses. So the bottle of the disinfectant in question did not predict the emergence of the new coronavirus, it was referencing other coronaviruses that their product can protect against. The company has issued an announcement denouncing the claim that their product is effective against the new coronavirus.

Photos show part of Huoshenshan Hospital in Wuhan, built in five days. The building is the medical center Dabie Mountain, reconfigured to accommodate coronavirus patients and located in Huanggang, 46 miles from Wuhan.

China builds a hospital for coronavirus patients in 48 hours. It is an extension of Huanggang Central Hospital, scheduled to open in May 2020. A dedicated work force made the empty building into a fully operational hospital within two days, which was mistaken as the Huoshenshan Hospital proposed to be constructed in six days. Huoshenshan Hospital is still under construction and expected to open to patients on Feb. 3, 2020.

Coronavirus hits a 15% fatality rate. The 15% fatality rate from coronavirus (2019-nCoV) applied only to the initial cluster of 41 patients with confirmed infection and severe symptoms, as reported in The Lancet. coronavirus infections can also produce mild symptoms, which likely went undetected. The mortality rate based on a group of more than 800 patients with laboratory-confirmed infection suggests that the fatality rate is closer to 3%.
